description:
This place can get pretty crowded, from the previous memories of this place. Last year, I remember that the lines were long. This most recent visit, I had the Painted Ladies Expresso Escape. I love a coffee flavored ice cream. To make it into a sundae, even better. The ice cream is always so good here and the prices, I guess I could say is reasonable.

There's a large variety of retail merchandise there too. A wide variety of of chocolate squares that will drive you crazy, trying to figure out what you should buy or if you should just buy one of everything so you can try everything.

My last visit was in earlier this month, so there was a great number of halloween merch. Prices for merch I think are a little high, but that's what anyone should expect of this touristy spot. Although I thought I would have visited this place more than once to tame down my ice cream fix while I was in town, I sadly didn't. There's actually a great variety of ice cream shops in the city. Don't isolate yourself to this classic ice cream shop when you're in town.
author: Antonio L.

description:
Chocolate lovers rejoice! Here they give you free Ghirardelli squares as you enter and if you ask nicely they might even give you a different flavor than the ones they're offering.

I was a fan of an informative walk through of how the chocolate is made, the history behind Ghirardelli and the cute little ice cream shop upstairs too. This was a fun stroll with a sweet treat in it at the end. 

The arched sign at the front entrance also makes for a memorable/cute photo op too!

2018 Yelp review #63
author: May C.

description:
This place is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!! I have family that lives in San Francisco so we don't visit the city that often. But this place is a gem! It is located in a very cute plaza with lots of shops and dinning. Don't bother looking for parking on the streets because it has a parking structure that makes it very convenient but that comes along a price tag. The parking was about $8 for 2hs. Nonetheless, the ice cream and Ghirardelli is well worth it! Very Instagram worthy, if your into that! 
Over all, this place is a must if you are in the area, skip Pier 39 and come grab a nice dinner and dessert in the Ghirardelli Plaza! 
Quick note, the portions are huge so you might want to share!!
Highly recommend the chocolate brownie fudge sundae! It's delish!
author: Yesenia R.

description:
When I told some friends and family I would be visiting San Francisco for a few days, they all exclaimed that a stop at Ghirardelli for one of their iconic sundaes was a must.  

There are two shops in Ghirardelli Square that are pretty similar overall and they both sell sundaes and endless squares of chocolate. The one on the left and closer to the street seems smaller in size, although here, you can view some aspects of the chocolate-making process while enjoying your sundae. For instance, it was neat to see the conching process - the final stage where the chocolate is smoothed and aerated.  Upstairs is a continuation of the shop, where there's a separate sundae station for to-go orders. 

Walking further into Ghirardelli Square there is another store that appears much more spacious.  We came here for dessert one night since there was plenty of indoor seating. They offer such a large ice cream and sundae menu, so it was tough to choose just one. I ordered the Treasure Island brownie sundae ($12) which I split between two of us. Served in a goblet, it contained a couple scoops of vanilla ice cream, layers of hot fudge, a chewy brownie half and was topped with whipped cream chopped almonds and a cherry. The sundae was decadent and the hot fudge was pretty rich. It was a definite splurge, but we couldn't hold back. 

The Ghirardelli shops offer several types of chocolate that are rare sights in typical grocery stores. I spotted both bourbon and blueberry flavors, and we actually bought one dark chocolate bar that contained dehydrated raspberry bits.... after tasting it, I wished we had bought a few more. 
Once you walk in the doors, see the walls all lined with colorful wrappers and are greeted with a welcoming chocolate square, you are guaranteed to be in a cheerful mood. Make sure to include this attraction on your itinerary to SF!
author: Courtney L.

description:
Nope, no, nah-not worth the calories. The hot chocolate was meh, the sundaes were blah-I still love their chocolate but this is a tourist trap. I wasn't impressed with their ice cream and they are very over priced. 
Skip this.
author: Joujou N.

description:
For my birthday, a friend was coming from the Ghirardelli Chocolate Festival. Luckily for me, this friend knows I love my candy. He brought me a few treats on Saturday, September 8th around 6pm.

Premium Chocolate Assortment: 80 Squares
*Milk Chocolate Caramel
*Milk Chocolate 
*Dark Chocolate 60% Cacao
*Dark Chocolate Caramel
*Dark Chocolate Mint
*Dark Chocolate Raspberry 
*Dark Chocolate Sea Salt Caramel

He got me a giant bag of Ghirardelli squares. I'm glad there were a lot of dark chocolate options as I'm not a huge fan of milk chocolate. I especially liked the caramel and mint squares. For something simple, a piece of the 60% hit the spot. He also grabbed me a bar of Intense Dark Cabernet Matinee: dark chocolate infused with natural blackberry and grape flavor with other natural flavor. Super dark chocolate infused with something similar to wine? Yes please! I have yet to try it, but it sounds tasty.

Even though I'm not the biggest chocolate person, I've always had a soft spot for this SF chocolate company. Since this is the original location, definitely worth a stop.
author: Elena N.

description: So on my first day back in San Francisco after being here decades before, I was walking back to my hotel when I saw the giant illuminated Ghirardelli sign.  It was so majestic I had to go in and check it out.  Inside there was a large assortment of chocolates but I opted for some ice cream.  The ice cream counter was clean and the staff professional.  I got a waffle cone/bowl with their signature chocolate flavored ice cream and signature fudge sauces.  I was very good, it was also almost ten bucks.  Would I go here every week?  No. However, for breezing through town and a chance to try an ice cream in such a wonderful establishment it was worth it.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Tsk, tsk tsk. 

No milk chocolate. How is it that the flagship store is out of milk chocolate?

Hard semi-sweet semi-nasty cookie. --and I bought two, before I knew it!
author: Dev R.

description:
Visiting this place was very cool on account of the history of this place. 

Many of the original, working chocolate making machines are still present and in use. They are all on display and were making chocolate during our visit which was a treat 

The ONLY negative about this place are the prices. Everything us EXTREMELY expensive but I "get it". They are targeting tourist like my family and I who paid for a ice cream treat and a few souvenirs 

The view from this lo action is that of the San Francisco Bay which was very nice. 

Overall, a nice visit
author: Ray M.

description:
I was really excited to visit this place while we were in San Francisco today.  I have memories of entering the store and getting a free piece of chocolate.  However, they don't provide samples anymore, which is a bummer.

We decided to order some snacks (ice cream and hot cocoa) and ate inside. My cocoa was good.  However, what was really off putting for me was that there were so many bugs flying around in the air near the chocolate machines.  Like a lot of bugs.  I don't even see this many bugs outside.  But there they were, hovering around the tables above our heads as we waited for our order to be brought to us.  It just makes me worry about the cleanliness of this place. 

Pros:
-iconic place
-they have a parking lot that validates
-they have a yelp check in offer for sundaes

Cons:
-no more free chocolate at the entrance
-bugs in the seating area
author: Cari A.

description:
Each trip to the City By The Bay, we ALWAYS end up At Ghirardelli Square.  We used to enter the gift shop to buy those famous chocolate squares to bring home as gifts.  Unfortunately Longs started to carry them so the novelty has worn off.

This most recent visit we actually were taking a slow paced stroll.  We entered from the ground floor elevator and knew the direction of the restrooms to the right of the enlarged signage.

In previous years there was a place for afternoon tea and another time a musician playing with his CDs available for sale.  Both have sadly gone.

This time it was agreed, we would have ice cream even though we just had lunch from Fisherman's Wharf.

We walked through the gift shop and proceeded to the ice cream parlor.  We found a vacant table by the chocolate churning artifact.  You then go back towards the front to place your order, pay, get a numbered stand and wait for your items to arrive.

All 3 of us got different things.  My chocolate dipped cone was thick and rather hard. The chocolate ice cream was rich and good.  Hubs said his was too big but he finished it off.  My daughter had a hot cocoa.  

My bucket list was de- mystified- there were so many flies hovering above and around us that it was kind of ughs-ville.

If ever I return, I think I will take it to go and enjoy it on a bench facing the water.  Make sure to pick a spot with a good view.
author: Gail U.

description: I ordered a brownie. It was rich and delicious and had chocolate chip pieces in it. There's a downstairs and an upstairs location. They offer chocolate covered strawberries, shakes, sundaes, and sorbet for lactose those who are lactose intolerant. I would visit again.
author: Tawanna M.

description:
I kept it simple and just ordered a scoop of Rocky Road because the other items looked a little too sweet for me and I was already full from lunch. The scoop of ice cream was still the most delicious Rocky Road I've had, though. It was so rich and creamy and the chocolate was amazing.

Knocking off a star because the girl who helped us (Dominique I think?) was a little short with us. You could tell she was aggravated by all the tourists and did not want to be there, which is fine because as someone who worked in food service, I completely understand that. But her shortness with us definitely made me uncomfortable and rushed the entire interaction, giving us barely enough time to look at the menu because we just wanted the transaction to be over.

Other than that, cute and clean place with a lot to do around the square!
author: Patricia G.

description:
Located in Ghirardelli Square, this shop is perfect for tourists with a sweet tooth! Great for a one-time visit or a regular place to come for dessert, but it's not cheap.

It's chocolate heaven in here. You can snag a couple of gift bags. You can even build your own bags with different single-packaged Ghirardelli chocolates. You can also try a free sample or two. 

Best of all -- the sundaes! The World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae is the go-to pick around here, but there's plenty of others to try out. The Golden Gate Sundae features a banana split, the Treasure Island Sundae features a warm brownie, the Marina Sundae features raspberry sorbet, the Ocean Beach Sundae features sea salt caramel, the Earthquake Sundae is large enough for 4 to share -- and there's so much more.

As cute as an yummy as everything seems, be prepared to pay quite a bit for these sweet treats. The World Famous is almost $12. The Earthquake is almost $40, but it looks massive. Good for a one-time buy, I would think.

Ghirardelli Square is located by Fisherman's Wharf and Fort Mason, ideal for tourists passing through. There's a lot to do within the Square, too.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
OK so you will hear from a lot of folks that going to the original Ghirardelli in Ghirardelli Square is "too touristy/ not worth it" blah blah blah, but please trust me in that you should go! It's honestly on my top 5 list of things to do in SF while you're there! 

Now what I can share is that if you go in the evening, this place is PACKED! There will be a line (it always moves relatively quickly) and you will have a difficult time finding a table to sit at (more than likely, you'll end up stalking tables to see who looks almost finished and then kind of hover there.) This is what gets them 4 stars for me instead of 5. It's just always packed in there. What's unfortunate is that I don't think people know that there's another scoop shop just up the steps as part of Ghirardelli Square that has more seating and outdoor options as well. I've never been to that one in evening....so it may be equally packed. 

I have been here 3 times. Two were in the evening and I eentually found a spot prior to my ice cream coming out. The other time was just to buy gifts and get a hot cocoa in the morning and I was one of the only people in here. So if you're trying to beat the crowds, go in the morning or early afternoon. 

Also, I recommend the hot cocoa (the Bay Area can get pretty cold regardless on time of year!) and the classic hot fudge sundae (no nuts for me!). You just can't beat it! 

Also a great place to buy gifts for friends/fam back home. They have a lot of assortments of chocolate, many with SF themed boxes, etc. I also like to just walk around the square and go into the various shops.

Definitely head here when in SF. It's worth it!
author: Chelsea E.

description:
You just have to come in and have a sundae during the Summer or a hot chocolate in the evening. Ghirardelli near the Wharf is synonymous with great quality chocolate and their soda shop is a classic throwback serving everything your sweet tooth is craving.

I like the classic chocolate sundae or the banana split. The very berry sundae and the cookie bottom sundae are also both delicious. There are many choices and some are certainly meant for sharing. There are also a variety of chocolate confections to take home in the gift shop. Those squares of various chocolate flavor combinations are famous the world over. So come to Ghirardelli Square at the end of Fisherman's Wharf... grab some chocolate to take home while you wait in line to order and just let the cashier know which ice cream offering or chocolate dessert you'd like to have. They will bring your dessert to your marble top table.

Street parking immediately outside the square. Check for signs and times. There are pay lots nearby but I always get street parking as I tend to go later in the evening each time to avoid the big tourist crowds.
author: Chuck D.

description:
The original Ghiradelli is a huge tourist spot if you're hitting up San Francisco. I'm born and raised in the Bay Area and still love coming here! There is a certain kind of nostalgia for me with the long lines, tasty ice cream, and quick service. You're right by the water and in Ghiradelli Square you've got cute shops, restaurants, and more to see. 

Now don't get me wrong, the lines are long, but the ice cream and experience is totally worth it! The line moves quite quickly and the place is pretty large so you can almost always find a seat. There's some sort of magic here if you're into this kind of experience. 

The sundaes are decently priced and wow the flavor is spot on! I got the fudge brownie sundae and I was not disappointed! The portions are huge so if you don't want a full belly on ice cream I suggest sharing your treat.
author: Bri D.

description: I love coming here with my fiancé because we always end up leaving extra happy. Such a cute place to hang out at and enjoy a delightful dessert. My fiancé and I wanted to end our long fun day with  hot cocoa and the warm fudge brownie sundae. It was so delicious and we literally finished our drinks and ice cream in less than 10 minutes.... it was that GOOD. Perfect way to end the night at Ghirardelli Square!
author: Neloffer E.

description: Absolutely love the ice cream sundaes here!!! We dropped by here to to pick up some souvenir and ended up ordering the crissy field sundae - a cookie bite sundae with vanilla and cookies and cream ice cream, homemade hot fudge, whipped cream, chocolate cookie crumble and ghiradelli milk chocolate caramel! The taste of the ice cream and hot fudge were sooo amazing! This has to be the best sundae! Love the combination without it being too over sweet. A must visit for some sweets!
author: Paula C.

description: Sugar overload. You can't really go wrong with the food here. Their ice cream is outstanding and with all the concoctions on their menu, there's something for everyone. On this visit, we had a Vanilla Milkshake and a Hot Fudge Sundae. They were both super yummy, but the sundae could've used more chopped almonds. Expect a long line, sticky tables (if you can find a place to sit), and maybe a grumpy waiter (we only encountered one, and he seemed to be having a bad day).
author: Florence A.

description:
Fisherman's Wharf is perhaps the most touristy neighborhood in the most touristy city in the US 

However. There is nothing quite like this ice cream parlor.
It is not really about the ice cream though.
It is about the crafted hot fudge which for this San Franciscan is unmatched elsewhere.  If you do not get it, you may as well pass.

On busy days(every day), the lines are long for the restaurant.   Pass on getting a sit down and a sandwich.  Get a sandwich in north beach.  When you get to Ghirardelli, Go right to one of the kiosks for a HF Sundae. 
The ice cream selections are more limited but ice cream is just a vehicle for the fudge.  Grab the sundae and walk to aquatic park for the View.
author: Phil N.

description:
You don't need to read reviews for the original Ghirardelli. 

If you like chocolate (or, like me, love chocolate), or if you like deserts, then you just need to pick up your phone, enter Ghirardelli Square as your destination on Lyft (or Uber) and go. 

Just go. 

You are still reading? you are supposed to be going.

Why? because it is decadent, scrumptious, and delicious.

Ghirardelli is not the best chocolate in the World (I like German or Belgian chocolate better). They don't have the best ice cream (especially if you have tried Lindt ice cream, say, in downtown Florence). But it is an experience you must try while in San Francisco.
author: Gerardo D.

description:
I love coming here for an ice cream concoction in the afternoon! It is situated on a steep hill and requires some effort to get there, but it's well worth it. 
The staff is always friendly and accommodating. This time around we ordered the Muir Woods and Strike it Rich sundae, minus the almonds. I very much appreciated that they asked if I was allergic to nuts or just didn't like them. They inquired again when they dropped it off at the table because the butter pecan ice cream has nuts in it. Great to know they care about allergens! 
The inside is decked out in SF pictures and chocolate related items. They have machines in the back that show how they make their chocolate, and it is fun to watch the machines work (almost whimsical). 
The ordering process is simple; you order at the front entrance then take your number to a table and they bring it out to you. 
They offer a smaller to-go type stand at the base of the hill and a sundae cart in the square. The bay is visible from parts of the square.
author: Victoria E.

description:
This place is pretty pricey (~$15), but probably because it's targeted towards tourists. I got my hot fudge sundae to go, and it was prepared pretty quickly. The waiters and cashiers were all friendly, and remained calm despite the large crowd. 

I don't have much of a sweet tooth, so this hot fudge sundae was an overload. It was definitely good, but there was too much going on for me to finish it. The fudge hardened really quickly, and the thickness of it made it difficult to enjoy. I liked the nuts, but I wish they added more so I could've had some with every bite. They also had one scoop of vanilla ice cream, and it tasted very standard - nothing special.

Overall, I wouldn't come back because I don't enjoy sweets that much. But, if you're around the area and are curious to try their "world famous hot fudge sundae" - give it a shot.
author: Aileen J.

description: No reservations are required! The banana split and sundaes are amazing!!! If you have little kids take them inside they will enjoy seeing the choclate being made and of course eating ice cream.
author: Lucy A.

description: Hot brownie, chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream.. you can not go wrong. Personally is overpriced for the amount of work it takes to get in, find a table, get your order and by the time they find you your icecream is having a hard time to survive. But 4 stars for how delicious its is. I've had their hot chocolate in the winter and is spot on as well.
author: Lucy G.

description:
Sweet treat bliss in every spoonful. I ordered the Golden Gate banana split dessert, which is enough to share between 2 to 3 people. The ice cream scoops are generous, the banana is softly ripened, and the chocolate/strawberry/pineapple syrups complemented the decadent richness of the entire sundae.

From their chocolate shop next door, I bought a 40 square pack of their milk chocolate caramel ($19.95). They were also having a BOGO deal of buy one get one chocolate pack 50% off.

The Original Ghirardelli Shop is certainly a can't-miss destination when visiting the Bay Area to indulge in a sweet tooth heaven filled with sundaes and chocolate.
author: Anna B.

description:
If you want overpriced, sickeningly sweet desserts at a tourist area, this is the place for you. The appeal of it is 90% tourist attraction and 10% the chocolate ice cream.

Nevertheless, the interior is really cute. To order your dessert, you have to stand in line. Sometimes the line extends outside the store and it's a little awkward and crowded. You then get a number and the dessert is brought to you. There is an upstairs section that is a little more quiet and empty. 

I got the Mint Bliss ($11.95) and it was way too sweet. The fudge just tasted like pure sugar, while the mint ice cream just tasted like regular dreyer's ice cream. What stood out was the small scoop of chocolate ice cream at the very bottom. It wasn't overly sweet but you can taste the depth of the flavor. If you order a dessert, go for something with their chocolate ice cream is you want something somewhat worth the high price tag.

There is ice water on the second floor that helped me wash down the sweetness of the dessert.
author: Gracie W.

description:
If you're here, you might as well go inside. It's an SF classic with excellent chocolate, and an old timey feel. 

Note, only one of the stores gives you chocolate samples (the second door, not the door to order food, on the top story of the factory, the one that goes to see the chocolate machines). 

While this is not my favorite ice cream store (let's be real SF has some wayyy better gourmet ice cream) it's a great place to stop in and visit for some decadent chocolate. It's great for tourists just stopping in for a snack at a place full of history. 

Overall, great tourist attraction, not the best ice cream in town. If you're looking for classic SF ice cream, may I recommend Mitchell's. But this is AMAZING chocolate.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Lovely place. This is what makes San Francisco so special. I almost always go for the brownie sunday, its really good but sometimes they forget to warm up the brownie - which is the fun part! So just remind them.

They have plenty of seating space, and they also have live chocolate making machines on display. I wish they had covered the machines in glass or something to prevent people's coughs/sneezes etc from getting into it.

Other than that, its a great place. Ghirardeli square is nice. They have a big chocolate shop thats disjoined from this ice cream place too, if this gets busy.

I love going here. They also have a dollar discount with yelp checkin!
author: Arjan N.

description: Visiting San Francisco, I always make sure to stop by at Ghirardelli Ice Cream store. Although I never buy the chocolates from the store, but my eyes and tummy can't resist the temptation of the sundaes. This time, we went on a Sunday night. The place was crowded. We had to wait in line for about 30 minutes to place our order. We had Treasure Island sundae to be shared between the four of us. It was bomb! My favorite part is the chocolate fudge, perfectly combined with the vanilla ice cream. Will definitely go here again whenever I can.
author: Nathalia H.

description:
To leave a one star is still too much for this commercial chain of chocolate. This review has been long overdue.
I took some friends here from out of town and I only went because it was for them to experience San Francisco like any other tourist would. We did the cable car and the last stop was Ghirardelli square. 
First of all, the hot cocoa and my cup of tea they brought were all sticky from strawberry syrup. How do you get strawberry syrup on the cup handles if you are not cleaning up as you go. 
This place employs people from all over the world on visas (which is awesome), but they place no attention to cleanliness. It made me grossed out that they are that careless and filthy. I know they are busy but that is not an excuse to slack on cleanliness.
The service is a bit slow and it feels like you are just another number and they just want to deliver your order and be over with it. 
The quality of the ice cream and chocolate is definitely not good. It tastes like sugar and flavoring and thats it!!! 
Please do not waste your time on such low quality chocolate and go try Bi-Rite by Delores park!!!
author: Wajma Z.

description: Every tourist ever visits so the line can look long but they are quite quick when they are serving people. I would recommend splitting a sundae with someone as they are very heavy. I love the cookie and cream sundae. It is to die for and has actual cookie bits which is absolutely phenomenal.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
Biggest piece of advice: where comfy shoes. because it is going to be quite the wait! The line tends to go around the shopping center.
But it is definitely worth it and the line moves fairly quickly.
it's worth the experience!
author: Dayana P.

description: This was our last stop before heading back to the airport. It looked like an old fashioned ice cream parlor but you ordered as soon as you entered and they brought your order to you. The options (all ice cream related) were plentiful and LARGE. Hubby and I tried some sort of Ghirardelli Brownie Sunday with caramel (you know, just so we could say we tried a Ghirardelli brownie and caramel).  Delicious! Highly recommend! I did have a problem with an Uber driver who didn't understand that we wanted to go to Ghirardelli Square and not just a Ghirardelli store, but oh well. We still got here.
author: Christy M.

description:
This place is awesome! That word says it all! 
The employees and owner are generous to give free samples! That's a good advertisement and strategy! 
When you eat one chocolate, you cannot resist another one! So the only way to eat more is to buy a big portion! 
And never forget to take the parking validation for free 1 hour when you buy 20$ 
The place is always crowded but be patient, it's worth to wait for!
author: Truc M.

description: The original shop is pretty neat! I was hoping for more of a tour though. You read and look through it yourself. I had hot chocolate as it was unusually chilly "summer" day and I found it to be delicious! Definitely a one time tourist stop!
author: Shivali D.

description:
Come visit this old fashioned ice cream shop while visiting the Pier/Wharf area! It even has a square named after it! The ice cream is fantastic. I suggest the ocean breeze sundae, which has caramel AND chocolate . Yummmm!
Hint: if it's nice out...go all the way upstairs & sit on the deck with a beautiful view of the Bay!!
author: Shawn W.

description:
Even though I find Ghirardelli chocolate to be far too mass-market and conventional compared to local artisan names like TCHO and Dandelion, this particular outlet is worth visiting even if you're a local, not just because of the touristy and historic factors, but because of its gigantic, overloaded sundaes.

Don't be turned off by the super-sized prices; they're super-sized to match and are easily shareable by 2 people, if not a family of 3 or 4. They come in all sorts of combinations and it makes for a great way to reconnect with friends, particularly folks visiting from out of town. 

Although my 3-star rating indicates that it's not the best in the area, neither for its chocolate (see the aforementioned names) nor for its ice cream (try Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe), it's still worth a visit - at least once.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Being a tourist, or even a local who wants to do tourist things...this is a place to go. It will satisfy your sweet tooth and at the same time you can learn about Chocolate...sorta. 

The plaza does have a lot of different location where you can get Chocolate. It is one of the first ghirardelli location. If you go into one of the building to get a milkshake, ice cream or a banana split you can see the making of the chocolate with tempering and stuff. 

Next to it, it had a small gift shop to buy the chocolate. If you walk more in there is a bigger store that sells Chocolate as well. You can try some of it, just make sure to ask. 

There are other store in this location as well. You are able to buy soap and other souvenirs. If beer is what you want then you don't need to worry. There is a location where you get sf brewing drinks. 

If you don't want to buy anything, just walking around it is beautiful. They do have outdoor games as well. Totally worth going.
author: Drew R.

description:
An all time favorite spot to visit while in SF. 

With 11 kids who want ice cream, where else would you go. Lol.

Enjoyed a banana split, topped with various syrups, whipped cream and of course...a cherry!!! The dessert shop had tons of different options from shakes to extravagant sundaes. Check them out if you havent yet.
author: Corabelle G.

description: One of the reasons why we love to stay at Downtown SF near the wharf. Ghirardelli is a nice place to hang out with friends and family. The only problem I have here are the bugs flying around the chocolate machines. But overall, we had a great experience coming to this locatiot.
author: Maria I.

description:
Light snack before Dinner 
"Mint Chocolate Bliss"
POGIBALLS overall rating 4 Stars
Food 4 Stars
Service 4 stars
Restaurant Cleanliness 4 stars
Restroom 4 Stars

This light snack was very delicious, the ice cream was very creamy and fluffy. The mint flavor was on point, mixed with whip cream, chocolate syrup and a Ghirardelli chocolate bar on top made a perfect dessert.

I would dine here again #ghirardelli, Ghirardelli, San Francisco  #pogiballsratings
author: Richard F.

description:
After all these years, this place is still an iconic tourist stop, and looks the same as I've always remembered it. As a local, I come to this, and other Ghirardelli locations to purchase gifts for visiting friends.  This time, I came by this original Ghirardelli spot to purchase chocolates for Hubby's business clients visiting from Taiwan and Belgium.  

This time I got two tins ($27.99 ea.) of chocolates with pictures of the Golden Gate Bridge and Painted Ladies.  Normally, I always get the wooden cable cars filled with chocolates.  Both are very presentable, and a nice take home memory of San Francisco that lasts well after the chocolates are devoured.  

Even on an early Friday afternoon, there was a line to just pay for my purchase, and an obvious longer line of people waiting to be seated inside. If you're inside enjoying ice-cream, don't miss seeing their chocolate making machine in the very back.

Freebie Alert:  They're handing out free chocolate squares here all the time!
author: Lori N.

description:
Tried the August sundae of the month. Ocean Beach, which is sea salted caramel with Ghirardelli hot fudge and whooped cream. 
Seriously to die for.
author: Lesleigh P.

description:
A little crowded but always a classic!

All their treats are good, just a little pricey. 

Tip: go to the upstairs area to avoid the crowds downstairs!
author: Miranda M.

description:
Ice cream is good. A very well known institution in San Francisco.

Very crowded and commercial place. Be prepared to wait.
author: Fa R.

description:
Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop is located and easily found in iconic Ghirardelli Square along the Beach & Larking Street side. There is plenty of metered street parking and private parking lots in the area. 

If you check out the Chocolate Shop there is plenty of flavor options, and packages to choose from. You can even make your own bag. Also when you walk in there is usually a sales person that greets you with a free chocolate sample of the current promoted flavor.

Depending on the time of year or day of the week Ghirardelli can get crowded quick because it is an hour with high traffic especially from tourist. I been here on busier and quiet times but do not let the line discourage you because they are efficient and the wait time for the order wont be too long.

At the Ice Cream shop there is plenty of dessert options between ice cream and drink variations. Inside of the Ice Cream shop there is plenty of tables and a restroom located in the back. After you place your order take your order tag and find a seat. The wait isn't that long to find a table or receive your order since people are usually rotating in and out of the shop.

I had the Treasure Island - Warm Brownie Sundae that comes with vanilla ice cream, a warmed Ghirardelli Chocolate Brownie half, handmade hot fudge topped with whipped cream, diced almonds and a cherry. I modified my order without almonds due to allergies. 

This is my favorite sundae and what I usually order whenever I come by. The portion size is pretty big and more than enough to share with others. They are very generous with the toppings which can get a little messy once you dig in but the sundae is served with a small plate to help manage any type of mess. The flavors of the toppings compliment each other well which nothing overpowers each other. 

If you're in the area looking for chocolate, ice cream or drinks then come by and give Ghirardelli a try. Ghirardelli also has Ice Cream and Chocolate Shops located throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.
author: Paul V.

description:
Everyone knows about Ghirardelli chocolate it's excellent 
But to get the drinks and the ice cream from them that's different but be super ready for 45 minuets line
author: Marco H.

description:
This place is just a big cluster of tourists but I come here anyways when I need to either 1) buy gifts with tacky SF imagery on them 2) have a sundae or hot chocolate craving.

The hot chocolate here is tasty but overpriced. Nearly $5 for a small. You're better off purchasing their hot cocoa packets and making it yourself because the cost is the same.

Ice cream is good but doesn't light my world on fire or anything.
author: Connie M.

description:
DELISH!!! Went with 10 other friends and got almost everything on the menu. It was a little pricey (~100 for everything)but the texture and richness of the ice cream was worth it. 

They also give you free samples of chocolate on the way in. How could you resist?
author: Graciela T.

description: Ghirardelli has definitely become a tourist trap. Their ice cream is good, but is it worth waiting for 20 minutes in line and battling for an empty (and very sticky) table and then waiting another 15 minutes for your order? Maybe if this is your once in a lifetime visit to SF, but otherwise probably not.
author: Paul G.

description: My favorite place on earth for dessert. I have been here literally every time I have come to SF and every single time it's been nothing but heavenly. It truly and experience to come and see the factory and staff serving. It does get quite busy in the evening but it's well worth the wait. ALSO!!! Don't buy water because they have a water station near the back of the restaurant which you can just help yourself to. Have always come here and will continue to come back. Don't understand why this place doesn't have all 5 stars.
author: Harman B.

description: Too touristy.  Line is long, wait for the ice cream is longer.  Dining area is messy.  It's just chaos in there.  Better off to order to-go from their cart outside.  If you're a large group hoping for a seat, forget it.
author: Janice T.

description:
We recently moved to San Francisco and I took my daughter to Ghirardelli to celebrate finishing all her school work to prepare for 5th grade. She was SO excited! 

We arrived at Ghirardelli to find out they do not accommodate people with nut allergies. My daughter was so sad. Nut allergies are so common. I would assume such a presence as Ghirardelli would cater to the entire population, including those with nut allergies. I will never go back there, even if my daughter isn't with me. 

Zero stars.  Yelp insisted I place a star.
author: talia F.

description: The desserts here are huge and really sweet. The taste is pretty good but the food is really expensive. It is a place you should visit though if you are traveling to SF
author: Maria O.

description:
It absolutely hurts my heart that I live six hours away from San Francisco. I think about this place once a day...  I don't think any other ice cream can compare to the ice cream I had here. I consider packing my bags and moving to San Francisco just for this place a hundred times a day. I will return for you my love 


Okay, but in all seriousness now... the ice cream here is AMAZING. Did you really go to San Francisco if you didn't visit Ghirardelli Square? I think not!
author: Natalie A.

description:
Philthy reViews...the ice cream go to spot if you're visiting the wharf...

Should you go?  Yes.  Tons of chocolate and ice cream.  So much fun to be had here at the expense of your pancreas and blood sugar.

Ice cream sundae: ($11.95) Nothing short of amazing.  Milk or Dark, it doesn't matter what chocolate you use.  They're both delicious.  

Check out the menu..it is littered with a minefield of ice cream goodness..that feeds 1 person to 8 people...something like that..It's amazing the selection present.

Pricing: Kinda much for ice cream, right?  I agree.  It would be nice if it didn't break the $10 barrier.
author: Philippe G.

description: This place is huge! We came walking from the Pier to here. During night time, it was packed. I enjoyed seeing the lights that they have up. There was a long line to get ice cream. I didn't think the ice cream was that great! But the area is pretty to be at. I'm sure during day time, you will be able to enjoy that beautiful outside view.
author: Carola S.

description:
I like ice cream and well the ice cream here is just okay. I like Thrifty's ice cream way better than Ghirardelli's but of course I'm on vacation for the day so I'm a tourist and I've ventured into this place so I'm going to pay the big bucks to have my sundae and enjoy with my friends. 

The place was packed with tourist. The line moved fairly quickly and we placed our order and found a place to sit. It took a bit to get our sundaes but it's all good. 

The place looked clean but my space at the table was a little sticky but maybe it was me. 

I recommend checking it out while visiting SF.
author: Tim E.

description: The ice cream was great! The staff was friendly and service was prompt. However, it gets 4 stars because the place was dirty. The floor looked dirty and had cups and napkins. My friends commented that it was unappetizing because it was not clean and tidy.
author: Adriana E.

description:
Started the day seeing the Golden Gate Bridge  and wrapping up the afternoon with a Golden Gate Ghiradelli Banana Split from the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop

When I was in San Francisco, one of the places I had in mine to visit was the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop. I've had Ghirardelli through the years and I thought it would be really sweet (both literally and figuratively) to check out where it all started.

Located at Ghirardelli Square at Pier 39, this place was not hard to miss. There's a big arch right at the front with the name. (It's perfect for photo ops by the way). The place is split into two sections- the chocolate shop where you can get chocolates to go and the restaurant itself.

At the chocolate shop, every one gets a free sample! They also have a variety of deals.

The restaurant is cool! They take your orders up front and then you can sit where you want. What I really enjoyed was they had a live display showing how their chocolate is made from start to finish. Along with the machines making the chocolate, they had signs showing the process. It's like having a lesson in chocolate making. 

For my visit to the restaurant I got their Golden Gate Ghiradelli Banana Split. Now the Golden Gate bridge is phenomenal and this banana split named after the famous red bridge is as well. It had vanilla, strawberry, Ghiradelli chocolate ice cream topped with crushed pineapple, strawberry topping and handmade hot fudge served with a banana, whipped cream, diced almonds and a cherry! It was intense and definitely a treat.

It was truly a sweet day in San Francisco that day.
author: Jenn G.

description: Salted caramel brownie sundae. Salted caramel brownie sundae. Salted caramel brownie sundae. Yum!
author: Charles L.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid in the 70s.  We used to make it a regular part of the SF tour we'd give our many visitors from Japan and German during the 80s. Their eyes used to pop out of their heads at the display of American decadence! But since we've been exporting excessive eating to the rest of the world for decades now, it's probably not such a surprise to tourists anymore.  

Now that I have kids of my own, it's been really wonderful to take them there when we're in town.  Lifelong memories!
author: Suzy G.

description: Really neat place that's a must see in San Francisco! It's basically at one end of Fisherman's Wharf, so it's pretty easy to check out both Pier 38, Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghirardelli Square in 1 day. The chocolate/dessert shop had a long line when we were there.. and it was also at night and like 47 degrees with wind from the Bay blowing hard..but it didn't stop any of us from wanting ice cream at Ghirardelli! The dessert we got was really good! There's also other places to check out in the square... some shops, a high end restaurant, etc.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Decadence on a spoon.  

But on this particular day in San Francisco, I'd walked nearly 14 miles & felt I'd reward myself with a nice sugar coma.  They were giving out free samples, but being a proactive shopper, I had scanned the menu even before entering the state for a work trip & knew what I wanted: "Mint Chocolate Bliss," 3 words that fit together so perfectly.  A menage e trois for the taste buds.  

It can be busy, even when it's not sweltering & people are perhaps more inclined for ice cream, so allow yourself some time for a crowd.  And to indulge.
author: Shawn F.

description:
Just what we needed after hours of biking through SF and the Golden Gate Bridge. It was really cold but for some reason I wanted a nice cold drink. We decided to get one of each. 

We opted for their salted caramel hot chocolate and thick Oreo shake. The salted caramel got chocolate was a little disappointing for me, it just tasted like chocolate. The salted caramel did not come through the drink at all. The Oreo shake was really good! It was thick, creamy and smooth. It just what I needed after that bike ride. The sugar rush afterwards helped us get through the rest of our day. They even gave out samples for their new pumpkin spice chocolate squares. 

This shop is actually located on the bottom of Ghiradelli square at the top you'll find the old factory which sells ice cream. The store below sells drinks, candy, gifts and sundaes. But if you want the full experience walk upstairs to the old factory building. We had our bikes which made it a little inconvenient for us. Defiantly have to stop here while in SF it's just one of the staple buildings you can't miss the huge Ghiradelli sign!
author: Karen H.

description:
This is it! With over 2,000 Yelp reviews so far, this original national dessert and ice cream shop located at the historic shopping district has it all called, "Ghiradelli." Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop (right inside Ghirardelli Square) serves the customers of all ages from young to old to taste and experience the historic Ghirardelli vibes from chocolates, shakes and malts, sundaes, delicious ice creams and many more every 365 days a year! The atmosphere is very busy and active as I welcomed there. The concept is much original and well made filled with various of rooms to explore from the mini cafe on the lower floor to the upper floor of chocolate shop and an another expansive cafe too.

The employees from baristas and clerks are dong a great job for making the customers like me a very good service despite the busiest environment. No cons found here.

Now onto the treats! On 10/7/2017, after nearly 30 - 40 minutes of wait in a single line, I ordered a Classic Vanilla Malt with an additional topping of fresh strawberries on top. As I slurp it, it tasted delicious! I can feel the flavors of vanilla ice cream mashing up in a blended smoothie twist! The strawberry add on was such a huge success as I did feel the natural flavors of strawberry very well. Delish!

Parking at the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface street nor the parking garage if it's available. Alternatively, you can ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, the Ghirardelli at Ghirardelli Square is the most sensational and original ice cream and chocolate shop that I've ever visited in 26 years of my life! Since it's an overwhelming success for all residents and tourists alike, I'll might be back again next time to try out some more goodies! A well visit! My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
Great ice cream but horrible management. We came at 8:30 on a Thursday night during peak tourist season and they closed off a huge section of seating for no reason, other than they didn't want to clean it.  People ordered and couldn't find seats when there was a whole section of seating blocked off by a chair.

They were instead offering to refund people's money for their orders versus opening the section.
author: A T.

description:
Well, what can I say about this place? It's been a San Francisco staple for the longest time; I've been coming here since I was a kid. It's pretty busy on the weekends but quite empty on the weekdays, and their desserts are very extravagant. Lots of sweetness in the ice cream and chocolate! I love this shop because they always give you a free piece of Ghirardelli chocolate when you enter the store; it's great! Definitely swing by if you're in SF!

[Side note: 1800th review!]
author: Andrea W.

description:
Just love my chocolate this place is great but it's always crowded with so many tourist but I love it anyway. 

Long time to get to the cashier to place your order and after placing your order you receive your number and hopefully find a place to sit and wait for your ice cream they have plenty of tables chairs but it's just to crowded so it's hard to get a spot if you are one grab it otherwise it will be gone 

The prices are high but this is the famous Ghirardelli Chocolate so it's expected
author: Geneva W.

description:
I gave this three stars due to these reasons:

1  for their varieties when it comes to chocolates that they sell. So many to choose from. When we come here I always buy at least two to three packages of different chocolate flavors.

1 for their delicious ice cream and shakes they offer. There's always a big line outside their store just to get an ice cream.

1  for how the staff are attentive in cleaning the tables, cleanliness of their restaurant, and the arrangements of their merchandise are always neat. 

There's two things that i noticed they need to work on. 

1.) to get a system that will work when they call on customers number on the board.. where people can see that their orders are ready for pick up. Constant yelling from the people behind the counter to call on people's order number. It is excruciating  on people's eardrums, and the customers waiting in front of the counter makes it more chaotic because they're blocking other people to walk around and constantly bumping people chair that are placed in front of the counter. 

2.) there should be a sign  for the customers to not block the front of the counter and for them to wait in a corner where they don't block other people's way. Of course this can only happen when Ghirardelli owner decide to put a system where customers can see on the board if their order is ready for pick up. They can also add more tables and chairs for customers to sit in and eat their ice cream  

Overall, it's a place where my family and I would visit again during summer time.
author: Lyn W.

description:
It's not everyday that you visit the Original Ghiradelli Square! There was a line out the door and the wait was about 15 minutes. Be prepared to be on the watch for seating because table do fill up fast.

The coolest part about the place is that chocolate is being made right in front of you. You can see all the steps in making the Ghirardelli chocolates.

We ordered the brownie sundae and it seemed like the order was lost in the sea of orders. People who were behind us had their orders come in and they had many orders, whereas we only had one. We had to talk to the waiter and see the status. Once we did that, our order finally came out. 

The sundae was absolutely delicious! It was really rich and the chocolate was smooth against the cold vanilla ice cream. The brownie was decadent and chewy.
author: Jannat C.

description: What a great experience!! You have to visit this place if you are visiting San Francisco, you will love it and your kids will love it too.
author: Shady S.

description: Never went there before, after the bar party was over at 6:15pm, and I moved to Philadelphia and I went this chocolate place with my boyfriend and the service was nice also. So I ordered a World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae, and I wanted to put some sprinkles on the sundae and it was super good. After that I wanted to get Dipped Strawberry for the extra, because it was awesome.
author: Tatiana V.

description:
A tour of Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf is not complete without dessert at the Ghirardelli Ice Cream Shop so plan your meals and walking time accordingly. Ending up at Ghirardelli Square with a full stomach is a shame. 

First, meander through the adjoining chocolate Ghirardelli shops to get your free sample of chocolate. Usually it's a flavor I don't want like caramel something something, but it's good to gather samples for the one person in your group who likes that flavor. 

Then head over to the ice cream shop. They have a ton of paper menus at the front/cashier so get one and get in line. Suspend your disbelief at $12 sundaes and just get one to share.

My favorites are the Mint Bliss sundae $11.95 and the "cookie bottom" Hot Fudge Sundae. Not sure why they took the cookie bottom hot fudge sundae off their menu. You can still order it, but you have to pay an extra $2.50 for the half cookie on top of the $11.95 charge for a hot fudge sundae. The sundaes are served in chilled glasses, but they melt too quickly because of the hot fudge so eat fast. 

Free small water cups and a water station are located near the back of the shop where they have the display cacao/chocolate grinder apparatus. You'll need water after all that sugar, ice cream, and chocolate.
author: Thien H.

description:
It smells so good in here!

Walking distance from our hotel, we had to visit The Original Ghirardelli Shop. As soon as you walk through the doors, you are given a free sample. Thank you friends :D Employees are all very sweet and helpful. So many sundaes, shakes and floats to choose from. Plenty of seating inside, but this place can get very busy. Tried their ice cream and hot chocolate, both were excellent. This is a great place to get gifts for loved ones. It's chocolate overload here and that is always a good thing.
author: Kimberly J.

description:
Every time my boyfriend and I are on a hot date at the pier, we make sure to stop by the original ghirardelli ice cream shop to indulge in a yummy banana split. You cannot go wrong with ending your fishermans wharf festivities with a delicious bowl of ice cream :) 

I love going through the chocolate shop bc right when you walk in, a chocolate shop worker gives you a free piece of chocolate. My bf and I always opt for the banana split, with cookies and cream to replace the vanilla and extra chocolate sauce. Sometimes when I'm feelin fancy I add a brownie. I love sitting next to the windows in the left of the store bc you can see the ghirardelli sign. There's a certain level of comfort eating a banana split next to the window that no other ice cream shop has. The charm is definitely there. 

The ghirardelli shop is an original and a must see when stopping by sf. Try the drinking chocolate!
author: AJ C.

description:
This place really disappointed me. We flew all the way from the other side of the country and amongst other things we did, wanted to take a tour of the chocolate factory. We were saddened to hear that the factory has not done tours at this location in many many years. After being completely bummed out by this all I wanted was some chocolate covered strawberries. What upset me was not that they claimed they were not in season but that we sat down and the person next to us received 2 sundaes with chocolate covered strawberries on top of them. I immediately asked the woman that served them where we could get some and she said "the only way you can get them is by ordering that certain sundae". 

Besides this, the store was clean and the service was fast.
author: Erica C.

description: Line is long but moves quick! I had the raspberry smoothie which was delicious! My friend had the Nob Hill drink which was also great! All of the staff are friendly + guy walks down the line and gives out free chocolate samples while you wait!! Portions are huge!! Also: if the line is too long at the main store, keep going and there's a Ghirardelli sundae shop inside the square that has treats and retail Ghirardelli items with a shorter line.
author: Alexa A.

description:
CHOCOLATE!!! What more needs to be said. Beautiful building with all the chocolate anyone can ever want. You can actually see the machine making the chocolate. 
Oh and the best part about entering the door. Free chocolate!!!!
author: Joiya A.

description:
My girlfriend loved it here as she's an ice cream fanatic. 

I got her a sundae and she absolutely loved it. 

A bit pricey, but expected in the area and well worth the purchase. 

She just got a standard sundae with vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream and nuts. I believe it was like $12. 

You order and sit down and they bring it over to you, very old school type ice cream parlor feel. The area outside the store is very nice and I can imagine it's even more beautiful around the holidays.
author: Jim T.

description:
ok, disregard the ice cream and chocolate for a second. can we just appreciate that everyone who works at the ice cream shop seems to love what they do? they're so nice and welcoming. it really feels like you're at some kind of chocolate amusement park and they all want your experience to be excellent. they're just amazing.

i take a lot of my out of town guests here. and as i've come here a number of times in the last 2.5 years, i've seen ghirardelli square become nicer and nicer. the first time i came, it was like a ghost town! this last time i came, it was a bustling amusement park! i like that they added some restaurants and pubs and stuff to make it more of a hang out spot and not just a tourist-y area. 

ok, now the ice cream. i mean, c'mon. the ice cream is going to be phenomenal. it's freaking ghirardelli. the portions are huge (which is good cause you're going to be paying a little more for it). i normally just get a cone of the cherry ice cream. i'm not a huge fan of chocolate, but i have tasted it and it is really good. they do a really good job of keeping the tables clean cause you know they just get all kinds of sticky with a bunch of kids spilling ice cream everywhere. 

i think it's worth a special trip to come here to eat ice cream. i'd definitely like to check out of their restaurants and pubs and stuff.
author: Enoch C.

description: I remember coming here when I was young with my family and loving it. Made my kids walk a mile to get here, got 3 sundaes and 3 waters for $50. Super disappointing, bad attitudes, bad presentation...
author: Katrina B.

description:
I visited SF 6-7 years ago and that's the first time I went here and had their World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae. At that time, I believe SF was still the only place you could get one.

Later I was visiting San Diego and stumbled across a Ghirardelli and was thrilled to see the sundae. They've since expanded to even more cities.

In any case, I was in SF last month and obviously returned to get another one of these sundaes. It's incredible how much room for improvement a regular fudge sundae can have.
author: Mitchell R.

description:
I hate to knock off a star, Italian immigrants opened this establishment! However, the family sold years ago and the Swiss confectioner Lindt corporation now owns Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop so I can knock off a star. Why? This is a tourist destination and they are looking to drain everyone out of their hard earned cash.

I first discovered Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop at Disney in Orlando. I'm used to giving them my Disney Vacation Club card for a deep discount. There is no way an $11 Sundae would sell to Orlando vacationers. Ouch.. 

Once you get your mind straight, you know you'll be paying a ultra high price for that sundae, a homeless person will swoop in out of nowhere and stare at your ice cream? Still want it? Guess what? I'm from New York and I don't care about your sanctuary city laws. I just purchased some expensive and deelish, freshly made ice cream. I have dogs, if my dogs were jumping on me to get a lick, I'd push them away. Trust me, I'm not intimidated by that BS. 

Domenico Ghirardelli who incorporated in 1852 created the third-oldest chocolate company in the United States. I tip my hat and say thank you. Now Lindt corporation, hire security to keep the damn homeless off the patio area.
author: Bill S.

description:
A must-checkout place in San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf area. I visited this place on a weekday and it was decently crowded. I guess it will be quite busy over the weekend and expect to stand in queues for some time before placing an order. 

I and my wife tried out the Nob Hill Chill and it was marvellous. The amount was perfect if you are in a mood to share. The chocolaty iced drink eas
author: Suvadeep B.

description:
I came here with my dad on Saturday, Oct. 6, right after we watched the Blue Angels perform at Fleet Week at Fisherman's Wharf. The line was SO LONG! But it was expected. The wait lasted 10-15 minutes. We ordered the Lands End - a salted caramel brownie sundae! It was perfect for two people (and conveniently comes with two brownies). It was delivered to our table in no time and we scarfed it down :) It was really rich in sugar, but I enjoyed every bite of it (as did my dad). It's made up of vanilla ice cream, caramel sauce, sea salt (usually not my go to, but in this case it complimented the dish), fudge (drizzled on the ice cream and crusted the bottom of the oval bowl) and a cherry on top. Just divine!

The cashier was friendly and didn't seem overwhelmed by the crowd. The waiter who cleaned up our table was also nice. It does get crowded inside, but considering it's ice cream I'm sure the customer turnaround rate is quick (especially when you consider the fact that ice cream melts quickly)! Weekends are expected to be busy, so if you're planning a stop here,  come by during the weekdays!
author: Jamey P.

description:
Espresso chip ice cream.

If you come here for no other reason, come of the espresso chip ice cream. 

This shop is large and busy - always. We came by late into the evening and it was still busy! 

There are menus near the registers so you have plenty of time to look over your options before ordering. After ordering, you take a seat and they bring your order to you. I ordered a scoop in a cone and it was delivered on a plate type thing. I assume that was to make sure they didn't have to try to figure out how to deliver a cone and the other items on the tray. Also, the scoop was huge! Way bigger than what I expected from a one scoop order!

I know it's touristy and I know it's expensive... but it's worth it.

Take a bite of delicious San Francisco history!
author: Sabrina B.

description: Worthy the novelty of it, but not 5 star worthy based on their stupid prices... WOW!  I admit, darn good "Classic Hot Fudge Sundae" but far from epic and further when you look at your receipt!  Nuts!!
author: Michael R.

description:
The iconic Ghirardelli Square is a must for all chocolate lovers! I came here on a short trip to San Francisco and insisted on sharing a dessert with my friends. We got the Crissy Field which is a vanilla and cookies 'n cream sundae topped with chocolate chip crumbles, Ghirardelli chocolate minis, whipped cream, hot fudge, and a sweetness only found in heaven. Within 5 minutes, we destroyed it leaving it barely any time to melt away. Delicious!

The other time I was here, I tried the world famous hot fudge sundae which was also so so yummy! The only difference was that I attempted to go at that one alone and though I was happy in the moment, the after effect left with me with some lessons learned. It's sweet, but then again, everything here is sweet. If you're not accustomed or are not a sweet tooth in general, it only takes a few bites to do you in. And if you think you have self control, think again. No joke... It was just that good.

With that said, bring friends and family! It's a great atmosphere and the staff are really cheerful and friendly! I'll never get tired of his place, so until next time. Can't wait to try their other flavors:)
author: Queenie N.

description:
A very touristy thing to do in SF, for good reason! Come here if you're looking to indulge yourself. We came on a Wednesday afternoon and encountered no line at all. In fact, we got our sundae in less than 3 minutes - exceptionally speedy service. 

We got the Treasure Island Sundae to go, and shared it between two people. As expected, it was nothing short of delectable. The warm brownie was heavenly, paired with scoop of vanilla ice cream and fudge. I would honestly ask for an extra brownie in mine the next time I go. 

Overall, exactly what you would expect in an ice cream sundae, but executed very very well.
author: Kevin T.

description: This place is so cool and I like the taste of ice cream chocolate yum yum and I can wait to go back again.
author: Bentley A.

description:
Like many other reviewers said, this place is a must when you are visiting SF. 

I shared a $13 crissy field sundae with my sister and my nephew got a twin peaks sundae. The only bug a boo would be the price but overall it was quite tasty!
author: Chelsea L.

description:
When you go to SF, Ghirardelli is a must. Just for the experience and to say you did it, it's one of those "SF things to do". 

First note that at Ghirardelli Square, there are multiple "Ghirardellis". I've been to the main one before, but when I put it in my map, I ended up at the on-the-go location that's on Beach. And trust, I was confused as hell and was thinking to myself "where'd the rest of it go???". If you want the real deal, make sure you go up Larkin and look for the Ghiradelli arch! That's the one you want to go to ;)

I took my boyfriend here when he visited me from SoCal. After spending the day walking the piers and wharf, we ended the day with dessert. (Yum) and let me tell you. If hot fudge, whip cream, and cookie crumbs don't already reel you in, just look at their dang menu. O. M. G. It's freaking fudge and sugar heaven!!! We ordered and shared the Crissy Field which definitely fulfilled our craving, but check out the menu. See what dessertalicious heaven calls out to you, because trust, one of those desserts will call out whispering your name. It's love, you just know what you want. Ghirardelli won't leave you questioning "did I make the right decision? Did I order the right thing?" Because they are ALL the right decision, you simply can't go wrong. LOL.

Anyways, Ghirardelli is great, we had a blast and enjoyed our date. You can't go wrong with ice cream and chocolate. :D
author: Angelina Ariana A.

description: The shop was stocked with an array of chocolates, suitable for both gifts and personal indulgence. Ordering a sundae was easy and it was made quickly. I ordered a hot brownie, chocolate ice cream, and hot dark chocolate fudge. The price was reasonable and the sundae was amazing. The brownie was that perfect, warm, ooey-gooey consistency, the ice cream was rich and flavorful, and the fudge was simply luscious. I ordered mine to go, to enjoy while I walked along the marina, overlooking Alcatraz.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Ended my Fisherman wharf tour here, and what a treat it was. Got in before the rush, as people were still enjoying the air show of fleet week. Ordered, sat down and deserts arrived very quickly. Chose the famous fudge Sunday and sea salt hot choc. Both amazing, rich but not overly rich, presentation was good, and the side chocolate freebies just topped it all. Some deserts will leave you bleh, and may leave that little bit of cream at the bottom of your glass. Looking around, including me, our glasses was cleaned. Lol. 
The surprise for me, after indulging in so much sugar, a health tax on the bill. Lol I am from the UK and thinks this is a splendid idea. 
Didn't buy anything in the shop, would love too, but like everything else, and pretty much expected eating at the original shop, gonna be over priced.
author: Trieu L.

description:
What a fun experience! The order came pretty fast, it was yum! It's definitely bigger than you see in the pictures and we couldn't finish it but it's not their mistake. We all had lot of good time! 
Really good place to visit and eat some good things including their banana based orders.
author: Vik S.

description: I think I have been to almost all the Ghirardelli sundae locations in the Bay Area including Monterey, minus Lathrop.  Not a regular indulgence since it is $10+ per sundae but a nice treat once in awhile.  We normally go for the Lands End or banana split to share but this time couldn't resist the peppermint sundae that was limited time for the holidays.  Hopefully it was because it was new to the menu but ironically we found it was not made properly at this location where the peppermint should be throughout vs. just on top.  Overall, a fun atmosphere even for locals if you find yourself here when it is less crowded.
author: Joyce Z.

description: Ehh!! Overpriced and very touristy. Had to send back my Hot Fudge Sunday because it didn't have but a small amount of hot fudge. I prefer the local shops over this
author: Rick T.

description: I loveeeee this place! Had the best sundae here! Very nice feeling walking to this place as it's the original. Unfortunately they don't do the tours anymore here but it's worth the visit and worth the extra calories
author: Rose S.

description:
Overpriced tourist trap.  The actual Ghiradelli store is RIDICULOUSLY overpriced.  12.45 (plus a bunch of hidden SF taxes) for a "world famous sundae".  There is nothing famous about this except for the price.  

It was literally one scoop of icecream in a plastic dixie cup (we got ours to go) with some fudge sauce (yeah it was good but no better than any other hot fudge I have had - I mean how hard is it to screw up hot fudge?) a little dollop of whip cream and a cherry. 

Seriously nothing special.  The ice cream was good but it was gone in about 7 bites.

If you really feel the need to say you have had one, great, but honestly you aren't missing anything if you decide against it.  If you have 4 people in your family plan on dropping 50 for ice cream.  Unless you are a Hilton, it may be a good idea to keep on moving down the street for cheaper ice cream.

The store itself is ok - think 29.00 for a bag of chocolate squares. Whatevs.  

Just meh.
author: Olystacy B.

description: I ordered the Hot Fudge Sunday (with waffle bowl dip) and it was as amazing as I expected! Very sweet
author: Sydney X.

description: I've been here twice now and haven't finished anything I've bought :(( which makes me sad because i really tried to let it live up to the hype each time but the last time i went they charged me 20 dollars for a brownie Sundae which is originally 12 dollars. Because i added an extra topping and a little more brownie (which they forgot to give me) and it tasted just okay and my fudge and brownie wasn't warm. super sad. overall this place is not worth it.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Umm free samples of Ghirardelli's milk chocolate caramel squares at pretty much every entrance you walk through? Heck. Yes.

I ordered a warm brownie sundae to share with 2 friends, and it was the perfect amount of sugar overload. For $13 it was definitely way more than I'd usually spend on a dessert. But when in Ghirardelli Square, do as the tourists do, right? If you like brownies, I'd definitely recommend this over the classic sundae as it's only a dollar more. Plus, with a coupon I ripped out of one of the tourist pamphlets from SFO, I got a free chocolate bar with my sundae!

After ordering you get a number to bring with you to a table, and idk how they knew where we were cause we went to the upstairs seating, but we got our sundae super fast! Probably in like 5 minutes or so after we ordered. TIP: you can order their sundaes or whatever else you want from several places around the square, don't be foolish tourists like us and wait in the longest line.

If you want an assortment of chocolate, get the gold tin boxes and stuff it to the max. They were 2 for like $20, and my friends each stuffed like 33 chocolate squares in there. This was like the highlight of our trip for them ha.
author: Anna R.

description:
So a couple of things to know in advance:  this is a tourist area and consequently you will pay more than elswhere.  Given that, I think the desserts that you receive (milk shake, banana split, hot fudge sundae) are great.  The ice cream is excellent as is the hot fudge.  

You order the dessert as you enter at the cash register and then they bring you the dessert after giving you a number to display at the table.  They are very quick on delivery and even if there is a line, it moves quickly.
author: Heinz L.

description:
How do you come to Ghiradelli Square and not get something chocolaty? I admit, this location attracts more tourists on a weekend than Winnie the Pooh to pots of honey. But if you're giving friends the Ultimate Tour of SF, this is a must.

The best thing to get here imho is a hot chocolate if it's cold and a sundae if it's hot. Everything on their menu is for sure to give you a sugar high with their gigantic portions and sweet tooth desserts. I recommend (to share!) the Lands End salted brownie sundae and the Golden Gate banana split. They also give out free chocolate samples!

Be warned, it can get ridiculously crowded/ claustrophobia-inducing with huge 2-hour lines that wrap around the building.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Back for a visit to this landmark and I couldn't wait to get to Ghirardelli for some chocolate. Since tonight was a bit chilly I opted for the Sea Salt Caramel Hot Cocoa and my son and daughter went with the Classic.  We were enthusiastically greeted by the cashier and took our number to our table. After about 20 minutes I questioned the status of our order which had gotten lost in the computer. As the confusion evolved I asked for the manager. Moments later Glen appeared saying-I hear you have been waiting a lifetime for your hot chocolate! He so graciously apologized and explained the error, then offered us free items from the menu. Mistakes happen and Glen made sure we were taken care of by going out of his way to please! We returned two nights later with friends and had fabulous and quick service and the most delicious ice cream sundae in town!
author: Eileen F.

description: Let me start off by saying how I couldn't stop talking about this place for a while! This place was fantastic! Upon arriving we walked into the little shop quick with no lines. We were greeted with free samples of the milk chocolate with caramel flavor. Pricing on all chocolates are a little over priced, but they did have some great deals! Purchased some chocolate, and they gave us more free chocolate samples! Once finished, we sat down in their main seating area. After sitting there for about 5 mins, a server came up to ya and asked if we wanted a free sundae, of course we said YES! Lucky us we received a free sundae!
author: Joanna C.

description: Defitnetly a recommended place to come eat if you are having a sugar craving! Place was delicious the service was fast. In my personal opinion if you are not much of a person who eats lots of sweet stuff it's best to share because even the small shakes seem huge. It is a bit pricey too but it doesn't hurt if much if you share.
author: Iridian M.

description: I absolutely love this place. The atmosphere is very cheerful and friendly. And the desserts are amazing! My friend and I ordered a cookie bits sundae to share. Hands down best sundae ever! About halfway through eating, they brought us another sundae! They gave us a free salted caramel brownie sundae. I'm not sure why they did that. Maybe it was because we kept taking so many pictures of the ice cream they thought we were foodie instagramers
author: Cassie T.

description:
Spent an entire day walking the entire stretch of Embarcadero from the Federal Building up to here and back. If you are familiar with the place, then you know how much walking I did for a day.

Ghirardelli is located at the far end of Embarcadero. At the entrance you will be greeted by one of the employees handing out free samples of mini chocolates. Then you will see stacks and stacks of chocolates in various flavors, colors and sizes.

I wanted to order something from the cafeteria but since the place was so packed and we can barely move, I had to ditch the idea. I didn't bother buying any of the chocolates because it's something that's always available in any regular stores anyways.
author: Cris I.

description: Great location and large variety of everything chocolate. While this is more about the square specifically, bathrooms in this area are hard to find. They are located in the square, but they are basically underneath the buildings and signage is not well. But if you're just coming for chocolate and/or ice cream... DO IT!
author: Rebecca D.

description: Chocolate lovers unite! This wasn't a stop that was necessarily on our list of places to go but we figured why not stop in and look around. We spent most of our time browsing through the shop and cafe, there were multiple people giving out samples while we were there and by the time we were done our sweet tooths were plenty satisfied. The chocolate smells amazing and there are so many different kinds to browse through, they also make great gifts to bring home with you. It was a rainy/cooler day when we stopped in and it wasn't overly busy so we didn't have crowds or long lines to contend with. A yummy pit stop to make while touring San Francisco.
author: Miranda R.

description:
These sundaes are famous for a reason-- they're decadent and delicious. There are actually 3 ice cream shops in Ghirardelli Square & you could be served the same thing in any of them. 
We went to the smallest one, which didn't have nearly as long a line but also had barely any indoor seating. The guy behind the register was not very enthusiastic or friendly, but he got the job done. 
After receiving our sundaes we headed up to one of the bigger shops to find a place to sit. The small shop definitely is the least fancy of the three, while it was serving its ice cream in plastic, the others were serving theirs in glassware and serving people to their tables. If you want a cute ice cream parlor experience, I would definitely recommend going to one of the bigger shops. 
The ice cream was good-- I got the Chrissy field with caramel & it was delicious. Perhaps a bit too much whipped cream for my liking, though but other than that I had no issues with the flavors. The portions, though, are gargantuan. I would definitely recommend splitting with one or two or maybe even three other people. Trust me, there'll be plenty to go around.
author: Anji C.

description:
Loved this place! A must try while you are in the area! If your any sort of a chocolate lover this place will definitely make it on your list while visiting San Francisco.  Instantly after walking in and looking at the different options of ice creams desserts I knew this place was going to be amazing. I ended up getting a Sunday with dark cherry ice cream and chocolate (had a fancy name, I just can't remember what it was). Anyways the Sunday did not disappoint. Had the perfect ratio of chocolate to ice cream. 

Only con: a little bit on the pricy side.  But completely worth every penny. 

Overall, give it a try. This place is delicious!
author: Dakota S.

description:
If you like ice cream or if you like candy or chocolate, you really must come here when in San Francisco.  Ghirardelli Square is really cool but the ice cream shop is very awesome.  When you walk in, there will probably be a line.  Hang tight and wait.  It will move along.  There is a menu posted outside and there are menus posted at each ordering station.  Pick what you want, they will give you a number and you go find a table either inside or on the covered patio area.
  
It will only take a few minutes for your order to be brought.  They will bring you napkins, spoons and your order.  Whatever you decide to get will be incredibly tasty and a pure treat!  On my trip I got the Muir Woods which was a black cherry ice cream with hot fudge.  Holy crikey it was yummy!  So rich! So filling! So cold! Very good.  I also tried my sisters Salted Caramel sundae which was equally good and nice and salty but not too salty.  My nephew got a huge ice cream cone and he happily ended up fully of chocolate.

This was a great early evening stop and I am really glad we went.  I would happily return!
Parking is easy nearby.  They have a garage or there is plenty of street parking available. You have to pay for both options but both take plastic.
author: Angela D.

description:
