Fun place to take the kids to get a delicious sweet treat! They hand out a little square of chocolate as a sample. Also, a great place to play mini golf! Cute little stores there to look at and not to far from pier 39. 
Would definitely go back whenever we are in town.
author: Joyce B.

description: Chocolate heaven awaits you...  from the many choices of chocolate squares to the delicious hot chocolate that my daughter always insists on getting whenever we are in San Francisco.  Plus, they give you a sample chocolate when you enter the chocolate store - score!
author: Ann C.

description:
It is hard to beat the original! This place has a history to it, and you can see and read it on their walls. The original is upstairs, and the express one is downstairs. They both hand out samples. So if you like the sample they have for the day, you can go back and forth! 
The line downstairs is a lot shorter, but you do get the novelty if you don't mind the wait upstairs. I ordered the brownie fudge sundae and it was amazing! The brownie was so gooey and chocolatey! It is like heaven in your mouth. Combined with some delicious, cold vanilla ice cream and some hot fudge, it is a deadly combination. After a while, it got pretty sweet for me to handle. I advise sharing it with someone. Unless you love sugar, then go for it! It was awesome coming back to this place again. It has been years since I been here!
author: Michael W.

description:
I've visited too many times.  I'm the king of re-entering the store to scam an extra free chocolate square.  

Everyone knows the chocolate is solid, yet I always considered the ice cream shop a tourist novelty. I tried my first salted caramel sunday and to my amazement IT WAS THE BEST SUNDAY EVER!!!  The ice cream was smooth and tasty, caramel and fudge sinful, and overall size was huge!  Yeah it cost about $12 but at least it was absolutely excellent!
author: Scott H.

description: Omg! I love chocolate and this place definitely scratches my itch for some good ol' chocolatey goodness. I have only been here one other time but I could barely remember the first time. Then I come this time and I could smell the beautiful aroma of chocolate as I approach the entrance. There wasn't much of a line when I went and it was on a Saturday. I looked kind of crowded inside but then we realized there was seating on the second floor. My fiancé ordered a hot chocolate and when he got it, it was straight up CHOCOLATE. Instead of drinking it, we dipped brownies in it. I would definitely recommend coming to the best. It's here!
author: Justin T.

description: After visiting The Wharf you're going to be tired, so why not stop by and visit a San Francisco fixture and have a real hot fudge sundae from the people who have perfected them. Delicious goodness in every bite and the perfect place to relax and plan your next adventure in The City!
author: Sergio N.

description: You must stop by here when visiting SF to get the full experience. The ice cream shop is very lively and they offer numerous selections. I ordered the sundae special which was delicious! The scenery surrounding the restaurant is breathtaking as it situates itself near the Golden Gate Bridge, Maritime Museum and the infamous Alcatraz Prison.
author: Chynna S.

description: Everything is overpriced, but that's probably what you should expect in San Francisco and right next to the Bay. It is all very delicious, their chocolate is TDF! It is a must for tourists since it is world-renowned. My wife and I ate here in 2005 every night on our honeymoon (thankfully prices were reasonable back then).
author: Neville S.

description:
Touristy? Yes, but oh so worth it!

We came here on father's day Sunday June 18th after a loooong walk from Presidio picnic - Chrissy Fields - Fort Mason and then we turned here for some ice cream. Let me point out I already had 2 ice creams that day (pistachio gelato from Alimento and ice cream sandwich from Bi-Rite at presidio picnic -off the grid) but nothings was going to stop me on such a hot day!!! And Hello? Super long walk? Totally deserved it, right?

Between the three of us we shared the Treasure Island - warm brownie sundae. No questions asked! That brownie though...

Place is packed but lines move fast (section upstairs where the chocolate making takes place) and we easily found a free table inside :). Already missing it. Can't wait for a good excuse to go back :)
author: Heliana M.

description:
I go once a year while in San Francisco for an event held there.  It is a good place to meet new friends as well as catch up with old friends around decadent ice-cream sundaes and splits.

No question that the ice-cream is good and I always get the salted caramel sundae.  Gooey, sweet and crunchy salt.  Good for large groups...pay, get your number for your table, and they deliver it to you.  Simple and good.
author: David T.

description:
Honestly!! I love it!! Absolutely worth the wait and it was super fast service and a quick moving line... on a Friday... but the fudge IS really DELICIOUS !!! 
I ordered the world famous fudge sundae and it was perfectly delicious... I thought it was too boring or plain but honestly with all of the other tempting sundaes and treats offered I had to keep is OG... and see what the fuss was and sometimes it's just good to stay original ... I was pleasantly surprised and pleased!!
My daughter got one of the mint  fudge sundaes with dark chocolate and it was amazing but a little too rich for me... 
if in San Francisco you must try the giradelli sundaes!!
Oh yes I tried a caramel latte... it didn't even taste like espresso was in it... don't waste your time on the drinks come here for the sundaes!!!!!!
author: Pamela G.

description:
It really is the chocolate factory, sans oompa-loompas!
Fun place, cool building and square, good ice cream, neat store, wonderful staff and service, long line but it moves fast.  It was fun visiting and having way too many calories... A little expensive, but hey, it's San Francisco and the tourist area.  Won't blow your socks off, but you'll most likely have fun and enjoy the visit.  I did really like the brownie Sunday.  My wife really liked the milk shake with banana in it.  And the square is neat too, cool place to just shop around.
author: David P.

description: Went to purchase chocolates for my friends today...spent over $40. On different chocolates and was never offered a sample
author: Judy K.

description:
Get your ice cream! Come and get it!  This is a staple of the SF area and if you're coming to SF for the first time, then you owe it to yourself to check this place out and get a dessert or two.  The quality is top notch and the smell here will leave you wanting more. 

Sweet tooth's will love this place as there is so much chocolate, you might have a panic attack not knowing where to start eating.  Don't indulge too much as you might leave with a new cavity or two! 

Great chocolate, a little pricey, but this is the tourist trap area of SF.  Still, I give it my endorsement.
author: Benny H.

description: Wanted to try "earthquake" at Ghirardelli cafe for a long time. Finally, decided to try it out. 8 different flavor's of ice cream with banana an whip cream. Shared with other 2 people, but I ate 75%. So many calories but worth it! Memories!
author: Kaori M.

description: This place is just incredible!!!! The smell of chocolate is just delicious we had the ice cream and the hot chocolate the ice cream I wish had more hot fudge but overall so creamy their whipped cream is out of this world and yes it is crowd and hard to find a seat but worth it and their chocolate machine makes the place even better
author: carla a.

description: Wow . Service was awesome CHOCOLATE EVERYTHING was awesome this is definitely a place for a chocolate lover but have no fear if you're traveling with someone who doesn't like chocolate as much they've also got you covered
author: Nayeli D.

description: You can buy desserts, hot chocolate, or delectable souvenirs here. As you walk in the door, you are greeted with a free chocolate square. There's usually music in the outside square where you can enjoy an ice cream sundae. The views from the dinning room are great, on sunny days, you can see the Bay & Alcatraz clearly. There are other little shops in the Square too, you can buy stationary, soaps, liquors, or even dog accessories. At night the Ghirardelli sign lights up the night. A good place to come if you have a sweet tooth. My only concern was a rogue pigeon in the dinning area looking to score a free dessert when someone wasn't looking. Ugh.
author: MTex G.

description: Each time I'm in SF I need to visit one of the Ghirardelli icecream shops. As someone who is willing to die for my sweet tooth, I need their fudge sundaes--I feel it should be doctor recommended. Even my friend who lives here and doesn't have a sweet tooth finished a whole fudge brownie sundae--we were both shocked! The icecream is a nice compliment to the delicious and gooey fudge that wraps itself around your tastebuds. I wanted to do some shopping at their store too, so this was perfect. We grabbed our sundaes and walked across the street to the Maritime boardwalk and park, but the space at Ghirardelli Square also has beautiful spots to sit and enjoy your dessert. I'd definitely recommend visiting them during the holidays for their great deals on chocolate and the beautiful Christmas decor.
author: Maryam A.

description: I got the coco float . Very tasty but way overpriced! Spent almost $10 for a float! The quality is premium and the service is fast for the amount of people in the small shop! I enjoyed it very much but don't think it was worth the price.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Playing tourist has its price. And only when you feel ripped off can you achieve a heightened tourist mental state of mind. I did very well by coming to Ghiradelli. 

After walking around, we ended here for some cooling down on a warm afternoon. The line as ridiculously long, many people took selfies by the entrance as if the store is a celebrity. The menu consists of mostly overpriced sundaes. A brownie sundae and a 2 scoops dish totaled about $21.00. There was nothing spectacular about the flavors, and the choices were limited. Most brownies are served with vanilla ice cream, cuz you know ... no imagination. 

To make me feel just a tad bit more like a desperate tourist looking or life experiences to post online ... it took a long time for our order to come out. I mean, they weren't cooking anything, right? You scoop the already frozen ice cream, top it with can whip cream, toss on some sprinkles and viola! 
And when the order finally came, part of the ice cream had already melted. Perhaps they should've stored the goblets and serving dishes in freezers. 

This experience had led me to actually feel sorry for real tourists who probably flew in to SF, got a hotel, rented a car, overpaid for parking, stood in line just to try and enjoy this overpriced, semi melted ice liquid. 

Not worth the time or money, unless you truly believe in supporting the local economy ... then hey, thanks a bunch!
author: James L.

description:
After several consistently great visits to this Ice Cream Shop ordering the same "Original Sundae", I was finally able to tear myself away and order other items.

MARINA SUNDAE - with the raspberry sherbet and Ghirardelli chocolate fudge is good... for those who like sherbet. I personally don't get fudge and whipped cream on a sherbet, but if you break it down to its individual components, each is very good.

PAINTED LADIES - MINT - Very good chocolate chip mint ice cream. Good Sundae.

PEPPERMINT BARK SUNDAE - sooo good.

I guess I'll always have a special place in my heart for the Original Sundae.

What's up with only having ONE cashier at the front, by the way? Need to add more.
author: Kislev A.

description:
Come here for a free piece of Ghirardelli chocolate as you enter their shop! That's probably the biggest plus here though. We were determined for some ice cream, so waited in a separate line from the shop to order. This spot is a tourist trap, so what can you expect other than pricey ice cream? But I do have to admit that their portions are huge!

I ordered the Butter Pecan single scoop ($5) in a Waffle Cone (extra $1) topped with sea salt. Let me warn you not, the sea salt was salty AF. I mean, I get it.. I ordered salt for my ice cream, but it was too extreme. There's also huge pieces of pecan in the butter pecan. I did not like any of it. This is a self reminder to stop being adventurous. Or this is also why I prefer ice cream shops that let you try their ice cream flavors. In the end, I basically tossed most of my ice cream away and just ate the waffle cone. I'm a sucker for waffle cones, so that made it better --except the cone got really chewy in some parts.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for service alone. The sales people are helpful and knowledgeable and the folks at the registers are sweet as... well, chocolate. Everyone who worked there seemed like they were having a great time. 

And the chocolate! Most everyone has had Ghiradelli chocolates, but if you're at one of their stores, you have to try one of their baked goods! The very friendly cashier asked us if we wanted a brownie or cookie. I sounded on the fence so she just gave us a free cookie. And this cookie is HUGE! It fed 2 of us and we still had some leftover. Get one right out of the oven or ask for it to be heated up. Tastes like cookie dough.
author: Lisa T.

description: Although the ice cream is obviously good, it's all hype. First of all, the prices are ridiculous for what you get-around $14 for any sundae. Second, they list the calories for every ice cream sundae, and the lowest is 700 cals. Essentially, I left hating myself and wishing I made the same sundae with halo top and the caramel milk chocolate sample they gave anyone who walked through the door. Wish all of that being said, it's still one of the must-do things in San Francisco. Go once to say you did, and don't miss the chocolate machine in the back of the restaurant!
author: Melissa G.

description:
Wow!!!! What a great place if you are craving for good sweets:))) 
The bad:
It is a touristy place, so long lines, long wait for your order to come out, not friendly person at the cash register and very expensive bill.
Portions are small for what you actually pay

The good:
It's really good! We ordered 3 different items from the menu and they were all very tasty! We got the hot fudge Sunday, and the midnight reverie with coffee ice cream and a tons of fudge, to die for!!

Overall, this place is very expensive, so this is not a every week to go destination, but if you craving for an amazing fudge, this is your final destination!
author: Michelle C.

description: While visiting SF, I decided to go to Ghirardelli Square to see what it was all about. I bought a few yummy chocolates and ordered a hot chocolate. It was hands down one of the best hot chocolates I have ever had. It had a rich chocolate flavor without being too sweet. YUM!! I highly recommend trying out what Ghirardelli has to offer!
author: Nat N.

description: Always a hit with tourists but so crowded... there are several other amazing icecream places in the city to make me want to stand in line again....
author: P M.

description: We stopped here for dessert after a nice dinner on Pier 39.  It had been some time since I have been here and it was much nicer than I remember. The ambiance was super chill and enjoyable. We both got ice cream milkshakes. I got a medium espresso chip milkshake. It was delightful! So perfect! If I could have had 5 more I would have! It was the perfect dessert!  I will definitely be back to try more of the amazing desserts here! Bring the date or the family! You will be happy you did! Yum!
author: Nathan L.

description:
Good service. Keeps the line moving while giving out delicious samples. Huge portions, may want to consider sharing. 
Staff is very nice.
author: Adrienne D.

description: Great flavors. What I appreciate is the consistency they have maintained with their ice cream sundaes. View is pretty good too.
author: Finla P.

description: We got the Treasure Island and the World Famous sundaes. OMG! So delicious! Their portions are pretty big, I would suggest sharing. The line wasn't long at all, for a Sunday afternoon. Great place to take friends or family visiting San Francisco. If you enter through the store they even give you a free piece of chocolate ;)
author: Neha S.

description: The line was out the door but that didn't stop my family and I from eating here. We stood in line and looked at a menu and I ordered the hot chocolate and banana split it was one of the best banana splits I've ever had. The employees are very helpful and made my things quickly considering how packed it was. I'm very pleased with this place and went home to brag about their goodies. I will be back
author: Jassy G.

description: A great, classic place to visit and see! The sundaes are very expensive ($11) and not too good but it's the Ghirardelli special.
author: Eric T.

description:
It's just one of those places you have to indulge in if you come to Ghirardelli Square.

As everyone has mentioned before, it's overpriced - but everyone expects it when coming to a part of San Francisco that's demographic is solely tourists, including locals. Even locals don't say, "Hey let's go get some ice cream from Ghirardelli today!" Nope, they'd pull up an entire list of ice cream shops on Yelp before picking Ghirardelli. However, when we also want to play tourist, Ghirardelli Square and the ice cream is an obvious choice.

Lines get long, but they don't take too long. The biggest struggle with this place if you come at a peak hour on a weekend would be finding a table so sit at, but thankfully it's just ice cream so people don't take too long to eat.

[FOOD]:
World famous, hot fudge sundae: Perfect if you just want something more on the simple side of vanilla ice cream with hot fudge and whip cream. The hot fudge is amazing against the cold ice cream. Good size for two people, or one really hungry person ;) 

Earthquake: 8 scoops of ice cream with a plethora of toppings on top including nuts, mini chocolate chips, bananas, and more. This was $40, and with tax around $45. It claims to feed 4, but our group of 6 struggled to finish it. A good choice if you have a really big party, I'd say at LEAST 6 people. The mini chocolate chips were my favorite part, weirdly enough. They gave an awesome and chocolaty crunch!

All in all, this isn't a place you come to everyday. But if you already made the journey to Ghirardelli Square, you gotta just accept the that it's overpriced and enjoy every single bite of that delicious ice cream. And trust me, you will!
author: Mars S.

description: We waited in line for what seemed like ages but it was all worthwhile. On a cold, windy day we were treated to some of the best hot cocoa I have ever had. We had the classic cocoa, which was simply topped with some fresh whipped cream. While this sounds pretty basic, it is clear that they use some fresh chocolate and cream to make a rich and satisfying hot cocoa. If it is a cold day, definitely try this instead of the ice cream!
author: Noah P.

description: The world famous sundae is good.  If you don't have sweet tooth, you won't like it.  I recommend to share with someone.  The line is long but it's worth
author: Quynh N.

description: This place is ok. I love Ghirardelli chocolate, but I wanted an option to buy some chocolates, not buy by the bag/pound size, more like handful, and it wasn't really an option. The chocolates sold are geared for gift giving, unlike other chocolate factories where they sell the "mistakes" for .25 cents! We found if you hang out long enough the various sample people will load you up without having to purchase! I also wanted a tour, like Charlie & the Chocolate Factory, but there wasn't an option for it. It was a nice 15 minute stop, the view from the outside overlooking the water & Alcatraz is amazing & worth a drop in if you're in the area.
author: Carrie C.

description:
This place never disappoints, its always been part of my city tour for friends and family visiting from out of town. 
I love the banana split and the hot fudge sundae.
author: ali e.

description: I came here with a friend of mine after spending the day in San Francisco. We got the chocolate chip cookie dough and brownie sundae, and it was the perfect way to end our night. The portions are pretty big, so I'd recommend sharing between at least 2-3 people depending on which dessert you order. The line wasn't too long, but it was really crowded inside and we had trouble finding a table. It was easily one of the best sundaes I've ever had though
author: Troy L.

description: Should've got the hot chocolate fudge since that's what they're famous for but we got the banana split instead. It had a lot of whipped cream and their hot fudge was really the only great thing about the ice cream.
author: Harshini R.

description:
Friendly, clean, and iconic.  We got a scoop of ice cream, which was pretty huge.

Luckily, we didn't come during a peak time, so the place was quiet and we got to look at everything unhindered.
author: Julie D.

description:
Hello,

Well, I wonder how can anyone rate this place less than five stars, especially someone with a sweet tooth. Besides being surrounded by chocolate all around, what makes the experience more exciting is the courteous, smiling and cheerful staff. They make you feel like you are at a happy place. The vintage process of chocolate making demonstrated to remind the visitors of the importance of this place is both interesting and overwhelming. Needs a bit of cleaning though. We were offered a caramel milk chocolate mini as a sample as we entered the store so there it got 10 points for who doesn't like free chocolates. I ordered Treasure Island. Its the world famous hot fudge sundae with a (very very gooey and tasty) Ghirardelli brownie. While the ice cream drips all over your hands, the hot rich chocolate fudge fills your soul. Whats not to like!!! These are the places that make non chocolate lover like me crave for chocolate. A must visit. I know I am going back there soon! 

Thanks,
Nidhi
(Indian Vegetarian Foodie)
Instagram: nidhishappythoughts
author: Nidhi S.

description:
Nice for a group experience, maybe take the kids, scratch off the bucket list. It's sort of a cool pit stop when in San Fran but nothing to write home about. 

There's plenty of seating both in & outdoors, amazing chocolate making machinery and sweets to choose from. Aside from ice cream scoops, cones & hometown sundaes, Ghiredelli's offers truffles, dark chocolate, milk chocolate bars, splits, shakes and more.

I'll admit the location is prime and the history is cool but I'm honestly not a fan of the service or lack of customer consideration. No lids for to-go orders? A dime for a bag? 

One word...Petty!

~Christy
author: Christy A.

description:
A cool place to come visit if you're in the area. Chocolate galore! Easy to get to using cable cars near by and and easy and nice walk with views in the area.

Yes it's expensive, but look where it's located. Yes it's touristy, well duh, look where it's located.

Had a great time here.
author: Christopher S.

description: CHOCOLATE !!!!! Free caramel chocolate sample.  We had coffee, ice cream sundae and a shake.  Over priced but good .... it's Ghirardelli
author: Basem T.

description: Sea Sea Salt Caramel Sundae is very tasty! The ice cream is very creamy. The hot fudge & caramel are not too sweet either. I was full from lunch and was able to eat almost the whole sundae...it's that good!
author: CP B.

description: Very fun to visit - especially when you get handed a piece of chocolate for just walking in! Everyone was super friendly and made the experience that much more welcoming. Of course it wasn't good for my bank account and my stomach after buying every flavor of chocolate known to man! Well worth the visit :)
author: Alicia D.

description:
I really love ice-cream, candy and anything sweet. We only go here on occasion, and each time it is delicious and a special treat.

Ginormous sundaes (and we had sundaes today on Sunday!!) -- 2 people could easily split one. 

Do not be scared by the line at the door, it moves fast.

I think my favorite thing is the chocolate shake (although I rarely get it anymore) --

Anyhow -- yes, it is good, but traffic etc and lots of people, this is only reserved for when we are in the hood.
author: Kate F.

description: Everything on the menu looked delicious! Unfortunately we couldn't try everything but the Lands End was AMAZING!
author: Diana C.

description:
I absolutely love ice cream, so when I was in SF, and realized that this was close to my hotel, I knew I had to try it. Also, everyone we spoke to said we HAD to go try it. My friend and I decided to walk over one night and see what all of the hype was about.

When we got there, we loved how cute the outside was with the sign lit up. We also appreciated the free chocolate you get upon walking in! There is SO much chocolate everywhere the second you walk in, and flavors that you never knew existed. They also had a ton of cute little chocolate gift items available. And the liquid chocolate being made for you to see...a sight for sore eyes!

On to the ice cream...unfortunately, we had just eaten a big dinner, so getting this ice cream was pushing it. Having said that, we didn't get anything crazy...just a scoop of ice cream in a cup. I had the chocolate and it was really good. Smooth, thick, and a rich chocolate taste. If I'm ever back in SF, I would love to come back here and try something else!
author: Jessica D.

description:
Need I explain the five stars. How can you even go wrong with this place? Well, I guess they could always put more fudge and sauces in there Sundays. That never hurts anyone.

I suggest sharing because if you eat a whole Sunday by yourself you will most likely break out of your pants that you're wearing and have so much guilt that you will run to the nearest gym. Lol!!
author: Juls B.

description: Nice little place here in San Francisco good little shopping district have a lot of chocolates my wife likes chocolate so she's familiar with this brand name I've seen it before I probably had it before but nothing to write home about because I like wings and beer and things like that wife likes chocolate so this is right up her alley I'm sure it's right up a lot of people's alley cuz it's always crowded.
author: Jeremy J.

description: This was hands down the best ice cream sundae I have ever had! It was pricey at $12 but ohhhhh it was worth it! All the hype is true! I got the cherry chocolate sundae! This was a highlight from our pier 39 adventure!
author: Jessica C.

description: The ice cream here was amazing ! My wife and I shared a painted lady. The service was fast and the place is real busy. Good treat for walking all over San Francisco! Highly recommend getting a treat here
author: Thomas G.

description:
This store is super busy in comparison to the other two. 

We didn't end up buying anything here, just looked around the store. I like the information they had on how the chocolate is made and the displays
author: Rowena B.

description: No matter how much i say about this place, it doesn't seem enough :) the hot chocolate fudge sundae is out of the world. The fudge is literally liquid gold!! The hot chocolate is pretty great too but the sundae is what I keep coming back for! :)
author: Ahana D.

description: I went here with my family back in 2009 and I had the s'mores sundae. It was excellent. It was really busy but we were waited on quickly but the service was top notch and the staff was excellent. We will be returning to Ghirardelli's again you guy should check it out.
author: Ethan H.

description: Only reason I gave this four and not five stars is due to pricing. The ice cream, service and locations/atmosphere are top notch.  Got the hot fudge sundae to split.  And  the detailing of adding shaved candy was incredible.  We got ours to go and sat outside near the beach before sunset.  A nice ending to our amazing San Fran day .
author: Kim H.

description: I love Gerardelli...it's a unique San Francisco experience that all tourists should try at least once.  I am however not impressed with the crazy priced sundaes.  I paid $15 for a Muir Woods Black Cherry Sundae with extra Marshmallow sauce.  Tasted good but it's not worth the cost.  Like I said, it's great for tourists but I'll be taking my local business elsewhere.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: What's not to like when talking about Ghiraredelli?!?! I mean, chocolate, do I need to say anything else? Yes, ice cream!!! Let alone let me not get started on the milkshakes and combos?!?!?! Salted caramel? Yes, please! Overall be ready to indulge! For those of you counting calories you might want to ignore the calorie count!
author: Jonathan P.

description: Every single dessert I've had here is amazing, especially the sundae's. There's a chocolate machine in the back that had ribbons of chocolate. The only downside is the wait so come here when you have a lot of time. The portions are also good enough to share on any of the sundaes.
author: Apoorva D.

description:
Highly worth the visit in the city. Yes, it is one of the tourist attraction staples, but that's part of the experience to say you've been here and tried the World Famous Chocolate. So many will say they've seen and walking around Ghirardelli Square, but not eaten inside to try the goodies. The big deterrent is the price. $13 for a sundae and brownie is not the most appealing thing. These are tourist attraction prices, which come with the territory. Sharing the dessert is the way to go. My favorites since I have been going here are the Treasure Island, Nob Hill Chill, or hot fudge sundae. Anything with a brownie has me lured in already. 

Even on a cold night, you will see people enjoying ice cream, but it is warmed up inside. They are open late, perfect for a after dinner dessert. There is often a line spilling outside for weekends or holidays but it moves pretty fast. There is usually guaranteed seating. Don't forget to check out the chocolate wheel!
author: Jaime F.

description: Nice visit to see how the chocolate was made. Didn't have too much room after dinner to eat dessert so just warmed up with some hot chocolate. Also picked up some treats to bring back home. They sell this chocolate all over but this was from the "original location."
author: Ashley W.

description: Kinda expensive BUT the portions are HUGE and made to share. Try the espresso escape! The coffee ice cream balances the sweetness. Naturally, can get pretty crowded as it is a tourist area.
author: Puneet D.

description: I think this is a MUST SEE in San Francisco! You get a free caramel square just for walking in. But how can you not order something off their amazing menu? My friend and I split the Chrissy Field cookie bits sundae and a hot chocolate. With the sundae having 1680 calories, we honestly should have ordered something smaller, but it was soooo delicious! Needless to say, we couldn't finish the whole thing. The hot chocolate was so rich it was like drinking liquid chocolate.
author: Kali P.

description: We got a free sample of chocolate when we walked into the chocolate shop, and the ice cream was good.  The Ice Cream shop was extremely busy and crowded, and it was a really cold day (I would hate to see it on a hot day), so it kind of felt like cattle being herded through the lines, but overall the people were friendly.  Prices were more than I would normally spend on ice cream.  I also got a Hazelnut Latte to try and warm up. It was ok, nothing to rave about, but it was cold about 5 minutes after we left since it was such a cold day, so that plan failed.
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Tourist trap!

But if you are tourist and especially have kids, this is the place! 

A lot of fun shopping and checking it out, of course don't forget to try out chocolates and ice cream. This and boudin bakery across the street are the go-to places around fisherman's wharf with family.
author: mengzi w.

description: After a long trip, shopping and dinner we ended our day here. We arrived around 8:30pm and there wasnt a seat available and a line almost out the door! The staff didn't seem annoyed or in bad spirits, they kept up great customer care which we appreciated. One couple felt bad that i had my baby in my arms so they gave us their seats, so we finally settled in after walking in circles for a while. My kids loved their sundae and i Ioved my espresso sundae....need to try to recreate it at home! Its a tourist hot spot and so obviously the prices are pretty high...almost $30 for one small sundae and one sundae that can possibly be shared. All in all...good experience, but wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
author: Tanya S.

description:
I fell in love with Ghiradelli ice cream Shoppes a few years ago so naturally I just had to visit when in San Francisco. The shear size of Ghiradelli Square is amazing. There are multiple ice cream Shoppes / stores around the square to handle the mass amount of people that visit everyday. 

The food always gets a 5 star. The only reason for 4 stars was the inability to keep up with customers and seating. That was very minor though.

Good food, good customer service.
author: Hillary L.

description:
Holy crap this place is expensive!

Holy crap this is good ice cream sundaes!

I guess you get what you pay for...

Very touristy but everyone has to give this place a try in their lifetime.
author: Joey H.

description:
This is some damn (good) expensive ice cream.

+1 star for the fast service
+1 star for the handmade whipped cream
+1 star for the cool chocolate story exhibitions and history
-1 star for how expensive this is
-1 star for imbalanced ice cream + topping ratio 
-1 star for the lack of caramel sauce despite the caramel topping that I opted for

This is way too expensive. I think the experience itself makes up for the high price tag. When I paid $7 for fancy NYC-based Thai ice cream, I never thought I'd pay double the price tag to eat ice cream in SF. I don't like when I am paying for the store's rent, rather than the food itself.

Bonus points for being located on a hill so you could walk off the calories afterwards.
author: Maria G.

description:
We met Glen,one of the managers, downstairs at The Pub. Had some friendly conversation.  He loves what he does and was very knowledgeable and helpful as we asked the touristy questions about Ghirardelli and San Francisco.  We were excited to try a sundae after our meal downstairs! We parted ways with Glen at the bar and headed upstairs to grab a sundae and take some pics of the square.  To our surprise, Glen was walking out of the ice cream store and handed us a coupon for a sundae! It was definitely not necessary for him to do this but it was greatly appreciated!  He was many of the kind people we met during our trip to San Fran!  Thanks Glen!  

As for our treat, we tried the brownie sundae.  It was very good, however, I would put it up against some of our local homemade hot fudge ice cream shops any day!!! We would most definitely splurge to come here again!!
author: Sarah E.

description:
Yes, yes, and yes! The menu is a bit pricey, but the treats are totally worth it! I ordered the espresso escape and loved every bite. Everyone else in our group had no regrets about stopping here. It's a fun experience regardless, especially being able to learn about their process while waiting for your treats to be ready.

The inside was surprisingly clean, too, for such a high traffic tourist spot.
author: Kirk M.

description: Beautiful building, great location, excellent service and amazing ice cream and chocolate. The warm brownies and fudge topped with any flavor ice cream is the way to go. I prefer vanilla.
author: Juan M.

description: If you love chocolate, this is the place to be. If you're lactose intolerant like me, it's still the place to be: just don't forget your pills because it'll be worth the 20 bucks you paid for it. Super rich and sweet, with something fun for everyone. Very busy though, so try to avoid peak hours.
author: Kevin N.

description:
We entered Ghirardelli Square and were immediately confronted with a line of people for something.  Turns out hey were all waiting to go into the Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop. A large poster outside of confectionery delights was pretty tempting, but we didn't stop, browsed around the Square, and then ended up on Jefferson Street walking towards the Wharf. Then, for some reason, we both turned to each other with one thought in mind: let's go back for some ice cream! So much for willpower.

There still was a line, but it moved fairly steadily. We were not expecting that when you get to the front of the line you immediately have to make your choice and pay the cashier. No problem: how could you go wrong with "The World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae"?  But if you are debating about several items, you may want to grab a menu and decide in line.

We opted to eat inside, they give you a number and bring your ice cream after a few minutes. We took one bite of the hot fudge sundae and - wow - that's gotta be the best hot fudge sauce I've ever had. We shared a sundae and gobbled it down in no time, savoring each spoonful. Delicious! And I'm not normally a sundae lover.

Afterward we wandered through the gift shop where they give you a complementary square of Ghirardelli chocolate, nice! and bought a few gifts.  This is definitely a must-visit if you are in the Ghirardelli area.
author: David F.

description:
Short review:

Holy crap this place is good! In the tourist mecca, expect lines that move quicker than you'd think.
author: Mark R.

description:
Oh my, the ice cream sundaes are amazing! The fudge is amazing. Rich. Chocolatey. Amazing. The lines are usually long, but I think it's worth it if you want to go once in a while for a little treat. It can be a little confusing when ordering, since you can order downstairs and also upstairs. Once you order, you sit down anywhere. Somehow, they will find you and bring your sundaes to you among the huge crowds and people enjoying their desserts. 

We've ordered the Presidio Passion and Muir Woods sundaes. PP is a strawberry hot fudge sundae and MW is a Black Forest cherry sundae. I preferred Muir Woods, because it came with more fudge and it was just a great combo of hot fudge and cold vanilla ice cream.
author: Jessica H.

description: Great assortment of sundaes and chocolate. I have to give them three stars because they have limited seating inside and the outside tables are dirty. They also only use plastic spoons and containers as opposed to glass and silverware, like at their Monterey location. I do appreciate that they have parking for a reasonable price but it is very tight.
author: Paul O.

description:
The sundae was surprisingly delicious.
I personally do not like fudge much, because of how sweet it is. 
But it wasn't even that sweet, it was right on track.
I would definitely go back to San Fran for that sundae.
author: Grace H.

description:
Growing up in San Francisco...it is amazing to see how much Ghirardelli Square has changed in the past few years. It's a tourist attraction, so it's pretty much always going to be crowded. The price for the sundae and such have of course increased over the years. It's not often I can justify spending this much on a sundae, but it's a treat and my family is usually very happy whenever we visit. 

The sundaes are great. So very sweet. When I was younger, I could stomach one by myself, but nowadays, I share. Banana split is my favorite but their brownie sundae is also hard to resist. I've had the earthquake once in my life and don't think I'll do it again unless I have 15+ people with me. Local or tourist...Ghirardelli is a must! 

PS : if you walk into their stores (either of them), you'll get a free piece of chocolate! Also, love that they don't cut them open anymore so you can save it for later.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I had to hike up a hill to get here since we were coming from the pier so a two scoop cone with chocolate and almonds on top is like a recovery meal, right??? I honestly did not expect Ghirardelli to have great ice cream since their specialty is chocolate but the ice cream was really good! I was reminiscing of when my older brother used to surprise me with ice cream when he would get out of work. He used to get me vanilla ice cream with black cherries, and that is what I got here. Two scoops of vanilla ice cream with black cherries in a cone with chocolate and almonds on top. Sooo freaking good! My sweetie got the Nob Hill Chill shake. He loved it as well.
The shop was super busy. You stand in line while looking at the menu and go through a register prior to getting to the seating area. It has a diner feel, your order is created behind a counter and then your number is called to pick it up. There is a chocolate making machine in the back that was cool. I always imagined myself bathing in chocolate... Don't worry I restrained myself from climbing in :)
The order came out fairly fast but there was a hiccup with my order, I asked for a cone and got a waffle cup. My order was fixed right away and the wrong order was given back to us as extra. I had the intention of eating both of my icecreams but the scoops are so generous, the first one put me in a sugar coma. I really appreciated the gesture though. 
If you are looking to just get chocolate to-go, on the right side of the shop there are chocolates for sale. 
P.S. Icecream and chocolate should always come together!
author: Natalie K.

description: Okay so obviously if your in town you stop at Ghirardelli. Amazing ice cream and shakes. This was my favorite part of san francisco. My son says to add that Hot fudge sundae was really good !!
author: Carissa H.

description:
As a "local" - okay, so I'm from the Peninsula/South Bay area, but you get the idea - I try to avoid the really touristy areas of the city, but sometimes you just gotta play tourist and have some fun.  So, on a day trip to the city with the fam we hit some tourist hot spots to just soak in the atmosphere and pay too much for food.  Ghirardelli was the perfect place to do both.

Is the ice cream on the pricey side?  Oh yeah, there's no doubt about that.  But is it delicious and well presented?  Absolutely!

We made the wise choice of visiting here on a weekday.  I've been past here during weekends and the line goes way out the door, both to get into the shop and into the ice cream parlor.  There's actually a second Ghirardelli store and ice cream parlor just across the square which we didn't discover until after we were finished, but the one we chose has the working machines that's a treat for the kids.

Anyways, we got two ice cream creations and one salted caramel hot chocolate.  The total bill came to about $35.  Currently there's a sale on Breyer's ice cream at a local grocery store - 2 packages for $5.  So, I guess we could have picked up 14 boxes of ice cream for the price we paid, but this was so much more fun.
author: Lee L.

description:
Sometimes a trip to the wharf isn't complete without walking to Ghirardelli's for something sweet! The line has definitely gotten longer over the years (damn tourists!). We went through the chocolate shop first for free square samples then waited in the ice cream line. At least we met some interesting people while in line! 

The three of us shared a banana split and vanilla scoops, and I had cup of coffee as well. I'm a big desserts person and have been to my fair share of ice cream shops, so this place wasn't bad but wasn't anything to rave about to be honest. I mostly went for nostalgic reasons. Everything tasted good, but there's also a handful of other places that taste just as good or better. Still worth a visit if you've never been and happen to be in the bay area.
author: Mintz L.

description: It's hot with spotty service inside..... Be prepared for the sugar rush!!!! Definitely hit the spot with my rich and filling chocolate craving. My boyfriend and I shared the Ocean Beach sundae and man, I kinda honestly regretted it afterwards because of the super crazy sugar rush that went to my head. I believe I had a headache but didn't want to really blame Ghirardelli because it's not their fault... It was just so good, I couldn't waste it!! Let's just say that we didn't have chocolate for the rest of the trip - I totally denied the free chocolate that was given out at the door. I'm sure all ice cream and chocolate taste the same at the Ghirardelli locations but this is just cool that it's the first one. There are chocolate machines that are mixing the chocolate and whatnot. Pretty cool, I wouldn't make it a must visit but it's something nice to stop in if you're in the area.
author: Jessica P.

description: Very long wait for an ice cream place. I get that they're crowded but it took longer than it should for them to bring us our sundaes. The sundae itself was very tasty, but a bit overpriced in my opinion. Also, who would pay $5 for ONE chocolate-covered strawberry?
author: Kate J.

description:
This will always be my favorite and most beloved Ghiradelli. This place is were you come and grab an ice cream sundae and create memories. From first dates, the family outings it's a must visit for those who never been to San Francisco must check out the original chocolate factory. It has been remodeled a few times over the years but it still has kept its charm since the beginning especially since the chocolate machine is still there
 
If you're lactose intolerant please walk away. I feel sorry for you because mostly everything I gallery has dairy so I walk down to fisherman's wharf and find yourself a gelato  to eat. I love Sundays and ice cream and all things fun come try some other delicious flavors and don't forget the chocolate fudge on top. Enjoy and take lots pa pictures as this Will be a highlight on anyone's trip. We can still get busy in the line does get long but it's worth the wait,  unless it's really long go walk around the pier and come back later.
author: Ella P.

description: I go to this place once a month as a treat for myself and partner for a hard working month. I would normally give this place a 5 star rating, but after yesterday, I think i'll be going to the other Ghiradelli, . I ordered their sea salt caramel hot chocolate, like I normally do. They were busy this day since it was a friday night which is understandable. However, when I got my hot chocolate, it was very watered down. Like they gave me the last bit from the machine before adding new hot chocolate. When this happens, I usually go back and they give me a new one usually with an apology and an awesome smike. This time, when I told them it was watered down and didnt taste right.the guy looked at me, looked at my cup, took my cup and just pumped a bunch of hot fudge sauce in my hot chocolate and gave me back my cup and walked away. It was gross to say the least.  unfortunate.
author: Becky Mae A.

description:
So, confusion: there are two Ghirardelli shops around the corner from each other. The other one at the top of the hill closes earlier and just sells chocolate; THIS is the one you want to go to. The original Ghirardelli Shop and its vintage décor reminds me of a 1950s ice cream parlor.

The line was out the door on a Friday evening but moved quickly. You order at the register, get a number and take a seat - your treats are out within a few minutes. The sundaes are expensive but HUGE - we easily split one amongst three people ("Treasure Island" if you're curious - they're all named after SF landmarks and neighborhoods). 

In the back, you can see the chocolate being made in real time through the multiple steps, and signs explain what you're seeing - really neat and reminded me of Willy Wonka's chocolate factory.

The ice cream with a Ghirardelli brownie and chocolate was sinfully good. Wander through the shop on your way out - there are tons of unique Ghirardelli products and gift sets, including flavors I'd never seen elsewhere.
author: Katie U.

description:
Super decadent ice cream sundaes, but very expensive!

Would go once for the old-school experience but you can get equally great ice cream elsewhere.
author: Michelle B.

description: Hot chocolate is always delicious, especially when it's from GHIRARDELLI  the whipped cream and syrup on top, it was so yummmyyyyy
author: Brigitte A.

description: Super cold out here but all and all beautiful view and Express to go store on first floor.....
author: Alona P.

description:
The Ghirardelli name has become world famous for their world class chocolates and ice creams. A visit to San Francisco is never complete without eating ice cream at Ghirardelli square near Pier 39. 

Try their mint bliss (dollop of green mint chocolate and dark chocolate) chocolate sundae with fudge in a chocolate coated waffle cone bowl - simply yummylicious! ($16). Each serving can be shared by 2 people unless you are possessive like me about your ice cream! A must visit!
author: Raj G.

description:
I've been here three times so far and each time I come here, the ice cream is amazing and the service is fast! I went here yesterday, and there was a new hire at the register along with an employee training her. The employee training her was extremely patient and supportive. I wish I got their names but the new hire had red hair and the employee training her had black hair above the shoulders. 

I got the treasure island sundae. It's vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, and a warm brownie topped with whipped cream and a cherry! The sundae came out within minutes of ordering!
author: Kalani M.

description: Aaa--MAZING!!! Best ice cream I've ever had besides the gelato in Europe. I had a scoop of chocolate and another scoop of strawberry, both were great! I saw them preparing a banana split that was big enough for at least 3-5 people. Sundaes also looked good. So many options to choose from. This place is definitely a must if you are in San Francisco.
author: Sandra C.

description: I loved that you're able to go in and watch how they make chocolate. It smells amazing inside. Yes, their prices are high but let's be real, it's worth it. I bought a caramel brownie sundae and the brownie was amazing. Wish there was more of it!!
author: Merlyn H.

description:
"My sweet tooth has met it's match."

The name Ghirardelli has become synonymous of fine chocolates and decadent cocoas. Add in ice cream sundaes and you have the perfect recipe for an unforgettable dessert experience. My only disclaimer to this flagship location is that it is an absolute tourist spot. Pack your patience, prepare to line up, and search determinedly for seating. We have visited this location multiple times and found the popularity still grows regardless of varying times of the day and outside temperature. The ordering process is easy and there are multiple cashiers ready to assist. Making a selection proved to be the toughest part as the menu does a wonderful job of describing the decadent toppings included in each sundae. I have tried a couple scoops of the chocolate ice cream, Ocean Beach, and The Painted Ladies Mint Bliss. 

The chocolate ice cream, without any toppings, is a nice and simple dessert. Decadent flavor of rich chocolate guaranteed to satisfy sweet cravings. The Ocean Beach Sundae (Sea Salt Caramel Sundae) is my absolute favorite. Vanilla ice cream with generous amounts of caramel and layered with hot fudge. This is then topped with whipped cream, more caramel, sea salt, and a Ghirardelli Square Milk Chocolate. The Painted Ladies Mint Bliss is my second favorite. Mint chocolate chip and Ghirardelli chocolate ice cream layered with dark chocolate hot fudge and topped with whipped cream and intense dark twilight delight chocolate. Each sundae has its own unique twist and satisfies sweet cravings.

I recommend stopping by the chocolate shop for a souvenir tin or even a bag of mini squares. If you are looking to avoid the line, I recommend visiting other locations around the San Francisco area.
author: Karlo G.

description: My Wife and I had a fantastic time at Ghirardelli's. We ordered a sundae, which had a fresh baked brownie, yummy fudge and ice cream, I highly recommend, although I'm sure everything they serve is scrumptious.
author: Carl E.

description:
I've been coming to Ghirardelli all my life. It's a tourist attraction, so of course the prices are ridiculous. You should know that coming in. But their sundaes are ooh so Yummy.
I am usually not a chocolate person but for some reason their chocolate sauce just tastes so good! I typically order the original sundae, light sauce and rainbow sprinkles on top. 
I can't not stop here when I'm ever so often in the area. Reminds me of my childhood and it's great. If you're new to SF, then you have to check it out at least once. Just keep in mind that it will be crowded and you'll be spending at least $11 for a basic sundae.
author: Nari M.

description:
This is a must visit if you're around the area/near Fisherman's Wharf! I've been here a total of about 3 times, every single time I've been at Fisherman's Wharf, and it's the best. There is inevitably always a line, but the line is worth it. Also, the line moves faster than you think. If you're in a party of 2 or more, I would recommend one person staying in line to order and the other person looking for a table to sit as there aren't too many seats and it might be difficult to find a table sometimes. Lastly, they have a parking lot available where they validate.

Their Presidio Passion (strawberry hot fudge sundae) is AMAZING. I normally don't like fruity flavors with chocolate because I'm a huge chocolate person, but man, the presidio passion is just so good. Their whipped cream on top just makes everything even more perfect. The mixture of strawberry and hot fudge is unlike anything I've ever tasted; highly highly recommend! Also, it's big enough that 2 people can easily share.

Their classic Ghirardelli hot cocoa is great. My mom, who's not a huge chocolate person or a sweets person, absolutely loved the classic Ghirardelli hot cocoa. She said it wasn't too sweet and the taste was perfect. If you're looking for a warm drink, I would recommend this.

The Crissy Field (cookie bits sundae) is up there with the Presidio Passion. It comes with ice cream, whipped cream, cookie bits, chocolate, and caramel drizzles, and it literally melts in your mouth. If you're looking for something a bit more sweet, I would recommend the Crissy Field over Presidio Passion. The Crissy Field definitely has a lot more sugar as it's packed with so many things. The taste is absolutely delicious. Whenever I go to Ghirardelli now, I always get the Crissy Field. And just like the Presidio Passion, the Crissy Field is big enough for 2 people to share.

If I'm around the area again, I'll definitely be stopping by for dessert. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu and their chocolate is also very high quality.
author: Jen S.

description: Walk in and they give you a free small ghirardelli chocolate square. It smells rich and sweet with people bustling in for souvenirs or treats. Not far from the maritime and the Pier so you can definitely walk around. After all the touristy spot, come in for a hot chocolate or a sundae. Plan to spend a good amount since it's a "souvenir" item.
author: Jackie R.

description: ORDER TO GO! We were so excited to have ice cream after a long day of traveling. We ordered and found a table that hadn't been bussed yet. We waited over 20 minutes and never received our order or had our table bussed. It appeared they didn't have enough help to deliver ice cream to patrons. I took our number and receipt and got a refund. The manager said "they were looking for you" he apologized up and down and gave a us a refund. Lesson learned I won't ever order "for here" service.
author: Sarah C.

description: Not sure if I'm imagining things, but it seems like the chocolate you buy here tastes better than what you buy in the stores. Maybe it's fresher or something. I do t know. Anyway, they have an awesome ice cream shop with REALLY GOOD ice cream--all the flavors are super yummy! The banana split was great, and I've had the enormous earthquake in the past which you can share with 4-6 people. Highly recommend checking the ice cream shop out if you are in the area.
author: Kevin D.

description: We love this place! The price for just about everything is high but this Ghirardelli Ice Cream Parlor is great and worth it. They have lots of ice cream and chocolate offerings and you can get pretty creative with the sundaes. All of us got chocolate waffle bowls with our ice cream, which was delicious. There's lots of people but the lines move quickly. The only issue is that finding a place to sot can be difficult.
author: F H.

description: Awesome ice cream! The prices were a little steep but expected as this is a tourist spot, but the lines are super long!
author: Thania D.

description:
Bottom:  Decadent ice cream sundaes served in a historic factory building.

I'm not a big ice cream eater yet I always want to go Ghiradelli Square to get a decadent sundae.  I think I've finally realized that what I like about The Original Ghiradelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop is the 1862 era building in which it is located and the dazzling white marquee lights on top of the roof. The 150 year old large brick building was originally built as Pioneer Woolen Mills and then Ghiradelli moved in around turn of the century and continued their chocolate making operation there until the 1960s. In 1960s they moved to their current day location in San Leandro but they, with some hard work, retained a presence in the area which eventually became known as Ghirardelli Square. 

As far as the ice cream eating experience goes,  you order just inside the door and then find a table and a server will bring your sweet treats to you.  They have about 12 flavors of ice cream and you can keep it simple and just get a scoop for about $4.  For more decadence, a fancy sundae runs about $12.  In my opinion, that is some pricey ice cream.  The decor is nostalgic and perfectly suiting for an ice cream parlor, which I really appreciate.  Although Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop has been on all of my itineraries to date, I think I can leave it for the true ice cream connoisseurs.
author: Courtney K.

description:
Went after july 4th
Still good service and was pretty fast
Got the treasure island sundae and shared with my boyfriend...which I immediately regretted
author: Song K.

description: Well excellent desert but we wanted to buy this gift item and it was on sale ! We get to the checkout and the gentleman said he couldn't do it because well the manager kinda disappeared. Not cool
author: Nadine K.

description: Two simple facts about this place . This is a touristic chocolate heaven and Chirardelli just tastes better here , although you can get it almost in any grocery store across the US:) . What you can't get anywhere but here is gigantic signature sundays and this unforgettable chocolate smell ... Amazing
author: Kristina K.

description: Yes you may be able to find Ghirardelli chocolates anywhere around the world, but it is absolutely different when you actually go to the factory. This is a must if you are visiting San Francisco! It is off of Fishermans Wharf! I got a hot chocolate which was freshly delicious, in addition to an ice cream sundae which was also outstanding! They have three different stores you can go into. Each store I believe sell everything to eat on the spot but some stores have more chocolates to choose from to buy. You can even watch how they make the chocolate slabs and a whole bunch of other great things they make at Ghirardelli. Everything is fresh to order! Cant wait to be back in San Francisco to come back here!
author: Rene B.

description: A must if you're ever in San Francisco.  Great scene, environment, and ambiance. However, I'm a bit disappointed that they don't make their ice cream. All their ice cream is imported by Dreyers ice cream.
author: Mike C.

description: Cold night for a 9:30pm visit!  Line out the door but we the line went pretty quick.  Once you give your order at the hostess/cashier stand, you are given a table ticket stand and the challenge now is to race for an open table or stand at the counter (no chairs) and watch for tables to open.  That's the toughest part.  By the time you find a table and have it bussed, your order should be on its way!  It's expensive but delicious and it's iconic.  $12-23 per dessert.  Optional choice is to ask for a single scoop sundae and add your own toppings which will save you $ and calories.
author: leimomi k.

description:
If you love Ghirardelli chocolates, then the Original Ghirardelli Icecream and Chocolate shop is a place you cannot miss in San Fransisco.
On the right is the all famous Mint Bliss and on the left is the Strawberry shake. Also, the chocolates and other Ghirardelli products are sold at a price less than the market price. So do visit this place as someone has rightly said- Chocolates are happiness, and when it's Ghirardelli, it is Bliss!
author: Suverna J.

description:
I love this place so we decided to come back. However this time we had some issues. 3 out of 4 ice creams ordered came wrong. They apologized and took back to change but second run was also wrong.
We also decided to park our rental car at their public parking. We got charged 13 Dollars for 1 hour 4 minutes. Look for parking outside if you don't want to have a heart attack  at the payment machine.
author: Alex B.

description:
Definitely a stop for anyone visiting San Francisco. The shop provides a full ice cream bar with desserts as well as a full store of candy options. I purchased gifts for friends to take home and discovered that the prices are higher there then the countless stores throughout San Francisco. However it's part of the experience to buy the chocolate from the square. 

Definitely recommend having a meal around fishermans wharf before heading up to the square because I noticed the options for restaurant there were limited and pricey. A meal beforehand also might limit the amount of sugar you intake while there.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Yes, it's a tourist trap. Yes, it's expensive. Yes, it's crowded. But you still need to go...it's fun and delicious!!!

* The line goes pretty fast so don't let it scare you away.
* They give out free samples of chocolate in the gift shop.
* They offer a bunch of sundae selections but don't hesitate to make something custom. 
* Try to go on a weekday when it's not completely overrun with tourists.
author: M M.

description: Everything we picked there was awesome. How chocolate, sundaes, truffles and their famous squares.
author: Uday G.

description:
Ice cream was huge and yummy! Worth this wait.
Get plenty of napkins cause the waffle cone gets messy.
author: C. S.

description: Wow the memories here were so great.  The smell is the same as it was over 20yrs ago.  The most delicious chocolate is here!!!  The ice cream sundaes are also quite amazing and super delicious.  Also my son loved all of the unique names of the sundaes.  It was a total pull for him of what sounded good or if which location it was named after was his favorite place we had been!  Overall one of the best places in San Francisco a must visit!  Peace
author: Heather M.

description:
Salted Caramel hot chocolate  was the best I have ever had, but they did not had any brownies that day , had to stand in line for 30 mins to know they were out of brownies so they served  the ice cream with it 
Very long waiting line
author: Fatima A.

description: Ghirardeli is the best place to go to first, when you come to San Francisco. They have some of the best brownies ever and their ice cream is delicious! Don't forget to stop here when you come to SF.
author: Jon M.

description:
When I think of San Francisco, I think of Ghirardelli Square and the sweet things I can indulge in!

Everything, literally, everything is good here! Sitting in despite the crowds almost at all times of the day, or ordering to go is perfect. Last I was here, I sipped on some mocha, shared a ridiculous huge ice cream sundae and bought some (read: A LOT) of chocolate for my trip.

Now that I'm back in my hometown for good, I'm taking all my out of town guests there and bought chocolate I was suppose to send to out of town friends. But I ate it. hehehe If I worked here, I too would be just as happy as the helpful staff here.

Overall, Yummy! Yummy!
author: Hala A.

description: I love that on the banana split you can substitute with any flavor have nuts or fudge on the side ...my boyfriend got the chocolate shake recommended by the friendly lady taking our order it's definitely something special it's a lot of sweet stuff but it's so good you'll finish it ! Who doesn't love the ice cream shop experience ! Tasty sweets  a must go perfect for after dinner can take it to go as well.i feel like it's like going to Charlie chocolate factor but better!!!! A must go !
author: Najla B.

description: I stopped here to gladly overpay for a touristy ice cream treat. It was expensive and delicious!
author: Jason W.

description: I love this place. I came here at least 3 times every time I visit SF! Loved it!
author: Jimmy P.

description: Always love this... not only does this place show you how they make the chocolate but they serve it to you too. Ice cream with chocolate. So good. Plus they even have a special one that has gold shavings. (Yes real gold shavings) .... of course it's outrageously priced but they will give a special spectacle for you if you get it.
author: Michael F.

description: The first time I was at Ghirardelli Square, I didn't get any ice cream. I felt like I had to this time. I only ordered a scoop of cookie dough. It was expensive- more than $5. I don't mind if the ice cream is fantastic, but to me it was just very sweet. I'm glad they provide water. A cool place maybe for family and dates, but not for me.
author: Helen H.

description:
40min wait and The Banana on the Banana split was as raw as it could be! 15$ would be well spent in buying a sundae across the street! 

-good job Ghiradelli, we expected nothing less.
author: Sanchit G.

description: Nice walk from the pier.  Every time you walk in, they give you free chocolate.  Vanilla milk shake and cone were good.  Other than Ghirardelli there's no much up there.  You can see part of the Golden Gate Bridge.  I'd go again.
author: Dana B.

description:
The only reason I'm giving this place one star is because that's the lowest grade I can give and because I still had ice cream in front of me. Other than that, the service and employees who worked here were upsetting and annoying to be around. The hostess chick who took our order (Dominique) was rude and had zero class when greeting us at the door. Almost all of the other employees obviously hated their job through their facial expressions and contacts with each other. 

I literally watched one employee ask another, "Are you making more cones?" The other employee responded, "What do you think I'm doing?" The first employee then proceeded to slam down the cone and cone-waffle maker machine and march off. I expected a lot more from a company like this.
author: Mike Y.

description: Loveeeeeee this place! But who doesn't?! My absolute fav is the sea salt carmel hot chocolate, so delicious. Just the right amount of sweet with salty but not overbearing on either end, plus the carmel drizzle is a generous amount. The sundaes and milkshakes are classics, but a must-try during the cold weather are the hot chocolates. P.S. A little pricey but so worth it
author: Victoria C.

description: One of the most touristy things you can do in the city, but undeniably one of the best ice cream sundaes you will have. I only treat myself to the sundaes here on special occasions and when you have at least one other person to split them with. Seriously a heart attack in a cup, but with that it is totally worth it!!! The menu with all the different sundae options is going to be hung in front of my treadmill for motivation. Definitely a great spot to treat yourself to!
author: Ross S.

description:
Stopped by during my trip to San Francisco on a recommendation. I do not recommend going alone, the portions are huge!

Update! I went again the second time I visited SF. Would not visit again. Not worth the cost.
author: Steven T.

description:
Holy Smokes....this place is AMAZING. There was a bit of a line but totally worth the wait!
My boyfriend and I had to stop here while visiting SF and ordered a brownie sundae that was to DIE for!
So fudgy and rich...we demolished it in seconds!
author: Ingrid F.

description: Perfect for date night.  I especially enjoy the lights at night. Although it is often packed...it doesn't usually take long to find a seat for small groups.  Always check in on Yelp to get $1 off on your sundae order.
author: sandy h.

description:
Bigger than it looks, this is the upper location of Ghirardelli's in Ghirardelli Square (there is a smaller ice cream shop on the lower street level. 

They are fast at making those sundaes and bringing them out to you. 

If you have been to one Ghirardelli's, you know exactly what to expect but it is a nice treat to have as you stroll along the bay.
author: Kris G.

description: I'm definitely a fan. I had the Warm Brownie Sundae and it was so tasteful.  The warmth of the brownie with the cold ice cream on your spoon is amazing.  It wasn't very crowded but there were a lot of people there.  You have a place to sit and plenty of room to walk around.  You can see the employees cutting the chocolate right there in front of you and taste a piece as well. They offer free pieces of chocolate while your browsing.  I went right before Christmas so the décor was so warm and welcoming!
author: Erica L.

description:
Ghirardelli is as San Francisco as Joe Montana, Golden Gate Bridge, Rice a Roni, and Full(er) House.  Five stars seem like a lot, especially since I'm feel just okay about the ice cream here.  But sentimental value counts for a lot.  Plus the classic hot chocolate remains one of my favorite things on earth.  It's simply classic.  Undeniably  delicious. 

If I'm on death row and I'm asked for my last meal, I'm sure that Ghirardelli's Classic Hot Chocolate would be on that list.  The salted caramel with sea salt hot chocolate ain't too shabby either.  

Yeah, the place can be chaotic and a tourist trap.  I don't really care.  Give me a cup of hot choc and I'm all good.
author: Angel S.

description:
Stop by the famous ice-cream and original of SF!
Love the feeling of old fashioned fancy ice-cream however what we got is totally missed from the pictures show in menu. We got seat at the top floor where they serve the ice-cream in Togo container. The Flavored of ice-cream is ok but the feeling of getting "The Original Ghirardelli" is what impressive for my trip.
author: Vanda E.

description: The factory is no longer here! But the sundaes are still here. There's plenty more and quieter space at the top of the stairs, so don't be dissuaded by the long lines. If you just want chocolate there is a Ghirardelli marketplace nearby. They have atleast three shops here selling the same thing.
author: Harsh P.

description: My kids were in chocolate heaven! The Lands End  was absolutely delicious and big enough for two. My son got his favorite Thick Shake; Cookies'n Cream. Will definitely be back very soon! The line was long but it moved along pretty fast. It was a busy Friday night but we received fast service, got a decent seat and enjoyed our desert.
author: Mahogany M.

description: Finally had the chance to visit Ghirardelli Square at Fisherman's Wharf past weekend! On a cold windy evening, somehow people still kept filling up the space with orders. The line was long but could have moved faster if they had more than just two cashiers up front. The Square itself is pretty cool to walk around and the holiday décor was beautiful. We got a hot fudge sundae which came out to $13 - a little too expensive for a simple sundae. But do go experience it...you will like it!
author: Jatin M.

description:
This was a definite "When in San Fran...." moment of weakness. 

Line is always out the door, but moves pretty quickly. We ordered the Treasure Island (classic hot fudge sundae + warm brownie) and the sundae with cookies & cream ice cream, whip cream & warm chocolate chip cookie bits. They were $12 & $13, and while you do get a ton of ice creamy goodness, it still seems overpriced for tourists.

Super crowded inside, but many steps/ledges outside for makeshift seating. 

Overall the desserts were good but nothing too special. I'm sure the city has many more delicious dessert gems if you venture outside the tourist bubble.
author: Dominique M.

description:
Awesome service, everything is super delicious at this place. Its always very crowded but u can find a table very easy. They bring your order to your table very quick. The staff are very polite and the customer service is awesome. 

Its also very clean for San Francisco standards.
author: Salar F.

description:
For a line to the street at 8pm on a Monday night I was expecting to be in dessert heaven by the time I left. 

Meh. I got to the line and asked what was most popular and the friendly girl said their world famous sundae. Well, duh, I should have guessed that. 

I took my number and headed to find a seat. The inside of the place is pretty large with a enclosed patio type area. I grabbed some self serve water and plopped down in the patio and waited. 

My sundae came quickly with two spoons. I was solo, but I used both spoons anyway. She took the effort to bring it so why not? For $14, I was expecting a larger sundae...although I barely got to half of it as it was. 

I wasn't blown away by the thing and don't need to make a trip back. Been there done that.
author: Vee V.

description: San Francisco staple; very nice and I enjoyed my time! Free samples and all. It's two floors and has some fun history on the walls and memorabilia. The chocolate store had nice bundles to take home as souvenirs to friends and family.
author: Katherine D.

description: Extremely disappointed that this is not a safe stop for folks with Celiac Disease - never would have imagined that we'd be unable to enjoy a treat here
author: Bridget A.

description: This is a neat place to visit. The history is apparent and it is very warm and cozy inside. Of course the ice cream was delicious (I got the mint chocolate chip with hot fudge). My only complaint is that it was very busy and service was slow, but that is to be expected in such a touristy spot!
author: Stephanie H.

description: Long lines are always there during summer. I like having the Choco dipped waffle cone with one or scoops of espresso chips.
author: Mae N.

description:
The original Ghiradelli chocolate location = tourists galore and super crowded. There was a line extending out the door and down the block when we arrived on a Sunday afternoon, and it was super packed inside. Thankfully, the line moved quickly. 

There are a variety of sundaes and banana or brownie sundaes to choose from, all over $10 and named after famous locations in and around SF. We decided to split the "Muir Woods", which is a Black Forest cherry sundae with black cherry vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, chocolate bits and topped with a cherry ($11.95). If you check in on Yelp and show it to the cashier, you get a dollar off the sundae! 

The sundae itself was delicious. I really liked the flavor of the ice cream. It was a bit on the expensive side, but it was nice to experience and to say that you have eaten at the original chocolate factory location!
author: Amy C.

description:
This place was super packed. It was crazy! The line just went on and on and on.

By the time we placed our orders, there were barely any seats, but luckily my brother found something on the second floor. I was surprised how they would find us upstairs, but they did. They brought our goodies. They messed up one order, but were quick to fix it.

I love chocolate. I love Ghirardelli. The place was cute too. But it just didn't wow me as much as other places have. I just wasn't a fan of the craziness and disorganization. It still is a great place, though.
author: Ina M.

description: Who wouldn't enjoy this place, a grand selection of chocolate and ice cream in one place. That is why the line was out the door.  I normally don't like ice cream sundaes, but this one was amazing, pricey, but delicious!
author: Cassandra D.

description:
It was always a stand out place with w the Xmas lights around it and their chocolates are everywhere in the city and other states.

You can smell the sugar as you walk pass it.  

Get a menu. Decide what you want cause they all look similar but not and all sounds delicious.

Cashier is first so be ready.  Order then find a table.  While you wait for your dessert, check out the lil chocolate display factory in the back. By that time your dessert will already be at your table.

If you want water, it's self serve underneath the Stair case that leads to upstairs for orders to go.  Which I want to try next times just to see how they prepare a sundae  to go.

After you are finish.  Check out the chocolate souvenir shop but I wish I had notice the coupon before I purchased cause chocolate isn't cheap!
author: Gia C.

description:
I was greeted with samples when I walked into the store. I was hoping to try the Cabernet infused dark chocolate, but they did not have samples. The manager immediately pulled a bar off the shelf and opened it for me to try. He was incredibly kind and thoughtful to do so! 

The Cabernet infused chocolate was also delicious! I ended up buying several chocolate bars to take home.
author: Mahender B.

description:
I have always been a huge Ghirardelli chocolate fan (especially for the brownie box mix!), so the original Ghirardelli store was high on my list during my short trip to SF for this winter break. Unfortunately, during my visit to not just one, but TWO of the Ghirardelli stores at the square - the service I received was less than palatable. I would even say disappointing. My family and I entered both stores and bought a sundae from one, and chocolates from another. We lingered around browsing for quite a while making our choices in both stores as well.

Whilst there, there were workers standing and greeting every single customer and handing out free chocolate samples for the season (peppermint bark). Since we were in the store(s) for quite some time, we realized that said workers did not fail to offer every single customer/family that walked in the chocolate along with a Christmas wish... except us. We started to feel uncomfortable about it as it seemed to become (at least to us) exceedingly clear that there was some differential treatment going on. I am hesitant to call out on it as racism but that's how it felt to us (we're Asian and every other customer was White).
