It was especially clear when at the counter the customer before us was offered the samples but when it came to our turn we didn't even get a smile. We started to feel dissatisfied about this treatment and pointedly asked if we were allowed to have some as well (and we don't even like peppermint bark!), only then did the workers begrudgingly hand us one each. 

I hate to accuse any person(s) or any establishment of discrimination / racism, but that's how it felt/ was perceived as by me and my family of five. One thing is sure, service is downright unarguably BAD if you're making customers feel discriminated against. The ice cream was good and I'm sure the chocolate is as well, but simply as a matter of principle I will not be going back.
author: Ling Hui W.

description:
My thoughts before I bought and ate the Land's End Sundae from Ghirardelli: 'Am I really going to pay 14.50$ for one ice cream sundae...I must be cray cray!'

My thoughts after I ate the Land's End Sundae from Ghirardelli: 'Yes, I would pay 14.50$ for this ice cream over and over again...um, when do you want to come back for another?'

My favorite sundaes are hot fudge brownie sundaes; this one did not disappoint.  Not joking, this sundae had some of the best brownies I've ever tasted--they were moist and bi-layered.  I even asked if I could buy some to-go.  #firstworldproblems right?   So, the Land's End (i.e., the Salted Caramel Brownie Sundae)--It comes with two scoops of ice cream, hot fudge, caramel, and sea salt.  This is not the first time I have had Ghirardelli, but it is the first time I tried this particular sundae. 

Share this sundae with someone you really like and they will like you more.   I promise.
author: David D.

description: If u have not been here before, this is The Ghirardelli's to visit. If it's the same location, hasn't changed much since I was a kid. The ice cream is way $$$$$, but it's worth it for the experience. It also has tons of calories, but make sure u get the Ghirardelli's hot fudge to get ur calories and experience worth out of the food-they primarily a chocolate shop after all. Service wasn't great on this visit especially considering that they weren't that busy. Our Sundays were made fast, but left on the counter right behind us melting with some other folks ice-cream. We asked a lady who worked there if we could just take it and she was polite and served us herself even though it obviously wasn't her job and she was impatiently waiting for a coworker to come get it. They still give free samples @ the attached chocolate shop, so make sure to walk through on ur way out and pick one up. They also give u a free chocolate sample @ the ice-cream shop too, but hey, for the $$$$ they charge u, get another on the way out too :) make sure to look @ the historic confection making equipment, the experience is not the same w/o that.
author: Ronald R.

description:
Expect long lines and a long wait for some amazingness!
Didn't want to waste time or spend money on chocolate on our quick trip to San Francisco but glad I was convinced because it was so good! Shared an ice cream sundae and the chocolate brownie tasted fresh and soft. The fudge tasted like it was just made too. This was definitely worth the time!
author: Suikey S.

description:
This place is magical. Nothing can be wrong where ghirardelli chocolate is served 
They have a section where fresh chocolate is constantly made and churned in the machines for people to watch. Lines are always long but thats completely understandable this being the hot spot in San Francisco. I have been here 3-4 times and I have loved every single thing I have ordered over the years. 

This time we ordered chocolate ice cream with chocolate hot fudge and whipped cream. It was $12-13 so a little pricy then your usually sundaes in general. But, then you don't do this everyday so its all worthwhile! OMG it was heavenly!!!! I fell in love with the hot fudge sauce in the desert. Whipped cream and ice cream and fudge all together tasted great together :)

 I later checked out that they sell those hot fudge sauce in their gift shop for $12/jar. I however decided to give it a try to make it at home myself but if you don't want to go through any hassles. This fudge sauce is great and it would also make a great  

Parking is always difficult to find. If you get lucky to find any parking in the 2 blocks they are $6.25/hour for the meters or you could find parking at the Ghirardelli Square parking sometimes if its not full which is $5 for the first hour and $8 for the second hour and so on.
author: Labdhi P.

description: Got a sweet craving for a sundae, brownies, chocolate chip cookies or all of the above???! GO HERE! Their World-Famous Hot Fudge Sundae is definitely a must order AND so are their chocolate chip cookies! If you're eating the cookie there, ask them to heat it up if server doesn't offer. Ohhhh so good!!!
author: Christine M.

description:
It's just one of those tourist traps must have. Yes you must have an overpriced ice cream. 

I shared the lands end. Which is a brownie split in 2. With 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream. Tons of whipped topping and drizzled in fudge and salted caramel. It was delicious. But I don't see how anyone could eat the thing on their own. I didn't even eat my half. $14.50 

You also get a little sample of chocolate when you visit the shop.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I love going to Ghiradelli when I visit San Diego but there's something special about walking up to Ghiradelli Square in San Francisco and seeing the lights welcoming you.  

It's a short walk from Fisherman's Wharf and has a fantastic view of the bay.  Grab a menu, get a free sample of chocolate, get a scoop of chocolate ice cream and take in the humidity and views!
author: Tammie W.

description: Always a Xmas favorite. Butter Scotch Sundae. Seasalt Caramel hot chocolate. Heaven on Earth
author: Suresh S.

description: I'm full. But happy. This seemed like the place to be back in the day but since this is our first time. We're like why not versus other new ramen place. No long lines to wait in the cold. Easy in, sit, order yum. Being from LA. SF knows how to do Ramen. Ambiance is old skool but I like it. Great ramen!
author: Charlie Y.

description: Where do I go when I crave chocolate- Ghirardelli! It chocolate heaven- from hot chocolate to the chocolate fudge sundaes; everything is on point. It hey can get pretty crowded as it's in a touristy location. The servers are fast but courteous. They don't rush you but this isn't a place to meet and catch up with friends.
author: Dee V.

description: Ice cream was excellent, the staff not so much.  My friends and I wanted a treat so we decided to have some ice cream.  We did not want full sundaes so we just had scoops of ice cream.  I had the cherry vanilla with rainbow sprinkles on top.  The cashier definitely was not in a very good mood and did not seem to be enjoying her job.  My friends had the same experience with the cashier.  We then waited by the to-go counter and 4 or 5 staff people joking around when orders were pending.  I got mine then one friend got hers.  Then the other friend had to wait a bit and another staff person filled her order.  And she got almost a double scoop of ice cream while my other friend and I barely got a full scoop.  So they definitely need to retrain their staff on behavior and also offer some consistency on scoop size.
author: Karen C.

description:
How could we come to Ghirardelli square without stopping at the ice cream and chocolate shop?! We came on our very first day in the city, but since it was a little later in the evening and quite chilly out, so we opted out of getting a sundae, and chose to have their signature hot cocoa instead. We ordered the original and the sea salt ones, which were absolutely delicious and decadent and everything you hope for in a hot chocolate! The only thing that was a little disappointing was that the hot chocolate was lukewarm by the time it got to us, but I forgive them because it is always crazy busy in there! 

We came back a few days later on the last day of our trip so we can try their sundaes and ohmygod,  I'm still not over it. Pretty sure I'll be having dreams about Ghirardelli ice cream sundaes for weeks! We had the Golden Gate banana split and the Lands End salted brownie sundae! We shared both sundaes among 5 people, and although we all agreed we could have gotten away with ordering just one, we definitely didn't regret ordering two! 

The banana split was everything I love in a sundae and more. The classic Neapolitan flavors were creamy, rich and absolutely amazing covered in whipped cream and chocolate sauce, and the bananas were fresh and sweet. The salted brownie sundae was just devine. Words cannot describe the types of feelings I was having while eating it. It was an experience all on its own. I wish I had another stomach just so I could have fit more ice cream into my belly! 

I can't wait to come back! If you ever find yourself in Ghirardelli Square or nearby at the Fisherman's wharf, do yourself a favor and #treatyoself to something sweet at Ghirardelli's. I know it's such a touristy spot, but we're all human and we all deserve good ice cream!
author: Krystyl C.

description:
I love coming to Ghiradelli!

The area look a lot better after the construction.

Easy to walk to from Fisherman's Wharf.

The chocolate shop is full of different Ghiradelli varieties and gift sets. They also hand out samples when you walk in! Score!

The ice cream shop is like walking into an old school ice cream parlor. You see and smell the history of the building. 

There is a ton of choices and flavors so pick your poison. Portions are huge! I always have to share. 

Ocean Beach - $10.95 - Creamy vanilla ice cream topped with caramel and hot fudge. My teeth hurt thinking about it! Sea salt help cut the sweetness. 

Pricey for ice cream but I do enjoy myself every time.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Worth the walk, worth the wait.
The line was pretty long but went surprisingly fast. The place was PACKED but seats came up pretty quick. I didnt check upstairs but downstairs it was less than 5 minutes.
No specials on the menu but everything you want to see at your ice cream shop, We tried one original and one salted caramel between 3 of us. Perfect in everyway. 
The shop was hard to get around because of so many people but they had other shops around the square. 
Im glad we checked it out and hope to head back to SF for some more fun at the square really soon.
author: Robert B.

description: Ghirardelli is one of my favorite chocolates and I'm glad that I had a chance to come here before leaving San Francisco, would definitely recommend stopping by the area and the shop when visiting the city. The ice cream was amazing as well as the service, although there is a lot of seating, it took a while to find one because there are so many people. The price and wait is totally worth it!
author: Kayla Y.

description:
Chocolate chocolate everywhere and sooo much of it to eat and drink please don't be that person who needs to get taken out on a wheelbarrow!

Straight up I love Ghirardelli their chocolate is some of the best you can find anywhere as it's just soo flavorful and delicious with the ever so many varieties to choose from you'll end up in a chocolate coma hence the wheelbarrow statement before!

Coming here i knew to expect greatness but what I found was what beyond that as this was the best Ghirardelli shop I've been to as they had twice as much chocolate as well as this awesome serve yourself area that was overflowing with different chocolate concoctions!

The serve your self area was a chocolate lovers paradise as they had many different varieties of chocolate covered goodies like almonds, Cranberries, Blueberries, Pretzel Balls, in dark and milk chocolate variations as well as a bunch of other goodies that I got overwhelmed with!

The best part of the serve your self area is that they were running a special where you get 1/2 pound free when you buy a 1/2 pound now that's just awesome and needless to say I still have some chocolate left a few days later!

They also have all the ice cream Sunday's and chocolate drinks you can find at any of the Ghirardelli stores around of these my favorite to get is always the Nob Hill Chill as it's just soo delicious with that thick gooey chocolate that runs down the inside of the cup that's mixed with the ice cream and those yummy little chocolate chips!

On this particular morning I wasn't really feeling anything too cold so we decided to get some of the dark hot chocolate wile it was super good on it's own my lady and I both found it to be a bit rich and hard to drink because of this but need no fear we asked the baristas if they could add some milk to it so that the drink would even out a little bit and sure enough after they did this for us the dark hot chocolate was just so so so good and totally warmed us up on this cold February morning in the bay!

Without a doubt I'll be back to another Ghirardelli soon as they always have what's good in chocolate form!
author: Rachel H.

description: Stopped by here on a busy day during the holidays. Sunny was the only person working at the time when there was a line to the door. She managed the business at the time in a cool, professional manner. Only wished management had staffed adequately so she wouldn't have been put in that position. Shout out to Sunny for great customer service!
author: Alex S.

description: I was debating whether or not to give  this place four or five stars.  I decided five because.. well... the ice cream and chocolate was so friggin gooood!! The only reason i was considering giving  them four stars was because it gets a little crowded and sometimes hard to find a seat.  But definately recommend  the cookies and cream on a waffle cone!
author: Edgar R.

description: I always have to keep coming back to this place for the salted caramel sundae. It's to die for. I highly recommend this place especially for the view of the city you could see not too far off in the distance.
author: Robyn M.

description: I'm torn between 3-4 on this review. This place is totally a tourist trap, but it's also reasonably priced and the food is good. Service isn't as personable because it's consistently crowded, but they manage to make everything relatively quickly. If you really want to experience the greatest food San Francisco has to offer, look for some smaller names you don't recognize. If you like touristy spots with merchandise and picture opps, give it a try. I'm not judging!
author: Chris C.

description: Try the fudge ice cream cone!! The best ice cream I've had in my life, but you may not be able to finish it - it is very rich. Everything else is highly overpriced, but worth the visit just for the ice cream alone.
author: John L.

description: We had a good time enjoying all the chocolates goodies at the store. We all had ice cream sundaes and it was delicious. This is one of our favorite place to visit in SF. Always a crowd pleaser and they have something for anyone who like sweets/chocolate.
author: Sid H.

description:
Yummy ice cream sundaes! 

Make sure to grab a menu so you know what to order when you get to the cashier. I already knew what I'd get by doing this and the cashier seemed to be one of those Just-Order-And-Don't-Ask-Questions type of people. Not the friendliest but also not mean or rude, if that makes sense. Don't forget to check in on Yelp for $1 off your sundae.

Your ice cream will be brought to your table. We found seats right away on a Tuesday afternoon even though it was quite busy. 

I got the Presidio Passion (vanilla ice cream with strawberry and fudge) and my bf got whatever the mint chocolate sundae was (don't know if it has a special name, haha). We both loved ours. It wasn't too sweet at all. Yes, it's obviously expensive, but considering this is a popular tourist spot, that's going to be a given. 

Recommended for sure, especially if you're from out of the area like me. It's near Fisherman's Wharf so it's a nice, quick walk from other touristy attractions.
author: Kay H.

description:
I stepped my way through the chocolate shop, looking for a no-sugar-added option as a gift for a diabetic friend. While they do have a spectrum of 10-12 different flavors of chocolate, there aren't any here that you can't find in your local supermarket. Prices didn't seem to be all that great. The exception were the gift baskets and variety packs, but again, it's the same chocolate that you get anywhere else.

And this is absolutely one of the "must do" things if you're being a tourist!

I did not manage to find a no-sugar variety. The gal working the register said that they did not stock one.
author: Bruce K.

description: Great experience. Wonderful location & view. Great service with a smile. Everyone working there was very happy to be there. Not to mention the chocolate & all the options they have. Chocolate lovers paradise. Truely is. Enjoy. Go for it & don't look back.
author: Bryan C.

description: Although the ice-cream here is very popular, the staff inside is incredibly rude and uncourteous. After ordering my ice cream, I asked for a lid in order to take my ice cream to-go. The employee responded to my request with a bad attitude and did not even put the lid on the order himself. He acted as if my request was an inconvenience. I noticed that he was forcefully giving an elder customer an order that was incorrect although the customer repeatedly informed the staff member that the order was not his. In the process of grabbing my order, I dropped several items that I was holding, as both of my hands were fully occupied. The staff member then placed my order down and walked away. I spoke with the manager about this matter and he seemed to disregard my complaint although he insisted that he would speak with the staff member. Apart from this unpleasant incident, there was a wonderful employee with a charming attitude handing out chocolates at the front of the store. I really loved his customer service and optimism. He really engaged with the customers while they waited in line. They should consider making him the new manager and have him train the other staff members. Overall, the ice cream was delicious but the service was absolutely horrible.
author: Sarah A.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid, this is a great place for great ice cream and a lot of fun.

Be prepared to stand in line and hope you can find a place to sit after you order.
author: John M.

description:
A famous tourist attraction in San Francisco. Ghirardelli makes really good chocolate, but I have to say their ice cream are mediocre, slightly pricy, and quite sweet. I got a little sick of the sweetness after the eating the whole serving. But I have to say, their chocolates are bomb!! 

Favorites:
CRISSY FIELD($11.45) - Vanilla & cookies'n cream ice cream with hot fudge. Topped with whipped cream, Ghirardelli Chocolate Chip Cookie crumbles and Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate Caramel minis.
author: Victoria L.

description: I was excited to try Ghirardelli's, as I had heard so much about it. There are two sides to the business, but it seems I entered the smaller, more crowded side. I was there on a Friday afternoon, but the line was coming out of the door. The staff was friendly and fast in dishing out their desserts. Sadly, I was too full after lunch to get anything bigger than a scoop of ice cream in a waffle cone. While the cone and ice cream was delicious, I've had better ice cream at local spots in Florida with better ambience and more seating. On the plus side, they greet you at the door with Ghirardelli chocolate.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Can't get myself to give this place more than 3 stars for the sole purpose of how expensive and overpriced it is. I understand it's the Ghirardelli name brand and is in San Fran but still it's just ice cream at the end of the day. 

Menu is user friendly and fold with description and images making it super easy to make a decision and know what you're going to get, but again it's ice cream at the end of the day. No need to ever pay 12 dollars for ice cream. 

Super busy place, but has a lot of room for seating and has a variety of menu items. I guess it's a must see place to go to, especially if you're near.
author: Jeremy G.

description: To much and to complicated to explain. If you look for chocolates - perfect , but expect higher prices then your corner CVS. Ice creams hmmm well you better go somewhere else , ice creams are all in shakes and mixes that you might actually forgot what means real gelato
author: Jerry B.

description:
So I came here with my sister and got the Land's End to share. It was decadent, covered in whip cream, and had two brownie chunks slapped onto the side. 

I have a sweet tooth and so for my first few bites, it was outstanding. I usually never complain about too much food, but I think even sharing this amount for two people is too much, so bring a third if you're planning to get this sundae. 

The brownies were chewy, thick, and perfect. The ice cream was solid. Oddly enough, I think the base of caramel and chocolate that the ice cream sat on was my favorite part.

Overall, awesome sundae and you should definitely try it.
author: Jenny W.

description: Ghirardelli knows their chocolate. The line is usually out the door, but so worth it. They have someone standing at the door with menus - and free samples of chocolate! I was busy munching my chocolate and don't notice I just ordered a $12 sundae, but it was so WORTH IT. They are the suckers: I would have paid $12 just for the spoonful of fudge that was in it!
author: Jim K.

description: One of the best sundae's ever, loved the Espresso Escape - so much that we came back 3 times throughout our week in SF! The sundae was so big that my daughter and I split it every time. Fun atmosphere and a little fun information about how chocolate is made! Be forewarned - Very touristy and VERY expensive - about $13.50 for one sundae!
author: Sue H.

description: This is a regular stop for us while in the Bay area.  There are a bunch of unique shops around and the place is practically made of chocolate.  What's not to love?  For a sweet treat, we went to the chocolate shop and ordered a couple of drinks.  I had the Nob Hill Chill, and my wife had the Ocean Beach (I think.  The sea-salt caramel).  Mine was fabulous.  Loved every drop of it.  My wife's was good, but lacked a salty element.  The interior of this place is nice and there was ample seating.
author: Fred P.

description: My family and I always have to stop here whenever we vacation in San Francisco, it's just so good!
author: Hannah K.

description: This was very cool! The outside area is so cute at night time. We stood in line for a couple minutes and ordered two Crissy Fields. Yes, the desserts are pretty expensive... but we expected it. And it was very good. Probably not worth the $13, but it is Ghirardelli. The whip cream is sooo creamy, clearly not just out of the can. The cookies and cream part was SO good with the whip cream and cookie crumbs. I think they aren't normal oreos inside the ice cream because they were super delicious. We couldn't even finish one our ice creams, and we had two people sharing one! And, we realized that our ice creams didn't come with the two mini caramel chocolate squares on top, so we asked a waiter. We expected him to maybe come back with our chocolate squares, but he brought us a whole new Crissy Field ice cream! Unfortunately we were super full, so we ate our squares and gave it away to another table. The service was nice, prices were obviously a bit steep, but the ice cream was fantastic. It was a nice experience for a couple of tourists and very yummy. I suggest coming here when you are not full, and can share ice cream!
author: Michelle C.

description: Chocolate and more chocolate.  So creamy and delicious.  2nd night, just can't pass up the $1 off coupon.  Nice way to end the night, eating a sundae and overlooking the sunset
author: Teresa M.

description: This place seemed amazing! Free to just walk in and look around. The desserts, drinks and basically all dishes seemed absolutely decadent but we didn't try anything. Can't wait to return to try something next time I am in town. Great location also! They have a mini store, large seating space on the main floor, inside, outside and upstairs as well!
author: Virginia T.

description: Really long wait times on Saturday but worth it. Seating was hard to find. The world famous sundae was amazing and the painted lady mint sundae was spectacular.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
This is really a three star place, but just for sentimental reasons ( I have been coming here all my life) bumps it up to four stars.

Let's face it Ghirardelli is pretty much a tourist trap. As in everyone there is wearing an alcatraz T-shirt, or some San Francisco logo Adorned Hoodie.

But the look of a little kids face when they see the chocolate being made is very cool. 

Their sundaes are pretty much meh. Crystallized Ice cream...as in it was allowed to heat up and then refrozen. Fudge that is pretty mediocre. Phony whip cream....Wait didn't we pass Swensen's on the cable care ride down (that's the real deal folks...hint hint).

If you live here and have never been go and be done with it. If you're taking friends from out of town....well your really great friends for biting the bullet!
author: David G.

description:
The picture menu of all the ice cream sundaes is sinful. I had a really hard time choosing how much chocolate I wanted to stuff my face with, but I eventually picked the Mint Bliss which is a tall sundae that is one of the 3 Pink Ladies sundaes. My husband went all out and got the Warm Brownie sundae. 

I wanted to try his but could barely finish mine and I would say I got one of the smaller sundaes! It was so good, minty with plenty of whipped cream, a ghirardelli square on top and the bottom was a good two inches of pure chocolate sauce. I mean.....heaven. My husband's was basically the same but bigger, with vanilla ice cream, and a big brownie instead of the Ghirardelli square.

This place was packed, even on a rainy day! We thought we had it all figured out and would be the only ones there on a gloomy day. Plan ahead people; I can't imagine the crowds on a nice day! Definitely a must see destination because chocolate and ice cream are just so good, but be ready for crowds! Though the staff are very efficient at clearing tables and getting the desserts out.
author: Christine S.

description: Fun to look at way over priced. Single scoop ice cream $6.95. 3oz. Tin of my chocolate $9.95
author: Tony B.

description:
Filled with the sweet aroma of chocolate and bustling with people, Ghirardelli has a charm of its own. I do not have a sweet tooth but one look at the menu and tables around me and I was sold. 
I ordered for the CRISSY FILED COOKIE BITS SUNDAE - Vanilla ice cream nestled between cookies'n cream ice cream and smothered with our handmade hot fudge. Topped with whipped cream, Colossal Ghirardelli Chocolate Chip Cookie crumbles and two Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate Caramel minis. It was sinful and so perfectly delicious, I could not stop eating and it was all I could talk about all night.
I can't wait to back and dig into it again!
author: Ishani S.

description: This place is nuts. You have too fight for seating. Lines out the door. The dessert is good but nothing terribly special. Hot chocolate was ok. Ice cream was ok. Hot fudge was good though. I don't think it's worth the wait.
author: Danny S.

description: This place is definitely a must when in town. I've been here multiple times and have tried not almost everything on the menu but enough to say that this place is simply BOMB! From the hot choco-latte to the ice cream, I've always left this place with a smile on my face. What makes this place even better is my son loves it, too! Do expect to wait in line! It's always busy and everyone's always rummaging for a table. They have seating upstairs and outside, as well. I love how they bring your dessert to you and the people that do so are super patient! I give them so much credit for what they do. :)
author: Ashley P.

description:
Tasty! But goddamn! This place is FILTHY!!!

You'll have to fork over at least $10 for a shareable sundae. We had one with brownies and salted caramel and it was ahhhhmazzzing.

So the bad... the sundae did take over 25 min to arrive to our table, which we bussed ourselves because there were like 20 empty Sundae dishes on it and tons of sticky spills (eww). There were plenty of workers walking around chatting, but not cleaning. Seems like a management issue.

Open till midnight on Friday & Saturday.
author: Shannon C.

description: Super tasty smooth sundae we got here, Ghirardelli Square was kind of disappointing though, I expected it to see chocolatiers and chocolate shops everywhere... still worth the stop we were in and out of here in less than 40 minutes despite long lines and the shop being filled with tourists.
author: Tony D.

description: Yum, how can you be in the area and not have some delicious ice cream? Got 3 cones for about $15, and thoroughly enjoyed my black cherry ice cream cone. If we had more time, I would've loved to indulge in some of their chocolate fudge, but another time! There's also a smaller shop downstairs and hand out complimentary chocolate pieces.
author: Denise L.

description:
This place is my childhood.. Came back recently and it doesn't seem as magical as I remembered.

Anyway, came for hot fudge sundae.. Yum! They put the right amount of the fudge and the chocolate on my waffle cone was so good. The ice cream wasn't anything special. It also is kinda pricey for a sundae but still good.

Wouldn't go out of my way for this place though.
author: Donna D.

description: they need to work on their price a little more, to be honest some things are a bit overpriced, like their chocolate dipped strawberries, id rather just buy strawberries and dip them in Nutella myself instead of paying that price again lol. Plus they need to work on their hygiene, the tables rent really that clean, they place in general has a lightweight messy feel. but their deserts are delicious.
author: OD ..

description:
We visited the Original Ghiradelli Ice Cream shop and the had Presidio Passion which is a classier name for a strawberry and fudge sundae. The actual ice cream did not present itself the way it was pictured. I was missing two layers of fudge! The chocolate covered strawberry was a huge disappointment and you can immediately tell it was already going bad as if it were a few days old.

The place was extremely crowded and if you decide to dine in on a Saturday, you may not find a seat. People were hovering over others that were nearly done and about to leave just to grab their seats. We were able to find seating by the booth but the table was a mess and it took some time before someone finally cleared it out. We immediately regretted not taking it to go.

The good news is that they've decided to open another ice cream bar at the Ghiradelli Chocolate Shop that we walked by earlier and had practically no line! I'd recommend visiting this location if you don't mind that it is not the "original". Overall I would give this place a 2.5 stars since the ice cream was satisfactory although not pleasing to the eyes.
author: Frank T.

description: Ghirardelli's was an exciting experience - right from the free chocolates while waiting in line to the vibrant crowd inside. The ice cream was perfect and the fudge they put in their sundaes are marvelous. It is a wonder how the waiters find the correct number for the order amidst such a humongous crowd! Just a tip - have the sundae there instead of to-go. They serve in old-fashioned glasses and long spoons which adds to the charm of the entire experience! (I hate those plastic cups for to-go.)
author: Arko B.

description:
I went there over the weekend and thought there will be a lot of people but there wasn't. I wish their chocolates was a little cheaper or give a discount to sf natives. They have little sales like 3 boxes of minis for $27... but you go in, someone will greet you and give you a piece of chocolate, individually wrapped, as a sample.. 

You walk around until you get to the next section, the ice cream ordering.... there were 4 of us, one coke float, root beer float, hot coco, and a Caffè mocha. My coke float was delicious. The ice cream was fresh, you will know the difference. 

The wait wasn't long at all and they do have sundaes and other stuff, but it was 10am, so a float will do. 

Parking is ok, lots of meters... if you know the area well enough, there's non meters in the area. Fishermans wharf is nearby, walkable distance!
author: Eugenia W.

description: What a wonderful location so much chocolate to pick from, I stuffed the clear box with as many as I could fit for $20. The cashier helped me fill it up to the brim it was such a great deal, I also got a waffle cone with cookies and cream ice cream, delicious.
author: Kris R.

description: The Twin Peaks Sundae is the way to go! Let the delicious marshmellowy and ice creamy goodness drift you into a winter fantasy wonderland. Sure, the line was long. And maybe I could have gotten ice cream elsewhere. But, would it be Ghirardelli good?
author: K S.

description: Cute place to bring a little friend along. Just remember to not order too much even if you're a chocolate lover! I love my hot chocolate and my sister ordered the ice cream from there that was minty and different from other places for ice cream. I love that you can see how they process the chocolate and the place seems old fashion.
author: Phuong N.

description:
Really cool store but honestly I didn't see anything I couldn't buy at a grocery store or Target.  

I got the 2 scoop waffle cone - pretty good but nothing out of the ordinary that you wouldn't get from another ice cream shop.
author: Martin P.

description:
Forget Dieting!

This is a must,  but don't eat for a week before or after the calories are off the scale but worth it! Coffee is good to!
author: Rain B.

description:
I originally came here for souvenirs - my boyfriend's grandmother requested some authentic Ghiradelli milk chocolate, that's why we braved the rainy windy weather and walked all the way here after dinner at Fisherman's Wharf. 

To our surprises, this place was actually a sit-down restaurant, where we could enjoy a selection of Ghiradelli chocolate desserts. Since we were here, thought we could try something off the menu. We ordered a Nob Hill Chill to share - and much to my disappointment, this is not worthy of the money we paid for (with the San Francisco Health Tax, it costed more than 10 dollars!). It tasted nothing more than a cup of melted chocolate ice cream, really, that's it. Perhaps I had higher expectation from an establishment that was known for its chocolate products. 

The place itself was nice, it was later at night when we visited but I could tell this place would be great to visit during daytime. Maybe this review can be better if I order something else next time I visit...
author: Loretta F.

description:
If you're a tourist, it's a great place to come to for desert.  If you're a local, it's a nice place to bring out of towners as the area is nice.  If you're nostalgic, then it's a great way to spend time if you grew up visiting the Cannery and Wharf area.  If you're simply craving something sweet and desert, then there's a couple of factors you have to consider... parking (in the heart of SF!) and prices (avg $10 per person for a decadent yet not super sized, 'tho good satisfying portion, not sharing sized).

Parking has gotten easier if you know SF and the way to have forced karma through knowledge and education of how to work the meters and zones as well as the surrounding nooks and crannies of the area, especially right now when it's in the fall/winter when it's darker faster and colder outside of tourist season.

Pricing, as mentioned is on the above average higher end, yet the quality is good not necessarily uniquely great, but good, and A-OKAY.  There's many other local places for deserts and ice cream, but this place does have nice seating inside.

If you go through the chocolate candy area, the odds are you'll also get treated and greeted by staff handing out a free square of chocolate too.
author: Rick S.

description:
It's super cute and family friendly inside, but you're definitely paying a premium for the location and brand. I think my sundae was $13 with tax and tip. Saying this, you might not want to, but the servings are large so you might want to spilt with a friend (saving calories and pennies).

Definitely enjoyed it! Be prepared for a bit of a wait considering the number of staff members.
author: Lara G.

description: I got the Crissy Field and shared it with my family of four, it was delicious and filled all of us up. Main complaint was that the chairs felt really rickety and unstable, I think a screw was loose in mine. I also didn't like how you had to order before you sat down, it felt stressful and like we were being rushed. Otherwise, pretty good experience plus they were giving away free samples in the gift shops!
author: Logan L.

description: While still delicious, I think less and less that it is worth it here. A ice cream sundae costing $13.49?! That's outrageous. They know it, and that's why the prices aren't posted outside on the menu board. It's a great sundae, but coming here is certainly not without its fault- cost, lines, a bit of cleanliness could be improved, and how crowded it is.
author: Dan E.

description:
I have been here many times at night. My boyfriend and I love taking our friends here!

Here's the low-down:

First off, parking off of Jefferson street is sometimes easy to get. That's where I normally park and it's only about a 2 minute walk away. Be ready to be searching around and bring quarters if necessary. 

This Ice cream shop is at the lower part of Ghiradelli Square not to be confused with the other shop. This one has a cute little entrance with a bunch of gift baskets with chocolate. You walk around the corner and you enter the dining room with tables, a food prep area, and A CHOCOLATE MACHINE IN THE BACK!!!!

I am writing my review based on my visit from last Saturday the 12th. I came with my boyfriend and two friends a little after 11:00 pm. They're open till 12 which I love! We weren't sure about what to get so we ended up getting a chocolate-covered strawberry, some fudge cubes, and a chocolate chip cookie. Our friend ordered a cookie as well and our other friend ordered a sundae, I believe it was called Lands End. 

The chocolate-covered strawberry was tasty. It was huge and costed like $5.00. A little high for me. The fudge was very rich and just the right texture, however it didn't blow me away. The price for 5 cubes was like $11.00. I wasn't sure how much the cookies were but they were very moist and warm. Very tasty! 

The sundae was about $17.00. I thought if it was that expensive, it better blow me away. It didn't but it was still good. It came with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, two brownies, hot fudge, chocolate sauce, and a cherry. It was a decent size and the 4 of us enjoyed it. But to be honest, I felt like I could make it myself at home if I had all the time and ingredients. 

I like the dining area. They have a decent amount of seating but I can see it being overcrowded. I feel like they could have more seating. 

What blew me away was the happy and great customer service!! My friends and I were helped out by Monique and Kenyatta. They were so happy to serve us and answer all of our questions about the food. We were pretty indecisive so they had good patience. They gave us good recommendations on heating up the cookies and what they thought about the sundae. We were able to joke around with them and they had positive attitudes with us. They made our experience quite fun! 

Overall:

Ghiradelli Square is definitely a tourist attraction. It's a good place to come by for the experience, sweets and great customer service. The prices may be steep but I feel that it;s definitely worth to try out. i'll see you again Ghiradelli Square!
author: Robby T.

description:
When I was in college, I'd visit San Francisco every year at Christmas. During my visit, we'd always stop by Ghirardelli Square to see that wonderful Christmas tree. I haven't been here in over 15 years, but I really wanted my son to get some yummy chocolate at the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop during our recent vacation.

We were so surprised by how long the lines were here. After waiting an hour in line, we decided that we just couldn't wait any longer. When we mentioned to an employee that we just wanted to buy some chocolate (the line was apparently just for ordering sundaes), she mentioned that the other door led directly to the store.

This was very, very crowded as well, but it was nice to pick up some items and go directly to cashier. They also gave samples of chocolate as we walked in the door. The customer service was good, but not necessarily great. Because it was so crowded, the staff seemed completely overwhelmed. It was impossible to move through the crowds of people in the store without bumping into everyone in sight.

Although we're not sure if they still put up a Christmas tree in Ghirardelli Square around the holidays, we'd love to come back to get some of their delicious ice cream and see the lights at Christmas. Hopefully, the lines won't be as long when we're back the next time.
author: Tami D.

description:
Originally I thought that I didn't want to come here since I have ghiradelli chocolate back home in New Jersey. But I never had their ice cream.
Well worth the visit! I came In a group of four and we ordered two ice cream sundaes. We were so full afterward but very satisfied . Definitely order a few sundaes and share so you can try each one.
My only downer is that the brownie in the brownie sundae was not soft and warm. It was still delicious because ghiradelli brownies and chocolates are amazing!
author: Kamila M.

description:
So. Super. Busy.  (...and it was just a Thursday evening!)  

The sundaes and shakes were perfection! Our group of 6 each ordered their own thing and surprisingly, there was nothing left.  Bunch of gluttons we were that night!   Cookies and cream shakes, to caramel sundaes, to banana splits, to single scoops.  
I'm positive they are  used to the crowds so I withhold a star because alllllll the free tables were such a mess and so sticky and it was just hard to find a seat.   

Fabulous desserts...but $65.  Oh my!
author: Heidi D.

description: Ambience is old times fun, the Sundaes seemed to have some pizazz.  My sea salt hot chocolate was underwhelming.  I was expecting strong presentation with a chocolate square (like the menu said) I got not chocolate piece, my drink served in a benign ceramic mug as if I were at any diner in the world, with the handle of the mug covered in gritty dried chocolate drink spillage... even though it tastes fine, not impressed!
author: Kelly S.

description: Amazing ice cream. We had Presideo teice in a row. Many tables to sit and hot fudge is a must!!! Loved it!
author: Pat P.

description: I love how this place was decorated, it has plenty of space and even a chocolate tower. Their ice cream and chocolate together makes anyone's day better.
author: Tan D.

description: If you love chocolate and ice cream, this is definitely your place. If you love Ghirardelli chocolates, you best believe that it's a must that you come visit here. This is chocolate heaven. All flavors of Ghirardelli chocolate, if you can think of it, this store most definitely will have it. You can always find someone walking around giving out free samples. My favorite Ghirardelli chocolate is the milk chocolate caramel. I thought it was pretty legit that the day I came here, they were giving out these flavored sample chocolates. It always super hectic here because it is both a chocolate store and a chocolate/ice cream shop. There are areas set off along the sides of the store for specifically the dining areas. I would definitely suggest trying to get something here no matter how large or small. What's not to like? It's both chocolate and ice cream! Be sure to have patience and make time during your visit here because it's always super busy and filled with people here. There's people left and right trying to find chocolates to buy and people trying to look for seats to sit and eat. It's totally worth it, once you put a spoonful of Ghirardelli chocolate and ice cream in your mouth, the rest of the world seems to just melt away.
author: Brandon D.

description: Always out of the world experience. One is always greeted with a smile and a chocolate sampler. Variety of gift packs to chose from, and ice cream sundaes are out of the world...great location. Overall has a fantastic feel to it.
author: Ankit K.

description:
Since we were in San Francisco we wanted to try all the popular tourist places, and this was definitely on the list!

The line was huge which made us even more intrigued- long lines means it must be good right?! 

After maybe half and hour of waiting, we made it inside and stared at the menu. How the heck do you pick one thing off this thing?? Everything sounds amazing and so tempting!!!!! We ordered the world famous sundaes and eagerly waited.

We got our chocolate creations and dug in- goodness. Let me tell you this place is so worth the line! The ice cream and caramel and brownie pieces and everything else served to give you an amazing and decadent dessert! I ate way too many calories but every single calorie was worth it:p

I can see why this place is a popular tourist attraction- it is too good!!
author: Vicky M.

description:
I come to San Francisco on occasion and I must admit every time I come I either whine to the group to stop by Ghirardelli or drag the group right to the shop as a first stop. Just yesterday I made a trip to SF just to buy an ice cream sundae at Ghirardelli (and I live about an hour and a half drive away). 
In total I've been to this Ghirardelli location three times in the past year, at least that I can remember. I'm a big fan of the making your own sundae (it's a better deal), and I think it's nice that they now offer some complementary toppings. One thing though, I'm not sure if it's true, but I feel that the SF location has higher prices on the same items offered in other Ghirardelli locations.
It is very crowded, especially on weekends. On a weekday or during the slow part of a weekend the line can be bearable, but during the busy time it can easily stretch past the next building of the square. The line does move relatively quickly though.
One of my favorite things to get is the raspberry sorbet. I'm somewhat lactose intolerant (totally great idea for someone like this to go to an ice cream place huh), but I get the sorbet because I really think it tastes good! Also because the menu does display calorie information and I feel so much less guilty getting the raspberry than my second choice, which would would be the black cherry vanilla ice cream. This time I got three scoops of raspberry sorbet, Ghirardelli dark hot fudge, toasted almonds, Ghirardelli dark chocolate chips, and a maraschino cherry. I forgot to ask for diced strawberries, but it was enjoyable nonetheless. I paid a total of $9.96. 
They made my order really quickly; I waited for five minutes if not less. Since I got it to-go, I ate it all up while walking along the beach nearby. It was definitely a worthwhile trip.
I knocked off a star because the cashiers are kinda rude. All three times I remember going the cashiers were very matter-of-fact-ly, looked annoyed, and were quick to input my order and move on. Yesterday was better, the lady who took my order clearly had other places to be but she spelled my name right and got my order in without mistake. The first two times (I believe I got the same cashier those two times, how unlucky) I went with my mom (who has a bit of difficulty speaking English), and let's just say it ended with her snatching the receipt from the cashier and fuming about how rude the cashier was the entire time we were waiting for our ice cream. The second time really ticked me off too, I asked how she was doing and she just ignored me and nonchalantly greeted me back, to which I frowned, confused, but brushed off. She continued to mess up our order two times, which I didn't brush off so easily.
Anyways, for any hard feelings the cashiers may cause, it'll all be cured when you get your ice cream :).
author: Jackie Q.

description:
This is such a heavenly place.  One is brought back in time with their red bricked walls and traditional ice cream parlor server hats.

I love the idea that they gave free mini Ghirardelli squares as you enter the door.

We had their sundae served on a chocolate dipped waffle cone and topped with a generous serving of whipped cream and two squares.  Yum!
author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.

description: Prepare to wait if you're here on the weekends, but by far this is a MUST in San Francisco. So many things on the menu. If you're indecisive, you cannot go wrong with a single scoop of Ice cream or the hot fudge sundae. The line moves quickly and eating inside is quite nice.
author: Daniela V.

description: I love Ghirardelli chocolate there's no denying that. Ordered an ice cream Sundae and 2 scoops of ice cream in a waffle cone for $20, dayum. Definitely overrated since it's basic ice cream but I guess you're paying for the name and atmosphere. I wanted ice cream so I can't complain, but normally I would just go somewhere else.
author: Tram H.

description:
In love with this place... The best combination of Ice Cream and world's best chocolate... 

Love every single sundae I have tried here so far... 

Anyone who visits California should definitely visit this place... 

They have hot fudge in almost all their sundaes and its so delicious... They don't sell drinking chocolate boxes here anymore but if you can find it at any other Ghirardelli stores - it's a must buy... you won't regret it... 

It's totally worth waiting in the long lines if the dessert is so good... and if you are on a diet stay far far away from this place because the smell of chocolate will drag you in and your cheat day will ruin your entire diet...
author: Rupa S.

description: This place was beautiful and a chocolate lover's paradise.  Customer service was lacking; cashier person was not friendly.  Some of the tables to sit at and eat at were not cleaned off.  Ice cream brownie sundaes and chocolate milk shake were awesome! Overall, glad we stopped by.
author: Marie J.

description:
I finally visited Ghiradelli Square! It took me a LONG time (4 different trips in 10 years). I remember seeing it on my Chelsea Motor Inn map when I was a young'n and I was really interested in it- it took all these years to get here! The original, the first. :3

Yes, it's a tourist trap, but that's quite alright. It's a trap for CHOCOLATE. Yummy delicious tasty sweet chocolate. There are three doors. One door (on the far right) leads to the chocolate shop. The other doors are for the chocolate sundaes and such. 

Crissy Field (Cookie Bits Sundae)- Vanilla ice cream nestled between cookies 'n cream ice cream w/ hot fudge. Topped w/ whipped cream, Ghiradelli CC cookie crumble, and two Ghiradelli Milk & Caramel minis

Painted Ladies (hmmmmmm...)
Espresso Escape (9.95)- Espresso chip ice cream, freshly homemade dark choco hot fidge, w/c and intense Dark Twilight Delight 72% chocolate.

Crissy Field- the cookies and cream weren't sweet, which is good, but the hot fudge smothers the taste when you hit it. There's tons of whipped cream on the 2 sides, which is fine, but the cookie is a bit dry :-/ Def. mix with the ice cream (eh)

Espresso Escape- Had one bite but had tons of hot fudge in it haha. It was dark chocolate but insanely sweet. :)

The service is nice, as the first Crissy Field started to melt, and the server brought it back to remake because "she didn't want to give us a melted ice cream". which is really really nice. :3

OH and there's no signal in here so check in BEFORE you get in and show them the coupon! I didn't do it cuz i was stupid and checked in into the square first- which screwed me over. I had a coupon from Fish Wharf so I got that coupon (Whew!) $1 off a sundae w/ Yelp check-in!

Heyo, come in and try it- it's the original store! There are a lot of people but you can have tons of seats in the first and second floor- plus look at the chocolate makin' process in the back of the first floor. Enjoy it, have fun (:
author: Raymond L.

description:
LOVE Ghiradelli chocolate. Came in and got the Treasure Island. I would suggest splitting this with another person.

Also, beware when you look at the menu. The calorie counts will surprise you!
author: Bryant E.

description:
Came to the Ghirardelli Square because of google. Yes I googled things to do in San Fran and Ghirardelli square showed up. Went inside the square and noticed the Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop. Ok please do not laugh. I am from Canada. So.... I have no idea how famous Ghirardelli Sundae are. 

My friends told me that their Sundaes are a must try. So you have to go and order and pay for the Sundae first and they will bring it to you. 

I went and ordered their Ghirardelli Square Sundae. I was amazed at their Sundae. I don't know how they do it. The ice cream is cold but the chocolate is warm. The chocolate is very thick. I am guessing when they make it, they don't dilute it with too much milk. I love that thick gooey texture and best of all the sweetness goes perfect with the vanilla ice cream. I wish they have more peanuts sprinkles on the top. I love nut sprinkles. They also add in a cherry to make it look nice. 

The portion is huge. Its actually enough to share for 2 or even 3 people. But because I am a big fan of ice cream, its better off you go get your own ice cream! I am serious. I did manage to finish it all and because it was so good, I actually want to order another one.

As I am typing away I am craving for their Sundae. 

The Sundae cost $10.95 and I have to say it is priced at the higher end. But for the taste, you really have to try it. Its so good. I can say best Sundae I have ever tasted.
author: Denise W.

description:
Location is amazing and the dessert choices are to die for. The actual desserts are not too sweet and the price is sufficient! The reason why I'm giving it three stars versus four is because of the following.

1. The lady who greets and gives out samples was not helpful at all when I asked for assistance and she ignored me twice.

2. The cashier was not to friendly and had a little snobby attitude.

3. Tried to get a water cup and the water pressure was beyond low, it took five minutes to fill the cup half way!
author: Steven W.

description: This was one of our first stops when we got to San Francisco.  We decided ice cream would be great after our lunch.  The line was fairly short, maybe a two minute wait.  I went to a register and ordered an Ocean Beach and a chocolate cone.  I then proceeded to a table.  Once at the table I looked at my receipt and noticed it said Ocean Beach and chocolate.  I went to the counter and asked a server what it mean and they said that it mean I wanted the Ocean Beach with chocolate ice cream instead of vanilla.  I then told them what I'd wanted and offered to pay the difference.  The server said no, that was fine and went to tell the other employees what my order really should have been.  A few minutes later my order arrived perfectly.  The taste was wonderful.  The chocolate was rich and the salted caramel was amazing.  I thoroughly enjoyed my sundae. My son's cone was huge and he was in heaven.  My sister also ordered a sundae, black cheery, it looked wonderful as well.  I would definitely return on a future trip to enjoy some more delicious ice cream.
author: Ashley E.

description:
Its my last night in San Francisco so i wnet for a late night drive with a friend and stopped by this place at about 11pm..
Heard the chocolate is reallg nice af Ghirardelli 

I ordered a root beer float, golden gate banana split and a brownie fudge ice cream.
3 stars for the amazing tasting fudge and brownie and also scoffed down a sea salt and caramel chocolate block , very tasty !!

No stars for the cream and ice cream .. both were very average! 

Would go back for the chocolate but nothing else!!
Maybe they should think of getting another ice cream providor or use gelato instead !!
author: Billy E.

description: When going to San Francisco this is the place to go for ice cream,  great for this hot weather!!! My son loves their chocolate with caramel ice cream and my husband and i the hurricane. I definitely recommend!!!
author: Edith Janet M.

description: Came here when i visited San Francisco. So delicious! I'm glad my friend and i got there when we did (about 3pm) because they were running out of cups and cones were their only option that they were offering.
author: R R.

description:
With an average price of $12/sundae, I was thinking man this must taste like GOLD, like heaven in your mouth. Maybe I would faint and reach God momentarily before coming back to life because it was just that good. Disappointed to say that didn't happen today unfortunately. 

The line isn't so bad, it goes by pretty fast. Once you get inside though...that's where Table Games begin. May the odds be ever in your favor! Seriously, you'll need it. You place your order at the door and they give you a number stand, and then you're on your own to find a table. Not sure why they structured it to be this way, it'd probably be less like an apocalypse if they sat people down when tables become available, or maybe make use of technology to help you mark which tables are available. Come on Ghirardelli.  

I know a lot of people say that coming to Ghirardelli's is a must-do if you come to SF. I'm a SF native and have passed by the square on so many occasions, but have actually never tried the sundaes here LOL until today. I think this place is more so for you chocolate aficionados and chocolate lovers. The sundaes are nothing grand, but insanely sweet. Makes you THIRSTY! Not sure what you're paying for because you're definitely not paying for $12 worth of ice cream. Experience? Forget it. 

Conclusion: This is SF, there are so many amazing and delicious ice cream shops in the city, in my opinion you'd be better off going to those. My reasoning 1) taste, 2) price (cheaper), 3) shorter lines and no table war. 

PARKING: street, insane. You'll be lucky to find one. Fort Mason is nearby and have more parking spaces, unmetered, I believe it's 2 hours (No Parking 4-6pm). There's also garages of course. 

PRICE: expensive for some basic ice cream. 

SERVICE: table situation terrible, but the workers there definitely deserve recognition, having to deal with the mass amount of people that come by everyday.
author: Vivian S.

description: So completely delicious & definitely a must-try place if you're visiting the area. My only compliant is the prices, but it's so cool to get the experience behind the wrappers and behind the chocolate that you just purchase at a convenience store. It was the perfect spot for the whole family & we all enjoyed it and it's delectable treats. They give you a free sample of chocolate at the door, which leaves you wanting more. Smart marketing choice on they're behalf. ;) Anyway, I definitely recommend trying the place- just remember to bring some $$.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Story of my life. 
There are two thing in life I want:
1. Hot body.
2.CHOCOLATE.

There are two thing in life I cannot have at the same time:
1/ Hot body.
2. CHOCOLATE.

Craving a sweet-salty drink? One drink: Sea Salt Caramel Banana Shake: Chocolate bar + Fresh Banana slices = Heavenly scrumptious milkshake, too good to be true.

Five Yelps! No questions.
author: Sari A.

description: This place is huge! You order at the counter and they give you a number then they bring out your order. They have milkshakes, malts, ice cream cones, sundaes, etc. Tons of options to choose from as well. Got tons of tables and they have free water displayed in the back as well.
author: Magz K.

description:
I absolutely ADORE this place! The chocolate is superb and they have a huge selection of it. It could be a gift for a loved one or just a small treat for yourself. I first visited this place with my friends and we decided to split the Earthquake ice cream sundae. Yes, it is expensive and it costs 40 dollars, but we split the price between 8 of us so we only paid 5 dollars. In the end, we couldn't finish it because it was too big! I have to admit that this was one of the best memories I have of San Francisco. 
I also recommend that you learn a little bit about Domingo Ghirardelli (he was the man who started this wonderful business) because it will make you appreciate what he worked so hard to accomplish, and help you believe that the American dream does exist.
author: Daisy B.

description:
How can you not go to San Francisco without hitting up the "Original" Ghirrdelli Ice Cream Shop. Make no bones about it, this is a tourist trap. No matter, we could not wait and made it one of our very first stops.

Location is superb at the wharf, but technically called Ghirardelli Square. Easy access to get to the area on public transportation via cable car, or bus. Don't waste your money on a taxi its too easy, scenic and reasonable to not go public. The benefit of this is also no issue with parking which is a challenge. Off street parking is around, but close to impossible to come by. If there is a garage nearby I did not see it. There are parking garages on down the wharf on Jefferson.

I could have easily hit this review with a 3 based on how much trash is around. I tried my best to not get too excited because the whole area has debris to some extent and this is better than some. But you will find all type of trash almost every where in the square. But in front of the door it was clear.

Ghirardelli has been around a long time and has a great established name for quality products. We have been fans for years and there is no local shop in our area of Virginia so we made two stops in our week by the bay. This is the "Original" shop not to be confused with others in the city...it's the best in my opinion. It has some nice extras and can accommodate a lot of customers.

Service when ordering is immediately upon walking in the door and was excellent both times. When you do a yelp check-in an offer comes up for $1 off for sundae. Also if you get a MUNI pass they have a 10% discount, so even a better deal because it's not limited to a sundae. You will want a deal believe me, a two scoop sundae is $11 +tax. Smiling faces from staff help the sting of the cost and you will absolutely love the product.

Seating is downstairs and upstairs both. They will find you by the number given after paying. I never had any issues locating a table for two even though it may look impossible. Make your way to the back and see some cool chocolate machines, then chocolate fountain on steroids. They also dip the waffle cones in this area which is fun to watch. I found the dining room to be tidy, any empty tables were cleared and clean from what I saw. 

There are no restrooms located in the shop which is a downside. You must go to the public restrooms in the square that is not too far, but used by homeless. I've seen worse, so I am not hitting them hard. However, they have been well used. Everything worked with supplies present.

The delivery of the sundaes on both visits was within 10-15 minutes and comes with extra napkins and spoons in case there is sharing. Believe me, the deal is to share because even a two scoop sundae is crazy huge. If you split it also makes it much more affordable. I had a hot fudge with vanilla and chocolate sundae with was scrumptious. On another visit a chocolate shake that was good, but too rich and chocolaty if that is possible. My wife got the Mint Brownie both times and said it was awesome. You could call her a SUPER FAN! When finished there are tons of staff that work cooperatively on clearing the table. On both occasions they swooped in and grabbed dirty dishes. 

There is a gift shop that is connected to the shop. It has the large bags of square chocolates variety packages. We bought two bags on sale for a 4th of July deal that was pretty good to take home. Its not huge, but displays are attractive. We ended up going back here at the end of the trip for a few more gifts.

So to recap it's a must stop and hit the "Original" one in the square at the wharf. Use any and all discounts it's expensive. They are huge, so if you don't mind share and save a lot. Finally take public transportation due to issues with parking congestion. You will love whatever they make you.
author: J David H.

description: Ummm what's not to love?! Chocolate and ice cream and cherries and sprinkles! A piece of chocolate when you walk in and obviously the beautiful lit up Ghirardelli sign?! This place is great, I've been here each time we visit San Francisco. It's a must! The ice cream is delicious. The lines are pretty long on the weekends but they move quickly!
author: Carly T.

description: This one is simple:  Get the Chocolate Shake.  I know, it's a pretty basic choice when so much decadence abounds.  But it is delicious and rich.  Sometimes you've gotta stick with the classics.
author: John M.

description:
What is not to like about Ghirardelli?!?! This place is heaven for chocolate-lovers like myself. The only thing Ghirardelli needs is to build more of itself with tons more chocolate. Every time we are in the area, we have to stop there and just indulge in the moment! 

Indulged on-butter pecan two scoops with any cone (but might as well go for broke and get the chocolate dipped cone with almonds)...and always get two scoops so that it will be worth the food-coma lols! 

Ghirardelli...mmm mmm!
author: Bjorn R.

description: The park next to the shop is amazing! The line however was not nice. The shop is so small that once they take your order, you get squished into the corner waiting for your item. I know it's not the fault of the staff but the ice cream is amazing. Just something to be aware of when trying to get something sweet.
author: Zoë O.

description:
I've been to the shop so many times as a kid and even during college. But this is my first time ever purchasing something from here! 

I came here on the Friday before 7/4 and holy moly...claustrophobic overload! There are two lines going on here: one is into the actual shop to order your dessert delectables and the other was the to-go line. There was no line going into the chocolate shop, so we went there first to get our free mini salted caramel samples! 

We waited in the never ending line for about 20 minutes before we got the register. I love that they give you the menu when you are waiting in line to speed up the process!

After much contemplating, I ordered:
-Crissy Field aka Cookie Bits Sundae: Vanilla Ice Cream nestled between two cookies and cream ice cream scoops, smothered with homemade hot fudge. Topped with whipped cream, Colossal Ghirardelli chocolate chip cookie crumbles and two Ghirardelli chocolate squares

LOOK AT THAT DESCRIPTION. They say it's bad to have dessert before dinner...but you don't get Ghirardelli ice cream everyday! 

We ordered around 3 PM and the cashier told us they had ran out of waffle cones! (Sure. I saw you making more back there...) But either way, you can choose to dine in or to-go. Dine in, you hunt for a spot. To-go, you wait in line for them to call our your name. 

We chose to dine-in and the wait was about 40 minutes. The hard part was finding a table, because most people were already saving spots, so we had to hover over others and swoop in when they left. 

We got our ice cream delivered to us, with two spoons. (I wonder how they know how many spoons to bring?) TIME TO DIG IN! 

Pros:
-DELICIOUS COOKIES. I love their cookies! Now let me go get a mix of this stuff!
-Good portion size! All portion sizes are huge, and this was definitely a good "appetizer" before dinner! 
-Great service! No matter how crazy it got, the cashiers and waiters were still super helpful and knew how to calm the crowd. 

Cons:
-Uh...where is my hot fudge? I was literally only slurping down melted ice cream and lots of whipped cream. Where is my fudge?! 
-In the process of waiting for the waiters to hunt me down in the midst of people, my ice cream had melted quite a bit. SUCH SADNESS. Even if they announced numbers over a microphone and made me get it myself, I would be totally fine.

Tips/Observations:
-There is seating upstairs for the coffee/hot chocolate "bar"! But I would recommend staying downstairs if you choose to dine-in or else your ice cream will become a hot mess. 
-CHECK IN on Yelp and get $1 off your sundae! Tmobile literally has no service upon entrance of the front door. Get checked-in BEFORE you enter the room to show you did it!

Overall, I will definitely come here to try their other sundaes! Bring groups here to indulge in the awesomeness of ice cream!
author: Hurjane V.

description: Totally a tourist trap!! Prices are crazy high. But it does satisfy any sweet tooth cravings if you're in the area. I got the Lands End Sundae (vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, warm brownie, whipped cream, almonds, and a cherry on top) and my friends got the banana split to share. I thought my sundae was good at first but after a few bites, the sweetness was too overwhelming. However, my friends really enjoyed and devoured their banana split! Parking is terrible since this is a popular tourist destination. The line can get quite long but it goes by pretty fast.
author: Nancy C.

description: One word...Divine...This has to be the most iconic example of an ice cream shop with unparalleled customer service, the best atmosphere ever, and the most delicious desserts...This is the only place that can make me feel like I'm a kid again (aside from Disneyland)...
author: Glenn V.

description: Love love love the chocolates. We got 2 sundaes. They were both amazing. The portions are so big. We split the 2 sundae between 4 people. And we were all stuffed by the end. I loved the place. The restaurant has sticky floors but other than that its a good restaurant.
author: Sharon J.

description: Does this place even need any more reviews??? I highly recommend visiting this shop if you are a chocolate lover.  I came here during a trip and knew that I had to buy some chocolate for my return trip home.  I recommend the 72% midnight delight chocolate!  I also recommend  trying the original hot fudge sundae with dark chocolate hot fudge.  Beware-the line can be ridiculously long, and the wait can also be a bit agonizing while it could take over 30 minutes to get your sundae.  The good news is that it is enough to share, and you would hope so because it comes out to almost 13 bucks a pop.  Anyways, there are actually two ice cream and chocolate shops in the Ghirardelli square, the only difference is one actually showcases some of the original chocolate making machinery and is a bit bigger and two stories.  The other one still serves sundaes and treats and has chocolate for purchase.
author: Persila N.

description: Wowww haven't been to this place for the longest time. Can't even remember when is the last time I visit this place. It is almost the place that I won't go unless I have to bring relatives for all the tourist spot. This place is super cute, it has all the little boutiques and also places to eat and later you can always go to Ghirardelli for the sundae and also the infamous chocolate.
author: L D.

description: Ice cream just can't be bad.. we had the sea salt caramel sundae and it was so good. Just wish the brownie had been warmed! A fun stop due to the history here... Just wish they had outside seating!
author: Courtney L.

description: I visited this place on my second day in the United States. One of my best friends had been bragging about this place for years and I had to try it. Now I know what she meant when she said it was the best place for Ice-cream lovers.
author: Archie A.

description:
I always love coming to Ghirardelli Square when visiting SF!  My friend and I's first stop was of course the ice cream & chocolate shop.  We got some delicious samples of pumpkin spice chocolate on our way in, and then made our way into the cafe.

Since the weather was on the cooler side, we decided to get some hot chocolate. Best cup of hot chocolate I have EVER had!!!  So creamy, rich, and delicious.  No other hot chocolate will ever come close!

I've gotten the sundaes here before as well, and they are always mouthwateringly delectable.
author: Tara R.

description: This is the Disneyland of icecreams!!!  It's dangerous because we've been to a Ghirardelli store 3x in the past 5 days.. we'll probably go again tomorrow before our dlight back to the east coast.  Highly recommend!
author: Joyce V.

description:
If you love a Ghiradelli sundae or hot chocolate at your local store, at AT&T Park, from the market....you'll LOVE the original from the Ghiradelli shop here in SF. It is a must stop for touristy folks looking to buy chocolate souvenirs, a good stop on a warm day in SF for hot fudge chocolate sundaes and a great stop for a hot cup of hot chocolate on a cold, foggy SF day. Kid you not, the hot chocolate is to die for. The BEST OF THE BEST of hot chocolates! Rich, creamy, sweet, and chocolaty! 

The building validates for stopping in as well, and there's street parking.
author: Ticha B.

description:
Awesome place to visit especially if you're in the mood for some chocolate. We loved the ice cream and latte. I would have given it a 5 star if someone had sat us down. It's so crowded, and you have to find a seat yourself... so people are just standing there waiting wherever they can until someone or a family gets up and leave. 
They are military friendly which is great!
author: Marley B.

description:
Ok. It's good. C'mon it's ice cream and chocolate. What's not great is the lousy attitude of the staff. You Are Selling Ice Cream! It is supposed to be fun. Not drudgery. 
It's pricey and sad to watch big families have to leverage a $200 tab on the credit card. 
The brand is still good and it's delicious, but the long lines and cost can make you think twice.
author: David B.

description:
I had their original hot cocoa and a brownie. Both were heavenly! The hot cocoa was the perfect temp so as not to scald my mouth. It was also delicious and not too sweet. The brownie was by far the best brownie I have ever had! It was rich, gooey, and perfect in flavor.
(Disclaimer: I am a chocoholic.)
author: Itsa C.

description:
Okay experience this time. 

We ordered ice cream with waffle cones. The family was so excited to try them. However, we were disappointed with dipped chocolate/waffle cones. The chocolate was old and the cone was stale. Informed the team to provide us with fresh cones since we had another group. Still fail. Their ice cream was good. But, if you are going to offer waffle cones, at least ensure they are fresh or properly stored.
author: Hussam S.

description: Stick to the hot fudge sundae- simple, classic, and absolutely delicious. Served with tons of fudge, the way ghiradelli (and god, I'm sure) intended it.
author: Bre S.

description:
I got their chocolate milk shake which was AMAZING!!! rich, thick, creamy and smooth milk chocolate...What more could you want from a shake! 

Downfall, the crowd in the waiting area is no fun and it's not very stroller friendly also it's a bit pricey at 6.98 for a regular shake!
author: Dana M.

description: Honestly not impressed. For a chocolate place, I was expecting more flare and amazement. Just your typical candy shop with over priced chocolates.
author: Alyssa E.

description:
It's always busy here, but the cashiers and servers get your dessert/coffee out QUICK!

Was here on a Saturday night, and was at the shop in the square with indoor seating.

Quite busy, lively, and full, melting pot of variety of different cultures and tourists.

Got the 'crissy fields' sundae, was bomb, and shared with two other people.

The quality and taste of the ghirardelli chocolate if on point, very creamy tasting and I can see why they are known for their chocolate now.

Samples on deck were caramel filled pumpkin spice chocolate, if you ask for another sample, they have no problem to give you more, or go around or to another store to get them!

Coffee was great, very smooth, and sweet with that whole milk.

Definitely would come back to try more sundaes they are sweet and to die for.
author: Elijah B.

description: Great location in the heart of San Fran! Free chocolate samples as you walk in. The ice cream is DELISH. I just wish they had smaller portions of their sundaes and cones. We were able to snag a table by the window and watch the Blue Angels perform, right over our heads!!!
author: Lysa D.

description:
This destination is a true tourist spot. Being from Denver, I've been told to check-out the Ghiradelli Ice Cream Shop when traveling to San Francisco. Having been there now, I can say that it's a nice little shop. But, it's a little bit expensive. And there doesn't seem to be anything spectacularly special about it. Maybe I'm just one of those girls who likes a little bit of uniqueness in the touristy places I go, but I didn't find this shop to be too exciting. 

When we walked past this shop on my first trip to the piers, I saw that it was super crowded. Both at the downstairs and upstairs location. Although I don't mind crowds, I do mind rude people. And tourists tend to be rude in general. But, I thought I'd brave the hordes and venture in to get the ice cream I was craving. Right before the doors to the upstairs entrance, there was a basic menu. And OMG, the prices were a little steep. Not wanting anything fancy anyway, I opted for just a sugar cone and a scoop of ice cream. 

Upon entrance, we were greeted by some employees. They offered a free sample for one of their limited edition chocolates. It was a dark chocolate with some blueberry filling inside. While it tasted fine, it wasn't my cup of tea. So, I ate a bite and gave the rest to my friend. While waiting in line, I had already chosen the ice cream scoop I wanted, the black cherry vanilla. When I got to the register, I was super disheartened to hear that they had run out of that for the day. While this does happen to every busy business, I was still a little bit disappointed. In the end, I just opted to get a cookie dough scoop. 

As it came time for my ice cream to be put out, I watched in amusement as the servers were scooping my ice cream onto the cone. The guy literally broke 3 cones trying to put a massive scoop on the cone. This was pretty pleasing because I knew that I was at least getting a giant scoop. I felt at least a little bit relieved that my money went a little further than usual on this scoop. 

While the scoop tasted fine and like a usual scoop of cookie dough, it wasn't that exciting. The ice cream tastes like any other ice cream.
