Their flavors weren't spectacular in the least (in general). And this place is pretty average. If you do go, I recommend going through the service at the top floor. The downstairs is really busy compared to the upper floor. And be expected to pay high prices for ice cream you could literally get anywhere else, in my opinion.
author: Stephanie N.

description: Very fun and unique. It is the original Ghiradelli chocolate factory and I really loved how they had the chocolate machines still going! You can order sundaes and buy chocolate there. It is very touristy but also something you have to do.
author: Amanda W.

description:
I dated a guy for a bit in high school/college, and while that joke of a relationship crashed and burned horribly, I can't ever regret it because he brought me here on our first real date.   I had lived in SF my whole life, but it took that guy for me to have my first Ghirardelli experience. Can I just say, it was absolutely worth the disaster year or two that followed!

15 years later, I am still a regular.  The dark chocolate masterpieces are the absolute best, but you can't go wrong with the old fashioned hot fudge sundae.  Try it - you won't regret anything either :)
author: Noelle F.

description:
A must every time in SanFran!
Great for a couple, family event or just a great place to have ice cream...
author: Ruy M.

description:
I came with my friends on a Monday night in July. It was extremely crowded when we arrived, and after waiting in line for some time I got to the counter to order. I was told they were out of glassware and my super expensive sundae would come in a to go cup. Then, after paying $16 for my specialty "Summer of Love" sundae that was supposed to come with cheap sunglasses and a flower headband, the cashier handed me two headbands and said they were out of sunglasses. No apology. Then we proceeded to wait for more than 45 minutes for our sundaes. I say "more than" because it has been that long, we have no ice cream, and we are still waiting. 
This place needs a sign at the front of the store indicating the extended wait. Or something. Anything.  This is way too expensive for such a terrible experience.
author: Amy D.

description:
When in the are, especially towing always hungry teens, one must visit the Ghirardelli parlor to experience on of their massive sundaes.  First 'treat' is being greeted by a spunky youngster handing our Ghirardellia chocolates to get your chocolate pump primed.  

We dove into a banana split - we had a partially full tank from our recent dinner at Roam Artisan burger, so we thought it important to pace ourselves.   Ample size, the banana split lasted about (or it seemed) 2 minutes before all but the cherry stem and plastic bowl remained.  I guess we liked it!
author: Patrick K.

description: Waited around 15 min and ordered the waffle cone with one scoop of their espresso chip ice cream. Tummy was happy.
author: Christina S.

description: Had to get the Mint Bliss sundae to share - make sure you check in on Yelp! for $1 off any sundae. It was decadent. They use one scoop of chocolate and a second scoop of mint chip, and layering Ghirardelli hot fudge under and over each layer of ice cream. When I saw them making it I thought, oh that is just way too lusciously decadent to eat! It will be too sweet! And then I promptly scarfed it. The hot fudge is insane with the mint chip ice cream, so creamy and rich, you could eat one of these things for lunch. Definitely called "Mint Bliss" for good reason! If you love mint everything, like I do, definitely try this sundae while you're visiting Ghirardelli Square - you will be in chocolate comatose heaven, just like I was!
author: Elizabeth V.

description: Service with an eye roll and an attitude when they get your order wrong. Horribly expensive. Was expecting more from "world greatest chocolate" store. The only person that was courteous was the woman at the front door passing out free chocolates.
author: Anna M.

description:
How could you ever go wrong with Ghirardelli!?

Came here twice in two weeks. Both times were amazing. 

The Lands End sundae was pretty damn good but the Chrissy Field was the MVP!  

The place was busy but the service didn't take a hit. Sundaes came out quicker than expected and the establishment was clean. 

I will be back.
author: Terrance H.

description: Total tourist trap. The ice cream shop is exactly  the same as all the rest. Subpar quality on the sundaes. Not very flavorful at all. My sundae was almost completely melted when it was brought out. The tiny brownie (if you could call it that) was so dense that I could not get a chunk off of it without splashing melted ice cream all over. I thought seriously about sending it back and making them do it over, but why wait another 15 minutes, so my family can watch me eat after they are done? Wasted money.
author: Joshua P.

description:
One word Chocolate. I am not talking about just any kind
of chocolate this is The Ghirardelli Chocolate. This place is the birth place of the Ghirardelli Chocolate. You can only have chocolates, deserts and coffees. When you enter inside they have kept the original look of the please as it use to to be when they opened. A lot of the original big rosters for roasting the beans and mixers and all. They don't use them anymore but you can see how they use to do things in the olden days and learn a little bit of history as well. The location of this places is just amazing not only you can visit this place but can also have a great view of the ocean and pears and the market place. It is a beautiful tourist spot. Must visit place if you are in the area and who doesn't like Chocolate.
author: Rahul R.

description:
Need a sweet treat after walking around fisherman's wharf? This is the place to be! 
Check in on yelp to get $1 off any sundae! Cable car tickets and other city attractions also offer a 10% coupon. 
Don't forget to explore the rest of Ghirardelli square after you eat. Many cool shops to see. 
I ordered the mint bliss sundae and shared it with 2 other people. It is huge! Every menu item looked amazing too.  All of the sundaes are around $10 and big enough to share.
author: Olwen C.

description:
I'm going full blown Tourist Mode now.  I got some Rocky Road ice cream, which was very good.  I like Ghirardelli chocolate, so we picked up some squares in the shop next to the "factory".  It was a mob scene, very chaotic, but the sweets are delicious.  The prices are very high.  Parking is very challenging.  

Good luck, Mr. Phelps, if you choose to accept the Mission.
author: Jerry H.

description: I visited this place with my friends, as Ghirardelli square is one of the tourist spots were any first time visitor to SFO would go for. This place was super busy on a weekend so we stood for some time in a long line. No doubt, they have excellent ice creams and sundaes, but the place is pricey.  However, I had a very good time here with friends so would visit again!
author: Ramya S.

description: Second day at Ghirardelli for ice cream! Had the Treasure island yesterday and having the Golden Gate today. Can't get enough chocolate and fudge!
author: Andy L.

description:
I can dig this place- as long as I have enough grub in my debit card and there aren't too many people around!

The Original Ghiradelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop is one of the biggest tourist traps anyone can stumble upon. There's often a line out the door just to order one of the infamous hot fudge ice cream sundae or hot chocolates. Not to mention, exploring their gift shop to sample some free chocolates is a plus too.

The only reason why I like this place is because of their hot fudge sundaes. Despite the sundae price being on top of the roof, the warm hot fudge with vanilla ice cream, nuts, and a cherry on top is a way to end the night at San Francisco. On the other hand, Yelpers get a dollar off the sundaes which is a plus! 

The only downfall about this place is the amount of tourists checking this place out. The indoor seating just to enjoy the hot fudge sundae can make one feel extremely overwhelmed or claustrophobic. If I were you, I would enjoy my sundae outside of the shop by sitting on one of those resting benches or perhaps indulge your sundae in the comfort of your own car.

As for buying Ghiradelli novelties, I suggest stopping by your local Safeway or some grocery store that has the chocolate squares in stock. The price they sell just for those chocolate squares are ridiculous!
author: Aubrey D.

description: If you have to go it is fine.  The world famous Sunday is good.  Just so over priced.  $13+ for one Sunday is a lot even in San Francisco.  Go get a free piece of chocolate in the shop
author: Kyle L.

description:
It was my 30th Birthday and I had just arrived in San Francisco that evening after an airy salt-water drive up the coastal highway from Big Sur.  A fan of sweets of any kind... I was looking for something to mark the occasion.  And boy!  Did the original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop fit that bill!

Let me start off by saying... I LOVE ice cream.  I also LOVE chocolate.  So how can you really go wrong with this place.  If this was a review of just the consumables... this place would be hands-down, five stars.  I ordered a 2 scoop cup of ice cream (1 scoop of Ghirardelli chocolate and another of cookies & cream) topped with caramel and whipped cream.  The dark chocolate fudge topping was calling to me but... I decided to draw the line just before going there.  There is nothing bad I can say about my dessert, it was fantastic.

As an obvious tourist attraction, this place does really well to keep the long lines moving.  Paper menus are passed out to those waiting in line so you can order right away when you approach one of the several cashiers inside.  You can either get it to eat there or to go.  I opted to take it with me as it was clear there were already a number of people crammed into the small seating section found inside.  I was directed where to pick up my order then tried desperately to find a place to stand to wait.  Each time I found somewhere to stand that was out of the way of the hustle and bustle of the staff moving around inside, I was told that I couldn't be there and had to move again.  There is just really no space for those to wait who are taking their orders to go.  

There is an interesting moving display inside that walks you through the chocolate making process.  It was pretty neat to check that out.  Try to take your time soaking in the interior of this place with its original tile floors, etc.  With the craziness of the atmosphere inside, it is easy to lose touch with the history its walls exude.

In my opinion... a must stop if visiting San Francisco.
author: Ashley P.

description: Overpriced and the place was a mess. We couldn't find a clean table. We had to bus the table ourselves and the table was sticky...the best part is the hot fudge and the caramel topping. The ice cream is just so so. So save yourself the trouble and buy the topping and go to Salt and Straw for amazing ice cream and make your own sundaes.
author: Anna H.

description: Each time I visit the piers I like to stop at Ghirardelli square and have a Sunday. The chocolate is delicious and compliments Ice cream exquisitely. More than just the sweets, though, I enjoy the establishment itself, which feels like a classic ice cream parlor as well as a chocolate factory. The area that serves as a tour of how the chocolate is prepared, with functional machinery, is a nice touch. Can't recommend it enough!
author: Sean A.

description:
The biggest and most decadent ice cream sundae I've ever had. 

When we got here, there was a huge line streaming out from the front (on a Monday afternoon!), but it moved pretty quickly and we only waited about 10-15 minutes. Each sundae costs $10--which is pretty ridiculous--but I couldn't pass up the opportunity to try what they advertise as world famous ice cream. I ordered the Mint Bliss sundae and the boyfriend ordered a Golden Gate Banana Split.  The ordering process was really smooth, and you get $1 off per sundae if you check in to Yelp! Then we went to hunt for a table, which took a while. I'd recommend to order to-go and sit outside if the weather is nice since it's so crowded inside. 

My mint bliss sundae was hella good. It came with a huge scoop of chocolate ice cream, a huge scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream, hot chocolate fudge, whipped cream, and a dark chocolate Ghirardelli square on top. I dug in right away. The ice cream was rich and delicious, and the chocolate fudge was divine. It was so rich and smooth that it pretty much tasted like chocolate ganache. I tried a small bite of my boyfriend's banana split, and it was really good as well. Unfortunately, I couldn't finish my sundae because it was just way too much. I really wish they offered half-sizes..
author: Stacy Y.

description: Ordered ice cream and a chocolate chip cookie and they both tasted amazing. I would definitely come again if I was in the area!!
author: Ana C.

description:
It was cool, you order at a register and they give you a tall stand with a number on it. You sit wherever you want and when your order is ready they bring it to you.

 I ordered the brownie sundae. The brownie was warm with a crisp outside and a very smooth and rich inside. The vanilla ice cream was delicious and complimented the brownie very well. It was a great brownie-to-ice cream ratio. Not too much brownie so you were left dry. And enough ice cream so you can enough it was the fudge and then some.The fudge was  amazing, especially when some of the ice cream has melted.

Overall great experience. Beautiful outside with a water fountain. Very spacious and clean. The employees were friendly, and I enjoy seeing people genuinely happy to work together.
author: Eduardo M.

description:
I am a man who loves chocolate.  I've loved chocolate and have been eating chocolate as my dessert of choice since I was...really young or something.  Basically, I have eaten a lot of chocolate in my day.  Ghirardelli's signature sundae did not disappoint.  Side note:  check-in ahead of time for the $1 off Yelp coupon.  I did not do this.  Amateur mistake, and I had to ugh...save my coupon for later.  The worst.  

Anyway, of course I switched my sundae from vanilla to chocolate.  No brainer.  Almonds on the side because they remind me of healthiness.   Then I dove into two scoops of excellent milk chocolate with lakes of hot chocolate on the sides which kind of morphed into the melted ice cream for extreme bites of pure sugar.  The whipped cream was of sufficient substance so held firm deep into the sundae.  As opposed to cheap whipped cream which falls apart and then leaves behind that trail of melted white stuff.  

It was the stuff dreams are made of.  And when I had eaten almost every bite my greedy spoon could reach, I drank the dregs like a champ. It was wonderful.  

Other noteworthy things about the shop.  Nice atmosphere with a high-end old time feel.  They have a few stools at their sundae bar where you can watch these baristas at work.  Plenty of seats with great views of the bay.

Staff was friendly.  Someone gave me a piece of chocolate when I walked in.  There is nothing else to say.  I liked it a chocolot.  If you cannot be happy here, you belong on Alcatraz.
author: Chris B.

description: Excellent Black Forest Sunday and Brownie Sunday. Place was packs but the staff kept the tables clean. It took no time to get our Sunday's.
author: Phil B.

description:
The place offers sit-down or to-go and has a fairly large dining area so there's usually not a wait. The Hot Fudge Sundae is really good, however seemed a bit over priced ($13). The chocolate is what makes it great (and expensive), so if you're not a chocolate snob and just want something sweet, there are lots of other cheap options close by.

Overall really great taste and quick service, would visit again!
author: Trevor P.

description: Overpriced ice cream sundaes, but I had to do my touristy thing and get the "world famous" hot fudge sundae. You can get the exact same thing with MUCH less of a wait for tables at the location further inside Ghiradelli Square, though this one does have the little display that shows you how chocolate is made.
author: Ling X.

description:
The smell! Oh good Lord the smell! Pure heaven!!!
There is something about that rich, smooth, velvety smell of chocolate!
My daughter put together a nice bag of 1 oz. squares. 
The ice cream sundaes looked incredible. Unfortunately the line was out the door and wrapping around the building! 
My wife and daughter went back the next day around noon. They got a great parking spot and were seated and served immediately. I guess the night before was just bad timing. 
They said that the ice cream sundaes were indeed incredibly delicious. I'm definitely jealous that I wasn't with them.
author: Robert M.

description: No trip to San Francisco would be complete without a visit to Ghirardelli Square. Our ice cream sundae was so good that we even forgot to take a picture of it! Yes it's a bit pricey, and too much to eat (so full!) but Ghirardelli is my favorite chocolate. The hot fudge is a must try! And I'm sure we walked off the calories trudging up the San Francisco Hills!
author: Carol R.

description:
Another great spot to bring visitors from out of town.

The line is always long but moves quite fast. The bathroom is outside the building. They also have a store and they give out free chocolate square samples. Their sundae with brownie is really indulgent. $1 off when you check-in on Yelp so don't forget to check-in! You can see the machinery for chocolate making inside by the walls.

Also, don't forget to checkout the steps and picnic lawn in front of the square. The view of the water is breathtaking :)
author: Norases V.

description:
We figured there must be a good reason why people stand in line to get in......

After a 15 min wait on a Sunday night, we ordered one $13 Hot Fudge Sundae. Then scouted out a dirty table to use.  The wait was another 15 or 20 mins.  The Manager came around with some free sample chocolates and apologized for the wait.

The Ice Cream itself was of normal size, but the amount of Hot Fudge was pretty frugal.  Nothing here exceeded any expectations given the price. If you show up with a family of 4- figure on $50+
author: Matt S.

description:
Lots of steps in this mall!

We tried the Ocean Beach (salted caramel and chocolate fudge).  It was tasty and the line went fairly quickly.  

Don't forget to pick up a free sample from the chocolate gift shop!
author: Carol N.

description: This is the famous Ghirardelli right at the historical Ghirardelli Square. Their ice cream is pretty good. As for chocolate, try the ones with sea salt!
author: Merve A.

description:
Dude. 


That's all you'll be able to say since everything is amazingly delicious and unreal.
author: Catadorah C.

description: Don't trust the scale in the make-your-own section. It weighs half of the scales at checkout, which means you pay double what you expect to pay. For a business that sells product by the pound, they aren't very considerate of the clients.
author: Ann D.

description: I LOVED the fudge sundae we tried. It was truly huge, so I'm glad my mom was willing to split it with me. The fudge on the ice cream was some of the best I have ever had. The vanilla ice cream was also wonderful. I didn't like how crowded the store was though. Because of the crowd it was hard to find a seat and it took a little while for our sundae to get to us. Other than that, I highly recommend trying!!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
This place is really silly. I love it. Every time you go in, you get this ridiculously giant piece of chocolate for free.

But they are smart, they know what they're doing. Nobody goes expecting to buy chocolate, everybody leaves buying chocolate.

Very shortly after entering, you put that piece of chocolate in your mouth and feel like you got the deal of a lifetime. In a short period, the chocolate begins to melt in your mouth, and it's Goodwood. You start looking around...and there's a lot of chocolate. And it all looks Gooooood.

The chocolate at this point, is on its last leg as it continues to melt in your mouth. Can you notice that the little squares of chocolate are not that much, in fact of the large candy bars are not that much. Maybe will just grab a couple. 

 And you're thinking how much could these tiny little guys be? So you grab a couple. Then he grabbed three. And if you are with a friend they also grab three. And maybe while you're in line you also grab a big candy bar.

This place is like a snowball mouse trap. Where the further down the rabbit hole you get, the more chocolate you leave with.

This might be the smartest business plan I've ever seen. Hardly anybody ever, ever goes in expecting to buy chocolate. But everybody ends up buying chocolate. All because they give away a little piece of squares for free. And as the person walks through the store, the chocolate melts in their mouth. Reminding them chocolate is delicious. 

The only reason my girlfriend and I went into the chocolate shop, was to get a free piece of chocolate. But we end of leaving buying like eight or ten dollars worth of chocolate! How did that happen!

Enjoy your free piece of chocolate. Suckers! Oh my god it's so good, I'm eating one right now!
author: Dave K.

description:
They have an excellent chocolate. No doubt.
But don't let that full you, and buy ice cream. Not worth it
author: Clarita C.

description: Good place to just chill and have awesome Ghirardelli ice cream shakes. It's right inside the factory's plaza. The staff is friendly and give out samples on regular basis. It doesn't become too crowded although the noise level sometime becomes too loud. And if you are lucky enough, you can get a window seat which give a good view of the SF ocean.
author: Saumya A.

description: We went on a Saturday night, so we naturally expected a long wait. However, the line moved reasonably quickly and once we ordered our dessert was made reasonably quickly as well. We got the Lands End which is vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, caramel, brownies, whipped cream & a cherry. The brownies were super fudge-y which was great. However, it cost us $16! I would recommend going once for the experience, but save your money and stick to a simple scoop or something. It was a good dessert, but not $16 good for sure.
author: Hannah K.

description:
The greeter, Gloria, could not have been nicer, and she loved our doggie Coco so much, that she asked to take a photo. The chocolate and ice cream here is terrific and I'm not just saying that because we live walking distance  and love to stop by, it truly is. This place is a treasure and we are so glad that it's a part of the neighborhood and San Francisco history.
It always feels like you've won the Golden Ticket when you walk in this place!
author: Taz B.

description: Always delicious with reasonably speedy service delivered amidst crowds of anxious patrons.   At this location, the view of the chocolate making process is beautiful to watch while you wait.  Highly recommended and close to the Wharf!
author: Peter S.

description: One of the best desserts I have had in quite a while! My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and this was #1 on my to-do list. The place was packed, but there was more than enough tables to accommodate those who wished to dine inside. I ordered mint chocolate chip ice cream with Ghirardelli milk chocolate fudge and a warm chocolate chip cookie on the side. To my surprise it was served to in a large glass goblet which helped keep it cold as I was eating. After one bite I was in love. My boyfriend ordered the Treasure Island, a warm brownie sundae, and he too did not leave any leftovers. The only downside was the price - we paid $26 for those two desserts. However, it was worth every penny and I will certainly be back the next time I am in San Fran.
author: Briana B.

description: Very nice ambiance we got going here. Same exact menu as the one at Westfield but the atmosphere in this place is just amazing! Love the Crissy Field - I love the cookies and cream and vanilla ice cream with cookie dough bits!
author: Emilio C.

description: If you are looking for anything from chocolate bars, ice cream sundaes, or wonderful non sugary souvenirs, Ghiradelli is a fun place to visit, which is near Fisherman's Wharf.  You get a $1 off for their ice cream sundaes for checking into Yelp.  While you are waiting for your purchase, you can see the process of making chocolate by the various phases.  This is definitely one of my favorite stops in San Francisco.
author: Vijay R.

description: We weren't happy with the sundae we ordered so Gilvan made us a new one even though we didn't want him to but he did anyways. It was really nice of him. He even gave us 2 free lattes. Great management!
author: Hana T.

description: This place is a classic must visit when you come to SF. The whole square smells like warm melted chocolate. We decided to come when it was a very busy presidents weekend, so the lines were a bit longer than normal. The place was kinda insane, so we didn't get to sit down, and they forgot my friends order. But the ice cream is tasty and you can see how they make chocolate!
author: Larissa S.

description: Blazing fast wait times and next to instant for your order to be delivered after ordering. They churn out so many customers that even during the peak times finding a seat will be easy.
author: Eric R.

description:
This is a fun place to bring friends and get a quick treat before heading back out to tour fisherman's wharf. I ordered the classic sundae and the chocolate was heavenly. Better eat it fast though! The ice cream sits atop warm fudge and will melt quickly. 
You can also see the machines make the chocolate which contributes to the wonderful sweet smell throughout the store! (Just don't stick your hand in our you'll end up possibly worse that that kid in Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory) Getting this sundae was literally the cherry on top. 
It was a little difficult to navigate through the store and find a table to sit at because it was packed! This is definitely a popular spot.
author: R C.

description: Lines are insane!!! Wanted to wait to order upstairs (wasn't open yet) but the manager said the line downstairs will take only 5 to 8 mins. Liar =p. While I stayed upstairs to save seats, friends went down and ordered... I waited about half an hour!!! Apparently, shortly after they went down, the upstairs cashier opened up -_-. Anyway. It was my own damn fault for insisting on coming to the original shop. Drinks were fab, but the wait kind of ruined the whole experience. I could have gotten the same drink at the Westfield in Union Square. Still had fun though :)
author: Cindy J.

description:
I love getting ice cream from this place! A must go to place when visiting San Fran.

Pros:
Delicious Chocolate
Friendly Staff
Beautiful Scenery

Cons:
Long lines
Long Wait Time
Dirty Tables / Lack of Tables
Short Validation
Price 

I was disappointed with how long they validate for parking. We ended up paying $5 or $6 extra for parking because of the time it took them to give us our ice cream and the time it took us to actually eat it. Each ice cream is about $10 and you have to spend over $20 to get validation. So I paid almost $30 for two sundaes.... 

Another thing I didn't like was how a cashier allowed a huge group to cut in front of everyone just to serve them. My husband and I thought he was opening another line, but he was actually just serving them, and he told us we had to get back in line. I was furious and demanded he serve us after making us wait so long and did not clearly say what he was doing. Fortunately he took our order.

I would love to give this place a higher rating because of how great the desserts are, but there are some serious flaws with their service.
author: Sonia T.

description: I had the world famous hot fudge sundae and my wife had the banana split! Yummy!!! What a great place to have dessert.
author: Petey C.

description: Ordered the world famous sundae. Over hyped. Ordinary taste, nothing great. Over all a pleasant experience if you want to enjoy ghiradelli chocolates.
author: Anup B.

description: Thank you to Kelah and Jenaline for the best customer services. You sure made my trip up here in San Francisco so sweet
author: Lesley C.

description: Another place I've been too many times before but one that never fails to please. We got the hot fudge sundae this time!
author: Will A.

description:
A well-known touristy spot in San Francisco. I'm biased since I'm not a big ice cream fan, but people love this place. Know what you want when you get to the cashier - she means business and she is not there for recommendations, she's there to take your cash. There are a million menus posted, look around and be prepared. I went with the Treasure Island. It's all a variation on the following: ice cream and chocolate, it's not rocket science. It's a jovial place but it's hard to find a spot to sit. People love to spread out. You may have to bus your own table since there aren't a lot of servers or bussers. The whole thing was super tasty but about 4 bites in, I was pretty done. They are big enough to share. 
We had a good time taking in the SF nightlife and the good time vibe there. The square is pretty, but there are a lot of tourists. We were right by a cable car stop (speaking of tourists), so we took it. The lines are long, so get ready. Have cash in hand. 
Another fun "must do" in San Francisco.
author: Janet C.

description:
Best ice cream and hot fudge in the city! I have been visiting Ghirardelli since I was little and when they only had 1 location. Now, you can find 4 locations in Ghirardelli square. The original location which is easier to find and see from the main road is usually busy with tourists so expect long lines and unavailable tables. I would definitely recommend walking inside ghirardelli square towards the back to their other location which is a lot bigger and offers more selections of chocolate and gift baskets. 

If it is your first time here, I would definitely recommend the original hot fudge sundae. What makes Ghirardelli so good is the combination of the not too sweet vanilla ice cream with their rich dark hot chocolate fudge. Best thing ever.
author: Arda S.

description:
Came here since we were walking around Ghirardelli Square. I have never bought anything at Ghirardelli Square but my GF and I were craving something sweet. Of course, we had to try this place. 

Line out the door suggested this was a either a really bomb and legit spot or tourist trap. We got their World Famous Sundae on a Waffle Cone. We were told the waffle cone was freshly made to order so I was excited. When the Sundae came, the first thing I noticed was all the freaking whip cream it came with. Probably half the sundae was whip cream!! Moving on... the waffle cone wasn't even freshly made! It was rock hard covered in chocolate... Pretty disappointing. 

Definitely a tourist trap.
author: Juan F.

description: Every Time I'm in San Francisco i have to go get my cup of hot chocolate! You don't know hot chocolate and you absolutely cannot say you have had the best until your try it here! I get the sea salted Carmel hot chocolate and it comes with a piece of dark chocolate on a plate. I love to put the chocolate inside my hot chocolate! No matter how stuffed I am I somehow manage to down this cup of love!
author: Nessa C.

description: Horrid customer service. Over priced ice cream sundaes for $12 each. Not worth your time.
author: Kay R.

description:
Midnight reverie: delicious. Cones are probably more worth than the cups, since they tend to be very generous with portions. Cones = 1/2 price of cups. 

Place itself: a touristic mess. 

Suggestion: go to the other locations to get the same stuff, without the hassle of having to deal with thousands of obnoxious tourists.
author: Giacomo C.

description: Of course this place gets 5 stars. Always great. Ice cream is the best. You must stop by and give it a try if you are in San Francisco!  I am a traditional Hot Fudge Sundae person.  It can get very busy so leave yourself sometime to stand in line. You will get a free piece of chocolate when you enter!
author: Micah B.

description:
How could you not like this place! Everything is so yummy! Brought the kids here for the first time and it was a huge hit! Duh! 

Lines Re long but it goes by so fast! Seating is limited but it somehow always works out!
author: Hatifa E.

description: Great place very busy several different locations where you can have an ice cream sundae.  Little pricey for an ice cream sundae but what do you expect it's very good excellent  ice cream sundaeand also they do have different stores were you can purchase the Jeera deli chocolate bars and small square of chocolate candy or pretty expensive price if you don't mind paying you can
author: R B.

description:
First of all the quick service with all those customers was amazing. Secondly, the Nob Hill Chill was worth every extra pound I came home with. I love thick milkshakes and I love sundaes and I love fudge. Somebody invented this for me!! It came and it was big. Thought I wouldn't finish it.
WRONG! I even scraped the hot fudge off the sides with my spoon. SO HEAVENLY!!!
author: Talby G.

description:
Not sure if this Yelp one is for both of the shops because I know there is one by the Main Street and a smaller one deeper inside the plaza. This review is for the smaller shop.

Pros:
- When my BF and I came into the shop one of the lady greeted us and told us about the special going on and gave us a small caramel chocolate sample! It was super delicious!
- You order whatever food you want at the cashier and then they bring it out to you which I like! I hate having to wait for someone to take your order, especially at a populated area so ordering at the front was great.
- I'm not sure what day I went here, but I came during night time (maybe 9-10pm) and it was surprisingly not crowded and felt more "romantic" if you're going on a date or something. The other shop was very crowded.
- Got our hot salted caramel chocolate (or whatever it was) pretty quick

Cons:
- Kind of weird to list it as a con, but the hot chocolate we got was WAY too rich for my taste. It was really thick and sweet and it literally made my throat itchy as heck (because it was so rich with chocolate and heavy milk or something) It really felt like you're drinking melted chocolate like the person melted pure chocolate and gave it to you lol

Overall:
Great place to visit when you're visiting SF and around the area. I wished I bought some chocolate squares that was on sale ;(
author: Vonnie T.

description:
What else can be said about this timeless San Francisco classic? Ghirardelli chocolate store and cafe are a must whenever I come into the city. Between the free chocolate sample you receive at the door to the store or the fragrant aromas that bathe you when you're approaching Ghirardelli square - a must for every local and tourist alike. 

The prices are a little steep but it's Ghirardelli ... Worth every cent. I personally love their indulgent beverages: from their classic hot cocoa to their coffee drinks, you feel like you're sipping heaven. 

Crowded in the summer, I love coming to Ghirardelli in the "off season" or on an off day. My boyfriend and I came by Ghirardelli yesterday when it was pouring rain and the cafe had plenty of open seats for us to enjoy our hot cocoa. Fast, friendly service, Ghirardelli knows chocolate and knows the way to this girls heart.
author: Courtney P.

description: One of my fav places to visit in SF. I love the smell of chocolate and the ice cream is delicious.
author: Kristal G.

description: This place is crowded!  It's a tourist attraction so it's hard to not feel like one when you're squeezed in there.  I had the butterscotch sundae.  It was a sundae...what else is there to say?  I've had better...
author: Kim Y.

description:
You know the drill.

I scream. You scream. We all scream for? ICE CREAM!

On those rare, beautiful, sweltering HAWT summer days (daze)in SF, I'd rather be cocktailing. But not when it's fleet week Sunday, the Blue Angels are in town AND I'm at Ghirardelli Square. 

Boom.

I knew I wasn't going to finish three scoops of espresso ice cream topped with fresh whipped cream, hot fudge and a chocolate square. But darn it! sometimes you just gotta MAN up and try. (I failed. I didn't even make it halfway) He didn't have much luck either, but sure enjoyed his Mint Bliss. 

Sit outside in the square, it's a great feeling to be surrounded by these brick buildings that have been around for decades. It's a touristy treat that sure can't be beat. ;-)
author: Janice C.

description:
Nice place 
I'm not a chocolate fan but I had to visit 
This place is really cute I got the brownie sundae and shared because the size is sharable . 
We actually didn't finish it . 
The place is very family oriented. 
Also it was beautiful because we walked around the whole little village the beautiful Christmas tree & all. 

Prices vary 
$7-18 ruffly for ice cream 
Candy by the pound is $29 if I can recall don't mark my words but ruffly
author: Nicki S.

description:
The place is expensive but it's well worth it. I went late at night so it was not busy and there were not many tourists. During the day, it would've been packed. 

I had the brownie sundae and it was amazing. I love desserts and ghirardelli always satisfies my sweet tooth. If you like chocolate, ice cream, sweets, etc, this is the place for you. They give free samples as you walk in the door.
author: Stephen W.

description: My boyfriend and I took a spontaneous trip to Ghirardelli square after walking Fishermans wharf. The distance is far but it is quite an adventure. As you know, this is a tourist spot in San Francisco, so expect a long line out the door of their location. It gets busy but they take orders extremely fast. The hard part is finding a place to sit. I believe I walked up a few stairs into a cramp dining room. My boyfriend and I got lucky enough to find a seat next to random people but we got served quickly. We enjoyed our banana split.
author: Sheryl H.

description:
This shop is located at the entrance of square and is also full of Ghirardelli Chocolate everywhere... staff smiling and handing out free chocolates... AWESOME!!!

Lets get down to logistics... the place gets crowded as its not just a chocolate shop but also and there is an ice cream shop at the back. Both area a bit pricey but worth it as quality and heavenly chocolate is to die for. The Shop itself is tiny and could get to crowded to move around and there is constant rush of people in and out.

I would recommend to go to the market place inside as they have the same stuff and are bigger. They have nice seating inside but you can also sit outside. But as this shop comes first everyone tend to go here first.
author: Bilal S.

description:
This is one of my favorites places in sf but there can be a long line here.  
I love the brownie ice cream Sunday here and all the toppings.  The chocolate mint ice cream is so yummy yum yum. 
The waffle cone is yummy too.  It is worth the wait and tables will open up.
author: Toma C.

description:
Been to Ghirardelli Square in San Francisco a few times. They have some really good ice cream - I'm especially a big fan of their sundaes and root beer floats. However, the price is expensive, much more expensive than other ice cream places in SF. They have a chocolate shop as well which sells a variety of different types of chocolate. Again, very expensive.

The location is OK. There is a good view of the pier and of the bay. But it's a bit hard to get there from public transit.
author: Alvin W.

description: If you are looking for decadent ice cream and chocolate based desserts, this is the place!  The prices may seem high but the portion and taste more then make up for it.  This spot has two separate places to get your chocolate fix!  The main one is the manufactory which has examples of the chocolate processing machines.  That one always seems to be crowded.  If you are a large group, definitely consider going to the other spot.  It's newer and more modern, and has a lot more space to find a spot to hang out and partake of the decadence.  This is also a retail store so you can take home fine examples of their offerings!
author: Gene D.

description:
Ghirardelli Square has A LOT of Ice Cream & Chocolate Shops in SF. There's the tiny one near the Marina. There is the big one up the stairs with the view of the Bay. There is the shop near Union Square.

However, if you are a tourist pressed for time trying to see all of SF in a day and you already walked by the Marina to enjoy that view... then come immediately to this one. While they no longer hold tours of the Ghirardelli Factory, they still have displays here of the chocolate making equipment (as shown in my photos). Might not be as big as seeing the actual factory, but it's actually really neat to see the process of making the chocolate... and who doesn't like watching pure chocolate get mixed in a giant vat? It's literally food porn for chocolate lovers.

While you're admiring chocolate being stirred, I would highly suggest ordering something from their dessert menu! Don't think "Oh I could just buy this from a Baskin Robbins for cheaper" - DO IT FOR THE EXPERIENCE! I haven't tried their sundaes, but their chocolate drinks are amazing. They literally take their chocolate, melt it down, and use it in your drink.

I've had the chocolate milkshake and hot chocolates, which is great for walking around SF. It's thick, creamy and chocolate-y. If the sweetness of milk chocolate bothers you after awhile, I would highly suggest asking for dark chocolate - they have ability to accommodate such requests at this shop. Dark chocolate won't have that sickening sweetness, and you'll appreciate more of the natural chocolate flavor.

As for buying chocolate... if you're an out-of-towner, it's worth coming here because you can individually select flavors of the chocolate squares for gifts. There are some unique ones that you don't see out in the stores. Also check out the bars, since there are some I don't normally see in stores like Mango.

But for those of us local to the Bay Area, there are Ghirardelli outlets that have the same selection of chocolate for 65% off (the Great Mall in Milpitas has a location). However, I gave this location 5 stars for the shop itself - the equipment, desserts, and things to see are what make this location a great tourist stop.

So if you're a chocolate lover, worth checking this shop out.
author: Alyanna C.

description: The aesthetics of this place is on point! Many tables to eat and enjoy your treat and the service is good. A little pricey, but it's quality chocolate! Hot fudge sundae was the favorite. Portions are pretty big, can definitely share between two of it three people, depending on how big of ice cream lover you are! Have to go here. Treat yourself.
author: Anna Z.

description:
On my first-ever trip to SF, I had to make a stop at Ghirardelli Square! We first entered through the chocolate shop entrance (there are a couple different ways to enter), where we were given a sample chocolate caramel square! After that, we made our way over to the main event, the Ice Cream Shop! Surprisingly, the line wasn't too long. You order and pay first. Then, find a table in the shop, place your number on the table, and a server will bring your dessert to you.

The Haight-Ashbury Very Berry Sundae - Strawberry cheesecake ice cream topped with sliced strawberries, under a layer of vanilla ice cream with blueberry topping, whipped cream, chocolate covered blueberries, and a chocolate-dipped waffle roll. Wow, talk about a sundae to satisfy your sweet tooth for the next few months! There was quite a large dollop of whipped cream on top, which was a little much considering the strawberry cheesecake ice cream was already quite rich.  They could have put less strawberry syrup because most of it was dripping out all over the cup, making the whole thing super messy and sticky! This huge, overflowing sundae was more than enough for two people.

Coming to Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop was fun to try and experience once, but once is probably good enough.
author: Lisa Y.

description: This is real life Willy Wonka in the Chocolate Factory ( but sadly not as good) This is the best location since it is the original but there are a few others if your looking just to grab a treat or some candy as gifts. This location as all the others gets a line !! We waited around 10 minutes because they are pretty fast and efficient and have a good method of getting you through ! The desserts are crazy here chocolate everything you can imagine and big !! They have a pretty price for them but defiantly worth it, it is good quality chocolate after all ! I got a mocha and it was very delicious and with soy milk ! So that's a plus for me being someone who can't have all that ice cream and dairy there are some dairy free options ! It is a cute little cafe with the big chocolate machines moving and the " soda jerk" looking staff is friendly and fun ! The store is pretty tiny and actually doesnt sell that much that's very different from any other location. It was a fun experience just to say I have done it , but I highly recommend for you dessert/ chocolate lovers !
author: Morgan M.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a child.  Great memories.  Such a treat every single time.  Ghirardelli is as much of a San Francisco treat as rice-a-roni.  Ha.  My family and I have a routine.

Go to the shop first.  Get your free sample chocolate.  Look around.  Buy an assortment bag of chocolate.  Head over to the ice cream area and order their signature sundae.

I don't think I've ever finished the sundae by myself.  It has always been shared between 2-3 people.  They use dreyer's ice cream which would be my only complaint, if I had to chime in.  I think they should be sticking to local products like Ben & Jerry's.  Anyhoo, layered in between the scoops of ice cream is their delicious fudge.  I love how the hot fudge hardens and how I need to scrape it off the glass.  Topped with whipped cream and a cherry, you're good to go. 

This is definitely a spot highly populated with tourists.  Don't worry though as there are lots of seats and they tend to work quickly.
author: Jen W.

description: So one night me and my friends decided to go to Ghirardelli to have some ice cream. The prices for the ice cream are pretty decent and the ice cream is great. I really enjoyed every bit of it. It was a great experience and overall there wasn't anything to complain about. The line moves very quickly and we were served immediately.
author: Dean A.

description: The cherry chocolate coke float was delicious. For $7 bucks it better bee. Most items on their menu are $11.5 once you get past ritzness you can get back to enjoying the pleasing asthetics. Whats not to like. The staff are helpful and friendly. FREE samples.
author: Crystal P.

description: Even on a cold summer day, I just had to come get ice cream because my b/f loves ice cream. What better place than at Ghiradelli when you're the ultimate tourist? Got the crissy field to share with my sis and bf and it was the perfect amount. It came with vanilla in between 2 cookies and cream scoops with crushed cookies, whipped cream and chocolate bars. It was  pretty rich, but nonetheless delicious! Taste great even on a cold day. Would definitely come back for my ice cream fix.
author: Stella Y.

description:
Some people say diamonds are a girl's best friend, but I don't know. Chocolate might be better. Is Ghiradelli touristy? You bet it is, but it is a fun experience. 
When you walk in, a greeter will offer you chocolate sample. If only that was how every business was - I would be in heaven!
Experience every flavor of chocolate and take some home for your friends in family... or just for you. 
Don't miss the ice cream show there, too! Their sundaes are GIANT - I would suggest sharing this with another person.
Eat your treats in the shop cafe or take them outside to their beautiful patio and watch boats cruise on the ocean and beachgoers splash in the water.
author: Kim K.

description:
Yes, it's a tourist trap.

Yes, it'll probably be crowded.

Yes, there are two shops, the original and the less crowded new shop.

Yes, this is more like a Disney experience than an authentic piece of real SF history.

Yes, the chocolate and the Sundaes are very good.

Yes, they are WAY over-priced.

Yes, the people are very friendly.

Yes, there's plenty of parking.

No, you can not tour the factory, you can only buy chocolate and other treats. Deal with it.

No, this is not a must see, there are better things to do in San Francisco - MUCH BETTER THINGS TO DO.

Yes, I live in the Bay area and am glad I took my kids there. HA!
author: David S.

description: I got disrespected by one of the employees here an older black gentlemen. He was busing tables and I received crude language from him just by standing in line for a sundae. I came to San Francisco for a family vacation and I spent money on this place because of all the reviews from here. what's the point of hyping up this place if the customer service doesn't live up to how good this place is.
author: Rebecca T.

description: My boyfriend and I tried their World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae. I am glad we shared it because it was a big portion size, very good. A little pricey $13 bucks with change but it's their original location. The place was packed. Seating was hard to get but we managed after 10 minutes or so. The lines are log so expect to wait for a least 30 minutes.
author: Mere R.

description: I love this place for their free chocolates and their sea salt caramel hot cocoa. It's for people with a sweet tooth!
author: Kate V.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for....Ghirardelli Hot Fudge Sundaes!!!!

This place is a must try if your in the area.  The waffle cones are freshly made if you want a chocolate waffle cone they are freshly dipped.  For first timers I recommend the world famous hot fudge Sundae. You cant go wrong.  Just thinking about it makes me want to go back, like right Now.

Last time I was there I ordered Strike it ritch which has butterscotch and I really enjoyed it, and I dont like butterscotch LOL.   I'm pretty confident now that anything I order will be just as good as any other item.

Ghirardelli has really improved the upstairs seating area, I remember when it was just a little room with a few seats, now it has a chocolate shop, booths, and a street entry.   Also there are now more cashiers so the line goes by really fast.  

The only down side is the seating area, during peak times available seating is non existent and other customers can and will stand at your table waiting for you to finish.  Other than that just GO to Ghirardelli. yeah.
author: Michael L.

description:
Such a long long line, given the other store at the same area was closed due to renovation. But as a dessert person, i always fight for the best sweets and this place came into mind.

We got the mint chocolate cup with pineapple topping, as well as the venilla latte, given we were already a bit full...The icecream was fantastic, yet venilla latte was way too sweet. I should have got the unsweetened version...

One thing i wanna highlight is still the waiting time. After you got your seat and ordered, it was still a long long wait. So make sure enough time is spared.
author: Elaine H.

description:
Normally I avoid tourist attractions, but I had to indulge especially since it's the Mother Earth of Chocolate! I have been coming here since I was a little kid and would take weekend getaways with my family & Ghirardelli was always on the list! How could you blame me? Best chocolate! Unfortunately since I overindulged in food earlier, my appetite was limited, but there's always room for chocolate! I had the Chocolate Milkshake and sometimes all you need is the perfect classic! 

Go to their shop first because they always give you a sample of the chocolate, your choice!

I also heard they have Ghirardelli at Giant's Stadium! I might have to go check that out!
author: Maddie M.

description:
Besides all the Ghirardelli's (top, lower levels) I haven't eaten anyplace else in Ghirardelli Square.  The building itself if very nice but it's sort of strange how the restrooms are all the way in a different part of the structure.  I would have thought that Ghiradelli's would have their own.  There are multiple places for Ghirardelli's in this place as well.  The top part which is a order and sit down place and the other level where they bring it down to you.  The one that is right across the street from the Marina park is yet another one.  

The location at the corner of North Point and Larkin is the one that is quicker because it's a walk up order which is what I'd prefer.  They still sell chocolate here as well in the small boxes and other special containers like the tins etc.
author: Lambert P.

description:
This is definitely a sweet stop for anyone visiting or living in SF.  Save room for dessert at their ice cream shop.  Try their signature classic sundae with dark hot fudge without the chocolate covered waffle bowl unless you don't mind getting your hands dirty as you indulge and dive into the decadence.

My favorite combo to get is dark chocolate, sea salt, and roasted almonds.  Whether it's a bag of small pieces or a slab to munch on, you'll be delighted by the rich. sweet and savory flavor with a crunchy texture.

The lines can get long, so try going during off-peak hours.  Service is friendly and fast, so hopefully that makes up for it.  Don't forget to check out the process and equipment on the side regarding the origin of the shop and how they make one o the yummiest and high-quality chocolates!
author: Jenny L.

description:
We split two sundaes between five people. The World Famous Sundae and the Treasure Island Sundae. Both were delicious but the fudge was a bit overwhelming. The brownie in the Treasure Island was so good. Perfect addition to a sundae. Too much whip cream for my taste, should've asked for less. Seating was a complete struggle, but we were able to find seats. 

Very nice ice cream parlor. I'd go again. Definitely recommend it for those with a sweet tooth.
author: Brandon L.

description: Is there anything better than Ghirardelli?  Seriously, I'm asking, because I've yet to find it.  Yes, it's a huge tourist attraction (trap). And yes it's overly packed.  And yes their service is sometimes slow because it's so packed.  But they always greet you with a smile and a chocolate sample and nothing really matters after you take your first bite.  Ice cream, cookies, brownies, or just their endless variety of chocolates, it's all good!
author: Denis S.

description:
I totally forgot to write about this place when I visited back in September!

Some of my friends and I were visiting SF for a trip around Labor Day and of course this was one of the stops we had! I almost didn't get a Sundae b/c it was so cold - but my friends told me I was crazy not to. Ha. They were so right. 

SO AMAZING. SO DELICIOUS. Best ice cream I've had. Just .. damn. Maybe b/c I LOVE ice cream, but ... just go. If you visit SF, I recommend this place. I would also recommend going at a warmer time haha. I literally ate my ice cream all layered up in clothing and walked outside. 

They have lots of other things but their Sundae is famous. 

Only thing is - it was super crowded and all the tables were full :( The service was kind of slow, but hey, they're busy. A nice man asked what I ordered and found it quickly once I told him my order #. The folks in the shop are really nice overall.

Parking is okay - make sure to carpool! 

Yes very touristy - but if you love ice cream and sweets. COME HERE. I will be back when I go to SF again! :)
author: Rachel K.

description: We had a delicious Salted Caramel Sundae! Lands End - came with brownies too!  We shared with 4 of us and it was perfect!
author: Nanette M.

description:
Had to stop by to sample some more Chocolates and see what's cooking.  Tried some rasberry and mint chocolates. Oh yeah, meh.

Cool old equipment inside the Restaurant to show how the chocolates are made. Cool gifts here to buy and try.
author: Russ C.

description:
Yes it's "touristy," yes it's crowded..and yes it's worth visiting! I really enjoyed visiting Ghirardelli Square and their ice cream shop! My husband and I tried their famous ice cream sundaes and they were so big we couldn't even finish them! 

The atmosphere inside is really cute and I enjoyed seeing the original machines and learning about the history behind the brand. 

If you visit San Fran and are a Ghirardelli fan, this is a tourist spot worth stopping at!
author: Sara N.

description: I know it's touristy but every once in awhile I just feel like a ginormous ghiradelli sundae. They're huge and overpriced but it's just good- plain and simple. Make sure to check in to get the $1 coupon which will cover some SF tax. Also love this spot cause it's open late and you can always find street parking at 10pm when you have that late night ice cream craving.
author: Leina K.

description: This is a classic site to see when in San Fran. Being here on business, I made sure I had time to swing by for a sundae. This is a great place for families and kids. It's really cool how you can see the chocolate being made and learn about the process while shopping and dining. Lots of great chocolate gift items to buy. I had the ocean beach sundae and it was to die for. I recommend sharing a sundae - personally I could barely finish half of mine. No matter what treat you choose, make sure it has hot fudge - that's a must.
author: Andie L.

description: Their chocolate is good, but their ice cream is completely flavorless.  Also, I'm pretty sure it's not supposed to have chunks of ice in it.  Their staff is pretty rude, and doubted that I paid for my item, despite having both the table number and my receipt.  Never coming here again.
author: Kendrick M.

description: Always packed and high prices but it is a tourist "must". Bathrooms are at the end of the square and they do have free water in the restaurant. Small gift shop.
author: Epi L.

description:
A trip to SF would not be complete without a stop at Ghiradelli (and the Buena Vista!) for the kids - and the big kids ....

GARGANTUAN ice cream concoctions in an traditional ice cream parlor environment. Smells like childhood. Friendly servers rushing this way and that with towering ice cream treats!

This visit: Treasure Island warm brownie sundae, caramel Quake Shake and the Ocean Beach sea salt caramel sundae. And a long walk before and after!

If you have never been here, this is not your average ice cream shop. It really is worth the trip and is quintessentially San Francisco. Be prepared for a line but it goes quickly and there is always room to sit. 

Be a kid again for a few moments and enjoy.
author: Lauren C.

description:
There's 2 parts to this location: The retail store and the ice cream shop. The store has all kinds of goodies. The best chocolate and a great selection of flavors. They're always giving out samples. Yes, it's a tourist trap but I just can't help myself. Whenever I'm in the area I always stop here. The chocolate is expensive but it is delicious. 
The ice cream parlor area next door, always has a line out the door. It's very rare to not be waiting in line. But, don't worry, it typically moves pretty quickly and it starts very close to the front door, so it looks much longer than it really is. The only thing I've had here is the hot fudge sundae. It's your basic vanilla ice cream with a puddle of hot fudge at the bottom and a good pour on top, whipped cream, nuts and a cherry on top. It's perfect for 2. Keep an eye out for the discount on your receipt.
author: Sylvia L.

description: I should have known better. This place is a tourist trap. They have you pay first before getting seated. So they keep letting people in even though it is already overcrowded. People stand between tables waiting for one to get freed up. The additional star over the minimum one star is because of the ice cream, which is pretty good. But prefer another place where they also sell Ghirardelli rather than that one.
author: Tom C.

description:
Being a tourist in San Francisco, with other tourist friends (including a friend who lives here), we of course had to stop at Ghirardelli's original shop..  

I'm not a big chocolate eater (or dessert person).  I may have 1 molar designated as my only 'sweet tooth'.  However, I do enjoy baking or making chocolate treats for....

1.  on the rare occasion of satisfying my only sweet tooth, or
2.  when asked to satisfy others' sweet tooths in the form of desserts / candy (fudge, truffles, bark, cookies, cakes, etc..etc.)  I have purchased Ghirardelli chocolates for all of the above reasons.  Why?  because it is premium, high quality, delectable chocolate my chocolately friends!   You can really taste the difference...

This original location is definitely worth checking out.  Classic.  Some very cool, old fashioned contraptions, and all the history to boot.  Definitely a FUN TIME for a kid - or the 'inner child' in all of us.  They have chocolates galore. And yes, I do enjoy some great chocolates from time to time.  Did I feel like an Oompa Loompa in Willy Wonka & The Chocolate Factory?  Nope, but that doesn't mean you wont!  Had I been 'swimming in chocolate', sure I may have felt like an oompa loompa...  Now that sounds like my kinda time!!

While I didn't have the ice cream here, my friends did and absolutely LOVED IT.. I did taste & buy some delicious chocolates slathered in nuts (my favorite kind) and gifts to bring home.. They have a ton of souvenir's as well.  Mug filled treats, espresso cups...you get the picture.

You must experience this historic chocolate haven for yourself, especially if your a chocolate lover.  So come check it out.  Grab some chocolate, a sundae, a superb shake or hot cocoa.. I feel much sweeter having had the experience myself ;p
author: Nancy L.

description:
Although it says "1 check-in here" in this review I've been to the original Ghirardelli location in Ghirardelli Square a handful of times over the course of me being in SF for whatever reason. It's one of my favorite places to go to if I'm ever playing tourist in SF and even with the discovery of Smitten/Bi-Rite/Humphrey Slocombe they serve pretty decent ice cream in the form of sundaes. 

-This ice cream shop is a MUST on any itinerary that involves the Fisherman's Wharf or traveling in a cable car (or MUNI bus in place of a cable car). It's closer to the seafood restaurants of Fisherman's Wharf if you want a sweet treat after you've tried clam chowders/seafood and you don't want to walk too far in the opposite direction towards Humphrey Slocombe in the Ferry Building. If you're in the Powell/Hyde cable car route the route ends near the border of the wharf/Ghirardelli square. The treat is even better if you decide to stop at Lombard Street prior and decide to walk several blocks down the steep incline.

-There's actually *two* stores on the square. The other location is further down closer to the harbor. There's also less seating.

-Separate lines to buy chocolate and the ice cream sundaes, but this is true for all Ghirardelli locations. If you stop by the store you can get a sample of one of their squares, which is usually their caramel flavor but can change depending on the season (peppermint squares are sampled upon Christmas).

-You can never go wrong with any of the sundaes, which is $1 off with your check-in (also true of all the Ghirardelli locations). Their most famous is their world famous sundae, which is just a simple sundae with their world-famous fudge (which is what I enjoy the most about their ice cream. Their chocolate ice cream includes this fudge.) 

-Hot chocolate is very good. Their drinking chocolate is decent, it is *quite* rich.

-Good place to people-watch if you choose outdoor seating. Especially good if you are sitting in their other location closer to the wharf.

-Line can vary depending on what time you go. This has historically been the case as I've seen longer lines towards the evening, but I didn't see much of a line on my last visit when the 2nd store opened up.
author: Isabella B.

description:
This place was really good but a huge tourist trap. Subtracting one star because I think the place needs to be a little more clean. If you're looking for quality ice cream and delicious, consistent sundaes, head here. If you're a tourist, like I was, you'll definitely enjoy it. It's on top of a hill so don't wear heels like I did (bad decisions, good intentions). We waited in line for about 15 minutes which wasn't too bad. There was no seating anywhere so we had to go upstairs. It wasn't too bad but that space quickly filled up as well. The sundaes themselves were really good. I ordered the traditional sundae while my friend ordered the cookie sundae. They were both excellent. The service was decent. The lady taking our order seemed to be over her job, but I would be too.
It's an iconic place to visit while in SF. I'm really glad I came here on my trip.
author: Zoe Y.

description:
I am a native here in SF. I usually try to avoid the big tourist spots but I could never resist the chocolates at Ghiradelli. When I walked in and asked a worker named Jerry what he recommended for a sundae he suggested us to get a waffle bowl sundae and the newest sundae they have, sea salt caramel. MmmmMm so good! He also told us we can even add extra toppings which was another plus, so I added bananas :) 

One of the nicest workers I have yet to encounter at Ghiradelli, who suggests multiple great things and gives us his honest opinion on the sundaes here.
author: Jenny S.

description: I love this place. It's one of our last stops before we leave sf. I love receiving my little chocolate sample upon entering. The ice cream is delicious, everything is pretty much great here.
author: Lupe T.

description: Place is overrated. Ice cream lacks in flavor and is way overpriced. Not as satisfied as was expecting to be:( $25 for 2 people!
author: Amanda M.

description: We brought our purchases up to the counter and never was acknowledged by the lady checking us out. She continued to talk to someone else about how she "had to" take care of us first, even though we were next in line to some other guy. She mentioned it three times and we're standing right there... like we HEAR you. The chocolate, of course, is great the service is meh.
author: Alycia W.

description: Very popular tourist attraction.  The line was always out the door but moved fast when we were there.  We each got sundaes which we're good but overpriced in my opinion.  Our favorite dessert came from the Franciscan Crab down on Fisherman's Wharf called the Valrhona chocolate sundae.  Sit at the bar and you shouldn't have to wait.
author: Chuck C.

description:
DON'T WAIT IN LINE, PEOPLE! 

Hopefully you are reading this if you are waiting in line.

There are two Ghirardelli options winthin 50 yards of the line you are waiting in. At the opposite end of the square, there is shop #2, and it seats at least the same number of customers (along with views of the bay). Or you can get something to-go at the shop that is located upstairs on the upper street level.

The banana split wasn't all that special. Order something with chocolate.

Enjoy.
author: Paul C.

description:
Coming from San Diego, I didn't think this was that special because we have a Ghirardelli in downtown SD.

Once I saw the huge sign representing the Ghirardelli square, I was in awe. This truly was a great sight to see and made me feel as if I was really in a historical place. (The original Ghirardelli) Seeing the chocolate fudge being mixed right before my eyes, I only imagined the history of this location and it just impressed me. Oh, and the ice cream was great as well! 

The only reason it does not get a 5-star is because other than the historical aspect, this location and its ice cream is no different than any other location I have been to.
author: Melvin M.

description: Ghirardelli Square ice cream is one of those touristy place that you just have to visit! I had the World famous hot fudge sundae; scoops of vanilla ice cream topped with dark chocolate hot fudge, whipped cream, cherry and almond nuts - Delicious! Each cost about $9.95, pricey, but they gave you generous helpings of ice cream and toppings. Lovely ice cream shop and I would definitely be back to try more of their decadent concoctions.
author: Veronica C.

description: This is my go to place for that San Francisco tourist experience.  The chocolate is fantastic,  the deserts delicious and the atmosphere memorable.  Take the trolley back to your hotel after you're done....PERFECT EVENING!
author: Frank C.

description: I love the brownie sundae - vanilla ice cream, brownie, regular caramel and fudge. Wow, finally went to the headquarters. They have 3 to 4 shops in less tha half a block to buy chocolate, sundaes, and all of their usual spots. They are close to the bay so u can get ur sundae and enjoy the scenery outside if you like.
author: Jesse V.

description:
Who DOESNT love a big helping of ice cream in one of the coldest cities around?

Located in the heart of Ghirardelli square, this is the place to go to if you're in the mood for a huge huge serving of ice cream and chocolates. It's a to-go-to spot in San Francisco, and while you can find Ghirardelli chocolate scattered about California, this place takes the cake in expressing how much love they have for it.

For one thing, you definitely NEED to get here earlier than what you'd expect, especially if you're trying to win a girl's heart with ice cream under the starlit sky. This place gets crowded faster than In-N-Out. There are loads of different things to order, from specialty creations, to warm and cold drinks. There's two entrances, so if you're planning on dining in, don't go through the chocolate shop entrance (they're next to each other)

Make sure to drink up that water!! This place will make you appreciate water on a whole different level lol. It's pretty pricey here too, but if you're a tourist with a sweet tooth, you should definitely pop on over here.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
"All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." - Charles M. Schulz

A visit to San Francisco is always sweeter with a stop at the Original Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop. For me, no visit to the San Francisco waterfront is complete without popping in, getting my free sample, or buying some chocolate squares, chocolate-covered cherries, and whatever is on sale.

There are multiple entrances. If you want ice cream, it is one entrance, if you want to eat-in, there is another entrance, and if you want to shop chocolates (and get your free sample), there is a 3rd entrance. Because of the lines and tourists (including you) Ghirardelli is really more of a tourist attraction than anything at this point. There are better ice cream or chocolate shops around the Bay and in the city; however, none of them are the original Ghirardelli.

Go to Ghirardelli because it is Ghirardelli ... and that's about it. Don't expect a magical Willy Wonka land or Chocolate heaven. It's a storefront and a popular ice cream parlor packed with people. It may not be "fun" or amazing, but it is still obligatory on each vacation to San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf or Pier areas that I hit Ghirardelli to make my trip just a little lovelier and sweeter.
author: Michael S.

description: This is a must-see for visitors of SF. One ice cream is big enough to serve 2! It's also known across the world. You can actually watch them being made here and you can also buy chocolates to bring to your loved ones here. After finishing the chocolate you gotta catch the beautiful view!
author: Buortau L.

description: Loved the experience of finally coming here. I shared a yummy sundae with the boyfriend. There is a huge line with tourists filling up the place. It's hard to find a table to sit, so people eat outside. There's a good selection of chocolate. The sundaes are extremely sweet and filling. Try not to eat one by yourself unless you don't mind high cholesterol or replace a meal with it. The atmosphere around the area is nice for tourism.
author: Alice S.

description:
Five stars for the hot chocolate, the cute store, the free samples when we walked in, and the iconic sign over the beautifully lit square. Four stars for the constant crowds.

We came into the city to see a performance at the SF Symphony.  The Ghirardelli chocolate shop is always open late so we drove to the square and went in for some hot chocolate. I love how they're always open late!  It was packed so we took our order to go (which turned out to be much quicker than eating in). The Salted Caramel hot chocolate was perfect as always. It was chocolatey and smooth with a generous helping of whipping cream on top. and the caramel drizzle with bits of salt were both fantastic as well. It was a perfect end to a perfect evening. We will be back!
author: Stefanie R.

description:
The Original Ghirardelli.  The sound of it as the original, already makes it worthy as a must try when you're in SF!

Their classic sundae is the way to go when the weather permits the sunshine!  I can't get enough of their warm fudge with their ice cream!  It's deliciously amazing!

This Ghirardelli is grand and spacious!  Over ice cream or hot mocha, it's a great outing to be at!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
We stopped here at about 9:30PM on Friday, November 27th for some dessert.   I have to give this place simply average reviews. The line was not that long, as we only had a wait of about 20 minutes.  

Once we got to the cashier, she was extremely friendly and pleasant to deal with.  We had the Crissy Field for the two of us to share.  We got the sundae and sat upstairs.  It arrived within 5 minutes and we thought it was absolutely delicious!   It was very filling.   

The reason for only three stars is simply the price.  Yes, I know Ghirardelli is a tourist attraction in the heart of SF; however, the prices are simply out of control.  The Sundae we overpriced; however, not too terribly I suppose at $11.45.   However, I was interested in buying some chocolate in the gift shop afterwards; however, promptly left after looking at a few of the prices.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Came here on a Monday night around 9:30 and it was not that busy.
Ordered a Medium Hot Cocoa and the Cookie Bits Sundae (Crissy Fields and it came out within 10 minutes, they both were pretty good. I'm happy to say we found a seat and there barely was a line.
author: Jessamyn D.

description:
It's a visitor must-go! Sweet Chocolate heaven. We got the salted caramel hot cocoa (which was more like Luke-warm Cocoa) and a classic hot fudge sundae (more like a Luke-warm fudge). 

The parking is a little pricey, but I guess that's what you get for SF. At the meters a quarter gets you 5 mins and a dime gets you 1 min. Charge for using a credit card. We were in and out in 20 mins since it was chilly. 

It's mainly a go-to for novelty sake. I only wish they had a smaller sundae for a single person. A large $11 can be a little much!!
author: Aly S.

description: Spent the day in San Francisco with the family and kids and decided to end the long day of walking around in Ghirardelli square. Since I have a weakness for ice cream I just had to quench my sweet tooth with these delicious sundaes. First things first the atmosphere is real inviting and has that old parlor feel. The employees are pretty welcoming and very approachable once you enter. The sundaes themselves take a whole new life of their own with the signature favorites and the simple scoops. You don't leave feeling disappointed.
author: Omar R.

description: Way too overrated. Sure, the ice cream was good, but it was also $15 and ice cream you could get anywhere. The staff looked very overworked, and did not look happy at all. You can buy their chocolate basically anywhere, and paying way too much to go here is completely useless and a waste of money. The only real reason I went is for the experience of "Ghiradelli Square" but besides that, I won't come back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Madison S.

description: I get that this is a tourist trap/attraction, but there are better things to try and do in SF. No matter what day/time you go in, by the time you get your ice cream it's all melted. They use dreyer's ice cream anyways, so I ended up getting the same stuff and making myself a sundae at home.
author: Nick Y.

description:
Not enough stars for this place. Never disappoints.

Though I didn't enjoy the chocolate chips in my midnight reverie...
author: Pritha H.

description: This is the stuff dreams are made of! From the delicious ice cream sundae to the marble-topped tables, this is classic San Francisco class and charm all the way. I loved the friendly atmosphere and attentive staff. They clearly loved working there and took their time to make sure each customer had a great experience, especially the kids in the cafe. I highly recommend this stop when exploring the Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Carlie D.

description:
We all know it's a tourist trap, but last I checked, traps suppose to have some kind of lure in them...? This place desperately needs a makeover.
I love Ghirardelli chocolate. When I'm in the city, I always go there for an ice cream.
Over the years the place got dirtier, noisier, and the staff looks overworked.
It doesn't help that apparently, they hire only high school kids (or I go always at the wrong time?)
The sundaes barely had any fudge and whipped cream on, the hot chocolate was lukewarm.
After spending $80, I asked at the register to validate my parking ticket. Guess what, they didn't validate it right, I still had to pay $5 for 30 min. parking! I didn't go back, I was so disappointed, I just wanted to go....
  
I have friends coming from Europe in 2 months. I'm glad I checked out this place, we will skip it.
author: Hajni C.

description: Ghirardelli: Having to stop by Ghirardelli and order a Small Hot Fudge Sundae, to say we did and buy some souvenirs (chocolates) to bring home, we found it quite pricey. $9.95 for the sundae, buy 3 bars get 4 bar free. Could I have gotten them at a better price at my local Fry's?, probably, but this is the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop.
author: Melody K.

description: Talk about disgruntled employees, I did not see a single happy and welcoming face here except for an older Hispanic gentleman who smiled and said hello why'll cleaning the tables. This place is overly priced and I swear I've seen Ghirardelli chocolate cheaper in other store fronts.
author: N And N K.

description: This place was insanely busy on a summer Sunday, but the ice cream was worth a wait. We had the salted caramel sundae (ideal for sharing). The ice cream is expensive, but if you are on vacation why not! The fudge was so good and tasted like a walnut brownie.
author: Nicole B.
