description: I know this place is touristy, but it's seriously worth waiting in line for the rich chocolate deserts. I usually get the Land's End, which is perfect for splitting and costs about $16 with tax. Definitely a must do when in SF!
author: W D.

description: came to ghirardelli sqaure for their renowned ice cream sundaes, and was not disappointed! i shared the chrissy fields sundae with two other people, and it ended up being just the right amount of food. it comes with three scoops of ice cream, two cookies and cream and one vanilla, and is topped with plenty of whipped cream, cookies chunks, and 2 mini chocolate squares. splitting the cost of the sundae 3 ways makes it relatively cheap too, as it comes down to about $4 per person (which is great for SF). would highly recommend, as it is delicious and also extremely aesthetically pleasing (very insta worthy)!
author: Ellaina L.

description: We enjoyed our stop here. We had a hot fudge sundae and iced mochas made with their chocolate. Heavenly. Be ready for a sugar coma.
author: Jerry H.

description:
This is the biggest sundae I've ever seen! Look, the plate is as wide as my shoulder!

First time for me to try the Earthquake Sundae: 8 huge scoops of ice cream, 8 delicious toppings, finished with fresh bananas, whipped cream, chopped almonds, decadent chocolate chips and cherries. I went there with my family and friends, there were 7 of us who ate this sundae. If you come here with your family or friends, you should try and share this sundae.
author: Euodia A.

description:
I had the sea salt caramel shake.  It was solid.  There was not an overwhelming caramel taste, which was nice.  It was just a solid shake, but just too pricey.  That should be expected given the location and name on the wall though.

Will I go back?  Yeah, sure.
author: Dan M.

description: We come to this place every New Years Eve Day and have ice cream, which IS good, but the comments about customer service are true. I don't think it has to do with race as we are white and the crews just plain ignore you when trying to talk to them. They were out of several flavors by 4pm and we did enjoy adding the lard to our rears, but these folks need some training in dealing with people and how to be polite. The manager obviously has fallen on the job. Zero respect. My children have been raised with more respect for every human no matter what flavor you are... especially PAYING customers.
author: Eric P.

description: Favorite place for dessert whenever locale on area. Courteous, fast service. Will continue to visit when in the area.
author: Carmen M.

description:
Ghirardelli's is always on my Must Visit List on any trip to the greater San Francisco Bay Area.  

Oh yes, it's quite the tourist trap, and the parking situation is hideous, but still . . .  The ice cream is good, a good bit overpriced, and not the best, but I don't know of a better place to eat some.  The view is magnifcient.

There is a pretty well-stocked gift store there, though, just right to buy those little gifts for the unfortunate folks left behind.
author: Bert G.

description: Went during busy December months when lines were 45 minutes long, but it's sooooo worth the wait! A big plus is that you get to see how they make the orders so the wait is a lot more tolerable!
author: Dhwani P.

description: Nob Hill Chill is a must. What could be better than a blended up vanilla ice cream and hot fudge? Nothing, that's what.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Ice cream was great, but messed up on our order ;(. Then after, we found out that the chocolate in the back was actually fake and we have been lied to for our whole life.
author: Hadeel R.

description: Perfect dessert treat!! (Sorry Tiffany, I promise we'll go Saturday!) this place has the desserts of all desserts!!
author: Jennifer E.

description:
I feel like this place is playing with a loaded deck. How are you going to sell chocolate and ice cream and expect to see anything less than 4 or 5 stars? But either way, the ice cream is delicious and the history of the building is very interesting.

WARNING: It is a HUGE tourist trap. Don't buy souvenir chocolate there. You'll pay a significant more than if you were to buy the chocolate at Walmart in your hometown, so buy it at home and pretend you bought it at the gift shop!
author: Edwin R.

description: A true test in patience but worth it.  Super crowded, ultra touristy ice cream parlor that serves a killer hot fudge sundae.  You'll have to fight for a table since the crowds are always heavy here and there's no host to seat you.  They'll give you a number and you're on your own to find seating which is impossible on weekends.  However, both the ice cream and the toppings are worth the aggravation.  So delicious.  I order the hot fudge brownie sundae and it's amazing.  The staff always seems to be in a fowl mood so don't expect friendly service either.
author: Anthony G.

description:
I was in town for my friends wedding and we all decided to come here late tonight after dinner. Overall I was unimpressed with the service and the ice cream but it was worth trying.

We arrived around 8 PM on a Saturday night and it was incredibly crowded. The servers were slow in clearing tables so we ended up sitting at a table smeared with ice cream for quite a while. We finally had to get the attention of a server to get the table cleaned. We also had to cobble together various chairs and tables to seat our party. Some of this is understandable on a busy night but it was a bit ridiculous.

Though the ice cream and toppings were good I found it to be overly sweet. The richness literally made me sick because it was just crammed with sugar and not many other delicate or complementary flavors. I would've liked to see fresh fruit or other things used to offset the richness and give it more depth.

All in all I am still glad that I came tonight. It was something worth experiencing but I don't think I will be back here next time I come to San Francisco.
author: Jason C.

description: We ordered a banana split and it was delivered without bananas... Lol.. They promptly fixed the issue.  I have always seen this place from a distance but I'm glad I popped in to check it out.  Very nice view and ambiance.
author: Edi S.

description:
One of the best chocolate ice creams!
Glad that we did not overlook this place as it seems like a tourist trap, totally satisfies your sweet cravings!
author: Helen K.

description:
It may be crowded. It may be toursity. It may be overpriced. But with that being said, you can't come to San Fran without a visit to Ghiradelli.

Some of the reasons that I mentioned above will probably drive some away, but in some ways Ghiradelli reminds me a lot of the Hofbrauhaus in Munich, Germany. You gotta go at least once just to say you've gone and there's an almost 100% chance that you're going to love it.

My girlfriend and I shared one of their new sundaes; the salted caramel and were blown away. The vanilla ice cream was delicious, the hot fudge and caramel was the best combination since chocolate met peanut butter, and the salted caramel candy was literally the cherry on top. 

You will see all walks of life if you come here, whether it be families, couples, friends, tourists, and even some locals. After your ice cream coma, take a walk around the gift shop, enjoy free chocolate samples, and see why this place has been around forever. You won't regret it. I promise.
author: Jeff D.

description:
Tourists be damned, locals love a cone too! 

This is by far the most amazingly mediocre ice cream shop in town, yet I kinda like it that way. My mind allows me to think it's more Wonka than Wanker. I've taken dates to this place and waited online over an hour just to get to know her a bit better. 

Overall, it's solid though. I absolutely love the caramel hot fudge sundae. It's delectable, delicious and just short of a 20 spot. Tourists love this place, so if you are in the pickpocket business, you can get fat here.
author: Hector G.

description:
Beware, you may leave about 10 lbs heavier than when you walked in, but soooo worth it! In my opinion a SF staple and adorable place to visit. If you have kids they will love the area where you can see the chocolate being melted and and swirled around. 

The whole square is a great place to walk around and explore the other shops and restaurants and listen to any street performers that may be there. If you go into the actual chocolate shop to the right of the restaurant/cafe side you will almost always get a free sample! 

I've never tried their hot chocolate or drinks, but their ice creams and sundaes are delicious. Not the best I've ever had, but the atmosphere makes it a great experience. I love taking friends here that are visiting from out of town! Definitely a tourist spot with oftentimes long lines but regardless a great spot!!
author: Kayley W.

description: If your a fan of the chocolate then this is a must for you! Located within walking distance of Pier 39 (Fisherman's Wharf), this place serves as a fun locale. Make sure that you go to the square as there is other shopping and eateries to attend. The square also allows you to get some great views of the Golden Gate Bridge and the surrounding area. Plus the chocolate is delicious!
author: Michael A.

description: They totally ruined my sundae! !  I asked for a strawberry only sundae, not with chocolate!! Ugh, gross!!! Hate berries and chocolate together!!
author: Angela K.

description: Well if you have never been to Ghirardelli then you are in for a treat ! From their savory, drinks, malts, ice creams and chocolate you will be over whelmed with delicious choices. This place is a very iconic spot for San Francisco that I got a chance to enjoy while visiting. I ended up ordering the chocolate Sunday which was just enough for me but it did have heavy syrup so if thats not your thing them it may not be for you. The wait was a little long about 1 hour and 20 minutes but I did come on Memorial day weekend so that was to be expected. Since there is a Ghirardelli in SD I could have skipped this because they same selections but my trip would not have been complete without it. If you have the time please visit, it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Leivonie H.

description: Touristy? Yes. I bought a lot of souvenirs from here though, and nobody complained! It's just a stop along the way, don't spend a lot of time here. There are lots more to see here, i.e. Fisherman's Wharf, gift shops, boutiques, etc.
author: Elsie W.

description:
During my weekend in San Francisco, I hit two milestones: I spent the entire time in bottoms with elastics and almost certain I stretched out the elastic in each one.  I do believe this is as accomplished as a person gets. 

At first glance, it seems there are like ten and a half seats.  In reality, there are like ten and a half seats.  Far from spacious, if there is any room to be had, people are constantly filling it. 

I ordered the biggest-sounding ice cream sundae equipped with a waffle bowl and I ate more than half of it, if you were wondering how my diet plan is going.  It was a magical, brag-worthy moment between the ice cream and me.  

Is there anything as beautiful as two gigantic scoops of ice cream with whipped cream and a chocolate drizzle?  Other than Kate Upton's boobs, maybe?
author: Whitney B.

description: I mean, can you go to SF without going to Ghiradeli square and see the original shop? But beware, it's hard going there just to look... But then is that really why you went? If so, bad idea. So the Sunday menu is a thing of beauty, pricey tho so just keep in Ming you will be paying a round $11-15 or even $18? Depending on what you get. Totally worth it so don't grimace till you try it. And if there are no seats inside, don't worry they will find your number outside. Which I would suggest if the weather allows because it is pretty outside.
author: Nia D.

description:
The food was amazing. 

However, the service wasn't. You have to order at the front and then find a table which is fine but really chaotic. When we found a table there were still dirty plates on it. The waiter brought us the food while the dirty plates were on the table and he only wiped the table and left the dirty plates and our food on the table. Another waiter came by and took the other dirty plates away and spilt chocolate on a customers coat... really poor service haha.
author: Samantha C.

description:
I've visited before but never had a chance to sit down and share a sundae until the other day. 

They give you samples as you walk in the store. If you're lucky, you get more than one sample if they don't remember you.

I ate in the second store more towards the back. The set up is strange because it's both a place to eat and a place to sell gifts. My boyfriend and I chose to get the Cookie Bottom Sundae. 

The name itself sounds amazing. I have to admit that they make the cup and your serving size bigger than it is. Our cookie was a bit burnt when they over heated it. Overall taste was awesome but only because those general ingredients (vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, hot fudge, choco chip cookie, nuts, cherry) taste good together. 

On another note, my boyfriend bought a small bottle of caramel flavored sauce. This is dangerous because it tastes great on it's own and on everything including potato chips, oatmeal, waffles....

Tourist trap but they do have some treats.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Over a week later and I think I'm still coming down from my sugar high. The decadent chocolate drink is sort of like a hot chocolate made of melted chocolate. Thick almost syrupy chocolate deliciousness is a must try. The only problem is that it's so rich and filling that you need to tap out before the bottom of the glass....or at least I did. I think this is a must if you can find one or two chocolate lovers to share it with.

The fudge sundae is a classic. I haven't had one since I was a kid and embraced very bad eating behavior while on vacation. This of course requires ice cream topped with whip cream and hot fudge to fully consummate my exercise in straining the limits of my jeans. Excellent quality ice cream which we enthusiastically likened to Haagen Dazs or Ben and Jerry's! Great sundae and it is my opinion that unless you are sharing with many, you don't need to order anything bigger than the standard sundae.

The store is jam packed with the many flavored squares of chocolate, with samples of the seasonal flavor being handed out at the entrance. There are also a ton of gift packages to take with you for your favorite chocolate lovers back home. Great stop and the historical square behind the original Ghirardelli factory where it's located has lots of shops and live music.
author: Marc M.

description: When I knew I'm coming to SF for a trip, I know I need to come to this original Ghirardelli location. I love Ghirardelli chocolate and ice cream products. I was happy like a little girl here!
author: Jinny T.

description:
Place is a mess. (The kind of mess where you have syrup on the kitchen floor and then 1000 people step on it.)

My father really really liked his hot cocoa. I got the single scoop ice cream in waffle cone dipped in chocolate. Everything else on the menu looked drenched in whipped cream. My single scoop had about 4 servings of ice cream so definitely share it between 2. I think Cold Stone makes their ice cream (don't quote me on that) and it was just ok.The waffle cone was soggy.

Very touristy experience and is not worth a detour.
author: Joy Y.

description:
Touristy spot for sure! Since I was a tourist... We definitely came here. Stopped by the ice cream shop in the back of the square facing the water. Didn't realize there were two. We just didn't want to wait in the ridiculous line! The line was probably less than 10 min and another 5-10 minutes to get our ice cream. Luckily, the passed out mini samples while we waited in line.

We got the cookie crumble sundae. Very good! But I recommend splitting it with someone because it is a lot to handle. Drizzled in fudge and topped with whipped cream and cookie crumbles. You get two scoops of cookies and cream ice cream and one scoop of vanilla.

Worth it? Meh. Ice cream was good (nothing special) and the price was very inflated!!!
author: Pauline T.

description:
How could anyone not like this place? They give free samples the moment you step in the door. Obviously the chocolate is top-notch. I actually walked out and walked back in so I could obtain more samples! 

I tried a Quake Shake which is basically a thick milkshake. I got mine infused with Caramel. It was thick, creamy, and glorious.  I'm hesitant to look at the nutrition facts. Thank goodness we were walking around so much! 

They have a set-up in one of the main buildings showing how the chocolate is produced which was very interesting. Ghirardelli Square was definitely a nice, touristy stop while visiting San Francisco!
author: Justin V.

description:
I used to love this place so I don't know what happened. My bf and I came here this past weekend and we shared a banana spit. We started digging into it and then realized that it was the wrong order (the person altered their ice creams). We were given a new one without hesitation and were able to keep the wrong one, which was nice. 

But I don't know what it was, but the banana split just wasn't good. We didn't like the pineapple topping. It does not go well  with any of the ice cream flavors and I didn't like the strawberry ice cream or the strawberry topping. I pretty much just ate the scoop of chocolate ice cream while he ate the vanilla and we both avoided the mound of whip cream. 

Not only that, but their ice cream melts at an incredibly fast pace. I wasn't even done with the scoop of chocolate ice cream yet and everything started to look gross and messy. Actually, even when they brought it out to our table, you can see that the ice cream has already started to melt. 

Probably wont be back any time soon, maybe I'll just stick to Fentons.
author: Samantha C.

description: Lived in San Francisco my whole life and I've only been here a few times. I remember trying the Earthquake a long time ago and shared it between 3 other friends. It was definitely a huge portion and a lot of sweetness. Awhile back I had their hot chocolate, which was good but a little too sweet for my liking. Yesterday, shared the Treasure Island with the boyfriend and a friend got the Crissy Field, which were both delicious. Sharing the sundae was the perfect amount for me. The place is always packed, but we were lucky and went in when there wasn't a line yet. Service was good and friendly as well. It's a bit pricey, but it's that type of place where it's expected. I'd definitely be back again and I personally think it's worth trying. I'm looking forward to trying the other desserts.
author: Maggie W.

description: The sundaes are quite yummy but to be honest, they just seem like normal sundaes to me. I got the strawberry sundae and my friend got the banana split. The fudge was great. They give you a free sample of chocolate when you go in. It's hard to find a seat to sit on the weekends. Sometimes the waiters can't find you to give you your sundae because after you order, you just walk around to find a seat and they try to find your little number sign. My friend waited half an hour for her sundae because they couldn't find her. It's ok because the sundaes are great.
author: Amanda L.

description:
This is definitely a tourist trap, but who can resist ice cream and [free] chocolate?! There WILL be crowds but the wait for ice cream wasn't too long (only 15-20 mins) and the time goes by rather quickly when you're hanging out with friends/family. I recommend the to-go cafe for a faster ordering experience otherwise you'll be waiting even longer to grab a seat indoors. But it's much more pleasant to eat outside anyways--go enjoy the view of The Bay or sit by the fountain. 

ESPRESSO CHIP ICE CREAM in a CHOCOLATE DIPPED WAFFLE CONE is pretty amazing! I recommend this for chocolate and coffee lovers alike. LEMON SORBET was also light and refreshing. The ice creams and sundaes are definitely worth the money--a single scoop in a cone was huuuuge. I suffered from a sugar coma on the MUNI shortly afterward. 

I wouldn't recommend getting the mochas or coffee drinks--they tasted pretty average for the steeper price you pay.

Next time I'll get an almond or sprinkle dipped cone...they are the same price as a regular chocolate dipped cone. And +1 for free chocolate samples! nom nom nom ;)
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
This place is the original Ghirardelli and I've been going here for years.  It's nice to try it out but there are faster ways to get the same ice cream nowadays in different locations. 

This location is a big tourist site nowadays.  I remember back in the day it was easy to get ice cream sundaes but now It's an effort.   

But nonetheless its still really good and worth it if you can do it and you have the time.
author: Homer S.

description:
I always love coming to this place.. Their ice creams and sweets are amazing and they know it! :) 
***Management: Im writing this review bc I need to get your attention, it's incredibly disappointing that you dont have restrooms inside of the restaurant and not only that... But the outside restrooms that your customers are forced to use are dirty, stinky and small! 
I hope to hear from you!
author: Jen P.

description: This is a San Francisco classic!  I have many memories of coming here with my family when I was a child.  The ice cream is delicious and they give you free samples of chocolate when you visit their store.  Not to be missed if you're in the area!!!
author: Laleh J.

description:
Yes it is 1:16 AM when I'm writing this. Haha

This place is a tradition for me to go to whenever I'm near Pier 39 and it's been like that for about 6+ years now and it'll never change. Anyways... I really like this place! 

Let's talk about the location. I think it is at a wonderful location, at end of the pier area and up a few flight of stairs. (I'm not from here so please tell me if I'm wrong about this part) Or if you want you can take the semi steep hill to get there. It has an ALRIGHT view of the bay. Of course like any tourists trap area, it's almost always packed with people. The wait to order and to get it was decently good. When you get a table, it will feel faster cause you have a place to chill and talk while they make our sundae(s). I only came with a friend so it was easy to find a table. I wish you the best of luck if you go with a group of people, especially on the weekends or holidays. The place feels nice and clean. Also unlimited free water. Who can say NO! to water when you're downing a very sweet sundae, am I right? I always get the Strike It Rich and highly recommend to whoever doesn't know what to get. Overall great place! Good food! Good time.
author: Minh Quang N.

description: Menu is actually quite limited. Mostly vanilla ice cream used in sundaes. Very expensive for what you get. Average tasting ice cream. No real special flavors.
author: Holmes B.

description: Super fun. It's crazy busy but the ice cream is reallly good. We luckily found a table and had a nice time. The ordering and delivery is a little bit unorganized and that's why I'm taking off one star. I ordered and waited a long time, didn't really know where to stand etc. so that was a little weird. Overall, such a great little place and a must visit if you have guests in town!
author: Joie S.

description: Yes we all know this is a tourist trap, but who can resist saying no to an iconic spot? I went in on a weekday, and there were not too many people there. We got the Lands End. Boy was is Chocolatey!!! As a personal preference, I think the brownie is too thick and fudgy (who would have thought such a thing existed?), but the ice cream was definately delicious. If you are ordering for one, the sundays might be too much (..or not) and I would suggest maybe a cone of ice cream. My favorite part of the meal was towards the ice cream, so if I could go back and reorder I would probably just get a cone.  You can also order hot chocolate (which sounds delish, especially with that cold San Francisco summer), or also a coffee. They come in huge portions, as all fatting American meals do these days.
author: Sabryna L.

description:
My husband and i finally made it to San Francisco! The must go to place on my list was Ghirardelli Square of course. I'm a chocolate lover so this was like heaven for me. 
Went there on a chilly Saturday night. There was a long line and did not care! As soon as I had my first spoonful of hot fudge....it was quite exquisite....!   
Cashiers were quick and friendly ...everything was made to fast... would definitely come back...
author: Dee S.

description: This place is small cute clean with very friendly staff serving you, they have all the latest and newest chocolates out for you, they were passing out free samples...that's what I like anything free count me in, there is only three bar stools and two lower chairs not much to see any way, this place really look like it gets really crowded, a great place to come when its cold and when its hot, so I'm a fan.
author: Tommy M.

description:
Plan to go with at least one other person or two!
The ice cream is so diabetic-ally delicious that it'll make your mouth sore. Be advised that the ice creams are huge and I couldn't even finish half of mine.
Before I left I went to the store and bought some of this sweet delicacies to bring back home to Dallas. Gotta share the love!
author: Ann P.

description: Visited three times. Twice we had the Nob Hill Chiller which was delicious and the other time a deluxe hot chocolate. Both were really good and didn't take to long to be brought to our table. The free samples of peppermint paperbark were really nice (although I missed out on one visit) only complaint I have is that the dishes aren't cleared quickly and the tables are a bit dirty. I had to ask for one to be wiped down and then it still had something on it. I'm not precious, I wiped it myself and enjoyed my drink and the awesome view!
author: Cat M.

description: Stopped here on the way back from a retreat in Novato and got the Muir Woods sundae in a dipped waffle bowl. The sundae was tasty, but the size was a bit lacking in the waffle bowl. I would suggest getting another sundae type instead.
author: Hirav G.

description: I actually don't like ice cream but still enjoyed the ice cream here! Super creamy and rich it was delicious. Waffle bowl was also really cute and crunchy.
author: Anna H.

description:
This spot is really cool, the location can't be beat, so close to the water and within walking distance of the Fisherman's Wharf and cable cars. Someone is always inside to greet you with a chocolate square before you take a look around at the huge selection. The best part is obviously the ice cream shop area where you can see the old school machines producing their delicious fudge and sit to have a nice artery clogging treat. 

I tried the banana split and a hot fudge brownie. The ice cream was decent and the brownie was very good but for the price of around $17 it was totally not worth it at all. 

There are usually lines during the peak hours in the evening right after dinner so, just expect to wait. There are times when this place is absolutely dead though, so it can be hit or miss. I found it worth trying just to say that I did more than it actually being worth the money for what you get...nothing special at all.
author: Kenny O.

description: The warm brownie sundae, hot chocolate and hot fudge sundae are amazing!! There was a super long line but it went very fast and the service was excellent! It was my first time here and I can't wait to come back!
author: Lizzie L.

description: I love ice cream. I had yet to meet an ice cream I did not like, until my visit here. I waited in line to order a mint bliss. I had read reviews that service was quite quick, unless you are forgotten like me. I waited 50 minutes after ordering while watching waves of people get their ice cream. Even the family that was ahead of me finished theirs before I got mine. Finally, the waiter brings out a half melted cone of chocolate in a pan. Not a mint bliss. I then wait again to get my sundae. The piece of chocolate on top was fantastic but the rest left me dissatisfied. The whipped cream left a weird taste in my mouth and the mint chocolate chip ice cream (which is my favorite flavor) tasted so awful that I only could eat a few bites. It had the leftover film a java chip frappucino from Starbucks has. I was quite disappointed in service and product and will not be returning in the future.
author: Jenna D.

description: This shop has hired some employees that do not behave well with international customers, especially Asians...an employee named Frederick refused to offer any sample to my father in law. ..later he threw a chocolate bar on the floor and told him that it was his sample...this is blatant racism and that too in SFO! My father in law is a respected individual and does not deserve this!  The area manager Mr. Kroma remedied the situation by making his employee apologize and offering a complimentary gift..highly unhappy with the situation but satisfied  (somewhat) by the manager
author: Vivek R.

description:
Many many years ago when I was young, my dad got a coupon for Ghirardelli's. 20% off or something like that. We decided to hit Fisherman's Wharf for the day, get some clam chowder, check out Ripley's--the whole shebang. My family lives in the East Bay so we never really do the tourist thang in the city unless friends or family are visiting from out of town. Of course, our plans were to end the night with some dessert at The Original Ghirardelli so we could use the coupon.

We perused the menu while freezing our butts off in line and ordered a couple of sundaes and a cup of decadent hot chocolate with marshmallows once we approached the register. But alas, we found out my dad had left the coupon at home. 

It was to expire the next day. 

Well, we still went ahead with our orders, we still finished everything, and we went home very full and very, very happy.

Since then, I have been here many times: on dates, with friends, as a host for out-of-towners, etc. Not once did I leave here without a smile. I guess my point is...despite the tourist-y factor, despite the crowds, despite the nongourmet ice cream, despite the bathroom being outside and far away, and despite the unrelenting cold (there's basically a 90% chance it'll be cold if you come here, regardless of the month)...you'll leave Ghirardelli's happy and with good memories.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
This one is always packed...

Do yourself a favor and get the sample, then head over to either of the other 2 Ghirardellis for a shorter line should you decide to place an order for dessert.

Also, usually this shop runs out of items. I was looking for the chocolate toffee candy bar and they were out, but the other stores had it. 

Mint bliss with milk chocolate hot fudge..... 

MMMMMMMM.......
author: Maria C.

description:
(: Boba-Foodaholic Says :)

My order: Banana Split 

So I went here after our dinner on Valentine's day. It was hard to find the place at night  in the beginning. However, I saw there big shinny Ghirardelli sign at the top of the building (you have to walk all the way top of the building). When I got at the top of the building, I saw a man with a sample basket! I got caramel chocolate which was delicious as always. Then I saw a big line, which I wasn't expecting a line in front of the place. However, someone told me that this is a line for ice cream and that no line is for retails. 

We waited in the line for one hour at 8PM to 9PM, just to eat that freaking ice cream. When it was my time, I was really happy to order my ice cream :) After riding cable car from union square, there was 10% discount coupon with cable car ticket, which we got $1.09 discounts. You can't use the check-in coupon with this discount ticket. After having a seat with a number stick, we enjoyed the night view of SF. Then after short period of time, they gave us our banana split which as so delicious. We felt more delicious after waiting for that freaking long. After eating, we just left the boat on the table. When we existed, there were more lines than when we were in the line at around 10PM. I felt so bad for those people in the line, which they have to wait for a long time. 

I totally come back for more to Ghirardelli ice cream but not this location! Too long line!
author: Alice C.

description:
The Sunday's are amazing!!! They are definitely a must try. Share it with a friend. They're huge!

I've been to SF so many times in the past but I've never had the opportunity to check this place out. Man, oh man... I was definitely missing out.

Bit pricy but worth it. :)
author: Omar V.

description:
I believe that my feelings on this establishment are best expressed by Spongebob & Patrick's first customer in "Chocolate with Nuts"....CHOCOLATE!!!!!

But seriously, loved the icecream sundaes, but I do wish that I had tried the classic hot chocolate over the sea salt caramel.

My only complain was that it took them very long for them to get me a glass of water.
author: Saagar U.

description:
I know this is a huge tourist hot spot but it's still a draw for my family.  Now that we have a 14 month toddler in the family, our stops in SF are a lot different these days--but it's fun to expose my little niece to these places. She's probably still a little young to remember but she responds and seems to really enjoy the sites and people watching. 

We spent the day walking around the wharf to get our clam chowder in a sourdough bowl fix and ended up here to finish out the night. Even though its winter and was super cold out, it didn't stop us from ordering dessert and a hot chocolate. I ordered the Cookie Bits Sundae and it was yum! It had the banana split on the bottom, vanilla and cookies and cream ice cream wedged in between, with their famous hot fudge drizzled dripping over the ice cream, a generous helping of whipped cream.....and the best part -- the mini chocolate chip cookie crumbles on top.  My husband and I shared and together, we were able to polish off the entire dessert which we didn't think we could do when this huge dessert was presented to us.

It was super busy during the holidays but the square was beautifully decorated and lit up at night which made it a really nice place to stop and enjoy a yummy treat. We were freezing as we sat on one of the patios but I'm glad we all ordered hot chocolate to keep our hands and bellies warm until the guys brought the cars around. 

Despite the crowds and the huge calories we consumed here, it's really worth the stop.
author: Sharon V.

description: This place made me feel like a kid again! I got 2 scoops of cookies & cream and cookie dough in a chocolate waffle cone WITH SPRINKLES...can't have enough sprinkles. Loved it all!
author: Kristal C.

description: The icecream is delicious- their hot fudge is TO DIE FOR. When you walk in they give you a complimentary bar of chocolate which is always awesome. Lets put it this way. It was like 50 and windy outside yet we still got icecream and sat outside to eat it. Worth every calorie.
author: Erin L.

description: Not one of my most favorite tourist spots in SF because there wasn't much to see. This place is packed because Ghirardelli was founded here in he heart of SF. Overpriced because it's gourmet and they make their chocolate fresh the day of. Check in and you get a dollar off your sundae. This place is alright, it was more of an accidental stop because we were looking for the Hyde Pier right across the street.
author: Sophia V.

description: Always a must go to spit when you go to SF! Jena did great assisting us! Thank you Jena for amazing customer service!!
author: Mariah P.

description:
Cool touristy place to visit.   The surrounding area is nice to hang out and take pics.  

You can see them making the ice-cream w/ all the open windows.  

The ice cream is solid and pretty good, overall 3.5/5.

Banana Split - $10 - Pretty solid, 4/5.  Oddly, chocolate isn't that good w/ the bananas.  The vanilla & strawberry parts were better.
Hot Fudge Sundae - $9  - Solid, 4/5.  I liked this more than the split.
Hot Chocolate - $6 - 2/5.  Wasn't that good.  It's hot milk and they give you 5 bars of chocolate.  You gotta throw the chocolate in the milk, mix it yourself, and melt the chocolate.  Didn't taste that great.
author: Mike T.

description: $14 for a sundae may seem steep but was visiting San Francisco so figured I gotta at least visit Ghirardelli square.  Well the sundae was really good, and so I can cross this off my bucket list!
author: Darren S.

description:
My first visiting location, will be back, maybe. Parking is hard to find, garages are expensive, beware if there is an event parking can be $45! 
Lines are long, but move quickly, your order is delivered to your table, if your lucky to find one. 
Our order was incomplete, good thing I kept my receipt typically I throw it out immediately. Staff was friendly. Ice cream creations are about $10, a single scoop is $3.50. I enjoyed my 2 single scoops, but nothing out of this world ...on my soo good experience! Maybe their creations are more tasty. 

They have lots of chocolates in unique San Francisco packages. Prices are standard, you are not getting a "deal", they are generous with samples. Overall experience 3 stars. If we are in the area, find parking with ease, I will be go again. Yet, I won't be disappointed if we drive past it.
author: Grace G.

description: We arrived at a very busy time of day. We made it thru the line pretty quickly and ordered right away. We probably waited about five minutes total. There were customers ahead of us that were quite rude and short with the staff but the staff continued to be courteous to everyone. Kudos to them for that. Clean place, fast service and great product. We will return.
author: Kimberly K.

description: Always a great stop after walking around all day. Their hot fudge sundae with brownie and whipped cream is delicious. We both got our own and we were able to eat everything as nothing was too sweet. It is always packed, even during Christmas Day, so make sure someone gets a seat while another person orders. It is a little pricey for a sundae, but it is touristy and cannot be missed.
author: Hana A.

description: Dirty tables, dirty silverware, sub par desserts. This place is a giant RIP OFF. Feeding off of their established name, this place lures customers in and digs deep into their pockets. We ordered the chocolate sunday and it was pretty much awful.  Didn't taste like real ice cream and the brownie included didn't taste fresh. The staff was friendly but obviously overworked and overwhelmed by the number of people in and out of the place.  This is a solid skip.
author: Timothy C.

description: Great spot by the pier for a tasty late night dessert! They are open late with serving a selected variations of ice cream flavors as well as many choices of sundaes & additional toppings. They offer free tap water by the stairs & will come bring out your order to our table as u wait for them to prepare your order. It smells so sweet inside due to them making fresh fudge! Great for groups & when you need to indulge in some sweets! Not to mention, they have a chocolate store right next door where u can purchase goods, prepackaged baked goods in containers, & ready to bake items.
author: Lisa S.

description: Ok tourists trap for ice creme but MEN just pull out the wallet and enjoy time with your family!  The $10 malt was a good treat after walking the wharf.  Lines form fast so plan your vist.  Cable car lines LONG at 6pm so lines here will be same.
author: Sam A.

description: try the treasure island. you will not regret it.
author: Mohammad K.

description:
What a terrible disgrace. This is what most people who come to San Francisco get to experience as "authentic". Garbage. I felt like a late-night cone on my way home. How nice, some place was open. I knew what I was likely in for, but I went in anyhow. Of course it's a tourist trap. But maybe, maybe, just an ice cream cone? 

They served me melty crappy artificial bright-green mint chip in a pseudo-"sugar" cone -- and here's the kicker: the cashier asked me: "for here or to go?" I replied, "well, it's an ice cream cone, it doesn't really matter does it?" He just ignored me. I said "to go". I  waited at the "pick up here" window amid a chaos of signage, sugary smells and fake chocolate making machinery. And then someone handed me an ice cream cone. Wrapped in paper. Tipped over, in a plastic box. 

In a plastic box ?!??!?!!?!?!

Like, for safety? So I wouldn't spill it? For WHAT???!?!   For god's sake people. In a plastic box??!?! It's already IN a cone. That's the whole point. Imagine how sad a child would be to receive an ice cream cone, served TIPPED OVER. What has the world come to? Let's end this now.
author: Bowen D.

description:
Really great place to visit when being a tourist in San Francisco. It's iconic. There is an ice cream store and chocolate shop there. Don't go to the busy one (too hectic!) Hang a right and go to the quieter one that has all the same stuff there. The staff are able to help you, personally, without all the other tourists there.
We were given a sample as we entered. Delicious. Great variety of chocolates to purchase. I want to go back and spend an hour here. Wonderful!
author: Kate H.

description:
A lot of tourists, a lot of people. 
Must-visit if you are a big fan of chocolate sundaes !
They are open until really late and it is really busy even at night. 
I highly recommend their hot chocolate with whip cream! It's absolutely delicious. 
They always give you some free samples when entering the store, which is always a plus!
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description:
This place is very busy, a long line and no empty seats (Saturday.)
We took Strawberry Hot Fudge Sundae ($9.95) 
It looked very nice, but very very sweet taste, so sweet! I ate a couple of spoons.
author: Tetiana M.

description:
I always come here when I have people visiting me from out of town! Most recently, I came here during July 4th weekend and it was absolutely packed! The line was completely out the door and starting to circle around the courtyard. I decided to show our visitors the infamous chocolate making process they have on display. Very cool as they have signs that describe each step and are completely visible. Took lots of pictures at each station!

We then went to the shop and bought lots of chocolate (of course!) while one of us decided to stand in line. The smell around us was too tempting so we decided to bite the bullet. Luckily the line had shortened quite a bit and we ordered the Ocean Beach Sundae to share. It was delicious!! Not too sweet but that hot fudge was on point! It also helped that the 4 of us shared since we all got our cravings satisfied but did not feel overwhelmed.

Definitely a highly recommended place when you have out of town visitors! Took a star off due to the long wait time. 

As a side note, you'll get a $1 off coupon once you check in :)
author: Natasha S.

description: Since we stuck to Fisherman's Wharf/North Beach area on foot, after lunch ended up at Ghirardelli Square. Shared one of the "Painted Ladies" Intense Dark Sundaes, the "Espresso Escape" ($10.95) which had espresso chip ice cream, dark chocolate hot fudge, whipped crea, and a square of intense dark 72% Twilight Delight chocolate. The place was pretty busy for a Friday afternoon, and we ended up sitting outside at a table. The glass the sundae was served in was a regular fountain glass I'd imagine is used for water or iced tea or soda floats or something, not as fancy presentation as the menu suggests. Also, couldn't tell if the hot fudge was truly dark chocolate (based on my photos and tastebuds it was not), but oh well. Can't really go too wrong with ice cream and fudge, except when there's a shortage thereof. This was a pretty tame sundae compared to the behemoths I've previously conquered at the likes of Fentons or Leatherbys. If I'm ever back I may try one of the other sundaes...no sharing.
author: Michelle L.

description: How could anyone give this less than 5 stars!  This IS San Francisco!  The family loved the place and the sundaes are amazing.  I did the lands end, will be working it off all week!  But wow!  Those brownies are to die for!  Great people, service, and yum!
author: Robert B.

description:
How do you pick just one dessert off the menu! So many options to satisfy your sweet tooth!! 
Place was big and clean and had chocolate all around to get for souvenirs. 
Got the world famous sundae and it was yummy!! 
This is a great place for tourist!
author: Allison P.

description: I don't know what's better: fresh Ghirardelli chocolate squares or their delicious sundaes. Either way, I managed to indulge in both. The shop was jam packed with people but service was short and sweet (no pun intended). This is definitely a fast paced environment, where people come in for a quick pick me up. I'd advise you to enjoy your sundae with a bayside view (located in the shop towards the right wing of the center). Definitely a tourist hot spot, so if you want to avoid the crowd, try coming in the late afternoon.
author: Sarin P.

description:
Does it get any more tourist SF? 

There is a huge selection of desserts - sundaes with or without brownies? hmmm
Everything was great! $11/sundae. Definitely big enough to share!
author: Em L.

description: It's hard to say anything bad about a place that has chocolate in the name.  However I'm interested only in honest, on point reviews.  You have to stand in line like you're at Disneyland waiting for a ride or cows getting in line waiting the abattoir.  Ordering and taking a number reminded me of being in a hospital cafeteria. The salted caramel and hot fudge brownie sundae was delivered quickly and was a little piece of heaven.  I could have done without the guy who brought it to us asking where we were from then telling us about the time he did in one of our local prisons.  He hung around just talking away while our ice cream was visibly melting on the table.  He was friendly enough and worthy of a few laughs so I don't want to take that away from him.  So why just three stars?  The product is great, but the standing in line, taking the number, and the incredibly flat order taker really stole from the experience.  Would I go back?  Of course, is still the best chocolate in the world.
author: James S.

description:
TLDR: DELISH.

Ghirardelli always does a wonderful sundae, and the shipped at Ghirardelli square doesn't disappoint. Rich ice cream on top of a soft moist brownie + fudge + fantastic caramel = diet busting heaven. I'll go back to working out next week if I don't die content first.
author: GB M.

description:
I love their chocolate and Ice Creams. Every time my wife and I go to San Francisco we try to come here and get come of their delicious ice cream. The workers here are nice and helpful, but some can be rude.

Pros:
Best chocolates

Cons:
Long line
Rude customers

Next time I come here I want to try their banana split.
author: David N.

description:
I've gone to alot of ghiradelli's, the one in the mall in SF, the one in monterey, and a couple more, but this location is really the original, and as good as it gets.

Came here on a sunday evening, SUPER, SUPER packed. Theres like three levels and entries and all had lines. No tables anywhere, but i will not leave SF without some ghiradelli ice cream. So I did the unthinkable, parked in a no parking zone, and cut in front of everyone in line. Yes, I sinned =(, but I promise I wont do it again, the kids were driving me nuts and I could not wait while they whined. 

Our ice cream came out very quick, right as we grabbed a table. 
We got the Mint bliss, and boy, oh boy was it bliss. This location is known for the chocolate, and the chocolate ice cream under the scoop of mint was AH-MAZING. Like my kids devoured it. The chocolate ice cream and sauce was just so perfect. 

You have to come here and get something with chocolate ice cream.
author: B. B.

description:
Amazeballs!!!! Although after finishing one (yes, I can finish it), I always feel like I'm going to puke. 

Their portions are HUGE, which is good since I guess they give you your moneys worth? But I wish they had a Small and a Regular size because I really don't need to be eating that much ice cream/cookies/brownies. 

I've gotten the brownie one, cookies and cream, and tried the Butterscotch one. They're all really good, just depends what you're in the mood for. Super decadent, I do recommend splitting it with someone else. 

The next one I want to try is the banana split!!! I come here like once a year so I'll be saving my tummy for it :)
author: Harmony L.

description:
Cute dessert place! We were hunting for several popular tourist places and this place was one of it. 

Ordered Muir Woods and Chocolate Ice Cream Float. Muir Woods was delicious!! Black cherry vanilla ice cream with hot fudge. Portion was good for two people. 

Chocolate Ice Cream Float wasn't that great. 

I liked the fact that chocolate shop is right  next to the dessert place. I ended up buying several gifts for family and friends. 

Service (*) - Service on the other hand was very poor. Cashier was busy gossiping with her co workers and made us and other customers wait in the line for several minutes. I would have give four star but definitely was not satisfied with Ghirardelli employees.
author: Sophie L.

description:
Came to ghiradelli square to indulge in some chocolate love. The shop has tons of chocolate and sweet things. 

We tried the banana split and it was absolutely delicious. The chocolate was creamy, strawberry was sweet, and the vanilla was perfect. 

The banana split came in its boat that was just snug fit so some of the melted ice cream flooded over bit there were a ton of napkins nearby. 

It took some time but that's understandable since the place is a tourist attraction.
author: Liz C.

description: I really wanted their famous ice cream sundae but being a visitor from NYC's hot and humid summers, I was not used to the cold and breezy SF nights and opted in for a hot chocolate instead - and my goodness, it was absolutely delicious!! So worth waiting the line for!! The hot chocolate was also great for keeping my hands warm lol! Yum yum yum!! Highly recommend it.
author: Chenda H.

description:
Gonna keep this short and sweet (hah, get it?):

Sundae was very very good. Not amazing, but pretty damn good.
We got in line, and within 15 minutes we found a seat and were already eating. The floors were a little dirty, and there was some trash. But it was a great experience overall.
author: Jake C.

description:
After our fine dinner at Scoma's, Diane and I hiked up Russian Hill to enjoy a sumptuous dessert: Ghirardelli's classic two-scoop Hot Fudge Sundae.  Festooned with a plump cherry, a few chopped almonds, and heavenly whipped cream on top, and large scoops of cold Vanilla Ice Cream riddled with several rich veins of Hot Fudge, this was a true treat.  Service was friendly and swift.  

Although the Hot Fudge was more bitter than sweet, in all other respects our shared sundae provided an excellent end to a very enjoyable night in the vicinity of fabled Fisherman's Wharf.   

A solid 4-1/2 stars overall!
author: Dennis T.

description: Why or who wouldn't give this 5 stars!! Maybe just a little more caramel!! The line was out of the door...however the service was fast!
author: Tk R.

description: Excellent!  Worth it's weight in Chocolate and more!  Great staff, ice cream Sunday is World Famous!
author: Daniel M.

description: Every time I am in SF I get a chocolate craving and have to visit Ghirardelli chocolate shop and ice cream parlor. This time my experience was not that great. First of all, its hard to find parking, so plan on paying at the meter or high priced parking garages. They definitely pray on the tourists. Take Uber or Lyft instead. After placing our order it is very hard to find a table. They forgot about our order so we waited a lot longer than necessary. Our overpriced sundae and cocoa was way too sweet and not worth the wait, since we had to worry about getting back to the car because the meter was going to expire. If you are looking for ice cream in the city, you may want to go to a neighborhood icecream shop away from the tourist area for a more layer back and enjoyable experience.
author: Sherri P.

description:
Really cool atmosphere,  but that's where the good stops.   Total tourist trap.   Chocolate that you can buy at Walmart for $2.5 costs $5.

Unfortunately I got talked into buying an ice cream sunday and hot chocolate to split with my family....And spent $20!! Ice cream and hot coco were good,  but not $20 good.   I would have paid $10, maybe. 

Go to the square and keep walking to the next ice cream shop :)
author: Justin T.

description: Sinfully wonderful ice cream shop with the best sundays that I have ever eaten. The salted caramel brownie sunday has just the right balance of sweet with pops of salt crystals. It is large enough for two to happily split but not too big for one, but it would be very filling. If you dine in the ice cream is served in glass and metal dishes. They also have a water station so you can fill up your water bottle or get a small cup. I have come here several times while visiting the wharf on a lazy weekend. The shop itself does not have a bathroom but one can be found in the square and it is clean and well maintained. The store has two areas to sit, one by the chocolate display and one by the windows, and they also have the square itself with a lovely mermaid fountain. This is truly a fun place to swing by on a weekend out.
author: Lacy C.

description: Sundaes to DIE for!!! If I wouldn't get fat from eating ice cream all day every day, I would eat a Ghirardelli Sundae all day every day. These things are awesome and recommended to all! The way the shop is set up is pretty cool as well and you can see the chocolate being mixed in the back of the space. Super trendy and super delicious!
author: Scott B.

description:
OM NOM NOM. Stuffing my face with chocolate and ice cream! 

I know this place is such a tourist trap, but every time I go to San Francisco, I visit Ghirardelli to get a chocolate sample from the employee at the entrance. I also often get a sundae. (Hint: If you go after 1pm, the upstairs cashier is open. There are shorter lines at that entrance as well as another employee giving out chocolate samples!). 

You're probably thinking, "But Howard, my arteries!! Chocolate and ice cream with toffee, butterscotch, and caramel? How will I survive?!" Hey, you're life may have been cut a little bit shorter by a visit to this place, but it definitely got a lot tastier! 

Just a quick price note: Sundaes are about $10 each and the chocolate isn't cheap either. There are many SF guides out there that have a 10% off coupon for purchases at Ghirardelli. Plus if you purchase a MUNI multi-day pass, a multi-use coupon is also printed in it.
author: Howard L.

description: I probably haven't been here in over 10 years. We stopped into the ground level shop for some ice cream. We all didn't want to overindulge so we all got a single scoop. Some of us also had the waffle cone too but it wasn't the best that day. Slightly undercooked so it wasn't very crunchy. I had the chocolate chip ice cream with the regular milk chocolate fudge. Gotto have the Ghiradelli chocolate fudge on top. It was great. A perfect amount for me to go with my scoop. But some complained it wasn't enough or it was too much. The line seemed way shorter at the ground level shop versus the one upstairs. Didn't see the set up upstairs but the downstairs one had a few tables outside. And inside was just meant for ordering (ie no place to sit). It was great. But next time, when it's warmer and we're hungrier, a sundae is in our future for sure.
author: Alison W.

description:
Eat here. 

Fantastic desserts. The chocolate fudge is enough reason to wait in line. If they sold it by the bucket, I would order two. 

If you don't want ice cream the sea salt hot chocolate will keep you warm on a chilly San Francisco day. 

The service is speedy whether you're here or to go. The only worry should be about whether or not you can find a seat inside. Wish it were a bigger place.
author: Hayley P.

description:
There is no bad sundae at Ghirardelli.  Not much to complain about other than maybe the crowds during the height of tourist season.  It can be a liitle hard to find seating but with a little waiting and maneuvering it is manageable.

Customer service is pretty good by the staff considering the environment they have to work in day to day.
author: Dana B.

description:
Love ice-cream, chocolate drinks and all
Chocolates.

Service is extremely slow. Average wait was 30 Mins. Compared to customers, it is crowded and not enough space to accommodate all.
author: Prasad D.

description:
Enjoyed the espresso escape ice cream $13.49 incl. tax. Perfect for 2 people.
Nice seating area overlooking the bay.
author: Esther R.

description:
Yes you have arrived at Chocolate Heaven ! LOL We had the espresso chocolate thingy it was chocolate Goodness ! LOL How can you go wrong ! Combining coffee and chocolate !  
We will always come back here ! Parking is a problem in the area. you might haft to drive around for a while to find a stall.
author: Brent K.

description:
I scream for Ghirardelli ice cream!

Yes, it's a tourist trap but who cares?  You can't go to Ghiraredlli Square without squeezing your way into this shop, grab some samples, and get some overpriced ice cream!  Plus it's Ghirardelli so uh, yum?  Anyways, you come here for the novelty and the experience.  The actual ice cream isn't that much better than any other joint although I am compelled to say the chocolate is richer but that could just be because you're in Ghirardelli.  Bah!  Service is a bit lacking but this place is constantly packed.  I waited almost 30-minutes to get my ice cream in a waffle bowl but it was a Friday night so it's understandable.  The atmosphere here is laid-back and casual and if you don't want to eat inside, the courtyard area and the concrete stairs facing the bay are always good options.  

Do you have to stop in?  No.  Should you though?  Of course!
author: Joyce W.

description: Nothing more than a tourist attraction. Always crowded and noisy. I would suggest anyone to just a walk, buy some chocolates and get out. The ice creams are nothing special and I find the ice cream menu is so regular. SF has lot more better places for an ice cream.
author: Sharan N.

description: Great experience...the treasure island desert melted in my mouth. Pure chocolate and vanilla ice cream goodness. Unfortunately the server seemed like she hated her job and didn't bring good vibes to our table. Also the price is a bit steep for a big sundae. But it's premier desert in The City..so what do you expect...if you're on the wharf, this is highly recommended !
author: Danny D.

description:
I'm not even that super into to chocolate and this place was freaking great!!!

I shopped in that chocolate store for quite awhile looking for treats for me and for my chocolate lovin granny.  Of course the prices are a little too high, but I was able to find something for both of us. It was fun to chocolate shop -- who knew?!

It was so cool so see open vats of mixing chocolate in the café area. Who wouldn't look at pools of chocolate and dream of skinny dipping in THAT. I was so surprised it's as open as it is and reachable if I stretched out to it could totally touch it. Is that really the chocolate that people eat? Check it out for yourselves!

Really, this would be a spot I'd take any chocolate lover or even chocolate "liker"!
author: Pamela M.

description: Glenn was extremely nice and provided excellent customer service. We ordered cones and apparently, they ran out of our specific cone, so I told one of the waiters and a few minutes later Glenn came over with a great attitude and offered to help fix our order. He also offered to credit the difference. Even though we had an issue with our order, the experience was very positive.
author: Roman O.

description: Came here on a Sunday night, the place wasn't too crowded inside.  I had a banana split and my friend had a strawberry shake.  It was good but I was disappointed that they had forgotten to put any hot fudge on top of my banana split- it only had strawberry and pineapple on top.  They brought me a small cup of hot fudge on the side.  I could only manage to eat about 1/3 of it before I was stuffed.  Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
My Boyf is crazy for chocolate I don't care so much for it but he wanted to stop in and get something in the form of a Ghirardelli ice cream treat. On a Monday early evening in Late October not very busy but got a seat inside near the water station. -you'll need lots of water with your sweet treats. There are some live contraptions that show you how the chocolate was made not sure if this is the actual stuff they use in the treats or for show. I'm thinking show. 
We waited a few minutes for our caramel something chocolate something ice cream to arrive. -Sea salt caramel  ice cream sundae -oh yeah. It was just as expected - expensive overrated ice cream sundae. I think it was over $9-10 enough for 2 maybe 3 but like I said I wouldn't have stopped in for myself. 
If your into this sort of diabetic coma inducing concoctions  feel free -good thing we walked around all day. 

Pro Tip: The chocolates here are more expensive than at say Target (they have a bigger variety here though ) so just go to all the little Ghirardelli stores. They give you samples as you walk in. It's all you need and nothing tastes better than free!
author: Tasia C.

description:
i try and go here every other time i go to SF in the daytime. I dont go to SF that often in the daytime, mostly at nighttt! (; love the nightlife. 

Gotta find parking in SF, then you gotta wait in the long line that goes out the door (but it goes by pretty fast -- and theres free samples next door!), order your ice cream and then find a seat in the ridiculously packed place! big hassle. then the wait for your ice cream continues forever. 

I heard their assortment of hot chocolate is pretty amazing here, but i havent tried it yet. I've only had their ice creams! A little pricey on the side, but still tasty if you love chocolate and ice cream! They also put a lot of whipped cream! yummm. pretty much the best place to get hot fudge sundae! and they give you a lot.

i have gotten the presido passion, the domingo, and the regular hot fudge sundae. i have tried the cable car and the sundae on the chocolate waffle bowl. mint chocolate ice cream is good too (: my favorite has got to to be the domingo because the banana really compliments the chocolate and the ice cream, plus its also good and refreshing when you cant handle allll that sweet gooey chocolate
author: Vivian H.

description: What's a trip to San Francisco without visiting Ghiradelli Square and visiting the chocolate store?  This is the store to visit.  There are many gifts to buy, however they do not carry the individual chocolates nor do they gave samples when you walk in.  (If they do I completely missed it!)
author: Darylynn D.

description:
The boyfriend and I went on vacation last May and decided to act like an old couple on a Friday night. We took the cable car from Union Square down to the very last stop (I forget which station this was called, forgive me for I am only a tourist). While figuring out where to go, we saw the Ghirardelli sign from a distance and decided to walk over. Mind you, we walked in at around 11:35PM and they were all trying to close up shop but everyone was still so nice and friendly that I wouldn't have known that they were trying to close! The only giveaway was the fact that they were cleaning out espresso machines and wiping down surfaces.

Anyway, we got two salted caramel hot chocolates to sip on during the cable car ride back since it was definitely chilly that night. The order was ready and ohmygosh, that was probably the best hot cocoa I've ever had! It was the right mix of sweet and salty. 

They also gave the boyfriend and I free brownies.. I guess we were staring at it and the lady noticed haha!
author: Sara P.

description:
We went here as part of our usual hang out place and this one never fails us.. A lot of crowd on a saturday late afternoon and it was exciting.. We ordered Midnight Reverie Fountain Ice cream and it was delicious.. While walking at the beach we noticed our ice cream had mint in it and we knew that the cashier and server made a mistake on our order coz we ordered Midnight Reverie and Not Mint Bliss.. But thats fine, still delish but hopefully they wont make any mistake again esp if the prices differ... 
Quick service, great presentation and the smell of the choco aroma is inviting.. The crowd says it all, a place you wanna go back to..
Could have given 5 stars except for the mistake on our orders.. (I hate mint and i prefer dark choco but that's fine)
author: Kash D.

description:
One of my favorite places for ice cream!

Self-seating. If you have an extra person, then I definitely recommend to have this person to go inside first to find a table while you wait in line to order. Next, find the correct line and stand in it. Sometimes there's another line to get into the chocolate store. That's not the correct line. The lines to order can get a little long because this is a tourist attraction. Don't get discouraged. Line moves fast.

Love their Hot Fudge Sundae. The chocolate fudge tastes amazing. "World Famous" for a reason!

Water station is at the middle of the restaurant. I successfully carried 5 cups of water to my table in one go. Not recommended.

They have a little widget demo in the back showing how they make their chocolate.

They have an underground structure for parking, and they will validate for an hour with a $20 purchase. Otherwise it costs an arm and a leg, plus your first-born.
author: Ray I.

description:
Want to satisfy your sweet tooth craving? Well my friends, you have come to the right place. Ghirardelli has something for everyone: ice cream, chocolate, sundaes, hot fudge, soda pop, hot drinks, cold drinks... and well, you get the point. It can get a little busy here with all the tourists and all but it is a place well worth visiting when you are in the city. 

You order at the front, they give you a number, you find a seat and then wait for your order to be delivered. It wasn't too busy where I couldn't find a seat but there was a lot of people in there. My girlfriend and I shared the warm brownie sundae and large cappuccino. The warm brownie sundae was big enough to share yet not too big where we couldn't finish it. Everything about the sundae was exemplary. The brownie was moist and perfectly balanced by the vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and chopped almonds. The cappuccino had a good amount of frothiness to it although the presentation could have been better. Total was around $16 which is a bit pricey. Overall a great experience. 

On your way out, don't forget your free sample of Ghirardelli squares.
author: Maria D.

description:
Some times us locals have to do the tourist thing. My husband said he has never been to this Ghirardelli so we hopped on the 101 can came for dessert. The line was out the door but it went by pretty quickly. We go to the one in Monterey so no surprise on the taste. Great as always!

While waiting we watched the old timey chocolate machines. It was really cool to see the steps Ghirardelli goes through to make their famous chocolate. After we grabbed our to go sundaes and sat outside. 

Parking was easy at night. We parked by park and walked up.
author: Malia W.

description:
Chocolate heaven !!! 
Unforgettable feeling and taste! 
Absolutely loved it and will revisit 

Highly recommended
author: Ovsick H.

description:
These are my favorite things about coming to Ghirardelli Chocolate for dessert:

1. ice cream is creamy, fresh and delicious
2. super fresh whipped cream
3. super delicious hot chocolate fudge
4. quick turnover in seating
5. free parking on Bay street
6. 10% discount if you have a MUNI one day passport pass or a cable car ticket
7. service is prompt

My not so favorite things are:

1. parking can be difficult to find
2. it can be very busy with long lines
3. it can get expensive

Are the not so favorite things going to keep me from coming back? NO WAY! Love it here!
author: Janet E.

description:
If you're in search for something sweet don't look any further.. You've got to come here! We came in for some ice cream scoops and had the Ghirardelli Chocolate, cookie doh and classic vanilla. 

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE GHIRARDELLI   CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM. It's a wonderful melted chocolate lovers dream! 

Unfortunately I don't have a picture to go alongside my review... RIP to the picture I could have taken.. 

The location is a little walk up the hill but it's San Francisco. The store is always busy with lots of hustle and bustle but the cashier was friendly. 

You must come here-- that's all.
author: Lindsay S.

description: This all speaks for itself. Chocolate wasted.
author: Angella G.

description: The ice cream is ok. However, I asked about a nut allergy in a topping, and they only told me that it has tree nuts. I checked and it doesn't appear to have any actual nuts, I'm guessing it's just made in a facility with tree nuts. Know your product that you sell, even if you don't make it yourselves.
author: Moodie F.

description:
Heaven for all you ice cream fans. Our group of 6 came here to get the Earthquake. It was a lot. Place is pretty packed especially on the weekends. Seating can be very hard to find but just hawk down a table and swoop on into the seat the moment they get up. They also give you free chocolate when you walk into the gift shop! Do note though that the chocolate wrapper is cut open so you kind of have to eat it. I guess they do that so you're not super cheap and take a bunch to wrap as a gift instead of paying $20 for one bag of chocolate. 

It is very much walkable from Fisherman's Warf so save the hassle of driving a bit more and then looking for parking and just take the exercise and walk there.
author: Binh T.

description:
This places always smells delicious, and it tastes even better! I can barely eat all of their sundaes, but every bite is chocolate decadence. Well worth the money, and there are plenty of restaurants  in Fisherman's Warf to go to after, because obviously I eat dessert before my dinner :)

If I had a complaint, it is sometimes its hard to find seating. On busy, sunny days, you have to find a table and quick.
author: Bryan M.

description: Nothing more than a tourist trap. If this is your first visit then I recommend going here just to check it off the list. There is no value in going the second time unless you want to spend at least an hour standing in queue to eat an half melted ice cream on sticky tables. Expect zero customer service.
author: Uday M.

description:
I ordered an Espresso chip scoop with dark chocolate fudge!!! I love it! The espresso chip has bits of chocolate on it and it has a rich, deep coffee flavor. It just wakes you up.

I love dark chocolate and this fudge didn't disappoint! I would want to order it again! I just love it! I go crazy over ghirardelli chocolate fudge! Yummy!
author: Clarice Colleen M.

description:
Nothing like ice cream on a cool San Francisco day. It's not just me that craves ice cream when it's cold, right?

P.s. Waffle cone all the way!
author: Laura S.

description: The Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop is a must stop when you're in San Francisco. Make sure to check in on Yelp to receive a discount off of a purchase of any sundae. I recommend the Sea Salt!  The historic building is a great location for a selfie or group picture.  Make sure to visit either early or late at night so you can find a spot to park.  Most of the are has paid parking and ranges anywhere from $5-$40, so plan accordingly. Don't forget to pick up a sample from the chocolate shop prior to ordering ice cream!  Their staff are very attentive and greet you with a smile.  When we left, I made sure to leave a tip for the older lady who delivered our ice cream.  Also, an older man said thanks for visiting, come back soon!  Loved the hospitality from the Bay Area.  Stay Classy San Francisco!
author: Arnel D.

description:
Service here is great and quick. If you have a sweet tooth this is definitely the place to be. The choice selection is great.

They were giving free samples of mini caramel size. Noms while the wait to order. 

I got the strawberry fudge sundae and mango smooth. 

It's two floors. Bottom floor has more seating area and bigger gift shop area. You can see the chocolate being made as well! Top floor you get quicker service, but not as many tables for seating.
author: Corie L.

description: Hot fudge sundae was great.  But don't wait in long line -- look outside on the patio for the cart on wheels serving the same treats.
author: C L.

description: After waiting for 30 minutes and letting the ice cream preparer know about it twice, and letting our ice cream thawing for 5 minutes, finally we got our half melted Strike it Poor. Worse 12 bucks ever spent.
author: Ignatius R.

description:
Chocolate lovers paradise! this location has sitting area with windows overlooking the bay.  Very nice! You are immediately drawn to the aroma of the ice cream shop - how can you NOT buy some ice cream? 

The desserts are rich and very sweet but so delicious.  The portions, depending on what you decide to order are good for 2-3 people depending on how much your stomach is craving for sweets. The salted caramel sundae and cookie brownie sundae were so good!  

They also give you some free samples on your way in and out.
author: Bernadette S.

description: This place is great especially when it comes to being a tourists - you will always find a lot of them here. They have a variety of different chocolates here and so many choices to choice from. It is on the pricey side and you can expect to spend close to $30 for two desserts. This place is always packed especially after dinner and everyone is looking for an over priced desert to have, because of this finding a seat is hit or miss but luckily they have two floors to choose from. Parking around here is terrible but if you are lucky you will find a spot. Check this place out if you haven't already and check it out if you are visiting SF for the first time cos apparently it's the pit stop to make if you are here! But then again who would want to pass up 1st class rich chocolate/desserts?
author: Anne R.

description:
Good ice cream and chocolate. They get total overwhelmed though when it gets crowded. 
The hot fudge sundae and the giant chocolate chip cookies are great. However there are some misses too like the butterscotch sundae which is just way way too sweet for my (very) sweet tooth and the caramel milkshake wasn't great either.
author: Isa T.

description: My 2 year old daughter and I had a great experience here.  Waltzed right in (no people there on a Wednesday morning) and checked out a small exhibit showing the chocolate making process.  Then we proceeded to the register, where we ordered a hot cocoa.  The server promptly brought it over to our table and was very attentive to us.  He gave my daughter a chocolate and also brought over a little cup so we could drink from separate cups.  A great visit!
author: Chris L.

description:
Start the WWE/NHL chants!! "Overrated" tun tun tun tun tun tun!!!

They have 2 locations of Ghiraradelli in the square, you have the original, shit show one, and a newer, not as busy location on the right side of the square. Your average sundae will cost $10 or so. If you choose to "dine in", take a number and someone will "find" you. The average wait time for your ice cream on a weekend or holiday day is 25 minutes so by the time you get your ice cream its melted and just a mess. 

Advise, get your ice cream in a cone and walk around. SF has better ice cream parloooooors.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
RUN AWAY: Oh my god, what the hell happened to this place???  I have fond memories from childhood when I was so small the sundaes looked bigger than my head to being a teenager and sharing one with 3 friends and still barely finishing.

Sadly, this weekend, 4 (nearly) middle aged adults came into this tourist trap (because, really, that's all it is anymore) for a late night fountain snack (yes, at our age, 11pm is late night now...).  What we found was the smell of old milk, sticky tables, chairs, and floors, and a 15 minute wait after we sat down for a banana split and ONE coffee.  

The split itself was the saddest looking, half melted, smallest disappointment of a "dessert" EVER. And at $9.75?!?! Where was the hot fudge?? Oh, that little drizzle at the bottom of the bowl, was that it?  There were three scoops of ice cream in there?? Could've fooled us, it looked like a puddle of lumpy soup hidden by three MOUNDS of whipped cream from a can. 

I'm so disappointed it's palpable. Next time, if it's before 11pm, do yourself a favor and head to Swensens on Hyde.  The ice cream is MUCH better, cheaper, and is a TRUE San Francisco Institution, not this bullshit.
author: Alice L.

description:
[Review #116]

Whenever I'm in San Francisco, I almost always stop at Ghirardelli's to have some ice cream (during spring & summer), hot chocolate (during winter), or to pick-up some chocolate (always) for my family & friends. =)

I love the welcoming smiles & free chocolate tastings when you enter the shop. Step in the threshold & take a deep breath... & let the heavenly chocolate aromas envelope your senses. Mmm... You might need this cleansing breath as this shop can/will get jam-packed like sardines. :-O

We usually stick to 3 sundaes: Crissy Fields (love cookies 'n cream ice cream; this ice cream in anything is a MUST), Ocean Beach (you can never go wrong sea salt & caramel), Muir Woods (black cherry vanilla ice cream is another family fav).

I always leave with a few of the white chocolate raspberry bars (my fav... a bit sweet, a bit tart - it's a great flavor combination). I'm not a big dark chocolate fan, as this is considered real chocolate. The higher % of cacao, the better... there's even health benefits for eating dark chocolate, so you no longer need to give an excuse for inhaling all that delicious chocolate. LOL ;-)

Other Delectable Picks: Milk & Caramel Filled Bar, Milk Chocolate Covered Raisins, Milk Chocolate Malt Balls, Milk Chocolate Covered Cherries, Sweet Ground Cocoa, Sweet Ground Chocolate & Cocoa, Sea Salt & Almonds Milk Chocolate Bar, & Hearts in S.F. Bars Collection (in addition to a yummy treat, a portion of the proceeds goes to the San Francisco General Hospital Foundation).
