I love Ghirardelli's but I hate 2 things about this shop: parking (the lack thereof) & crowds (it can be a tight fit so I rather not leisurely enjoy my sundae indoors while being elbowed by people milling about). :-|

This shop has a little something for everyone... come, eat, & savor a bit (or a lot) of chocolate bliss! Mmm... ;-)
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Being a local in SF definitely has its perks, like having Ghiradelli being a stone's throw away for instance. Today after dinner, I was craving for a sundae. Not just any sundae - not even McD's $1 sundae! I wanted a delicious, filling, fresh hot sundae (with bananas) from Ghiradelli square. So after dinner my partner and I made the short drive to the ice cream shop, since I saw that they closed on midnight! 

Not thinking that it was Friday and summertime, we walked up and there was literally a line snaked all the way halfway to McCormick's & Kuleto's. We braved the cold (the yoosh)and it literally only took us 10 minutes to get to the front of the line. Considering the length of it, 10 minutes really wasn't too bad. We decided to take our ice cream to go (FYI: even though you want to take your ice cream to go you still have to stand in the same line as the in-house diners)

My favorite to order is the domingo - its basically the basic ice cream sundae with vanilla ice cream, loads of hot fudge, bananas, fresh whipped cream, and a cherry on top - if you check in on yelp you do get $1 or 10% off your bill! 

Lastly, there is a fire pit and outdoor heating when you go up towards the other Ghiradelli shop - not too many people know about this so it's kind of a secret ;)
author: Kathleene E.

description: Too expensive for the small cup of too-sweet-chocolate that I've ordered. Nothing out of this world to be that well known.
author: Elia C.

description: Yummy ice cream and great staff! I love coming here. There's nothing better than Ghiradelli!
author: DVictoria C.

description:
I was so excited to bring my daughter here for some ice cream and all I can say is never again. 

As soon as I walked in the staff were just talking to each other not paying attention to the customers who wanted to order ice cream. After we got our order which was $15 for one ice cream. 

When we went to sit down the place just seemed very dirty. Our table was dirty tables that were not in use were dirty. staff were just standing around talking to each other. Besides the staff that were really working. 

I did find it gross that even though staff have their gloves on they are touching everything with those gloves, garbage your ice cream, your spoon they hand to you. I am sorry but this was just not clean and I had to make a review.
author: Sky P.

description:
Huge tourist trap with medioce ice-cream

Walked in at around 4pm on a Saturday afternoon and the place was packed liked sardines! There's a top and bottom floor. It was confusing trying to figure out where to place your order, so that you can sit and eat and where the to-go-order line was. Instead, we happen to see a sign just outside the super long line for placing orders that read that there's a second ice cream shop just 1 minute walk away in Ghiradelli square. So b/c we're highly efficient and smart people, we decided to get ice cream there. 

The second shop was much less congested but just as nice! We placed our order immediately (very short line) and there was AMPLE seating outside in their patio. If you're going with a large group/family, I'd highly recommend going to the second shop b/c it's less congested and tons of seating!

I wanted to try both their cookies n' cream ice cream and their mango sherbet, so I asked if I can have 1 scoop of each in different goblets (who wants to mix ice cream w/ sherbet?!). When I requested 2 separate goblets, the cashier told me no, and that it's not possible. Regardless, I proceeded with the order and I was shocked when he told me that my total was $9.50!! for 2 scoops of ice cream?! wth! I gave in b/c I wanted to try both, was on vacay and just didn't feel like making a fuss of things! He handed me a place holder with a number, so that our waiter can bring us our ice cream.

It took nearly 15 minutes for our server to bring our ice cream to us (we were sitting outside on the patio and we made sure our place holder number was visible). When it finally came:
1. the serving size is HUGE! no wonder my total for 2 scoops of ice cream was $9! Each scoop could have clearly been 2 scoops each! So definitely just get one scoop for 2 people.
2. they did bring my sherbet and cookies n' cream in 2 separate goblets, which made me happy =)
3. most of our ice cream was 60% melted by the time we got it!! HUGE CON! We also ordered a chocolate fudge sundae, which wasn't fun to eat b/c it was pretty much watery! my sherbet turned into a smoothie with a ping-pong size of actual sherbet visible in the middle. My cookies n' cream was milk-shake status. Huge let down!!! We were so pissed that we waited this long for melted ice cream!

Don't come to ghiradelli thinking you're going to get amazing ice cream like Haagan Daaz or other mom/pop ice cream shops. The ice cream tastes mediocre at best...similar to ice cream you get at any grocery store. 

If I had to do it over again, I would go to the second shop (1 min away from the original shop), but place my order to-go so that I don't get partially melted ice cream. And I'd only order 1 scoop! I would not come back b/c the ice cream wasn't anything special. Definitely over-priced tourist crap that we all fall for.

Lastly, the free samples of packaged ghiradelli squares tastes EXACTLY like the ones you get at your grocery store. There is no discernible difference b/w chocolate from "the original ghiradelli shop" and the ghiradelli packaged chocolate at walmart or at your mall. Sorry if I popped your fantasy bubble
author: Ro P.

description:
Who doesn't love ice cream?! Well, I'm a huge fan even though I try to eat "healthy"... or so I like to think.

This place has it all! Chocolate, chocolate, chocolate, and did I mention chocolate?! You can find whatever you need here, but if you're hungry, they definitely will fill your stomach with some Ghirardelli goodness! Not to mention they have every flavor imaginable of their chocolates. If you're looking for chocolate for baking purposes, you'll find it here!

FOOD - 5 Stars: We had a couple of desserts and I was pleasantly surprised because we ordered two kinds of ice cream:

- Black Cherry Vanilla Ice Cream in a Waffle Bowl - This was really rich and the black cherry flavor shined through. Also, you can never go wrong with a waffle bowl! I think sometimes I just order ice cream for the waffle cone or bowl. Ain't nothin wrong with that!

- Lemon Sorbet with Pineapple, Almonds, and Candied Ginger - I remember going to the San Diego location and was slightly disappointed when I didn't see any lactose free options. So, the moment I saw this, I knew I had to try it! The lemon sorbet was full of flavor with every bite. The pieces of sweet pineapple and the crunch of almonds gave it some awesome texture and added sweetness to counter balance the sourness of the lemon. To top it off, the candied ginger, which I was hesitant to eat, was really delicious. I wanted to order another dessert!

SERVICE - 3 Stars: The service is friendly, but I don't know if they were understaffed that day, but it took at least 15-20 minutes to get our order. There were so many people waiting around and only 1 or 2 people manning the area to take orders and make them.

ATMOSPHERE - 5 Stars: This is a pretty busy spot especially with tourist, but it's a nice break from your day outside especially when it's hot. The moment you walk-in, they're basically throwing samples of chocolate at you! So, that can only brighten your day! It was really nice to relax, talk, and eat in here. We even made some friends with the next table... that's how cool the atmosphere was here.

RECOMMENDATION: I'm huge fan of Ghirardelli chocolate and I really wish they had more locations like this open everyday. I'm in LA and there isn't one that's conveniently close by, but you know when I do see one, I will definitely stop in and get my fill!
author: Hugh H.

description:
I was really underwhelmed with the quality of the ice cream. We chose the Treasure Island Ice Cream Sundae ("Vanilla ice cream paired with our warm Ghirardelli Chocolate Brownie and smothered with handmade hot fudge. Topped with whipped cream, chopped almonds and a cherry;" $10.95) and it was pretty bland and unimpressive. The actual brownie was not actually that warm, but it was definitely the best part as the hot fudge was thin/barely there and the ice cream was vanilla. (I understand that Ghiradelli is a chocolate company, not an ice cream one, but would it hurt to partner up with an ice cream vendor or something to add a few flavors?)

Because of the quality of the sundae, the expensive price, and the service, which was (somewhat understandably) pretty slow, I would not recommend getting your dessert at Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop.
author: Stephanie D.

description: The line is ridiculously long, no matter the day, no matter the time. But it's one of those places you have to go to when you're in SF. We ordered two sundaes, and when the waiter came to our table, he brought us a complimentary milk shake as well. What a treat! :)
author: Tanzina I.

description:
Ghirardelli Square was a legend of my youth and an icon in the world of chocolate confection and ice cream excellence. I was here when I was but a lad,. I came here as young man. And now as father, I still have a gleam in my eye when I see this place If you are doing a tour of the wharf, the pier or even the cruise ships to Alcatraz, this is a must stop visit to one of the all time shrines of sweets across the world.

Last time there, we hit the ice cream first. The place is self-seating so if you have an extra person, send them to find a table while you wait order in that often well populated line. Make sure you get in the correct line and both are usually lengthy. One will be for the ice cream shop and the other for the chocolate shop. Remember: this is a tourist attraction of great notoriety but don't be dismayed. The lines will move quickly. The atmosphere is bustling and a bit tight in some floor places but always comfortable and clean. If you dig watching the process, they will run the equipment in the ice cream section and show how it's done. Young and old, it's always cool to check it out.

We ordered sundaes. Our boy had a his version of a chocolate sundae and I shared a Crissy Field. The prices are steep for sure but you come here expecting that because you're at Ghirardelli Square for the experience. The Crissy Field is an amazing sundae with three scoops of premium ice cream topped with cookie crumbles, whip cream and their famous milk chocolate squares. The presentation is beautiful and the taste will blow you away.

If you are visiting, the chocolate shop must be visited especially since it is right next door and connected to the ice cream shop. Their entire selection can be had at various quantities. The packaging and display is confectionery perfect. And because you're visiting, get flavors and treats that are not available in your neighborhood. You'll be glad you did.

What's my bottom line? Good? Better than good! I'm coming back on my next visit. My actual rating is a solid 5.0 stars because a chocolate god with its own ice cream joint and chocolate making show is actually way over a 5.0...
author: Aloysius C.

description: Brought my wife here after getting lunch at fog harbor...the line was pretty long, we had to wait about 15-20 minutes before we could order, but it was worth the wait! We shared the Chrissy Field sundae, which had actual fresh baked cookie pieces in there...can't wait to come back!
author: Danny N.

description: I had the best chocolate brownie ice cream sundae the day i visited Ghirardelli in April 2016 . There were two young African American male  employee's working on the day i was there and the service was excellent. Good job guys Thank You.
author: Sharna B.

description:
One does not come to San Francisco without making a stop here, delicious ice cream creations and delicious chocolate. 

Need I say more?
author: Shareen D.

description: Why so many 5 stars!?! Well how can you give this place a one especially with all those sweets!!!
author: Shawn T.

description:
Super sweet & delicious ice cream! 

This is definitely a go-to spot for tourists that are roaming around the Fisherman's Wharf area. I've come here often and never was there a time where I didn't have to wait. This place gets SUPER packed! I've always ordered their banana split sundae.  They have a handful of ice cream choices to choose from - all which are very good. During my last visit, there was a gal at the door handing out samples of Ghiradelli caramel squares; kudos for that.  

You're definitely in for a sweet treat if you stop by! :)
author: Mei W.

description: $1 off any sundae when you check in, what could be better?! Always delicious desserts. The sea salt caramel hot chocolate is the BEST!! Friendly service and clean faculty. We always go when we visit San Francisco. We will be back!
author: Jean S.

description:
Is this place a little bit gimmicky? Yes

Is it overrun with tourists from Fisherman's Wharf? Yes

Is it super fun and gluttonous? Definite yes.

If you're out and about and looking for a treat, then I think it's worth stopping in if you're in the neighborhood. It's a fun experience, and the chocolates are delicious, from the ones that they hand out as you walk in the door to the melted fudges on the ice cream. In fact, the rich melted chocolates on the ice creams are the best.

You want my pro tip? Split the one of the sundaes. You'll get all the deliciousness and won't hate yourself quite as much when you leave.

Pro tip #2? There is a second shop in the back of the square that usually isn't nearly as busy as the one in the front.
author: Brent W.

description:
I've been here before and it seems like my experience is always different lol. There was a long line out the door since I went last night, Saturday night, BUT I could not leave SF without getting something from this place. So my BF and I stood in the line for maybe about five mins. Looking over the menu, since I notice they always change it, I saw something new, the Crissy Field. It's cookies and cream ice cream and vanilla ice cream with hot fudge, whipped cream, their chocolate chip cookie crumbles, and two mini dark chocolate pieces. 
We got that. And TBH, it was good, however it's something you could just make @ home. Instead of vanilla we got rocky road. There was too much whipped cream, as my pic shows, and I was kinda disappointed. Like I said tho, it was good! I won't be getting it again however. We also got dark chocolate hot fudge which there wasn't much of on our sundae. 
We waited the normal time to wait for our sundae to come, not like last time where we waited and waited and waited. Our ice cream wasn't melted, it was good.
The girl who took our order was good and nice! She made sure she understood what we got and the change we made. Her name is Niat. 
Of course I will be back lol, but I thought I would share other experience of mine from here.
author: Akemi H.

description:
I have to try really hard to separate sentimental attachment to this location from the review of it as an actual eatery.  I have had ice cream from this spot since I was a tiny tot and honestly, at this point coming here for a sundae is essentially grabbing some ice cream with family present and departed.  If you have that kind of attachment, this is still a great place to go!

As for the food, the ice cream is good, but not phenomenal. Definitely have had better, and it isn't worth going out of the way for it.  The toppings do help out quite a bit...especially the hot fudge.  That is some premo stuff :)

It is a pricey spot, so be prepared for that. I don't think I really got $13 worth of sundae, but it is certainly a tourist spot which explains the price.  That brings me to service and atmosphere...

The line is almost always out the door, down the sidewalk, across the little fountain plaza, and sometimes wrapped back on itself....seriously.  Plan on waiting at least an hour for this experience.  The process is fairly straightforward - wait in line, order when you get inside the doors. If you are dining in - try to find a table (good luck). If you are doing takeout, send the rest of your group outside and try to distract yourself from the crowd by looking at replicas of original chocolate making equipment while you wait another 20 or so minutes.

The whole process is like a sausage factory of tourists, but it is still a little slice of history...and you end up with ice cream, so it could be worse :)
author: Bob F.

description:
Came here craving a tasty cold dessert in SF, and had high hopes because I've heard so many great things about the sundaes! But unfortunately I left very disappointed. 

Ordered the Crissy field, it came out and looked delicious. But after a few bites it just wasn't what I expected, more than half of the sundae was whip cream.. Bummer. There were very few pieces of cookie bits, hardly noticed them on the sundae. The ice cream was just okay, nothing spectacular. And just felt like it was randomly thrown together. I've had better sundaes at cold stone/ben and jerrys.. For half the price.

-1 star for each of the following.

Very crowded all the time. Be prepared to wait.

The sundae tasted bland and more than half of the sundae was whipped cream.

Over priced/hyped. 
Maybe it's just this location, but I know I won't be back to one again.
author: Joe M.

description: This place is a chocolate lover's paradise. There are so many different varieties that I had never heard of that all sound so yummy. They make gift giving easy with so many options of boxes or gift bags. You can even make your own box of assorted chocolates if you prefer a mix of other flavors instead of the ones that are premade. Since we were stopping by before dinner, I didn't want to spoil my appetite by having dessert, but it's definitely on my bucket list for next time. The sundaes looked delicious.
author: Monica V.

description: Kids love the place.  Perfect way to end the evening.
author: Koi K.

description:
Man, do I like chocolate anything--chocolate shake, chocolate ice cream, chocolate milk, chocolate cake, fudge, hot chocolate, chocolate men--okay, I'll stop there. It's true: chocolate is a very touchy subject to me and I squeal a little too much when I see chocolate-covered almost anything.

I first went to the bottom location and it's more of a cafe--Haagen-Dazs-type--and the people are so laid-back, especially the guy. I got a Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate and it was okay. It wasn't hot enough and the chocolate wasn't very thick and smooth. The upstairs location is a much bigger location with everything you can ever imagine from Ghiradelli in all sorts of cutesy packaging. There are tons of different flavors you will probably never ever find elsewhere. A little expensive but I promise it's worth it; Cookies and cream and the Creamy Almond are musts!
author: Sharon T.

description: So many treats to choose from.. First time visitor I will definitely be back and it's so close to the pier can't believe I haven't  gone before now.
author: Sirena L.

description: Very touristy spot for chocolate lovers. Chocolate ice cream was great. Staff was friendly. A lot of chocolate souvenirs to shop. Also, dont forget to try free chocolate samples. ;)
author: Raymond K.

description: The customer service was so good, I wish all businesses were this kind and approachable. They really make you feel welcome and the treats are of course great!! Heavy traffic store though!
author: Alice M.

description: Very good for dessert, the chocolate is awesome as always, the waiting in the long line deserves to the eat the delicious. Large and comfy place, near the pier
author: Adrian B.

description:
There is something to be said about a business that has achieved so much notoriety in more ways that one!  The name Ghirardelli is synonymous with delicious chocolates that have evolved into a countless number of flavor variations that include caramel, salted caramel, mint, peppermint, dark, semi sweet, milk, white, vanilla, etc, etc, etc......

Established as a well known historical land mark of San Francisco, it is located in its very own shopping mall known as Ghirardelli Square, attracting tourists far and wide.  This chocolate shop offers its famous candy in every form expected by the most discerning of chocolate connoisseurs.  As you walk into the entrance, you are given a free sample; often a seasonal flavor of the month or holiday.  (One of my favorites is the peppermint bark):  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MRnBmfC07U4   Then, be sure to have a napkin with you in case your mouth waters, because this place is stocked and beautifully decorated from top to bottom with so many chocolates, that it is literally eye candy for you to explore, as you wander room to room.  Your final stop leads to the ice cream shop where one's sweet indulgences are fulfilled even further... Just be aware that prices aren't exactly inexpensive.  But well worth the splurge once in a while!  

As I said before, you can't help but admire a business that has gained fame and fortune, all based on the cocoa bean.  What better way than offering a product that humans love, maybe even more than sex?      

(But please don't let your dog eat any chocolate; it can be toxic to canines!)        

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s46inWD-Vdk
author: Ida H.

description: My boyfriend had never been here so I took him. We shared the brownie sundae and both of us couldn't finish. Chocolate coma! Love ghiradelli...
author: Alexys E.

description: Had midnight reverie and crissy field. Both are really good but midnight reverie is my favorite. It's so sweet that i feel like i'm having tiny heart attacks every bite but every one of those heart attacks are worth it because it's sooooo goooooood. The chocolAte topping apparently is so sweet that it destroys you so should be avoided till the very end lol
author: Suzy K.

description: Always a good time to have Crissy Fields. Love the cookie at the bottom along with the vanilla, creme and chocolate
author: Jaafar L.

description: Waited in line for over 30 minutes for their "famous" hot fudge sundae, only to receive a cup of mediocre vanilla ice cream and almost no hot fudge!  The young lady who made our sundaes was loudly asking for more hot fudge, but that did not stop her from handing them to me. Disappointing!
author: Richard M.

description:
It was fun to visit.

It was cold at night as my daughter and i visited after eating dinner nearby restaurant. However, we were craving some sweet and visited here. Everytime i visited here, this ice cream shop was always busy. long line formed, mega ice cream, being filled with the people who drooling for World famous Ice cream.

Bloating because of the dinner, we ordered the simple chocolate ice cream cones. It was huge and absolutely sweet and thick favor of chocolate. Sitting at the table inside, it was fun to see some chocolate mill and souvenirs. As we sat the table, one sweet hearted old staffs brought a cup of water to our table. His mustache was whimsical curving upward. When i asked to take photo with him, he made pose with us. And he brought freshly made chocolate dipped waffle cone and gave it to us. He sang a song "San Francisco~~" for us. I felt like i m in the Movie" Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory." Even though we stayed only 20mins, it was lots of fun.
author: Sun H.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: almost impossible to find parking. Over 30 minute wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: normal service. The chocolate machine was cool. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: the chocolate fudge Sunday is a MUST TRY! Best hot fudge I've ever had! Thick, rich, and chocolatety!

_____

Overall Experience
4/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Best Hot Fudge Ever!!! Worth the wait.
author: Elliott N.

description: Ok, so this place is really touristy and there's a line but it moves fast and it's one of those things you have to do while in town. Simply but decadent. The ice cream is delicious and I got the classic world famous sundae while here. It's got the famous Ghiradelli fudge in it and normally I don't love chocolate but the mix of really quality vanilla ice cream & warm fudge was a hit.  The sundae came topped with 3 cherries (my request honored!) and lots of whip cream. One sundae is big enough for two.. be sure to check in on Yelp for a dollar off (it's $10) so not cheap.  Besides the classic sundae, they made a few with black cherry ice cream and also have really yum looking banana splits if that's your thing.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Finally got to experience the Guiradelli Chocolate Square.  Plenty of shops and cafés to explore. Interesting history to learn and be standing on it.  It's a happy place to indulge along with the Fam Bam
author: Jilma B.

description:
Came here during a trip with the USC band. Ate at Boudin and then decided to hit up Ghirardelli Square.

If you've never had Ghirardelli chocolate before, you should definitely try it. I've had better, but as a tourist, the Ghirardelli shop is a cool place to say you've been.

They have a cafe as well, so you can purchase Mochas, Hot Chocolates and even Ice Cream Sundaes.

This time around I just bought some chocolates for the lady that came in a nice little souvenir mug. Price wasn't too bad, and they have a ton of options for gifts there. Obviously the prices of the gifts range on your ability to shell out the cash.

I walked here from Pier 39....definitely got some exercise.
author: Mark S.

description:
Went in with high expectations but turned out a bit of a letdown. I cannot say this is among the top ones. Something fell short - softness, smoothness, essence - I don't know. My experience at a Guylian Chocolate Cafe was much better. 
The place gets quite crowded but service here is very good.
author: Shantanu D.

description:
Came here twice over the course of three days because it's just THAT good. The Sea Salt caramel sundae was amazing -- I loved the crunchy little salt pieces that added a whole other dimension of texture and flavor to the sundae. I kind of wish I had asked for extra salt!

Here's a bonus: You can swap out ice cream flavors in any of their sundaes. I wanted to go hard core chocolate on my sundae so I swapped the vanilla for chocolate. Divine!

Their Sipping Chocolate is thick and super rich -- I honestly couldn't finish it, it was so decadent. But get some chocolate dipped strawberries and dip them into the sipping chocolate as you drink it -- yum!

Sure, it's touristy, but even the locals can't deny that this place makes the best sundaes. Lines move quickly, they deliver the sundaes quickly.

It can get pretty packed later in the evening, but I came in at around 11 a.m. once (sundaes for brunch, anyone?) and it was pretty empty. Love it here!
author: Angelica K.

description: Yes, it's a tourist trap. But it also serves chocolate sundae ice cream on a sunny day with thick chocolate fudge. So they'll get 3 shining stars. 3.5 if there's a button for that. Better get the chocolate somewhere else though.
author: Jenny T.

description: Ghiradelli always comes in clutch! We had the World Famous Sundae and the new Salted Carmel Brownie Sundae. Another great experience at Ghiradelli Square!
author: Kolby S.

description: What an awesome sundae!   We tried the original as well as the one with salted caramel.  The salt was just enough to put that extra taste into the sweets.  We also tried the sherbet sundae and it was also surprisingly really good.   The chocolate fudge was awesome in all three sundaes...
author: D A.

description:
Ghiradelli is one my favorite places to stop by when visiting the city. The chocolate and gift baskets are delectable. They offer you a chocolate sample when you first walk in, but trust me, you'll want more. 

The thing I love most about this location is the coffee! The mochas are so rich and creamy. Always a nice way to warm up from the chill of The Bay.
author: Tracy M.

description: Always a cool place to hit up regardless of whether it's for ice cream or to see the wharf. I just love the vibe... The sundaes are a tad pricey but for the experience, it's worth it. Ohhh...and there's parking. Like...FREE parking at night. PRIME
author: Joshua F.

description: The ice cream is amazing. The fudge is even better. Get fudge on everything you get, but DON'T ask for extra fudge. When I poured it on my already very sweet sundae, I couldn't eat it. Otherwise, you should definitely get fudge on everything. Seating is okay. (Do you see the sarcasm there?) It is hard to find a seat, but it is definitely worth it, though. All in all, this place is good. It is much better than the location at Disneyland.
author: Zooza M.

description: A SF classic, you've got to come here. Some of the best chocolate you could ever taste. The ice cream sundae is amazing! It's also fun to watch them make the chocolate right in front of you.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Wandering around town, we spotted the Ghirardelli sign and Sweetie couldn't think about anything else.  We figured they were closed on a Sunday evening, but nope, open and hopping.  Most of the crowd was on the ice cream side, but we were interested in candy.  We ended up with some sale candy and a cable car ornament souvenir.  Prices are a bit high, but it is good stuff.  Service was very good, from several employees.  There's a nice selection of big and small packages of candy, mugs, books, etc.
author: Mark K.

description: Best Ice Cream and Shakes... Loved it and will be back when visiting San Francisco :)
author: Leslie. C.

description:
Apart from the crowds and touists, Ghirardelli's still has it. Particularly so in the ice cream department. In fact, my salted caramel sundae with espresso and chocolate ice creams was so delightful that I managed to scarf the entire thing down on my own. Reliving my glory days, I tell ya. I was once capable of 15 scoops on Baskinn Robbins's 31 cent day. 

I love the ice cream more than I enjoy the chocolate. I also love when it's crowded and I come in from different entries and get multiple pieces of chocolate. I also quite nejoy the caramel filled chocolate. I don't care for anything else though because it's no longer a novelty for me.

The ice cream though. Still a novelty and still flipping delicious. I don't think you can order anything and go wrong.
author: Radhika P.

description:
Up for the weekend from Southern California and thought we would take the kids to the "Original" chocolate shop, the one that the scale model in Disney California Adventure is modeled after. Right on queue, as we walked in the door, free samples of chocolate are handed out. Great start. 

There were several entrances and several counters to order ice cream (with hot fudge, of course), so we walked around to find the door with the shortest line. We got a sundae, a couple of scoops, a chocolate bar, a jar of hot fudge, and a souvenier hot chocolate mug (filled with chocolate, btw).

At the end, my son wanted just some simple milk chocolate. They didn't sell just a small bar, or a couple squares. They only had the $27 bag. My son (10 years old) wanted to spend his own money, but we thought that was a bit much for him to spend, and didn't really want him eating that much chocolate. 

The reason for my review is for what happened next. The young lady saw our dilemma and told my son to wait for one minute. She returned with a handful of the milk chocolate and just gave it to him. That little gesture was worth the whole trip for me. It is good business practices like that that make lifelong customers. Kudos to you AND your wonderful staff for doing such a great job.
author: Dru M.

description: Life is good, sun was shinning the weather is sweet...had to end the day with Ghirardelli's ice cream Sunday!!!
author: Ace M.

description: Yummy in my tummy. Got the waffle bowl sundae for dessert. The whip cream had a sweetness to it, the ice cream was soft and smooth, and the chocolate warm. Just the perfect combination. Oh and the sprinkle of nuts on top!
author: Thuyvu P.

description:
I was really excited to come here and I thought it was just ok. We had a salted caramel sundae which was an overpriced $11 and the salt was only on the top with the whipped cream! I wish the ice cream was salted caramel or something. 

Keep in mind the sundaes here are HUGE. The two of us girls shared one and then walked 2 miles to work it off. 

I'm glad I came to say I did it but I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Ninette C.

description:
OK, I admit. I'm one of those people who go in and out a few times for the free chocolate. Yes even though the people know it, they don't seem to care. 

This is where I take a lot of people to visiting from out of town. It's almost like a must do. Parking is pretty bad during the day so utilize public transportation if you can. 

I've only had their ice cream two times and both times I definitely ordered a lot more than my stomach could handle. They can get pretty busy and scoping a table can be tough! They have this crazy ice cream platter I think called the Earthquake with like a ton of ice cream. Want to try it but I know I wont be able to finish it before it gets gross.
author: Tommy L.

description:
USEFUL TIP #5: GO TO THE ONE DOWNTOWN. There is a Ghirardelli chocolate shop on Stockton, which stocks all their chocolates and the nice employees will automatically give you a sample of chocolate as soon as you walk in.

USEFUL TIP #6: GO TO THE ONE UNDER WESTFIELD MALL. It's a regular Ghirardelli Sundae shop, you can even get their gigantor EARTHQUAKE there, if you're in the mood for that, AND additionally, you're already downtown, so you can feasibly burn off everything you just ate while shopping in a sugar-induced stupor.
author: Joshua L.

description:
I love visiting this place each time I visit SF! And this time I brought a friend who had never tried this place before. 
I ordered my Warm Brownie Sundae and used my yelp check in offer for $1 off any sundae, and my total was about just under $10.00.

I was disappointed when my ice cream finally came out. It was served to me in a plastic cup (not a glass), and silver spoon The brownie was dry/hard & nowhere near "warm".  Definitely not fresh.  The flavor itself was lacking.. I guess I have high expectations when I pay almost 10 bucks for ice cream.
author: Mia I.

description: Delicious ice cream, as you would expect! The place is incredibly crowded though, but that's also to be expected since it's definitely a tourist trap. The reason I'm only giving it 3 stars is because after placing our order and paying, we realized we forgot to ask for our treat in a waffle cone. The cashier gladly rung us up and we paid the difference. When the ice cream was brought to our table, it wasn't in a waffle cone. The cashier was rude and rolled his eyes when we said he had paid extra for the waffle and he demanded to know which cashier helped us. He couldn't find her and so he asked someone else but he wasn't getting the answer he was looking for and he was very obviously annoyed and not bothering to hide it. Then, he finally just went to grab a waffle and stormed back to our table after having dumped the ice cream in it and pretty much threw our ice cream dish on the table, practically spilling it and stormed away. Horrible service and if it wasn't for the delicious ice cream I wouldn't recommend you come here if you're looking to be treated with common courtesy. Can't beat the tasty ice cream and shakes though.
author: Nellys S.

description:
This place was so fun! I love anything vintage and this place was spot on. The large lettering above the shop and the history makes this a top spot for all visitors! We saved this for last on our long Memorial Day/First Anniversary weekend in San Fran! It was a lot of fun walking around the square and pooping into all the different shops.
  My husband and I shared a salted caramel chocolate sundae...his pick. It was sooooo romantic getting to share this super decadent treat with the hubby. Especially in such a historic building on our vacation. We walked out of there CHOCOLATE WASTED!!!! We shared one and we both could barely move afterwards hahaa! Needless to say, it was the coolest spots to check out and it was totally worth the extra calories! Must do!!! Top of the list place to visit!!
author: Meryl S.

description: This shop deserves atleast a single visit! The place was very colorful and every dessert on the menu appeared delicious. The making of chocolate looked fun and informative! Go in and get indulged in chocolate :)
author: Sukirti S.

description:
First of all, this is a MASSIVE tourist spot in SF, so if you choose to go here, prepare for large crowds, long lines, and overpriced ice cream and chocolate. 

If you go into this place with that mindset, you will greatly increase your chances of enjoying your experience. There's not much you can do about large crowds except for trying to go during a weekday. The staff here does a good job at keeping the long line moving quickly. I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes after ordering to get my ice cream. 

The ice cream is good! Although, I love anything sweet, and I always drench my ice cream in hot fudge--so take from that what you will. 

Again, it is a tourist spot, so yes, it's overpriced--big surprise. If you're not willing to pay 9 bucks for an ice cream, then this isn't the place for you. However, if you are visiting SF and you love chocolate and/or ice cream, then definitely check it out. Plus, there are some good views just down the block and there are a couple of restaurants in the area as well.
author: A S.

description: It was a treat to visit Ghiradelli Square. The service and desserts were delicious. Jenaline was especially helpful. Definitely worth the visit.
author: Megan T.

description: wow - I've never been here but went for the first time this weekend.   Lines of tourists across the plaza, but we went upstairs where the line was significantly less.    Fun weekend idea for SFer's - act like a tourist....go to Fisherman's Wharf....do Ghiradelli...a blast!
author: Max K.

description:
Low rating for the line to sit inside their dining room and enjoy your order from a table.  High rating is for the wide selection of chocolates squares, bars, minis, and various other products on offer.   Unless I was a super snobby chocolate snob that only eats high end chocolate, I could be happy buying a few bags of squares from here.  They do have some sale items too on display so always make sure that you're happy with what you're buying.

We eventually did manage to order some hot chocolates although we ended up drinking them outside by going to the take-out counter on the top floor.  We were lucky to get our order in as they shut down the take-out register soon after we ordered our drinks.  I wonder if it's always a zoo type environment here on the weekends!

Unless I had out of town friends to entertain, I probably won't be back to fight to get  a treat at this ice cream shop.
author: Ben H L.

description: Loved it! I got the brownie sundae and it was so yummy and filling. I was happy to pay the price which was reasonable with a $1 off coupon that was on there website.
author: Mandy G.

description:
Right after lunch, the bf and I walked on over for a sweet snack. Right when I got there, I was in shock how long the line was. But I refuse to leave, it would have been the 3rd time, I passed by without having any ice cream. But you know what? Third time is a charm! I got my ice cream!! *victory dance*

Surprisingly, the line moved super fast, when my foot was in the door, I saw that they were working all 3 registers. Good jobs peepz, keep up the good work.

I treated myself out a Chocolate Dipped Waffle Cone with a single scoop of Ghirardelli Chocolate. YUM! I paid, I got a # and waited inside, while sitting around, I realized there is no reception at all what so ever. :( How am I suppose to take a picture and post it online if there is no reception to send to Yelp or Facebook?! How do I make my friends jealous?!
So I decided to pick up all my stuff, move out doors to wait for my sweet sweet treat. It was about a 5-10 min wait. I was fine with it, everyone sitting around me outside, young and old was enjoying their ice cream. 

I saw this tiny little cute baby enjoying his mommy's ice cream, it was such an adorable sight. :D  

For sure I will come back next time and have a Banana Split, I would think, I would need to come empty stomach if I wanted to finish the entire thing myself. Or maybe, MAYBE, i will share with the bf, if he is nice. 

Downside:
- no reception indoor
- not enough seats indoors and out
author: Laura T.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered the Sea Cliff sundae. Delicious, as it came with a cookie at the bottom, dark fudge, ice cream, whipped cream and a cherry on top! The last time I had Ghiradelli ice cream was in Disney World, so all my memories came back when we walked it (yes, even including the long line). If only Seattle had a location, my life would be complete. I didn't give a full five stars though I am a huge fan because the service at the register was just alright.
author: Lisa U.

description:
So my friends and I decided to do an ice cream tour of Sf since we were visiting for the weekend. This was our first stop. I decided to keep it simple and get a scoop of strawberry ice cream. Took a while to get to me and when it did, it was pretty much melted. 

I'm thinking the server couldn't find our table because we were in the back corner and the ice cream probably melted in the process. I'd give the place at 2 and 1/2 but I do like the chocolate squares so that's why it's a 3 star rating. 

Otherwise, i rather get ice cream at another place. But I guess this is a tourist spot to hit when you're visiting sf.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Its a cold and misty night. The night sky is covered with fog. I'm in The city and I need something to warm me up. ICE CREAM!!! Ice cream is happy time! For gloomy weather, the best remedy is happy food! 

I love this place! Such an iconic San Francisco land mark! With great ice cream, friendly paper hat wearing servers, and happy customers, it's the best place to go for a gloomy day! I had the treasure island sundae! A warm brownie, with vanilla ice cream, hot fudge and whip cream!  As soon as I started eating my sundae, I was feeling warm and fuzzy all over! Every spoon full of ice cream was a spoon full of happiness. 

As Im eating my ice cream, I forget how ugly the weather is outside! It's like I've gone back in time and I'm a little kid again!  As a kid you don't care what the weather is, you just want to have fun and eat ice cream! That's how I feel every time I come  here. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Roger P.

description: Omg this place is heaven. I was so looking forward to my vacation to come to SF so we can hit up this spot. Amazing. Expect to wait for a while but totally worth the wait
author: Jesus A.

description:
A bit on the pricier side for a dessert place, but it is Ghirardelli Square so... expect that. The service was good, and I liked that you could see the Ghirardelli people preparing all the desserts behind the counter and how they used to make chocolate back in the day. Also the inside of the store smelled amazing. 

My boyfriend and I ordered a Domingo sundae to split and it was about ten dollars. It had vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, lots of hot fudge, a cherry, and sliced bananas. There was nothing wrong with it, but it wasn't life-changing-ly awesome either. Overall, come here if you're a tourist in the area and want to experience Ghirardelli Square. Otherwise, I'm sure there are better places for dessert.
author: Bethany A.

description:
You can't get any more touristy than Ghirardelli.  But, even when I was living in San Fran, we'd come here for their chocolate sundaes.  There's something in their chocolate that makes your toes curl and keeps you coming back for more.  

Whatever you do, be sure to enter the retail shop from the outside, even if you don't plan to buy anything from the retail shop, because there's a greeter at the entrance handing out samples.  YUM!!!
author: Nat N.

description:
It's a touristy spot and it's pricey. But is it worth it? YES. The service can be spotty at times and they can be a bit slow to empty up a table. But the ice-cream is pure delish and their sundaes are always on point. The portions are huge and can be a little daunting to finish. Sharing is always the best option here. Parking can be a pain so I recommend parking a few streets away.
Even on a Monday afternoon there was a huge line but they do tend to move fast. 
There are also other spots in Ghirardelli Square where you can get the ice-cream and chocolate if the line is too crazy. 
All in all, this is not necessarily the place I would go out of my way for ice-cream, however, it's a great spot if you're in the area.
author: Anusha K.

description: Love this place! When you want Choco...this is your place! WOW...you name it! Will not disappoint any chocolate fan. Cold weather...get the hot chocolate....warmer weather...Ice Cream Sundae! YUMMMM...  1000's flock to this place each day so you know it's GREAT!
author: John J.

description:
Yum!!!  We ordered a cookie sundae with cookie dough ice cream. So delicious!!!  I loved their whipped cream. It was obviously homemade. It's not too sweet and nice and thick. The cookie dough inside the ice cream was soft!  I don't know how they pull that off or if they're mixing the flavor to order but it was amazing.  Definitely a must have if you're in town. 

Side note, Someone walked by with a milkshake and it looked awesome. I didn't order a shake with my ice cream but if calories didn't count I would have!  Another side note, I really hope the chocolate in the machines on display is for show and not for use because the machines are very exposed and if someone sneezed it would be all over the chocolate!
author: Elyssa S.

description:
Nothing quite like running around in a chocolate factory with awesome ice cream. ultra rich, lush, creamy dessert here...if you go into the candy shop, they always have samples of some of the Ghiradelli bars.

For ice cream, I decided to try a crissy field : cookie crumbles, cookies dough ice cream and cookies and cream ice cream all topped with the works. Blast to eat, but recommend sharing with a friend :).

If you are in the mood for something hot, strongly recommend the salted caramel hot chocolate...I'm not a big fan of the salty sweet stuff, but personally I think it's one of the best hot chocolates I've ever had.
author: Wayne N.

description:
First off, I have a REALLY big sweet tooth! I wasn't expecting much from the sundae because I thought it was just a tourist trap. But the sundae was amazing, especially the fudge! Before/After, you can also go into the chocolate shop to get a free piece of chocolate.

I went on a Sunday afternoon, and I waited at most 10 minutes in line (I let people in front of me though 'cause I couldn't decide what I wanted)

I'd be willing to come back here every time I'm in SF, but the parking and traffic in the city is just horrible.
author: Emily C.

description: Worth it! We originally didn't get in the long line, then decided to an hour later - WORTH it! We had one if the painted ladies (espresso chip icecream) and it was phenomenal! We also got an ice cafe mocha and it was delicious! The line moves very quickly!
author: Anisha P.

description: The items we selected the chocolate brownie sundae I added Carmel  and my husband had the strawberry and chocolate sundae. Both were good and worth the wait.
author: Ginger M.

description:
I rolled my eyes watching all the tourists gushing about the place.  Look at them... These camera holding, wholesome family looking, overly happy people. What's wrong with you?!?!  It's chocolate!  You don't see me coming to your town taking photos at your iconic food destinations do you?!?!  Oh wait, I do that. Nevermind, as you were..

It's the Ghirardelli Chocolate Company.  Being born and raised in SF, going to places like Alcatraz, Cable Cars, and Pier 39, my desire to see these things are minimal at best.  So as a result I never actually had anything from Ghiradelli Chocolate Shop.  Sure I've had a piece of candy here and there much like See's candy.  But this was my first time stepping foot into this crowded shop. 

I was handed a sample chocolate from the lady by the front door, took a bite.  Ok.  Not bad.  If I walk out the door and put sunglasses and a beard on will the sample lady not recognize me and give me another chocolate?  But I decided to walk further in the shop instead and I ended up ordering a large chocolate milk shake and hot chocolate. 

Large Chocolate milk shake:  first taste and you'll be in chocolate heaven, so packed with tasty, thick, and creamy chocolate it numbs the pain of the $8 that you just spent on it.  But this is where it gets bad.  Two thirds down and the chocolate becomes so intense and rich you'll be chocolate wasted.  I couldn't take another sip if I wanted to. So I recommend to share it or order a small.

Medium Hot Chocolate: this was my wife's drink since it was a normal San Francisco evening weather-wise. (Which means cold) Same exact experience for the wife, great chocolate flavor but overwhelming half way through.

Ghirardelli Chocolate is great chocolate.  The milk shake is worth trying.  But I'll let the picture taking happy tourists enjoy their chocolates, go ahead, I'll take the photo of you guys in front of the Ghirardelli Sign...
author: Michael L.

description:
Love this place! I've been to SF more timed than I can count, but I didn't go to Ghiradelli til I was at least 27! Now it's one of my fav places in SF because it holds an "old school" place in my heart just like Fisherman's Wharf.

Always a must to have the Hot Cocoa every time I go! and the sundaes never fail me! Every bite is comfort - my fav is the Espresso Escape!!

Definitely a tourist spot, but grab yourself a Ghiradelli hot cocoa and a cupcake from Kara's and just enjoy the SF Bay ambience in the courtyard. ;)
author: Rachael D.

description:
This is a great spot to visit. Who wouldn't want Gharadelli chocolate?  Inside in the seating area there is chocolate in the making. 
You can order sundaes, hot cocoa/coffee, or smoothies. 
However, it is a PAIN to try to find a table.  This place ia crawling with tourist. Wish they had more tables or had a 20 minute limit on seating at the tables. But I still enjoy my sundae. ...when I finally find a table.
author: Jeanie Ann D.

description:
The best: Chocolate dipped waffle bowl with a scoop of mint chip and cookies n cream.

I always go here after competing in the Escape from Alcatraz Triathlon. It's the best reward after any sort of challenging physical activity!! 

Yes, portions are nice and generous (but sometimes depends on who is scooping for you).
It's a little pricey, but you're in the hometown of the Original Ghirardelli Shop, so you're paying for that experience as well.
author: Amanda N.

description:
This actually deserves NO stars!!

There was this long line in front of the entrance-
I get it. It's popular.

I purchased my order and waited in line for 20 minutes and nobody was moving. 

No manager took notice of the chaos and lack of structure of the line because there were customers coming from all directions to one open window where they serve the ice cream.

When I brought it up to a manager's attention and requested my refund, she wanted me to wait for another 10-15 minutes and I would eventually get my ice cream. THE HELL?!?!

I'm never coming back. 
*I ended up getting my refund*
author: MadBunny ..

description:
Heart attack in a cup. I ordered the dark chocolate espresso chip and shared between two people. 

Sticky tables/ floors (-1) 
Pricey ($10 per item on menu) (-1)
author: Donna Y.

description: Great date location lots to choose from. Seating available outside and around with occasional live performances
author: Jesse R.

description: Living in SF for a few months now and I barely got around to trying this place. The smell right outside is amazing!  I've just always been too full from dinner to make room for dessert.  Well, this time we went specifically for dessert.  I had the brownie sundae in a waffle bowl... It was tasty!
author: Yisel F.

description:
Beautiful spot for both tourists and non-tourists!

For all of us "regulars" and San Francisco natives, I would suggest coming on a weekday around 2-3 PM. There are little to no crowds and plenty of seating options!

The presentation and taste is always spot-on, which is a comfort. Usually, if hyped-up spots receive a lot of business, their product and service starts to decline (looking at you, DryBar and b. Patisserie). However, I've been coming here ever since I was little and it never disappoints!

If you want decadence, go for the Warm Brownie Sundae! I didn't know you could substitute different flavors of ice cream for the traditional vanilla, but you can! I'll have to try that (good excuse to go back soon? I think so!)

Also, pop by the Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop right next door and get a free square of chocolate! Leave, put on some sunglasses and go through again to get another. What? I'm the only person who has done that? Oops, sorry!
author: Gabriela K.

description:
That's a pretty f**king good milkshake. I don't know if it's worth five dollars but it's pretty f**king good. 

Except instead of five dollars, it's more like seven. Here's a hint, go upstairs and around the corner to order instead of the downstairs. I'm not exactly sure why, but the line upstairs is much shorter and there was plenty of seating, even on a Saturday afternoon. They were pretty quick with the orders, so no problem there.

I recommend getting a small if there's a size choice simply because everything is super rich. If you're sharing, then get a large =)
author: Warren C.

description:
I had a Nob Hill Chill and was dazed out in some heavenly bliss for a long long time as I savored about 2000 happy calories that I didn't really give a crap about.

So, freaking, good.
author: Tian Q.

description:
Over ratted, skip it - unless you are going strictly for the nostalgia of it being The Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop.

I've experienced wonderful chocolate shops in the NY area and while Ghirardelli is OK. it's really on the same level as a Hershey's bar or something - there is nothing special about it.

My son and I both had hot chocolates, he had an original I had a salted carmel - both were filled about half way, then topped with whip cream and marshmallows (mine sprinkled with salted carmel pieces of some sort). The beverages were not "hot" they were barely luke warm and not very tasty at all.
author: Candace L.

description:
Why did I come back?  I totally forgot what a rip off this place was.  You will WAIT AN HOUR FOR YOUR ORDER or more on Saturday night.  After we rode the cable car, we wanted some hot chocolate and we waited OVER AN HOUR.  The ordering system and the management of this place is a complete clusterfuck.  It's madness in here since once you get your order, instead of having the customers pick up their order (WHICH WOULD BE MUCH MORE EFFICIENT), the Ghiradelli waiter kids have to go look at EVERY SINGLE TABLE to see if the numbers match up.  I waited for my order at the pick-up counter where people were hovering and I saw numerous ice cream and coffee orders go into the TRASH since the workers couldn't find the numbers.  Also, most of the ice cream was melted by the time the worker picked it up.

Wrong orders, people clamoring for a refund or people just LEFT without their refund or order since they were so frustrated.  This review is for all those frustrated people that left in a huff because they couldn't understand why their hot chocolate or ice cream order would take so long.  Really, you're not cooking anything, just putting the ingredients together.

POOR MANAGEMENT and they need to get their ordering system down where the customers pick up the orders and the workers can be more productive making the orders.  The workers are also pretty immature - they yell at each other and I saw this blond girl throw a fork in the Asian guy's (Chris) face to get his attention.  This was last Saturday around 10p.

Terrible, terrible management.  They need to fire the operations and HR and hire new ones stat.
author: Chris L.

description: This has been my favorite spot since I was a child, but I was REALLY let down this last time I went. I was helped by a girl named Daisy, who obviously had no idea what she was doing. I said I wanted a caramel sundae and she said she didn't know what I meant. So, I told her I would like the hot fudge sundae but instead of fudge, I would like caramel. She proceeded to ask what kind of fudge and then ended up charging us for a single scoop of ice cream with caramel and a few toppings on it. Ridiculous!!! But then Mike and Danny understood my frustration and gave me the proper sundae when I was very disappointed. They should get a bonus for being so great with customer service! They really turned my terrible experience into a good one. Props to them!
author: A J.

description: Ice cream that isn't too sweet and perfect for flavor. It's the place to end the night for some dessert.
author: Mark D.

description:
What's there to say that hasn't been said? This place makes their own Ghiradelli chocolate fudge!!! Chocolate heaven. 
I tried the Salted Caramel Banana Milkshake this time since we were on-the-go and didn't have time to sit in the cafe. The banana taste was very strong. Blended well with the salted caramel and chocolate. 
Usually I get the typical sundae. It's cool that they have new creations once in awhile. But this place has gotten so crowded eith tourists lately. It's such a drag waiting in line to get a seat, but at least they have a separate to-go counter now. 
BIG THING!! They validate one free hour of parking for their parking garage when you spend $20, which you will if you order two sundaes. This is such a good deal because street parking around the square has gone up to $5.75/hr (parking in the garage is $6.00/hr). So definitely take advantage of this deal!!
author: Timothy J.

description: Ice cream is tasty but WAY over priced. If you like ice cream then stop on down bc this place has some good ice cream. Worth noting that the staff is very friendly.
author: Paul L.

description: We had the traditional ice cream sundae at Ghirardelli's but the price was OUTRAGEOUS for what we were served. Two  sundaes cost $27.00. I wish I had a little more chocolate sauce on mine. Very noisy atmosphere. Tourists galore!
author: Gina R.

description:
Hooo weee this place is CROWDED.  Must be good right?  I mean, if there's a crowd, it HAS TO BE GOOD.

Ok ok, I'll admit, it was good.  But worth the crowd?  Let's see ...

Upon entering, you get a Ghiradelli chocolate.  Great, something to munch on while I wait in line.  When I came, the line was honestly OUT THE DOOR.  While munching on my delicious Ghiradelli chocolate, I perused the menu, and thought I had decided upon just getting a scoop of ice cream.

Then I checked into Yelp, and my whole perspective changed.  WHAT? $1 off a sundae?  How could I pass up a deal?  So I took it.  Turned over that menu to the sundaes and narrowed down my choices to either the Presidio Passion or The Domingo.  Both sounded delicious.  Strawberry with hot fudge.  Banana with hot fudge.  How's a girl to decide?

Thankfully, I had my friend with me.  It became a no brainer.  We ordered both.

The sundaes were good.  Chocolate melted upon our sweet ice cream to provide sweet, savory cream in every bite.  It wasn't incredibly sweet, but I still couldn't finish a whole one.  Next time, I at least know I need to share it with someone.

Now, the crowd.  I feel like they could have handled it so much better.  With so many people, the wait between ordering my sundae and actually receiving my sundae seemed like forever.  They have separate people taking the orders and making the orders, great idea there.  However, there were only three people actually making it.  I think I waited 15-20 minutes for my sundaes.  No bueno.  It was a Saturday.  Put more people on staff so you can take care of the crowd better.  Just a suggestion.

Ice cream = good.  Wait = bad.  Three stars.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I read about the shop before visiting San Fran. So glad I checked it out. The line was out the door- but so worth it. I ordered a strawberry/chocolate Sunday. Decadent- but just enough! Also cool to see how they make chocolate.
author: Lillian Y.

description:
Any time my wife is demanding that we drive through traffic, find parking, and then wait in line for 20 minutes without getting hangry, you know you found the right spot. We always split a butterscotch sundae, and that shit is ridonkulous... 5 stars for satisfying my wifey, because when the queen is happy, the land is happy.

I would scream "I LOVE YOU GHIRARDELLI" at the top of my lungs if it weren't for the shards of glass lodged in my esophagus from scraping the bottom of my sundae cup so hard with my spoon.
author: Ed P.

description:
Very nice ice cream shop with lots of history, but this is where all the tourists go. I went there with some family friends, about 12 of us, and we told the person at the front what we were going to order and then we sat down. 

Sitting down was rather difficult , as this place is made for mainly gouprs of 2 or four , not 12.  We basically had to work to get our tables together , but we finally got to sit together .  

After we ordered , and eight of us ordered the Carmel sundae, we were waiting about 30 minutes for our ice cream. This is what really dissapionted me about this place. I have  been here several times before and they have never been this late. I really wanted to give them three stars, but couldn't because of the size of our group. They also havld given us a free shake afterwards.  

Our Carmel sundaes were beyond delicious and I recommend them to everyone.  They even came with a little piece of chocolate from Ghiridelli Square covered in Carmel. I felt completely satisfied by the time I finished it. Unfortunately you can't take any home    

I recommend it for small litlle date nights and groups and its right next to the pier !!
author: Nick M.

description:
Let me tell you why this place is pretty ridiculous.

Looks nice. Ice cream is pretty good. Of our five sundaes, three were served in glasses and two were served in plastic cups (??), as if this were Baskin-Robbins and not the flagship Ghirardelli ice cream parlor. I don't wanna be a snob... but if I'm paying $12 for a sundae, why is it coming in a plastic cup like one that costs $5 at the mall? We also asked for water, and they never served it and told us there's a water fountain in the back. Classy. On the upside, you don't have to pay tip because despite the classic parlor appearance, service is practically nonexistent. They couldn't even bring us enough spoons for the number of sundaes we ordered. The experience overall was fine but my opinion of Ghirardelli as an upscale brand has definitely taken a dive.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
3.5 out of 5
- - - - - - - - - -
What can I say? It is what it is. 

It's a tourist attraction to go to Ghirardelli Square, but it's still delicious nonetheless. The sundae we got was around five bucks, and it was cold, , sweet, and creamy, but not anything better than I could have made at home. We got a fancy diner-style glass and were able to take it outside to enjoy at a quaint table in the square. 

I wouldn't visit again, but I'm glad I went and I would recommend it to other visitors.
author: Nicole O.

description:
On one trip to California I went to the San Francisco location twice and the LA location on Hollywood Boulevard once. This review is for the location in San Francisco in Ghirardelli Square. There are in fact 2 locations in Ghirardelli Square where you can order these irresistible sundaes. The first is the original factory that's closest to the main entrance. This was packed with people when we came on a Saturday night. People were waiting for seats to free up. I did notice that there was an upper level seating but that area was closed. With everyone waiting around, it seemed common sense to open the other seating area. Hence the 4 stars. But anyways....getting right to the ice cream and chocolate. 

D R E A M Y

This place is heaven for chocoholics, sundae lovers, ice creams maniacs, and anyone else who loves dessert. Loved the warm brownie sundae and the chocolate malt. 

The chocolate gods called me once more to return... And so I came back the following night. By chance I went through a side entrance into ghirardelli square and found that there was another, less crowded location. Ahem... I'll get the banana split, chocolate malt, and hot chocolate please :) 
I'll give this location 5 stars. Great service, clean tables, and roomy. Loved loved loved this place!
author: Richel R.

description:
IN CHOCOLATE HEAVEN! This place is always packed with tourists, or maybe it's because every time I come here with my friends its always on a Friday night. The lower level consists of their little store that sells their chocolates, and they are nice about giving samples out. 

Parking is extremely difficult in this area. So you have to keep circling the area, or pay for parking. The wait is pretty long to get seated, and I've only tried their earthquake sundae platter with banana splits. It's topped with A TON of whipped cream for decorations, but I personally dont like the whipped cream. The ice cream however is perfection. I love their mint chocolate chip, and strawberry best!! 

Only downside, their ice cream does melt fast, even with 6-7 people eating one platter together... and no one wants to eat melted ice cream mixed with a bunch of saliva and whipped cream. Hahaha. But overall, it's a nice atmosphere after going on a stroll at Pier 39 to bring people here to enjoy some dessert! The smell inside of chocolate is amazing!! I will continue to come back!
author: Cindy D.

description: When you come down to Fisherman's Warf you must stop here at their original ice cream shop. For 3 people we shared the Hot Fudge Sundae and the Caramel Sea Salt Chocolate Sundae. Can I say yummy!!  They were absolutely incredible this Iconic San Francisco staple will always get 5 stars from me!!
author: Dr. Scott C.

description:
This place can get pretty busy so my first tip (to save you some time): if you are going with more than 1 other person, send someone to grab a table first!! Seats fill up pretty fast. Get a game plan down and approach this as you would a two-prong attack. 

It is open seating, and after you order, just bring your number to your table. Someone will be by with your order shortly. 

Good news is that people tend to eat (even in large groups) and then head out pretty quickly. The tables turn-over pretty quickly, so if you don't get a seat immediately, don't fret. It's almost like a Formula 1-style pitstop here. 

If there are no seats below, try upstairs. 

Do not be fooled locals: this is definitely a tourist stop. 

My only complaint? It's Dreyer's ice cream dressed up with Ghirardelli chocolates. Hard to justify the $10 per person price tag...
author: Charles K.

description: Warm soft brownies with ice cream? Can't really go wrong with that! The lines are really long but they do go by fast. I recommend trying the sundaes if you are ever in the area. Cute sign of the ghirardelli right in front of the shop if you are a tourist (like myself) and want to take pictures. Gotta do it for the Instagram right? There isn't much around the plaza but there's a cute little fountain to sit near and enjoy your chocolates!
author: Amy T.

description: It's a must!  I had the World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae.  Great chocolates, ice cream and milkshakes!  Our waiter, Robert, was very helpful and gave us a lot of history about of Ghiradelli's Chocolate.
author: John A.

description:
I usually order the hot fudge sundae when I come here. I like how you can choose the flavor of the ice cream in the sundae. The scoops for the sundae have gotten smaller over time. I remember the scoops sticking out of the top of glass as a kid. They also have been putting less hot fudge on the sundae. One time my order got screwed up and I ended up getting a coffee that I didn't order with my ice cream. I ordered the chocolate milkshake once and it was very thick and chocolaty. You can get cups of water from the water dispenser near the middle of the room. It sucks that I can't even use my $1 off check in offer because I lose reception as I get inside the building. 

There is usually a long line here since a lot of tourists come here to eat. Service can be slow or fast depending on how busy they are. It is sometimes a challenge to find seats. They have a cool chocolate factory display in the back showing chocolate processing steps. 

You can get a free sample of chocolate at the entrance of the chocolate shop.
author: Alexander L.

description: Who doesn't love chocolate is telling a lie!  Seriously have to visit this place every time I'm in SFO
author: Mauie J.

description: As much as this place drives me crazy with all the crowds...  whenever we go to San Francisco we have to go in and have another wonderful ice cream sundae at Ghirardelli's!! Yes it's overpriced ice cream but it is San Francisco and it is delicious! My favorite is always the mint chip sundae. They always pass out free chocolates when you arrive and that's always fun too! Their newest flavor is the dark chocolate blueberry which is amazing! If it wasn't for the crowds, I would definitely give this place five stars....
author: Melissa A.

description: As a chocoholic I HAD to come here even though I used to frequently visit the one in Orlando FL every time I went to Disney. Going to the original store may be the most touristy thing to do but it had to be done! While I still treated myself to some ice cream what I enjoyed the most was the machines showing how the chocolate is processed as I've never seen those before.
author: Allie S.

description:
Had the mint bliss for $8.95. It was way too sweet and I was scared for diabetes.  Luckily I had someone to share it with, but it's good for 3-4 people.  The portion size is too ridic, but they also charge you a arm and a leg.

This place is definitely worth checking out in SF but seating is a nightmare.  It's basically self seating and you have to react fast to grab a table.

I love the fact that they gave chocolate samples here.
I try to make an extra round to cheat sometimes.  They don't care. Hehe
author: David W.

description:
It astounds me that they had to open a second sundae bar location in the same plaza because of how crowded they can get. I've never quite understood what all the hype is about over Ghirardelli. It must be the novelty for tourist that alludes me since I lived in california my whole life and always had Ghirardelli around.

Anyways, I don't think it matters all that much what I have to say but to keep it brief...

Chocolate is creamy, balanced, great quality and well worth a trip if you really want to be a tourist 

Some cashiers are quite rude, if you hate your job/people get another line of work

Overall Thoughts

Can't go wrong with chocolate now can you?
author: Eddie W.

description: Pretty cool. I like chocolate, so it's tough to go wrong here. Bring your girl here if you need to shut her up for an hour. Chocolate has that effect on women.
author: Austin T.

description: It's a Friday night in March, just a little windy but expected in SF and there's a sundae line out the door.  Our bellies were too full for ice cream but we wanted a little something something.  We entered the back door, got a deelish caramel sample, twice, and then huge fresh chocolate covered strawberries.  Totally amazing and worth every fatty calorie.
author: Amireh G.

description: What can I say. Chocolate, ice cream, and a hot fudge sundae. What more can you ask for. I love this place.
author: Doug T.

description:
A 20-year-old phenom name Trevor Bayne won NASCAR's Daytona 500 on February 20. After winning the biggest event in motorsports, he did his city-to-city tour to celebrate his victory. He flew in to San Francisco on Tuesday evening to promote his victory at one of San Francisco's historic chocolate factory and ice cream parlor.

His appearance: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vzBSlQezq2GJkDeqBQxdtw?select=j4gfQQm1nCPD-Q_W-I_vlg

His promotion: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vzBSlQezq2GJkDeqBQxdtw?select=S9pK2w3Q9XFbrltJ9dmWVg

That night was such a chaotic gathering with various media personnel and NASCAR fans ambushing the young up-and-coming driver. I was also shocked on how many NASCAR fans are there in the Bay Area.  

In honor of his victory, Ghiradelli Ice cream shop is offering a limited edition Double-Double Ice cream Sundae. For $8.95, this sundae is very similar to the popular Cable Car sundae. The sundae has one scoop of Rocky Road, Chocolate Chip and Chocolate Ice cream, a cloud of whipped cream, and marshmallow with a drizzle of warm hot fudge, a square of milk chocolate candy and a cute cherry topping. A small piece of brownie is also added for his special sundae.    

I actually went overboard on this treat. In addition, I'm not sure if it is appealing enough of gaining a few pounds just to see a celebrity. But the treat was sinfully good. 

My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vzBSlQezq2GJkDeqBQxdtw?select=Ln2DPFIoIitGCpbO85_i8Q

I hope he (Trevor Bayne) chooses Ghiradelli's Chocolate as one of his sponsor for future races. That would be a big lift for him, his legendary Wood's Brother team, and Bay Area's businesses.
author: Matt G.

description:
Are you kidding me? This place turned me right round, baby, right round (as in it made me round in size)! Remember when I was on a diet at one time? Ya not so much in SF, let alone upon walking into this blast from the past Ice Cream shop on North Point near Russian Hill and Fisherman's Warf. 

As you walk in, you place your order from the over sized hand-held menu. Good luck because the vibrant pictures filled with ice creamy and sundae-y goodness are enough to give one diabetes just from gazing upon it. Almost like the Medusa of Ice cream!

After some deliberation (and by some I mean I was tormented worse than that time I had to choose between having my left or right hand chopped off) my friend and I decided to fatten up and ordered the Presidio Passion sundae. Sweet marvelous Moses!!!! My taste buds and my belt buckle were set free like the Jewish slaves of ancient Egypt! When Kris U was in Ghiradelli Land!!!! Let my shame GO!!!

Layers of ice cream, strawberry and chocolate fudge. Topped with layers upon layers of chocolate fudge, a chocolate covered strawberry - oy vay! This was certainly a shareable sweet and not something one with a weak ticker should attempt in one go. 

Thank god the cable car was close by because I surely would have rolled down the hills of SF for days. 

Eatcrest Out!
author: Kris U.

description:
Ghirardelli Chocolate San Francisco is located by the Fisherman's Wharf  on North Point Street by the water. It is one of the biggest San Francisco tourist attraction and a place for people to get souvenirs. We got some chocolates here for our friends back home. Though to be honest, Vancouver also has these for sale. Inside The Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop there are chocolate machines running like in Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory. I do hope that this is only for display because it being open like that I would really question the sanitary hygiene.

Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop is super busy. There are constantly tons of kids running around. Their chocolate ice cream is delicious if you are a fan of sweets. The Ghirardelli waffle cones are fresh. I really like the Caramel Sea Salt Fudge Sundae. I like the saltiness that compliments the decadent fudge and caramel.

For souvenirs, we bought couple bags of these variety packs for our friends and family. There are also nicer chocolate gifts in tin cans but if you do a quick price variance you will find that they are overpriced. You are paying simply for the presentation and packaging.


At the end of the day Ghirardelli Chocolate San Francisco is a bit of a tourist trap. When you plan your San Francisco trip it will most like appear at the top of any must do San Francisco itinerary or San Francisco must eat. I'd say if you are in the area, sure why not. I probably won't go out of my way just to visit The Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop.
author: Nancy W.

description: Super Delicious!! BUT super busy... Which we expected.... Very noisy....  Service is fast for as busy as it is.... & it's always sooooo GOOD!
author: Heather A.

description:
SUGAR BOMB DOT COM. Had the Domingo? Which ever one is just two scoops of vanilla and bananas. Traded hot fudge for caramel sauce. Bananas were getting brown.. so it looked unappealing but tasted alright.

But you wonder why so many Americans have diabetes, including yours truly!! 

Never coming back again, but glad I can say that I've been there and done that is this sugary sweet tourist trap. Risked my life for this review.
author: Angela L.

description:
Touristy?  Sure.  Over priced?  Absolutely. Best ice cream in town? Definitely not.  But, Ghirardelli holds a special place in our hearts and so do their big ass hot fudge sundaes.

We bypass the chocolate shop and in the spirit of tradition, we always get the World Famous Hot Fudge sundae ($8.50).  It comes with two scoops of vanilla (this time we swapped one scoop of vanilla for a scoop of coffee), home made hot fudge, almonds, whipped cream and a cherry.  It's rich and it's classic. We hoover that thing like we're trying to set some sort of world record. There's seating on the main level and it's usually jam packed with booger faced kids running around, unsupervised, and high on sugar.  Instead, make your way up to the second level where there's a bit more breathing room and additional seating inside, as well as outdoor seating on a nice day.

Parking is available within the garage below Ghirardelli Square for a whopping $2.25 for every 20 mins (some stores validate).
author: Lorraine P.

description: Way overpriced and the staff was barely friendly. The hot fudge sundae was $12 ... I know things are more expensive in California but that's absurd. Also, there's minimal indoor seating off of Beach St.
author: Gabe C.

description: Super busy and crowded, but the wait wasn't too long. The sundaes are delicious - that gooey Ghirardelli fudge satisfies any sweet tooth. The plaza around it is also super cute and nice for people to check out.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Long line.
Impatient and unfriendly staff.
