Expensive experience.
Ice cream sundaes were just ice cream sundaes.  Nothing special to us?!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
Best fudge I have ever had! 
The place is packed so be ready to stand in line for a little while... But worth every minute of it! If I can pinpoint anything, it would be the fact that the cashiers are in a really bad mood! I guess because the place is so busy! Either way... No excuse because customer service is their job! This is a place that you need to come to when in San Francisco :) at least once!!!!
author: Marcella W.

description: They have 2 outlets now at ghiradelli square but they are still crowded. But gotta come for sundaes when visiting SF
author: Shirley W.

description:
We loved Ghirardelli ice cream for years so we were excited to come back to this location while we were in town and try their new Muir Woods one (cherries and dark chocolate). They give you coupons outside their store, you find coupons for them inside maps, magazines, so that's nice.

We went in, placed the order, barely sat down and they brought the ice cream. Too fast! We felt like they didn't put any care and time into making it. It was nothing great. Actually it was disappointing, it was the worst Ghiradelli ice cream we ever had!

Too bad this place turned from a cool local institution into a tourist trap. We'll stop going to their ice cream places for now on. It's overpriced and they're careless about their craft.
author: Jo S.

description: Ordered their amazing family dessert dish called the earthquake, which had 8 scoops of ice cream (we picked chocolate, mint, cookies & cream, dark cherry, vanilla), bananas, whipped cream with chocolate chips, cherries, and a bottom layer of chocolate fudge. Easily satisfied my group of 7.
author: A L.

description: If you come to San Fran, you have to bury your face in one of their sundaes. What is good? Anything on the menu. What's not to like about a buried brownie smothered in ice cream, chocolate syrup, and whip cream. If you are watching your calorie count, forget about it. This is way over one days worth of calories, even if you share. Yes, portions are huge, but who wants to share ice cream. If you are avoiding sugar, you can just go see how the chocolate is made. I would not recommend this place for people with diabetes.
author: Hanan Q.

description:
Local Insider Tip: If you go up to the "to-go" portion of the restaurant, you'll get in and out MUCH faster than if you were to eat in their main dining room. If you're looking at the entrance of Ghirardelli, go out the gate, to your left. You will see a door on the side of the building. This is where you place "to-go" orders. You can take your ice cream outside rather than wait HOURS to get a simple sundae. 

Local Insider Tip:  Go through the gift shop. You get a sample of chocolate. One square is really all you need.

Local Insider Tip: Bring wet wipes. The tables can get sticky with all those customers filtering in and out.

Local Insider Tip: The best night to go is Wednesday night. It's rarely full during the middle of the week. Avoid summer weekends like the plague!

Word of caution: Don't order the peanutbutter sundae. It takes just like globs of peanutbutter. Order the classic sundae, it's a good bet.
author: Rachel S.

description: Ghirardelli's hot fudge sundae! Yes, it's oversized and overpriced, but really really good. Get it with a 10% discount with Muni pass coupon.
author: Ivana K.

description: Holy moly! Talk about being drunk on chocolate! I ordered a chocolate malt and after one gulp I was craving water...dreaming about water...it was so chocolatey and I couldn't handle it! It tasted so good, very rich, smooth, creamy, with a cherry on top! I couldn't finish it though :-/. This place was crazy busy even at 9pm! Finding a table wasn't a problem though. The smell of chocolate gave me a headache, but I managed! Recommend this place! Perfect tourist spot lol!
author: Lizette R.

description: Who doesn't like getting inside for free chocolate samples?? Lol Basically this is just one big chocolate candy store plus another little one off the curb. Lots of variety to choose from and there's quite a few nice gift packages too. If you're visiting the area, it's nice to see it at least just once.
author: Mai Y.

description:
This is a tourist trap! Don't get me wrong, my salted caramel sundae was good, but definitely not $10-good. I guess you can go to check it off your list, but it's not a repeat place for me.

But the free chocolate samples are pretty nice!
author: Ashley E.

description:
There is extra sugar overload in most of their desserts. The only ice cream that we manage to eat is dark chocolate, where the sugar level is equivalent to a normal 60% chocolate. 

We ordered midnight reverie with brownie. The brownie had so much extra sugar. Wonder how this has not been taken note of
author: BoredYelper R.

description:
Classic sundaes, but nothing extraordinary. 

I had the Very Berry Sunday and (yes it was delectable for the first 3 bites but) got sick of it real quick. The strong odor of sweets throughout the entire shop will possibly give you a headache. This place is chocolate overboard! Meh, maybe I'm just not as much of a chocolate/sundae fanatic as the average Americano, but I wasn't going wild for this place. 

On a brighter note, the setting is pretty gnarly! Definitely a tourist attraction. Will come back to take pictures with the huge Ghirardelli sign! :D
author: Sara L.

description: Mediocre, overpriced ice cream. But you're paying for the experience (bustling waiters in crisp white uniforms), location (smack dab in the middle of tourist central), and novelty factor (overflowing sundaes served in old-fashioned glassware). Visit once so you can say you've been there and then stick to Bi-Rite for all of your future ice cream needs.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Ode to Chocolate:

If you don't love the sundaes I'll call you insane
The hot chocolate and ice cream are FAR from mundane
Everywhere you look there's chocolate galore
You can't stop yourself from yearning for more!
__

As a teen in high school, I was able to polish off a whopper of a hot fudge sundae -- two generous scoops of mint chocolate chip and coffee ice cream. It would always be a cold wintry day in SF with great company around the holidays. We had dessert cravings that could only be resolved one way: we looked at each other and said with lit-up eyes and great excitement, "Ghirardelli's." 

It didn't matter how cold it was. It was time for ice cream, and LOTS of it! The hot fudge oozed over the ice cream, slightly solidifying before dribbling down the sides of the cup, which struggled to contain my enormous masterpiece. And don't forget that hot chocolate! Intensely satisfying. How have I not died of a sugar overdose??

I don't have quite the stamina I used to, but I can't resist the attempt, even with my dairy allergy. Hey, if I'm going to avoid dairy a major percentage of the time, I see no better way to celebrate than by having just ONE TINY sundae. (Okay, so it's not very tiny. Of course it had to be the hugest sundae I could possibly find... but let's just not talk about that for now.) Still delicious, still amazing. 

Ghirardelli's will always bring fond memories of the holiday season. Just thinking about this place, I can practically TASTE that hot fudge sundae right now! It's that good.

TIP: Picturesque setting by the bay + amazing chocolate + ice cream = DATE WIN. Extra bonus is that it is typically cold there, and you and your date will be colder after sharing a sundae, therefore requiring that you snuggle up together over some hot chocolate. ;)
author: Denise L.

description: Your trip to San Francisco wouldn't be complete with a stop at the Ghirardelli Square by Fisherman's Wharf.  They give you a sample at the entrance to the factory and have great seating looking over the bay at Fisherman's wharf.  You must try their sundaes.  The hot chocolate fudge is so delicious and completes your vacation as whip creams tops of a sundae.  It's right by the Hyde Cable Car Turn around but the muni bus lines stop right in front of it.
author: Rhonald N.

description: I'd like to start by saying Ghirardelli's chocolate is my favorite & I have very fond memories of Ghirardelli Square from when I was a child. As an adult, however, I was pretty disappointed. I brought a friend because she'd never been & we were saddened over the fact that the options were really limited. Holiday baggies or assortments & that was it. There were also very few flavors to choose from. I don't remember it being like that when I was a kid. It was still neat to walk through, just wasn't happy that it seemed a bit like a Hallmark store with only a few cards.
author: Ms D.

description:
ICE CREAM SUNDAES! theres actually 2 shops, the one closer to pier 39 is always busy but you walk in the square a bit to the end and theres another ice cream shop in the back.  same menu same ice cream same chocolatey goodness.  sundaes are about $10 and ice cream cones are about $4.  i think ive tried each sundae.  all good in their own way.  its nice that they all come with chopped almonds instead of peanuts for the ones that are allergic to peanuts.  theres also a store that is connected.  theres always a worker giving out a free chocolate sample.  this time i went was the caramel square.  mmmm.  always love a free sample.  loads and loads of chocolate.  what more can you ask for.  its the original!
$1 off when you check in with yelp!
author: Matthew G.

description: I love the squares,  and the sundae's here.  prices are high but you are in a tourist trap.  The park across the street has great views.
author: Jeff J.

description:
Being from Vegas, my family and I will always stop by here when we come to the bay and walk the city. Usually I would just get some chocolates to bring back home for coworkers, friends, etc. Ive always wanted to try the sweets treats but have never had the time, hands, or stomach to. Recently while I was there, the timing was right, the line was going fast, I had no choice. So many of the options sounded delicious. But I came to the conclusion that, I am at Ghiradelli Square, so I should get a freaking Ghiradelli Square sundae. While waiting, the lady making my ice cream was getting mixed up in the receipts or something and almost forgot about me, I waited a little but that's no problem. Even though while I was waiting, some foreign people in front of me dropped the drink they just received and it splashed on me a little, actually more than a little, but that's also okay. I'm not here to review things that can't always be controlled, let's talk about the good stuff. 
As soon as I got my sundae, I walked out to find my family at the table so I could sit and enjoy it (and also take a picture real quick before I destroy this thing). I took one bite getting a good amount of hot fudge, vanilla ice cream, and whipped cream at once and oh lord, that was so good! I'm not really a fan of fudge but I could lick that Ghiradelli fudge all day. Just the combination together was so yummy it was like too good to be true. I even bought a jar of the fudge for my pregnant boss. Would've kept it for myself but I'm working on the bod lol, anyways if you have a sweet tooth, you'll love this!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
My boyfriend got a Painted Lady sundae. We understand that Ghirardelli chocolate is strong, but the sweetness was overpowering. One would think a $12 sundae would have some balance, contrast and/or complexity. Nope, not at Ghirardelli.

I also don't like it when the only portion size is Huge. If it weren't so disgustingly thick and sweet, two people could have eaten this mound of sugar and fat which had to be in excess of 1500 calories. But what if you're dining alone, enjoy different flavors than your friend or loved one, have food allergies, or have children who would almost rather starve than share peacefully? $12 a pop is a lot just for brand recognition.

The seating is woefully inadequate, also.

I definitely would not return.
author: Michelle R.

description:
The first time we visited Ghirardelli Chocolate and Ice Cream Shop it was closed for a private party. It was quite a bummer because of the long drive for nothing. This time, we planned it better. I called the shop first to find out if there was any private function going on and luckily they didn't have any. It was open to the public and so off we went. There were tons of people buying ice cream on a hot sunny San Francisco day. It was also Father's Day. Busy busy busy! 

I ordered an all Rocky Road Banana Split with all its toppings while my fiancé ordered their Mint Bliss Sundae. We got a table and waited. The place was bustling! Both locals and tourists mingled inside their dine-in area and it was just loud, well, not concert loud. It was just above than normal loud. 

Our orders arrived and I was quite disappointed with it. They served my ice cream dripping on the sides because it was melting real fast. I started eating it and didn't really get in the mood of being happy about it. How can you be happy with melted ice cream? I was more busy fumbling for napkins because the table flooded with my ice cream drippings. 

I honestly couldn't stop myself from comparing Ghirardelli ice cream to Cold Stone ice cream: at least Cold Stone's ice cream is served as "frozen ice cream" and not as chocolate milk with mixed nuts and marshmallows in it. I had no qualms about the taste. Ghirardelli's chocolate ice cream was rich and thick with flavor, but it wouldn't do anything for me if it was melted. I stopped eating when I had like a bowl of chocolate milk with floating nuts and marshmallows in it. I wasted more than a scoop of ice cream because it was not ice cream, it was chocolate milk. 

I wouldn't travel all the way to San Francisco just to visit Ghirardelli for ice cream. I'd rather step inside Cold Stone's Creamery. FROZEN rocky road just the way I like it.
author: Sonnia K.

description: Whenever I go here it's always super crowded (which I guess is a good thing). The staff there are really friendly and they have a lot of choices. I usually just get a scoop of ice cream though and it tastes good. I usually like to sit down and enjoy my treat but it's nearly impossible to do so at this location due to how many people there are and how small the space is. There are some outside seatings although not nearly enough.
author: Carly A.

description:
im a fan of this joint. just difficult to get a table so I usually grab a double scoop waffle cone to go, but sometimes one is craving for a good old fashion sundae.
their ice cream is top quality. cant beat their toppings either. when they say sauce, they mean THICK RICH sauce. sometimes the fudge is way too much for my sweet tooth
of all the 3 ghirardelli sites I visit, this 1 is the busiest bc of its touristy location.

tip: ask for a cup to get water
author: Keikaikaoakua P.

description: I absolutely love their ice cream and fudge, this location has some of the best ice cream I ever had. The few issues I would have is that it is a bit pricey and the wait could be awhile.
author: Ricky L.

description: Free chocolate samples at the door, yes. I truly enjoyed the Sea Salt Caramel Hot Chocolate and loved the young staff's energy and the comfy ambience. Must try if your into sweets and tranquility.
author: Joel V.

description: Yum yum and yum! Love the free samples they give at every entrance. Must stop here is you have a sweet tooth!
author: Justine M.

description:
Serious taste orgasm! The Hot Chocolate is to die for and I think I want to leave my wife and marry it. It gives me so much pleasure, It may be illegal soon. So keep it to yourself and make a B Line to this place any time you get the chance for the next best thing than sex and racing cars. 
Maybe not in that order. I love to race.
author: Mario A.

description: Do you have $100 you are tired of holding and wish you had a way to part with it?  Take it and 3 friends to Ghirardelli.  No prices on the menu, but except a nice surprise at the cash register.  The ice cream sundaes are not much above what you could make at home, but when you find they are nearly $13 each!  - Long lines, high prices, tons of tourists who don't know the value of a dollar.
author: Eric S.

description: Tasty ice-cream sundae but very crowded and not enough seating. Not cheap either but worth trying for sure. Service was swift.
author: F S.

description:
Who wants Ice Cream???? I do!!!! I do!!!! You my pay a little more but you will get more than you paid for in serving size!!!! I suggest maybe sharing :) This place is located right after fisherman's wharf.  Don't want ice cream??? Then indulge in their chocolate selection!!!! I love filling up the tin cans myself with a variety of flavors!!! What I ordered:

Lemon Sherbert!!! $6.00 plus they will give can give you the mini guided tour to fill you in on all the history of Ghiradelli :) So what are you waiting for? Go get your ice cream!!!!!
author: Connie G.

description: Great spot for an ice cream sundae! A little pricey for dessert but definitely worth it. Come hungry! It's rare for me to have to give up on ice cream but I had to tap out and couldn't finish the first time me and my fiancée went. I came prepared on our second visit though!
author: Ryan H.

description:
CHOCOlicious!

Great place to savor on your favorite ice cream and chocolate treats! Came here on a Sunday and I was instantly in chocolate heaven. I ordered the banana split. It came with the classic toppings of nuts, cherries, whipcream, three flavors of icecream, and of course a banana. The flavors were a perfect blend and not too sweet or too bland. 

The shop also has a station where you can view how they actually make ghiradelli chocolate which is pretty awesome. There is also an outside patio to sit on a sunny day.

I would definitely come back again to try the other desserts!
author: Stephen C.

description: Savory treat especially in the summer heat and after walking for 7 miles all across Piers 31-37! It's served in a big tray that is perfect for 2 people but it's possible to be greedy and indulge in this heavenly treat all by yourself!
author: Cherise M.

description:
The go to spot for tourist, but hey...why not?! This location is superb, you can enjoy the nice park across the street and the lovely illuminated Ghirardelli sign right in front of the shop.

Staff is prompt and knows how to definitely deal with a fast pace environment and mob of crowds. It was my birthday so the lovely cashier, Jen, made sure the runners sang me my birthday song. Candles and all.

OOOOO I cannot forget to mention about the scent of luscious CHOC-O-LATE when you walk in the door. The aroma fills the restaurant considering there is a nice display of milk chocolate stirring up in the back.
author: Vic A.

description: We arrived when it was cold, were, and crowded so my experience maybe different. I had a hot chocolate while we shared a hot fudge brownie sundae. We discovered a hair within the ice cream but they were able to give us a brand new one. With this and the timing of our trip, the experience was okay.
author: Natasia B.

description:
Yes, this place is an overpriced tourist trap, and a good one at that! You can get a lot of the chocolate bars for less money at the local Walgreens or convenience store, but what fun is that? The new products will always arrive at the Ghirardelli stores first. Plus, if you save your receipt, then you get 10% off on your next visit.

The chocolate is amazing here, and the ice cream is great, too. If you're visiting San Francisco, you really should check this place out. It's a classic!
author: David T.

description: As everyone on here has already said, yes it's packed with tourist but it's SO worth it. Most tourist stops let you down with all the hype. Fortunately, this shop does not disappoint! We split the Lands End between two people and it was just the right amount of dessert for us. The brownies are so rich and smooth your taste buds won't know what to do. The best part? The small amount of sea salt they put on it. Gives it just the right balance to the salty/sweet. Brave the crowd and enjoy!
author: Jacky W.

description:
If you love chocolate this place is for you! The system for ordering is a little confusing, especially if you come in through the gift shop like we did. Someone takes your order up front, gives you a number and you find a place to sit and they bring it to you. I guess this system works for them, I thought it was a little confusing, maybe it's me :)
Anyway, the important this is the ice cream, which was incredible. I had the sundae with the fudge brownie in it! It was AMAZING!! My mom had a root beer float and my sister had a dark choc ice cream cone! They were so sorry they didn't order something special like I did! Just splurge! You're probably on vacation anyway when you come here! I would order the same thing again if I went back! YUMMY!!
author: Sandra S.

description: Everything but the very sad whip cream was good. They loaded the fudge which was a plus. But our cherry sank into the mushy whip cream.
author: Teresa G.

description:
My favorite thing here is the Mint Quake Shake! simply delicious!! it is great if youre in the mood for something sweet. 

I have tried a couple of their other options but their flavors are really rich. if youre not pacing what you scarf down, you might get a stomach ache so just take your time.

This is so monumental in SF that it is a place you must try when visiting the city.
author: Nikita D.

description:
Yes, sir! We hit up the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop. First we bought the chocolate to take home. Then we got in the other line to get our treats. I ordered the Warm Brownie Sundae. It was delicious and I ate the whole thing though I would suggest to everyone (including myself) to split a dessert like this rather than indulging in the sweet, rich tastes of chocolate and ice cream in mass; it sets you on a sugar high that's a pain to bear when you crash a few hours later. 

This place is always busy and swarming with crowds, but it's also amazing and delicious. It's a must on any trip to San Francisco.
author: Sharece B.

description: I love Ghiradelli Factory for its dessert and its nice that they do a fundraiser every September for Project Open Hand, but who knows how much of the millions they raise actually go to the charity and on top of that the event coordinators hire vendors without telling them how little money they are able to make!! The vendors are mainly there to give samples to people with sample tickets and they make next to no money after taking labor, the vendor fee, little sales and most importantly TIME into account! I find this very disrespectful, unprofessional, and terrible client relations with this lack of information to the vendors hired. I hope everyone sees this and vendors are informed!!
author: Monique H.

description:
We came here twice in two days while visiting SF. 

You can't really go wrong with ice cream and hot fudge. 

The first time, we had a cookie bottom sundae which was half a warmed chocolate cookie topped with ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, almonds, and a cherry.

Tasty and sugar overload. The cookie was actually a bit overwhleming when added to the rest of the sundae. It was also more the crumbly type of cookie (maybe slightly overcooked) than the soft n chewy kind.  

The second time around, we got the regular sundae in a waffle bowl. Definitely get this. It's simple, but sooo good and the waffle cone is a good compliment to the ice cream and hot fudge. 

The sundaes here are big and you definitely can split them between two ppl. A bit pricier for a sundae, (~$9), but worth the experience and the sweet tooth satiation.
author: Suie C.

description: Went on a Thursday afternoon around 2:30pm and there was not a wait, it was perfect. My friend had the treasure island sundae and I had a scoop of the espresso chip ice cream in a sugar cone. My ice cream was delish, and her sundae was pretty rich (not something I care for, but she really liked it). Can't beat a good treat:)
author: Erika S.

description:
Overrated and overpriced unfortunately.
I'm In complete understanding that this is a tourist trap, but $16 for a small hot fudge sundae but is half melted when you receive it? No thanks.
author: X M.

description: As a tourist you simply cannot miss Ghirardelli square. This place has wonder drinks ice cream and chocolates. I had to pick up some cute souvenirs and they carry some very San Francisco designed chocolates. Upon entrance a sample of their mini chocolates is given out   by a friendly girl. Their drinks were reasonably priced and we're nice and creamy.
author: Bei T.

description: There is no way you can say anything bad about this place.  The chocolate is amazing!
author: Todd B.

description: Following some bomb pizza I had to get something for dessert. Ended up getting ice cream from the Ghirardelli Market place. Cant really ever go wrong with Ghurardelli, I got the Muir Wood Sundae, one of my favorites!! They have a lot of choices and im sure there is something for everyone here!
author: Daniel E.

description: Delicious, rich ice cream! One waffle cone is enough for 3 people. Don't do it to yourself like I did; just ask for extra spoons and share!
author: Faith M.

description: Firstly, seating is impossible. Its pretty cramped inside the ice cream shop. I dunno, I really didn't find the desserts here amazing. I tried some of the mint chocolate shake and sundae (with the chocolate syrup? Maybe it was called grasshopper or something), and the berry sundae. None of them stood out and made me want more. It was numbingly sweet, and I don't know.. it didn't taste amazing. One bite of each was more than enough. Some of the other desserts looked better, so I wouldn't mind coming here again. Free chocolate squares from the Ghiradelli shops are always a plus too.
author: Tricia M.

description: The best icecream in SF! I live in the SF Bay - but come down to SF once a month or so to visit Ghirardelli. I tweeted to @LoveGhirardelli a few months ago asking for a caramel icecream. Just today, I tried their new Lands End which is basically Ghirardelli's new icecream with iecream and caramel. Basically 2 large scoops of vanilla icecream with 2 Ghirardelli chocolate brownie with cream, caramel, hot fudge and sea salt. The little bit of salt adds a good touch to the icecream. Should be shared between at least 2-3 people (unless you come here for a meal).
author: Ananta S.

description:
Two words:

TOURIST TRAP

I've been known to play tourist in my city, after all the views of the bay from Pier 39 are amazing. The one thing I've never been fond of is touristy food. The one thing I don't do is eat like a tourist. After spending a warm day on the water I was craving ice cream. Against my better judgement I came here. After ordering a couple of different sundaes I quickly realized why I haven't come here in YEARS. Their ice cream is sickeningly sweet. I'm sure if I was 5 I would love it. I will save my money for one of the numerous ice cream shops in town selling better made and better tasting ice cream.
author: Maria M.

description:
Sometimes, we'll just have to agree to disagree....  I really didn't find anything special about this shop or the surrounding square...  You can basically get all of the items here at any mall in America or online.  The only exception here is that you will have to pay a hefty parking bill.  Although the staff tried their best to be helpful, all they really could do was give you a free chocolate sample square.  

In summary, if you want to fight through hoards of tourists, tight and expensive parking, all for an experience you can get at any US mall, this is the place for you.  Else, save your money and go elsewhere (recommend Hershey, PA)...
author: Yan W.

description:
The warm brownie sundae is my go to here at Ghirardelli no matter which location I visit. Came in pretty late and the place was packed. The line did move quickly but there weren't too many places to sit. 

I always enjoy the warm brownie sundae and it comes with two scoops of ice cream, I always get one vanilla and one rocky road. You can also request to get the normal hot fudge and the dark chocolate hot fudge, both are really good. The brownie at this location was the best out of all the places I visited. 

If you're looking for sweets, they have plenty of options so come in and try them out.
author: Raymond L.

description:
Ghirardelli Square is one of the main tourist attractions. It's walkable from the wharf so you can spend half a day there at the wharf and hike up to the square for some chocolates and ice cream! The shop has something that will satisfy everyone's love for something sweet! From milk to dark to flavored chocolates! I love how you can pick and choose Ghirardelli squares and buy it by weight! You can use it to make little goodie bags or gifts if you're visiting! 

Oh and they always have some kinda of "chocolate sampling" so you def don't want to miss that!
author: Karen L.

description:
It is overpriced? Yes. 
Are the lines ridiculous? Yes. 
Is it one of those things you have to do while in San Francisco? Yes.
Is it delicious? Yes.
author: Nadia G.

description: Probably the best hot chocolate I've ever had. So rich!! It's also pretty unique to be able to see the chocolate making process. At night, the place is romantically lit. I'm sure the view during the day is great too! Maybe things are a bit pricey, but with how rich everything is, you really can't eat much of anything. So ordering one thing is good enough. You can probably share and split the larger items.
author: Ange L.

description: A little bit of a biased review. FYI. I have been working for this place for a little over a year now and I have also been a customer so I get both sides of the story. It's expensive for two scoops of ice cream but it is all about the seating and the atmosphere. Honestly it's so packed 99 percent of the time but that adds to the wonderment. This place can be a place to bring your family for years to come so long as you have the time in the day to wait in the line and be ready for a crowd.
author: Anthony J.

description:
San Francisco's jewel!  This review is solely based on Ghirardelli Chocolate Co.'s products where their administrative office reside in San Francisco, CA.

Despite of having never traveled to the West Coast of U.S.A., Ghirardelli travels to the Big Apple at local supermarkets, and pharmacy retailers directly to my mouth.  My all-time favorite classic is the Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate Squares.  Classic, old fashion chocolate squares wrapped with a 2010 flair of flavors.

For all the men who are insincere with their interest for me:  I DON'T need you as I have chocolate!
author: Tina C.

description:
I don't like chocolate. I'm probably one of the only women in America that claims such blasphemy, but honestly, I just don't find it appealing. Except for Ghiradelli's, that is. 
I stopped by here because it looked like a fun place, and I thought some icecream would be nice. All I can think about now is how FREAKING DELICIOUS the icecream sundae I had was! I mean, dreams are made of things like this.

The place is usually pretty busy, but I think it's well worth the wait. Some reviewers have commented on how expensive the ice cream is, but I didn't mind paying $10 for my delicious sundae (and there is a $1 off coupon if you in on Yelp!). Finding a spot to sit can be tricky, but the turnover rate in tables is pretty quick so don't fret.

Be sure to walk through the chocolate shop section while you're there. There are lots of cute 'touristy' gifts that your BFF back home will adore. Any chocolate lover will adore a cutesy San Francisco themed tin filled with chocolate.  They usually are giving out free samples at the entrance, but be warned that the samples inhibit your willpower against buying lots of sweets!

Overall, it's a fun place to stop if you're visiting San Francisco.
author: Melinda R.

description: My mom and I came here yesterday after having a nice lunch at Scoma's and strolling around the square.  I hadn't been since I was a student at SFSU over 20 years ago.  We were both still pretty full from lunch.  We passed on the famous hot fudge sundaes and each had a goblet of ice cream.  Still very good!!  Although I'll always have fond memories of having one of those famous hot fudge sundaes as a kid.  They were the BEST!!
author: Richard C.

description:
In visiting The Original Ghirardelli Chocolate restaurant in Ghirardelli Square, I knew I would have a positive experience, but I underestimate how wonderful it would be. On a Wednesday at about 1:00pm, we did not face lines or inadequate seating. After ordering a cup of coffee and the 'Treasure Island' (warm brownie sundae) to share, we took seats near the chocolate processing in the back. The warm brownie sundae with chocolate fudge was decadent and exceeded expectations. The coffee was made well and complimented the dessert. The highlight, though, was the staff, namely Tadesse (I really appreciated that he provided excellent customer service, smiled the entire time of our visit, anticipated patron needs, and graciously attended to customer requests).

Recommendations:
-Avoid peak times and aim for early or mid-afternoon on a weekday 
-Order (and share!) the 'Treasure Island' instead of their 'Ghirardelli Square' 

Verdict:
An SF highlight! All in all, this was an amazing experience and I am so glad we took the time to visit the Original Ghirardelli chocolatier.
author: Laila A.

description: Monster sundaes are abundant here.  Line moves quickly and it's a cool place for the kids.  Definitely worth it as a reward for dealing with the touristy crowd at Fishermans wharf
author: Eyal E.

description: This place is popular! There are limited seats inside and some outside.  Make sure you give yourself enough time, depending on when you go lines accumulate.  If you live in San Francisco or visiting you must visit this historic staple at least once.
author: Mary F.

description: Pretty good! My first time in SF and I had to check out this place. Lines were long but not bad of a wait. I loved their sea salt caramel sundae. That's how I got into sea salt desserts.
author: Aljelen P.

description:
Sugar free vanilla. Single scoop. You would have never known that it was sugar free!
Loved hearing Italian there too!
author: Thomas D.

description:
This place is AWESOME!  It's pricey but so is pretty much everything in San Francisco. $9 per sundae is about the average on the menu. 

The Hot Fudge....legendary!  It's the best in the world. The ice cream is really good as well. 

Plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. There is also a display which shows how chocolate is made. 

Worth a stop if you're in the area.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Strike It Rich! And so I did when visiting the Ghirardelli Chocolate shop for the umpteenth time. Always a favorite when in San Francisco.

The rocky road and mint chocolate chip were fantastic substitutes for the vanilla and praline ice creams normally in the Strike It Rich.

When parking, don't put too many quarters into the street machines, it won't tell you when to stop.

If you order vanilla anything at a chocolate shop, I'll be able to tell through the force. The force of Ghirardelli Chocolate is strong with me.
author: Chris R.

description: I was told to definitely check out the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop while in San Francisco. The dessert shop is located near Fisherman's Wharf. It's nothing like the sweet aroma of fresh chocolate and waffles cones. Customers can see the chocolate being made inside. Ghirardelli was very busy over the weekend. This is a big tourist attraction, so expect long lines and a wait. I ordered a chocolate chip cookie dough sundae. Check in with your Yelp app to receive a $1 off sundaes. This was one of the best sundaes I've eaten. The ingredients blended great together. I enjoyed every spoonful. The portion is huge and filling. It's enough for 2 or 3 people. Service was good for a busy dessert shop. There are different custom chocolate souvenirs customers can purchase at this location. If you're a tourist, put Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop on your bucket list in San Francisco.
author: Dominic B.

description: 1. Chocolate; 2) Chocolate everywhere; 3) I'm gonna get diabetes from just standing in there. This place was awesome. This is a must go-to place if you're in SF. It makes for a nice relaxing place to go after exploring Fisherman's Wharf and Hyde Street Pier. This is also a great place to go to get souvenirs for friends and family back home, plus you get a free sample of Ghirardelli chocolate whenever you enter! Be warned: the Sundaes were are huge and I thought this would be a little snack before dinner but became a full-on meal for me. I got the Espresso Escape from the Intense Dark Sundaes line. Highly recommend it if you love chocolate and coffee.
author: Brena H.

description:
A clock tower and a giant sign that said "GHIRARDELLI" beckoned me to this place. That and the promise of a cold white chocolate mocha during what became a hot sweltering day. 

The mocha was rich, and I really enjoyed how much history was in this building (the free samples of Ghirardelli chocolate helped too). Authentic looking decor like old clocks and a chocolate churning machine AND a front entrance stocked to the roof in Ghirardelli chocolate really made this a super unique place to be at. I kind of wish service was a bit better though as the guy serving my drink was kinda rude and loud to me.

But seriously, as far as I'm concerned, this is as close to being in Willy Wonka's chocolate factory in California as you'll ever get.
author: Albert L.

description:
The history nerd in me loved this more than the sweets offered. The room was a little overwhelming with chocolate craved people looking for their next fix, but I loved the energy.

We bought a couple bite size chocolates we hadn't tried before and then grabbed a hot chocolate. The brownie sundaes and other treats coming out of the kitchen looked decadent and too rich for our taste. The hot chocolates were good and a great touch to the very chilly breeze blowing off the ocean waters.

The outdoor seating was pleasant and provided more space than the indoor seating.

The history of Ghiradelli Square and the historic building are displayed on the southwest wall - you have to read it - it's so fascinating!
author: Lindsy H.

description:
This place went down a notch since the last time I was here. 
We got a banana split and for a chocolate famous spot they sure didn't put any on the ice cream. 
Also they used to bring the ice cream on a separate plate to catch the drops but this time they insisted on not doing that even after I requested a plate so that the ice cream wouldn't drip all over the table. I guess they want to save money on washing dishes.
author: Juliana B.

description: After riding bikes across the golden gate bridge and enjoying a meal at Fisherman's wharf,  we treated ourselves to dessert here.  We were seated fairly quickly on the bustling friday night.  We both had an Espresso Escape-  espresso chip ice cream a dark chocolate hot fudge sundae.   OMG Perhaps one of the best ice cream experiences of my life!   The dark chocolate hot fudge was indescribably good.  Kinda glad it's not more accessible to me because I would be hard pressed to resist.
author: Maura T.

description: Took our family to Ghirardelli Square for ice cream and so glad we did.  Ice cream was exceptionally delicious! Very creamy and flavorful.  Went into a couple of the shops and everyone very friendly.  Chocolate samples were offered in two of the chocolate shops, which made me naturally want to buy some to go. Ghirardelli Square is must visit location when in San Francisco.
author: Brigette B.

description: Although touristy, it was a great place, great location overlooking the water and fun ambiance.
author: Viola H.

description:
5, really!?  My answer is an emphatic yes.  Where else could you wait in line, usually at night and in the cold, to overpay for an ice cream sundae, wait yet again for a table, and still feel like you weren't ripped off by the experience?  Ghirardelli that's where.

It's hard to screw up great ice cream and hot fudge.  Add a cookie, brownie, or whatever other old school ice cream parlor topping you'd like and you won't be disappointed; however if gummy bears and frozen yogurt is your thing you just might be.
author: Alberto O.

description: The hot fudge sundae is one of my favorite desserts anywhere.  We went a few times and at different times of day.  There was always a line and this is always worth the wait.  Probably one of the top three sundaes I've ever eaten.
author: Matt S.

description: The atmosphere of this shop wasn't quite as inviting as I thought it would be....But who cares?! the hot fudge sauce was AMAZE! I would eat it under a bridge down by the river, so a few un-bussed tables didn't detract one bit. It's an SF icon, go here and pig out people!!!
author: Maud R.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for GHIRARDELLI! Well, maybe not all, but I certainly do!

Somehow, we always end up here on our visit to SF. If you have a big army, you must order the earthquake: 8 scoops of ice cream and toppings of your choice. Or if you want to be brave, you can have them surprise you! That's always fun because they're the experts, you can't go wrong with that option.

Every time I've been here, it has been packed. The seating clears up pretty quickly though, so don't you worry your sweet teeth! There's a cute little water fountain at the back of the room. And it's complimentary! You will definitely need it after all that sugar you have consumed.

Bonus: Free sample if you go through the gift shop!
author: Sidney T.

description: We shared  warm brownie sundae   ( I loved that chewy/ creamy texture ) and strawberry dream ( which wasnt that sweet, but warm strawberries really  elevate it.).  do I have to say that was one of the best  ice cream I have ever had? and iw was really rich,  especially brownie one so it was almost our dinner) definitely worth to try!
author: Hanka J.

description: Chocolate OVERKILL!  I split a sundae and it was still way too much!  With that, it tastes heavenly.  Make sure you grab any tourist pamphlet on the way in or check in because they have lots of different coupons available.
author: Amanda M.

description: Quick service and quite busy so that was a little surprising. Ice cream and chocolates were great and store provided several choices.  A nice place for dessert.
author: Ann W.

description: Hands down the best ice cream,  fudge I have ever had.  My only complaint.  The longgggg line. But it was worth the wait. Loved it.
author: Audrey N.

description: Holy all that is delicious and chocolate filled. I kind of forgot about this place until I saw a review that reminded me that I have never reviewed this place. What true gem! It is also a MUST that you go there if you visit San Francisco. I am not kidding. Stock up on those caramel filled chocolates and stand in line to get you some hot chocolate. Just wow! I promise it will be worth it. Great for photo opps as well!
author: Chelsea R.

description:
Chocolate. Hot Fudge. What else do you need???

As a little girl, I always insisted on getting an ice cream sundae for myself. I didn't want to share it.  I think my parents/relatives wanted to share because they couldn't finish one on their own, but I knew I could. It was just THAT good!  Now as an adult, it's still just as good, but now I'm more calorie conscious and wouldn't consume an entire sundae on my own, unless I was going to splurge.

So on my most recent visit, I almost got a sundae, only because I wanted their thick, dark chocolate, hot fudge.  Until I realized that I could just order a scoop of ice cream with a hot fudge topping.  So I got cookies & cream with hot fudge. MMMmmm...boy was that good! ...and it was the perfect amount!
author: Audrey C.

description:
If you're visiting San Francisco. make sure to head here after you check out Fisherman's Wharf. Get some pretty pictures and then head into the cafe to buy some ice cream or hot chocolate. 

Of course I bought a sundae. Rocky road, vanilla, crushed almonds, hot fudge, and whipped cream. The hot fudge was incredible. It takes like they just melt their rich chocolate and smother your ice cream with it. I'm assuming thats what they do. The staff is so nice and the inside is beautiful. 

Plan on being here for at least an hour because you'll need 30 mins to wake up from your food coma.
author: Laura G.

description:
Excellent chocolate ice cream. flavorful and it tastes like actual ghiradelli chocolate.

Nice outdoor seating with a view of San Francisco Bay.
author: Lawrence T.

description:
This place was totally packed with people on a Saturday night, craving their overpriced chocolate because it's "gourmet".

I think the floors are bowing in the center, too.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
One word that says it all:

CHOCOLATEEEEEEE

^__________^
author: Amy C.

description:
Counter Lady: Hello, how can I help you?

Me: Hello, I'm looking to purchase a single-scoop of ice cream in a chocolate-dipped waffle cone.  What's your most popular flavor?

Counter Lady: That'll be the Ghirardelli Chocolate, that's what we're known for.  

Me: Okay, I'm going to get strawberry.

That wasn't the most intelligent conversation I've ever had, but probably the least intelligent decision I've made.  I went against the norm/recommendation and it kind of bit me in the behind because the strawberry ice cream was very mediocre in taste.  In their defense, strawberry isn't what they're known for.  But I will say that it was HUGE in size.  I mean, this thing was the size of my forearm plus fist.  I'd pay the $5-something again even if it was just for the waffle cone though.  That thing tastes so fresh and you can watch them whip it up behind the stations.

The chocolate shop has a ton of great treats for you to take home (DIY kits, holiday specialty chocolates, hot cocoa mix, chocolate bundles, etc) and they make perfect souvenirs.  There is a friendly Ghirardelli man who greets you with a complimentary Ghirardelli square as soon as you enter into the store.
author: Crystine W.

description: The sundaes are a bit pricey but you can definitely share them between two people. I had their cookie bit sundae and it was to die for !
author: Autumn ..

description:
Sugar overload - in a good way! We go to this place every time we take guests to show around SF. 

Ghirardelli is my favorite American chocolate brand [Of course, I prefer European chocolates like many others]. Their sundaes are awesome - the Salted Caramel is unique and my favorite so far. They have ample outdoor seating and it is always fun to sit outside and enjoy a sundae, while enjoying the nice weather of SF and watching people.

Prices are a bit on the higher side, but worth it.
author: Mia C.

description: if you haven't seen it post renovation, you need to! They've done an excellent job with the recent construction! Perfect place to grab a dessert or coffee and just watch the sunset over Alcatraz. Don't forget to take a jacket, it does get pretty chilly!
author: Khalat T.

description: Delicious! The ice cream and chocolates are soooooo good! Definitely a fan favorite! You can tell it's the place to be for tourists and locals because it was packed! The only thing holding me back from 5 stars is that the floors and tables were dirty and to go to the restrooms you have to go outside but there's no security. Other than that, a great place to go for some sweets and a great conversation.
author: Lyndenise B.

description:
My Favorite place, Hot fudge Brownies Sunday 
Love it !! 4 star so no place to sit :)
author: Raman D.

description:
OMG.

SO GOOD!

Its kind of a walk up a steep hill to reach the entrance, but it is SO worth the hike.   Order at the counter, find a seat (this can be quite difficult at times), and wait for heaven to arrive.

I ordered the Gold Rush and specifically ordered the dark hot fudge.  It was layers of dark chocolate, real crunchy peanut butter and vanilla ice cream.  It was delicious.

Con: It is about $8-10 depending on what you order.   If you have a family it could get very expensive.
author: Heidi S.

description:
I am truly a fan of this brand of chocolates. I use this brand for all my chocolate infused recipes and can only find it at certain places here in Vancouver. It was actually my best friend's idea to come and check this place out while in San Fran as a culinary must. This was close to the Wharf so it wasn't out of our way at all.

This place wasn't just chocolate, it was ice cream, pastries and them some all made with Ghirardelli chocolate. I was already in a mental sugar coma before the ordering began. 

It took me at least 30 minutes to decide what I wanted 'cause I only had a few Weight Watchers Points (needed to fit into the bathing suit for pool side at Coachella). Thankfully my best friend was willing to share the sugar load (no pun intended). We ordered a banana split. I felt less guilty about it since there was fruit even though it didn't positively affect the calories. If I am going to over eat something, I would rather do it with less guilt as possible. 

There is only a few stores in Vancouver that sells these products, therefore, I was tempted to buy a whole bunch of chocolate for baking but walked away with some decency. Only problem was that they did not sell singles, you have to go to Fisherman's Wharf for that and buying an 80ct 5lb bag was unreasonable. 

Being the original site it's extremely busy, therefore, if you're inpatient by nature this is not the place for you. It is a sit down service but the turn over is fast since it's just ice cream.
author: Shila B.

description:
Who knew that the opposite end of the square had another retail shop whereby we could nab some hot chooclates to nurse our chilled bodies after an evening spent in Fort Mason, witnessing and partaking in the GG Br's birthday bash?! Busy busy busy at 11PM!

For about $5, it was hot, silky, and smooth... Ever a yummy beverage. Taking our treausres outside and nabbing that beaut of a firepit conversation pit with benches surrounding. Loathe to leave.....making my race-walk back to the BART in the dark night not so pleasant! Made it.. with 2 mins. to spare!
author: Jana C.

description:
Agh, so torn.  I hate to love this place and love to hate it.  This particular visit was more of a hate to love it.  It was beyond busy during the holiday break.  Finding a table was cut throat.  Had we not had a 8 week old baby on board we may not have snagged a table in time when our drinks and treats came out.  Note to self, carry small baby with you for sympathy and preferential treatment...works like a charm.

It's over priced, yes.  It's tradition, sure.  It's touristy, you betcha.  It's hard to pass up dessert, of course.  And where else can you attempt to eat your weight in chocolate sauce, ice cream and over priced hot chocolate and it be acceptable behavior?  Exactly!
author: Gina S.

description: Love their ice creams... Expresso escape is the best!
author: Manoj D.

description:
Great place to take in the San Francisco Bay in a family friendly area. Lots of cute shops and great chocolate. It is a bit of a tourist trap, so if you don't like crowds of people this may not be for you.

I always go thinking I'll have only 1 or 2 bites of my husband's sundae and then end up devouring a lot more :)
author: Marlyn F.

description: We came here to try the chocolates and Ice cream and its the bomb ( meaning D-lishes ) we had a few samples and a chocolate brownie cake ice cream, can you say yum, wow. I love this place, when on vacation we always buy the new chocolates coming out, and have an Ice cream. I wish we lived closer, but if i did I wouldn't have any teeth. Its that good. See you next...
author: Leone G.

description: My husband and I stopped here and shared a sundae with hot fudge sauce, which was well worth the $12.39 (including tax).  You can choose any two flavors of ice cream, but we stuck with the basics of chocolate and vanilla.  It was excellent, but definitely a good item to share; it was massive!  The store was very crowded, but the staff was efficient, and things moved pretty quickly, which was nice.  Our friends each ordered ice cream cones, which were also huge.  Everyone enjoyed this stop; it is definitely pricey and touristy, but that is to be expected.
author: Violet G.

description:
The ice cream was very savory and creamy. Definitely recommend it if you're visiting Aquatic Park or Pier 39. I can't believe it's my first time coming here and I've lived in San Francisco all my life. 

The staff here could be nicer and more polite though.
author: Jasmin C.

description: Visiting from Los Angeles, it was my first time exploring Ghirardelli Square, and I gotta say their ice cream and chocolate is excellent! I ordered a Treasure Island Sundae and it was the best sundae I have ever had in my life! Had to wait about 15 minutes to get my order, but it's definitely worth the wait and the $12. Will be returning on my next trip!
author: Franky H.

description: The environment is great. A little noisy but not overwhelming. My girlfriend is a big chocolaholic so i knew she'd love it. She got the Fudge brownie sundae and i got the Chrissy Fields. We both gave our Sunday's an 8. The chocolate can get a little much so we had to get some water which is free in the center which you see everyone running for of dehydration lol. Great service and has an old school ice cream shop feel.
author: Carlos M.

description: Major tourist trap, but when it's named The Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop and you're in San Francisco for the first time ever, how could you not pay a visit? Ordering is the simple part as it's quick with many lines to jump on. The wait begins once you start hawking for a table (even if it's just a small table for 3) and then waiting for your sundae. No seriously, it's so crowded, you literally will feel like you're on edge scouting for tables as people tend to stay awhile. All in all, we waited a little over an hour for our Ghirardelli Square - World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae, which is vanilla ice cream overflowing with handmade hot fudge, whipped cream, chopped almonds, and a cherry. One bite into this dessert and you'll instantly forget about the table troubles and how you waited over an hour for it. It was THAT good. Not to mention, this sundae was meant to share with 3 people, but I ate this entire thing alone..
author: Boris C.

description:
Ice cream shoppe or bust! If I ever make my way through the tourist den known as the Wharf without diving headlong into a Domingo sundae accented by my free square of Milk Chocolate with Caramel, then son, my legs must've been Lt. Dan'd.

I've got a slight tiff with those goblets that magnify the fudge capacitor (McFly!) and how even with the most minimal of meltage, you're guaranteed an overflow. But one bite of that redundant banana/fudge/ice cream monstrosity and all is well with the world.

Besides, where else but a faux-soda shoppe can you use the line: "That place was full of jerks. It was awesome!"? Nowhere - that's where.
author: Damien S.

description:
Late review from my last trip. Must visit:) nothing better than eating at the actual factory for some Ghirardelli yummy scrumptious goodness and actually watch them make it from behind the glass wall!!!  

You order at the counter where you can customize your yummy orders and they give you a number for your table. On the way out, grab some Ghirardelli goodies to bring home or to a loved one. I especially like the San Fran cable car tin full of chocolates.. But that's cause I'm a tourist^_^V
author: Alviesan T.

description: We had the cookie sundae and it was fine. I really don't think its worth the hype at all, but Ghirardelli sure is making a killing on the prices. You go up and order, they give you a number, then drop it off to you. I really felt like I paid $10 for Dreyer's ice cream and just a little bit of fudge and some cookie crumbles on top. Really, not worth it.
author: Ashley P.

description: once of best places which I would like to come in. They show the process of chocolate making too. milk shakes are too good . You need to wait for ur order which will be worth. Thank u.
author: Chaithanya G.

description:
A very hyped-up and overrated fox. Fun to go once, but nothing worth returning to. 
It's a shame, because I love Ghirardelli chocolate, and I always use their cocoa for hot chocolate or baking, and their brownie mix for my "homemade" brownies. Which brings me to say, I found my brownies, which I make with their mix, much better from what they serve here themselves. Their sundaes were very melty, overly-sweet, with average to low quality ice cream. But of course they can get away with it; it's a San Francisco tourist trap.
author: Niusha S.

description: Super cute. Great place for a date or a little romance with a sugar high.  The sundaes are huge and plenty enough to share. The line can get long but moves quick. Walkable from the pier. Huge lawn.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Feeling a little tired? This is a place where you will get a whiplash with sugar rush. 

One word for this review. 

WOW!!!!!!
author: Neo N.

description:
If you're ever touring San Fran for funsies, this is a great place to go. Whether on a family vacation or just exploring god-forsaken California, this place is rich in history and in chocolate toppings.

It's the original building where Ghirardelli supposedly started, the little bulletins on the wall give you a history lesson of its making and there's also some displays set up to show how chocolate was made back in the day. The smell of chocolate overwhelms the store. Not to mention there's always a chance to snatch a few sample of the latest chocolate being released.

While the pricing for their massive sundae's may be a little over the top, it's to be expected in a heavy tourist area and I'll make any excuse to eat lots of ice cream shamelessly.
The chocolate fudge they use is so amazing and spicy, it's unlike any chocolate you could get anywhere else.

A perfect place for children, as they were running around, screaming everywhere, hyped up on sugar, and the only thing that would make this place complete is free shots of chocolate vodka for the parents.
author: Nicolette H.

description: I don't know what's special about this place. Super touristy and over-priced. Will not visit again.
author: Cindy K.

description:
God this place has delicious ice cream. Just visited SF and already missing it.

When we entered they gave us a free square of the caramel chocolate. We ordered the sundae that comes with cookie dough, cookies and cream ice cream, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and 2 caramel squares. SO DELICIOUS. Expensive but tasty.
author: Sara K.

description:
Just a couple more nights on our trip and I had to bring my daughter here. Was a great tradition when I traveled here w my childhood friends. Starting a new tradition!

My go to way back when was The Cable Car sundae and it's just as good as I remember. Jonathan took our sundae order and with a smile, said he added a little something extra. I took a look at the receipt and it said "extra happiness". I laughed and didn't think anything more of it. When they brought out our sundae they also brought a special brownie for my daughter. Very sweet of them and she loved it. Jonathan stopped by to say hi and we thanked him. Was glad to share one of my favorite experiences from my trips here as a kid.
author: Gabe L.

description:
This is one of the tourist staples in San Francisco.

Ghirardelli has long since been an established name in the field of chocolate, and this location stands as the monument to its success. Perched high above the park and waterfront below, Ghirardelli Square offers a cozy and large courtyard for both its shade during the day, and the gentle lights when the night settles.

Any time you walk through the main doors, you're greeted by an employee with a sample of their daily chocolate...and that's honestly where it stops for me haha. 

It's not that I'm against their chocolate (Ghirardelli's darks are very good), but I can't see myself eating their bags of chocolate anytime soon, and the prices on it aren't helping. Rather, I like myself one or two fancier chocolates and I'm set. Nevertheless, Ghirardelli offers a full menu of ice creams and drinks, all of which seem very tasty, I'll have to actually try it one of these days!

Always a comforting spot to rest while you trek the hills of San Francisco (if you're a boss), Ghirardelli is always a treat! Cheers.
author: Nicolai D.

description: Busy busy busy tourist place. However, even during peak times, once you order - stuff comes out fairly quick. This is one place every tourist should add to their list. The Ghirardelli ice cream, milkshakes, and sundaes are wonderful. If you have a large party (4+) you can share a $40 banana split... it's huge.
author: Susan H.

description: The brownie sundae was probably one of the best things I've had all day. It's a bit overpriced and crowded, but it's worth it after walking around the area. It's best to share this with a friend (or better yet, don't share this) and go to town on ice cream, warm brownie and whipped cream. Great stuff. There's a lot of tourists (obviously), but you'll make do with your ice cream.
author: Soren N.

description: When you're in San Francisco and need an ice cream fix, The Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop is the place to go. Yes, it's filled with tourists but so what? They have a great selection, the staff is amazingly friendly and it's Ghirardelli chocolate. What more could you want?
author: Dave S.

description: Nice gift shop, friendly staff, Only ordered the ice cream but it was yummy (: cookies & cream FTW ! woohoo. Their waffle cones were top notch too! Hrm..cute little sign outside. Nice seating area inside and out. Definitely a cute tourists spot. I haven't tried anything else besides the ice cream so I can't go much into detail. But I can say that there were plenty of people there eating. It didn't seem as if most of them were tourists. Maybe it was just locals that know a good place when they see it ! (: Oh and btw they give you free chocolate when you first come in :D
author: Andrea L.

description:
First...make sure you check in here before you order/pay!  You get $1 off a sundae!

Second...the salted caramel sundae is bomb diggity!

Third...if you don't want to wait in line for an hour to just get a seat to eat your ice cream, go around the back....follow the "to go orders" signs.  You don't have to sit inside to enjoy your ice cream....go pick a spot in the courtyard or a grassy spot in the park out front.
author: Sheng M.

description:
I went twice to Ghirardelli for ice cream of course.
So I get the Warm brownies sundae and the rocky road sundae.

The former is sooo yummy. I think the brownies is homemade, so perfect ice cream after having hang out in SF the whole day. I recommend this one.

The latter, I would say too much whipped cream and not enough ice cream. This one is heavy, too much for me. But, it's my point of view of course..

I will still get this place 5 stars, because the ice cream is good, and waiter and waitress are friendly, which can be difficult at the end of the day in such a touristic place than SF close to the Lombard street.
author: Cyprien K.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy, ice cream in my tummy.

Despite the cold winds outside, I still had no problem saying yes to a sundae at Ghirardelli. My friends and I split the caramel sundae, the chocolate sundae, and the cookies and cream sundae. We all agreed it was the most velvety rich ice cream we have ever had. Right by Pier 39, I can imagine how crowded it can get. 

My favorite part was all the ghirardelli chocolate bars that you can buy. SO MANY TO CHOOSE FROM!!!
author: Ashley N.

description: We had the presidio which was a combo of strawberry and hot fudge syrup on vanilla ice cream! it was heaven and it was generous serving for two people. While waiting for the ice cream, we looked at the stationary ice cream  making equipment and did some photo ops. In the retail store, the nice guy was handing out a free sample of ghirardelli chocolate! Another heaven! There were exciting packages on display that are very American in themes; e.g. American flag, San Francisco memorabilia, and there were Valentina's items. Yay! We ate our ice cream outside and it was superb as the cool breeze of the bay was enveloping us while enjoying the ice cream. Talking about cloud nine with ice cream!!!!!!!
author: Kitty D.

description:
I could see this having tons of traffic, being this is the "original" site, but I didn't find my visit to be any different than the Ghirardelli back home. Sure, get in line, order your sundae/cocoa, pick a table, then while you wait, take pics in front of their machinery. 

I was anticipating a nice cup o' luscious, rich ghirardelli-style cocoa. The Lombard Street cocoa: cup of hot milk + squares of their milk chocolate, stir it in yourself. Not quite the come-all-the-way-to-SF-for-this-jelly. I suppose it's a step-up from the powdery-syrupy stuff I get back in their Chicago store. We also split a sundae, but I guess if you didn't live around a Ghirardelli shop, you'd find the experience more novel.
author: Jenny H.

description:
You know you are close when you smell the dreamy chocolate in the air. 
Walk into the store an they will give you a free piece of chocolate! 
However, the ice cream parlor is where it is at: a miniature chocolate museum. I enjoyed reading the history of chocolate.
Of course the ice cream sundaes are fabulous!! But they cost a pretty penny. Make sure you have enough room to spare on a pricey taste of heaven. There are tables inside and outside to sit. A nice little touristy spot to visit while walking the water in San Francisco.
author: Amber H.

description: I was really excited to visit this place with my family, so we decided to give it a try. Our orders came melted with broken cones and our coffee was ice cold. Such a disappointment because i had such high expectations. If im paying $10.00 for an ice cream, it better not be melted with a broken cone. Never coming back.
author: Zaynab A.

description:
Why do I always fall into this tourist trap?  I don't necessarily enjoy paying $10+ for a bowl of ice cream but all the other cute couples come here to split sundaes!!!

There is always a line here regardless of time of day.  It is always hard to find a table and most of the time the table is a sticky mess covered in the last person's trash.  Bus boys frequently come around to clean but this place has a very high turnover of customers.

I will admit the ice cream is good, very good.  Again, it's just so expensive and so overrated!
author: Erin H.

description: Ahh yeah definitely worth stopping by to get dessert or hot drinks! Service was quick. The dessert menu is definitely worth exploring. The hot chocolate was one of the best ones I've had! Also the sundae was so delicious though it had a bit too much chocolate syrup!
author: Nin A.

description:
Love love love their banana split and hot fudge Sunday.
Lines are crazy but we also went during spring break!
Don't forget your free chocolate sample!
author: Jo L.

description:
Stop into the original Ghirardelli shop.

Prior to my stop here, I had only visited the shop at Downtown Disney in Orlando.

While I did not sample the frozen goods this time around, I did enjoy the free chocolate square upon entrance and the chocolate production machines.  

Before visiting the restaurant, check out the tourist stands in the square as there will most likely be a 10% off coupon floating around.
author: Brian K.

description: The ice cream here is just as good as any place, but the atmosphere is what makes this place cool. Prepare to wait in line to order, and then another 20 mins for your ice cream. It's a total tourist trap, but a good spot for dessert nonetheless. Check in here for $1 off a sundae.
author: Britt W.

description: A MUST - if you are looking for the best ice cream around - this place is for you - delicious every time - always tasty
author: Phillip S.

description: Got the domingo ( I think) maybe I made it up. But it had tons of sweet bananas in a sundae cup filled with vanilla ice cream and chocolate fudge. The lines were long but they move fast and in no time I had my sundae for the fleet week show.
author: Janet D.

description:
I love Ghirardelli chocolate, but this place is a nightmare.

This is definitely a tourist spot, which would explain the massive crowd standing in line, but waiting for my ice cream made me regret ever walking in. There is no room for people to wait for their orders. Not only that, my family and I had to wait for around 30 minutes for two ice cream scoops and a sundae.

Their system is very inefficient as the cashier located at the back wall of the building and the pick-up area is located at another wall. The output of orders can't keep up with the input and the never ending line.

(If you only want chocolate, there is also another Ghirardelli store. Walk around the building and check out the courtyard.)
author: Vivian K.

description:
This place is good to take a significant other, but the guys get the short end of the stick (unless you're a sweet tooth).
My goodness, the real fudge is wayyyyyyy too sweet. I couldn't handle it. I just liked the ice cream. The fudge was a bit over the top for me. PHewwwwww..

And the place is really frantic with all of the fifty workers rumbling and stumbling over each other to get the orders out. I think they need a bigger work space! They seemed so stressed out and the inside of this place is a bit claustrophobic!

The sundae is enough for two. Expect to pay about $10 per couple. Unless you stop by the side shop :P
author: Michael K.

description:
Mmm.. Believe the hype.

If visiting Ghirardelli Square (http://www.yelp.com/biz/ghirardelli-square-san-francisco) didn't fill you up on chocolate goodness, waddle your way over a minute or two the the Ice Cream and Chocolage Shop. Yes, it's crowded all of the time. Imagine what would happen if Willie Wonka opened his factory to the public. Yes, exactly the mayhem you would imagine.

My recommendation (to help avoid tummy aches): have your dessert fill here.. THEN head over to the gift shop at the Square.
author: Peter K.

description:
Amazing amazing place for chocolate lovers :) they have the greatest banana splits & chocolate malt shakes. I love the spinning chocolate wheel! 
Weekends are busy, as expected. But this is in a great location! Definetly need to check this place out if you're coming from out of town.
author: Isabella M.

description:
Right below the Ghirardelli chocolate factory in Ghirardelli Square right offa Fishermans Wharf.

Went to the ice cream portion and got the $8.95 Hot Fudge Sundae. Unbelievably delicious Vanilla Ice Cream as the Hot Fudge from melted chocolate is amazing!!! Thick and rich!
author: Shaun W.

description: What a cute place.  At the front door they were giving out free samples of peppermint bark.  I tucked them in my bag to take back to my coworkers.  You enter into the market/cafe and order from a cashier any drinks or ice cream treats you would like to enjoy.  Hubs and I ordered the cookie bit sundae.  While waiting in line I strolled the store and bagged up more small chocolate squares in a variety of flavors for the folks back home.  After a somewhat long wait (-1 star)  our sundae arrived and it was perfect in its cholatey goodness.  Homemade real whip cream, check!  Melted Ghiradelli choclate and cookie pieces, check!  A perfect sugar high for adults and kids!
author: Bianca S.

description: Over priced ice cream and chocolate. This place is a tourist trap. Nothing special about it all.
author: Khanh C.

description:
Ok, this is a tourist stop.  However, sometimes it's fun to be a tourist in your own city.
Sundays are great.  I think it's the real whipping cream that does it.  Chocolate is just right.  This isn't some sort of poofy gourmet spot but it makes the perfect rendition of a hot fudge Sunday.  Location is picturesque.  I like to sit at the outdoor tables on the square.
The $1 off for a yelp check-in is a nice bonus.
author: Ric S.

description:
Ghirardelli's is a cross between Willy Wonka's chocolate river and a hydro-electric dam. Whimsical chocolate on a massive industrial scale. We could have done with a warning that each of their sundaes can easily feed two people and ruin appetites at twenty paces.

Despite our best efforts we barely put a dent in one Cookie & Cream sundae and I was completely defeated by the Butterscotch variety. In my defense, it was about one-third pure golden syrup. We felt bad about the sheer wastage, but it was either that or risk a diabetic coma.

Overall it was kind of fun, but I don't normally do this much soul-searching after dessert.
author: Dave H.

description: This is a must eat when you are in San Fran. It is THE original! If you are a fan then this has to be on your bucket list. The chocolate cherry ( new on the menu) is the best creation I've tried yet! the sundaes are always amazing, be sure to either come starving or share, because they are big!
author: Karlynn J.

description: Umm.... does this really need an explanation?!  It's a store full of wonderful delicious chocolate and you even get a sample when you walk in.  I would highly recommend the salted caramel sundae.  YUM!  Grab a basket and fill up for the holidays
author: Kara K.

description: Ice cream is amazing and hot fudge is out of this world!! But make sure to come here with available space in your stomach because you may not be able to finish your order.
author: Glo G.

description: Never ever had had anything better. Ever. Beat desert experience of my LIFE! You've never had hot chocolate until you try the sea salt caramel hot cocoa. Ugh!! To die for. And the ice cream.... omigod even something as simple as traditional vanilla, there is absolutely nothing ordinary nor traditional about it. Delicious
author: Susie D.

description:
I love ghirardelli because of their atmosphere but unfortunately they only get three stars because when the ice cream came, it was like 1/3 melted. melted ice cream?! sad times))): Idk if the dishes were too hot or if the waiter just took too long to get it to us but i would've been a much happier camper had the ice cream came like it was supposed to. 

however, I love their chocolate, love the string lights outside and the mood of the place. I'd come back but definitely not for another year or so. hopefully the ice cream won't be melted next time

PS. I went with 5 other friends, so including me, that's 6. We split the berry one and the cookie one. and it was enough for all 6 of us! it came out to $3.84/person! def a plus!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
The Ghirardelli Chocolate cafe and shop within the renown Ghirardelli Square is heaven personified for chocolate lovers.  The restaurant entices long lines of patrons with their huge sundaes; massive brownies and chocolate chip cookies; and rich milkshakes.  The indoor dining parlor can fill up rather quickly, but the outdoor courtyard offers additional, more relaxed seating options.  The attached gift shop sells all of the chocolatier's creations, both singularly and in bulk.  

During my recent excursion, I indulged my sweet tooth with a substantial chocolate chip cookie.  Though the treat was crisp and served at room temperature, each bite possessed the tantalizing saltiness of raw cookie dough.

Ghirardelli Square is not necessarily providing snackers with something that they cannot get at home, but the decadent experience is still enjoyable.  Your stomach will thank you for stopping there...at least initially...
author: Alison C.

description:
This review is not for the desserts, they are good. 

Please save yourself the wait, do NOT come here. Pick another location because its a nightmare here. We waited OVER an hour for a milkshake and two scoops of ice cream.......Even though the place was packed, does it really take that long? It's not like the workers have to make ice cream from scratch in the kitchen. We wanted to change our order to to-go because it took so long, but they told us it didn't matter because orders were prepped by the order number. Then why bother having the to-go service option?! The customer before us at the outdoor area left their unfinished drinks on the tables even though the trashcan was literally right behind them. The table was also SMELLY, like a dirty rag smell. I noticed that my cellphone case smelled like the table after placing it on their table. Disgusting. Anyways, please don't come cause the wait is ridiculous.
author: Anna W.

description: Make sure you check in to get $1 off!!! Their sundae is pretty pricey and I personally don't think it's worth it. The ice scream is average...nothing special about it. Cold stone is better than this.
author: Nicole H.

description: Great cafe to sit down and grab some cold or hot chocolately refreshments near the wharf. The hot chocolate is delish and the ice cream is creamy. They also had plenty of samples as well as bulk chocolate offers. A must visit in SF!  Plus the seating is great and the sundaes are enormous but great!
author: Danan R.

description:
Nothing like some delicious chocolate!! My favorite part is that when you enter the store they give you a free sample of chocolate! 

Their Gold Rush Sundae is so good!! If you love peanut butter you should try it! It won't let you down!
author: Patricia V.

description: If you do not believe in God or a higher power that gets you to heaven, then you need to because I almost certain that Ghirardelli is what heaven tastes like and I need that in my life for eternity. Yes, this is a tourist stop and a must in San Francisco because I've really never seen an ice cream shop quite like this anywhere. The sundaes are huge, definitely shareable, and delicious. I had the treasure island, which is vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, a few nuts, and a warm brownie. It was amazing. I worried before we went that we wouldn't have a place to sit, but that ended up being no problem as there was no wait at all. The shop was clean and the service was great. The only thing that I thought was weird was that our sundae came out before we could even get seated, they must have making them down to a science or so many of a certain thing is ordered that they just make them anyway. Regardless, it's still delicious and I am going back several times before I leave because I'm a little piggy and I don't care.
author: Caroleigh N.

description: This place is a huge tourist spot and a go-to for anyone visiting the city. However $10 for a sundae is pretty expensive and you don't get a large amount. The flavors are pretty standard and the fudge topping is good but you're mainly paying for the experience and atmosphere of ghiradelhi square. There are definitely better ice cream shops in San Francisco but ghiradelhi is historic.
author: Matt S.

description:
