This is a great stop after spending a day wandering around the city or Fisherman's Warf. We stopped in here to get out of the cold for a little while and take pictures. We decided to indulge and fill our tummies with oodles of chocolate and to see what they had to offer. 

There are two places that you can go to order goodies and we went to the one in the back of the square near the chocolate building (look on the map to see where it is). There weren't a lot of people and there was almost no line to order. 

I decided on the Warm Brownie Sundae that set me back $9.95 but the thing is massive! The sundae has vanilla ice cream with a double chocolate brownie, hot fudge, whipped cream, chopped almonds and a cherry. I also couldn't resist a large Classic Ghirardelli hot cocoa that had whipped cream which was $5.25. I love hot chocolate so really how can you go wrong with hot Ghirardelli chocolate, which 
basically was like liquid gold. 

We sat down at one of the high tables to catch a view of Alcatraz Island as the sun was setting. I wasn't focused on the sunset at all or the view but on the copious amounts of glorious diabetes I was consuming!
author: Sara L.

description: Disgusting is what I can say with my overall 1 star rating. This is a tourist trap so avoid buying anything here. The 2 ice-cream we bought was overpriced and full of nasty stuff like tasteless cream and chocolate. You eat one for 15 days and I can guarantee you would die right before you get out of Fisherman's wharf. We ended up throwing both out ice creams half way.
author: Manoj N.

description:
Earthquake!!

Very touristy stop -- one of those places you take your out of town friends. 

It's pretty expensive, but that's to be expected for a touristy spot in the city.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I love chocolate and I love ice cream and I love ice cream with waffle cones. You can imagine how excited I was to try this place! I got the Ghirardelli World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae in the chocolate dipped waffle bowl. All the super thick chocolatey goodness is balanced out with the sweet vanilla ice cream. I even enjoyed the waffle cone so much I started hacking it apart to chew on! 

As you're waiting for your order, you can also watch how they make their chocolate in their mini chocolate factory inside. The chocolate pools make you just want to dive in and take a gulp! A must-see in San Francisco!

This is definitely a sweet treat but one order would seriously be too much for one person. So make sure you grab a friend to go to this place!
author: Karen H.

description:
Yes, yes, everyone is going to be raving about the food here. Of course you're going to eat the sundae with a rootbeer float on the side despite your fasting glucose level of 250 and Hgb A1c at 11.5%. I will let you guys read all the other awesome reviews below to get the skinny on all the great desserts here. When you walk in, you just live and breath chocolate. Here are some tips that you may not know about but will keep you from destroying your experience here:

For parties greater than 4, you are much better off getting your ice cream to go and eating it outside. You are not going to find 2 tables close enough together to enjoy your sweet delights and it's so beautiful outside! Grab it to go and eat it on the pier. 

Bathroom? Why the hell would I be talking about the bathroom at Ghirardelli's? Inevitably, you will be looking for one when you come because chances are you drove for 30 -45 min at least to get here and then you walked up this ginormous hill to get in. The bathroom, ladies and gentlemen, is on the OUTSIDE. Yes, there is most likely going to be a line too.

While you're waiting in the 1000 person line to order your food, send one person to the front of the line to grab a menu and decide before you get to the counter... it'll do us all a favor.

Have a designated stander in line (DSL) who will hold your spot while the rest of your party goes into the gift store to buy your san francisco treats (not rice-aroni). 

Hope this is helpful! If you don't get the brownie hot fudge sundae, you're crazy.
author: Eric C.

description:
Had a bunch of horrible experiences here the last few times I came. The manager offered to send me a Ghirardelli gift basket to make up for it, which I refused. It was however a nice touch to see that the management did care about their guests' experiences, so I returned.

I ate here once last week and am pleased to say the experience was much, much better. While the value is a bit iffy ... nothing in Fisherman's Wharf costs what it would in 'real life'. The portions here aren't amazingly huge, but the ice cream and chocolate is great quality, so it makes up for it.

I had the brownie sunday in a waffle bowl. (You pay the extra for the waffle cone/bowl ... but it totally makes the sunday better!)

The servers were polite and attentive and the process was fairly speedy from ordering to getting the sunday. There were no mistakes made this time, which was nice. It was the off-season, so not as busy but there did seem to be some staff retraining that occurred since the last time I was there.

Overall, this is a fun place to stop for an ice cream while you are doing the tourist thing. Ghirardelli might be sold across the country everywhere from Walmart to CVS but there's something about eating it in its hometown that makes it taste better.

Despite a few rocky visits, they seem to have shaped up their service so I'd bring people who were visiting San Francisco for the first time here.
author: E T.

description: Great service, fantastic ice cream and a beautiful view of the bay. Yes $10 sundaes are a bit much but we all split one for every two. Parking is also expensive so take the MUNI or hope for luck in finding a meter, there are many around.
author: Valerie C.

description:
I came here years ago and like the pig that I am, indulged in their 10 scoop phenomenon happily! Fast forward years later...and I still kinda wanted to do that, but I have learned a bit about self control. Well, just barely!!

So, I took my fiance here and we just wandered throughout the store, which was a fun experience in itself! We stared at chocolate, watched them make some sundaes at the counter, got some samples, and left! This is definitely a fun experience for a chocolate lover, but I personally still prefer See's Chocolates or Fran's Chocolates, yum!
author: Nancy T.

description:
I must be going through a menopausal flashback since in the past couple of months, I've returned to...Merritt Bakery, Oakland Grill, Sam's in Tiburon...standbys from another era that somehow have survived the barrage of trendiness that have led to other establishments' demises. Here's another one, the Ghirardelli Chocolate Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop, which makes it sound like they only serve chocolate ice cream and chocolate, don't you think? 

I'm not sure what motivated Jamie W. and me to come here except there aren't any old-fashioned ice cream parlors anymore - especially in a city as culinarily chic as San Francisco. Sometimes fro-yo just doesn't cut it. Who wants tart when you need artery-clogging creamy? Besides, I don't want to be responsible for the downfall of the maraschino cherry industry. This stuck-in-the-1970's place is abuzz with enthusiastic suburbanites and rude foreign tourists enjoying a favorable currency exchange rate. We elbowed our way to a table where there were remnants of the $29.95 Earthquake, which apparently was eight scoops of ice cream with eight toppings served on a faux-silver platter. Belch. 

We went for the relatively modest $7.95 Hot Fudge Sundae and then splurged the extra dollar for a chocolate-dipped waffle bowl (see photo). Sure, it was good. What else could it be with nuts, whipped cream, chopped almonds, globs of hot fudge and the maraschino cherry which Jamie promptly pilfered? The noise level was darn near unbearable, so we tried to focus on the big paddle in the chocolate-making machine (see photo). Back and forth. Back and forth. Back and forth. Anyhow, we finished the sundae much to our dismay since it spoiled our dinner. Guess mom was right. 

HOT FUDGE SUNDAE - 3.5 stars...classic but nothing that exceptional 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...clean but needs an image update 
SERVICE - 3 stars...buzzed by but the cherry was intact 
TOTAL - 3 stars...classic San Francisco experience if that's what you go for
author: Ed U.

description: Essentially an overpriced alternative to Hershey's, with a crowded, disorganized, and unclean seating area.
author: Bella D.

description:
Ghiradelli Square is one of the required stops on any visitor to San Francisco's itinerary. As a man of simple taste I opted for a vanilla ice cream cone whereas Julia D opted for a milkshake so rich it would be enough for five people.

I was happy with the ice cream but I found the place a bit overwhelming for my tastes especially as screaming children seem to be drawn to it like moths to a flame.
author: Matt B.

description: The ice cream sundaes are so good here and the employees are so friendly and happy.  They even brought cups of water to our table as we ate our sundae!  Very much appreciated and needed.  This is THE place to get ice cream and chocolate near Fishermans Warf.
author: L. Y.

description: Amazing. All I have to say is delicious every time! Workers are lovely. Ice cream yummy and chocolate divine. Always a go to when in the city and although the portions are huge and I eat like a bird I always get my own! I like to have my own dessert! Especially here..
author: Jazmyne W.

description: Great place to visit if you are touring through San Francisco. We were in the area and had a craving for something sweet and this was definitely a great choice! We shared the browny Sunday which was amazing! Can't wait to go there again and try everything else on the menu :)
author: Hila F.

description:
Was looking forward to taking guest to the location. The nostalgic location is under renovation and I must say the temp location across the plaza is lacking in every direction. Not one team member was smiling as they took our orders at the stands. Myself and countless others complained that it took about 40 minutes to get one scoop of ice cream, and literally not one napkin holder had napkins. In fact somebody at the drink area told me to look in a brown bag, yes I looked, and it was empty. 

I hope this captures the attention of a team lead or manager. Every table outside was complaining, and yes all the people waiting at the bar area left unsatisfied. For the first time in 10 years so am I. Here's a call to get it together from one food service member to another. Tell us that it's going to take #:## amount of time, or have someone refill the napkins at all the tables because they were all empty! Be proud and hold up to your tradition.
author: AJ V.

description: A little touristy but worth the crowds. Classic sundaes served in proper glass or metal dishware parlor-style. You'll want to stick to something with chocolate of course but the sea salt Carmel is pretty crazy as well, especially in a parfait. The cable car sundae with mint chocolate chip AND rocky road is big enough to split for normal humans and is tough to beat in terms of multiple gooey rich flavors. Just be sure to walk home.
author: Jeff T.

description: The smell was wonderful well worth the walk lots and lots of chocolate.A must if you are in San Francisco
author: Amanda M.

description: Best ice cream Sundays in the Bay Area. Have to stop by after every visit to the city.
author: Anna B.

description: Not your typical ice cream shop. The cones are huge, the scoops are huge, the sugar rush is huge. PRO TIP: bring water while you're munching on your colossal ice cream cone in the park...you'll need it.
author: Katherine H.

description:
Very touristy place.  Been here several times and now I can say how much I don't really like their ice cream sundae's that much.  Had WAY better ice creams in the LA area.  As for their chocolates, I was hoping that it'd be a lot cheaper to buy at this store but there was barely any price difference.  Too bad because I was hoping it'd be something I can take as a gift back to LA with me.  Always crowded and busy.  It's another place you go once or twice when you're in the San Fran area and quickly get over it.  

Been there, done that, not happy with their prices on chocolates or ice creams.
author: Christy L.

description: Now this is a place that favors quantity over quality! So. Freaking. Big. After leaving (with a days worth of calories surplus), I couldn't even think of ice cream anymore. I think our party ate pretty modestly compared to the other diners (8 scoops for 5 people, while the average one person sundae was, I don't know, 3 1/2 scoops?) Plus, we didn't even finish it. This is a great place for coming once a year, and gorging yourself on sugary ice cream. And I mean, once a year. That's about how long it'll take to burn off one of those mega-huge sundaes. Quality is only so-so. I've had better ice cream. But when there's so much of it, you barely notice.
author: Anonymous R.

description:
This is about the Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop in Ghirardelli Square.  Why in the world would I give this shop only ONE STAR?    This ice cream shop is such a beloved and popular institution in the City of San Francisco, that my ONE STAR rating makes it seem that I am a traitor, or a Communist, or something even worse!!!  I have lived in the San Francisco Bay area since 1965, and attended middle school, high school, college (UCB), and graduate school (also UCB), in the San Francisco Bay area.  As such, I've toured San Francisco many times, and have enjoyed the the Ghirardelli Ice Cream shop on a half-dozen occasions.  At least, I have enjoyed it until last night, when I finally realized that I was being tricked.

On the plus side, the Ice Cream shop is very clean.  There will often be a line outside, but the line is fast moving, and the wait for a table will usually be under ten minutes.  Any person spending a half hour in this Ice Cream shop will enjoy the air, which is "perfumed" with the enticing fragrance of freshly roasted chocolate, and will enjoy being in happy crowd that typically includes international visitors.  When in line, it is typical to hear German, French, Farsi, Hindi, and other languages.   The menu of ice creams is lengthy and enticing.  Also, the chocolate shop off to the side, and in a different room than the dining room, has an attractive and varied display of many kinds of wrapped chocolates, suitable for home use or as gifts.  The types of chocolates vary from year to year, due to the innovating mind of the food scientists who work for Ghirardelli.  For example, an innovation that appears to have materialized in the past ten years is chocolate lightly flavored with salt.  I am glad for the variety and innovation of the chocolates in the gift shop.

Now for the bad news.  For most, or perhaps nearly all of the ice cream "meals," it is the case that about fifty percent of the volume is taken up by WHIPPED CREAM. WHIPPED CREAM!?!?!  The result is that your ice cream meal will taste like a slap of hog lard.  I do not particularly care for the flavor and texture of hog lard, and I do not particularly care for such a dominating presence of WHIPPED CREAM.  Apparently, one of the goals of management, is to save money, by scrimping on ice cream, and by giving you instead PLENTY OF WHIPPED CREAM.  For my recent visit (August 8, 2015), I finally came to my senses, and I ambled over to the trash can near my table, and scooped out half of my phony ice cream meal, which consisted totally of WHIPPED CREAM, and dumped the WHIPPED CREAM into the trash can.  The Ghirardelli ice cream meals are already expensive enough.  Management's behavior at giving you a meal that is 50% WHIPPED CREAM, results in an ice cream product that is in effect twice as expensive as with no whipped cream.  Another complaint is that some of the ice cream meals are given to you in an elegant, heavy-weight glass goblet, but other ice cream meals come in a plastic cup, just like at McDonald's. 

 I noticed that at least a dozen other reviewers complained about the fact that these phony "ice cream" meals consist of 50% WHIPPED CREAM.  As such, one has to be impressed by the phenomenal markup of your meal.   It seems that a typical customer is paying eight dollars for twentyfive cents worth of ice cream.  Wow, I wish that I could start a business where customers are willing to buy a product with such a steep markup!!!
author: Tom B.

description: The sundae that we ordered was delicious, but overpriced. ~$14 for a pretty small portion, 2 scoops of ice cream with fudge and whipped cream. The location is nice, and near to Fisherman's Wharf. I don't think I would go back.
author: Simon G.

description:
As far as a tourist spots go, this is definitely a go-to-spot if you haven't been to SF before. Why? Because there's a gift shop that you can walk through where they give you a free square of their famous chocolate. Also, the chocolate making display is interesting and entertaining. I would check it out if you can manage squeezing through the crowded restaurant.  If you've been here before, I think once is enough, because this place can get ally crowded and packed. I'd rather not wait 15 minutes in line and another 15 minutes to get your order for icecream.

Foodwise, they serve icecream and coffee.  The icecream is genuinely tasty, but definitely a bit sweet for my taste.  I've tried the banana split which is easily shareable amongst four people, but my crowning achievement at this place is ordering the earthquake.  It is basically a scoop of every single type of ice cream that they have topped with chocolate syrup and fruit sauces.  I would only order it if you have at least six people to share it with.  It's definitely worth the price considering you get to try a little bit of all their icecream.

In terms of service, order at the front counter. It should be easily be identifiable with the long line stretching out of it.  Once you make it to the front (usually about 15 minutes), place your order and pay.  They will give you a number so that you can find a seat.  Once you find a seat, they'll bring your order out to you.  This usually takes another 15 minutes.

Like I said, this place is worth a try if it's your first time, but if you've already experienced it once, then there really isn't much enjoyment in mingling with tourists and long lines, especially for just icecream.
author: Howard H.

description:
Salted Caramel Hot Coco!  Holy cannoli its awesome!!

Line can be long, seating can be hard to find.  But if you can  just grab it to go and cop-a-squat outside!  

Go through the gift shop and you get a free sample.
author: Erika G.

description: Service is so so. Parking is a hell and expensive. My sister also bit into a chocolate and found a foil piece in it. But I will say the drinks are fantastic. The best chocolate milk and mochas. And they have flavors of chocolates that you can't find anywhere but online.
author: Anastasia W.

description: Tourist trap for sure, but it's not as packed with tourists compared to Fisherman's Wharf. There's two sections to this place. The first is the gift shop where you can buy all the Ghiradelli chocolate you could ever want, in bars, in bags, in different assortments, in little San Francisco cable car boxes, et al. The second area is the ice cream area. You order first, then take a seat while waiting for your dessert. These desserts are big and quite sweet, so I usually share with a friend. While you're waiting, check out the mini chocolate factory in the back of the shop!
author: Judith C.

description:
I'm actually kind of disappointed by this area because they have something exactly like this at Disneyland so it wasn't special to me except for the fact that this was the original shop.

The products here are more souvenir and touristy with all the San Francisco love going on.  The desserts are a no brainer.  They are all so freaking delicious that it's hard for me to tell you what we ordered.  Just don't order a scoop of ice cram, that's just a waste, get a sundae.  

Service here is quick and short.  They're not that friendly, just want to get their job done which I guess is a good thing since there' so many people here.

Getting here by foot kinds of suck because you have to pass some questionable areas and there's a lot of hills but that's expected in SanFran.
author: Jackie N.

description:
What has happened to this San Francisco landmark?  Unfortunately, like most of San Francisco it has become dirty (ok, actually filthy) and over priced. 
We visited on a Saturday night, expected the 20+ minute wait in line, but did not anticipate the 35+ minute wait for our sundaes.  Tables were non-existent, not cleared or cleaned when vacated.  Floor was covered in used napkins, smashed cherries and ice cream spills.  We ended up next to the dumb waiter which was overflowing and open for all to see.  There did not appear to be any manager present. 
The sundaes finally arrived and I have to agree with other reviews, that they just aren't as good as they used to be.  Hot fudge does not have the same depth as before, quality of ice cream isn't as high and whipped cream had a stale taste.  
Skip this place and head on over to the Ferry Terminal for a truly San Francisco experience.
author: Ally S.

description: Worst sundae ever. My boyfriend took me here during the day today for my birthday and the experience was so awful I had to write a review! I've visited this location many times, and have had the most delicious and decadent sundaes, but not today! We got a caramel sundae from the 'to-go' shop. We were waiting for a pretty log time while or employee made a line full of people's orders. When he had to call for help his "supervisor" came out and started helping with the orders. He came out and would call people's names before he even made your order (probably to make sure you hadn't left yet) then would make your order. He made me the sloppiest most un-delightful sundae of my life. He skimped on all the ingredients he possibly could. I have had better sundaes at McDonalds. So basically unpaid 9 bucks for a 1 dollar Sundae and really bad service. never again!
author: Christina G.

description: Clearly this is a tourist destination. They have ordering upstairs and eating downstairs. It was so busy when we got there that the lineup stretched to the door. If you ride the cablecar first you get 10% off so plan accordingly. I ordered a berry smoothie that was almost $8, my hubby ordered some 3 scoop ice cream thing in a waffle cone which was over $6 and my 3 little kids each shared a 3 scoop sundae over $4. Little pricey. So the restaurant was a little grungy and I cant imagine how much the pest control  contract costs with all that sugar & syrup on the floors. I don't care much for GMO anything and there was so much super sweet chocolate and chemicals that its not enjoyable for me. But that's just me and this is my yelp page so there.
author: Corina J.

description:
easter sunday festival 2014, frustrating and  so hard coz they are not 
Organized...1 baloon sculpture maker...line is like 30 plus...
1 bunny picture booth...50 people lined up...
1 face painter...20 people in line. 
People are just losing patience...
They did the egg hunt at 1030 am
But website says easter party is 12-230pm....

We drove 1 hr to get here....
we are thankful for the free icecream for kids :)
author: Bing.kay B.

description: Just looking at the staff making these adorable sundaes makes you feel like the happiest person on earth! Not to mention the taste, which is out of this world!!!
author: Iris H.

description:
AHH! FREE SAMPLES! I wanted to leave right after (and come back after an hour), but I couldn't resist the 3 for $34 deal they had! There were so many different flavors and I wanted to buy them all, but my blood sugar would sky-rocket. I decided to buy their milk chocolate, "vanilla dream," and dark chocolate truffle! I like the SF bridge and double decker bus souvenirs they have for sale here, too. They make nice gifts for friends and family.

Of course, with Ghirardelli Square situating itself as a tourist spot, don't expect bargain deals. The prices do seem a bit inflated, but I don't mind paying double or triple if I get great chocolate and ice cream. I wasn't  able to eat at the ice cream shop since it was packed, but I'll stop by when I have my next trip to the Bay Area. I'll admit, the chocolate here is certainly not the "best," but it was a nice experience.
author: Jay M.

description: Hands-down, BEST ICE CREAM I HAVE EVER HAD. Sundae with cookie dough ice cream. I'd recommend splitting with someone else so you're not sick. The hot fudge, the cookie dough - everything is out of this world.
author: Melissa G.

description:
A diabetic's dream. If you're lookin' for something on the sweet, chocolate, and high in sugar then this is your one stop shop in SF for all of your tourists! 

I'm a huge fan of milk shakes and I remember I got a carmel mocha and it was even way too sweet for my standards. They actually melt or implant the chocolate into your drink. It was ridiculous. 

Desserts, cookies, shakes, anything fatty. It was simply marvelous. Definitely check it out if you're not afraid of root canals, ants attacking your mouth at night, or if you have the inability to get high cholesterol and diabetes.
author: Justin Y.

description:
The first time I went to San Francisco a little over 10 years ago, I thought Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop was the coolest thing ever. 

When I went a few weeks ago, the place just wasn't as exciting. Even though there wasn't a long line and our sundae (which we got $1 thanks to Yelp) came out super fast, I just wasn't uber impressed with the place. 

The next time I crave a brownie sundae, I think I will make one at home and save a few bucks.
author: Traci D.

description: Lines not too long when we got here. It's really crowded. Price for ice cream Sunday is really expensive. But the fudge was pretty good. It's not bad.
author: Wendy V.

description: This is a great place to go for special occasions or out of town guests.  The sundaes are great and they have the best chocolate sauce ever.  The name, however, is a bit misleading.  The portions are significantly smaller, and the prices significantly higher, than they were 10 years ago.  At $10.95... the management can afford to give us an "original" Ghirardelli product.
author: Craig A.

description:
I used to like this place.  Heck, when I was a kid, I LOVED it.  

But then it became a pure tourist trap, which has realized things like "customer service," "selling you what you bought in a timely manner," "selling good ice cream," "have reasonable prices" are unimportant, as they don't expect any repeat business from anyone!

Last time I was there, a couple at the table next to the uncleaned table we snagged said "Good luck!  it took us an hour to get our ice cream!".  I presumed they were just griping, that they were crazy, whatever.  Nope!  After 20 minutes, I flagged down someone and got them to clear our table.  After 30 minutes, I flagged down someone and said "where's our ice cream?".  After 45 minutes, I went inside to the "kitchen" where they make the ice cream, found a supervisor, and said "where's our ice cream".  He said "we're a bit backed up, it'll be here soon."  I continued to stand there for another five minutes (these times are all pretty precise; the time we ordered was on the receipt and I wear a watch), until he got someone to put our order ahead of others in the line.  

It wasn't just a one-time mistake; they're actually running a system where it regularly takes 45-60 minutes to make and serve a basic ice cream sundae.  How is that even possible?  

The sundae was fine, but relatively small, with ice cream that wasn't great.  

The time before, I came here was it was maybe 50 degrees out, late at night on a weekday; we got hot chocolate.  It wasn't slow, because there was no one in the shop, but it tasted watered down.

Avoid.  Find some actual high quality local chocolate or ice cream store on your trip to San Francisco, and skip Ghirardelli's, which isn't even manufactured locally anymore anyhow.
author: Zachary R.

description: Mmmmm Dream seasalt caramel sundae!!!!
author: Jivvy C.

description:
So just a tip for everyone, if you're just getting ice-cream and are entering from the main entrance go around to the left on Larkin street and enter in the corner for a shorter line!

This place is quite pricey, but it's also delicious.  I usually get the chocolate dipped waffle cone with two scoops and it's quite large and definitely enough for two people to share.  The chocolate dipped top part of the cone is quite intense as it's dark chocolate.  On to the hot fudge sundaes which will run you $8.95 each I think is pretty decent too.  What is the coolest part of the trip, is upon arrival there is a lady that usually stands in the front and hands out a free sample of the Ghirardelli squares which you can snack on while you wait in line!

If you're just visiting you definitely gotta come here and try it out so you can brag to your friends of the awesome ice-cream you were able to consume!
author: Angeline Z.

description: Ghirardelli chocolate and ice cream is a match made in heaven. Friends and I decided to go here for a late night dessert. The place was extremely busy, but like us most were probably tourist. I enjoyed seeing the chocolate machines on display working. Despite how busy they were, we still got our sundaes fairly quickly.  If you do go, make sure you go at night and see the Ghirardelli sign lit up.
author: Robin W.

description:
Not bad not bad grade ice cream but I went on Fleet week with the blue Angels and the line and the wait was so so long. 

I went to the main one the larger one where you can sit down I know it's a tourist trap in the tourist area I think I should've gone to the one on market Street because I would've felt like I wasn't being rushed to get out. 

Of course our screen was great service was quick but the amount of people that were there made you feel like you could enjoy yourself because they had to flip the tables and get you out to get the next person in. 

It will get more stars than this but I don't like being around tourist and people who have no concept of my personal space. 

If you like that and okay with that then this Garideli chocolate factory is the place for you.
author: morgan g.

description:
Great place for dessert--however, everything (including just a single scoop of ice cream or a hot chocolate) is very rich and filling. Their sundaes are good for sharing.
Chocolate here is delicious and savory, everything from fudges to chocolate drinks. Even their whipped cream is yummy. Bring your sweet tooth here!!
author: Selena L.

description:
We came last Saturday night and were probably the only eight locals in the place.  10:00pm, and the place was packed.

You need to order and pay the cashier upfront.  You're given a number that matches the number on your receipt.  Next you have to attempt to find a place to sit down.  That was a challenge for a party of eight but someone in our group got us a nice corner table.

It's a very hectic place with sticky floors.  You can sit on the ground floor or take the stairs up to a smaller dining area. 

Prices aren't exorbitant for the amount of frozen delight.

I got the Nob Hill Chill - hot fudge on the bottom of the tall soda fountain glass filled with mostly melted vanilla ice cream. Like a milk shake.  Just slurp it.  Right up my alley.  Hit the spot.
author: Shirley N.

description:
What a disappointment.
I have been coming here since 1974 before UCLA football games against either Cal or Stanford.  The last few years, service has been poor, mistakes made.  Saturday night, unfortunately, was not different.  We placed our order at 7:02pm.  At 7:20, I went up to the fountain and was told my order was being completed.  At 7:25 I went back, told that the "milk was being changed" and that it was coming.  I searched out the assistant manager who did nothing to speed my order.  After 7:30pm, yes, 30 minutes later, my order was delivered, no apologies, not refund and, unfortunately for my adult daughter and I, our de-caf mochas were not de-caf and we were still awake at 1am, Sunday morning.
We will not be returning to Ghiradelli's, we will buy our candy elsewhere and be done with this disappointing relic from our past.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Overly hyped up prices for ice cream, amazingly the fastest melting ice cream in 50 degree F weather too. WTF man.. And if ya'll didn't know, the floors and tables were kinda sticky too. 

Ice Cream:

Mint Dark Chocolate Sundae - I felt jipped. 2 scoops of ice cream, but the hot fudge was dumped on top of it. It looked like warm poop soup when it came out. THOROUGHLY DISAPPOINTED. 

Walnut Pecan in a cone - How do you fuck up a cone?! W.T.F

Service:
Slow, uneventful, long lines, wasted my time. Shoulda went to Ben n Jerry or Haagen Daz instead. Lesson learned.

Never coming back to this shit hole again. Not even going to bring my out of town friends here. Ghirardelli Square should be called Shit Square because the ice cream looks like shit when its served to you. Tastes like Lucerne, so whats the difference? Save yourself $6.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
This place is an over-rated tourist spot.

Its nice to order dessert and then take a number and find a table and wait for your dessert to be delivered to your table. The staff is usually pretty nice.

Everything is great, except the ICE CREAM. The Ghirardelli ice cream quality sucks.  Way too much added sugar and salt; I hardly taste the vanilla or chocolate in the ice cream, when I leave my mouth is traumatized from the avalanche of sugar I dumped into it...and I always get this sick feeling by the time we leave. 

However my hubby did bring me here a lot recently after we got married and I loved the 10pm dash we would make from the south bay to this spot and try to get in just before it would close.  *aww the memories*  for that I have to add one extra star.
author: Navdha V.

description:
I asked myself, why is this sundae special? 
Possible answers: 
-Ghirardelli square is over 10 years old. A historical landmark. Thus I am eating a piece of history.
-It's my first time. 
-It's ice cream. Fudge. And whipped cream. In other words, FAIL PROOF.
-A man with a funny little waxed mustache served it to me.

Then I asked myself, why doesn't it taste especially, well, special?
-It was JUST a regular ol' hot fudge sundae. And the fudge was cold. 
-It was $9

Ice cream and chocolate are usually my best friends. But I think I can make better, cheaper, less fame-hogging friends elsewhere.
author: Kathy L.

description: Chocolate HEAVEN:)) my husband brought me here for the first time last month. We shared a brownie sundae in a chocolate covered waffle cone and we couldn't finish it. That's saying a lot coming from me because I have a high tolerance for sugar/chocolate/sweets in general. Maybe it was because every time I turned around I was being handed a sample of pumpkin caramel choc bites, which I happily enjoyed. (:
author: Christina M.

description: The Asian girl with blond hair is so bitchy!  What ever happened to customer service!? Grrrrr
author: Eric F.

description: I definitely enjoyed visiting this place and if wasn't for being so stuffed from dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House, I might have enjoyed this even more. Like many ice cream shops, they will let you try some of their flavors. I went with cookie dough and I will have to say it was awesome. I did it as a brownie sundae however, and even though it was great, it was also probably the most expensive sundae I've ever had by about twice the price back home at about $12. Definitely take advantage of the $1 off Yelp check-in coupon if you can. Besides the price being a big of shock, there was about a 20 minute wait to actually get my sundae. The place was very busy, but I'm use to having my order made in front of me when it is ordered and not having to wait on the sidelines for it to be even started in the near future.
author: Kevin C.

description: The BEST cocoa ever had!!! Chocolate sea salt hot cocoa, you have to try it!!!
author: Xue Z.

description:
My family and I have been coming to this location for 14 years. But out last visit on 12/31/13 made me need to leave a review.  The servings used to be really huge and served in traditional glass sundae dishes and glasses. Now, this location has moved to serving in the plastic To-Go cups that they use at the "to go" Ghiradelli ice cream locations. BOO.  

Also, the servincg size has diminished and the prices are the same.  another boo.

They used to have a S'mores kids sundae, but it seems like they took that off their menu too and replaced it with a very sad, very expensive one scoop sundae.  third boo.

Yes, this is a touristy place, but up until yesterday, I used to really enjoy this ice cream shop even with all of the people.  =(  big sad face.  

I guess we will just have to head up to Mariposa Ice Creamery in Napa or the California Creamery in Walnut Creek if we want good quality ice cream.  Oh yea, there's Fenton's in Oakland too, but that place doesnt have as good value..
author: Sandy L.

description:
Does a Hot Fudge sundae get any better than this?

So good and so tasty, we went in twice during a 4 day trip to SF. 

The first time we had the classic, original Hot Fudge Sundae. The hot fudge is tasty, the vanilla ice cream is among the best I've had. After walking around downtown SF for about 6 miles, this really hit the spot.

So big that you can (and probably should) share it with someone. We certainly did.

The second trip, we tried one of their new offerings. Sea Salt and caramel sundae. This was also delicious. I don't know if it was seasonal or just new to the menu, but I would definitely order this again too.

The place is super clean and the people working here seem happy. 

Plus- right when we walked in- we were handed a nice chocolate square wrapped in foil.

Don't you wish more businesses just handed you a piece of candy right when you walked in their door?
author: Pete H.

description:
I'm not doubting the Epicness of their chocolate here because the hot fudge on my sundae was amazing, but damn, do you gotta give me only hot fudge and nothing else??? 

I ordered the original hot fudge sundae and had like three bites of ice cream and the rest of my sundae was hot fudge. Not the best balance. 

Pretty much, I paid 9 dollars for some hot fudge.
author: Jayme N.

description: This place is classic. It's crowded all the time, but you get good desserts. I had no idea how big this place was until my friends and I went exploring. Miss the crowd by going inside, and there is a second restaurant with a view. Only donwside is that I ordered a hot chocolate for dine in, and they gave me a paper cup...
author: Kaitlin V.

description:
You like ice cream?  Definitely go here.

They had every sort of awesome ice cream creations you could possibly desire.  Shake, split, sundae, cones waffle bowls or cones with or without chocolate covered tops...

You order and pay at the front, take your number, find a seat and wait for your delicious treat to arrive at your table in a matter of minutes.

I decided on a plain waffle cone with mint chocolate chip and chocolate.  It arrived in a simple dish, on its side with the ice cream spilling out and a spoon.  I was surprised to find a chocolate covered waffle cone with my ice cream, instead of the plain one I had ordered.  Nice free upgrade, however I found that I preferred the cone plain and picked off the top with the chocolate.  The ice cream was delicious, mint chocolate chip was perfectly minty with chunks of chocolate and the chocolate was the perfect blend of chocolate.  I am very glad I did not opt for a sundae or anything with more toppings, because I found it to be a struggle to finish the very rich ice cream, its almost too much yummy-ness!  Next time I will opt for a single scoop or share with a friend.

The soda fountain/chocolate shop is a fun place to just sit and walk around and watch the workers too.  They have informational signs above all of their machinery, telling you what it does and why.  Watching chocolate being made while you eat it, how fun!

Definitely glad I stopped her on my trip to San Francisco.  Definitely am glad I don't live nearby or visit often, because I would probably end up being a bazillion pounds with all the calories I would undoubtedly consume from repeat visits.  Yum!
author: Jasmine B.

description:
Yum!!  Came here the night of Bay 2 Breakers after a long day of drinking.  For under 10 dollars you get a HUUGEE-ass dessert that I'm pretty sure you're supposed to split

but of course I didn't.

I got the presidio passion I think, which has vanilla ice cream + strawberries + a chocolate covered strawberry on top!  i couldn't finish it, but i brought the strawberry back home and it was still good the next day!

Inside, you can see the chocolate being made / mixed, which is cool for like... 5 minutes.
author: Jennifer L.

description: So good. Every foodies dream. I had the sea salt caramel hot chocolate and it was amazing. I did get it warm and it could have been hotter but the salt and caramel combined in hot chocolate was to die for. Only thing is it was warm  I also tried the world famous sundae. Really good. I would go again if I could.
author: Ryna O.

description:
Brought my date and her cousins with us to see if this hell hell of tourist trap could improve from my previous visit, and surprisingly everyone ordered the same items we had on the last visit. But Low-n-Behold....their ice cream melts faster than steam comes from the mens bathroom urinals on a freezing san francisco day....

Especially any of their "specials" that include hot fudge. By the time your mint delight or ice cream sundae with fudge comes to your table, you would think your bill should say, mint-chocolate chip milk.....

RIP OFF PRICES FOR MEDIOCRE QUALITY...COME HERE ONLY IF YOU'RE A TOURIST WITH NO OTHER OPTION...

Chocolate candy bar yes...Ice Cream Specials/Social.. O' HELL NO!
author: Eric C.

description:
Having walked from our home atop Russian Hill to Hopper's Hands early this morning and whilst returning home she who must be obeyed suggested that we eat ice cream for breakfast.

And so we did eat ice cream for breakfast at the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop.

I ordered a scoop of vanilla ice cream covered with hot fudge and peanut butter, and chased with a depth charge or red eye depending on where and if you order this coffee and espresso combination.  My lovely better half ordered the Cappuccino Chip and decaf coffee...as simple as kiss my hand, eh?

I am not sure how long our order sat on the counter and the hot fudge certainly contributed to my ice cream arriving a bit more like soup rather than ice cream.

And then there was the depth charge that is meant to be coffee with a shot or two and then, if you're really, really luck at Ghirardelli, the depth charge will be piping hot.  I was not lucky.  She who must be obeyed was served warm coffee and she asked if it might be served again but this time piping hot.

And so I slurped my milk soup and chased it down with warm, dark water whilst my lovely wife patiently waited to be reunited with her decaf coffee only this time piping hot.  We waited in vain as the coffee that arrived was not quite hot.

And so dear reader and in keeping with Yelp!'s guidelines I must write, "Meh. I've experience better."
author: Jay D.

description: I love ice creammmmm!!!! The prices definitely increased since high school days. The Earthquake was my favorite choice when going with a group of friends, but now it's $35 just for it, I don't think it's worth it but I assume it is for tourists. I ordered a warm brownie sundae to share with my boyfriend and it was just perfect after eating lunch. I love the warm fudge and how they have a demonstration of how chocolate is made in the back. I do think that they need to figure out a more organized way to deliver the orders to the customers because I do notice ice cream melting by the time it got to the customer because the waitress couldn't find the number. This place is crowded most of the time, especially with tourists. But because I love their ice cream and chocolate, they get a 4 star. I visit every so often because it's a little pricey, but satisfied my cravings!
author: Amanda C.

description: One of the worst Sundaes I've ever had. We got the ocean beach and the strike it rich. The proportions of ice cream to topping was totally off and the fudge was stone cold. The only reason I get a sundae is for the hot fudge contrasting with cold ice cream. Both sundaes were sloppy and slapped together. Not worth $10.95.  The water cups are tiny plastic disposable 6 oz cups and the water is luke warm.. The employees look worn out and without hope. Sad all around.
author: Alex C.

description:
I came here 2 years ago and got chocolate ice cream and remembered liking it a lot. I came back this time with my friend and though I was already a bit full, I shared a cookies n creme scoop of ice cream with my friend and though I'm not a fan of this flavor usually (plain vanilla is my favorite) as it tends to be overbearingly sweet, this one was just the perfect amount of sweetness, with a rich creamy taste. I love ice cream like that. 

For some reason, though, one scoop of ice cream took forever and it was already kind of melting by the time it got to us. Seriously, why did it take so long to give us our ice cream? Was it because we had a group of boys sharing ice cream in front of us? I saw that the people after us got their sundaes immediately. Get it right! I'm only giving you 4 stars for good ice cream, which trumps this little annoyance.
author: Emily C.

description: There is nothing like the ghiradelli ice cream shop. There sundaes are to die for. I won't recommend trying to go here during the weekend as there is usually a line that goes out the door and can take up to an hour. Best time to visit this location is during the day.
author: Paul D.

description:
Here's the thing about Ghirardelli - they know how to make great chocolate. Here's the other thing; they're not where you go to get great ice cream.

The wife and I split a banana sundae. You know, to get my daily servings of fruit and be healthy and all. It comes with vanilla, strawberry and chocolate ice cream, topped with their syrup. At one end is a lovely thick  pineapple topping, while at the other end is an equally lovely strawberry topping.

The best ice cream was the chocolate, as you might imagine, because they made it with their freaking good cocoa powder. The vanilla was the next best, although a little light on flavor. The strawberry ice cream was either icy, or had itty bitty bits of frozen strawberries in them, because I definitely disliked the texture.

Fortunately, we walked out with parking validation (which was useless, having parking in the garage for 11 hours) and five bars of all sorts of flavors of Ghiradelli, a pair of which I haven't seen for sale at home.

It's a tourist trap, so expect tourist trap prices. But also expect some really good chocolate.
author: Robert G.

description:
I came here after an incredible Italian lunch.  My older sister Julia recommended this place - this was one of her favorites when she came to San Francisco.  Henceforth, planning it after our trip to the legendary Tony's Pizza Napoletana in North Beach.  The first place that I went to at Ghirardelli Square was the Chocolate Shop - it had everything including Ghirardelli's famous chocolate powder; I came away with two bars of their decadent chocolates.

After the Shop, it was time to indulge in their ice creams; my sister and I each ordered their "World Famous" ice cream sundae.  It was drenched in hot chocolate fudge and sat in a delicious waffle cup that was decadently coated in a rich chocolate sauce.  Everything was edible except surprisingly the spoon!  It was definitely an amazing way to top off a incredible Italian lunch. The service was very quick and the food heavenly.  I definitely was not disappointed : )
author: Nancy S.

description:
Well DUH!  It is a San Francisco staple. Always delish!  Lick your bowl, lick your fingers of all chocolate remnants bc its THAT good.

Knocked off a star bc of the RUDE cashier service.  You could tell she hates her job and dealing w/tourists.  Shows in her attitude, w/o a doubt.  Eliminate that cashier and its def a 5stars....
author: Sarah N.

description:
Always love the Banana Split here, in spite of the wait and hard to find seating. :-)

They also validate your parking ticket in the underground Garage of Ghirardelli Building if you spend more than $20. Just Awesome.
author: Shane H.

description:
All I can say is their desserts are YUMMY!!! I loved the taste and flavor of their hot chocolate- it's smooth and not overpoweringly sweet, their vanilla ice cream has a creamy texture, with caramel to make a sundae it's sure to pleasure that sweet tooth of yours. The only drawback about the place is that it is overly crowded left to right! If you choose to dine in the place, you'll feel like a sardine scrambling or fighting to get a table with chairs! So you'll find yourself standing and being alittle too assertive when it comes to getting a table with chairs.  

Other than that, the service is okay for a busy place, the table bussers are almost quick to get tables cleared, and their other things on the menu is a must try....that'll be what I'll do the next time I go back. So 4 stars for some pretty tasty desserts so far!
author: Chas A.

description:
I have been going to Ghirardelli since I was a kid.  I have always enjoyed the ice cream and atmosphere in spite of the crowds.  Yes, there is almost always a crowd, yes, you always have to struggle to get a table, yes, there is always a wait.  But I do not think there is a better hot fudge sundae anywhere else.

This time I was going solo as I was in town for some continuing education and on a Monday night in January I got right in, ordered and found a bunch of tables to choose from.  After a short wait, I got the salted caramel sundae and it was very good.  I almost always go with the regular hot fudge sundae (dark chocolate fudge) but tonight I risked it and got something new.  I was not disappointed.  It was very good.  The combination of salt and sweet was very good.

If you are in SF, make sure you stop at Ghirardelli's.  It isn't a complete trip unless you do and the wait is worth it.
author: Robert G.

description: I love this place and I'm amazed EVERY time I'm here how efficient they are.  I ordered a hot chocolate on my most recent visit, and holy hell...it was scalding hot!  Burned the roof of my mouth and watered my eyes.  I expected hot, but it felt like I took a sip of lava.  Something to note for next time.
author: Gina J.

description:
I made the mistake of not reading yelp before I came here so here is a tip that will make your trip 1000x more enjoyable. 

Take pictures at the front Ghirardelli sign infront of the cafe. 
Walk through the square to the end market and order everything off the same menu with no lines and plenty of open tables and chairs. You'll be surrounded by chocolate instead of other tourists. 

On a cold windy day (like most days in SF), A sea salt caramel hot chocolate is the perfect drink to warm you up. Just remember to stir your drink VERY often otherwise the last few sips will taste like sea salt gone wrong!
author: Marvel Z.

description: Been here a few times. It's always fun to eat here with the family. The original shop is back open. We got the strawberry sundae. I thought it was ok. Otherwise love ha place in spite of being very touristy
author: Tim A.

description: Came after dinner with GF on valintines day around 8:30 pm. There was a line out the door! We almost left but the line went by fast! No more than 10mins. Ordered our ice cream to go and it was ready in 3 mins! Real speedy and great ice cream! I got the ocean beach. Sea salted caramel ice cream! Soooo good! Gf got the browie sunday. Very good too! Everyone in san fran should stop here at least once! Tons of different ice creams to choose from! Cant wait to go back! And at night its pretty romantic
author: Daniel R.

description:
It is very, very, very sweet and comfortable place, it's also famous and so prominent it should be a landmark, and their staff are very polite, and there are sometimes free chocolates.
But everything on the menu is overly sweet, and I mean it, overly sweet. There is nothing to eat or try, that is not loaded with sugar (or may be it's corn syrup? they are not disclosing). It is so much sugar that I was afraid I won't be able to part my lips anymore. It was scary.
I would highly recommend against visiting the place. Passing by, take a look, it's nice inside. Make sure you keep walking.
author: Alex M.

description: This place never disappoints! If you're ever craving a good-old fashioned ice cream sundae, this is the place to go to. A bit pricey but worth it to satisfy your chocolatey ice cream craving.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Had the black cherry vanilla and rocky road ice cream in the waffle cone (which I didn't know came chocolate dipped! So good) And their hot chocolate is one of my favorite hot chocolates, please try one
author: Nessa E.

description: Touristy, yes, long lines, yes, so why do I have to go there every time I visit San Francisco? The answer is because Ghirardelli is an institution. I have to have a hot fudge sundae. Like Michael S. says, no visit is complete without a visit to the original shop. We went after dinner and enjoyed a massive hot fudge sundae with vanilla ice cream. It's one thing in life that never changes. That sundae is always like you remember it from when you were a kid.
author: Karen L.

description:
Pure heaven. That's all I have to say after a visit during my recent excursion to CA.

We stopped by here since we were looking for a quick after-lunch snack, and I'm so glad we did. We got the chocolate chip cookie sundae and the banana sundae, and while I'm normally not a fan of overly sweet things, they were fantastic. Highly indulgent and probably not that good for me, but didn't matter - I was on vacation.

Do be warned that they don't specifically list allergens (that I saw), so if you have any allergies, definitely be proactive and ask if the items contain them. The servers were super old school, with the mustaches and outfits to match as well, and it didn't take too long for the stuff to come out either.

Another cool aspect is being able to see the chocolate creation process as well as the waffle cones on one of the sides!
author: Abhishek Y.

description: Good ice-cream, hot fudge my fav, just the long 30 mins wait for it, either eatin or to go makes me not to want go for other
author: Rafael G.

description: black cherry, cookies & cream, chocolate, or vanilla. Any of these flavors will set you free. Oh and the hot fudge, ya gotta get it.
author: Faith A.

description:
Ghiradelli is a must when in San Francisco. Sure, you can find their chocolates in your local grocery, but the chocolate selection here is substantial. It is definitely a tourist trap, but a very quaint one. 

The space itself is not all that big. It is located a couple streets away from Fisherman's Wharf in a decent size shopping square. The store itself consists of a cafe in which you could order all kinds of chocolate treats and a chocolate shop with their signature squares and bars. It is a bit pricey, as SF typically can be. I got a mixed bag of 50 Luxe chocolate squares for $20 as I had never seen this product line locally.

For a better deal on the same Ghiradelli chocolate, a visit to the San Leandro factory outlet is suggested. Though I could not find the time to get over to East Bay, so Ghiradelli Square had to do. Pricey or not, Ghiradelli chocolate is well worth it, so a pilgrimage here is a must for those who love Ghiradelli.
author: Jon L.

description:
This is a must stop for me on every trip to SF. I know it's touristy, and there are other locations to get some ice cream, and you can buy ghiradelli chocolate just about anywhere. I guess it's just nostalgia. I love heading over here, either by Cable Car or the MUNI F Line, or just walking. It's in a beautiful area, near Pier 39, but close enough to be away from *most* of the tourists(except the ones in the know). 

I always love the free chocolate I get. And picking out some chocolate to take home. On my most recent I discovered their new toffee, caramel chocolate bars. They are HEAVENLY. Definitely my new favorite. My boyfriend is very lucky I didn't just eat the whole thing when he stupidly left me home alone with the chocolate. I also love to get some ice cream. The most recent time we got a sundae, covered in delicious ghiradelli chocolate sauce, with a warm chocolate-chip cookie. It was fantastic. I am also a huge fan of their milkshakes. 

It's a great spot to relax while being a tourist in SF, and to get some chocolate to take home(or send to relatives if you are being really nice). 

I think there are like 3 Ghiradelli shops just in Ghiradelli Square, but this, the original, is the best.
author: Kristin C.

description: Visited here while I was in California recently. Super tasty! Everyone was super nice and I even went outside afterward and fed Sea Lions. Not chocolate. Don't worry.
author: Larson W.

description: Holy cow, this place is amazing, a chocolate lover's heaven!  As you walk in, they usually give you a chocolate square, and you can order anything chocolate--shakes, brownie sundaes, coffee.  But my FAVORITE is their chocolate chip cookie--ask them to warm it up, and it will be just divine.  And you can buy straight chocolate too!
author: Jackie K.

description: Ghirardelli good. That part to be expected. The location is perfect. We burned off all the calories we ate here walking a few miles to the GGB along the bay front. Bathrooms are a bit of a hike around the building. Prices are also more than I cared to pay.
author: Courtney W.

description:
The line was long. They closed the to-go counter while the line was still too long. So, to even order to-go, you need to stand in the long line. Not enough servers to take care of customers. 

No one to manage the pick-up line. The guy at pick-up counter was mumbling names of customers, the customers couldn't hear him so they couldn't pick-up their orders. The place was a huge pandemonium. 

Customers were standing in the dark outside as the line was long. No light on the menu placard that was kept outside to where the line stretched to.

By the time we got our sundae and came out, it was more than an hour!

Not worth it! We're not going there again. There're many other well-managed places where you get better ice creams.
author: Vinnie A.

description: One of the must go places when my friends visiting SF. Great selections of chocolate desserts and if you go with a group of 6 or more I suggest you order the earthquake! After you are done, walk around the square, some pretty good shops there. By the way, there is another shop located inside the square. That one has less ppl and great views of the bay
author: William C.

description: Any tasty morsel at this place is worth every single calorie. Go big and eat your heart out, and walk it off around San Francisco's many uphill streets :-)
author: Caletta G.

description: How can you ever go wrong with this place? I had the butterscotch something...it was amazing! I'm not a super butterscotch fan...only like that stuff because of butter beers, but the butterscotch ice cream sundae or whatever it was, was great! I've had a few other things there as well and those were great too!
author: Nicky S.

description: I have been frequenting this excellent establishment for approximately ten years. It is an amazing place, suitable to be under the world-famous Fairmont 's administration. The free chocolate tasting as well as the endless rows of delectable items makes this place a wonder. However, the ice cream is where all the fuss is at. The earthquake ice cream is delicious, and at around 40 dollars,  it is perfect for a family of three. There are enough seats and the chocolate machinery is something to marvel at. The plaza itself is beautiful and historic. The fountain of mermaids and the art galleries placed here and there exemplifies the true nature and beauty of San Francisco. Parking is validated so overall it is a truly remarkable experience.
author: JK C.

description:
This place has the best ice cream options in the world, the Sundays are unreal as are the ice creams. If you enter the gift shop, you will be given an awesome, complimentary chocolate which is like a $0.50 value, and quite tasty. If you enter and change expressions multiple times, they will give you a new sample. 

This place is all about chocolate and icecream and they have tons of options. Note, the desserts here are on the large side so watch out!
author: Spencer G.

description: We specifically came for the ice cream.  It was as delicious as expected but the line outside was very long to order.  Once inside, sitting was nice and one could walk around to see the chocolate being made.  It was a nice experience.
author: Denise B.

description: Thw line absolutely quick. And the orders come out within minutes. Such a great experience. I finally took the trouble to go and wait. Plus you can also get a free sample while you're in line haha
author: Leo M.

description: We were visiting family in San Francisco, and were wandering downtown and decided to stop in here to grab a quick ice cream.  It was all delicious. My first choice the brownie sundae was all sold out, due to the fact that they ran out of brownies. My second choice, the sea salt caramel was delicious!!! Overall it was delicious, but super expensive.  It was like $10 a sundae.  The shop was busy, and super crowded. I felt that they could've made the storefront a tad bit bigger.
author: Michael L.

description:
It's touristy. It's crowded. It's expensive. You'll probably have to wait 15 minutes for your ice cream. But it's still worth a visit if you're in San Francisco.

My visit to Ghirardelli's was more entertainment than eating. The place is a super swanky, classic ice cream parlour. They have some crazy sundaes and it's fun watching the staff put them together. I wasn't man enough for a full on sundae so I went for a basic single scoop of Rocky Road with hot fudge for $5.25. The ordering process is very efficient but it took a good 10-15 minutes for them to make my ice cream because it's so busy.

The ice cream is quite good though perhaps not as good as you might think given the swanky digs and popularity. Worth checking out a least once if you're in San Francisco.
author: Matt S.

description:
Yes I'm back here again
Love this place    Ice Cream is outstanding 
And with a 10%off coupon on your next visit 
It becomes addicting!
author: P S.

description: I wish I could spend more time here and bring people who would share sundaes with me! The menu looks super yummy, but everything is SO big! I wish the prices were a little better - $8.50 or more for a sundae is a little much...$6.50 for child size....but soooo goood!!!! Also, I brought home a brownie and a cookie....and I think they may be the best I've ever tried. The cookie tastes as if it may be some sort of an oatmeal base with chocolate chips. The brownie is super rich. Both will have to last awhile, as they are too rich to enjoy in one sitting - or even three!
author: Dani Z.

description:
The only reason why I'm giving them 5 stars is because Ghirardelli is definitely a must if you're visiting SF. 

It's definitely a tourist icon and if you've never been, you should at least try it once if you're around. You can't go wrong with ordering a hot fudge sundae here. It's a big glass of ice cream and fudge and yes, it's delicious.

I really like how rich their chocolate fudge is and also the different varieties of desserts that they have. I wish I lived closer because I would have loved to try more of their desserts.

Also, they serve water because the sundaes are just THAT rich!

It can get a little confusing when you arrive to the square. I kept circling around looking for the entrance because there's a separate store on the other side that only sells Ghirardelli merchandise and not the dessert. The entrance is actually on the side of the building so park near the left side of the square.

The building itself is very cute and quaint. Brick buildings, fountains and lights, a nice date spot to hang out with your lover. (:

Definitely a must try if you're not from the city. You have to try it at least once in your life.
author: Hanna P.

description: It's my favorite because it's the best thing about California when you want to have an ice cream sundae.
author: Manveen S.

description:
This is a must do when I am near the wharf.  I am not there often so it is a nice treat.

I always order the peanut butter fudge sundae.  I believe they call it the gold rush.  It is great, plenty of chocolate and peanut butter.  The flavore are rich and deep.

The service is very good and quick.  It is pricey, and that is why it gets only four stars.
author: Brandon S.

description: The chocolate from here is amazing.  Don't get a plain scoop of ice cream because it is just dreyers ice cream except for the one namesake flavor I think.    Sundaes are about $10 each and are huge.
author: Malabika M.

description: It's "OK".  I know it's a tourist area, but the sundaes are pretty expensive for what you get.  They have really thick glass in their containers so it feels heavy and looks big, but it's not a lot of ice cream.  Also, the quality of the ice cream has gone down over time and it's pretty cheap ice cream.  Sigh...no need for them to be so cheap.
author: Greta R.

description:
I thought it was good but the strike it rich had too much butterscotch and was a little too sweet
.I would still go back and try the other deserts
author: Andreas C.

description: I loved this restaurant. The chocolate was amazing! The service was wonderful. I have traveled all over the world in search of the best chocolate and this has to be up there. It's located in a very cute part of San Francisco. My mouth was watering as I ate. Truely delightful. However, after taking a poo, I noticed my poo was rock hard. I did not like this. 1 star.
author: Spencer P.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Ghiradelli Chocolates (especially the milk chocolate squares). Tried the hot fudge sundae and although it wasn't the best ice cream I've had, the chocolate is the best part. 

However, I actually prefer their hot chocolate (during the winter) - it's soothing and the rich taste of chocolate is incredible, one of the best I've had!
author: Kevin L.

description: The line was out the door, but it moved quickly. Our sundaes were delicious. I was in a not so secret jealous rage over my husbands sundae choice...sea salted caramel. Why didn't I order that?? We walked across the street and ate our sundaes on a lovely sunny day in October with views of the Golden Gate & Oakland Bay Bridges and Alcatraz. It was a beautiful day that I will not soon forget.
author: Lisa B.

description: Fun place and excellent sundaes, but I purchased hot fudge to take back home. The salesperson assured me it would be fine to carry on since it's almost solid. Well, TSA confiscated it since they consider it a liquid. The TSA agent told me this happens all the time at SFO with Ghirardelli hot fudge and caramel. So warning to those told it's not a liquid, it is!
author: Matt F.

description: I mean what can I say... Their portions as Donald Trump would say are HUGE. I always get a waffle cone because this place is worth splurging on. Mint chocolate chip for the win all day erday.
author: John L.

description: Very touristy. Long lines. Go to the one in the same building but under the main shop, same food, no line.
author: Michellea D.

description: Yes its busy but its really good ice cream! Didn't have to wait long at all and it was ready to go. We had a banana split and it was still too much for both of us and we were hungry! Afterwards we walked around the square and found more shops. Fun time for sure!
author: Allen O.

description:
Whenever we make a day trip to San Francisco and visit any of the piers, we are likely to make a stop at Ghirardelli.  There are so many good things about this place.  Besides the "ice cream" restaurant, there is a nice pond that is centrally located, a chocolate store, a nice picture spot with Ghirardelli arch and above all a very lively environment.

We conveniently forget the calorie count here :)  Banana split is our all time favorite.  But, just go with any of the ice cream that you like on the menu.  Chances are, you won't go wrong.  Quantity is generally heavy.  If you are like me, perhaps each order can serve two people.

If this is your first visit to this place, you can take a quick look at the chocolate making process while you wait for your order to be delivered.  It is nice and informative.

Very friendly and energetic staff.  The place is generally crowded at any time of the year and any time of the day.

Parking is generally a challenge here.  Finding a spot on the street side, may make you go around this place 2-3 times.  

As an iconic place of San Francisco, this is a MUST visit place if you are touring the city.
author: Srinath S.

description: Best ever .... Sold stone dreyers Ben and Jerry's what ever Ghirardelli is the real deal
author: Frank E.

description: Delicious sundae. But after a couple of spoonfuls, it was just too much. The fudge was stuck to the side of the cup and just became a big smudge. However, I still loved the sundae all in all.
author: Sung K.

description:
the foreign girl who rung us up [french?] had a total bitch attitude and literally rolled her eyes at us. Wednesday night, 9pm, what's your deal???

the mint choc. chip icecream was, normal. nothing spectacular and it was my first time here, that was a let down. service was fast.

eh, i won't be coming back. for tourist value, sure. i guess.

maybe i shouldve splurged and gotten something extra calorific.
author: Ellie B.

description:
go to the to-go counter at the top of the hill to avoid the massive line that awaits at the bottom. We got our desserts to go and we were able to just sit outside in the patio area  and enjoyed our ice cream. the single scoop ice cream is pretty big, if in a cone it doesn't even fit completely so they put it laying down in a plastic container. The mint chocolate chip ice cream is good with chunks of chocolate chips but i prefer Rite-aids mint chip (the chocolate chip is more like flakes of chocolate). The root beer float is OK as well. can easily make it at home without spending $8.

Overall, if its your first time in SF i'd come try Ghirardelli but i probably wouldn't come back now that i've tried it. its just a touristy spot.
author: Tammy L.

description: Their Hot Chocolate is so Amazing. Its sweet, with the right amount of chocolate its Delisshhh!!!
author: Amrita A.

description: I knew coming in here that it would be busy (and being a touristy area, overpriced) BUT, it was a reasonable price and you got a lot of ice cream for your buck! I shared the Black Forest Sundae with my hubby, and it was delicious!!
author: Dana T.

description:
I walked across an empty land
I knew the pathway like the back of my hand
I felt the earth beneath my feet
Sat by the river and it made me complete at...GHIRARADELLI! - Keane (somewhere only we know)

Yeah this place is popular and yeah it has the Ghirardelli name and yeah the view is amazing but...no it doesn't live up to the brand. 

The lines are out the door and seating is kinda hectic (you seat yourselves) and the wait for your chocolatey goodness is so long. Granted, I didn't have any expectations as it was just 'a middle in the day break' after spending the afternoon at Fisherman's Wharf. 

We shared a banana split (almost said we split a banana split...lol zing!) and some kind of frozen chocolate sundae drink and I wasn't impressed. I would've never associated the name with what we got and it just shows they are selling well based on the name rather than the actual product. Maybe we ordered the wrong things but how can you fudge up a banana split and use less than premium toppings when the name is associated with premium chocolates?? I'm not even disappointed or sad as I didn't choose to come here :) 

P.S. I'm also not happy that I used such a good song to associate with this review.
author: Danny H.

description:
I LOVE Ghirardelli.

For me, it's more than just chocolate. I was proposed to here two years ago with my shiny ring inside a free sample chocolate wrapper :) Then, we ordered the 13 scoop Earthquake Sundae to share with our friends!

Favorites:
-Green Mint Chocolate
-Peppermint Bark
-Milk Chocolate
-Any sundae- you can't go wrong!

*Tip: There are 3 ghirardelli chocolate stores all in the square where you can buy chocolate sundaes and get free samples, so if the line is long at the main one, go downstairs or across to the other side of the fountain to the other ones!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
It seems difficult to be bitter when ice cream is involved, but when the service was that bad and the pay-off that disappointing, you find yourself amazed to be hot under the collar trying to indulge in a sundae. 

After the place was closed for a private party one night, we finally got in and got a table the next. It wasn't all that busy compared to previous times I'd seen it. Only three parties in line. 

We ordered the Presidio Passion and waited more than half an hour for it. 

The order in which they brought people their food seemed haphazard. We were seeing people who just got a table getting their orders within minutes while others sat for longer. 

When this elusive Presidio Passion finally came our way, nearly 45 minutes after ordering it, it was like a bait and switch. Where were the layers of strawberry and fudge? The chocolate-dipped strawberry on top? (See photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vzBSlQezq2GJkDeqBQxdtw?select=n-3UtpKinpFBW3E7O9x8Yg)

Now granted, their menu/advertising picture was taken by professionals who strategically arranged the cream and fudge to be more appetizing (and probably didn't even use real ice cream when they did the photo shoot, at that), but when I pay $10 for a namebrand sundae, I feel I'm entitled to a strawberry and more than just a lone spoonful of fudge.

There were plenty of strawberries in the case, so they weren't out.
author: Christine A.

description: I forgot the names of the things we ordered but both were too sweet. I mean I thought I was prepared but I was not at all. You can taste amazingly deep well made chocolates and all but it's just too sweet. But quality is really good. Price is bit over priced for its reputation but it's one of those desert that you try once in a while. So I can understand.
author: Jake B.

description:
Whats not to love about this place. 
Great ambiance , touristy energy levels , gigantic ice creams with lots of yummy Ghirardelli fudge (which comes in dark chocolate too)
Its a mystery how the servers always find you so quickly.
author: The M.

description: We ordered Treasure Island and World Famous sundaes. Just so good! Line looks intimidating but moves really fast.
author: Ysca B.

description:
5 Star chocolate in this quintessential San Francisco/marina store and soda fountain.
They always give you a sample. Wide selection. And when you want an ice cream it's oh so delicious. A bit expensive but well worth it. Can sometimes be a big line.
author: Drew B.

description:
2.5 stars

A place for tourist and ice cream lovers. 

I ordered a hot chocolate, a brownie, and a cookie. The hot chocolate wasn't hot. It was the temperature where it is hot but yet drinkable. I wanted it hotter because 10 minutes later it was warm enough to be gulped down. Their brownie isn't the traditional types, it's basically a bar of fudge. Not my kind of brownie. The chocolate chip cookie was really hard. It was almost impossible to break apart.
author: Jess W.

description: Heavenly Warm Brownie sundae and the classic Ghirardelli sundae was awesome. Muir woods was relatively ok, not great.
author: Rao S.

description: Great tourist stop! We stopped here while on a bachelorette trip. All of the girls enjoyed picking up souvenirs of bulk chocolate in pretty packaging. All of the staff were mostly friendly and polite young kids who seemed to enjoy their job. We ordered a Ghirardelli  Fudge brownie sundae and it was absolutely fabulous! The brownie tasted like a warm piece of fudge doused in sweet ice cream and covered with hot fudge and caramel sauce. It was big enough to share. I see a lot of complaints about pricing. In regards to the chocolate, it's all packaged at a bulk and discounted rate so you can't beat that. As far as the cafe, the prices are justified due to the size and portion as well as the ingredients. Great experience and a must tourist stop!
author: Isra A.

description: We came here and ordered 2 coffees and a sundae. Our coffee came out cold and our ice cream came out warm. When we told the employee they said that's how it was supposed to be.
author: Josh W.

description:
Busy? Yes. Tourist trap? Yes. A bit pricey? Yes. Bomb @ssed sundaes? YUUUUUPPPP!!!

After a huge dinner of seafood at Fisherman's Wharf, we decided to trek our out-of-town guests to have dessert over at Ghiradelli Square. Sure you can get the little squares at most Walmarts across the nation, but can you get a sample for FREE?!?!?! Few guests I've brought here knew Ghiradelli was a "San Francisco Treat" and are often 'enlightened' after tasting the free square at the entrance. Glad I could be of assistance!

I don't really like too much chocolate on my sundaes. But I don't mind it here. I don't mess around with what's already great so I always order the Old Fashioned Hot Fudge Sundae. If I'm feeling generous, I'll share but most of the times, I'll spoon-block yours if it comes anywhere near my sundae.  The ice cream is perfect, not too sweet, topped with the perfect amount of whipped cream, nuts, the bomb Ghiradelli chocolate and a happy cherry.  

The gift shop has all sorts of cute things to bring back home to your co-workers, family, friends, or your own tummy. There is a little 'Ghiradelli Café' further back in the Square that I was told has no line and serves some sundaes (tho not all) so may be worth a gander to look back there if the Fountain Shop line is ridonkulous.
author: Vivian A.

description: Large assortment of Ghiradelli chocolates and other items.  Delicious.
author: Brian B.

description:
This place is packed whenever I have passed by but I finally got a chance to try the ice cream in a chocolate-dipped waffle bowl and I must say "well worth the wait in line!" 

Yes, it's pricey, but I have not had better tasting chocolate ice cream anywhere else (and I eat a lot of ice cream!)
