Molita made a great suggestion and was really friendly and sweet working the front and taking our order :) exceptional customer service, which was nice to be greeted with.

A tourist must and for those of us that are locals a good place to indulge.
author: Brittany S.

description: Why'd I come here and order vanilla?  The huz's chocolate concoction was a lot better...I know, no sheesh sherlock?  Super busy little place; we ended up finding a spot outside to enjoy the rays.  If you're a tourist, you have to go so pony up and ride over.
author: Myia B.

description:
I eat a lot of chocolate - GOOD chocolate, like from Whole Foods and all.  I eat dark chocolate, not any of that pansy milk chocolate.  And I can tell you firsthand that Ghirardelli chocolate tastes like shit.  It has no flavor.  Without the sugar and milk, their chocolate is nothing.  It is famous purely because it's San Francisco where "trendy" people live.

Inquire within as to which dark chocolate you *should* be eating.
author: Krissie S.

description:
Even though there was a line, it moved quickly, and that's always a blessing when you have kids in tow. After you pay at the cash register, you get a number and you can go find a table and one of the servers will find your number.

It was very crowded, but not bad crowded where you just want to leave. The whole area smelled like chocolate and it was almost theraputic just sitting at our table inhaling deeply.

The only thing I can frown upon, or didn't like, or found weird was that they bring your ice cream cone on a plate. I mean, of course, it doesn't ruin the ice cream, I guess it was just because I wasn't expecting that. I'm sure it's because the servers only have two hands and can't possibly hold every ice cream cone we order. It was just un-expected.

You can also see chocolate being made in the back and that was a nice distraction for the kiddies as well.

*PS - my son (he's 10) ordered a regular coke float and he says it's more coke than ice cream* then he made a face. 

What you do with this information is up to you. Hope it helps someone.
author: Just N.

description: What can I say? It's Ghiradelli. Delicious ice cream, a little pricey but not too bad. It is crowded though so get there at a good time and plan on spending a little time there. I would recommend any ice cream dish there because I honestly think they're all good. If you are in San Francisco, make sure you stop by here.
author: Anthony D.

description: Talk about chocolate galore! This place smells soo good and the stuff tastes good too! Ghirardelli Square is a cute area. The line to go in to eat is out the door, but the wait is really not all that long. Ordered some ice cream, coffee, and chocolate drinks- all totally worth it. You will probably crash from all the sugar though!
author: Carol N.

description:
I can't believe that I haven't written a review for Ghirardelli!

This is one of those magical places that breathes nostalgia as soon as you walk in the door. It reminds me of being a little kid and going to get ice cream with my parents after dance recitals or school plays.

Now I am a big kid who still loves a hot fudge sundae served in the traditional glass with sticky goo running down the side and pooling on the table. Oh yes, when at Ghirardelli be prepared to make a mess!

I always take visiting friends and relatives to Ghirardelli. It intertwines whimsey with history. (The Ghirardelli factory survived the earthquake and fire of 1906 and operated through both world wars).

Love this place!
author: Casey S.

description:
Big, bad and bold; the Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop is one half a tourist trap, yet one that is well worth at least a visit to see what all the hub-bub is about.  For any chocolate fan (or ice cream fan for that matter), if you're in the San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf area, it's worth at least a look-see and a taste-test.  

The shop is divided in two.  The first is a Ghirardelli Chocolate shop filled with pretty much all the chocolates they sell all over, even some items that weren't being sold (at least the time I was there) in other places.  The line was quite long even to purchase anything though so expect a wait and a shoulder-to-shoulder tussle to get anywhere.  

The real gem is the cafe connected right next to it which is absolutely amazing.  A wonderful concoction of cafe items from cookies to pastries to their world famous ice creams (such as their Hot Fudge sundae) are totally over-priced but totally delicious.  Again, it's worth it to try something on the menu that you really enjoy, don't look at your wallet afterwards, and enjoy the taste.
author: John W.

description:
The ice cream was delish!

The staff there is great. Always giving me chocolates. The cashier was really friendly and commented on my shirt. I got an original sundae in a waffle bowl and was not disappointed. The hot fudge in the sundae is amazing. The ice cream meh. The waffle bowl was so good and dipped in chocolate. They brought our ice cream to our table and also brought water for the 6 of us. I think that's good service in my book. The view was amazing looking out over Alcatraz island. It is a little pricey at $9 for my sundae but for the experience I gladly paid.
author: Kevin P.

description: Asked for a banana split. Got a milkshake. Literally! It was chocolate syrup! And when we asked them for a new one, they threw a different melted banana split on the table a few seconds later! I didn't even get the fruit that it was suppose to come with!!! On top of that the service was horrible!!! All the waiters look miserable. Should've gone to Mitchell's.
author: Ayana D.

description:
************* REVIEW 116 ****************

Free a piece of chocolate welcome you in, nice. For chocolate lovers as my dad, he was as a kid in a chocolate store, simply put!

They have everything a sweet tooth ever wanted. A nice out door sitting on a beautiful day.

Yes the line is long, but only 5 minutes wait. For a chocolate lover, that means absolutely nothing. Ask my dad!

What is my dad doing here on a mother's day? Well, he was waiting for my mom & I at Wattle Creek Wine tasting!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Love the mint chip sundae!!  Its a good thing I live four hours away otherwise I would eat a sundae every day and get really fat. The last time we went the wait was short and sweet :) they have lots of halloween treats in stock and the staff are very knowledgeable of their products and prices. I lile how the shop gives you a sample of their delicious chocolate.
author: Sasha W.

description: I seem to go against popular belief when I say: This was the worst part about my trip to the Bay. A friend and I ordered hot chocolate (that's it!). The line was CRAZY long, which was to be expected. Let's just say, we waited close to an hour just for two watered down hot chocolates. And it wasn't just us, we met the people around us who were waiting beyond one hour. There were only two workers actually making the drinks, while one female worker just stood talking to other employees. The hot chocolate station was A. MESS. There was ice cream everywhere, hot chocolate spilled carelessly all around, and the main worker could barely even speak English. After waiting for that long, you'd hope for a spectacular hot chocolate, when in reality, it tasted like Swiss Miss made with warm water. My advice: don't waste your time here. UNLESS you are willing to wait even longer for a sundae or specialty drink because those actually are pretty delightful.
author: Elise E.

description:
Yes, I know it's so touristy it's terrible.  But I love it anyway.

Whenever I'm in a town with a Ghirardelli cafe, I have to stop in, much to the dismay of my husband (and calorie count).  I love the hot chocolates, the cookies are amazing, and ice cream is delicious too.  Touristy?  Yeah, but hey, there is a reason why it's always so packed!
author: Patty M.

description:
Located at the original location of Ghirardelli's Factory is the Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop.  This iconic brand has a rich history and has been making chocolate since 1852.  With 160 years of experience one would expect their chocolate to be amazing and It certainly was. 

After a long day biking around San Francisco my buddies and I were craving an ice cream. When we arrived the line was out the door but moving quickly. We all ordered the World Famous Hot Fudge Sunday in a Chocolate Waffle Bowl.  Once you order at the counter it's a free for all to find a table to sit. We got lucky and found one easily. We placed our placard on the table and got a few glasses of water from  the self service bubbler while we waited.

A very nice waitress came to our table but unfortunately the order was wrong. Somehow the order went in incorrectly and was served in a glass bowl rather than the chocolate waffle bowl. Wanting what everyone else had we send them back. As the waitress turned she got bumped by another employee and two of the three sundae's hit the floor in a spectacular crash. Of course I felt terrible not only for her but for the wasted ice cream.

She returned a few minutes later with new sundae's as we had ordered. She did show us that the person at the counter had clearly put them in the computer incorrectly but she gave us what we wanted without any other mention of it.

The sundae's were huge and we could easily have shared one but how often do you get to have a sundae in the original factory in San Francisco. The ice cream was rich and creamy and the hot fudge was smooth and silky. I managed to finish off the ice cream and hot fudge but when it came to eating the chocolate waffle bowl I wasn't able to finish.  As good at it was I am glad I don't live to close because I'd be huge.
author: Drew N.

description: Ordered the chocolate sundae and hot chocolate. Both were chocolate heaven!  This is the original store so it's extremely busy. Order upstairs and the line is shorter. We asked for more hot fudge for our sundae and the manager gave us a side for free....yum, yum!
author: Nicole N.

description:
Dear Ghirardelli,
Please increase the staff size for your to go ice cream counter on Russian Hill.  During our visit the wait was exceptionally long and your staff was overworked and overwhelmed resulting in abrupt customer service and poor presentation of your product.
author: Chris O.

description:
Picture this... Disneyland on it's busiest day...This place is a ZOO. Of course it's a tourist attraction, so if you've never been, it's one of those things you can do once and check it off your list. I would never go here if I was a local....

My shake (ice cream sundae blended into a shake) was delicious I must say....But I don't need that kind of sugar high or calories very often in my life....

My kids enjoyed what they ordered, but they hated how it was total chaos inside..There is a nice orderly line outside as you wait to order and it moves along fairly fast considering...I think this is because they want to hurry up and take your money before you change your mind and leave. Once you pay and you head inside to look for a table, you will wish you never placed your order. Every single table is loaded with more people than the table can hold and around those tables are all of the people standing around waiting for their ice cream and anxiously eyeing every table to see who might be leaving, so they can hurry and swarm in before anyone else. 

I couldn't wait to eat my ice cream and get the heck outta dodge. 

I'm exhausted just re-capping my experience!
author: Kym W.

description: So delicious, and oh so bad for you. The chocolate and the caramel!!! -melts- But don't plan on eating here as it's always packed, not enough tables, and sticky counters. Yuck. But a must stop, even if it's pricey. BUT IT'S SO GOOD.
author: Chani P.

description: Absolutely amazing! Have been coming here since my childhood and have never been disappointed. On our most recent visit we got the Salted Carmel and Brownie sundae and were thoroughly satisfied. Sunday night around 7PM was the slowest I've ever seen and it we were even able to park right in the street and walk in and order. Will definitely be back again.
author: Peter F.

description:
Ice cream is my weakness, so I definitely had to try some even though I had just eaten 2 cupcakes.  It's okay, I was on vacation!  I'm definitely paying for it now though...

I didn't think their ice cream was really extra special compared to other places, but it was good.  It's really not a difficult task to put together a berry sundae.  And of course, since it's the renowned Ghiradelli, they can jack up the prices and tourists like myself will still spend the extra bucks just to say they tried it.  Been there, done that.
author: Jina R.

description:
Kind of a must stop when you're in San Fran.  Well, to tell you the truth...not a fan of chocolate, but I love ice cream.  The lady friend and the people we were traveling with wanted to stop here more than myself, and I'll tell you what: worth it.

To get to see inside Wonka's factory is how I would explain this place.  There was a non-stop line out the door, but it moves very quickly, and it is 100% worth it.  Again, not a chocolate person here, but I very much enjoyed myself in this factory downtown but I think everyone around me enjoyed it more.
author: Glen S.

description: Thought Ghirardelli was supposed to be high quality chocolate. So very disappointed to buy it and then notice on the label that the third listed ingredient after sugar and unsweetened chocolate is high fructose corn syrup. Really Ghirardelli? I would expect that from some dollar junk I've picked up in Walgreens. But I expected better from you. Oh well :(
author: KK W.

description:
All the way at the bottom of the menu but get the mint bliss sundae! What a ride!! Mint Choco chip, chocolate ice cream w dark chocolate fudge and dark chocolate pieces.

Sign in on yelp and get $1 off sundaes.

Please don't order one just for yourself, be kind to your body. I think the 1 portion sundae can feed 3 people. I shared with my husband and it was way too much.

I think I got my fudgy ice cream fix for the year. I may be back in a year or two.
author: Elli C.

description:
Going to SF you must try this place! 
Tons and tons of mouthwatering goodies to try!
author: Sarah L.

description:
After lunch me and some friends dragged our big bellies over to Ghirardelli Square for some ice cream, because we're fatties and we can do that right after eating a big lunch! Since we walked over here, we didn't have to deal with the parking, because there rarely is any by there anyway. 

There was a line, but it wasn't too long. We ordered The Earthquake which was a sundae with 8 scoops of ice cream of your choice, and 8 toppings of your choice all for about $30. We picked out our seats, and waited for our sundae to come out. When it came out it was actually smaller than I thought it would be, I think there was more whip cream than ice cream. The ice cream was really good, but I don't think the sundae was worth the $30, the scoops were really small, and we kept getting huge amounts of whip cream onto our spoons, because we thought it was ice cream. 

The place gets pretty packed in the afternoon, and the seating is a little cramped, but it was a nice place to sit down and stuff my face with some more fatty foods!
author: Heather C.

description:
We all know Ghirardelli chocolate is great and their ice cream is no exception. But, and you knew this was coming, the management of the Ghirardelli Ice Cream Factory needs to take a clue from other like establishments and move to the 21st century when it comes to service. This is a very busy place and they still depend on the stick with a number placed on top for their servers to find you. This is no easy task. The place is huge, crowded, and more than a little chaotic. With some sticks shorter , and children playing with other sticks, it's a miracle that your order arrives at all let alone a bit melted for the amount it needs to travel around before it finds you. 
I'm guessing that the servers are not listened to, or the owners don't eat here. It seems obvious that a new system needs to be adopted, and soon. 
The ice cream is very good, that's what the 3 stars are for, and I should have given a separate star to the servers who have to deal with this madness on a daily basis.
author: Philip A.

description: Butterscotch sundae was so great! I shared it with my husband and bought a few squares to go. The shop has a great location, the maritime museum, Fisherman's Wharf, and a seaside park are nearby. Also there is a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Mary R.

description: The vanilla ice cream in a chocolate dipped waffle cone covered in hot fudge was pretty good. I was a little disappointed that they ran out of peanut butter since I was craving that with my vanilla ice cream, but my sweets craving was still satisfied. Only complaint would be that the ice cream is overpriced, but I guess that's expected of Ghirardelli.
author: Brian A.

description:
Their on-the-go shop will not split a sundae for you, and there are no child-sized options available.  That meant that today my 3 and 5 year old had their dear old mom split a sundae for them which turned into an ugly mess and two little kids heartbroken because their sundae wasn't quite what they were expecting.  

What's more is that there was not an iota of an attempt to help me solve my problem from the staff.  They simply said "it's our policy not to split sundaes" but we'll give you a cup to do it yourself.  Hmmm... splitting the brownie, not so hard, but the whipped cream and the half melted ice cream and hot fudge?  How can I split that and make it look half way appealing?  I didn't figure it out.  My 3 year old left in tears and refused to eat the ugly mess I had created.

You might be thinking - why didn't she just buy each of her children their own $10 ice cream sundae?  After all the tears and what-not I thought the same thing myself and then came to my senses.  Those things have to have at least 1,000 calories in them and a bag of sugar!  They're supposed to be a treat and are a lot even for an adult - imagine that all going into a 5 year old body!!  And believe me, my 5 year old would have stuffed it down with all her might if I had let her.

Long story short, don't go there with children.  There are plenty of wonderful ice cream shops in the city that will cater to families and will be happy for the business.  Sadly, this is a tourist trap to the extreme with poor customer service.  The sundae was okay, but honestly the ice cream wasn't anything special and the chocolate sauce tasted like any other.  Give it a pass when you're in town.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I always end up here because we love visiting the square, but really after the first visit actually purchasing a dessert here is not worth it.

The desserts are seriously just okay: think overpriced regular ice cream topped with various toppings and syrups. They even note that they use Dreyer's ice cream! Definitely nothing special in a city known for its good eats. Definitely visit the square and grab your free chocolate, but opt for dessert elsewhere.

Finally, the store itself is small, but offers seasonal packaging/flavors. Everything is Ghirardelli priced, but it is a good place to pick up chocolate bars for the co-workers or a somewhat expensive grab bag to sample different chocolate flavors.
author: Melissa G.

description: My wife and I were a little disappointed.  They don't make chocolate here, and the prices are definitely high.  You can go around down the street to the Walgreens and get the same packages of chocolate at a discounted price.  The ice cream shop did have good blended mochas that beat out Starbucks (taste and price - $5.50 each).  There is a little museum there so you can see how they chocolate used to be made, but other than that, its a tourist trap.
author: Carl B.

description: We sat and had ice cream; spent $70; after finishing our ice cream with soggy cones, Guillermo threw us out to give our table to new customers; first time this has ever happened to me; don't know what to say; I guess they only like you within 15mins of you ordering and eating and then you are not appreciated as a customer!
author: John G.

description: Ice-cream was just ok. The waiter dropped our order about 5 feet away from us. Super bummer since it was busy & had to wait for the sundaes to be remade. Unfortunately they didn't offer us anything for the trouble. A bag of chocolates would've made it worth the hassle but nope. Nada. It's one of those places you need to try at least once & cross it off the list.
author: Jessica A.

description: Our family favorite for ice cream sundaes.  Love their chocolate mix (mini semi-sweet chocolate drops) too!
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Cookie Bottom Chocolate Sundae. Need I say more?!

Check them out. Seriously. Just go. And screw your "diet" for a day and eat the whole sundae by yourself. It's just that good!! :)

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: Obviously a huge tourist spot, but don't let that deter you! The hot cocoa was a perfect treat for a cool evening in San Francisco. I ordered the drinking chocolate. It didn't come with whipped cream, but I asked for some and the barista gladly gave it to me. It was amazing. Almost too rich to finish. My friends ordered the caramel sea salt hot chocolate and it was great as well. An equally satisfying but less rich alternative to the drinking chocolate. The service was also great. The staff was very polite and quick. The free chocolate samples at the front door were a nice touch. I didn't try a sundae but the menu looked amazing, so I will have to come back and try one.
author: Cara B.

description: I can't pass this place up no matter how hard I try. Love their chocolate and their ice cream sundaes. You'll want to visit too and grab a sundae of your own. Yes, it's touristy, yes it's crowded, but yes it's the original and delicious to boot. My dark chocolate fudge sundae with mint chocolate chip ice cream was amazing, as was my mom's butterscotch fudge sundae with butter pecan ice cream. There's truly something for everyone here... everyone who loves ice cream!!
author: Deb S.

description:
Very disappointed.   I hadn't been to this place for about 10 years.  Decided to stop in after a meeting that ended at 9:30 on a Saturday night since I noticed they were open until midnight.  I arrived to a busy line but was pleased with how quickly I was able to place my order and was given a number to place on my table to be served.  What table??  There we over a dozen people waiting for tables.  There was a sign on a stairway stating that the upstairs section was closed.  I asked several waiters and they all told me that that section closed at a certAin fixed time even though many of us were waiting for tables.  I asked for the manager and he gave me the line--I suggested that making people wait so long was not very good customer service.  I finally did get a table but was disappointed with my hot fudge since it had a dribble of hot fudge and the ice cream didn't taste like I had remembered.  I also felt uncomfortably rushed as people hovered over my table waiting for me to finish. 

I have returned to California after many years on Cape Cod.  I think the folks at Ghiardelli should check out the hot fudge sundaes at The Sundae School in Dennis, MA, on Cape Cod.  There you will find the actual best hot fudge sundae in the world, for less than half the price!!

Unfortunately I feel that Ghiardelli's has turned into a proverbial tourist trap.
author: Kenneth S.

description:
This is a really busy place, even at 11 pm on a Saturday night.

Have someone stand in line and order while the other person looks for a table. The sundae is really good, but a bit pricey at almost $10 a sundae. In addition, it's so crowded that you may be walking around for awhile looking for a table if you don't plan accordingly.
author: Kolby B.

description:
I would go past this place everyday on my way to school and when we use to cut school - but never really thought about eating there much.
I love that they give you free samples when you enter from the store side rather than the restaurant entrance. I would normally get the ice cream with fudge brownie, DAMN that thing was sweet! Definitely just stick with the regular scooped ice cream with the waffle cone from now on!
author: Linda K.

description:
In all the time I've lived in the Bay Area, I've never visited Ghiradelli Square. Not being a huge chocolate fan, I didn't really have a burning desire to visit a chocolate store, but since we were in the area, we decided to stop by for ice cream sundaes. 

First off, $20 for two ice cream sundaes? Ouch. We got the Very Berry, and the Warm Brownie sundae, and while it was good, there was nothing extraordinary. Seating inside was ridiculously difficult, and people were standing everywhere waiting for a seat. However, turnover is quite high so it shouldn't take too long to find a seat. 

Definitely a tourist trap, but fun to visit if you've never been.
author: Emily Z.

description:
After our dinner at Bistro 9, I had my heart set on Bi-RIte Creamery for our post-dinner sweet treat. But for some reason, my friends weren't feelin it. The conversation went like this...

Me: "But it's gotten so many good reviews! People fantasize about this place in their sleep!!"

Friends: "Ehhhh...."

Me: "Hokayyy...where do you guys want to go?"

Friends: "Ghirardelli!"

My friends are fans of familiarity. And sometimes this can put a cramp on my adventurous Yelp style. Ghirardelli, despite being in a touristy area, is a go-to spot among my friends. Now, I didn't protest too much 
because I must admit, I have a special place in my heart for Ghirardelli chocolate.

Lovie was jonesing for a hot fudge brownie sundae. Now that surprised me because he NEVER craves sweets. Breezy got a banana split and Jac and her man got a hot fudge sundae. All of us were noshing on the sweet chocolately goodness within minutes.

We walked in a little after 11pm. We took our time and left a little after midnight. Mad props for this place being open late. What a genius idea eh? I guess I'm just used to living back home again where everything closes at 9PM.
author: Grace L.

description: Free samples. chocolate! nice people. lighthearted ambience.  A few chairs.  Actually there is the same store at either end of the little shopping area.  of course right?  its ghirardelli stores in ghirardelli square..
author: Ami T.

description:
This store makes me nostalgic. Back when I was 7 my parents would drive 50 miles just to have a large cable car sundae. I remember the pile of ice cream adorned with heaps of almonds and fudge with a little whip cream. 

I'm not sure if it's because I'm a decade older now that the sundae seemed to shrink 1/3 of it's original size of ice cream per scoop and was covered with whipped cream to cover up the cost savings. In fact there was almost more whipped cream than ice cream, which is pretty disappointing for a $10 sundae. There was barely any almonds and no fudge was present. I was so disappointed by the lack of fudge because that's what makes their sundae special. The ice cream is from Dryers and you can get the other toppings from anywhere else. 

We wandered over to the new location and the scoops were almost 2x larger! We also found a family that recommended asking for fudge on the side. It was clear that there were two sizes of plates for the sundaes and they were moving towards downsizing. I think we'll be heading over to the new location next time.
author: Diana L.

description:
Hmmmm....Chocolate

If you visit, make sure you get Ice cream. Loved it.
author: Jason P.

description:
Seriously, what doesn't taste good in San Francisco?? 

I actually don't have a sweet tooth, but when I'm traveling, especially to places with a European flare, I find myself buying gelato at every ice cream store that crosses my path. 

Oh my, I'm glad this one crossed my path, because my day was perfect before but it was even better when I was licking all the delicious gelato off of my sugar cone while sitting outside, watching the blue ocean, birds, flowers..... oh, I think you just lost me to that moment.....
author: Shokouh H.

description:
This is one of the places that is a must-stop-by for tourist! It is said that the original Ghirardelli has been here since the early 1900s. You also get a $1 off for a yelp check in! Sweet!!

I decided to try the Famous Hot Fudge Sundae with a Waffle bowl. To my disappointment, it wasn't as good as I hoped it to be. The chocolate was not as rich as I though. It tastes as though I could make it at home with a scoop of ice cream and chocolate syrup from my local market.

All in all, this place is over-hyphed. Don't come here expecting something super delicious!
author: Pao W.

description:
If you think to yourself, "how good could a sundae be?" (Which is exactly what I think when my husband insists on stopping here when we are in SF).  You NEED to try a Ghirardelli Sundae. 

I am sooo not a dessert or ice cream person, I'd rather save room in my tummy for more of my real meal.  But sundaes from here are AMAZING.  

You must try the Brownie Sundae.  Vanilla ice cream layered with Ghirardelli Chocolate Brownie, Ghirardelli hot fudge, and topped with whipped cream. You will find yourself not being able to stop!  Lots of other delicious sounding treats on the menu too!!
author: Joanne N.

description:
I am giving the 2 stars because of the bad treatment my family received at the Ghirardelli shop in Ghirardelli Square. At the shop they were giving the usual samples, but the person who was giving the samples totally ignored them. People before and after them in the line were given samples but not them. They were 4 adults and a toddler. When they asked the person who was giving the samples, he said "I did not see you"! and he offered only one sample for the toddler where everyone else was receiving at least one and even was free to help themselves from the sample basket. 
I have to note that the ladies in the family were wearing head scarves. You judge for yourself if this is a discrimination or not based on appearance. It sure is.
author: may n.

description:
Regardless of the food, ambiance, service... a place is successful if patrons associate it with happy moments in their lives. To me, the Ghirardelli ice cream shop is such a place. I can always overlook the herds of tourists, whipped cream from a can and other imperfections of the shop simply because I had wonderful memories there.  

My first visit was after a high school homecoming dance. Being much younger and impressionable back then, I was thoroughly impressed by how romantic the ambiance was (back then it seemed much cleaner... and on the night that I visited it was drizzling outside, with very few customers). Nowadays, it's hard to be pleased even by a diamond ring, so it's not fair to judge the shop by my current standards as a jaded old fart. I will say though that to this day, I love coming here in the evenings, sitting in my corner seat, and stare out into the street, like I am "underneath" a bridge (you will see what I am talking about once you visit). 

I've tried their banana split, mint ice cream sundae, family style "earthquake"... and pretty much most things off of the menu, but my favorite, after all these years, is still the original Dark Chocolate Fudge Sundae. It is decadent, not overwhelmingly sweet, and a perfect size for someone who enjoys dessert but doesn't want to feel too guilty afterwards. I was tempted to try it in their waffle once, but that waffle was not impressive. It was stale as hell and I thought docked points off of the sundae itself. 

Whenever we have visitors, I always bring them to Ghirardelli Square. It is a stable in San Francisco and the ice cream stop is a must.
author: Salamander L.

description:
I had to pass on ordering something for myself.  I was more than happy to steal a few sips from my GF's "drinkable sundae".  The Nob Hill Chill aka nothing but chocolate upon chocolate with chocolate chips floating on top.

We were able to sample the Salted Caramel Chocolate Square.  I can see why people can get addicted to chocolate.  That thing was good.  So good in fact that some caramel made it's way to my beard without me knowing.  My GF had to point it out later.

Don't waste your money buying souvenirs in Chinatown.  Get your friends a package of squares from Ghirardelli and they'll feel really special.

Trust...
author: Nino R.

description: They are efficient and very busy at the wharf .  I had their browne ice cream sundae which was average. There candy is good. I would rather have Sanders chocolate sauce and a moister browne with better ice cream.
author: marlene c.

description:
You know the feeling you get when you're a kid and you see the huge letters that spell out "DisneyLand" for the first time? That's how I felt when I saw the Ghirardelli lights! 

The Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate here is to die for. I wish I could have tried the ice cream, but unfortunately it was freeeeeezing when I was there so I had to pass. The caramel chocolate square on top of my hot chocolate was more than enough to keep my sweet tooth at bay. 

They had a whole bunch of touristy treats, like the chocolate block shaped into the Golden Gate Bridge, which I thought was super cute. The chocolates available here was in a wider variety than the regular flavors you can pick up at any CVS. Plus, *cue little kid voice*  "it's not the saaaame!" There's just something about that huge wall of chocolate bars that just makes you cave in.
author: Aileen P.

description: Love this little gem in the square. You walk in, everyone is super friendly, and they pass out free samples! I have always thought their chocolate was the best you can buy many different kinds in one place. Definitely something to see if you are a San Francisco first timer.
author: Lindsay A.

description: Boyfriend took me here after our not-so-yummy dinner at Waterfront Restaurant for our anniversary. This saved the night! I'm really glad he brought me here. Even though I grew up in the Bay, I had never been here before! We ordered a banana split, and we even got a free sundae (I think it was because the girl couldn't find who it belonged to, because it was already melting)! It was pretty crowded, but I really liked the ambiance of the place. I enjoyed watching the chocolate being made--it was pretty cool. The sundaes were good, but unfortunately, we couldn't finish them because we were too full! The sundaes are a bit pricey, but I'd definitely come here again, for a special occasion.
author: Karen L.

description:
Oh, Ghirardelli. How do I love you? Let me count the ways. 

1. Chocolate covered blueberries
2. Chocolate covered espresso beans
3. Raspberry-filled chocolate bar
4. Caramel-filled chocolate bar
5. Fudge
6. Sundaes, sundaes, sundaes

The Verdict: Did I mention chocolate?
author: Cara S.

description:
First of all, DO NOT park in the garage! Cost us $9 and we were there for a little less than an hour I believe. Ridiculous! Street parking is your best bet. You can get validated for the parking garage if you spend over $20 in the chocolate shop though, but only for 1 hour of parking. 

I ordered the Lombard St Hot Cocoa (I believe that's what it's called). It was basically hot skim milk and they gave me 4 milk chocolate Ghirardelli truffle squares to dunk in it and melt to make it hot cocoa. Maybe other people are wowed by that, but I felt like I got seriously scammed! I didn't want to sit there stirring chocolate into my drink and waiting for it to melt and then not even getting marshmallows on top! Not cool. It didn't even taste that great. At first it seemed like I was just drinking skim milk with a hint of chocolate and then after 10 minutes it became overpoweringly chocolatey and I couldn't finish it. Not my cup of tea. 

I've tried the sundaes here though and they are pretty good! Your best bet would be to order that or ice cream or maybe a mocha cuz their hot cocoas are overpriced and totally not worth it.
author: Kriti R.

description: Prepare for huge lines of tourists.  The desserts and drinks are pretty good if you don't mind paying a little more and having a sugar stomachache after.  I got a sea salt caramel hot chocolate -SOOO sweet, the chocolate sqaure on top was a nice touch, REAL whipped cream.  My boyfriend got a mint quake shake.  They take ice cream then blend a whole chocolate bar into it. These two plus a bottled water came to $14.
author: Kelsey R.

description: It's a really cool chocolate factory, but a little overpriced if you ask me. I paid nearly $4.00 for a coke out of the soda fountain. Oh welly!
author: Barrett S.

description:
A great place to chill out visiting friends is taking them to this Chocoholics' Paradise!

After eating chocolate, the airport stressors just seem to melt away!
author: Shirley M. J.

description: Not much sitting room inside but tasty ice cream! There was a line out the door when we walked up but were pleasantly surprised to find that it moved very quickly. So if you see a line outside, don't be intimidated - the chocolate ice cream is definitely worth the short wait.
author: Michelle T.

description: If your looking for an out of this world sundae then go somewhere else. You order a sundae and wait about 30 minutes until it comes and then when it does arrive you may ask yourself, what the heck was I waiting for.  Tourist trap and a bunch of teenagers who don't care about there job or customer service.
author: Andrew P.

description:
I love chocolate, I love icecream and their sundaes are good, but the reason why this place has 3 stars instead of 4 is the fact that it's a tourist magnet.  Because it's a tourist magnet, sometimes you're waiting for 30 minutes to order and then 30 minutes to find a spot in that tiny, cramped, crowded place. 

I don't see why you would buy the chocolate here when you can just get it at Safeway or any other store.  There's nothing special about the chocolate, but it's a nice place to get your sweettooth on.  Who knows, maybe you're lucky to get through line FAST and find a nice and CLEAN table too (i have, it's happened) 

I suggest going upstairs because I went and we were the only ones up there
author: Meena N.

description: hmmmmmmm how can one possibly deny the irresistible Ghirardelli... you simply can't ESPECIALLY if you are just visiting. I believe they open rather late on the weekends and their lights around the area just invite you in. their sundaes are super delish but i highly advise sharing because portions are HUGE and you will be sugar high for hours. I also enjoy their milkshakes.... hmmm so good and how can you leave without picking up a bag of their CHOCOLATE? you simply can't. eat the ice cream there and pick up some chocolate squares to go. can't go wrong.
author: Kristina L.

description: The ice cream is so good!  I always get the Gold Rush, it has peanut butter swirled in!  The only problem here is there is never enough seating.  Maybe they should make the store smaller to make more room.  Also, save $1 if you check in on Yelp or get a coupon from some of the tourist maps!
author: Rachel R.

description: I came here last year on Christmas and did again this year. I've never been on a different day, so I don't know how it is, but the wait for a table is a little long on Christmas (it's self seating), but the hot chocolate is so yummy. I'll definitely be back next Christmas!
author: Kaii B.

description: Got lucky coming in on a Sunday morning at 10am.  No line and the people were so friendly.  All the Ghirardelli products you like, plus some customized for San Francisco.
author: Diana M.

description: Went here Saturday night after a baseball game.  We waited in line 20 minutes to order.  We ordered a Hot Fudge Sundae in a waffle bowl. The ice cream barley covered the bottom on the waffle bowl.  There was more cream and nuts then ice cream. We asked if that was correct and the guy said it looked just fine.  For 11 dollars I would except to have a good scoop of ice cream.  Hot fudge was cold and barley visible.   The workers were super rude.  Never going there again.
author: Laura F.

description: The sundaes are world famous and the quaint little chocolate factory is amazing for any chocolate lover. The place is open late and serves great warm delicious chocolate sundaes.
author: Gopi V.

description: I've always been a fan of the chocolate, especially their rocky road ice cream on that fancy chocolate dipped come covered in nuts. Anyway this location is right next to all the tourist stuff so as you can imagine it's packed. Good luck finding a table. Also I understand they're pack but the waiters will literally try to get people still eating out. Needless to say the downtown San Diego location is my favorite.
author: Angie S.

description:
I'm not a fan of ice cream or sweet dessert, but this place is packed and such long line just for ice cream. 

Got an order of banana split and wow, their ice cream really is good!! It is not as sweet as I thought it would be. 

There are so many type of ice cream desserts they offer on their menu, you'll want to try everything.
author: Xuankieu T.

description: Well, it's very commercial. Kind of like going to M&M world but with a tiny bit more class. The place is pretty crowded, and the lines can get long, but psst, there's a smaller cafe front in the back of the complex that makes the same stuff as the more crowded one up front. I can't say I've had better hot chocolate, although homemade stuff does come pretty close to their pricey concoctions, so share with a friend unless you're loaded.
author: Max P.

description:
LOOOOVE their banana fudge sundae!!  I usually add strawberries to it, and my gosh, it is deeeeelicious!!  This is my favorite sundae here!  I'm usually not a chocolate person, but their quality of fudge and vanilla ice cream....realllly good!

Banana split is also really good.  It comes with a scoop of vanilla, strawberry and chocolate ice cream, with pineapples, strawberries, banana and fudge toppings.  This one is good for sharing, but since I'm not a big fan of choclate ice cream and pineapple toppings, I usually go with the banana fudge sundae.  

Cute post dinner date spot!
author: Nancy S.

description: Very disappointed in the service. First, they messed up on the charges. Second, they made the incorrect order. Third, after a lengthy delay, the server spilled the melted, soupy ice cream mess on me, ruining my jacket.
author: JoAnn Y.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I'm a huge fan of chocolate and ate everything I ordered (cause I don't let chocolate go to waste), but I've had way better ice cream at many different places.

I sampled the chocolate ice cream and it seriously tasted like Lucerne or some generic chocolate ice cream. It wasn't different from other chocolate ice cream I have eaten. So, I ended up ordering the vanilla in a chocolate dipped waffle cone. Likewise, the vanilla was vanilla. Not vanilla bean. Not any tastier than any other name brand ice cream joint. And, the cone was soggy! Not the crispy crunchiness I was expecting.

You can get a better ice cream treat at Molly Moon's in Seattle, Rocky Mountain, Dilletante's in Seattle, etc.
author: Victoria C.

description: If you love ice cream but don't mind the long wait, this is a must do. Has a sit down area and a to go area with seating or take it across the street to Hyde park.
author: Michelle K.

description: Extremely long wait for melted ice cream. Waitress walked by several times. Was not even looking at order numbers. We had to ask her it was our order. Very disappointing!!!!
author: Norma E.

description: We both had sundaes. They were great and the service was good. Prices are always a bit high though.
author: Steven G.

description:
You can't go to SF without hitting Ghiradelli's up. And now you can't go to Target without getting your Ghiradelli on either. I am so happy that I can find GH products so easily now - their chocolate chips are always my go to for baking.

Anyway, the ice cream is good and I love everything about this place but I'm writing this review to give props to the classic hot chocolate! Spectacular when it's just too damn cold for ice cream. It's amazing and you can even go home and buy the powder mix at Target...yay!
author: Isabella L.

description: Clean, helpful, kind and just all around fun place to check out. The sundaes are awesome too!
author: Holly C.

description: Share a brownie sundae here and you'll be very impressed. Try to eat one alone and you'll be too full for dinner. Check this out but split the sundae.
author: David H.

description:
This is tourist-town.  As one will do in tourist town, I purchased souvenirs.  

BONUS - free samples!
author: Heather H.

description:
I was in SF briefly in November for a job interview and had to check out at least one tourist attraction.  I settled on Ghiradelli Square and the flagship diabetic nightmare.  Or for those of us still on our way toward acquiring the condition, sweet chocolatey happytown.

Ghiradelli is located in the Fisherman's Wharf neighborhood.  Nearby is Russian Hill, the kind of neighborhood that makes you wish you lived in the city by the bay, even if you're paying $2500/month for an all too average 1 bedroom apartment.  But let's focus on the goodies.

I got to Ghiradelli about an hour before closing time.  This place must be super popular at peak hours because they won't let you in beyond the front souvenir area.  To gain access, you browse the menu while in the foyer, place your order, pay ahead of time and then you're allowed in and shown your seat.  Kind of a roundabout way of doing things, but I'm guessing it makes it more efficient to keep the crowds moving.

I got a hot chocolate, which was topped with a heaping pile of whipped cream and a mini chocolate bar for stirring.  For my main course I got a peanut butter and chocolate concoction mixed with vanilla iced cream served up in an old fashioned sundae/shake cup.  Surprisingly, I wasn't totally sold on the dessert.  The taste wasn't quite as sweet as expected.  However the hot chocolate was delightful.

Feel guilty after gorging yourself, walk some of the streets that give Russian Hill its name afterward.  Larkin is no joke.  But the reward is that it will take you straight to the top of Lombard Street's famous crooked block.  Enjoy.
author: Bennett L.

description: I'll never get tired of the mint chocolate sundae here...period!!! A fun and interesting place to visit, great gifts to bring home...
author: Dave F.

description:
Bottom Line: Sarcastic service and a rich drinking chocolate does not impress me.

Ghirardelli's is a big ol' CF.  You have a bunch of tourists, who have no idea what's going on, and you have a weird ordering system.  It makes for a confusing time.  Put that together with an lady who obviously doesn't enjoy her job and you have the recipe for unhappy customers.  

I think they were short staffed at the counter and said, "hey, let's pull the lady in charge of bitchiness, and put her in a customer service spot."

For all the newbies ordering, you place your order in as soon as you get in the door.  There are several cashiers, and several lines, but that isn't always apparent.  Make your order, pay, and then take your number and try to find yourselves a seat.  Good luck - you'll need it.

I had the drinking chocolate.  It was very rich and creamy.  I think next time, I'll go with a plain old cocoa.
author: Anson G.

description:
Ghiradelli, oh the memories.  I started coming here as a kid, probably around 6 or 7 years old as a reward for doing well in school or during winter break when my mom would take me downtown to see the Macy's decorations and go to Pier 39.  The feeling of that smell of wafting chocolate that was being made in the restaurant.  To the free samples of Ghiradelli chocolate that they hand out constantly, this place can seem like a tourist trap sometimes and the prices have come up over the years but it's still oh so damn good.

You come for their ice cream sundaes, from their famous hot fudge sundae to my go to, the banana split, you can't go wrong.  If you come with a large group, try the earthquake, 8 flavors of ice cream, with all the toppings, can serve at least a group of 10.  I've tried it with my friends before and although it got a lil nasty towards the end because of the melting, it was a fun experience.  Their hot fudge is what they are known for, make sure you get a sundae with it included.

Parking can be tough, it is pier 39 area so be patient.  And seating can be rough inside but most people finish their ice cream and leave so it's not too bad.  If it's a nice day, you can sit outside and have their ice cream.  

On a side note, they hire a very international staff, with people from all over the world, that might be to help the tourists who eventually find their way here but I think it's a nice thing to do.
author: Brian C.

description: One of the best ice cream ever , the best hot sundae ever. Me and my bf go there every Saturday . Thanks to ghiradelli now I have yelp.
author: Moranii B.

description: Been here more than a handful of times and what's not to like about this ice cream haven. We all know the ice cream is on point here and it's never disappointed every time we visit. The reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is might take a while to find parking and if they are busy, you may wait a while to find a table.
author: Stephen D.

description:
I remember a really long time ago I went through the tour place, afterwards there would be this ice cream shop. Funny how I never got to try that ice cream shop until now. My friend and I decided to share the banana split, considering how each dish costed $10+. 

  As our banana split came it was a little bigger than we thought it would be. It was PERFECT to eat on a hot day. The ice cream was soo creamy and cold down our throats which cooled us in a flash. There was one scoop of vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, and some sort of sweet jam with it.  The temperature in the restaurant was a little warm and didn't have a/c, hence why some our ice cream melted a little. However, I am SOOO coming back here next time.
author: Aja S.

description:
Chocoholic. Sweet-tooth. Desserts type of girl. Yup, that's all me. Being a SF native, it is kind of sad that I've never had an ice cream sundae from Ghirardelli Square. Well, bum bum bum... I finally had one last month! Ahh, sweet indulgence.

I ordered the warm brownie sundae ($8.95). It comes with two scoops of vanilla ice cream, a square of warm brownie, hot "homemade" fudge, whipped cream, chopped almonds, and a cherry on top. The brownie was my favorite part of the concoction because it was soft and fudgey! Eating the brownie with a little bit of vanilla ice cream was sensational.

Devouring one of their sundaes alone can get a little bit sweet so I suggest sharing it with a friend or two.
author: Annie S.

description:
I've been here a few times, the ice cream is always really good and really rich. I think the sundaes are the best, the milkshakes are really good but I prefer slightly lighter milkshakes than they serve here. Its very touristy here and theres a line to order, and then you have to go find a table. The downstairs lobby is really full but theres an upstairs seating area if you can't find a spot. Luckily we found a spot. 

The seating area is a little less than charming and I wish they could do something to spruce it up. But if you come here just for the ice cream you'll be fine. We ordered some sort of mint chocolate sundae, I believe it was called Mint Bliss, and it ran somewhere around 10 dollars. Definitely pricey. It was a huge sundae though and my friend and I both split it without wishing we had more. 

They give you a number to place on your table, and then you get to wait a while and they bring out your ice cream. My other friend accidently said he wanted his to go, so he got to wait at the to go bar for his. He got his ice cream and found our table about 10 minutes before we got ours. We watched a waiter walk by with a mint bliss ice cream, look straight at our number, and keep walking. At this point we had already been waiting over 10 minutes but we just guessed they were really behind and it must have been someone elses. Well we waited, and waited and waited and still no ice cream. Finally THE SAME WAITER who had passed us by already shows up and drops our ice cream off. I'm guessing for some reason maybe our number didn't register to him when he looked at it, and he continued to search around and go upstairs and then finally back downstairs to give us the ice cream. We waited around 20 minutes for our ice cream and by the time we got ours, our friend was basically finished with his. To top it off our ice cream was MELTED due to the fact our waiter was a space cadet. If it wasn't so stinking slow I would have gone back and requested another one but we didn't have time to wait. Glad we paid over 10 dollars for melted ice cream. Granted it was delicious, but still.

I have been here a few times previously and always loved it and got my ice cream in a timely manner, and it was never melted. I'm going to contribute this flop to the waiter - which is unfortunate that one persons error can really dampen my experience so much. But the ice cream would have been good otherwise.

You do get a free chocolate sample if you walk through the store so thats a bonus. They have a few specials on chocolate too, and a very comprehensive selection of the chocolate flavors, variety packs, and different sizes. So thats worth checking out before you grab your ice cream.

Overally I'm still giving this place 4 stars because I've really enjoyed it on all of my other visits, and I'm not going to completely knock it because this one waiter couldn't get us our ice cream in a timely manner. 2 stars for my last visit, but 4 stars overall.
author: Kerri J.

description: The old shop is closed till feb 2016 so you can't see the chocolate making machine. There was a crazy long line to buy chocolates and an even longer line to buy ice cream.
author: Karthik K.

description:
definitely a tourist attraction and a place to take the kids. if you just want to-go there is satellite store on Larkin and North Point. if you too lazy to walk there...then may the ice cream god give you more.

ordered the cookie bottom sundae and it wasn't anything that was breathtaking. i wish the cookie was softer but that wouldn't make sense since the ice cream would have hardened it anyway. definitely dont get this if you diabetic. the best part was the cherry on top =)

the ghirardelli chocolate ice cream is very smooth but it becomes too much chocolate later on. the strawberry cheesecake is good with cheesecake bits. the waffle cones are freshly made and then one edge (even though circles don't have edges) is dipped in chocolate.

come for the sake of coming but if you really here for ice cream...go get something special like Bi-Rite
author: Kathy W.

description: Gotta say, and this goes without saying, I loved the The Original Ghirardelli so much! I'd say even better than good ol' New Orleans! If I found a bottle and a Genie came out of it and I had just one wish, it would to have a lifetime free membership at The Original Ghirardelli
author: Craig P.

description:
O-M-G. Can you say GLUTTONY? Well if you can and your gut can take it all in, I would definitely indulge in what is Ghirardelli Chocolate. 

They have a great selection of different sundaes here to choose from and all for about $8. Not only do you get the ice creams and whipped cream and chocolate syrup, but you get this monsterous chocolate FUDGE RIBBON to go with it topped with a Ghiradelli chocolate square! SOOO fatty, but SO good. I can't believe I finished the entire Mint Bliss sundae myself!! AHHH! 

I will definitely be back the next time I have a sweet tooth craving to try the other sundaes. 

Note: They also have a new Sea Salt Caramel hot chocolate out this season along with all the Peppermint drinks and Peppermint bark! YUM!!!! I LOVE the holidays!

Note2: They also take Amex!!!
author: Ling H.

description:
Fudge, Ice Cream, and Hot chocolate.  Perfect "meal".

I'm not sure I need to say much more than that.  :)
author: Emilynne A.

description:
Ghirardellis is a nice place to visit in SF.  We were lucky, and got in real quick with no lines!  It was our first time here after making many visits to San Francisco.  We shared  the warm brownie sundae in a chocolate waffle cone.  It was delicious and filling!!  It was not as expensive as I thought it would be considering that we were in such a touristy area.

The service was good, and we were seated quickly.  Within two minutes, our order had already arrived.  There is a chocolate shop beside the ice cream shop where they also offer some samples.  We sampled the pumpkin spice chocolate, and it was okay.

We will be making this place a must see stop the next time we take family or friends to San Francisco.
author: PatrickJ T.

description: I wouldn't come here out of the ordinary. We came here with a group of about 12 people. Plenty of seats for everyone. It was cold and rainy which probably explains why it was dead that night. A friend and I split the brownie sundae which was pretty good. I am not much of a sweet tooth but this was okay to me. The warm brownie was good and the fudge was actually really amazing and topped things off. All the big boys ordered the other sundaes.. unfortunately no one attempted to do the earthquake.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Solid.

You can't go wrong, settling your sweet tooth at Ghirardelli Chocolate. They have a wide selection of desserts, drinks and various sweets and all of them are bound to be good.

As a "When in Rome" decision, we ordered the Cablecar, and, as I said, you can't go wrong. This Rocky road inspired dessert with a scoop of chocolate chip cookie dough was delicious. Though, the ice cream is slightly icy, thus it contains a little more water in the water/cream ratio. I think putting an entire square of Ghirardelli milk-chocolate on top is a bad decision though, because it's impossible to break apart with a spoon in it's cold, solid state; it must be eaten whole. 

I've been to another Ghirardelli in Chicago, and on the interior, they're exactly the same. On the exterior though, the San Fran location is beautiful and is worth a visit if you're near Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Nik B.

description:
LOVE their hot chocolate. It's all I ever get. Mainly because I'm always here at night that it's just too cold for ice cream.

Ghirardelli Chocolate is always crowded. ALWAYS. Ordering is pretty fast, the trick is to find a place to sit. Your order will be delivered to you. 

It's a bit pricey, but you're here for the experience and ambience. Totally come if you're visiting. Otherwise it's once in a while or special celebration with friends. The plaza itself is really cute and worth walking around. Great photo ops. And Pier 39 is walking distance sorta. It's just very San Francisco.

Always have a good experience here so why not you? =)
author: Katherine H.

description: Great place. Been here many times with family and friends. Yummy.
author: Maya A.

description: Love coming here. Shout outs to the dude who gave me a free chocolate dipped cone. He's the bomb.
author: Shan M.

description:
Chocolate. Ice cream. Shakes. Saturated fats. Brownies. Cookies. 

Bottomline: I am one step closer to achieving my goal of getting Type II diabetes. They also gave free samples of their chocolates, with whatever flavor they were testing out.
author: Jeremy T.

description: A little pricey but delicious sundaes! If you like ice cream and good chocolate it is a must!
author: Julie W.

description:
This place is really to showcase the chocolate. It may be a tourist attraction, but I think a local can just as well enjoy this place. I usually get the sundaes with hot fudge. Their icecream/fudge combo aren't anything out of the ordinary, but once you get a sundae place in front of you, you can't help but be happy.

They have a good variety, it's locally made, and it's consistant.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
They give free samples at the door...full size squares.  What the heck are you waiting for???

You can't go wrong if you like this particular brand of chocolate.  Yeah, it's full of tourists.  Yeah, they are pimping it hard in there, there are lots of assortments to choose from....

Yes, they have sundaes and waffle cones topped with it...

Yes they have brownies made with it, so big and filled with chocolate you may not be able to eat one alone....don't even try it! (I'll send the ambulance your way, to rescue you from your sugar coma!)

Of course you'll buy some, have a blast and buy one of the factory bags of the little squares, they'll mix it up for you for like $20 bucks.  Get a cable car tin of mixed one or a box of full size bars (try the those extra dark ones with the toffee bits....)

I'm telling you all this from a good place, I'm a reformed chocoholic, I know what I'm talking about!  Go, play tourist and check it out...eat your sample with panache and enjoy the view of Alcatraz from the front door...it's pretty cool!
author: Diana W.

description:
Yesterday, after a long walk from the Ferry Building to Pier 39 to Ghirardelli Square, the boyfriend and I decided to stop in for some ice cream. Saturday was Bi-Rite, and Ghirardelli, despite the tourist attraction, was known for it's ice cream. 

Well, from now on it'll be known as FAIL cream. The host who took our order wasn't that helpful, and the ice cream we got was worse than the freezer burned breyers you buy at 3am during a late-night depression binge from the local convenience store. 

I'm disappointed in you, Ghirardelli. The only reason I'm giving you a star is because you had peanut butter in one of your 9 DOLLAR SUNDAES, that we gave up eating halfway through to leave for some better dessert. 

Skip this, kids. Go to Bi-Rite instead, at least there you won't ever get let down.
author: Jaime L.

description:
The reason why I give this place 5 stars is not because of the great quality of service and dessert they provide. I give it high praise because my nephews and nieces LOVE this place! Looking at there faces when they dig into a towering hot chocolate sundae brings back memories of my childhood.

I would take my 7 yr old niece here every time she would get good grades. And believe me! she would make sure she got good grades! LOL. Last time she went 'BANANAS' ordering two sundaes  and a hot chocolate!

1. THE INTENSE DARK 
    Mint Bliss ~ One scoop each of mint chip and chocolate ice cream
    topped with homemade dark chocolate hot fudge, whipped cream!

2. WARM BROWNIE SUNDAE
    Two scoops of vanilla cream paired with warm double chocolate         
     brownie, smothered with hot fudge, whipped cream and chopped      
     almonds and a cherry!

3. Hot Coco!

I thought to myself....Hhhhmmmm? How much can a 4 foot, 65 Ibs child eat??? I found out, not soo much! so guest who had to finish her extras??? MEEEEEEE!

I ordered one huge 'GLODEN GATE' banana spilt! as well! HAHAHA! We were so caught up in the moment, we literally went BANANAS!

This place does get extremely busy during peak hours ( Weekends, 5-9pm) and it is a tourist favorite, but who cares! Its worth the experience.

The Holidays are coming! I cant wait to get my HOT CHOCOLATE on! =)
author: Oliver D.

description:
This place is run so poorly!!!!! My family and I were there on Saturday afternoon and yes, I can understand on a Saturday afternoon in June they will be busy, but to have to wait over an hour for 2 ice cream sundaes is outrageous! There is NO ORGANIZATION to this place at all! They give you an order number that makes absolutely no sense, they send your order back to their "kitchen" and lord knows why it takes so long to scoop ice cream, you have to hunt for a table (we had to literally stand right next to a table which I'm sure made those people uncomfortable and as soon as they stood up we had to sit down otherwise someone else would have taken our table), you put your order number on a stand on the end of your table which cannot be seen by the servers in a standing room only, and then it takes over an hour to get your ice cream and coffee which, by now, is room temperature! 

I remember being a kid and going to Ghirardelli with my family and loving watching the chocolate being made and getting to have ice cream and how magical it all seemed! After this weekend, I will NEVER go back again. It was uncomfortable, miserable, and just too stressful. They should take a lesson from places like In N Out who serves a similar amount of people but they are so efficient!
author: Beth P.

description: bring back the gold rush peanut butter sundae!!!!
author: Sarah A.

description:
People, seriously. Everyone loves chocolate and ice cream, obviously Ghirardelli doesn't work hard to make really impressive desserts. Then why don't you go to any other ice cream spot? 

I had mint bliss sundae(mint+chocolate ice cream), with hot fudge and whipped cream. The present was horrible; ice cream melt in a second because of the fudge(who got the stupid idea...). That was really a weird combination.
author: Yisi L.

description:
Coming to Ghiradelli square for the first time I HAD to have the famous ice cream.  There was a slight line when I went which was amazing because its winter but ice cream is apparently all year long! 

The smell of melting chocolate bars, noise of clinking spoons to glasses, and the waffle cone smell is pure heaven. 

It definitely doesn't seem as if they promote any "light' treats.  The smallest ice cream I could order was a scoop but I treated myself to a sugar cone.  I ordered Rocky Road ice cream.  Very delicious!  They have water out by the tables that was great because it was so so sweet. 

I might try one of the shakes or drinks next time but I'll leave the brownie fudge chocolate drizzled caramel draped chocolate bar with whip cream ice cream for the pros.
author: Anya R.

description: Hard to go wrong at such an iconic place! Large crowds, bring your patience and your appetite!
author: Lisa K.

description: 45 min waiting for ice cream AFTER getting a table. It came out almost like a milkshake. And it used to be our fav spot, the new location is not good.
author: Khoa V.

description:
One of my favorite places to go in SF. If you need an excuse to have a decadent sundae, this is it. I don't count calories integral to the tourist experience! Everything I've ordered is my favorite. It's not easy on the wallet, however.

We're 60 miles from SF so trekking up there is quite a big deal, and yes, we've actually gone up there just for this ice cream parlor!
author: Sue Ellen E.

description:
Pretty please with a cherry on top? 

It is hard to believe, but I used to HATE hot fudge sundaes. Sadly this is true. I didn't really like chocolate. Shocking I know. My sundae of choice used to be comprised of vanilla ice cream (naturally), strawberry sauce (or caramel or marshmallow cream), whipped cream, and of course the cherry on top. 

I'm still not a chocoholic, again shocking. But fortunately my palate now appreciates a little chocolate now and then. Especially when it is in the form of a hot fudge sundae from Ghirardelli's. Gigantic scoops of vanilla ice cream are placed in a glass goblet and covered with hot chocolaty fudge topping. A crown of whipped cream with some nuts and a cherry are the finishing touches to this masterpiece. 

The servings are super large so make sure you are ready to completely devour your sundae. Otherwise it is just a sad waste of a delicious treat. Shameful!
author: Karen G.

description:
Oh my goodness!!! I've been to Ghirardelli Square many times and eat Ghirardelli chocolate and so forth. We were rushing thru the city and stopped on in to see what's good. what's good? are you kidding me, i wanted to eat the entire cafe up. I felt like I was in that move Willie Wonka Chocolate factory but in my version Jane Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory. Anything Ghirardelli was IN YOUR FACE. Chocolate here chocolate there, huge sundays as big as head being served left and right, baristas serving hot beverages. 

I decided to order Ghirardelli Hot Chocolate with Sea Salt and Caramel. WHOA!!! It was very rich in flavor but when the sea salt, caramel, and whipcream mix with the chocolate, it made my heart melt. Thank god the Chirardelli Cafe is way across town because if there was one next to my work, i'd be hooked like a fat kid likes cake. 

Will i be returning... definately to try one of those HUGE sundays.
author: Jane A.

description:
yum yum yum yum yum yum yum!!!!! Chocolate!!! Ice cream!!!!! 
What is there NOT to love about this place?!! My only complaint is that it's normally super jammm packed with tourists.  If you're okay with taking your frozen treat to go, head over to the ghiradrdelli store to purchase your chocolate goodies to bring home!  It's more spacious and you get all the same options of chocolate!
author: Catherine L.

description:
Forget the hot chocolate! Get sundaes! 

Oh man. There are so many different kinds of sundaes here... it's so tempting to just try them all! During this trip I got the peanut butter sundae and added a banana. It was amaazzinnngggggg. Peanut Butter + Banana + Hot Fudge = happiness and a satisfying trip to the City. It's open late too, until 11pm so don't forget to stop by here before you go home.
author: Jacqueline N.

description:
I haven't eaten here for over a decade. And yes, saying that makes me feel funny. 

I totally remember this place being less busy. And having a banana split. Those were some beautiful memories of me being very small and having a rare treat with the family.

I guess it shouldn't be too much of a surprise to see a line coming out the door. I don't think an hour wait for our treat was supposed to be included. It would've been longer had we not marched over to find out what happened. Whoops... mixed our order and completely skipped it over. Probably due to overstressed and overworked staff. Some of the workers looked like they were completely out of it. 

Anyways, vanilla ice cream is totally delicious and the fudge is addicting. I just wish that they didn't skip us over like that. It's kind of shameful to have the customer come up and ask for their order after an hour passes, yaknow?
author: Hayne P.

description:
Long lines but the best ice cream in the bay area!

If you can wait and get past all the crazy people this place will blow your mind!
author: Anthony Z.

description: Ordered the Treasure Island. The line was crazy & everything was overpriced. The workers were very overwhelmed. But what else did we expect? Overall the sundae was not worth the wait but it was fun to see Ghirardelli Square.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Definitely a tourist trap.   We Americans like to bring our foreign visitors here even though there are much better ice-cream and chocolate in Europe, and the ice-cream is too big, sweet and rich for Asians.  

I was sorry that I ate the Hot Fudge Sundae with Waffle Cup.  Let me count the ways:
-  The waffle cup was decent, but it was over-dipped with too much chocolate.  We normally gobble up waffle cones/cups, but we left half of it untouched this time.
- The fudge was all sugar, so sweet that we have to spoon it out to trash.
- The whipped cream was no good.  It was over-whipped and oily with a lot of holes in it.
- The ice-cream was typical American cheap ice-cream, not of the gourmet/artisan variety.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I think Ghirardelli's was one of my favorite places in San Francisco before I moved to the Bay Area, and honestly, living here has only made me love Ghirardellis even more.  The different types of sundaes are awesome, the vanilla ice cream is sweet and the hot fudge is to die for.  There's a sundae for everyone: peanut butter, berries, carmel, butterscotch or the mother of all sundaes which is a little bit of everything.   There's also the standard fare include shakes, banana splits, etc.

There's a to-go cafe upstairs but if you have time, go in and order.  They'll bring your ice cream to your table so you can enjoy in peace.  Make sure to grab some chocolates before you leave for later.
author: Tony M.

description: Ice creams and chocolates and sundaes! 'Nuff said :D
author: Srivatsan S.

description:
Confession: I live 5 blocks from Ghiradelli HQ and visit on a weekly basis. Why is this strange? I.hate.chocolate. 

HOWEVER. Ghiradelli makes the most amazing soy (yes, they have soy! Don't let the menu lead you to believe otherwise) caramel latte. Caffeinated decadence in a cup. At $4 (regular), a wallet-friendly Saturday treat.

Other things I love about G Square:
1. The outdoor firepit and ample outdoor seating
2. The cute (not *so* touristy) shops
3. The beautiful brick
4. The gorgeous waterfront
5. The secret downstairs location that is never crowded (and has the same items as the over-hyped, line-out-the-door "cafe") Secret's out.

Why 4 stars, not 5? The seating/general room to move around inside the shop is a bit lacking -- but the employees complete orders pretty lickety-split, so it's a minor irk.
author: Lacey B.

description: Delicious, to die for Ghiradelli Sundaes! The downside?  If you can actually imagine a downside to a Ghiradelli shop, the prices. So not worth $10 for a sundae. I guess you're partially paying for the touristy experience of Ghiradelli Square and the Instagram photo taking spot in the back where the chocolate mixing machines are located.  I've been to other Ghiradelli stores before and don't remember this kind of price gouging.  If you can get past that part of it, the sundaes here are delicious and the coffees are good, too. We ordered a jumbo chocolate chip cookie, also good. Worth a trip here if you have out-of-towners visiting, for the experience and the pics.
author: Cali M.

description: So yummy. Ordered the hot fudge brownie sunday. Well worth it.
author: EvilOliv 3.

description: Yummmmmmmmmm! That's the only sound out of my mouth when I'm at Ghirardelli :P I love their ice cream sundaes [the brownie one&strawberry cheesecake ones are my favorites!]!!! The line can be kinda crazy, but if the upstairs room is open, the line is muuuch faster there. I always have to get Ghirardelli's when I'm in the Embarcadero. And after you eat, you can walk down the piers and work off the tons of calories you just consumed! :P Win-win!
author: Amy L.

description:
expensive and a long wait. we were only the 3rd person in line when we walked up and it still took over half hour for ice cream. it's ice cream folks, you don't have to cook it, you just scoop it. how long can that take???

the kids were happy with a banana split (they're kids and they'd love plain sugar) but our shake was really watery, not a typical thick ice cream shake. flavor very blah. 

go and take your picture in front of the signs, then go get your ice cream somewhere else it's not worth it. ben and jerry's is down the street along with awesome gelato places in north beach. 

I think I'm just spoiled from Marianne's in Santa Cruz. That's a long wait and it's worth it!
author: great space cape r.

description: A standard ice cream place and tourist attraction, it comes in large portions that could be shared. Overall it was decent, its hard to go wrong with chocolates and ice cream.
author: Nancy L.

description: fun place to go if you're in SF and its very walkable from Pier/Warf.  The prices are kind of high but you are in SF. Share if you can, most threw away half of their orders
author: F P.

description: It was amazing to check out the original Ghirardelli. I've only had a few of their chocolates. I Decided to get one of their sundaes. It was the mint something with the intense dark chocolate. It was really yummy.. really not that intense IMO. The only downside is it was one REALLY expensive sundae at almost 10 bucks... But what can you do? It's San Francisco and everything is really expensive!
author: Christi D.

description:
Food: CHOCOLATE HEAVEN. 'nuff said.

Ambiance: Pretty noisy and hard to find seating.

Parking: Try to find street parking. The parking in the parking structures are expensive.
author: Emily Y.

description: I like being able to get some ice cream after shopping. The location provides a free piece of Ghiradelli Chocolate like the other stores in San Francisco. The Sundaes are all good and I'm a fan of their fudge. When I am having a sweet tooth and want to share a Sundae with my girlfriend this is one of the best places in San Francisco. I also like being able to see the chocolate machines. This place gets crowded with tourist but if you are visiting from another city this place is definitely worth a try.
author: Jason L.

description:
It's expensive but we got a coupon at the information desk; $1 off sundae or 10% off ice-cream. 
I got the Haight-Ashberry (hehe, love the name) which is a strawberry cheesecake sundae with strawberries, chocolate-covered blueberries, chocolate-covered waffle roll, and whipped cream. $8.95 the coupon eases it just a little bit. I wanted fresh blueberries instead since I'm not a big fan of chocolate, but it was a no-can-do since the blueberries have already been covered. Man ...
An employee with a really cool moustache came by asking me if I wanted water or anything. So I asked for some peanuts. He came back with a small cup which was more than enough for me. Sweet! Sundaes are incomplete for me without peanuts.
Best dessert I have ever eaten, since it has both cheesecake and strawberries ... my favorites. The layer of whipped cream is pretty thick, but once you get past it, there's vanilla ice-cream and strawberries. So good! Then ... and here's my favorite part ... at the bottom there's cheesecake. Not the kind where it's blended in with flavors to make it taste like cheesecake; there are legit cheesecake bits at the bottom. That just made it for me.

As a tourist in San Francisco, you just have to indulge. This was mine and it was wonderful. :)
author: Cathy N.

description: Ghirardelli is famed for their chocolate, but they have really good ice cream.  While I am not a huge fan of their chocolate, I definitely wanted to visit while in SF.  Now, I do like the chocolate enough that I willingly tried the free sample square (dark pumpkin caramel).  The ice cream was flavorful and creamy - my sundae included vanilla and butter pecan.  The melted dark chocolate sauce was rich and paired well with the butterscotch in my Strike it Rich sundae.  I recommend skipping the waffle bowl - it is hard to eat and not worth the extra cost.
author: Lia M.

description: Had an amazing sundae...a little bit of a wait but damn it was good. I know touristy but we had fun
author: Jay S.

description:
The picture looked better than the actual sundae. We ordered the chocolate and strawberry sundae for three people to share. In my opinion It had too much whip cream. If they had added more vanilla ice cream and less whip cream it would've worked. Also I didn't like the cashier lady. She was just looking around and was not helpful! I'll find another sundae shop thank you!

~ happy eatings
author: Rosa C.

description:
