Always amazing shakes and sundaes. You can't go wrong here.

It can be crowded during peak tourist seasons, so try the others near Union SQ.

There is parking in that shopping area and if you're lucky, there is parking on the street. Better to take a cab, bike, or cable car.
author: JD H.

description: Banana split yum!
author: Joni W.

description: Free piece of chocolate when you enter through the gift shop.  It's super touristy, but I recommend ordering something at the shop and sitting down to eat it (after you gaze at the chocolate machine contraptions in the back first, of course).  The cashier will bring you ice cream samples if you want!  I tried the famous chocolate ice cream, which was fantastic, but I was a little choco-ed out, so I went with the espresso chip instead.  I super loved it...it was sweet and a teensy bit bitter at the same time, with tiny chocolate chips generously embedded.  My mom got the famous hot chocolate with whipped cream.  SWEET JESUS that was good stuff.  Not only did I eat my ice cream, but I finished the hot chocolate for her afterwards.  Like a cow.  A fat, satisfied cow.
author: Jess H.

description: The colossal chocolate chip cookie is to die for! One of the best cookies I've ever had! And the chocolate is obviously delicious! Also got the salted hot chocolate which came with a square of their milk chocolate. You can't go wrong here everything is pretty darn delicious!
author: Jessica G.

description: Do not bother with the hot chocolate there. It is insipid and came out tepid. Swiss Miss from the grocery store is better. Top tip for Ghiradelli: go to Burdick's in Cambridge, Mass. They'll teach you how to use that otherwise great chocolate to make drinking chocolate. Total disappointment. At least the people were nice.
author: Steve V.

description: When in the mood, the desserts are great, rich and chocolatey.  So, I end up just eating the Ghirardelli chocolate squares, and way too many for my limited calorie intake.
author: Jason G.

description:
I know this is already short enough as a haiku, but this is precious time you could be spending footing it to Ghiradelli already and eating their sundae!

But whatever:

I don't like fudge much
But damn the fat - their sundae
Can be my sweet death.
author: Jerome V.

description: I love the chocolate, the ice cream! Yum! Crissy field- Can't go wrong. Only thing is I feel the ice cream dishes are alittle pricey. But I kind of expect it in a touristy city.
author: Christina V.

description: Very crowded, service slow and customer service not the best... Tourist attraction that's not the best place for a local but ice cream and especially sundaes are yummy.
author: Olga R.

description:
Went on a really packed night and something was wrong with my order. It didn't get through to the kitchen staff so my party and I ended up waiting over an hour for a sundae and hot chocolate. Not worth the wait. 

The system for employees delivering orders appears highly inefficient. I wish there was more order to the chaos...the customers should just go pick up their desserts like how  it is at the the take out / to go bar.

When it's busy it can be competitive finding seats. More seating should be added if possible. 

Servers work hard to help customers and clear areas. That is much appreciated!
author: Jae K.

description: After wandering around the pier, we decided to come by Ghirardelli Square. We visited the store to check things out and were pleasantly greeted by employees handing out free chocolate! Bad news was when we went to order ice cream. They had so many customers that we would have to wait 45 minutes to get a simple ice cream cone. However, we had time to kill so we decided to wait...and it was quite a long wait. We got the lemon sorbet and it was pretty good but the wait may have been a bit too much...
author: Ken T.

description: Oh my oh my... chocolate overload!!! We stopped in for sundaes one night, and it was fun.  tasty treats.  bummer is that it takes awhile for them to get to you, so at least half the ice cream is melted before it shows up.  they also fill them so full, that it's impossible to eat without getting it all over the table.  still good tho, and more than enough for sharing.
author: Linnea E.

description: Cute little touristy place. Yummy sundaes, pretty views. Ghirardelli is pretty good chocolate, even for someone like me who prefers European chocolate brands. The line can get pretty long, but if you go on a weekday, it's not too hard to find a table or parking.
author: Nausheen H.

description: We had chocolate ice cream topped off with dark chocolate syrup. YUM! And a brownie sundae. Also YUM! The only problem was that by the time they brought out our sundae it was melted :/ if you're looking for a something sweet, you definitely have to check this place out!
author: Tamar T.

description:
The chocolate here is great, but the prices here are pretty high. You can often find the same chocolates at other stores much cheaper.

If you go into the Ice-cream shop for a sundae, you should pick up the free Bay City Guide found within the Square. They almost always have a $1 off coupon in that for the hot fudge sundae.

They do have some novelty items in the store that I have only seen here, but I never want to pay the high prices for a cool holder for my chocolate. I would rather use the money to buy MORE chocolate. Yum yum.
author: Steve A.

description:
I've tried a few different sundaes here. My favorite is The Domingo (banana hot fudge sundae)! My second fav is the Gold Rush Sundae because I love peanut butter, but I like The Domingo better because the banana evens out the sweetness.

I've tried the warm brownie sundae before, but from what I remember, the brownie is cold and hard since it's at the bottom of the cup surrounded by ice cream...
author: Melanie R.

description:
I avoided Ghirardelli Chocolate like the plague for years. I always had it in my head that it was too touristy...too crowded...and so it must be overrated. Besides I've had those mini chocolate squares time and time again since I live in the bay area.They always found their way to me during big holidays like Christmas and Valentine's. Nothing special.

Weather dramatically changes my mind and mood, especially beautifully sunny days in San Francisco. Ghirardelli Square and Fishermen's Wharf are full of crowds but when it's this nice out, those really are the places to be at. My sweet tooth and I finally gave in and decided to get an ice cream banana sundae to share. All I had to say was WOW and I'm so glad I was FINALLY convinced otherwise!

What really makes the difference between their sundaes and the ones you can make at home is their melted chocolate that make the hot fudge. Nothing else goes into it. There are piles of chocolate squares at the counter just waiting to be melted and poured over your cold vanilla ice cream scoops. Top that with nuts, whipped cream and a cherry. You simply can't ask for anything more. 

There's a choice between milk or dark hot fudge. I personally think dark is the way to go but I'm sure anything you choose will be satisfying and delicious. Tourists should not have all the fun. Go get yourself a little piece of heaven and indulge in the real San Francisco treat with your loved ones today!
author: Julia T.

description:
Chocolate...nuff said.

Awesome, but expensive, ice cream sundae's here. Plus an entire store of chocolate. It's a tourist trap but well worth it if you need your sweet fix.
author: Mark H.

description:
Scoop of cookies n creme: yummm

First I walked through the chocolate store for a free piece of chocolate. Free makes everything better.

I thought I should've gotten a chocolate flavored ice cream but just went with my usual favorite cookies n creme. The ice cream was surprisingly very good and creamy. Some of the best I've had in recent memory.
author: Richard S.

description:
Chocolate lovers unite! 

Who doesn't love free chocolate samples when stepping into the store? Who doesn't love chocolate?! In forms of candy, ice cream, sundaes, banana split creations... *drool.

Kind've a tourist spot -- but it's nice to get a treat and walk along Fisherman's Wharf -- visiting the vendors, street performers, soaking up Bay area weather. =) 

There's metered parking right alongside the vicinity but if you go up some neighborhood streets, free parking! & you don't have to parallel park either!
author: Kristie F.

description:
Get your chocolate fix here! My favorite ice cream/candy/sweets is chocolate. Usually, when it's a "Ghirardelli Chocolate" run, I'm always down to go even if it's crowded, which it is during the weekends. I actually went on a weekday, but because it's summer time, it's still crowded. The line was out the door, but it's NEVER a long wait. Ordering is simple, just choose what type of sweets you are craving for such as ice cream, milkshakes, or even coffee. 

I like how they offer a little water fountain in the store if people are having too much sweets in them and just need to cleanse their thirst for more sweets :)

The only thing that may have a problem is how this place can be very crowded. Overall, if you need a chocolate fixed, this place satisfies it. It's a must try if you are ever in San Francisco. YUP!
author: Nette J.

description: A little disappointed that the ice cream was served melted!
author: Chris H.

description:
Omg, diabetes, but happiness. 

You order in the front, they give you a number, you pick where you'd like to sit, and eventually, your order comes out and you stare, wondering how you would be able to finish that thing. 

My cousins and I shared a Banana Split - chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry ice cream topped with whipped cream, a cherry, and of course, bananas on the side of it. 

MM. There are plenty of tables. We sat their the chocolate production line - pretty cool! 

They also have a cute little gift shop on the side. They were sampling the caramel Ghirardelli squares. Yum, yum!
author: Tina T.

description:
I ordered the Nob Hill Chill because I wanted to have the world famous hot fudge sundae conveniently served in a cup with a straw :) It was very rich and creamy, but not overly sweet.  Hot cocoa was great for a chilly day in SF but it was a bit too sweet by itself. Try adding a shot of espresso to complement it.

Every guest was offered a free chocolate square sample. I wasn't too impressed with the sea salt caramel flavor though. The store itself was packed as always. The staffs were probably having a bad day since they were rude.
author: Karen L.

description: Deliciously rich. Gonna have to run up a few hills to work off that sundae! Very quick and friendly service. Loved being able to see the chocolate-making process. Not too pricey.
author: Elven S.

description:
THIS PLACE IS GREAT! The desserts are very good! They always give you tiny chocolate squares samples! 

I ordered a Ice Cream here, it was really sweet and normally i do not like chocolate, but ghirardelli's chocolate strawberry ice cream was delicious!
author: Sophia W.

description:
Always PACKED! But the location is amazing, the hot chocolate is always flowing and the ice-cream is great to snack on. Love coming here during the down-time hours when there are no crowds to knock you off your feet. 

p.s. - the best part is the free chocolate that they often give out in the plaza :)
author: Karina A.

description:
Whenever you're in San Francisco, this is just one of those things you have to do before leaving. We ordered 2 AMAZING sundaes, including something about a streetcar and a berry something (sorry I wasn't taking notes) Heaven! Their ice cream is great, but you know the real reason everyone goes there: for that miracle food we call chocolate.

It's definitely a good idea to come into the store from the outside and get that free sample, and of course just go with it when for whatever reason you get lucky and they ask you if you want a sample another time. (Wow we really did do pretty great on our trip with the free thing, didn't we?)There's no denying it, their chocolate is phenomenal. But at this location, it's really the experience plus the happy happy everyone around you is because of its deliciousness and the fact that many are on vacation. If I lived in SF, after a rough day if I really needed a pick-me-up I could definitely see myself coming here.They only aren't getting that fifth star because they don't really offer much in the dairy-free department.
author: Hannah D.

description: A must stop if you're in San Francisco. The most decadent and indulging hot chocolate I've had. And they distractedly gave us free samples when we walked in and again when we ordered! It made me so happy haha. Sit by and enjoy the view!
author: Genesis J.

description:
For all the years I'd been living in San Francisco, this was my first time going to the actual/original Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop - it was great!

Even though I'd been to the secondary location, which is close-by and usually has a short line, the original was always packed with tourists and annoying kids so I never went.  I recently was in the area on a Thursday night and there was almost no line so I thought this would be the perfect time to go.  

As always, the ice cream selections were great and the brownie sundae I ordered was fantastic.  Despite the heavy traffic, it's well maintained and the staff is friendly.

If you're ever in Ghirardelli Square, the trip really isn't complete without a trip to the ice cream/chocolate shop.
author: Ken G.

description: Yum!! Definitely come here for dessert! Yes, it will be packed with tourists, but the ice cream is delicious and so filling. There are lots of cute touristy chocolates too, which is fun if you need to bring back gifts for people. Also, they usually give you a chocolate sample, which is always a plus in my book. On a warm summer day, Ghiradelli's ice cream is the perfect treat!
author: Joanna C.

description: Ok.. Where to start with this hectic establishment.. Came here with my girlfriend and her family because everyone was craving a nice cup of hot chocolate. We were first to order out of the family and we got the original hot chocolate and the pumpkin latte. Her cousin ordered two drinks after us and her brother ordered three after him. We waited for a good 15 minutes for our drinks and when the worker finally called our name they handed us ONE drink with no cap.. So we were like ok? Maybe he's still making the second one and forgot the cap? So we waited and waited and they were finally putting drinks on the counter but they called them out for her brother. He skipped my drink and her cousins order and went straight to the last one? He then deleted our order off of their order screen and that was when we got frustrated.. We complained and told the worker that he hasn't given us our pumpkin latte yet and that he deleted our order without finishing it. He told us, "yeah I did, I called it out for Ricky" Ricky is her brother, and we were like "uh yeah that was for Ricky not us" and he goes "well that one was supposed to be for you" whaaat? No it wasn't.. He finally made my pumpkin latte and surprisingly enough, it didn't even taste like pumpkin! It just tasted like a regular latte.. Whatever.. Worst of all her little 11 year old cousin got a small original hot chocolate and she was complaining that it was too sweet so she didn't touch it the whole night. Her mom opened the cap to find out that the cup was basically filled with straight up melted chocolate! It was so thick and was definitely not consumable unless you like to drink straight diabetes. They forgot to mix it with milk or whatever.. don't even know how that even happens. We already left and was too far away to come back and complain.. Ughh PLEASE TRAIN YOUR WORKERS!
author: Evelyn P.

description:
We were in town playing tourist with a friend so we stopped in to get some lunch (ice cream sundaes) that we could enjoy while walking along Aquatic Park.

The line moved fast, but the sundaes weren't that great. It's all about the free sample when you walk in and the name on the door - the sundae was just mediocre, but still hit the spot :)
author: H G.

description:
Gold Rush Sundae.

AMAZING!!!!
Little expensive though.
author: Laura C.

description: The sorbet was melted by the time we got it.  The ice ream had ice chunks in it.  The bathroom is across the plaza!  They were very helpful when I said I was injured and gave me a cup of ice and a glass of water.  Although there were long lines it was very quick.  The only reason to go is for the tourist attraction of fisher mans wharf.
author: Batya G.

description: This place was crazy busy and for what... Dreyer's Ice Cream. I was so disappointed to learn that Ghirardelli's doesn't have their own ice cream. All they did was make an average sundae with way too much whip cream and put one of their mini chocolate squares on it. The prices for their chocolate is overinflated too. I would take Hershey's chocolate over this any day.
author: Trent P.

description:
Didn't try the cafe part or order any food -- only the store.

But c'mon, free samples upon entree?!  Awesome!  Lots of selection of course, but the prices are a lot cheaper if you buy their overstock compared to any other place.

Best of all...  remember to look online and print out coupons!  We got 10% off of our purchase of 50 chocolates of $25.  It's usually an either/or dealio where you can get like $1 off of sundaes too!  Location is also awesome, of course...  beautiful Ghiradelli square and next to a bayside park.

I've always wanted to take my dog to a park like that.  Too bad I don't have a dog yet.
author: Andrew L.

description:
The place is a madhouse, but the chocolate is worth it.  We stopped in twice.  The first time there was a line out the door of the cafe - a long one - and the choco-shop was elbow to elbow.  Love those free samples.  We ended upstairs for take-away, where the line was daunting but moved surprisingly quickly.  Needless to say, the pumpkin-spice hot chocolate was wonderful.  

Second visit was for ice cream: we sat outside; they deliver to the table.  Oh, and don't forget those samples :)

Ghirardelli takes up an entire block just off the beach, near a nice lush green lawn for lounging and within view of the Golden Gate bridge.  Rent a bike and reward yourself after your ride!
author: Andy W.

description: This place was amazing!! We were first standing in line at the big chocolate store but then we saw the sign that said, "don't want to stand in line?, go this way". or something like that. It's the same Ghirardelli shop just around the corner on the top of the hill, above the other one. We were served fast and got our ice cream quickly. I don't remember the exact name of the sundae we got but it was incredible! This will definitely be a stop we cannot miss every time we travel to San Fran.
author: Janell D.

description:
What can I say about ghirardelli that hasn't already been said? When I'm in a crappy mood or its been a hot day or a fantastic weekend that just needs a sweet ending ghirardelli always delivers.

Sure, its pricey, but the peanut butter chocolate sundae is to die for. Just love it.
author: laura f.

description:
Friends visiting town? Well you know what that means, we're going to Ghirardelli chocolate. It seems like one of those things that have to be done whenever you have out of town guest dropping by. 

I absolutely loved this place when I first went there, but now it's reserved only when friends are visiting. I've seen there about 10 times now, and lately i've notice there's been some inconsistancy in their sundays.  Last time we went, they filled the sunday cup half full of chocolate syrup.  Not necessarily a bad thing, but that is A LOT of chocolate. 

Whats interesting is that despite what many people have commented on, this is not the only Ghirardelli chocolate cafe in the area. There's actually a huge Ghirardelli building off 1-5 that has the same setup. I happened to drop by it when driving down to So Cal one weekend. Everything down to the menu is the same, but was missing the busy SF crowds that add to the experience. 

Do I recommend going? Absolutely, but if you're not a fan of big crowds, try going on a weekday
author: Lisa T.

description:
When you walk up to the square you'll see a small Express Ghirardelli store rammed with people. But this isn't the only one. 

Walk up into the square, and you'll see another, much larger one to the left of the fountain. Here you can order and sit down and eat, and see the machine they use to make the chocolate. There is also a bigger store area which was giving out free samples. 
But don't wait for a table here either. 

If you walk to your right, to the far end of the square, there will be another quiet dessert cafe, same as all the other ones but in a smaller scale. you can get coffees, chocolates, sundaes - probably the same as the others but with a bit less. 

We got Drinking Chocolate and for $4 it comes in a small cup, but it was more than enough. It comes with a biscotti and the dark smooth chocolate was too thick to drink, but perfect to dip. 
In hindsight, would have loved to buy strawberries from the Pier Market and buy a drinking chocolate and dip. 

We couldn't finish it all, so we lidded it and took it home. Who knew, cooled down drinking chocolate can turn into the best chocolate mousse ever!!
author: Laura C T.

description:
The hot cocoa is to-die-for. Light and velvety--it's neither too sweet nor too thick. This is my choice hot drink on a cold, foggy day.

I deducted one star because everything else on the menu is over the top--in cream, in sugar, in portion. I don't count calories, but I don't need 3,000 calories from one dessert.
author: Liz T.

description: Salty caramel hot chocolate. Enough said :-)
author: Randi B.

description:
A quick walk from Fisherman's Wharf, it has a great, clean public bathroom.  Hooray!  

And the ice cream is good too.
author: Rebecca H.

description: It's chocolate, ice cream, and well, CHOCOLATE! How can you go wrong?   This place is always packed so expect a line and a wait.  It's hard to snag a table, too, so grab one the minute you can!   Yes, this place is touristy, but every now and then we have to swing by for a fix.  Parking is not fantastic but there are metered spots on the street and a garage next door.  If you take the Powell cable car over the hill from union square you can easily walk over one block and up (UP) one block to Ghirardelli.  Some tips -  get your ice cream to go.  Or hit up the smaller locations on Market Street
author: Amy J.

description:
It was a weekend and they were busy (expected)...the employees were so busy that I don't think they were paying attention to what guests were asking, sometimes requesting things several times. I think they need to hire more people.

Had Sea Salt Hot Chocolate which was great and then swam out of the sea of people.
author: Jared L.

description:
Ghirardelli  is known for its fantastic and delicious variety of chocolate that they serve. Ghirardelli chocolate combines its delicious chocolates with ice cream that gives you a slice of heaven. 

Pros

Food: The food here is to die for. If you love chocolate or ice cream then this is the place for you. They have such a wide variety of sweet that there is something for everyone. Definitely come here to dive into a piece of chocolate heaven. 

Service: Everyone is extremely friendly and willing to help you.

Atmosphere: Eating outside of the Ghirardelli Square serene, especially during sun set with the music and people walking by. It fit so well while your eating some delicious ice cream next to the perfect backdrop. 

People: Everyone here is so nice, because it such a tourist centered place that you meet huge diverse people. 

Cons

Crowded: This place gets packed, because its a tourist location so expect long lines outside the store. But the food is well worth the wait. 

Overall this place is a great place to take a date or to come and experience a little bit of classical upscale relaxation. So come here and see for yourself! =D
author: Lucy D.

description:
Fabulous.  The sundaes are too big.  I wished they have 1/3 sizes for 1/2 the price.  It's a great place to make some great memories with your children.  We recently went to the Chocolate Festival.  Tremendous fun.  However, there are weirdoes all over SF.  We are from the 'burbs, and over there, we are more relaxed.  I had my purse with me at all times, but at one point, an off leash dog was running amok near my child.  I instinctively stood up and ran to my child leaving a chocolate treat on top of my Choco Festival brochure/ticket and my child's shoes.  I was away from my little pile on the grass for not longer than 10 seconds and someone stole the Chocolate Festival ticket/brochure.  Shame on them.  They just took the brochure, and let my choco treat drop to the grass, and left my child's shoes behind too.  I was about to call the police, who were there for the event, but mainly just chatted with one another.

I went back to the ticket booth to report the crime and hoped to get another ticket as replacement with the number of treats I have redeemed marked off.  By that time, we consumed 3 out of 15 samples.  The girl there didn't want to give me another ticket even though I identify the original volunteer who helped with my ticket purchase.  She was nice but wouldn't budge.  Neither would I.  I just said to call the police over and I will do my report on the spot...in front of everyone, then buy another ticket.  

Then, she relented and gave me another ticket with my three samples marked off.  

But overall, she was very nice, and I was honest, so all was well.  That thief almost ruined my whole day with my child!
author: Goshen F.

description:
I had their fancy hot chocolate. Hands down, the best hot chocolate I've ever had. Simply amazing. It was dark, rich, and so thick. 

That is some quality chocolate. I am going to try and recreate this hot chocolate. I wonder where I should start?

Hot chocolate that will change your life
author: Sopheak S.

description:
Although 4 stars is good, I do have to say I was a little disappointed with my visit this time. 

I raved about the chocolate chip ice cream because the dark chocolate bits are awesome. In our sundae for some reason they threw in cookie dough which kind of messed it up. 

The sundae was a bit small for the price, so I can't rate it higher. It was nice to go to the flagship store, but it didn't live up to the hype I remember the first time I tried it in Pasadena.
author: Scott A.

description:
Anytime is a good time for Ghirardelli chocolate.  How can you go wrong with a Chocolate and Peanut Butter sundae?  Answer: you can't.  My wife and I shared one of these and it was pretty orgasmic.  

We also pigged out and bought a bag of their sea-salt chocolate squares.  Don't accept imitations - this place is gooooooooood (and good for you!).  

I know the line can get a little long with everyone, but in general, we've had good, fast service
author: David S.

description: Was really excited to take my wife (who like most women is a big fan of Chocolate), couldn't wait to show her the cool way they churn the chocolate here.  Then they were having some kind of private event, and wouldn't allow me in to show her.  After pleading with the front rope person that all I wanted to do (after travelling how many hours and miles) was show my wife the chocolate machine, they let me run in and show it to her. She thought it was cool. We left with some hot chocolate and chocolate squares.  Thank you to the very kind rope person for understanding.
author: Gavin N.

description: You are in San Francisco, CA.  You are at Ghirardelli Square.  Just do it.  Indulge.  I did with the Gold Rush.  Peanut butter chocolate fudge heaven!  That's all I have to say.
author: Aiko A.

description: Amazing sundaes. Do not come here if you are on a time crunch since the wait can be 20+ minutes and tends to be standing room only. The setting is very neat and cozy. We got the brownie sundae in a waffle bowl. Get the waffle bowl. Eat the waffle bowl. Love the waffle bowl. Order another separate waffle bowl.
author: Clint H.

description: Just passing through as a tourist, which seemed to heavily dominate this area, but who could resist Ghirardelli on Ghirardelli square.  Nice yelp perk of a buck or two off with check in.  Plus lots of good people watching in the area.
author: Joel B.

description: Yummmmmm Salted Caramel hot chocolate.  I absolutely love how perfect the combination was, and the ample amount of seating there was for guests wanting to enjoy their drink with friends.  I also love how fast the service was.  We placed our orders and I left to go to the bathroom for a quick minute and returned with my drink.  Great experience, definitely would recommend to friends.
author: Chelsea G.

description:
It's a San Fran institution and anything that's cold with chocolate on a hot day sounds good to me!

This is our second trip here and it's stayed the same since we were last here 6 years ago.  There's always a lineup outside the door for the sundaes and the selection has expanded since we were here last.

We split the Gold Rush, a nice and unique concoction of whipped cream, peanut butter, fudge sauce, vanilla ice cream with a PB square to top it off... yum!  Great for sharing - the sundaes are creative and it's worth a stop.

The chocolate shop is beautifully presented but I must admit that I buy my souvenirs elsewhere.  I was in sticker shock at the markup on their brownie mix here - seriously, go to Costco and get the jumbo pack.  You won't regret it after stuffing yourself with 6 batches of brownies instead of one with a souvenir tin from here!

The chocolate is decent but touristy, and I tend to like the more unique handmade ones, so it's a 4* for me.
author: Katie F.

description:
Wow, just wow. This place exceeded all expectations. Granted, I had no idea I was going here so there was 0% hype beforehand unlike alot of the other reviews. 

My friend had the Very Berry Sundae (8.95) and I had the Decadent Drinking Chocolate w/ Biscotti (4.95). The sundae was big enough for two and the fruits were fresh. Waffle roll was a perfect touch. The Chocolate drink,....whoa. I really should have known what I was getting into w/ a name like that. It was pure melted chocolate. Literally the richest chocolate I've ever tasted.
author: Roland B.

description:
If you're doing the tourist thing or just walking around the Pier/Fisherman's Wharf area, you may as well stop in for either some ice cream on a hot day or some hot chocolate on a cold day.

Personally I don't see anything so special about this place.  Everything is super rich (I'm not surprised, I'm just saying..) but I always end up nibbling on or sipping from someone else's glass.

It's a nice stop over but not something I'd make a special trip for.  

On the plus side it's close to a lot of things, including the cable car stop that will take you all the way across town to Union Square.
author: Robert K.

description: Hair in my Gold Rush sundae. Yuck. Complained to a girl behind the soda bar; was told: "That's not a hair, it's the cherry stem." No, not the cherry stem (still attached to the cherry), the black hair embedded in the ice cream. She offered to make another one, but somehow another sundae doesn't sound very good after you've eaten half a sundae with a hair in it. $10 a sundae...get a little quality control.
author: Benjamin M.

description: This place is awesome! I was in San Francisco for vacation and of course I had to stop into The Original Ghiradelli store. My family and I walked into the ice cream shop in the evening and we ordered and shared a chocolate sundae, caramel sundae and the hot chocolate with carmel and sea salt. All the goodies were super delicous, the ice cream shop was packed, even in the evening. My chocolate sundae was about $9, a little steep for a sundae but it was well worth it. Also, if youre in the area many hotels and vendors give coupons to get 10% off here, find a coupon!
author: Raquel R.

description: I am a ice cream lover, and a chocolate fean...but for claiming the "best ice cream sundae"...I don't get it. We had some just last week here with a family member out of town and it's nothing to brag about. Have had way better at birite or tin pot!
author: Mansi P.

description: Cool store because it has so much history. We were craving something bold and sweet so decided on their banana split. The picture on their menu resembled something rich and huge and decadent but once the dessert arrived, it resembled a banana split from Dairy Queen, with double the whipped cream. In other words, pretty puny. There a scoop of chocolate, vanilla and strawberry ice cream. Of course, the chocolate was the tastiest, with a nice creamy texture. But for $10 and change I expected more.
author: Samuel K.

description:
As a lifelong Girardelli fan, this place was somewhat of a disappointment.  Yes they have displays and displays of chocolates they are trying to sell to you.  However, the ice-cream "dishes" offered took very long to receive and were not very tasty.  It was like they had random very sugary ice-cream drizzled with random globs of hot chocolate, etc.  Could've had much better at many other places for far less money.

Oh, and I agree with others, this is a MAJOR tourist trap.  Skip.
author: Nicole K.

description: I had to pay this place a visit while I was in San Francisco.  Normally,  I would go to the one I'm Disney's California adventure or the one in hollywood... but since this is the original one. It was a must. This place was kind of busy for a weekday, but it was summer. The upper seating section was closed off, but there were a few empty tables on the main floor. The line was not too ling, and my sister and I ordered rather quickly.  As it was cold, we opted for hot drinks with a warm brownie and chocolate covered strawberries.  The drinks were really good and I enjoyed them. The attached gift shop was convenient as I wanted to buy some souvenirs. The line for that was long but moved quickly.  I did not get my free chocolate sample as I entered from the dine on entrance vs the gift shop entrance, but that's OK (I don't need the calories). It was a nice tourist spot to hit and I only wish it hadn't been too cold to enjoy a sundae.
author: Nikki V.

description: This is the best ice cream place especially for chocolate lovers.
author: Nilay S.

description:
Oh, Ghirardelli, your chocolate makes my heart sing!  (And hopefully not clamp shut due to excess fat build-up over time.  But what the hey.  I'm still young)

My brother had never been to Ghirardelli before, so we braved the lines and touristy craziness to buy a waffle cone sundae.  We sat and ate it in the cute sundae shop before braving a long, hard walk uphill towards Lombard Street.  I'm glad we got all the sugar we needed from the sundae before marching up at what was clearly a 70 degree angle, I tell you wut.  Okay, maybe my math is off...

The best part of the sundae is, of course, the chocolate fudge.  Un-bee-leeve-able.  I wanted to stick my head under the spigot behind the counter and lap it up, but I think they frown on that sort of thing.

Don't miss this during your visit to San Fran!
author: Christine G.

description: Walk up to the fountain of mermaids in the square. Go to the original building and get in line. There was a line that moved Oh So FAST, Our tip of the day, we found out by mistake Is to take it to go. We found a table and decided to eat in.  I told them of the change to eat in at take out. The next thing I know ishe hands me the order and we're eating delicious salted Carmel Sunday in a waffle cone whiile everyone else is waiting.
author: Meni H.

description: this is not a place where you will find high quality, nutritious, cacao drinks, but if you are in the mood for sugary processed tasty hot chocolate with a twist: this will be your spot! they are definitely overpriced. But hey! don't leave SF without trying it, it's a cool touristy atmosphere in and around here : )
author: Giselle C.

description: It's a cute place. However, the dessert we ordered was very disappointing. We ordered the WARM brownie sundae. It wasn't even warm! It was cold! The ice cream was already melting by the time it got to our table. It was more like a cold brownie melted sundae. Disappointing.
author: Nari L.

description:
The ultimate San Francisco (and San Leandro) treat!

I love coming here for sundae's or white mochas.  Ghirardelli makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside!  I don't care if it's touristy, Ghirardelli will always have a place in my heart.

For chocolate gifts though, I hit up the Factory Store in San Leandro.  It's way closer to home and a bit cheaper!
author: Earlene C.

description:
I found my love at Ghiradelli Square in San Francisco. It is the Dark Chocolate with Strawberry Filling. Let me tell you...I had my 7th piece of chocolate today...and it's outta control. The strawberry filling is not too sweet (which is great) and has strawberry seeds with it. The dark chocolate is not bitter and not sweet..I'd say it's about 70%-75% cocoa. Very delightful. Just thinking about it makes me want to have another piece. 10 out of 10!!

I came here last week to have the Hot Fudge Sundae Waffle bowl but it was a little too much...thank goodness I told them no whipped cream. The waffle bowl was a little hard and stale so I have to take away a point for that. 

Tried the Strawberry Ice Cream Soda Float...soda was flat. Nothing spectacular. Would not try this again.

I also had the Sea Salt Caramel Hot Chocolate which almost every Yelper who had gone to the Square recommend. However, I found that it was just any regular hot chocolate...it was quite salt and it was really difficult to taste the Sea Salt. Don't get me wrong, it's still good but I wouldn't be able to taste the difference between a Starbucks' hot chocolate (except it would be a tad sweeter) or the Square's hot chocolate. That's my 2 cents.
author: Polly C.

description:
The chocolate tastes pretty good - but as Jason T noted it certainly isn't as high end as the options at Recchiuti or Sharffen Berger in that much of it contains high fructose corn syrup and hydrogenated oils.  No one expects chocolate to be "health food," but honestly there is no reason for anything to contain these ingredients when stunning items can be made without their inclusion.

Long lines, super touristy, and high prices for something you can get at almost any mall in the United States.  Go to see the Square.....avoid the Chocolate Squares.
author: Michael U.

description: It's a tourist trap. I went this last time to take my Dad but it's not that great. I have been here about 3 times. There are better ice cream shops in the city with WAY better ice cream and service and cheaper. But if you have someone who has to go by all means go just prepare to spend a lot and be underwhelmed.
author: Eric T.

description:
People say that there is a line here...I have never encountered a line here...not too long anyways.  I dunno...maybe I am just lucky?

Sundaes are huge and very tasty.  Root beer float rocks...but hey...I can make my own by going to Safeway.

All-in-all...good place to take a date for some good ice cream!
author: Patrick C.

description: don't really like their ice-cream. Way toooo sweet
author: Wenli Z.

description:
A must for a SF trip.  These chocolates make great gifts and of course, we had to each have our own sundae.  This is a great kid friendly place. 
Would highly recommend!
author: Toshi I.

description:
First off, let me say that I love hot fudge sundays. I had been to Ghirardelli's in S.F. years, I'm talking years ago....man have things changed.
We went there for a special occasion this past weekend.  

It used to be normal, you went in got seated and then ordered.  I guess that was to BORING for S.F.
Now it has turned into a banana sunday free for all.  

When you arrive, you are forced to decide in about 2 seconds what you want, give your order to a bored cashier and then after being handed a number you are tossed into a sea of "diners" who are hunkered down to their table  waiting for their hovering brethren to grab their table at the least indication that they are finished.

I could NOT believe that the very cool experience I had as a kid had been reduced to this free for all. It was not a pleasant experience to say the least.  It is obvious that they could care less about the frenetic atmosphere that they are creating.

I would suggest a couple of alternatives.... get your order to go and kick it outside. Number two is..........there is a shop (next to lola shop)  that serves that same menu in a much more relaxed atmosphere,  You can sit in there or take it outside.  

Much better.
author: colleen r.

description: We've been here so many times because the kids love it.  We always manage to find something to purchase and take home with us in addition to getting ice creams and shakes.  However, the service can be spotty.  Friday (black friday after thanksgiving) night they lost our order, twice.  Granted it was very busy, but come on, lost the order twice.  It took over 2 hours.  If it takes too long to get your order, please go up and check.
author: t d.

description:
This is one of the upstate places where its worth only if you are trying to impress your girlfriend. 
Food- icecreams are not out of the world but try out sugar free options.
Location- hard to find parking.understandable.
Servicing- go before 7.30 or face with long queues.but the waiters tske orders with smile.
Price- way too high.
author: Pawankumar H.

description:
Delishous and fabulous! Free chocolate! Get yourself a chocolate ice cream, its rich, creamy (ok, cold stone creamery beats it in my opinion because you can add sauces and brownies, etc) but for a once in alife time trip to san fran, you gotta have it. I had mine ina lovely huge old fashioned glass. Had a nice few free samples of the caramel squares too!! excellent!!
Ps: free street parking just a block away for 2 hours :)
author: Rachael S.

description: I come for the free piece of chocolate, the place is always jammed with tourists and a line to show for it, the prices of their chocolates you'd think would be competitive with local retailers not so. If you want to pay higher than usual prices for their chocolate then this is the place! They do have a very large selection of there confections but no tour of the factory as one might expect when visiting for the first time. But hey you can always change cloths with your friends and go back thru  the line for another piece of yummy free chocolate before they catch on!
author: Drew F.

description: Absolutely great place to indulge in ice cream and chocolate. Great touristy destination as well!
author: Carmen T.

description:
I came here late night, it was one of our last stops on my trip with my boyfriend in San Fransisco. 

DON'T get the "Decadent Drinking Chocolate with Biscotti" unless you REALLY REALLY like chocolate because it's exactly what it says... it's you, DRINKING a melted chocolate bar. Super thick, super sweet, I thought I was a chocolate lover, but I couldn't man up to this one. It was still a fun drink though, so if you're in a group, get this one to share, not as your main drink.

My boyfriend's "Sea Salt Caramel Hot Chocolate" was AMAZING.

They also have ice creams and a cute seating area where you can watch chocolate turn in a giant mixer. The little gift shop has almost everything you could've ordered to take home, I got my mom a can of the cocoa powder.

There's no bathroom btw, you'll have to walk across the square to use the general shopping center one.
author: Nicole M.

description:
YUM YUM YUM

Yummy chocolate of course!

A somewhat pretty nice night on Sunday, I went here w/ a friend for a sundae after the fireworks for GG 75th anni. Was totally worth the $9!

I got the brownie sundae. A lot of ice cream and yummy fudge. I couldn't finish it! I was pretty darn close to. I wish I had know about the one scoop sundae before ordering. Pretty sure you can split one of the regular sundaes.

Anyways, it completely hits the spot. Just enough richness in the ice cream, but not overpowering. Huge variety of chocolate sales there too. Too tempting to buy something else.

Nice fire pit and seating areas outside. Enjoy the chocolate!
author: Sophie C.

description: Oh man the cookie ice cream sundae is the ultimate chocolate overkill. I have never had so much chocolate in my mouth at one time. I felt like I was drowning in the thick chocolate syrup. I should have made more of an effort to switch back and forth between scoops of ice cream and scoops of the cookie smothered in chocolate. Good thing I was able to wash most of it down with water. Chocolate overload=mega food coma.
author: Kim l.

description: Christina was perhaps the worst server I have encountered.  After standing and waiting for a table for about twenty minutes in the overpacked manufactory she was irritated when she brought our food and we hadn't found a table yet.  She rolled her eyes, tried to force us outside and I think she authentically thought it was actually our fault that they allow three times as many customers in than there are ready tables for.  The worst!  But the ice cream was good and so was the couple that witnessed the whole encounter and ended their date early so we could have their table.
author: David D.

description:
I often come here when I'm in the area of Fisherman's Wharf (which usually means I've got someone from out of town visiting), and it's definitely geared well towards tourists. However, be warned that this means that Ghirardelli's regularly has a throng of people (and not all tourists!) waiting in line for tasty treats.

It's good chocolate, and there's often a free sample being given out (on the weekends, at least), but I'm starting to feel that it isn't always worth braving the crowd for (or worth the price, because it is a little on the pricey side). I usually only want a little ice cream, and I'm mostly there for the dark chocolate fudge, but lately I've noticed a lower fudge to ice cream ratio (my last scoop that I bought here had a sad amount of the coveted fudge). Also, I find that my visitors often seem to be more impressed by Kara's Cupcakes nearby. 

I would suggest that if you or someone you have with you appreciates dark chocolate, head for TCHO.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Went in 45 mins before the place was going to close. He was very friendly, and was able to repair my phone in under 30 minutes.  

Complimentary snacks and candies available if you decide to sit and wait. I also picked up a very nice looking case after my screen was fixed. 

89 dollars for a perfect screen and a new case!  Not bad at all. He even gave me a five dollar discount out of sympathy because I was on crutches.
author: Cordelia P.

description:
Wow, been to the Big G more times than I can count and quality wise, they can't be beat. Their sundaes including the giant earthquake sundae which we have ordered frequently are super delicious.

I'm going with four stars because due to the crowds finding a seat is always a major challenge. Also, they have gotten a bit pricey over the years. But this will not stop me from returning the next time I am up in the city.
author: Joel G.

description:
Eh, it's chocolate and it's ice cream. It's not earth-shatteringly good to the point where I needed a change of undies.

Truth be told, it's actually kind of disappointing in a way. By the time they put hot fudge all over the sundae and deliver it to you, it's half ice cream and half soup. Not that I'm complaining about chocolate soup, mind you, I just wasn't totally impressed with what I'd ordered compared to what I've had elsewhere at lesser-known ice cream joints.

On a busy weekend night, it was pretty easy to find a seat. The line did stretch out the door, but the wait time was only five or ten minutes, tops.

I think I enjoyed the sample chocolate by the door of the gift shop more than the ice cream, really. Alas, when in Rome...
author: Tim Y.

description:
If you need a chocolate fix, this is the place to go. I shared a Cookie Bottom Sundae with my friend and it was perfect. The feeling of the warm cookie and the cold ice cream in your mouth is just amazing. Don't forget the delicious chocolate fudge!

It's very messy though, because the fill the sundae up to the brim of the glass. There was chocolate and ice cream dripping all over the place, so watch out.
author: Lauren Y.

description: This was actually a pleasant experience.  Their chocolate is extremely rich and the shake I had was amazing.  My 2 year old son didn't want to let go of his chocolate ice cream.  I realize that doesn't sound odd, but you had to see him memorized by the taste, he walked outside into the wind, no jacket on and kept on eating it all the way to the car.
author: James A.

description: I had the Brownie Sundae! The brownie was delicious but the ice cream not so much. Before you order, do a check-in on yelp and get $1 off any ice-cream or 10% any chocolate purchase.
author: Bianca P.

description: Not as good as the one in SF, but it'll do. Especially when you get a free one from a kid who's allergic to nuts =P
author: Josh T.

description: Can't beat their banana splits. Wait was a bit long to get our order but it was worth getting my sweet tooth craving satisfied.
author: Kevin C.

description: If you love chocolate then this is a the place to be. Their chilled coco drink was off the chain. My daughter had their sea salt caramel hot chocolate that was delicious. So many chocolate gifts to buy for family and friends. It is a must see in San Francisco.
author: Reisha B.

description: This place is crazy expensive. I paid $12 for the sea salted caramel sundae. It was more chocolate than caramel. I've had a better sundae at Baskin Robbins. This place is definitely more of a tourist trap than a good ice cream shop.
author: Tara T.

description: I had an original sundae and it was great!!! but it was smaller than I thought and it's a bit pricey for the portion.
author: Topanga S.

description:
I dont like it when its packed with tourists... then I'd have to wait... but the wait is worth it!!!! 
I got this coupon from this nice girl in this sundae outfit about a block away... I decided Id go check it out. Hesitant to pay the price, the price was later worth it. I enjoyed my sundae in the odd heat wave in San Francisco at the Cable Car turnaround later on.
author: Peter R.

description: Last night at the Ghirardelli. Warm brownie sundae is delicious with expresso chip and almond on top. Service was not so great but I wouldn't blame them because it was so packed last night.
author: ANJ A.

description: Tasty chocolate but nothing special. Worth a visit if you are a chocoladdict, but the prices are very unreasonable.
author: Catherine S.

description: Once upon a time I would have given this place 6 stars. However, it's lost its magic for me. Yes, you'll get a great sundae, but it's no longer a place I long to visit.
author: Michael S.

description:
I went for a walk in the City...

I had to get my fix of Hot Caramel Sea Salt Hot Chocolate comes with a chocolate square...it was Christmas in a drink...sweet and salt contrasts every sip, be sure to stir to get the right balance of flavors.

I walked out with some large chocolate covered strawberries ($3 each) and a very rich large brownie - so dark, fudgy, chewy it was perfect for my walk back to fisherman's wharf...

Love the late night hours - open til 12AM Fri/Sat and 11 on weekdays...
author: Trishia P.

description:
So this place is EXTREMELY touristy but the icecream treats are great.  Quite spendy but the caramel and hot fudge are the best.  I was a little annoyed that they post they open at 9am cause we had to get in and out before leaving town that day so this was one of our last spots before leaving and the icecream part of the place doesn't open until 10am.  Obviously most people don't eat icecream for breakfast  but I was annoyed that they didn't specify that online.

Another touristy note is that the chocolate here is quite spendy.  You can buy the same stuff at a lot of gift shops by the pier for a few bucks less.  The only thing I would actually purchase there is an odd flavor of chocolate or holiday versions of things.  

A neat thing is in the back they have a quick little spot to see how the chocolate is made.  I thought they would have more info on this but it was still a nice thing to see.  Employees were friendly too.
author: Jen D.

description: Heaven in my mouth! I got the classic sundae and it was simply the most delicious dessert I have had in a long time! The dark chocolate syrup was my favorite! I wish I lived closer so I could come weekly!
author: Kay Y.

description: I love the desserts at this place, except when you've waited in line for a long time, paid a lot for a sundae ($14) and then served it without whipped cream or cherry and told (our whipped cream machine is broken, sorry), with no discount or other accommodation.
author: B R.

description:
The Up - This is the best hot chocolate that you can ever hope to have. That may not sound like something special, but it really is.

The Down - The only down for me is that there's nothing else about Ghirardelli that's especially more special that any other gourmet chocolate shop that I've visited. I kind of wanted more because of the name.
author: Nailah M.

description: Cute little ice cream shop with a pretty good size menu of assorted desserts. I ordered the world famous which was two scoops of vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream and a cherry. The quality of the ingredients and the location explain the $8.95 price. I feel like if you visit SF you have to stop by Ghirardelli Square, get you some good dessert with friendly service.
author: Missy A.

description: Good chocolate, good ice cream, and lots of tourists.  Prices are a bit high but worth the visit.
author: Rodd R.

description:
Mmm....Ghiradelli Hot Fudge! I am so there. 

After a show my Man and I decided to make a late night stop for our sweet tooth fix. We didn't have time for dessert at dinner so we were majorly craving something delicious. 

I ordered the single scoop hot fudge sundae with cookies and cream ice cream. It was the perfect size and was absolutely delicious. Great creamery a San Francisco Must!
author: Caro S.

description: I reviewed this place at the other listing: http://www.yelp.com/biz/ghirardelli-san-francisco#hrid:VPo5mSJ5s9jyhBrBCZjh_A
author: Corey Tess T.

description:
Took the boyfriend here this past weekend because he has never been. We were eating at Off the Grid in Fort Mason, but were craving some dessert. I automatically thought of Ghirardelli, since it's always been one of my favorite spots to go to in the city - the area is beautiful and has such a rich history behind it.

We fortunately came at a time before the dinner rush and ordered a Cookie Bottom Sundae ($8.95), which is a cookie topped with two scoops of vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, nuts, and a cherry. I asked the lady to knock off the nuts, and she asked us if it was "preference or allergy". This kind of surprised us, and i didn't really see the point in that, but we answered her and found a seat. When the sundae came, the nuts were still on top, but fortunately it was pretty easy to scoop them all off. The ice cream was delicious, and the cookie and hot fudge were to die for. The taste contrast between hot and cold (hot fudge, hot cookie, cold ice cream) was soooo goood.

The atmosphere is pretty nice, the colors and decor remind me of a classic 50s style place to eat. There's an upstairs area too with another chocolate shop. The only bad thing is that there's no bathroom inside, so in order to do your business, you have to walk out and across the plaza to a public restroom. Which is not too shabby, but for lazy people like me it can be a trek.

I've been here a good amount of times, but I never noticed that there was a little display in the way back of the dining area where they describe the chocolate making process. It's a display with real machines from the original factory, as well as just vats of liquid chocolate. Just looking at this display made my mouth water, so make sure that you stop by the back and check it out while you're there!
author: Caitlin C.

description: Best hot fudge in the world.  Always have to make a trip when in SF even if it is close to dinner time!
author: BJ K.

description:
The actual menu is great: Sundaes, Hot Chocolates, etc. are all very delicious BUT if you have no tolerance for people: who bump into you because they have no concept of spacial boundaries, who sneeze with out covering their mouth because they have no sense of social norms or who cut you in a line, a very long line, then you really shouldn't commit to dining here.  Also, the restaurant always smells like wet mop and quite honestly, I am not a fan of that.

I am am fan, however, of everything I have eaten here.  I have a very big sweet tooth that Ghirardelli Sundaes always satisfies.  My personal favorite is the fact that they load you up on so much ice cream and hot fudge that it always inevitably oozes out and leaves you hunting down napkins.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Their ice cream sundaes and chocolates are awesome and I would have given them 5 stars if I was just rating their products.

The reason for the 2 stars is because the customer service is bad, to put it mildly. I understand that this place is a tourist attraction but it seems like they always forget my order every time I come here.

Today I waited over 40 minutes for an ice cream sundae and had to talk to management twice to actually get the sundae. They tried to make up for that by validating my parking, which was nice of them. They only validate parking if you spend at least $20 and I did not do that today.

In the future, I'll probably just get my ice cream sundae to go and avoid this whole mess.
author: Rovie A.

description: I love ghirardelli, it is an amazing brand and the chocolates are perfect.  The store here in San Francisco is great the staff is kind and helpful.  The ice cream and desserts part of the store is well kept however the line is long and they should have opened up another register.  I would recommend this place to everyone if you're in town come on down this place is great!
author: Talia R.

description: Ridiculously over priced ice cream that is adequate at best. Cones are not crisp and obviously old. Would not recommend.
author: Hannah B.

description: Super fun for the kids!  Sugar overload for everyone!! Great to just check out but kids will never left you leave with out desert!
author: R C.

description: I was there last night , Thursday , 10/8..This is the best, a for sure stop while in SF, the only reason I gave it a 4 and not 5, the table waitress , Michelle, seemed very rude with a very sour attitude. THat was the only bad encounter.
author: G M.

description:
The last time I was in San Francisco, it was for a high school debate trip. I went on one of these each of the years I was in high school. The first year, I established a bit of a tradition upon arriving in the wharf area: I would go to the Ghirardelli shop for a deep, rich chocolate shake, then go upstairs to the Boudin shop and get a bay shrimp sandwich. That combination, despite many lovely meals in SF, came to sum up what I figured the city should taste like.

Sadly, both the Boudin shop at Ghirardelli Square and the sandwich are gone. We stopped by several of the Boudin Cafes - now ubiquitous in the city - and ended up eating at none of them. I guess the lack of my favorite dish soured me.

But, I couldn't pass up the shake.

Since my time in high school, I've become much more selective about the chocolate I eat. This is due mostly to the excellent chocolate tasting class taught by Matt Caputo at Tony Caputo's Market and Deli as well as a lot of tasting and reading of my own. I expected going in, therefore, that the weight of my current snobbery would overcome any fondness from my formative years. Wrong.

Is the chocolate flavor a one-note samba? Yes. It didn't matter. The thick, rich shake reminded me of all of the reasons that I prefer dark chocolate to other kinds. We shared the shake, but even as stuffed as I was, I could have eaten a second on my own happily.
author: Ryan C.

description: Poor, no where near the standard of Stockton Street. The plastic containers made it feel cheap, most of it was air and its the same price as the upper class glass ones.
author: John P.

description: If you come on a weekday it's nice and not as packed. The sweet smell is so tempting and delicious. The service is decent. But especially it's clean. Very clean and family friendly.
author: SmOoOoteensie L.

description:
It was a cold January day and my out of town friends wanted some ice cream from Ghiradelli Square.  We walk way into the back store to avoid the big lines at the front location.  

They were out of waffle cones and bananas, which meant with the absence of the latter, one of their signature dishes was off the menu.  They had a special for something that involved peppermint ice cream.  I don't remember what the drink was called because all I ended up with my peppermint ice cream anyway.  (Yum yum!)  I got my order immediately, as in the guy (Patrick) ringing me up decided to get my ice cream for me!  He also asked if I wanted ice in my cup of water.  (I found that rather nice for some odd reason, especially because the water was coming from the tap.  Anyway...)  

I went and grabbed a table while my other friends waited for their order.  All the sundaes and drinks took awhile, but my other friend still had to wait for her order despite she ordering before me and only getting ice cream as well.

Sidenote:  Check out your receipt.  There's a 15% off coupon right on there, so I turned around and gave it to my friend behind me so he could take advantage of it.  

And how can you not love it when they give you a free square of chocolate just for walking in?
author: Teri C.

description:
Earthquake Ice Cream Sundae!

Be prepared to eat 8 scopes of ice cream, 8 toppings, four syrups, whipcream, and cherries!  I brought a team of my visitors to Ghirardelli Square and feed them this.  It's a very impressive presentation and you will definitely have food coma after this sundae:)
Enjoy!
author: Ying F.

description:
Haha HELLO TOURIST TRAP. Honestly, people who grew up here don't go here for ice cream. Duh that's what Mitchells, Birite, Polly Anne's, Joe's, and basically any other ice creamery other than G Chocolate is for. BUT if you're giving a friend the grand Tourist Trip of sf, this understandably is on your list. Don't get me wrong, the ice cream and hot cocoas are not bad, and it's nice that although there is usually a long line, the wait has never been too bad for me. They have PLENTY of seating to go around (2 floors) and the service is efficient. And the Earthquake (a gargantuan 20-scoops of ice cream mess you can share with a large group of friends/small group of fatasses like me) is pretty damn fun/cool. 

2 stars for locals
3 for tourists
author: Diane G.

description: No visit to San Francisco is complete without a Hot Fudge Sunday at Ghirardelli Square! Last night was no exception to the rule!
author: Mark O.

description:
Took my wonderful kids here after a fun, warm, swim and play at Aquatic Park (ahhh which I'm yet to review).

Walking in we were given free samples...and you see candy all over.

And of course who am I to say no to whatever they like.  I got them strawberry ice cream cone, banana split and a root beer float - good times!  Yeah, and guess who eats the left overs - ME!

I did get myself the decadent hot chocolate with a biscotti - delish!

Simply love it when we make a regular weekday feels like a weekend.
author: Pam S.

description: The Ghiradelli ice cream was a bit too sweet for my taste but this should be a place to visit if you're in the Bay area since it's advertised everywhere.
author: Olivia S.

description:
Two words: Tooo touristy! 

It was so crowded that the line to the cashier meshed together like a giant mosh pit! We couldn't find ANYWHERE to sit. And seriously, good luck finding a place to stand without being in someone's way!! Thus, I definitely recommend AGAINST coming here if you're looking for a place to grab a relaxing cup of coffee or sit down for some ice cream with friends. It's so loud that you wouldn't be able to carry a conversation at a reasonable decibel. Venue: 2/5

However, IF you're a tourist, you should at least come and explore. They have a cute little display showing how chocolate is made. AND I DEFINITELY recommend their Caramel Latte! I almost NEVER drink coffee, and I never developed a liking for it. It was my brother who got the Caramel latte, but it tasted so good that I practically stole the drink from him. I felt as if I was ingesting only the aroma of coffee without all the bitterness. With every gulp, you MUST sip in a bit of that caramel whipped cream to get a perfect blend of that creamy, caramel, coffee goodness. Caramel latte: 5/5!

The sea salt hot chocolate is pretty good too! However, it's quite sweet, so getting a small size might be a good idea. And DO NOT, I repeat, do NOT drinking the bottom. Once you hit the bottom of the drink, all you have left is a bit of hot chocolate saturated with sea salt. Gross... Sea salt hot chocolate: 3.5/5.

Lastly, the ice cream isn't bad either. But then again, it isn't amazing. The banana split is too sweet. I think they were trying too hard to incorporate chocolate- their specialty, into the ice cream that they overcompensated. Banana split: 3/5.
author: Rose W.

description:
This place satiates any and all of my chocolaty desires in the form of a sundae. A ton of people have reviewed this place and for a good reason, it's in the heart of touristy San Francisco and is one of the ultimate to do's while there. 

We came here after hitting up the 49ers pre-season game against the packers (49ers won... yay!... cheerleader was taken down by a cameraman's camera cable... haha). We must have had the perfect timing because normally there is a line out the door and around the corner on a Saturday night, but instead there were many empty tables. 

Our service was fast, our sundae's were scrumptious (I always have the Domingo, it's a classic hot fudge sundae but with bananas in it) and the cafe latte was the perfect drink to keep things from getting too sweet. 

On our way out the door there was a monster line forming at the counter (ah there's the line that I know and don't love), so as it turns out we really did just happen upon the place at the ideal moment.
author: Kristen M.

description:
The first time I ate at this Ghirardelli in SF,it was raining cats and dogs outside.I had their butterscotch sundae which was like 60,000 calories but I was like "oh what the heck,at least I'll die happy eating this sundae" lol

The earthquake is NOT for me at all.I mean it's delicious no doubt but it's kinda gross swapping spits.You can also shop for chocolate here at their original Ghirardelli store which is a plus.A lot of families come here to eat ice cream and just to have a nice quality time.Kids love this place and I felt like a kid all over again.

Everytime I come to SF,this is the place I gotta eat at. It makes that 6 hours or so drive from LA so worth it.I think it's also the weather that makes the ice cream taste so good.I mean who doesn't like eating a sundae drenched in that cold SF rain,right?
author: Alex T.

description: So I came here because I was in the area craving for some dessert and I tried the Berry Sundae and Peanut butter sundae! Yumm... I prefer the berry sundae. So good! I rather come here when its less busy  because its more chill and service is better.  When it was busy the second time I came around, there wasn't enough places for people to sit and enjoy their ice cream or whatever they ordered and this was around the lunch time.  It is definitely a nice place to go to with friends to socialize than starbucks in the evening.
author: Sharjah M.

description: When you can find a spot even amidst huge crowds, and when just half a sundae fills you up for dinner after a long day out, you can't help but love sinful Ghirardelli and give it a thumbs-up on Yelp! The yummy smells and the live chocolate vat just adds to the whole experience. Go chocolate!
author: Akshata R.

description:
F**k my life right now. 

Two adults.

One Warm Brownie Hot Fudge Sundae.

One small white chocolate mocha.

One Chocolate cone and one Strawberry Cheesecake cone. 

No Sunday dinner for me. Actually, no food for the next week!
author: Lily M.

description:
Went through the chaos to get a free square of their peppermint bark yum... it was just the right amount of sweet... tons of stuff on sale.. 30 cents a square 80 squares.. could be worse. Decided not to buy stuff-- the cafe line was out the door. eep.. 

My favorite memory is getting two of those huge bowls for about thirty of my high school students.. pie tins were all gone and one of our students got a dunking in the left overs...
author: Vicky T.

description: Wonderful atmosphere, and shakes are to die for. Have fun walking up that hill to get there, but that's San Francisco!  A must see on any trip to SF.
author: Aaron C.

description:
When I want a really good hot fudge sundae I come here.
There's just some about hot fudge made with Ghirardelli chocolate that makes it's worth going out to this tourist spot.  But as far as tourist spots go, this one isn't too bad.  It's not overly crowded and parking isn't too difficult.
There's also something about eating a sundae here that brings back many fond memories.  Also when you see others enjoying their sundaes as much as you're enjoying yours, you know you've found an asylum for sundae-aholics.
Lastly, the Buena Vista Cafe isn't too far away for a nice cap: their famous Irish coffee.
author: Dan B.

description: Disappointing.  We waited 5 minutes to put in our order (3 hot chocolates) and another 15 to get them.  They were lukewarm at best.  Although they were of decent quality (let's say 8 out of 10), when I go to a place known for chocolate, I expect a 12 out of 10.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but I was not at all impressed.
author: DeAnna P.

description: I have always been a huge fan of this place.  Tonight I have to deduct 2 stars because management closed the upper section of seating...on a Saturday night at 7:30pm.  That meant we were all crowded standing around people's tables waiting like vultures for a place to sit.  I asked for the manager and asked for it to be opened...but he never came to speak with me.  I don't want to pay $35 for sundaes only to be told I cannot sit when there are plenty of tables upstairs that could be used.
author: Andrew N.

description: Super fun! Everything is super delish. We got a caramel hot chocolate, and a warm brownie sundae which is absolutely to die for! If you're visiting SF, this is a must stop!
author: Melissa R.

description: We came here in the evening after touring around the city and walking around in the cool air we wanted to warm up with some hot chocolate. They hand out chocolate samples at the door, so I was already happy customer, tonight it was a truffle chocolate, which was delicious. We had hot chocolate which was excellent, tea, coffee, which wasn't hot, but they re-made it, we also had the passion fudge sundae which was super. It was a layer of fudge on the bottom, a layer of sweet strawberries in the middle, then another layer of yummy fudge, the topped with fresh whip cream and a large chocolate dipped strawberry on top! Best sundae I've had in a long time!! The fudge is to die for ;-)
author: Shirley C.

description: Amazing, a must do while in San Francisco! I've cream is delicious, an we actually came back to have some coffee.
author: Eddie L.

description: The only reason for the three stars is for the ice cream. I had looked forward to visiting throughout my entire trip just to be disappointed.  The usually wait time to receive your order is 15 -20 minutes.  Mine was 55 minutes for two sundaes. They had apparently skipped our order.
author: Rachel W.

description:
theres nothing better to top off dinner at the wharf then a Brownie Sundae from Ghirardelli. The reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because:

the brownie was super cold and hard when when we got our sundae.
this usually doesn't happen (I've been here a couple times before)
but this experience was a disappointment. 
but i'll be back again; i suppose.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
I'm not a big fan of dessert but their warm chocolate fudge sundae was BOMB. It came with warm chocolate fudge drizzled over warm soft brownie, chopped almonds topped with a big scoop vanilla ice cream. The best part was that the chocolate didn't taste like a regular processed chocolate bar...it was so fresh. You can watch the giant antique machines at work next to the bar. 

I wouldn't come here just for the ice cream but definitely for a chocolate dessert. People complain about the ice cream but it's famous for chocolate. 

Avoid weekends and holidays because it is a major tourist attraction especially because it is next to the pier. I'm definitely stopping by again when I am in the Bay area.
author: Wendy L.

description: Ice cream is delicious. The different toppings are great. The place is all about the locations and hours. Its perfect way to end a date night. It def is expensive but you are in San Francisco next to or even considered in the tourist area. When its busy the service sucks but what do you expect. Its not a 5 star restaurant its a place for desserts...its a 15-20 min walk from fishermans wharf...and thats a slow walk. Ive always been lucky and have found parking on the street around the square. For those die hards here is a parking garage where you can throw your money at. If youre trying to get chocolate wasted this is the place to go to.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Pretty small space which makes it kinda cozy.  I was visiting right after Thanksgiving so their holiday treats were available.  I decided to go ahead and try out the Pumpkin Spice Cocoa.  It was absolutely disgusting.  I tried to drink it...I did pay for it after all. But then I realized there was no sense in torturing myself.  I told the staff how terrible it was and asked for them to dispose of it (didn't want to dump a whole lot of liquid in the trash).  No apology was given and I was not offered to try something else.  *pshaw*
author: Zewditu D.

description: Its got the name but the ice cream was subpar.  The Ice cream was melted and overpriced.  I was ssssooooo disappointed.  Go to Swenson's up the street instead for great ice cream.
author: Jaque M.

description: free choco when u walk in, choco everywhere, sugar, desserts. what can go wrong... except there are sooooo many ppl. crazy. awesome spot tho.
author: Kai P.

description:
mmm chocolate + ice cream = heaven! I heard that if you go to Ghirardelli Square it's a must that you get chocolate of course. 
Indeed it was a tasty/sweet snack that gives you a rush! :) 
The cookie bottom sundae on a waffle bowl was absolutely
great, especially when you are craving something sweet!
I shared it with my two best friends and it's a great treat!
author: Shirley G.

description:
A must for tourists.  Not a fan of the food--it's not bad, but there is soooo much food in SFO that I usually don't waste time here for that.  WE'RE HERE FOR THE CHOCOLATE!!!!!!  Yes, pass me the free square on the way in.  Pick up the favorates and grab a chololate chip cookie.  

Ok.  The chocolate chip cookie.  OMG!!!!  Share it with someone please.  Don't try this unless you really, really, really like sweet and slightly salty shortbread cookies with AMPLE choco chips AND you have insulin on hand.  I usually get them to go for those "special moments" when a sugar rush is necessary.  No more details.

The brownie.  I love brownies.  I'm afraid of this brownie.  It has earned my utmost respect.  THIS is THE brownie.  I don't always get this brownie when visiting out of respect for this brownie.  

And we move on.  Huge Ice Cream Fudge Sundaes.  Great for the kids, crowd your with.  Awesome noisy place if your into that.  If not, get it to go!  This is a happy place!
author: John S.

description:
***** 5 Stars *****
This is my favorite store ever! I was the first time been this place today even I lived in San Francisco two years!
I got a "Hot Fudge Sundae in Homemade Waffle Bowl" tastes awesome!!!! I like how they put the Sundae in a Chocolate waffle bowl! The store smell like Chocolate!:) And my friend got a "Very Berry Sundae" I though the purple ball on the top of the Sundae are blueberry at first, and then When I put it in my mouth, It's too hard to eat them, and I found out that's not Blueberry and that's Blueberry flavor chocolate!!!!! So good!! 
I must go this place long time ago and not just go today!!
If you are ready visit San Francisco, and this is a good place to get ice cream!:)
author: Kassidi L.

description: Yummmmmmy errrythang.. I love chocolate and this place is amazing. if you are ever in the Bay Area you've got to pay this place a visit
author: Diyana I.

description: Overpriced.  I was excited to buy chocolate to bring home to the family only to find that everything was half the price at the Target back home.  We got ripped off!
author: Amy C.

description: sundaes!!!
author: Maricel J.

description:
What else would you when you're a tourist and you're craving for some chocolate?

This place is definitely a killer. I died there. 

Trapped between tourists, it took a while for us to find a seat. We ordered their Espresso escape, Midnight reverie and Cookie bottom sundae. I D-I-E-D, literally. It was chocolate and ice cream overload, but everything was heavenly. I cannot pick my favorite between the espresso escape (coffee ice cream with dark chocolate hot fudge) and midnight reverie (chocolate ice cream with dark chocolate hot fudge). The espresso ice cream was quite strong but not strong enough for my taste, but the dark chocolate fudge was the bomb. Nothing beats this delicious, chocolate and creamy high calorie killer. I just couldn't get more of it! The cookie bottom sundae was average right until you hit the bottom! Boom! The cookie at the bottom was so delicious! It sort of ruins it that the cookies were at the bottom (since you will get full from all the ice cream!) The cookies were rich and fudge like! So good!

I recommend trying their espresso escape and midnight reverie, but if you're a cookie fan, DO try their cookie bottom sundae and DIG to the bottom to indulge on the those delicious cookies before you fill yourself up with all those ice cream!
author: Janice L.

description:
After dining at the Franciscan Friday night, I decided to forego dessert and take us here instead.  Haven't had ice cream here in years, so coming here and sharing a "Strike it Rich" ice cream sundae with two spoons was like stepping back in time.  I remember coming here quite a bit during my college days with my very first serious girlfriend.  Funny how time flies.
