At $8.95, the price was actually less than I expected, but somehow, the size was smaller than I remembered too.  So much time has gone by since I was last here so it's hard to say if it's reality or just fond memories, but I do recall it being more impressive.

Regardless, it was a ton of nostalgia and a great way to end a fun and relaxing evening.  A lot to be said for being able to order the same dish that you grew up with, years later and with a different perspective.  I liked that...yes, I'm a fan.
author: Roy N.

description: Get a delicious "drinking chocolate" for a quick warm-me-up or one of their many ice cream treats for a quick cool-me-down. Or get both if you're feeling frisky. I want to try their brownie fudge sundae next time because the banana split comes with pineapple compote which screws with my taste buds.
author: Jenny J.

description:
OMG i heart chocolate. Melts in my mouth. My hand.  And unfortunately here, in the bowl or spoon before it reached my table. 

OK - I get it! it's a tourist spot and everyone comes by. But for that reason, it's hard to get a spot, and if they made the ice cream early on and have problems finding you - you're out of luck! Melty ice cream! They need to have some sort of 'mini tracker' so instead of just finding your number, they crew can track where you sat your number at, and come to you immediately! See? problem solved!

However. I love chocolate. If there weren't a million tourist, and a more efficient crew, 5 STARS. 

I love chocolate.


ya

:-D
author: Louis C.

description: The ice cream is DA Bomb!!
author: Robert R.

description: I suggest ordering at the to-go line and  finding  a seat instead of sitting down at a table..much faster! They should put menus near the door instead of only at the cashier. Three stars because they forgot to make my friend's vanilla milkshake after already waiting for 20 mins! :/
author: Christine C.

description:
World famous ice cream?!  HA!

HA! I say.  

Why do I say "HA!"?  I'll TELL you why.  I used to live across the street from Ghirardelli Square.  From my window, I could see the line for their "World Famous Ice Cream" shop, which generally stretches far into the square--a dozen people is a light day. Those people are suckers.

Early one lovely Monday morning, I was highly disturbed by what I saw when I looked out my window. I discovered a little-known Ghirardelli secret: the "famous" ice cream they sell for $9 at their "world famous" San Francisco ice cream shop is, in fact, Dreyer's ice cream. Yes, that's right--this is the same ice cream you yourself could get from your local grocery store. 

Little do these tourists know they could walk five blocks down Bay street to Safeway and buy an entire gallon of their own "famous Ghirardelli" ice cream, in whatever flavor they wanted. And it wouldn't even be melty, which is generally how it is served at Ghirardelli.

Don't believe me?  Don't WANT to believe me?  See the business' photos for evidence.
author: Sara O.

description: Awful service and food wasn't good. Ordered a brownie sundae and coffee, coffee came without cream, sugar or spoon. Asked about the sundae and he said it would be right out. After coffee was cold and 2 more requests he came with sundae that only had a drop of chocolate. How can a chocolate factory not put enough chocolate on a Sundae?  This place has turned into a tourist trap and I won't be going back.  Too many other good ice cream shops in San Francisco to deal with bad service and substandard food!
author: LaVerne C.

description: I make it a point to visit Ghirardelli everytime i visit SF. Ice cream is to die for!
author: Bhav P.

description:
Every time I'm in San Francisco, I always make it a point to come here and get a brownie sundae.

Be prepared for a long wait! If there does happen to be a long wait, get it to go (be prepared for smaller portions!) 
- always very busy! make sure to look at a menu while standing in line, so you know what you want by the time you get to the register!

Brownie Sundae with Butter Pecan/Ghiradelli Chocolate flavored ice cream
    - SO GOOD! just thinking about it makes me crave it! the brownie is rich and mouthwatering... the ghiradelli chocolate ice cream is thick and good quality.. but the butter pecan tasted like a huge lump of butter! 

i love this place! One of San Francisco's staple desserts!
author: Charla A.

description:
#24 reason why Chocolate is better than Sex: Offering Chocolate to everybody at a party doesn't make you a Ho.

     Ghirardelli is    THE    place    to go to get your chocolate fix in San Francisco. You have your choice of of picking up some some sweets from the large variety they offer from their shop, or sit down next door in the Fountain In for a rich and creamy ice cream treat. Why let the tourist enjoy all the free samples, and rich delicacies?

     It's almost Halloween and they are handing out free pumpkin spice caramel squares as you walk in. Why not indulge your senses with the sweet velvety goodness of premium milk chocolate embracing the rich luxurious flavor of exquisite caramel, inspired with pumpkin spices. They also have a lot of the usual varieties, as well as gift options available for sale.

     The choices of ice cream concoctions were a bit limited, but I was a bit disappointed when my sundae finally made it's grand appearance. It was lacking in both grandeur and richness. It was good, just not $9 good. More like $5-6 dollars good. I guess they must add a few bucks due to the tourist trap factor. It did not portray the picture on the menu any justice.

     The Chocolates and its' respective store deserves a a full five stars for the service, quality, variety, and over all goodness. The ice cream shop gets a measly two stars for the lame service and unimpressive sundaes. I would rate them separately if they weren't part of the same shop as a whole.
author: Yves J S.

description:
A must-stop place to visit whenever I come to San Francisco.  A wide variety of Dreyer's Ice Cream flavors to choose from as well as a wide variety of toppings to decorate your sundae however you please. 

If you come with a large group, DO get the large Earthquake sundae. It makes the most sense (price-wise) to order this if you come with a large group rather than everyone getting their own individual sundae or even sharing a few sundaes. Earthquake sundae is your choice of 8 ice cream flavors and choice of 8 toppings, topped with whipped cream and maraschino cherries for $29.95. 

Seating is not difficult to find (they have two stories and indoor and outdoor seating) but parking is hard to find (street or private lot for fee). After satisfying your sweet tooth, you can take a walk around the rest of Ghirardelli Square or go across the street to the beach/pier--perfect for dates.
author: Serena C.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I love Ghirardelli chocolate & I love the sundaes/ice cream/drinks made with their chocolate products.  However, because this place is such a tourist destination, I feel like it's not quite as nice an experience as other Ghirardelli chocolate shops.   They have a few scattered around the country and I've been to the ones in Vegas & Miami Beach and maybe one other city.  At those stores you have a nice experience - you walk in, walk right up to the counter & place your order, sit down, and your sundae is brought out to you.   

Here the experience is a little different.  You walk in, wait on a long line to order, pay your $10 for your sundae, and then realize there are no tables to sit at.  The whole place is incredibly crowded and loud, and you normally have to stalk tables for 5-10 minutes before finding a place to sit.  Tables are dirty, and even once people have left them, it takes awhile for the staff to come clean them up.  

The sundaes are of course the big draw, and I feel like the last couple times I've come here they've been sub-par.   One time, they screwed up and added nuts when I said I didn't want them.  This most recent time, the order was correct but the sundae was so badly mixed that by the time I got down to the hot fudge there was no ice cream left.

If I were being brutally honest I'd probably give it 2 stars, just because the other Ghirardelli shops are so much better.   But I'll keep it at 3 because if you've never been to SF you need to pay this place a visit, and because I have such great memories of this store from separate mother-daughter and father-daughter trips to SF as a kid.
author: A M.

description: Even with all the tourist I love coming here. The gold rush sundae is my favorite! Seating is always a bit of a pain but a willingness to share and some patience usually pays off. Service is efficient and friendly. Bottom line, we should all play tourist every now and then.
author: Lalena S.

description: Ghirardelli is a classic ice cream shop by Fishermans Wharf that most tourists would not miss. Expect typical American style sundaes with chocolate, butterscotch, mint, and the regular toppings. When I was living in Chicago, we have an outlet there as well but it's extra special to have Ghirardelli ice cream in San Francisco, especially when I have my favourite: the Midnight Revenie with extra extra dark chocolate. Also worth trying is the drinking chocolate served with a piece of biscotti.
author: Kwoky L.

description: This is my favorite ice cream shop for a few reasons: history, quality, and taste.  Yes, the restaurant is super crowded, but what do you expect on a warm San Francisco afternoon during the summer?  I love the hot fudge, and the ice cream (Carnation brand?) is great, too.  The kiddies love their little strawberry malts and sundaes as well.
author: Parris B.

description:
Their hot chocolate is out of this world!

And so are most of their other chocolate drinks and desserts.

To keep the wait down for a table if it is busy  have one person order while another person sets out to find a table.  When it is crowded it is every man for themselves when it comes to finding a place to sit.

You have to be quick to get a table.
author: Scott C.

description: Other than Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. Ghirardelli Square was another of my favorite hang out during my high school days. But this place had changed alot since the time I had gone back. except the Ghirardelli Chocolate And Ice Cream which is still the same. And is my favorite place to get a chocolate ice cream Yummy!!! Except for some shopping stores some were new to me when the time I have gone back to this wonderful chocolate place!!!
author: William B.

description: This place is off the charts...  The best ice cream in the universe, OMG!!!  I got the banana split and WOW...  Oh Yeah, the coffee wasn't bad either, LOL!!!
author: Joel S.

description: Hubby ordered the mint ice cream.  He liked it because he finished it all :)
author: Amelia W.

description:
Yes, we have been here before but when you are pregnant it is just mean! 
My son loves the smores sundae, I love the cookie bottom sundae and my Husband loves the classic. now there are there spots here where you can order so if there is a line out the door at one store just walk a little ways a there is another one right there!
author: stephanie p.

description:
Ghirardelli is a tourist trap, plain and simple.  However, it's my kind of tourist trap.  They have a nice, beautiful facility.  They have machines making chocolate that you can see.  They give out free samples, and have an extensive selection of chocolates to buy, some of which you can't even get in the stores.  They have a really good ice cream parlour where you can get all sorts of sundaes, cones, and other ways to mix their delicious chocolate with delicious ice cream.

As I said before, it's a tourist trap, but it's a good one.  It's the kind of place that locals may complain about and say they hate, but secretly they are wishing someone from out of town would visit so they can take their guest there and have an excuse to eat their delicious chocolate and ice cream.

One star was removed because of the parking situation and safety.  This really applies to the whole area from here to the Fisherman's Wharf and beyond, but car break-ins are so common that the police won't even show up to talk to you, you'll have to talk to someone on the phone and then that's the end of it.  Don't leave valuables in your car, and if you rent a car, get the extra coverage.
author: Shawn P.

description: Such great service! A young gentleman by the name if Brandon came right to my family and helped us get what we needed! He made us the best sundaes and provided excellent service. We'll be back
author: Prima D.

description: Yum- dark is best :-)
author: Graham Y.

description:
Yes Yes. Tourist trap for everyone visiting this place. The long a*s line and the never-to-be found open table. What's the point of complaining if you knew this would be the place to be to get your ice cream fixing.

Located close to the SF Maritime History Park and a walking distance from the wharf. If the tourist didn't know about the place, it would be a shorter line, but why be greedy? Not sharing the place would be travesty and a disservice for all mankind.

The Square is nice with all tourist shops, but it's this place that everyone want to get their ice creams and chocolate fixing. If there's a long line, it meant people loved it and would come back for more if they stop by SF.

So quit the whining and get out of line so that the rest of us can get our ice cream!
author: Mike L.

description: I had the dark-chocolate fudge banana sundae and it was the best I've ever had.  Wife had a single-scoop of the Ghirardelli Chocolate ice cream, also excellent.
author: Steve R.

description:
I always go there when in SFO. All their menu items are very tasty , fresh and worth trying atleast once , until you figure out what you really like.
 
Portions sizes are big enough to replace a meal. So  do not go their right after a meal.
author: Mac J.

description: This place left a bad taste in my mouth after they nearly refused to honor a coupon on the bottom of their receipt. My receipt from a previous visit said "Show this receipt for 10% off chocolate and ice cream on a future day visit to any Ghirardelli Store." But the cashier tried to tell me that it was only valid for the same day. He eventually gave me the discount, but they should have been more clear about their policy.
author: Harry S.

description: I swear if they had let me jump in to the vat of chocolate, I would give this place 10 stars! This place is a chocolate lovers dream.
author: Jen L.

description: Dessert lovers go crazy! Check it before you order. I still cannot believe how awesome the chocolate ice creams are. Oh my goodness.  Ordered the Mint Bliss and it was $9 and some change.  There were chocolates stuck to side of cup that u can scrape of and eat. Oh my now that is a plus!!!! for $9 why not?!? It was a meal in itself. Kids go crazy, adults become kids, how can you not like this place!!!
author: Lauren X.

description:
Go here if it's your first time in SF! VERY CUTE.
This place is a dessert a holics dream! Ghiradelli dark chocolate is really good and especially good in an ice cream sundae!!
author: Angela D.

description:
Not just for tourists....

Walk from here to Ft. Point and back...then indulge in a dark chocolate waffle cone with a scoop of heaven. 

Try the upstairs "grab and go" option when you can't spend 1/2 hour in line.  Free sample of chocolate is a nice touch.
author: Mo M.

description: This place is always busy but it's one of those places that you just HAVE to go to for some ice cream whether you're a tourist or Bay Area native.  Recently came here with family to celebrate my brother-in-law's birthday.  After getting our ice cream my niece, who along with her brother has a nut allergy, told us that her cookies and cream ice cream tasted and smelled like nuts.  After a few of us tasted and smelled it I went back  inside to have them give us a new scoop of ice cream from a clean scooper.  The guy happily obliged and was super nice about it.  Luckily my niece didn't have a reaction to it!!  Other than this one incident I love coming here whenever I'm in the area!
author: Dez B.

description:
Love this place!!

They have the best hot fudge you could ask for!!

Whenever I crave a hot fudge sundae, this is the place i go.
author: Austin B.

description: Four stars because they give free chocolate  and hot cocoa is the best!
author: Laiza S.

description: I'm a tourist so went here for ice cream and something with chocolate. Only three stars because I think it is overpriced. Way too much whip cream on the sundaes. Not enough space to sit. It was just an okay experience.
author: Peggy C.

description:
I had fond memories of Ghirardelli from my 1994 visit to San Francisco.  I've since cultivated my love of their products, especially the ice cream sundaes, at the downtown Chicago location.  

At 5:20 pm on an August Tuesday, the entire square was deserted.  What gives?  The weather was great.  Maybe because most of the shops were closed?  I got a sundae, and it was great, but I felt like I was wandering around a cathedral.  I sat on a bench to eat my ice cream, and I saw maybe ten people the whole time.  For once, I wished that there were more people present, even (gasp) other tourists, to make it more interesting.  The Michigan Avenue location is always hopping, day or night.  

Incidentally, it was the "Mint Bliss" sundae, one of their new line of fancypants concoctions.  And it was damn good.
author: David R.

description:
Yes, this place is totally touristy, but the ice creams are oh so good! After walking for what seemed like hours and miles along the Embarcadero, I was just relieved to find a place to sit  and refuel. I split a dark chocolate hot fudge sundae. Very tasty. Perhaps a bit small for the $7-8 price tag, but well worth it for a nice, cool spot to kick back. It reminded me of how I used to go to the Ghiradelli cafe at the South Coast Plaza in Costa Mesa with my Mom, which is sadly no more.

The shop also has some pretty good deals on chocolate. I was tempted by the 5 bar pack for only $10 by the register, but then I figured I didn't need  any more guilt on my thighs :)
author: Jennifer A.

description: it's a cute place. beware, there are a lot of tourists lingering around. My friend and I shared a hot fudge sundae, it was delicious. They served in a a plastic cup and topped it with cream and a cherry. Not bad
author: Connie M.

description: When I have friends in town we always make a point to go to Dim Sum for dinner and here for dessert. Love the peanut butter sundae and the mint one. Sometimes hard to find a place to sit so go upstairs and tip your servers... It can't be the most fun to have that job.
author: Danielle G.

description:
Believe it or not, this was my first time going to Ghirardelli Square in the entire time I've lived in the city. Not that I didn't know about it but a certain person kept promising to take me there after HS graduation (like 6 years ago) and never made good on that promise. 

Fortunately, I was able to go here yesterday with a friend. I love how they have everything chocolate within reach from Kara's cupcakes to the wonderful hot Ghirardelli hot chocolate which was perfect on that very chilly afternoon.

It's close to Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero and shopping, has beautiful views and other than it being a huge tourist attraction and crowded at times, it's a nice place to go with an old friend and catch up while having an excuse to indulge your sweet tooth! ;)
author: Petra S.

description:
It is crowded - lines do stretch outside the building.
This place is for tourists - Yes. 

It's fun and bubbly, hustle & bustle. Everyone is jovial and having a sweet ole time with their friends, lovers, & families. 

The service is quick and efficient but something about this place - seemed sloppy - not sure if it was the ice cream presentation or the sloppy employees who were clearly college students. 

Either way - you have to share seats with other tourists - which is what we did and had a lovely chat with a Texan lady - although to be honest, she was distracting Tiffany and I from being fully in the moment with our classic banana sundae. 

I ordered a diet coke which was super flat - so I sent it back and asked for any soda that wasn't flat- the teeny bopper comes back to me and says - sorry all our sodas are flat . 
Eek! big no no for places with ice cream floats - no?
So I got a little huffy and finagled a dipped chocolate waffle cone in lieu of the soda I couldn't get. kakakakakakakakaka

Pros
Cute place to hang out with friends
Have to share seats with others if you don't want to wait for your own

Cons
Flat Soda
Have to share seats with others if you don't want to wait for your own (depends if u see that as glass half full or half empty)

Note to self - next time try the brownie sundae

Peep the photos
author: Enjella L.

description:
Tourists tourists everywhere, obstructing my ice cream yummy goodness fix!

The **ice cream** itself is still a fabulous five stars, but wowza!!!  Maybe we were super lucky the other times we've been here, because I've never seen so many people before!

***Logistics** was a major fail:  one star this time!  The line was way out the door the last time we were here.  Someone went down the line and handed each person a menu; smart move, loved it!!  This was not an issue for me, but after we ordered, the nightmare began!  **Seating** is a free for all.  Since it was a packed house that night, there was no seating, and we were left to wander around downstairs and upstairs hoping the seating Gods would favor us that night.  This is not an ideal setup.  I really don't like having to fight for seating.  I actually would have preferred to wait in a line to be seated.  That would have been the less frustrating and fair way to obtain a table.  The only option available at the time would be to sit outside, but it was freezing that night!  

I didn't want to eat my ice cream standing up hovering over other people, so we opted to get a refund.  The person we spoke to suggested we could take it to go, but again, no way.  It was cold outside.  The manager refunded our money immediately in a detached way; no comments made to us, but at least the person at the register acknowledged our difficulty.  

Ghirardelli, please help out with seating on packed and cold nights!

TIPS:
1.  Maybe call ahead to see how crowded they are.
2.  If there is a long line, leave one person in line to order, and send scouts in ahead to look for seating.  I was unable to do this, because my BF was stuck in another long line for the restroom.  :(
3.  If it's a cold night, and you absolutely have to have an ice cream fix, then bring layers.  I would not have minded sitting outside, but I wasn't clothed properly for outdoor dining and enjoyment.
author: Roselina R.

description: Ordered Togo & didn't wait long on a busy Friday night. Staff was friendly & efficient. Ice cream was delicious!
author: Jessica O.

description:
Yes please. Can't stay away from this place.

OK, it's Ghirardelli's. Sundaes are quite good. Rich ice cream, decadent, sweet, sticky sauces. Hot fudge, of course, is best, but their caramel and fruit sauces are all very good. I am only mildly ashamed to say I tried all of them, because my friends and I always somehow ended up back here after a long day in San Fran. Don't know why. :)

It can be extremely busy during the summer, I am sure - it was plenty busy in October, when I was there. Worth it? Sure! Not a must-eat, though - there is plenty of other ice cream in San Fran.
author: Jason W.

description: Ghiradelli used to be a place to satisfy your chocolate sundae cravings. Unfortunately this time it was anything but a dream destination for craving satisfaction. The ice cream when we got it was a milky puddle, the brownie was a dry, cold block, and the hot fudge was cold. Everything about this warm brownie fudge sundae was wrong.
author: Warren S.

description: After you have an anxiety attack from the crowd inside, you buy a sundae the size of your head to take the edge off.
author: Soly Z.

description:
On a rare warm summer day in San Francisco I like to wander around ghiradelli square and enjoy a very berry Sunday at Ghiradelli chocolate. I've also treated myself to the Gold Rush, which involves a lot of caramel.

It's about $9 for a Sundae which is a little steep and seating might take a minute since its such a high tourist area. But I find that its a treat that I can occasionally splurge on.
author: Analisa S.

description:
I know that Ghirardelli sells their chocolate at many places like CVS Pharmacy and so on, but I have to say that by going to where it all started is certainly the best thing and a must do in San Francisco.

Their chocolate is DELICIOUS and I mean DELICIOUS! I want to say that it is as great as it can get for this San Francisco original (despite that they now make their chocolate on the other side of the bay in San Leandro). However, it is always a unique experience by stepping in to this place. It seems that the ice cream is quite popular since there were many people in their ice cream shop making line for ice cream. I guess at the moment I was not craving for ice cream and therefore my review shall not be focused on their ice cream but rather on the chocolate part.

The staff is very friendly there and they greet you and make you feel special. Also they do offer a free sample just for coming in. I recall that my free sample was some sort of peppermint chocolate, which was delicious! 

Overall, the atmosphere in the square and in the shop is great, and it is in the ocean front and you can see the bay from the square.
author: Ismael M.

description: I fell in love on my first bite....nuff said
author: Malou C.

description:
Ridiculous!  Our visitors from Georgia had this place on their "must experience" list, so we fought the crowds at Ghiradelli Square to stand in a line about 30 - 40 people long to order ice cream sundaes (starting at $9) and hot chocolate.  We were given our number in a little stand to put on our table and released to find a table.  Complete chaos.  

The three rooms of dining area inside (two downstairs and one upstairs) were packed with people - people sitting at tables and layers of people standing over them clenching their little numbers waiting for them to leave.  After several laps of all rooms and squeezing through crowds, we finally found a table with one chair to share between 7 of us outside in the cold.  

Servers walk around with trays of ice cream looking for the corresponding order numbers in all indoor and outdoor dining areas.  They seem frazzled, overwhelmed, overworked.  

The sundaes we ordered arrived melted (the hot fudge and hot caramel no longer hot, and the ice cream quickly turning liquid) and the hot cocoas were lukewarm.  

I understand this spot is catering to tourists who long for the Ghiradelli experience, but changing to this method of service (I'm pretty sure it used to operate like a restaurant where you were seated and served a decade or two ago) smacks of pure greed.

The chocolate shop, however, seems well stocked and organized.  I recommend making your sundaes at home.
author: Casey N.

description: Ok, Love the Sundae (4) , hate the atmosphere (1)...so average is 2.5, rounded up to Three because we purchased the hot fudge, made sundaes at home and they were good
author: Vivek V.

description: Thought the drinks and ice cream they served here was tooo sweet. Felt like I was going to get cavities. Do like the random free chocolate they give you! Yay free candy!
author: Liwei Y.

description: I know it's touristy but I still Love coming here! The ice cream mixed with the peanut butter and fudge is my favorite, my next go to the the brownie. It's a fun environment, and when I'm In the city and I'm craving some good old fashioned ice cream I make sure to stop by. There are a ton of dessert places in the city but one can only eat so many trendy cupcakes, crepes, and yogurt.. Oh but now they smash the ingredients into your yogurt you say? Ice cream is still and will always be better.
author: Garrett T.

description: As a tourist location, there's not much to Ghirardelli Square. However, all the desserts at this ice cream shop are really good. Overpriced, but good. My favorites are the hot fudge brownie sundae and the sea salt caramel hot chocolate. Especially the hot fudge brownie sundae.... the brownie is served warm, with melting vanilla ice cream on top. The best part is the hot fudge. It's none of that chocolate syrup drizzle nonsense... it's literally fudge. Incredibly sticky, gooey, rich, chocolatey, warm fudge. It is orgasmically good.
author: M L.

description:
The line sucks (especially when it's long..which is usually is) and sometimes the tables are sticky (what do you expect !?).

The sundaes are huge. I would recommend you share with someone. 
I'm not big on chocolate (*gasp* a lady who does not like chocolate?! what's the world coming to! ) but if you're browsing around and actually have some money to blow, try picking up some of the Ghirardelli liqueur. Makes a great chocolate martini..
author: Susy C.

description: I've always loved Ghiradelli's wonderful chocolates and ice cream sundaes. Scope out the SF city guide maps and you'll find a nifty $1.00 off discount coupon. Come here after 6pm and you'll find parking easily and it's free along the meters. In addition, the staff is very nice and makes your ice cream sundaes quick and I mean quick. The shop was packed and somehow the waiters were able to find our table and numbers and we were on our way to ice cream delight. It's nice to eat sundaes and staring directly at your crush's eyes. Man, it's the best feeling in the world and sharing our treats as well. Finally, close off the night with a nice walk along Aquatic Park's shore unless the oil spill is still lurking and keeping everyone away.
author: Danster L.

description:
This place is so good, I will brave the crowd of tourists just to get a sundae! And it's always a beautiful day to get ice cream here.

There's always a crowd in front of the shop, but only because I think people are confused about ordering here. We grabbed a menu, pointed at two items, paid and made our way over to the big #2 sign where we were to wait for our sundaes. It's a bit chaotic/noisy, to-go orders are picked up where dine-in customers are waiting to be seated.

I enjoyed my sundae because ghirardelli always delivers yummy sweets! I saw the other sundaes they were making, especially the HUGE one on a platter. Someday, I'd like to dine in and try something else. 

This is the one place you can order the most basic sundae and it is simply delightful.
author: Stella C.

description: Service was extremely slow and it took forever to get our table cleaned on MLK Day.  I had to raise my hand like a 1st grader to get our table cleaned.
author: James C.

description: Great place to take kids - watch their little eyeballs pop out of their heads as their giant sundae is set in front of them. Me? I liked my coffee.... the chocolate chip cookie I got was really dense and reminded me of the cookie dough used in ice cream... but harder. Weekdays (as all things in touristy areas) are best.
author: Vanilla P.

description:
It's a must-do for your sweet tooth! That is, if you have a really BIG sweet tooth! Don't shoot me, but I'm not a huge dessert fan. But the boyfriend is. Everytime we go out to dinner, he must have dessert. By the time the dessert menu comes, i'm stuffed from everything else and end up having no room for dessert anyway. So I like to take two bites of his and I'm satisfied. 

At 11 o'clock at night, the bf was feening for some Ghirardelli ice cream. We didn't think it was going to be packed at that time, but it was! Man, this place makes a killing off these tourists! $9 bucks for my Banana Fudge Sundae and $9 bucks for his Caramel Sundae. I felt bad cuz I didn't finish mine. I made it half way through and just coudn't do it anymore. It was delicious but way toooo rich! So even though I'm not big on desserts, I know this one hits the spot for everyone. ;)
author: Anne E.

description:
Had icecream here. The one which was called world famous was awesome. The vanilla ice cream inside was quite special and milky. The ice cream was too sweet for me, though.

I had another one with banana fruit and three flavors of ice cream, they are strawberry, vanilla, and chocolate.
author: Jay Y.

description: Any fan of chocolate will love this place from the endless amounts to purchase to the little ice cream parlor inside. It is a large tourist attraction so expect a lot of people and long lines but the place smelled great, service friendly, and prices reasonable. Always worth checking out when in San Francisco.
author: Patrick C.

description:
I felt like a kid in some kind of store.

The variety of chocolates were great and if you buy four bars they give you one free. 

That totally justifies $20 on chocolate.

Let's not forget that there is a complimentary chocolate square when you make it through the door (just don't put it in your pocket because it's
author: Brian S.

description:
Anyone who doesn't like Ghirardelli Chocolate is crazy, and I mean CRAZY! Double Chocolate Brownie soaked in ice cream and whipped cream, You can't possibly go wrong! It is not only delicious but this desert is good for two if you can't handle a big ice cream, the brownie is just to fall over your chair and die for... My boyfriend had the ice cream in a waffle bowl and that was oh so delish, the waffle cone is filled with ghirardelli chocolate on the inside..... oh how I miss you Ghirardelli.....

xo,
kristin nicole
soapnights.com
author: Kristin N.

description:
Espresso Escape. Way to escape yourself for a moment. Too bad gf got sore throat when we went there. If you went there with your gf/bf, just order one and share it. There's enough desert for two. And also you can save money and calories that way  - as one of these fudge/choco/ice cream.. can run up to $8 - $10 per person.

Overpriced? Yes.. of course it's a tourist place. You can get similar desert for less somewhere else. And dude.. don't kid yourself.. you can buy ghirardelli chocolate in your town for cheaper price than here.. save your money. The ghirardelli chocolate sold here have the same taste with the one sold in your town.

You can use that extra bucks to buy something else.. like a ticket to Alcatraz or pay parking fees at Fisherman Wharf nearby.
author: Yohann S.

description: I keep getting withdrawals from this place! I had their salted caramel hot chocolate and it was the best hot drink i've ever had! mmm they were giving out pumpkin chocolate squares, they are sooo yummy!
author: Lillybeth G.

description: You will walk in to be greeted by the sweet smell of chocolate...enough to have your pancreas release a months worth of insulin before you even take a bite. Lots of tourists here - but if you're looking for a spot to sit and recharge, the shop is good for that plus, you can buy as much chocolate as you want - to include loose assortments for a bi of a markup.
author: Jake K.

description:
This is America.  The land of the fatties.  Why are most of Americans obese?  Because of places like Ghirardelli Chocolate.  

Let's just be honest.  How can i not give at least 4 starts for huge portions, amazing ice cream (my fav. ones are the expresso and ghirardelli chocolate ice cream).  sure it gets crowded and touristy but all the loud noises are sweet melody to your ears once take a bite of ghirardelli's ice cream.  

you do get upset when you are paying close to $10 bucks for an ice cream but again, once you take a bite, you forget everything.
author: Jang David K.

description: Don't waste your money. We ordered a hot fudge sundae.  It was $9.  It came out in a plastic cup, not in glass as advertised, the vanilla cream was not tasty and has ice crystals, and there was only a teaspoon of hot fudge in one corner.  Big disappointment.
author: James B.

description:
1) bring a friend. The sundae portions here are huge. I really think they need to offer something smaller. 

2) bring your wallet. The teenager waiting on us wasn't even going to tell us how much our order totaled. Very inconsiderate. 

3) take lots of napkins. These sundaes have so much stuff on them and the glasses are filled to the brim! An absolute mess to eat. 

In general, I didn't think this was anything special. Definitely a one-time visit.
author: Francesca V.

description: This is what I like to call heaven on Earth! It's that simple. If you are in San Francisco you need to visit this place. The smell alone will drive anyone into choco-gasm!
author: Valerie R.

description:
I can't believe I had forgotten about Ghirardelli while wandering around SF! It was almost like seeing an oasis by the time we stumbled upon Ghirardelli Square. 

I was a little bummed out to see there wasn't any sort of tour, by my disappointment was soothed by the TWO shops and soda fountain fare. Even though we had to wait in line, our ice cream was definitely worth it. A few of us split the peanut butter sundae and it was incredible! 

There is ample shopping and I managed to get some hard-to-find things. I'm not even a little ashamed to admit my suitcase was quite a bit heavier on the way home.
author: Kate S.

description:
Ice cream and candy and chocolate.. how much better can this place get.

I was literally in a food coma for the rest of the evening

I had a butterscotch ice cream treat and it was absolutely amazing.. Ive been to this place quite a few times and every time its amazing.

It does tend to get VERY busy , its a huge tourist attracting. 

Will be back next time I am in sf
author: Alecia R.

description:
Whenever we stop in the bay area from hawaii, we come here to enjoy their hot chocolate.  The cocoa is really rich and hot, and on a cold night, nothing is better. So yes, I love their hot chocolate. 
My review is simply for customer service. My name is lopaka, which is hawaiian. I understand that most people can't spell it, so when they ask for a name for the order, I normally accept whatever they write down. Hence, paka was on my order.
While waiting for my order at the counter, I hear Alberto the barista call the other 2 employees over and say "look at this, try and say it. What is that. Say the name. It sounds like (Alberto makes crapping noises)" for about 30 seconds. so as the girl calls out my name and realizes I was right there, they all laugh...In front of me.
She also forgot both the chocolate and sea salt on top due to the laughing. 
I've done customer service for many years, I know the types of comments that are made. But under no circumstance do you, as an adult, make ignorant comments in front of your customers.
Should stick to eating lindt chocolate
author: Lopaka H.

description: Crowded and disorganized ice cream shop. I was disappointed that they don't make their own ice cream.  I'd rather have cold stone.
author: Sarah W.

description: Yes of course this place is a landmark, but after going once as a tourist, I don't feel the need to go there again. It is SUCH a mess. There are so many people, children, babies, strollers...it is loud it is messy there are workers bustling through people, running into people, straws and cups falling everywhere...I can't imagine having to eat inside we got our ice cream (which of course was delicious) and ran out of there....and this was a weekday! Organize yourselves, organize your lines, and make this place more enjoyable for your customers!
author: Milana K.

description: I feel like a kid at Disneyland every time I step into this chocolate paradise. So it's a tourist trap, but who gives? Prices are a little high and wait can get kind of long, but their warm brownie sundaes make it all worth it.
author: Sophia B.

description:
"Meh, i've experienced better." That perfectly describes Ghirardelli Chocolate ice cream. I'm from LA and I know a good portion of the best ice creams around. Ghiradelli doesn't come close to them at all. 

I shared a banana split with my brother and the cost was almost $10. I normally don't pay that much at all but i felt like i should try the infamous ice cream. It was very crowded and our dessert finally arrived to us after a LONG wait. The ice cream looked like a ship that was sinking. A good portion had already been melted. As for the portion that didn't sink.. well...it was nothing extraordinary. 

I DO recommend going to the mini chocolate shop and getting your FREE piece of chocolate. I was tempted to go in and out for a few more of them.
author: Melissa P.

description:
Besides the high priced desserts and tough to find tables/seats, great place to hang out with friends or on a date. Had the World 
Famout Hot Fudge Sundae, Very Berry Sundae, Root Beer Float, Hot Chocolate, and a Banana Split Sundae. Yes call us pigs, but if you weren't, you shouldn't be enjoying the chocolate / dessert delights at Ghirardelli.
author: Stanley C.

description:
Since I was a wee little girl, I have been making the trek to Ghirardelli Square to indulge in some sweet ice cream treats. Growing up in Redding, 4 hours north of the city by the bay, didn't stop my family from making Ghirardelli part of our agenda when visiting SF. And through the year's, I have visited this ice cream parlor with many different friends & family members.

Each time I visit this never changing, old fashioned ice cream shop, I wonder if my opinion could be shaken. Not once have I been disappointed. The building looks the same, the brightly lit sign looks the same, the line out the door looks the same and the delicious ice cream & chocolate treats definitely taste just as good today as they did 20+ years ago. 

Ghirardelli, my old childhood friend, I love you just as much today as I did yesterday. Thanks for the nostalgia & thanks for your uncompromising chocolaty, ice cream goodness.
author: Lori B.

description: Went here last weekend the day before my birthday. My friends and I were looking at the menu out front debating on a hot fudge sundae or banana split. The manager overheard them saying they would treat for my birthday and he said whatever I wanted was on him. He recommened the banana split, but I had my heart set on the hot fudge sundae. Very nice of him and the hot fudge sundae was excellent! My friends said the banana split was excellent too!
author: TBird M.

description:
This was my 1st time visiting. 

Food: We had a warm-brownie sundae. It was pretty good, but not extraordinary. It came really melted already, so it was kind of a waste

Service: The waitress came out to find our number when we didn't even get a table yet, but she still handed it to us while it was dripping all over the sides. She didn't offer to bring it back inside for us where there were tables available. Not only that, but she approached us with a serious face, no smile at all. 

Aren't you supposed to be happy, or pretend, when serving people this type of good food?

Inside - these 2 employees started mopping the floor next to us when there wasn't even any major spill. The smell was bad and 1 of them even bumped my chair while I was eating. 

Is this how they work there?  Not good at all
author: Steven L.

description: Came here a few days ago with my friend. We had the rocky road sundae. The ice cream was creamy and had some sort of a filling in the center. My friend and I prefer the banana split over the rocky road. So I would recommend the banana split.
author: Jessica C.

description:
If you love chocolate, you probably love this place more than I do.

Past few times I've came here, my sundae was ice cream SOUP. really melted ice cream is no good.

There so much syrup in all their sundaes, its way too SWEET for me. 

This other time, I waited over 45 minutes for my sundae when all of my friends got theirs already and finished it. And when mine came, it was all melted. :(


On the other hand, I love their chocolate covered blueberries.
author: Erica L.

description:
This place is a madhouse.

Think of nuts getting on long lines just for sweets.

Ridiculous.
author: ChowNut ..

description: God why do I do this to myself lol. So damn good!!!!!  Sundays!!! Best whip cream ever. #foodcoma
author: David T.

description:
I'm not really a chocolate person, but my girlfriend is, so she dragged me over here.

I picked up a strawberry shake instead.  And while it was thick and yummy, I also had this feeling to drink water.  Lots of water.  Meh.

I know, a 2-star review shouldn't reflect the fact that I ordered something that didn't have chocolate in it.  But then again, I did enjoy the free sample of caramel chocolate?
author: Ren L.

description:
Ah how I love thee hot chocolate~! Been coming to this establishment since 03 and fell in love with the place and its ambiance.  Great family friendly place anytime of the day~!! The place can be busy with tourists but hey I love people watching. I highly recommend coming here during summer time as you cool down with cold ice cream and drown yourself with free concert outside.  

Service: A
Food:  A
Overall: A

ps.  Parking can be tricky but you can find parking spaces off Van Ness St.
author: Izzy H.

description: Best place for ice cream and hot Ghirardelli fudge!
author: James M.

description:
On to Ghirardelli for my San Francisco visit.  I guess this is also one of the must-visit places in this city, as my friends took me there without me asking.  It was very busy there when we got there, but I think that is probably not unusual.  Ghirardelli probably attracts a lot of tourists.  

They had menus near the cash registers and we were supposed to wait in line and order from those menus.  It took me a minute to figure this out because I didn't notice the menus in the back of the line.  I noticed the sea salt caramel hot cocoa, and I thought sea salt in hot cocoa sounded interesting, so that's what I ordered.

Well I can't say I tasted any actual sea salt in the hot cocoa.  It just tasted like regular hot cocoa to me.  Overall it was an average experience.  I think Ghirardelli is more hype than substance.
author: Radford T.

description:
I had the brownie fudge sundae, and it was so freaking good i punched the lady at the counter in the face out of pure confusion. 

What is this? Is it magic or fairy dust? Trick question it was both.
author: Joyce D.

description:
I usually come here every time I go to SF & I always get the brownie sundae. What could be better than vanilla ice cream with delicious hot fudge and hot fudge filled brownie?

Its usually crowded here in the afternoon, but in the morning its pretty empty and peaceful.
author: Hazel V.

description: They may not actually make chocolate here anymore but it is a GREAT place to stop while in SF.  Ice cream, chocolate and free samples!
author: Smorga M.

description:
Ghiradelli, we used to be best friends???!!!   What happened to us?

A little piece of my childhood has been erased.

Ghiradelli no longer carries the Foghorn - a fantastic rasberry, chocolate and ice cream concoction that was an off the menu secret for locals for decades.

My ice cream was a little melted when I got it and there was a scant amount of chocolate, but I'm still giving you guys three stars for the great Christmas memories you bring me.

I'll be back in the spring, kick the quality back up a notch, and you'll get your fourth star back.
author: Victoria B.

description:
So this place is extremely crowded. However, I expected that. 

Love a free sample every time you walk in! Ordered a sundae to share, w/hot fudge and butterscotch. A couple of bits where enough. The butterscotch was so sweet. Now I know, stick to the hot fudge alone.
author: Kari D.

description:
Visited this place with my friends as the object of our jaunt to San Francisco. Literally, we only came to SF to satisfy our intense chocolate craving (or at least I did) at the Ghiradelli Chocolate Factory.

I was like a kid in a candy store.

They have all the varieties of those delicious chocolate squares. I'm a fan of dark, so I bought the espresso and sea-salt/almond kinds. 

What! This place sells icecream sundaes?!

Me and my lady friend enjoyed a banana split. It's served in a glass with a cherry on top. I was a little disappointed in the meltiness of the dessert. Nonetheless, before my friend looked up from her texting, I was halfway done with the damn thing!

The chocolate prices here are higher than what you would find at a Walgreens. But hey, that sundae was good.
author: Alex S.

description: This is place is a must when im in the city.  The best banana splits ever!!  They're big enough for two people to share.  Every ice cream dish they serve looks amazing.
author: Nic J.

description:
Ghirardelli Chocolate is definitely among my favorite chocolates in the world. Whenever I see a box at discounted prices at Longs, I'm stocking up for the apocalypse! The chocolate is incredibly silky and smooth, and every bite is rich with a chocolaty aroma and sweetness.

My favorite is the Dark Chocolate with Mint Filling SQUARES. I got a bunch of them individually from this store in San Francisco. I didn't even know the company was based at this location until I was there, so you can imagine my surprise and delight to see such a selection of the substance I love. .

Understandably, the chocolate here is sold at the standard retail price, but I bought a bunch anyway just because it was the HQ, and also I had a little money to spare vacationing here. I'm still glad I stopped by though. Just wish I had more time and appetite to have tried out their ice cream. I'm excited to visit again.
author: Hideyo K.

description: If you are visiting San Francisco this a Must Do spot! I live in the East Bay and when ever I have family & friends from out of town visit the city this is one of my spots to bring my visitors to!!  If we want ice cream and we are in the city this is usually our spot to go to!! Does not matter if it's a warm or cold day you will find some thing delicious to eat or drink! From the chocolate dipped strawberries to their sundaes to their chocolate selections you will find something to fall in love with! It is all Yumilicious!! I have been here a dozen times and I have never been turned off by the long lines that always go by fast or the waiting for a table... it is all worth it! If you find it a bit pricey, you can share. There dishes and drinks are big!! If you plan to come by make sure your meal before hand is small... you will need the room.  I give it 4 stars only because place is too small but it doesn't stop me from going,  lol!!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: This was my first time at this regular tourist attraction.. I felt like I was at summer camp with all the international servers.  Great hot fudge sundae.
author: S And B D.

description: great memories associated with this place, all the way from the early 90s. we'd bring every visitor here for the best sundaes ever!
author: Char Y.

description: Yummmmm! I love super thick strawberry milkshakes and that is what I got. Also split a sundae with a group of about 4 and it was scrumptious! It is pretty busy and kinda hectic with the servers walking around looking for your table number but they make it work. Love it love it!
author: Mymy N.

description:
Who doesn't like chocolate?

Seriously. How can you not love being here? It's the closest thing to Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, without the oompa loompas. Watch a SEA of chocolate stirred by manufacturing machines, processing endless combinations of chocolaty creations: hot fudge, brownies, ice cream, sundaes, hot chocolate, chocolate squares, chocolate bars, oh my! You can't really be disappointed here, especially out-of-towners. 

Tips: When in large groups, order something ridiculously huge like the Earthquake! The chocolate is overpriced but there are free samples!
author: Dave L.

description:
OMG! Is all I have to say for this amazingly delicious candy shop. My bf's cousin and his gf brought us to this famous place in sf. The lines weren't as bad as I expected it to be for a Friday afternoon and they had plenty of seating available, so that was nice. 

We ordered the World Famous Sundae for everyone. The fudge tasted like heaven, so freaking delicious. It was so gooey and tasty. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to everyone who visits SF.
author: Jennifer W.

description: So tonight my girl and I went into the city for a ice cream sundae, and why wouldn't you think of Ghirardelli's ice cream parlor. Right? We were both disappointed. They were very busy, but I don't think I've ever seen them not. The sundaes were melted as we received them. My girl returned hers for a new one as I kept eating mine. Although they were busy it just doesn't cut it if the employees just seemed as they didn't care. It was like we were bothering them. they just missed the mark tonight. Even upon delivering our desserts, the server lays only one damp napkin and two dirty spoons. Next time were going to skip this place and head to Fenton's in Oakland. If you haven't been there, you gotta go.
author: marc j.

description: The best hot fudge sundaes EVERRRR!!!!  At least we got the one with bananas in it so we could also have a serving of fruit ;)  I could literally DRINK that hot fudge it was SO DAMN GOOD.  Who cares if it's crowded and touristy?  The line moves quickly and you get your ice cream really fast!  A must, in my opinion, when you have out-of-town visitors who love ice cream (like my brother and his family!  :)
author: Eileen H.

description:
Hot Fudge.  That's the key ingredient to their sundaes.  Don't get me wrong, their ice cream is good, but man, their hot fudge is amazing!!

If you're a tourist, you've gotta check Ghirardelli Square out.  Whether or not you buy any ice cream, or chocolate, it's up to you...but for $8.95 (sundae), it's an experience.  

Tip 'o the day:  Order some ice cream or sundae, and ask for a "side" of their hot fudge.  It's free, and it'll make your dessert, so much tastier!
author: Daniel M.

description:
"It's not good for you", says the lady behind me in line... Hell yes it isn't! Located in an "interesting" part of San Francisco, the Ghiradelli Chocolate joint is right there, creating the sweet, sweet aroma of chocolate and awesome. I decided to stay old fashioned for my wallet, so got a single scoop of vanilla in a waffle cone. Talk about a healthy portion. Waffle cone, dipped with some ghiradelli awesome and the best damn vanilla ice cream i've had in a while. Nice and light, this whipped ice cream was made to satisfy that palette of yours and take your taste buds into a nirvana. Ha, some of you might think that's a little "over the top", but seriously people, it's that fracking good. I'd come back, my friend got a sea salt hot chocolate which was tasty. Just don't drink the end, it's super salty.

-the foodie

P.S. chocolate? did you say... chocolate? CHOCOLATEEEE!
author: Nick Q.

description: The Sea salted caramel hot cocoa was HEAVEN. yummmmmmmmmmmm. Perfect on a chilly October day!
author: Meribon W.

description: Who can say anything bad about ice cream?  As always, this satisfied my sweet tooth. Could have done without the chocolate dipped waffle cone. Not too fond of their chocolate surprisingly.
author: Monette P.

description:
Went there last night with my daughter to continue our tradition of getting sundaes there each time we visit SF. I was disappointed with their new system of ordering while you stand in line to get in, as opposed to the way it was before (and how almost all restaurants are) when they seat you at a table, give you a menu, and you can decide at your leisure what you want to order. Plus the service was very slow, as it takes them way too long to make a simple sundae (hey, it's not like they have to cook something), and to deliver it to your table. Plus they are expensive for sundaes. 
Nonetheless, they were delicious, as we had the caramel sea salt, hot fudge sundaes. Yum.
author: David W.

description:
Whenever I come here, there's always a line. Both to get in the shop and to order off their menu. But how can you pass up a free sample everytime you walk in? haha

Sure maybe their sundaes are a bit pricey but it's Ghirardelli so I don't care. It's why I'm there.

Now if you can't deal with the long lines to get your sundae, I recommend walking to the far west corner of the plaza where there's a smaller Ghirardelli shop. You don't get the sundae in a nice glass treatment; it comes in a plastic cup. But you get the same great Ghirardelli chocolate with much less waiting.
author: Dow L.

description:
I vowed I wouldn't come here because of all the tourists. But I had just finished a very long bike ride and I needed sustenance. Daughter mentioned that she had been here with her roommate and they each ordered a sundae and as sinful and delicious as it was, the single portion was just too large to finish. 

There are three places within this center where you can just order and not have to sit for service. The door that I went through had 3 cashiers all taking orders so the lines were minimal and the order process was efficient. Although there were 3 of us, I still only ordered a single hot fudge sundae made from their dark chocolate - $8,.50.  Then I waited for the sundae inside where they called my name when it was ready after about 15 minutes. 

The sundae was in a 6" high clear plastic cup with two huge scoops of rich vanilla ice cream intermingled with hot dark chocolate fudge sauce and topped with whipped cream, nuts, and a cherry. True to Daughter's word, it was good. When I first got the sundae, I contemplated ordering another one, but really the size was perfect for the three of us adults. I probably would have been able to almost finish one on my own, but would have regretted it later. 

We enjoyed sharing it outdoors in their patio area where there were plenty of tables as well as steps where you can sit and people watch. It was a bit chilly being that it was around 6pm, but this was a very satisfying treat to reward ourselves at the end of a bike excursion. To top it off, their retail chocolate store was just next door and we were given free Ghiradelli caramel chocolate squares on entry. No need for dessert later but I can hardly wait to go back and get a hot caramel sundae - to share of course!
author: Lily L.

description: During our short vacation in San Francisco, my friends and I stopped by Ghirardelli twice. I almost never dine somewhere twice on vacation since I want to try everything, but that's how much I enjoyed it! Their warm brownie sundae is my favorite dessert of all time. A mountain of rich vanilla ice cream topped with a thick warm chocolate brownie and drizzled in chocolate sauce. Oh so heavenly! Their berries sundae with strawberries and blueberries was also great. All of their decadent sundaes are excellent and big enough to share... Although I prefer not to. :) This is the only ice cream shop that doesn't leave me craving for water. Actually it leaves me craving for more. The line at the entrance moves quickly, too! Mmm... :)
author: Jennifer F.

description:
This Ice cream parlour is a must for any tourist or anyone in general in the area.  It gets really busy, so if you are planning to sit in and you are with more than one person I would recommend ordering for your friend and sending them in to find a table.  The queues are always pretty long but it is worth it, the sundaes are delicious although they are very rich, so don't forget to order a bottle of water :) 

The seats aren't very comfortable, but I guess you will not be there for a very long time.
author: Susana P.

description: This shop is always swarming with tourists, so the ice cream must be good.  (I don't eat ice cream.)  But when I accompanied some friends there recently I was shocked by the poor maintenence of the little outdoor terrace where people eat.  A tiny, inadequate, uncovered trash can was piled high to overflowing.  The tables were sticky and covered with trash.  The floor was littered with trash.  And this is the first thing customers see:  they have to walk through the little terrace to enter the shop.  Other busy cafes manage to bus their tables and empty their trash cans (think Taco Bell).  Why can't Ghirardelli?  They are obviously making money hand over fist.  Can't they hire a clean-up specialist?  It would make the customer experience so much better.
author: Diana B.

description:
I LOVE GHIRARDELLI SQUARE!! That should explain it all. If I wanna hangout in SF with good friends on a nice sunny day out, I would most likely go to Pier39, Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghirardelli Square with them. I've done this routine so many times, ever since freshmen year in highschool, and it never gets old.

Ghirardelli chocolate and ice cream is definitely also one of a kind! It's a MUST HAVE when you go to San Francisco (for tourists), so I'm really surprised when ppl who live in the city have never been here. I love all the variety that they have, and it doesn't taste super thick, although the chocolate flavor is very rich. My favorite would definitely have to be the dark chocolate and the caramel chocolate. Not a big fan of the mint chocolate, even tho mint choco chip ice cream is one of my all-time fav ice creams. 

When you go to ghirardelli square, you MUST go to the ice cream place and get a sundae!!! I LOVE their sundaes!!! favorites would have to be the brownie sundae, cookie bottom sundae, and the original hot fudge sundae. I love the hot fudge...although it does freeze very quickly, so remember to eat it right away! The cream that they put on top is also super tasty. Honestly I can't name what's super special about this place, but it has a very special place in my heart and I absolutely LOVE it!!
author: Louisa L.

description:
I don't feel so bad eating their amazing (and huge) chocolate concoction because immediately thereafter, I was climbing the steepest street of my life to get to Lombard Street.

I am obsessed with Mint Chocolate Chip, so it made perfect sense for me to go with the Mint Bliss. Mint Ice Cream, chocolate syrup, whipped cream, a Ghirardelli chocolate square, and more.

 I could only get through half of it, but there are no words to describe how heavenly this tasted.  Bliss is an understatement. 

I would recommend this place to anyone who loves chocolate, ice cream, or both. They have something for everyone here. Highlight of my trip :-)
author: Karin J.

description:
My husband and I bought some delicious chocolate for our moms here and a banana split to ... split. 

A scoop of chocolate ice cream, strawberry ice cream, and vanilla ice cream with a banana sliced in half the long way, whipped cream, nuts, chocolate syrup, strawberry syrup, and pineapple sauce. We asked to pass on the pineapple and for extra chocolate syrup -- a request that the great staff here obliged. 

The ice cream was a good consistency and texture -- not chalky at all, airy light, but also dense with flavor. The chocolate was divine, but the other flavors were good too. 

There are free samples here of different chocolates; many people apparently come here just for samples.

You order in the front, get a number, grab a seat -- if you're lucky, and wait for your number to be called at the right window. 

I want to try other stuff here, but it's not cheap for what you get, and it's a long line. 

We'll be back!
author: Anh D.

description: Overrated as an ice cream place. Mediocre ice cream, loaded up with lots of sugary sauces and toppings. A popular tourist destination if you have friends coming in town, and it'll fulfill your sugar craving, but for quality go look elsewhere, there are so many other ice cream places in SF that are better!
author: Amelia L.

description: Drools... five pound bar of chocolate bliss... chocolate overdose...
author: Mark W.

description:
SOO EXPENSIVE but....SO rich and delicious.

The Vanilla Milkshake is far from plain and the mudslide sundae is a chocolate lover's fantasy.  SO SO rich and flavorful.  Gotta love Ghirardelli.  Validation for parking is min. $20 purchase...but not hard to do (thats what she said)  esp when these dang sundae's are $6+.  (but def. a  treat)  Recommend (if its busy) to hold up your number when you see a waiter cause sometimes, they miss you and wander the shop for DAYS looking for you...and then when they finally find you, your ice cream is soup.  

Man, tourists are pushy... =/ no need to shove :(
author: Kat C.

description:
here is how I really feel about this place:

$9 on an ice cream sundae. 

yes, that is a questionable endeavor. but how often do you drop by SF anyway? (yes, this is a notoriously touristy place...)

also, a sundae is too many scoops. share it with your lover or mother or brother. 

kids will love it, and this place is sweet to come during the holidays or someone's birthday if you're nearby. 

what I didn't like about this place: 
- my hot fudge was not hot
- none of the workers smiled, except for one guy, and I'll bet he was a manager. it might seem picky but honestly when I go somewhere and no one smiles, I can't help feel a bit bad and part of the experience just disappears. 

sometimes I feel Ghirardelli is all hype; like there are so many hidden gems (or just purely shielded from the tourists) that have substance. maybe they don't have fancy chocolate machines and a whole Square for them, but you catch my drift......

and guess I'm still a fan because this place still is the real-life Willy Wonka factory I thought it was like when I was 10 and first came here..... (there we go again with nostalgic sugar-coating.)

but anyway, I hope the workers smile someday, or it'd be like Willy Wonka abusing his oompa-loompa slaves.
author: Surabhi I.

description:
So I'm not going to improve its overall Yelp score (hopefully), but the Ghirardelli Chocolate location on the east end of the square that sells ice cream makes some killer shakes.  I mean they're delicious.  I only come here when I'm with out-of-towners who MUST come to this landmark, but while I'm here, I try to assuage my own San Francisco sense of guilt for actually patronizing a location in Fisherman's Wharf by thinking of when I came here as a kid (as a true tourist then) and the shop that used to sell the Russian nesting dolls.

Get the chocolate shake if you must come here, and think about it for years until the next time people drag you back.
author: John S.

description:
Very touristy, but SUPER good!!

The only thing that is holding me back from giving this 5 Stars is that its extremely expensive and hurts my wallet :(.  Other than that, I must go!!  Everything here is delicious.

My advice, share with a partner or friend.  Portions are huge!!
author: Ryan G.

description:
I am not a big dessert fan, but am true to "my eyes always want more than my stomach". 

So we ordered a two scoop ice cream, cookies 'n cream and expresso, with chocolate fudge, and my first reaction at the table was "oh, not that big, we might need another one".  

That was nonsense!  It is so rich and flavorful, that you might not even be able to finish the two scoops. 

This is a great dessert spot, with delicious ice creams and shakes. 

It gets crowed on the weekends, and of course attracts a lot of tourists.  It's a fun and good place to go.
author: Michel A.

description: A must go when you visit SF.  If the store in front is too busy, there's another Ghirardelli ice cream store inside.  All stores have the same menu.  Bring a jacket.  It's cold at night.
author: Menoride Y.

description: Over priced but very delicious ice cream sundaes.  Me & My wife shared the brownie dark chocolate Sundae which we killed in 30secs. So delicious! I wasn't impressed by The hot chocolate though
author: Salim G.

description: Loved the variety of chocolates and the chocolate making, Had the best Hot Chocolate - too cold for ice cream unforunately. It was for sure pricey, but we firgured it was a tourist attraction and kind of expected it. We will be returning!
author: Jenee W.

description:
Review for Ghirardelli Chocolate Caffe:

The line was way too long for the sit down Ghirardelli Chocolate. My bf and I opted to go to the quick take out place a couple feet away.

We ordered the warm caramel sundae with caramel chocolate. It came with two scoops of vanilla ice cream and with lots of warm caramel. Simple combination, yet very tasty. 

The ice cream is portable since it comes in a plastic cup.

Store located in West Plaza
Phone: 415.474.1414

Hours:
Mon-Thurs, 8:30am-8pm
Fri 8:30am-10pm
Sat 9am-10pm
Sun 9am-8pm
author: Jackie S.

description:
How can you not like this place?

I love chocolate. Ghirardelli makes pretty good chocolate, and then puts it in giant sundaes. 

Yes, it's near fisherman's wharf, but on the better side of it. This is seriously a beautiful location. I recommend coming during the day to appreciate the scenery, but to beat the crowds come on a weeknight and take advantage of the fact that it's open pretty late.
author: Richa A.

description: Mmm I love chocolate and ice cream!! I shared a ice cream Sundae with my better half. We dined in and it wasn't a problem finding a table the ice cream came promptly. Soo good I highly recommend everything on the menu.
author: arlene d.

description: This place is quite yummy.  The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because it is always packed and hectic so the service feels a little rushed.  However, I think the desserts are worth the wait and price.  The hot chocolate is to die for!  They actually top it off with a square of Ghirardelli chocolate which melts wonderfully into the drink.
author: Jeanne R.

description:
How can you screw up a sundae the previous reviewer wrote?

How about putting the wrong fudge on it and putting so little that it was hardly noticeable? We paid extra for the waffle bowl, but they still wanted extra money after I went back and told them there was so little fudge - and that it was not the one we asked for. Disappointing. I've had better sundaes. So I'd say order one if you really want a sundae, but don't get one just because you are at Ghiradelli. They aren't anything special.
author: Forza M.

description: This place is super crowded but fast. Their hot chocolate is so gross though. I wanted to exchange it for something else (I only took a sip) and the employee who was working on the second floor gave me such a hard time about it that I just left with the nasty hot chocolate. Their sundaes are good so if you're going to get anything, I would get that.
author: Valerie B.

description:
Best ice cream sundae I have ever had in my life. Go the Cookie bottom sundae. It's HUGE, meant to be shared. Substituted one scoop of vanilla ice cream for the ghirardelli chocolate ice cream.  YUMMMMMMMMY! 

Only took a moment to order, got a table right away to sit at, and our sundae arrived within 5 minutes. 

I think the sundae was $8 which is a lot for ice cream in my opinion but it was for sure worth it!
author: Jenny D.

description:
craving for dessert, we decided to go here despite of my dislike of tourist spots.

can't go wrong with this place.
the chocolate itself is no question a good kind.
as expected it was a bit crowded, food pricey.
author: Learnee L.

description: This place is a chocolate/ice cream lovers dream.  It has a cute old fashioned look, and smells absolutely fantastic.  I've been a few times now, and on every visit it has been packed, but don't let that scare you away- they have ice cream down to a science and work very efficiently.  And even if they didn't, it's worth the wait.  Most sundaes will run you about $9 and the average person can expect to finish about half of one....maybe three quarters!  The ice cream, hot fudge, and fresh whip cream will not disappoint- your only problem will be deciding on which sundae to order.  Be sure to stop by the gift store for a free sample and to pick up some chocolate for the road before you head out.  And prepare for a nap once you're done!
author: Amanda S.

description:
this is my go-to spot for dessert. I loove everything served here from brownie sundaes to hot fudge sundaes, but my ultimate favorite is their Hot Cocoa. Chocolatey goodness served with the most creamiest whip cream on top. Talk about a comfort drink at its finest.

The place is usually crowded with tourists and is very hustle and bustle inside, so sometimes we'll go to the Ghiradelli Cafe, which is located at the back of the Square Courtyard. It's a little less hectic and quieter.
author: Ginger M.

description: The biggest mistake I made, is not writing down the name of the sundae I had! My husband and I went here with a friend after dinner while we were in SF. Just stepping into the store and smelling all that chocolate made me giddy with happiness. We each ordered a sundae, ambitious I know, but it was soooooo worth it. I don't remember the name of mine, but it had a vanilla and butter pecan ice cream with dark chocolate and salted caramel and it was outstanding. I could totally go eat two sundaes for dinner once a week. It's a good thing there is no Ghirardelli shop near where I live.
author: Natasha P.

description: Not worth the hype. I ordered the salted chocolate ice cream. There was not enough chocolate. The line was long and then you have to find your own table. I guess you have to try it if you are coming for the first time. The vanilla ice cream was just ok. My husband and kids loved it. Super expensive! I was disappointed.
author: gator N.

description:
OH MY GOSH
I had the best chocolate milk shake EVER!
author: Minori S.

description:
Hot Fudge Sundae. :] 
Probably the first ice cream that doesnt leave me thirsty afterwards. 

 [-1 star] 

We called ahead on Vday asking when they closed, and i was told 1 am. 
1am?!  like LMFAO's YESSSSS!  so i was pretty excited about bringing my lil sister with us. 

We get there at 11:58 and as i was walking up those damn stairs.. i get a bad feeling..  in my head.. *where is everyone.*

We even opened the door  to have them tell us they were closed. UGHHH. what a fail. had to run to the corner liqueur store to buy those stoopid chocolate squares & haagan daz.. boo.
author: Dee W.

description: Hot fudge sundae. Yum!!! Very bz place as usual and can get unorganized. I had to hunt somebody down for an order they missed.
author: sherlock w.

description:
I love this as a late night or any hot day place to have some ice cream. The sundae is big so if you just want a little dessert I recommend bringing your date and enjoying it together.

Plus afterwards you can stoll along the pier and burn some calories. :)
author: Carol Y.

description:
Fantastic ice cream sundaes.  The dark chocolate hot fudge is YUMMY!  

The free chocolate candy sample provided to patrons is a great perk.
author: Kim S.

description:
You know I really like Ghirardelli chocolates, but somehow I'm not a big fan of their sundaes and shakes. They are a little too OD'ed on chocolate for my taste - I don't like being forced into chocolate. 

It's a 1-time experience though if you're just visiting SF!
author: Shradha A.

description: Indulge!! Satisfying portion but on the pricy side. The place that I come to to enjoy the weekend
author: Michelle K.

description: This was absolutely delicious. It was kind of controlled crowd and people eat and move on so it's fine. We enjoyed our sundaes with a fabulous hot fudge and it was a very good experience for sure.
author: Lourdes E.

description:
kind of touristy but a must try.
fun for the kids.
author: Addison P.

description:
Ghirardelli is a staple of San Francisco and if you're a chocolate fan, this is the place to go. Although it is a haven for tourists, locals can appreciate the history of Ghirardelli Square and can't help but stop by and order a sundae with friends or some hot cocoa on a cold night after visiting the Wharf or Pier 39. Since it is a tourist destination, be prepared for long lines during good weather or during the holiday season. The lines tend to go out the door on some days, which is why a couple steps out the door you've got a menu to read from so you know what to order once you get inside. If you do manage to go inside and order up, make sure you have someone to save you a seat because those are snatched up within milliseconds. Just a warning.

Although it is pricey, you get a huge serving that you can share with another or if you're that hungry and greedy, you can finish it all yourself. My experience with their desserts was that it was very sweet and definitely an indulgence. I had their very berry sundae and their original hot fudge sundae, both were equally rich and decadent. So if you have a major sweet tooth, you've met your match.
author: Leslie K.

description: Really good Sundaes but be ready to WAIT in LONG LINES. We went for an after dinner treat at 7:15 & we waited about an hour. Chocolate sauce is great. Just not sure I would wait an hour if I knew ahead of time.
author: Ch A.

description:
This place is sort of hit or miss.  It is very extremely touristy, but I believe it is a good touristy.  If you're in San Francisco, go here and get some chocolate (and get ice cream if you want some pretty good but not amazing ice cream).  I like going here to see all the different types of tourists.  I get the cable car sundae, with 3 different types of ice cream and a slew of toppings.  It's pretty good, but not life changing.

To sum up, if you're up here to do the tourist thing, along with getting Boudin sourdough, get some Ghirardelli chocolate too.
author: Shawn M.

description: The decor is really cute here. It's like an old ice cream parlor with nicer accents here and there. The ice cream sundae with the yummy Ghirardelli hot fudge and the works is absolutely amazing even if the weather is freezing!!! Every spoonful makes me want another. The wait for the order takes a while, but you can buy a bag of Ghirardelli chocolate while your waiting for your order as well as a seat. LoL This place is pretty busy, but it's worth the wait to me because I love desserts with hot fudge! =P
author: Anji W.

description: I'm a fan of desserts so I can't give this place a bad rating. However I didn't find their ice cream to be anything special. It was also a bit on the pricey side for the small portion that I got. At Fenton's, I would get twice as much for the same price. Oh yeah, finding parking in the area on a weekend took about 30 minutes so plan your visit accordingly. I don't think I'd ever come back.
author: Bernard L.

description:
Meh. High expectations always leads to a higher let down.

My boyfriend and I came here after shopping in SF and we ordered a hot fudge sundae with a banana. Don't remember what it was called exactly, but the ice cream that came with it kept melting before we got to it and it wasn't that great.. The display of the desserts are really pretty which is what made me want to come here in the first place, but I wouldn't expect it to be something I wouldn't be able to make at home with my own melted Ghirardelli chocolate.
author: Stephanie N.

description: I was not surprised that the ice cream and chocolate was amazing, I am shocked that the service was equally as awesome! Everyone was super friendly and helpful.
author: Aliyah H.
