description: This place is awful! I have gotten better sundaes at coffee shops. We waited 30 minutes for your ice cream to be brought to us. There is standing room only. People were fighting over our table when we got up. The employees bringing our deserts did not speak English. They screwed up part of our order and two employees were not able to help. Huge disappointment. We won't be back.
author: JJ M.

description:
oh delicious cheesecake ice cream and brownie sundaes
love of my tastebuds and bane of my waistline
author: Nadine A.

description:
Yes.  Ghirardelli is a definitely an item to checkoff the list while in SF, but what I am confused about is why on earth Ghirardelli wouldn't take better advantage of this tourist attraction and expand their chocolate and ice cream shop in order to accommodate those massive crowds, especially during the summer.

BOTH times I have been here the lines has been ridiculous, and not the "you gotta have this" type-of-ridiculous, but more of the "this is insane, a fire hazard, why isn't this place setup better, it's a cluster, expand the restaurant to accommodate the crowds, have a flow to the restaurant, what are the managers doing, did you get your order yet because I've been waiting for 45 minutes, the servers just dumped out ANOTHER order of hot chocolate that was sent back for being "cold" hot chocolate, woah a table just opened so an elephant stampede of strollers, purses, bags with souvenirs, keys, flip flops (for those tourists that thought SF is a tropical location) and all sorts of items going flying towards the table to claim it" type-of-ridiculous.

During my second visit, I observed this place for AN HOUR while I waited for my one sundae and hot chocolate order that NEVER came.  The servers are wonderful and I can tell they work hard, but someone needs to let them know that a hot chocolate should not be made and sit out for 20 minutes until the sundaes are complete.  Nobody wants "luke warm chocolate" with their hot fudge sundaes.. it ruins the magic of the whole thing that you just paid top dollar for.

With that being said, who is responsible for directing the servers?  The management.  During my hour observation, I noticed that a girl manager was wandering around just filling napkin dispensers and trying to avoid the angry mob of customers waiting for their treats.  As a manager myself, you have staff that can do those mediocre tasks; YOU are responsible for the entire function of the restaurant, including your customers' experiences, your staff's tasks, the quality of the food, the safety of your guests and staff, creating a fun environment where people want to continually spend money and tell their friends, family and coworkers in order for your business to be successful and grow even more.  The younger guy manager did end up refunding me my money after he looked at his watch and the time stamp on my bill, but he barely took the time to listen to a word I said.  It wasn't worth a fight... I was tired, hungry and disappointed in the whole experience... WHICH IS THE WORST THING YOU COULD HEAR AS A MANAGER.

I guess Ghirardelli just expects that their brand name is a good enough and it probably does make them a lot of money... but there are ways to make MORE $$ with some changes to one of the biggest attractions in SF.  I'll fix it.. hire me as your senior manager. ;)
author: Baylee P.

description: As you walk into the store, you are greeted with a sample of their chocolate square. YUM! I forgot what dessert shake we got, but the idea of it is a "drinkable sundae" and damn that cup was just the epitome of "getting chocolate wasted".  It's VERY VERY sweet; rich chocolate fudge drowning in a chocolate shake  sprinkled with chocolate chips on top. Hahaha it was a bit much to even try but some people like that! I ordered the brownie and that was very gooey, & chocolatey.  Sooo sweet it hurts! If you are opting for a shake, it will cost you no more than 6.95.
author: Connie C.

description:
As true tourists, my husband and I made sure Ghirardelli Square (and specifically, Ghirardelli Shop) was on our list of places to visit. What a waste. Knowing that it's a popular destination, I didn't mind waiting in line for about 10 minutes. However, I did mind waiting for 10 minutes only to find out the item I wanted to get (one of the Painted Ladies) was sold out, and they couldn't be bothered to mark it on the "menu" out front. Fine. I quickly looked over the menu as the cashier rolled his eyes at me (because I was supposed to intuitively know they were out of what I wanted) and placed my order. We managed to luck out and get a table outside which seemed like a great way to pass the time. Unfortunately, I instead passed the time waiting in line again because the cashier forgot to ring up one of our coffees. Thank goodness I was able to go to the other cashier who not only walked back and got the coffee herself but didn't charge me for it either. However, even that didn't make up for what we received.

When our Painted Lady came out, we excitedly dug in, only to find that more than half of the tall sundae glass was filled with whipped cream that tasted off. Two small dollops of ice cream and two small layers of chocolate fudge are not worth the $10. Splitting this was almost a joke, but we tried to make the best of it because neither of us wanted to wait in line again. I alternated it with my luke-warm cappuccino (which is the temp it came out as) just to give it some flavor (not that it tasted much better).

Overall, I didn't have incredibly high expectations for this place going into it since it is a giant tourist destination. The wait and crowds were understandable. However, the attitude of the first cashier, the joke of a towering whipped cream sundae, and the forgotten/room temp coffees were way below what I had expected. It became the running joke of the rest of our trip. Hopefully they can up their game for the other tourists who get suckered into this place.
author: k a.

description:
Even though it's usually a very busy place the service quick.  If you are with a group have someone go into the seating area and save a table.

If you like chocolate this is the place to be. 

You're in San Francisco so parking is always an issue.
author: Jimmy P.

description: Worst Chocolate ever! It was very rich and disgusting. The packaged squares are great, but everything else is really bad. Also, the price is insanely high. It took me 55 minutes to get one milkshake. When I asked when it would be out, the person just said it would be out soon. Half hour later, it arrives. I also waited 25 minutes in line just to order.
author: Christopher H.

description:
Ghirardelli Square is a beautiful location to walk around at night but you can't come here and not grab some dessert or hot chocolate! I was able to stop by the store and get a free sample chocolate square before my friends got there too. 

There was a line out the door at Ghirardelli Chocolate but it moved quickly before my eyes. This is what happened: we stood in line and decided what we wanted, paid when we got to the cashier, received a number for our order, then scoped out a table to sit down at. It was crowded so we hovered by a table that looked like they were ready to leave. =P

regular size hot cocoa - It was hot, thick and chocolatey but wasn't powdery or too watered down. Perfect cup of hot chocolate in my opinion! I finished mine of course and it did its job to warm me up. Thumbs up!

salted caramel hot cocoa - Interesting concept but was way too sweet for me. I definitely was able to taste the saltiness from one sip...I don't think I would have been able to finish an entire mug of this though.

I don't remember the specific prices but it was around $13 for 2 regular hot cocoas and one salted caramel one. Not bad at all since we were able to sit in there as long as we wanted too. 

The reason I docked a star was because the wait took FOREVER (around 20-30 min) for our drinks. We saw plenty of ice cream sundaes pass us by...does it really take that long to make hot cocoa?? Also for the fact that they didn't have the decency to wipe off our mugs before dropping them off at our table. I guess that's what happens during their busy hours.

I would come back for sure to indulge in their delicious beverages again! At least I know what to expect of the service next time.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Hot Chocolate and Original Ice Cream Sundae = $14.

Walking in you order what you want from the front, and then you have to find your own seating inside. I believe there is window where you can order items to go.

I was lucky to find seating immediately on a Sunday afternoon.  The ice cream sundae was as good as I remembered from years ago. I think it's the hot fudge; its rich and sweet without that cloying sugar-iness that other toppings can have.  I haven't tried their other desserts, but hope to do so next time.
author: Janet P.

description:
Go big our go home right? Heck yes...I've been here on several occasions and each time I've ordered the "Earthquake."  8 scoops of ice cream, doused with caramel, butterscotch, hot fudge, pineapple and a bunch of other toppings that make this behemoth absolutely delicious!  Mind you, i've always ordered this with at least 3 other people with me bc its a lot of ice cream.

I brought my godson here when he was 6.  He ordered one scoop of vanilla ice cream with rainbow sprinkles. I thought "Thats it?!"  and asked him if he was sure, and explained that we were where chocolate is born.  Couldn't convince him to get anything chocolate...at least I tried!  

Service is fast and everyone is very friendly!  Plenty of clean tables and napkins (for those of us that are messy with our ice cream).  If you can't find a table, don't forget to check upstairs!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Since day one of finding out that I was going to San Francisco for work all I have been doing is plotting my trip to Ghiradelli's. Now, I have only visited this Chocolate Store/Ice Cream Shop one time before about three years ago, but needless to say it made a lasting impression. 

Sunday was going to be the only day that I had enough time to make it to Fisherman's Wharf and get my beloved ice cream treat. The search was on. I left my hotel around 11 am to head over to Pier 39 to do a little sight seeing as I walked to the store/shop. I was tempted by various other shops like Ben and Jerry's, ColdStone, and dare I say Godiva, but I knew what was in store for me if only I walked just a little bit further and low and behold there it was. My little Chocolate Heaven - Ghiradellis Chocolate and Ice Cream Shop. 

When I walked in I was overwhelmed on what I should have. Everything looked and smelled soooo delicious. I decided to take baby steps into this decision. First I had to choose either an ice cream sundae or a shake. It was a nice day out and I wanted to continue to walk around, so I decided to go for the shake. Then it was what kind of shake. I opted for the Nob Hill Chill - Vanilla ice cream, with dark chocolate syrup and chocolate chips on top. Man was I not disappointed. It was outrageous!!! By far the best shake I have ever sipped. 

The only thing I wish was that they had a Ghiradelli's Chocolate and Ice Cream shop closer to NY.
author: Crissy H.

description: The ice cream sundaes here are bomb!  My favorite is the gold rush sundae. (Peanut butter chocolate vanilla ice cream goodness). Also the salted Carmel hot chocolate is fabulous! If you like chocolate this is the place for you!!!
author: Abigail K.

description:
It's easy for us locals to not appreciate what is in our own backyard. The Golden Gate Bridge is too cold. Pier 39 too packed with tourists. Golden Gate Park too sketchy. On and on.

I often fall into that trap, and more often than not, visit and come away with new appreciation for what was once an unappreciated gem. Happened last night at the Ghirardelli Ice Cream shop. My grandparents were celebrating their 59th anniversary and after an exceptional dinner at The Pub (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-pub-ghirardelli-square-san-francisco#hrid:CfSW_vVHmgensmQmbZmlXw) we came for ice cream. Perhaps I was caught up a bit in the moment, but when you get a chance to share a root beer float with your grandpa and sister while watching your grandma absolutely own every bite of a coffee ice cream waffle cone (her favorite), you can't help but appreciate everything you've got.

Tourists might be the ones most apt to come, but us locals have just as good a reason to make some of our own memories too.
author: Jason B.

description:
Oops, my mistake! (I think I chose the wrong 'Ghiradelli chocolate') 

 "What? No one has Yelped this place yet? How is that possible? 
Well, it's probably because having lived for six years in San Francisco, I had not yet known about this place, either. (A few classmates told me about it last year, ha ha.) 

A perfect place to take the out of towners or the 'rents, they're open till late and serve up HUGE sundaes and free samples (just make sure you don't bring children under 10 that late at night. If you do, I am not responsible for their sugar high.) Right in the heart of Ghiradelli square, it's an old fashioned ice cream fountain- most of the patrons are visitors from outta town, but what the heck? You have to do it sometime! 

We took the 'rents a few weeks ago and they LOVED it- yes, our group actually managed to eat an entire "Earthquake" sundae (A virtual "bargain" at $19 since each sundae costs $7-9) 

In an ideal world, I would have taken them to 'real homemade' ice cream at Joe's on Geary, but since the 'rents tend to love the cheese factor of places like this, we ended up here. 
Also, if you can find the 'entertainment' book, there's a 2 for 1 coupon for sundaes."
author: M'ia K.

description:
Okay, I'm lactose, but I decided to eat here anyways because as soon as I walked in, the smell was unresistable!! LOL!

I got the brownie sundae, which absolutely blew my mind!! Maybe because I haven't had dairy in like a year, so I was savoring each bite. No, I lied, i gobbled the thing down like I was starving!! 

You know how theres some ice creams where its sweet, and taste good at first, then the sweetness kind of fades away and it becomes too sweet, that you don't finish it? Well, Ghirardelli ice cream is sweet, but not sweet enough to say UGH, I don't want it anymore. More like, FUCK GIVE ME MORE!!! Hahaha.

I'm definitely coming here again!!
author: Kim V.

description:
Probably one of the most touristy spots in San Francisco. It's great fun though! Menu is expensive but if you split it with someone, I guess it'll be okay. I had a hot chocolate and I shared the banana sundae with a friend. It didn't blow me out of the water but I definitely tasted more chocolate than I would if I got something from Baskin Robbins or Coldstone. 

If you are vacationing or dropping by San Francisco, check this place out. If chocolate isn't your thing, then I'd go somewhere else to get ice cream!
author: Emily L.

description: Busy.  Free coffee with chocolate croissant and there is more dark chocolate than croissant.  Ice cream is good but not the best I have had.  Nice touristy spot over all.
author: Chris N.

description: You have to go. I had the Sundae. The hot chocolate was great. The lines can be crushing, but we usually go late, and that works out well. There were some prom kids. The last time. I love this store. I love the Restaurant. Mr. Ghirardelli would be proud, on the commitment to quality.
author: Allan D.

description: The bf likes coming here on days we wanna be SF tourists. Everyone loves a sundae even when it's freezing cold outside! I like coming here, the system works pretty well. I honestly would give it a 3.5 if yelp would let me. But since I can't I'll give them 4. Why not 5? The prices are kind of steep and when you look at your sundae you aren't getting much, but it's the Ghirardelli chocolate fudge that's hooking it up. Also this place gets packed, so make sure someone in your crew saves a table for you. Can't front on SF though, it's a great spot to take peeps that are visiting. Take pics by the sign!
author: Marie P.

description:
Everyone says this is a must to visit when you're In San Francisco. It's def a tourist trap, but its a fun/quick place to visit. There's not much to do here other than eat and buy chocolates. There's also a cupcake place and a dog boutique in the square. 

OMG, the ice cream is delish! They have a long menu to choose from. I got the chocolate dipped cone with ghiradelli chocolate and cookies n cream. The ice cream was awesome, but i didnt like the cone too much because it was dipped in dark chocolate. Really great service! The waitresses are all sooo nice and bring your order with a smile. Next to the ice cream parlour is the chocolate shop. It's always packed, but there are so many chocolate souvenirs to bring home.
author: Chynna Y.

description: Their sundaes and hot chocolate are worthy of the hype. Best hot cocoa.
author: K C.

description: I had the Treasure Island which is a warm brownie sundae. It's basically their famous hot fudge with a brownie. I also had a sea salt caramel hot cocoa which came with a square of their chocolate.
author: Laurene J.

description: It doesn't get any better than Ghiradelli's Hot Fudge Brownie Sundae.  My wife and I always split one whenever we get a chance whether it's in San Francisco or downtown Chicago.  We made the mistake once of each of us getting our own.  There's a reason that our parents never let us eat ice cream for dinner.
author: Michael B.

description:
It's probably my fault for getting a chocolate chip cookie here. It's clearly a place for complicated ice cream shakes. My friends enjoyed their shakes, and the portions for everything did seem pretty generous. On the other hand, isn't a cookie a pretty important staple?

The cookie had an odd texture -- it felt like it had gotten compressed or something, so it was super dense but didn't taste moist at all. The flavors also felt separated, like I could still taste salt and sugar crystals while chewing on it. The chocolate was very good, but I found myself not wanting to finish the cookie at all, and any of my friends can tell you that I'm quite the cookie monster.

Did I mention that it cost me $3.50? If you're not eating ice cream here, go over to Kara's and get a cupcake for less than that.
author: Sharon W.

description: Insanely touristy, parking is impossible to find, very expensive. With that said, this place is a must-taste for everybody, tourist or bay area local. The sundaes are enough to send you into a diabatic coma for 72 hours, the fudge is thick enough to need hot chocolate to melt it down so your tongue can taste again, and the ice cream is rich but not to the point where you couldn't potentially finish a sundae to yourself.
author: Beini S.

description: This is my must-stop shop whenever I'm in San Francisco! Obviously I am a dessert fiend, and this is always worth a visit! The last time I was here was three weeks ago for a graduation trip with my boyfriend. We split the brownie sundae and it was as rich, gooey, and divine as I imagined it would be! Although this is normally a tourist trap and desserts are a bit overpriced, you're paying for the brand and you get what you pay for. Sinfully delicious desserts and a view of the chocolate being made in the shop. Plus we were serenaded by one of the workers which was random but sweet! Of course I will find my way back to Ghirardelli next time I am in San Fran!
author: Char P.

description: This place was going to get a five stars review once i walked in and the guy stuffed free ghiardelli chocolate into my hands! A couple tears of joy dripped down my face. Just for that i had to buy a bar of their coconut chocolate. That free chocolate really made my day much better :)
author: Jeremy R.

description: Had so much fun.  The place wasn't crowded when we went (Thu night at 7pm).  We ordered the banana split and it was great.  Felt like being a child again.  Great memories.  Could have used more chocolate sauce.
author: Megan B.

description: We understand that Ghirardelli Chocolate is pretty well-known and for good reason but this place was not what we expected. It was very cramped and confusing to navigate through. Got lost at one point trying to find the ordering station to get an overpriced sundae and iced coffee. We spent about $13 total for two items but we guess that's what you pay when your touring SF and stopping at all the touristy spots and you got a sweet tooth. On the bright side, If you love love chocolate and love it even more mixed with ice cream then the hot fudge sundae is definitely for you! The ice cream is drowned in chocolate and the whipped cream and cherry are the perfect toppings!
author: ShanDee R.

description:
My niece & nephew's very first trip to the city and my niece was insistent on dessert (auntie was so proud). I grew up with Ghirardelli... so there was no better way to introduce them to SF than with a thick, vanilla ice cream, gooey, hot fudge sundae with whip cream and a cherry.

The shop was packed on this brisk Sunday evening. Sundaes, shakes, cones of all yummy-yummy-good flavors and hot cocoa all appeared from behind the counter to smiles and giggles. Heaven! A bit messy but, then, no trip is complete without a 2-year old's cute face covered with fudge.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Recently made a pit stop there on a road trip from seattle to san francisco.  The sundae that we ordered was really good however extremely over priced.  It is a total tourist trap for the amount that you are paying.
author: Daniel B.

description: OM!!  This is the place for great sundaes if you are by Fisherman's Wharf!  The chocolate syrup is the best i've ever had!
author: Makia W.

description:
Absolutely the best :)

I love getting sundaes here after my boyfriend told me how amazing they are. My favorite is the brownie sundae. :D Super chewy brownie square with a mountain of ice cream topped with chocolate sauce (I get dark chocolate), whipped cream, chopped nuts and a cherry. Hands down the best sundae I ever ate.

The store can get crowded no matter what day and time. I suggest going on a weekday early because most people are at work... Not getting a sundae :P The seating can be limited as well but that's never too hard to find, most people are there to eat the sundae and go. The service is pretty speedy considering how busy it gets, at most I've waited for 5 minutes. (which is not bad at all)

I can't wait to go back again and again, I'm going to try more sundaes and I'm sure I won't be disappointed. :)
author: Stephanie J.

description:
If I'm ever close to Fisherman's Wharf, I will automatically head over the Ghiradelli square for dessert.  Not only do they have great desserts and sundaes, but they also have a huge range of options for anyone's sweet-tooth.  Don't go for the sake of just tasting chocolate or ice cream.  Go for the desserts that you love and that are offered.  Cookie, coffee, brownie, caramel, and gluttony fans should all be excited for a sundae right up their alley.

Just a heads up: these sundaes are extremely sweet and should probably be shared between 2 people.  If you're not that much of a sweet-tooth, get a coffee on the side.  It tastes great and it'll balance out the totally-worth-it sugar overload.
author: Julie C.

description: Love their chocolatier shop.  Their ice cream sundaes hit the spot, but better share or you might feel like you need to run for a week to work it all off!  Inside their retail store they welcome you with a sweet treat sample of the Ghirardelli squares.  Flavor depends on the season.
author: Dee H.

description: Tasty dark chocolate espresso ice cream sundae - gotta love the 86% cocoa =D  Being a one of the main tourist attractions in Fisherman's Wharf, the place was packed.  They have a variety of chocolaty goods ranging from the squares to sundaes, ice cream, etc.  Prices are very reasonable given the portions and it's def worth at least one stop if you're ever in the area.
author: Eric F.

description: Okay but not worth the price. The sundaes were just not that great. Plus, finding a seat is like being at a concert with general admission - everybody scurrying around trying to find some place to sit. I guess that's what you get for a tourist trap. Do make sure to get your parking validated, it'll save you $6 in parking.
author: Steve B.

description:
I'm giving this place 4 stars because of the product. I had a hot fudge sundae and it was superb, just like the other ones i have had there. 

I'm deducting 3 stars for the service. We put our order in, found a table right away which in that place is a miracle in itself. We enjoyed watching people coming in and going out. 

Now after sitting there and watching several people/groups come in, get a table, get their treats, eat their treats, get up and go, while we were still sitting there looking at a bare table we figured something was kind of wrong here. AT least 4 groups of people came in after we did and got their orders before we did. The receipt had the time in on it so looked at my watch and 40 minutes had passed. Oh My!!!! 

So we flagged down a worker and voiced our displeasure. He asked for the receipt and left. Approximately 10 minutes later he showed up with our hot fudge sundae's. 

And now I take away the last star for stupidity.
author: Charlie O.

description: Parking is a chore, the wait is ridiculous, the tourists are annoying. But the ice cream is dense--it's like they doubled the butterfat or something. They give you a fair amount that goes a long way. Preferably to the nearest hammock for a sugar coma.
author: Brian W.

description: Ghiradelli chocolate.. in ice cream, candy and drinks. You cant go wrong with any of it. Its chocolate. Its yummy, its sinful, its awesome!!
author: Laura T.

description: It was really good ice cream. But I failed to see the specialty.
author: Mohd I.

description: If you're going to go, go Ghirardelli chocolate. The ice cream is amazing. Don't foof it up, just get it in a hand dipped waffle bowl and savor the perfection. Sure the other stuff is delicious too, but it's Ghirardelli's for heavens' sake. Ambiance is loud to din almost constantly, service is lackluster and s l  o     w.  Expect your ice cream to have begun it's journey back to liquid state by the time you see it.  There's also frequently a long line to get in. But it is one of those things you have to do. We keep going back.
author: Terry G.

description: Whenever my husband and I visit SF, we make sure to end our trip with a visit to Ghirardelli's for a cup of hot soy chocolate milk with sea salt.  It's delicious and very comforting.
author: Soo S.

description: The chocolate shop always has a nice person with a smile and a sample. Great customer relations.
author: George T.

description: I was definitely disappointed with The Gold Rush sundae. :( It barely had any ice cream. I felt like all I was eating was the whip cream. It's not worth $8.95. I'd rather go to McDonald's and get a sundae for less than $2.
author: Fallon P.

description: Ok so yes the hot chocolate does cure sadness and the their sundaes make babies stop crying, BUT, the tables are never clean, and none of the employees know what's going on.  We ordered 2 hot chocolates and one sundae and we received 2 hot chocolates and the employee took our number so we tried to get her attention as she walked away and never heard us.  So we flagged down another employee, told her someone took our number without giving us the sundae, we showed her the receipt and in a few minutes finally got our sundae without any spoons and we are talking like normal people do so we don't notice until she walked away so I took the liberty upon myself to walk to the counter and reach over and grab spoons for myself.  I left with sticky elbows, a headache, and I will now make my own hot chocolate from now on.
author: Mike A.

description:
Dunno what all the fuss is about.   Mediocrity.  Tourist trap.  Chocolate is not memorable.
who cares about the machines?
author: Bobbie B.

description:
Hot fudge Sunday on a cold Sunday sounds yummy!

I've tried the hot fudge, banana split and some other icecreams and so far the hot fudge is my favorite at this place. The service is okay for a place that caters to large volumes of tourists and its always difficult to find parking around this place. I usually avoid the crowd by going on a Sunday evening or a weekday.
author: Rahul P.

description:
It is the place to go. It is $10 for a sundae. Get the 10% off coupon by checking in or going to a tourist center where you can grab the coupon. The chocolate sauce
Is good, but the ice cream lacks flavor and  creaminess.
author: Gwen R.

description: Being a native to the Bay Area practically all my life doesn't necessarily mean that I've experienced everything it has to offer. In this case, the phrase "better late than never" would apply. I don't venture out to the Wharf as often as I'd like to, so I try to take some advantage when I do. To close off an outing with one of my former co-workers, we headed here with her son to get some ice cream. While looking at the menu, my eyes immediately zoned in on their banana split, dubbed The Golden Gate. Done! I conquered the beaut all by my lonesome and it was delish to the very last bite. I don't think I've ever put away that much ice cream in my life. Not to say that it'll never happen again. I'm more than willing to drop by and grab another one when the wannabe SF tourist in me decides to.
author: Rhia R.

description:
AN EIGHT DOLLAR SUNDAE.  It's like the Five Dollar Shake in Pulp Fiction, adjusted for inflation.

Unlike the Five Dollar Shake, it does not live up to its price tag. It is not sprinkled with gold dust.  It is not made with organic, locally raised blah blah blah ingredients. So what's the deal? Well, Ghirardelli Square is populated largely with tourists who have been prompted by guidebooks to make a pilgrimage to the land of this great chocolatier. I'm guessing the combination of anticipation and dutiful check-it-off-the-list sightseeing, along with the fact that no sundae is going to be actually bad, keeps the place open. 

Yes, I did try a sundae, because I fell into the anticipation trap. It was fine. The ice cream is garden variety Dreyer's, and tastes like it.  I find Ghirardelli chocolate to be good, but not great, and I would rate the toppings as such. Nothing to write home about, seriously. If someone gives you an article of clothing that says "My soandso went to Ghirardelli Square and all I got was this lousy t-shirt", you got a better deal.

AN EIGHT DOLLAR SUNDAE.
author: Janna M.

description:
One word, one syllable - YUMMMMM!

Just don't pay attention to how expensive they are, and just indulge! I had the Brownie Shake and my husband had the Caramel Shake. Both were unbelievable! 

They rocked our world!
author: Jessica A.

description:
What a disappointment!  

Ghirardelli's has always been the end game of any tourist visit we take to the city.  Out of town guest or a group of suburban kids -- it has always been a memorable way to finish our day of showing off SF.

We made it to the Original Ghirardelli's after a crowded day touring the city.  The amazing thing is that there wasn't the standard long line out the door into the courtyard.  I thought we were lucky to hit it right, but it was actually a shame.

The reason we had no line is that Ghirardelli must have changed it's operation.  The cashiers who took our orders zipped us through - rudely.  We ordered with a sense of panic.  Our guests didn't even have time to look at the menu - we just pointed to pictures and said that one.  We had barely paid, when the casher yelled, "Next ready customer."  People were jumping line to get in front of others who had no idea how to order without a menu.

Then we entered the table area with our order number.  All the tables were taken, which is normal, but there were 2 or 3 groups standing with their order number for every table.  The line that used to stretch outside, now fills up the aisles inside -- both upstairs and downstairs!  To get a table you need to become slightly aggressive and hover over other tables that appear to be leaving soon.  

The best strategy became to ask a table that was eating if you could put your order number on the table while they were eating. Honestly, it took that long to get the order that the previous patrons would be gone by the time your order arrived.  

I can't believe that they are allowed to operate this way.  it was so crowded  that the staff couldn't navigate around.  

As for the Sundaes, I've always found them overpriced for what you get.  A trip to Ghirardelli's was really about the experience and now that experience has become unpleasant.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Let me start by saying I LOVE Ghirardelli chocolate. It is great to eat and by favorite chocolate to bake with. 

The sundae I got at the ice cream shop was of course good, but nothing overly special. The line to order the ice cream moved fairly quickly and my friends both got their orders within a few minutes, but I didn't get mine until they were done with theirs which was a little awkward. I'm still glad I got it, but next time I would probably just stick with their hot chocolate (it was cold!) and get cheaper, just as good ice cream somewhere else.
author: Amy S.

description: Free samples! Ice Cream! Hot chocolate! Have been here several times and enjoy making a visit here and there for some ice cream. It's quite tasty and they have all sorts of different combinations. I've only ever had a scoop or two in a cone or bowl, haven't ever been hungry enough to try one of their amazing looking sundaes. Hot chocolate is also some of the best I've had! Also, when the line is long and crowded, if you know where to go, you can get service a bit faster.
author: Lily K.

description: It doesn't matter if you do or don't like chocolate, you should still come out here and check it out!!! Before you are even at the store, you can smell the sweetness in the air. :).  I am not a big fan of sweets, but I still had fun and enjoyed the ice cream.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I LOVE ICE CREAM ON A WINDY SF NIGHT! 

The boyfriend and i shared the banana sundae was which AWESOME though our first scoop was melted due to the chocolate fudge. while the 2nd scoop was resting on top, it was saved. Every bite made me smile, and with every smile my boyfriend was happy ;) 

We finished the sundae in such a fast pace that i started to get said that the experience was all over already. so then i got myself just scoops of vanilla! and it started all over again =) At least i had my chocolate strawberry for the trip home ;) white chocolate with drizzles of milk chocolate atop of huge strawberry. YUM!

Complimentary waters, the waiter staff are very helpful with cleaning and bringing water.
author: Linda L.

description: It's worth the drive for the experience of seeing the kids faces when the huge banana split comes to the table. The gleeful exited smiles, eager to tackle the challenge of finishing the sundae (without brain freeze) makes the drive and somewhat arduous parking situation worth it. The menu is extensive, and it's nice they actually have a sundae for folks who don't particularly like chocolate (I'll never quite understand that). Now that they've opened up a second sundae spot up at the top of the square the main part is not AS crowded...but there's still usually a bit of a line to order and an even longer wait to find a table. Part of the trick is sending out someone in your group to hover over any table that looks like they might remotely finish up their sundaes in the next 5-10 minutes.
author: Kristy C.

description:
How can you screw up ice cream? Answer: You can't!  Big hot fudge sundaes with lots of great toppings. Huge delicious shakes (shoulda gotten a malt). 

Bonus! Some of our group didn't want to spend $9 for an ice cream, but a server stopped by and asked if we wanted a free sundae.  Someone asked for no cherries and they messed up, so we gained!  At least they didn't throw it away.
author: Jeff G.

description:
A tourist attraction in SF for sure! But I can't help myself but finding my way there for an afternoon snack everytime! It doesn't matter if it's a hot summer day or cold rainy day, I can go to Ghirardelli any time...

Hot chocolate sundae is so delish!!! And we get free bite of chocolate to taste! ;))
author: Florence W.

description: Perfect place to take your guests or just to act like a tourist! Craving a sundae on a hot day or hot chocolate on a cold night? Ghirardelli Chocolate is the perfect place for you! I love how they have an express option which is less packed than the actual restaurant. The employees are super friendly and the desserts are delicious!
author: Joyce E.

description:
It's Ghiradelli and its been yelped over 500 times, so I say to you this much....

1. its not overrated
2. the chocolate is amazing
3. get a sundae!!
4. (shhhh!) the cookies are surprisingly amazing! Get one for your walk around fisherman's wharf!
author: Shelly A.

description:
We walked through the chocolate store this afternoon and were given a Peppermint Chocolate square as a sample upon entering through the doors.  One bite into that chocolate sample, and I was in heaven.  

After spending only about 5 mins in the store, I didn't see anything that stood out to me, so I left.  On the way out, I observed very happy people buying assorted chocolates, discussing chocolatey things, all while seemingly in a chocolatey daze.  

Oh yes, this is most definitely the place to go if you're jones'in for some chocos!
author: Johnson N.

description: Get your icecream etc to go and go somewhere else im the square to enjoy it. Plenty of unchlostrophobic space that is predominantly evil children-free. Moment my bf and i got our sundae to share we got out of there as fast as possible. Loud crying obnoxious tourists with their mass produced families popping babies 24/7. I would hate my life if i worked here. $8 for a sunday with whipcream, a cherry, 4 huge scoops of icecream, a piece of chocolate, hot fudge, and some peanutbutter, i believe it's called The Gold Rush, kind of pricey but the sundeas are fricken HUGE and my bf nd i could not finish it. I suppose $8 for all we got was actually a really good deal considering. I also hate vanilla icecream, but if it's done right it can be not bad. Their vanilla was a good vanilla. Minus 1 for a crazy hectic atmosphere that makes you want to run for cover
author: Brittainie B.

description:
Everyone comes in for a sundae of some sort. Today we had the Classic Hot Fudge Sundae. A scoop of vanilla on the bottom, a layer of milk chocolate (or dark chocolate if you so choose) hot fudge, another scoop of vanilla, then whipped cream, chopped peanuts, and of course a cherry.

Decadent, indulgent, creamy, dreamy and sinful. Definitely made for sharing. Please share. Eat responsibly.
author: Cindy W.

description:
This is exactly what you might expect: intense chocolate desserts. 

I got the cold vanilla chocolate drink (not a sundae but forgot what its called) which was SO GOOD and cookies and cream ice cream which was all right. Should have stuck to chocolate.

They make their own fresh cones. You can smell the sugar butter from the cones as they make it! Smells so good!

There is also a chocolate churning machine for your visual enjoyment.

The place is crowded and the line may be long, but this is a tourist spot! Dont expect less
author: Julia L.

description:
2.5
this is a good tourist attraction with free chocolate samples, but the sundaes are mediocre at best. Its a good place to bring along a tour or to walk around but the ice cream is nothing special. we had a white elephant exchange here so i guess the atmosphere is versatile.
author: Robert Y.

description: Everyone told me I had to go so I did. Of course the ice cream was great but overall I wasn't impressed. Maybe I didn't explore the shop enough. I think it was all just a bit touristy. I will say in the square they had a really helpful concierge. She was great! Very valuable advice.
author: Angela G.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to gain five extra pounds!

Whether we're having typical windy, overcast San Francisco weather or it happens to be 1 of the 5 hot days we get a year, this place always has a line. Grab a menu & know what you want before getting to the cashier.

The last time the bf & i went here, we shared "the cable car" (rocky road/chocolate chip/chocolate ice cream covered in hot fudge/marshmallow cream/whipped cream.) We sat by the machines that churn (is that the right word?!) gallons of chocolate. You give yourself a self guided tour, which explains how they make chocolate, sit down with your number and a few minutes later, one of their staff in the striped apron finds you and delivers your huge ice cream order.

This is a great place to bring out of towners; I always bring my LA based friends here and they love it. The parlor is always bustling with excited tourists and children on a sugar high. It's a fun place to consume really quality ice cream and shakes.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Ah Ghirardelli; the place that always seems to be an integral part of my visits to the Bay Area.  Sure, you can buy G's Chocolate everywhere, but it's just a nicer experience when you get to go to the landmark.  

Yay for free squares of Chocolate when you come in :)  I love that Ghirardelli has maintained their old-fashioned decor and warm environment (both literally and figuratively), with their small white tables and red wooden chairs, old floor tiling, and welcoming staff.  

And I love their ice cream, hot cocoa, and chocolates, of course.

What else can I say that hasn't been said?  It's a little pricey, but nonetheless, worth it for a sundae and a side of nostalgia that I never knew.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
This place is a must go to when you are visiting "the city". I mean if you walk around the piers and you look up you are only going to see a big ass Ghiradelli sign calling your name right....

The price is up there for just a ice but let me tell that the quality of what you are getting is not just some baskin robbins stuff. The ice cream is good and the chocolate is made right before you very eyes. They literally make it in front of you while you eat your delicious order.
author: California R.

description:
I went here for an ice cream dinner after a winery tour on a Sunday.  It was very crowded which is to be expected on a holiday weekend, and we were lucky to get a place to eat our sundaes! While trying to find a table my friends and I were yelled at by other customers who said they got to our table first!  Luckily we found one and were able to enjoy our treats. 

Their menu has a wide variety of shakes and sundaes. I got the hot fudge sundae in a waffle bowl, one of my friends got the banana split sundae, and another got a brownie sundae.  While reviewing the menu before ordering, we had really wanted to get the enormous $30 sundae with multiple ice cream flavors to share but decided no because of the cost. Well, each of our own sundaes cost $10 so if you are going with a group you may just want to get the enormous one! We were sad we didn't.

The sundae was awesome, but if you are a normal person you may want to get the kids size. I ended up leaving about half my sundae since it was so rich and sweet.

Pros: good tourist stop, delicious ice cream
Cons: crowded, expensive, possible hostile patrons

Good for a visit once!
author: Amanda C.

description:
OM NOM CHOCOLATE HEAVEN. They have chocolate everything here and the fact that they have a cake/ice cream/hot chocolate area makes it even better! Ice cream portion is HUGE, bring a friend! Or a date! Or a friend date! Or just date your friend and drag her @$$ here LOL!

There is a big line at the door but it's to be expected: IT'S A TOURIST ATTRACTION. Complaining because it's packed is like complaining that there are too many kids at Disney World. The lines move pretty quick and your treats come out relatively quick. 

It's a tourist spot people, stop being so negative if you want a small cozy experience GO SOMEWHERE ELSE :P
author: Imran G.

description: It took almost an hour from the time we ordered  our sundaes to when we received them. They were good, but nowhere near that good.
author: Joshua J.

description:
A free chocolate square to every visitor!  

Get the cookie sundae.  That's all you need to know.
author: Brent L.

description:
The Ghiradelli Chocolate experience is an awesome, and when I come here I feel like a kid in a candy store. Chocolate is one of my Seven Deadly Sins, and I like to come here to indulge myself from time to time. 

I will get some of the fattiest ice cream on the planet and devour it here if a table is available, or take it outside. I love the coffee flavored ice cream, and like I said it is fat. I do not get the point of iced milk. I mean, really?

The Ghiradelli store is also a good place to pick up an upscale chocolate gift for that special someone. Or your mom.
author: Heather O.

description: I had my kids all excited to get an ice cream sundae here during their first trip to San Francisco, and while I know they enjoyed it, I thought the sundae was adequate but not great. The quality of the ice cream is anything but premium and although the other ingredients, particularly the chocolate were good, the mediocre ice cream sort of dampened the experience for me, though my kids still thought the sundaes were great. Worth saying you were there, but there are certainly better sundaes to be had.
author: Dee G.

description:
I came here because I was too lazy to walk all the way down the stairs to the far end of Ghiradelli square to the (what I think is a) coffee shop. This is not to be confused with the coffee shop that is upstairs, which I cannot vouch for. At the downstairs coffee shop, the chocolate sundae had three or four huge scoops of vanilla ice cream that filled an entire (what I think is a) 16 oz. cup. 
Here, I got the chocolate sundae expecting the same thing. Instead, I got two tiny scoops of ice cream in a ridiculously deceptively small sundae glass. It was more glass than ice cream. Despite there being hardly any ice cream, there wasn't even enough fudge for each bite of ice cream!
Just walk down the stairs and go to the coffee shop. Same price, waaaaaaaaaay more everything.
author: Anya F.

description:
This place is a Fentons to San Francisco. It's hard not to go chocolate crazy when you're here. Once you walk in, the smell of chocolate literally shoots up your nose. It's a major tourist places so it's always crowded. Trying to get a table here is horrible, especially on weekends during dessert hours. 

The sundaes are huge, matches the price and you won't be disappointed. Just getting an ice cream cone togo? Line expands out the door and into the middle of ghirardelli square. The place is really hyped up because it's the place to go. So, if you're going to do the whole tourist tour in San Francisco, you must hit this place. 

Definitely come here for dessert and NOT Kara's Cupcakes.
author: Katie C.

description:
I have a sweet tooth and I can't help it. 

Why I like this place?  It's an original ice cream place and I like thier Very Berry Sundae and their Cable Car.

Why 4 stars and not 5?  Because the lines go out the door.
author: Rose L.

description:
I have cute, pinchable chipmunk cheeks because of the salted caramel drink here.  Yup.  That's it.  Maybe it was the espresso and fudge sundaes or the appetizers...er.. I mean, free samples they give you before you make your way into line.  Either way, they give a girl some cuuuute chubby cheeks real fast.

I found 3 separate out of town friends' visits as very good reasons for coming back here 3 times within 2 weeks.  I mean, it's Ghiradelli Square, a very important landmark right???

Kara's cupcakes are just a few steps away too...just sayin'.
author: Tokki M.

description: Okay! I know that we have a Ghirardelli in Chicago, but I have only went in for the free chocalate and walked out. Not now that I had it here. The ice cream at Ghirardelli is so good. There us enough in one two scoop cup to feed two lovers and still give them a surgar fix. This is a must go dessert place. Yummy!!!
author: Christian H.

description:
On to tourist trap...number two.  Yes, I stopped here and yes, it is worth it.  You walk through the door (on the candy store side) and they hand you a free piece of chocolate (a peanut butter square melt).

Atmosphere - busy, long line, brick, regentrified factory setting, clean, delicious smelling

Food - Ordered the fudge sundae.  A huge sundae, with two scopes of vanilla ice cream w/ hot fudge, whipped cream, and almond slices.  The highlight of this dish was the hot fudge.  What is this made of?  It was so crazy good!  I could eat spoonfuls of it!  The rest was...mmmm...okay.

Service - Cheery, patient (for how crazy busy...amazing), helpful

Overall - It is worth the quick visit.  Next time I will buy a box of that fudge sauce!
author: Eric D.

description: Must visit place for getting chocolate or sugar wasted or brain freeze. Try their sundaes and lot more on menu.
author: Vlren P.

description: Waited 30 mins in line to order a sundae and hot chocolate. Have been waiting another 30 mins but lines are backed up and still no sundae/hot chocolate. Yes. Have been here an hour altogether. Poorly run joint. Happy to take customers money but not provide promised product in any kind of timely manner. Never returning here again.
author: Delara G.

description:
I went here during my senior year in high school and the dessert was pretty good. I got some sort of ice cream thing that was prettty good... IF IT DIDN'T MELT WITHIN 3 MINUTES. Ridiculous. This happened the last time I went here. The ice cream is good, don't get me wrong, but it melts soooo fast! I felt like I just bought a milkshake instead of that yummy looking ice cream printed on the menu. =[. I like to enjoy my ice cream, not eat it as fast as I can so that it won't melt.

Also, it takes the waiters a while to clean up the tables. I don't feel too clean in there.
author: Desmond C.

description:
My Ratings:
Quality - 5 Stars
Quantity - 5 Stars
Price - 5 Stars 
Location - 5 Stars 
Service - 5 Stars 
Speed - 5 Stars 

My Opinion/Story:
I don't know why I haven't reviewed this place... oh well, here it goes: 
I love it when we have new people from the Philippines.  It gives us an excuse to take them to Ghirardelli.  Not that I want to show them what good chocolate is about nor do I want to show them how bountiful their portions are, but I just want any excuse to drive an hour away to have their hot fudge.  Yeah, the chocolate bars are yummy and ohhh so bad for you.. but their hot fudge is totally sinful.  Any dish that has their fudge is just pure guilty pleasure.  I've had their Banana Hot Fudge, Golden Gate, World Famous, Cable Car, and others I can't remember.  All with their ooey gooey yummy fudge.  

Oh let me talk about the rest of its features: Service is good, they take your order, give you a ticket, find a seat, wait for you order, waiter brings your order and takes your ticket.  Simple as that.  The place can get pretty packed and seating can be hard to find but they have a second floor which accommodates the overflow from the main restaurant.  Price can be shocking for those who aren't used to eating there but it's all worth it.  Ghirardelli Square and this shop is definitely a MUST see and go whenever you're in San Francisco.  And don't forget to leave your diet behind!!!
author: Cherryl D.

description:
Sooooooooooooo over-rated!  (but still went every day just for the free chocolate squares - hey why not?!)   

I just don't get it, though!  How do you spell T O U R I S T   T R A P ??

O, btw, we walked by 1 early,  do u know what we saw?  A Dryers Ice Cream truck delivering their ice cream to them for the day.... WTH?!??!?!  Is there something I don't know here?
author: LINDA R.

description:
The ice cream is pretty alright. The chocolate is pretty alright as well. 

What weirds me out is that I don't remember what this place looks like in the day time. I guess that's because we here at night.

I know I had a hot fudge sundae and I bought some chocolate packages for my family. It's a pretty groovy place to kick it in. SF is very liberal, so you won't get people eyeballing you and your Latino clique. "Ma'am my hands are cold, that's why they're in my pocket." 

When I come back, I will be sure to take a trip during the day time.
author: Gerard I.

description:
I have such a sweet tooth and a soft spot for Ghirardelli Chocolate. I wish I can live in the apartments 1 block from here because I would come here everyday. I know it's a little too sweet, but I can never stop my cravings for their sundaes, hot chocolate and whipped cream. I can just feel the calories pouring in with each devilish bite, but my brain merely tells me otherwise. Their chocolate and ice-cream are the ultimate perfection of what a chocolate sundae should be and I can pour their whipped cream into my mouth all day. 

Parking is a pain, and after you arrive, parking your behind in a spot is also a pain in the rear due to the overflow of tourists and their far from quiet kids, but I swear, once I take a bite of the decadent vanilla ice-cream covered in fudge topped with whipped cream, all of my anxiety and annoyed sensations melt away. 

The price isn't too shabby either. I am willing to shell out $6 - $8 for a sundae and don't mind paying the $3.75 for a large hot cocoa because I easily spend that much on a Venti Frapp at Starbucks. 
Great spot for a treat and I am definitely going back as much as I can as long as I am still alive, even if I have to run the risk of diabetes.
author: Grace R.

description: The sea salt hot chocolate I had was like a creamy chocolate orgasm in my mouth.  I wish I could find one that good where I live.
author: Casey B.

description: My wife and I came here on our recent visit to San Francisco mostly because you just have to come if you're a tourist, but we ordered the standard sundae and it was amazing. The chocolate syrup is literally just melted chocolate which you can see being made in the back of the main room. My wife is a huge connoisseur of chocolate and sundaes and she said it was the best one she had ever had.
author: Colin D.

description:
The Ghirardelli ice cream shop has been a favorite of mine since I was a kid.  In fact, I still feel like a kid when I come here!  The only thing keeping this place from getting 5 stars is that it's always insanely crowded.  It's hard to enjoy a sundae when you're constantly being jostled by the passing crowds.

The sundaes aren't cheap, but you get a lot for your money.  On this visit, I had the hot fudge sundae with bananas.  Sadly, I couldn't finish it.  The whipped cream, ice cream, and sauces here are just too rich.  Not that I'm complaining.  It was delicious.

Ghirardelli's is a paradise for kids.  You can see the chocolate processing machines at work, and you feel like you're in a mini version of Wonka's factory.  The staff are incredibly nice, and I have no idea how they maintain their composure amidst the chaos.

Ghirardelli also has a retail shop where you can buy all sorts of chocolates and candies, although you probably will be too full to eat them.
author: Raina S.

description: Had the Ghirardelli's World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae on a waffle cone. Ice cream was tasty and the chocolate was even tastier...  Should've ordered 2! Haha!
author: Jeffrey N.

description: Delicious, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu! But the prices are outrageous and the wait time is crazy long.
author: SoCalSkippy ..

description:
they have a monopoly on this whole block.  where did the coffee bean and tea leaf go?  oh its a ghirardelli chocolate now.  where did the marche go?  oh its gonna be a ghirardelli chocolate.  whats that next to lolas?  a ghirardelli chocolate of course!  they are basically forcing you to eat ghirardelli chocolate ice cream or whatever is on their menu while you are walking around in this courtyard.  oh theres karas, but even they have a ghirardelli chocolate cupcake.  you cannot escape it.

it is a long line.  wait wait wait to order.  wait wait wait to get the sundae.

we got a banana split.  they put the hot fudge on the bottom.  everything was pretty good. banana, the ice creams.  i think they accidentally misheard us when we said strawberry cheesecake ice cream.  they gave us strawberry instead. o well.
author: claudia y.

description: This place was super yummy, and you get free Chocolate, I had several sundae's from here along w/Hot Chocolate and pastry, also bought some square's for the road back, everything was delish, the service was also great, my Mom's battery on here wheelchair happened to die going up those gigantic things they call hills and we were parked at the fisherman's Wharf parking lot which was quite a distance and when we asked the manager if we can plug in she said yes w/no hesitation thank goodness, also this location has like 3 different spots you can go to, I went to all three, It was really chilly when I went so the Yummy Hot Chocolate hit the spot...
author: ChRiSTiNa C.

description: Usually when I come to San Fran, I have to stop here to pick up a bag of chocolate.  Love the free sample as you walk in.  Very packed during summer and prices seem to go up whenever i come back.  Parking is not too bad, underground and validated if you purchase something $10 or more.
author: Dao N.

description:
I remember coming here as a high school senior on a first date with a guy named Rich (it was senior ice cream night).  He was so cute and funny, and I was thrilled that he asked me out.  I ordered an ice cream float... 

And I spilled it all over him.  

Awkward.

...

Fast forward many years later.  I order an ice cream float... 

And enjoy it to the last drop.  

Who knows what might have happened had it not been for that embarassing spill?  

(Just kidding, he and I dated for a bit after that.  It just wasn't meant to be; no use crying over spilt ice cream float -- ha ha).
author: Patty W.

description: The chocolate for sale here is the same price (or actually a bit more) than if you bought the exact same things in CVS or some other type store.  I bought a few things from here that came in SF specific boxes, etc because I thought those were at least good souvenirs.  I also had some sea salt type hot chocolate which was SO SALTY it was painful at the end.  My mouth just started watering thinking about how salty it was.  I am glad we stopped here since I was a tourist in SF but I was careful to not go crazy buying overpriced squares of chocolate and you should be too.
author: Jess K.

description:
I'll probably be bashed for this, but this review is based on my experience.

The chocolate is great, but I've had chocolate from other places that is just as good if not better.  The line was upsurd, we waited for around 45 minutes for some ice cream.  I ordered a root beer float and ended up with a cup that was 1/2 full of ice (YOU DON'T PUT ICE IN A FLOAT IDIOT!)

This is just a tourist trap that offers nothing more than any other Ghirardelli's anywhere else offers.
author: Randy W.

description: A MUST for my fellow chocolate-lovers! They have all sorts of treats from shakes to sundaes. When you walk into the chocolate shop side, they have a staff member handing out an indiviudal chocolate square for you to sample... and for some reason it tasted better than store bought ones. I ordered a chocolate thick shake (smallest) size and didn't finish it, so I would suggest splitting any order as many other customers were doing as the sweetness (even for my sweet tooth) was slightly too much that I didn't even finish half of the shake. Overall a great place to stop by. At the back of the first floor they have a set up of the processing of chocolate and a step 1-5 description of how chocolate is made; so that was interesting to see and take photos of. If you want a more quieter atmosphere to enjoy your treat escape to the second floor as there are more seating and not as much people as on the first floor.
author: Brenda S.

description:
Of course I love the Ghirardelli ice cream parlor! So heavenly. Took the Cable Car over here with my husband and we each enjoyed a decadent chocolate sundae. I kept it classic, but my husband had whatever special was going on at the time. Both were so enjoyable.

Love that all the chocolate sauce is made *right there*! It's fun to watch while you enjoy your dessert.

The store was crowded, even for late at night, which I was surprised about, so leave plenty of time to peruse the chocolates - highly recommend buying some LUXE chocolate squares/bars in the store! You will thank me!
author: Kristen C.

description: Granite-pounded chocolate. The way they have always made it for over 100 years. Dark, milk, white? Whatever floats your boat, they've got. Toffee? Mint? Caramel? How about a little crisp rice or some hazelnuts? Cheaper than getting the brand at grocery stores around California, and in my head, I like to tell myself that it's fresher, too. A must-try for any chocolate fiend visiting the bay area!
author: Frances L.

description: AWESOME! Presidio Passion and Buttersctch Hot Fudge Sundae! It was totally packed on a Saturday and they made the line moving pretty fast. There was a little accident and we had been waiting for a while but Ghirardelli boys and girls are very nice and patient. After all we got our awesome ice cream. I love this place and i will definitely go back for trying more ice cream out! On a weekday though. ^_^
author: Hailey K.

description: Salted Caramel Hot - Chocolate!!!?!??! Are you kidding me, AMAZING!!!!
author: Marie E.

description: Huge desserts full of much needed chocolate? A chocolate shop? Yes a yes.  The dessert was massive and chocolatey. I wish I could have finished as it tasted so good but unfortunately I had reached maximum capacity. Must visit when in the city!!!
author: cat w.

description: Ice cream treats featured here. The place for tired tourist to stop for a ice cream sundae, ice cream, ice cream floats and shakes. The line can be very long during the tourist season. There is also a store here featuring chocolate and Ghirardelli logo souvenirs. For the brave family, try "The Earthquake" featuring 8 scoops of ice cream, fresh bananas, whip cream and toppings.
author: Les W.

description: Awesome hot chocolate in a nice place for a date.
author: Ruben A.

description:
This is a great place to go to if you're looking for a diabetes special.  Chocolate and sugar don't have to go hand-in-hand, but Ghirardelli obviously doesn't see it that way.  Instead of maybe pairing a bit of salt with the chocolate (a wonderful combination), or maybe just toning down the sugar a bit and letting the flavor of their chocolate work itself to the surface, everything is just absolutely overwhelmed by sugar.

I went here with two friends, and we ordered the Cable Car (rocky road ice cream covered in chocolate and whipped cream), a brownie, a drinking chocolate (they ran out of their biscotti that's supposed to go with it, but still charged us full-price), a sea salt caramel hot cocoa, and a mocha.

The drinking chocolate was actually good, I'll give this place that much credit.  It wasn't too sweet, it was nice and strong, a perfect sipping dessert.  The brownie was decent, but wasn't anything special like you'd expect from a chocolate maker.  Things really went bad after that, though.  The mocha was overly sweet, like someone accidentally dumped a few heaping tablespoons of sugar in there - my friend couldn't finish it.  My sea salt caramel hot cocoa, which I ordered because I absolutely adore pairing salt with chocolate, was horrendous.  I couldn't taste caramel, I couldn't taste salt.  All I could taste was frothy milk, chocolate, and - you guessed it - a ton of sugar.  After a few sips (less than 1/5th of my drink), I gave up and stopped drinking, opting for water.

Finally, the biggest disappointment was the Cable Car.  Being a big fan of ice cream, I figured three of us splitting this one small dish would be pretty easy.  It was so overly sweet, so ridiculously rich, that the three of us didn't even get half of it done.  So for a grand total, three adults split one brownie and less than half a sundae, and the only decent drink was the drinking chocolate.  And even then, split between the three of us, I felt physically sick afterwords from the sugar high.

I couldn't help but imagine a group of people coming here, each getting their own drinks and desserts, and each actually finishing them.  So much sugar just disgusted me to the point that I couldn't give this place a positive review - again, chocolate does NOT equal sugar.  When I go to a chocolate maker, I want to taste the chocolate, I want to experience the raw and dark flavors, not the sugar and high fructose corn syrup poured on top to satisfy the masses.

All this, after waiting for over a half an hour in line, guaranteed Ghirardelli got the bottom-rung on my reviews.  This is absolutely a tourist trap, and unless you're a hummingbird low on sugar, I'd suggest you steer clear.
author: Garrett P.

description: Went here last night with a lovely model during a cold windy break from shooting (pixs) and come on....  $3.25 for a SMALL hot chocolate w/whipped cream? Then the guy putting the whipped cream just did a half second spray of the creamy stuff, so my gorgeous model asks for more, and rightfully so...  it didn't even protrude above the top of the SMALL paper cup! The tables weren't very clean, the floor littered but when one works as an employee and doesn't have to worry about appearances, who cares? After all, it's almost all tourists who go here right? Stay away, this type of high-priced touristy cafe shop gives SF a bad name in friendliness, quality and cleanliness. Obviously not even the manager - if one exists even - since the place was so dirty. I cannot understand how this place got such good reviews....
author: Tony L.

description: Pretty good hot fudge Sundays, EXTREMELY overpriced. You are literally paying for the name and the location- nothing else is special about it..
author: Ms. Y.

description:
Good service, great ice cream, I don't know what else you could really want. It gets really busy, but that just shows exactly how popular this place is.

We've eaten here twice. Both times were perfect, although the second time they messed up our order; as an apology, they let us keep the incorrect order for free and still brought out the correct one. How can you hate free ice cream?
author: Frank D.

description: I LOVE hot chocolate.  I love chocolate.  I love ice cream.  I love free.  So how could I not love Ghirardelli?  Free chocolate every time I step into a store whether it be on Lincoln road or in Ghirardelli square?!  Bonus for having two stores because that = 2 free pieces of savory caramel squares.  Since the SO gets a discount (haha) we opted for the TWO LARGE hot chocolates.  That was the only reason...b/c he gets a discount.  Not because we're gluttonous, hot chocolate drunkards.  The cream on top..mm...and an extra chocolate square to devour?  It took me an hour to finish the drink and I had to sacrifice a couple of bites of chocolate, but I finally did get through the rich, creamy, decadent drink.  Splurge!
author: Amber E.

description: I love Ghirardelli, and its World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae. The whipped cream, ice cream, and fudge seems so light that my brain tells me it's less fattening (probably not the case), but who cares...put one in front of me and I can devour it all in 3 mins!
author: Eunice M.

description:
Check this place out if you get a chance while you're in Frisco - you'll love it! You can take a quick tour which shows you how they make their chocolate, you receive a free piece of chocolate to taste while you're roaming through the tour and then you end up in their dessert shop where you can have some of their chocolate in different styles! Yummy!

Note: The tour really isn't a "tour" like you'd expect. Half of it is shelves of G's chocolate products that you can purchase. The other half is a self-guided tour where you get to look through glass windows at some small machines that churn the chocolate.
author: Joshua W.

description: Great chocolate after a long day walk. They have ice-cream with their chocolate on it. Smooth and sweet. Love hot cocoa too.
author: Unyo N.

description: The brownie hot fudge sundae here is TO DIE FOR. I don't care about the line. I don't care about the tourists. All I care about is my freshly baked brownie with chunks of homemade fudge covered with vanilla bean ice cream and drowned in the thickest blanket of hot fudge chocolate heaven that puts me on cloud nine. I've come to the conclusion that happiness IS this hot fudge sundae. Do not try and stop me from eating every last bite. Do not try and stick your spoon in my sundae. I will rip your hand off.
author: Danielle F.

description: Tourista Trap, fun stop but I am sure there are better places to grab sweets in San Fran!
author: Max G.

description: Yuck.  Seriously.  My parents were in town and they are both ice-cream-a-holics.  Naturally, each time they visit they want a Ghiradelli sundae if just for the massive size.  I have been craving a delicious shake for weeks so the scenario was perfect.  Except when I waited 30 minutes and finally got my shake, it was awful!  Problem being, it was ice cream soup.  And it was improperly blended.  Fail.  I find out from the waitress that shake to sundae ratio being made is 1000 to 1, but they make the milkshake at a different station.  So my milkshake was made minute 2 of my visit as we were stalking people for a table.  The sundaes were made at minute 28, so my shake was just chilling out melting for more than 20 minutes.  How pleasant!  Just awesome.
author: Britt C.

description:
For those who had never came here before and plans on getting a Ghirardelli Sundae, please bring 2 other people with you. Their sundaes are HUGE! I remember celebrating our 10 months anny here with the bf 2.5 years ago. We shared a banana split and oh man that little boat of ice cream and bananas filled us up! We probably didn't even eat dessert for a whole month after that. 

Ghirardelli has the best dessert sundaes! After your frozen treats remember to drink lots of water. 

Coming to SF for vacation and need souvenirs? There are bags of Ghirardelli Chocolate Squares wrapped nicely for you guys to bring home. Lots of different flavors and colored wraps.
author: Tracy A.

description:
6 words sums it up and if you disagree youre a fool:

BEST
HOT
CHOCOLATE
IN
THE 
WORLD.
author: Julie W.

description: I was not feeling it.  I got a 7 dollar milkshake it was way too rich, and there were too many screaming children.  Not going to come here again until out of town tourists make me again.
author: Julia D.

description: Would have been 5 Stars but the service is extremely slow. Coffee and ice cream should does not warrant a 25 minute wait after ordering no matter who made the chocolate!
author: Mike S.

description: After taking the cable car to the warf, decided to grab a mid day ice cream. I got the fudge brownie sundae and it was really good. They give you so much ice cream, I could not have eaten it. My only complaint was the price. It is on the pricey side being $9 for the sundae.  Other than that I am a fan.
author: Sean D.

description:
I liked this place.
Crowded for no reason. 
Do people seriously come here just to eat all the FREE SAMPLES?

Get the DUCK outta here with that BS!
author: Kwame J.

description: After dinner at Harris', my bf and I came here for hot cocoa on a cold night. Ghirardelli Chocolate Square is really beautiful at night. The place is kind of crowded and I'm sure it is full of tourists but who said it's only for the tourists? The great thing is that they let you dine and enjoy your desserts while having a little chocolate store as a part of the entire place.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I was at the factory museum location where they show you how they make their chocolate, and of course the museum part empties out
to a massive open store location with all kinds of their chocolates in different molds, or shapes.   The shop is very commercial and unfortunately the factory you walk thru is not too detailed, but windows
you stroll by - exemplify the process.   Still it was fun, and I bought some chocolates in the shop.   Their chocolates are above average, but no where near the best.
author: Michael W.

description: The best chocolate shop I've ever been to. This historic place has an awesome chocolate factory on the lower level that is worth checking out. It's in a very cool place in downtown San Francisco.
author: Brendan S.

description:
Son, I am disappoint.

I love chocolate. I have the cavities and fillings to prove it . Helped along by free peppermint bark samples, yay ! I was really looking forward to a Ghirardelli sundae so we got the Gold Rush--- first thing on the menu & all highlighted with a picture and stuff. Hot fudge, peanut butter, real Ghirardelli chocolate & not that instant Hershey's bottled stuff. Sounds great, but dear god I think they stuffed a whole jar of peanut butter in there. I would get a spoonful of what looked like ice cream and then blanch as I took a taste --- the whole thing was a chunk of peanut butter. OVERWHELMING, there was NO ESCAPING THE PEANUT BUTTER. I couldn't even taste the chocolate. Sigh. I had such high hopes too. 

Only redeeming quality is the atmosphere, the staff, and the hope that you might get something else. Otherwise its just a glorified bucket of Rite-Aid ice cream hastily constructed with fudge & whipped cream. & too much peanut butter. (I happen to like Thrifty's ice cream, btw so I'm not totally hatin')
author: Julie K.

description:
Ok, so one day I decided to stop in and check out the goodies, saw this item on the menu and had to try it. Damn, called the Mint Bliss, which had one big scoop of mint chip ice cream and chocolate ice cream, topped with that yummy dark chocolate hot fudge, whipped cream and a 86% Intense dark chocolate square. 
Sinful.
I need to get another tomorrow. Yum
Long line but it moves very fast. I live in SF but do enjoy a sundae while people watching every now and then.
author: Geoff F.

description:
Within Ghirardelli SQ, there are 3 Ghirardelli chocolate stores.  The main store is pretty large.  There are 2 entrances: one goes to the chocolate store, the other goes right into the ice cream parlor.

I like going into the chocolate store first because they always give out free samples.  They were giving out peanut butter filled and caramel filled chocolate squares.  They were good, and I went back got some more samples (free tastes better?).

We were going to have a few sundaes, but the main store was packed, and there were a lot of people hunting for open tables.  Also, it was pretty stuffy inside.

Instead, went to the store next to Lola's.  Still a line, but not as long.  The older girls each ordered Italian sodas, and the youngest wanted a scoop of chocolate ice cream with hot fudge.   Since it was a little cool, I had a white chocolate mocha.  Mocha was nice and hot.

My youngest didn't finish her ice cream, so I helped her out.  Very chocolate-ty ice cream.  Hot fudge started to harden a bit, but still soft enough.  Hot fudge was great.  Recharged to walk back to Pier 39 garage where our car was parked.
author: Steve L.

description:
I come here almost without fail each time I'm in San Francisco for fun, and this place always gives me a sugar-high and refuels me for the rest of the day.

Just about everything on the menu is delectable, though I wouldn't suggest you get the chocolate chip cookie, it's a bit too shortbready for my taste. The hot chocolate sundae is rich, decadent, and dripping in fudge. And on cold days, the hot cocoa with sea salt is very relaxing.

My friend and I stopped by the little factory space in the back, and were mesmerized by the chocolate conching machine.  It's the closest I'll ever be able to get to a Charlie and the Chocolate Factory experience, and it's fun and fattening each time.

Be sure you get some water from the fountain in the middle of the first floor, you'll definitely need it.  If the place is packed, there generally is more seating upstairs, but you'll have to wait for your order because I don't think the waiters always check up there.  When we finally got our sundae, the ice cream had gotten a bit melted/soupy.
author: Lucia C.

description: A friend was visiting me and wanted to check out the infamous Ghirardelli sundaes. I love ice cream so of course I obliged even though this place is consistently swamped with tourists. Service is pretty fast though once you place your order. The hard part is just finding a table to sit at. We shared the Peanut Butter Chocolate sundae and it was ice cream heaven. They do not skimp on the fudge or the PB. Overall I feel there is better ice cream in the city, so unless another friend specifically requests to go here, I probably would not come back.
author: Amy N.

description:
if you are up in sf, you must must MUST stop by this place!
creamy, mouth watering ice cream with ghirardelli's famous chocolate. 

what more could you ask for? 

simply bliss...
author: Vicky H.

description: Can life get any better then free samples, and tasty hot chocolate during cold winter? I especially like their chocolate dipped strawberries!
author: Irina K.

description: Took my friend from Texas here on her first visit out here, She had the Presidio Passion and I had The World famous Original Hot Fudge Sundae. They were excellent!!! Not badly priced and got a fair amount too. I'm definitely coming here again!!!
author: Scott G.

description: If you do not like lots of people in one spot......DO NOT GO HERE.  This place is so crazy busy that people hover over you while you sit and be watched Tyson when you are done some one can nab your spot....or fight over it since there are soooo many people waiting.
author: J R.

description: Mmmmm, expensive deliciousness... It's a cool place to be, a favorite among my out of town friends, because the ice cream "restaurant" offers a large menu, quality food, and a brief but nice self-led tour of the process with which chocolate is made. The interior could be nice if the seats and tables were...
author: Lana L.

description:
I hate coming here because of all the pushy tourists, but there is one thing that has me coming back, crowds and long lines be damned: Ghirardelli's Giant. Chocolate. Chip. Cookie. This monster is sugary, chocolaty, and best of all, HUGE. If they sold the recipe I would be making a batch every week. 

Now let me just warn those of you who consider yourselves self proclaimed "cookie monsters"- this is not your average chocolate chip cookie. It is not moist and gooey, so if that is what you judge a cookie by, you should go for their intensely chocolate brownie instead (its very good).
