It was christmas night so there were more people than usual for a weekday evening. After we got our orders down (ice cream sundae w/ dark chocolate fudge as usual, a hot tea, and one hot chocolate which came to be ~$14!!!) we sat down for a bit. A server gave us the sundae which had seriously a scoop and a half of ice cream. 1.5 scoops was not enough between the two of us so I made him order a ice cream banana split that turned out to have a decent amount of ice cream but this time, very little fudge!

I brought the banana split to the people who make the orders and I told them that I wanted more chocolate and that I didn't care if it looked pretty or not. The lady then pumped a ton of hot dark chocolate fudge on the ice cream, and then handed it to me. As I grabbed the ice cream the fudge started pouring onto my thumb. Hot fudge is seriously hot ( I was thinking lawsuit lawsuit lawsuit!!!), but luckily the other staff offered to make a new split with more chocolate. They even let me wash my hands in the working area instead of making me go to the bathroom which is so far from the cafe. 

Originally I was going to give 2 stars for the price, minimal ice cream, and the trouble to get more hot fudge, but I'll give em an extra star for the courteous service.It was, after all... christmas night. Nice save, baby Jesus!
author: Jason S.

description:
Love this place.  Yeah the ice cream is great but it's perfect b/c of location and history. The square is so very cute and the view is amazing especially at night.  The food.....YUM.  We've been to other areas before but nothing can be compared to the original place.  From the chocolate churning machine to the service, this is the best out of all.  

*Food = YUM YUM YUM
*Location = perfect
*Price = good
*Service = good
author: Akiko I.

description:
Throughout my 2 years of living in SF, I pass by sights here and there that remind me of my visits to SF as a child. Two stand out to me: 1) 12 years old - standing on Lombard Street in my cheap pink San Francisco sweater purchased at Fisherman's Wharf, feeling like a total nerd while my dad tried to take a picture of me but couldn't get a clear shot because of all the cars that would pass. 2) eating a delish sundae at Ghirardelli Square (wearing the same cheap pink San Francisco sweater). 

Well, #2 has definitely not lost its appeal for me. Even though it's touristy, the ice cream is just damn good. Plus it's open til 11 p.m. on weekdays which is helpful when the dessert cravings kick in at night. 

P.S.
Try to find a guy who works there named Oscar. He rocks.
author: Dalia K.

description:
On a hot summer day, I bought a small cone of chocolate and walked down the street with it.

I ended up having to stop, because it was so good. I couldn't walk. I needed alone time with this cone, I needed to sit down and savor every bite. It was the most amazing ice cream I've ever had in my entire life, ever. Times ten. And I've had my fair share of ice cream.

Go here. You need to go here. RUN, don't walk! When you go here, bring me back a cone, even if it's melted.. I'll still eat it.
author: Mindy W.

description:
This is the best ice cream joint in the Bay Area (Fentons is second). 

I've been to this spot many times since I was a kid. 

I pretty much tried everything on the menu from sundaes, banana splits and the earthquake! i notice the classics like the cable car or the golden gate isnt on the menu. i think its secretive (like in n out animal style 4 by 4) and you have to order it. but i'd recommend the cable car. its my fav. 

the only problem is the restroom. you have to walk around the building to find it. one time, the whole place was under construction and i ended getting lost. i gave up and peed in the corner then retracked my way back.
author: Ken C.

description:
I have visited Ghirardelli Square and never ordered an ice cream at the fountain.  I did.  The prices are expensive.  It's worth it!!!

I ordered the Brownie Sundae.  Rich, huge, and delicious big time XD  I almost couldn't finish it.  The last time I ordered a brownie sundae was in Las Vegas 2006 and I thought that was the best.  Wrong.  Ghirardelli beats it.

The sundaes were big enough for two people to share; although, each person orders a different sundae and share each other's.  I just hoped both people don't get tummy aches :O  Just take your time and eat slowly.
author: Raymond M.

description: Took a Chocolate Icecream, it tasted like poor quality cocoa powder mixed with sugar and cream.
author: Howard W.

description: Split an Earthquake with 3 other guys. Something of an ice cream overload, or maybe it was the 6 marischino cherries I ate from the sundae. We got basically neopolitan flavors with cookie dough, 2 scoops of each. Good times.
author: Jonas C.

description:
Heavenly.

No trip to the City is complete without a stop at Ghirardelli. Any combination of ice cream is possible here. I was never a fan of one of the sundaes straight from the menu, and ended up with just a goblet of ice cream. The ice cream itself is just simply delicious. The atmosphere is fun, kinda sticky and dirty (but what isn't in SF?). 

There is often a line outside of people waiting to place their orders and get in. It's worth the wait.
author: Kimberlee J.

description:
Oh man, the chocolate fudge is so good.  I always order the classic fudge sundae, though the brownie and new raspberry ones are delightful as well.  There's never enough vanilla ice cream, though, which can be annoying if you don't want to eat a ton of fudge.  

It's difficult to find tables/seats for some reason, even though the shop is fairly huge.  If you are willing to carry your ice cream outside (maybe sit by the wharf), the fountain lines are MUCH shorter than the main entrance line.
author: Elaine Z.

description: A little pricey and the wait is quite long when you plan on eating there.  If you have a sweet tooth and love sweets i think you'll enjoy it.
author: Hai D.

description: I LOOOOOOOVE chocolate! I eat chocolate EVERY day..yes, I'm addicted, if I don't have my chocolate, I get bad withdrawals..coming here was HEAVEN! So you walk in and you are greeted with a free sample..yum! Chocolates galore! We ended up buying 6 bars..buy 4 get 1 free..not bad!  I wanted to try their sundaes but we had to go to our wine tasting at Wattle Creek, which is right next door..how dope is that? Chocolate tasting then wine...loves it! Def recommend coming here!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Delicious waffle cones and ice cream!!!! Don't bother waiting for a table "downstairs", go upstairs to the take-out area where they also have seating area and even on a nice Saturday night, you'll find seating. They serve in you in take out containers but you don't have to tip and you get a less crowded dining experience in a quiet area for conversation. 

One not, I was walking toward the stairs through the main dining hall and one of the staff members said to me "the restrooms are outside". I replied "I am not looking for the restroom, we have a table upstairs." I was insulted he just assumed I wandered in just to use the restrooms! So, yes, the restrooms are outside the restaurant next to McCormick's.

How does this place compare to Fenton's in the East Bay? Send me your thoughts.....
author: Mary R.

description: Okay I have to say that the cherry ice cream is delicious. I ordered a dish that was supposed to come with chocolate chip as one of the scoops but they put butter pecan instead. A bit disappointed that they messed up something so simple, but we still ate it! At $10 an ice cream dish...it's a little pricey. But it's a tourist must-do so I can't complain!
author: Laynie B.

description: Hoards of people in love with chocolate. Lots of chocolate. I have a feeling the Ghirardelli chocolate given away for free here tastes 1000x better than the ones sold in stores. A bit too crowded for my comfort, but I'd definitely go again for the freebie & the chocolate ice-cream.
author: Rahul Aurora S.

description: Good looking place. Fun to shop. Pricey and crowded but tourists love it for the experience
author: Veranna N.

description: No trip to SF is complete without a visit to Ghirardelli's for a classic sundae. Love this place, hate the lines (which snaked around the fountain). The place was packed (I went on a Saturday, what was I thinking LOL), and the service was friendly. Nice mounds of yummy vanilla ice cream, with warm gooey chocolate and a nice mound of whipped cream on top... mmmmm. I shared this concoction with my offspring, who kept yelling, 'more chocolaaattttteeeee! more chocolaaatteeeee!' Looking forward to the next time (I don't typically buy the chocolate here because I've found it less expensive at Target or other stores in my home town, but I have been known to buy a bag or two...). Don't forget to present your parking ticket for validation, otherwise ya gotta pay....
author: caryl r.

description:
What more can I say about Ghiradelli? Ice cream, chocolate, friends, and fun?  FABULOUS!!! :D

I really like this location because its fun and romantic, and there's always people milling around.  Granted many of these people are tourists, its always busy and people are always smiling here!  The line is a little confusing because theres a whole ton of entrances, but in general this place has good ice cream!  You pay first and then get your ice cream in a couple minutes, whats there to hate?  However, the one star docked is for how busy they can get, since a lot of times there isn't anywhere to sit, or you have to steal chairs from tables who arent using them!

Overall, ice cream = thumbs up.  ^^
author: Linda C.

description:
Where else can you get a sundae called the earthquake (8,000 scoops of ice cream with 8 million different toppings!)??  But please save those for special occasions when you've got enough people to share it with (and hopefully you don't mind those same people double-dipping their spoons into the giant sundae).

Otherwise, their hot chocolate is fabulous as well as their chocolate dipped waffle cone.  Oh yea ...
author: spiff e.

description: This place can get busy, but I love the energy and ambiance of the area. Especially during the holidays and at night. The chocolate sauce in the sundae is really delicious, I can taste the milk in it! It's not a place for chocolate conoisseurs, and there are a lot of tourists. However, if you can get past that, it's a great place to have dessert.
author: Chrystel J.

description: Free chocolate square when entering the store.  It's a great place to cool down and get a milkshake or ice cream...but be prepared it's very pricey and touristy.
author: Krys G.

description:
i finally had a chance to come here! 

for my first time, i just went with the regular hot fudge sundae in a waffle cone. i really liked the fudge, it wasn't overly sweet. the only thing though was that it was on the bottom and i had expected it to be on top of the ice cream. i normally really like waffle cones but i didn't really like the one my ice cream came with. it was too hard and the chocolate that covered was too bitter for me

i don't really have a sweet tooth so this isn't a place i would crave to come, but the reason why i give it four stars is because i do see why a lot of people, especially chocolate and ice cream lovers, come here, whether its with a group of friends, or on a date.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Can I first point out that I'm thoroughly annoyed that there are two places to review the Ghirardelli ice cream parlor? Usually Yelp combines duplicates but for some reason they've let these two review pages run rampant and it almost annoyed me enough to not review the place! Collapse the lame 21 review page with the misspelled name (GhiraRdelli no Ghiradelli people) so we can get on with it already!

Hokay, so.

I have lived here for more than 2 years now and I am still and will forever be a Ghirardelli ice cream parlor regular.  Of course I bring all my friends and family from out of town here but I have absolutely no shame in showing up at this place on my own and with other residents at any given time.  There just isn't any other place like it in the city.

I am particularly fond of the warm brownie sundae EVEN though the brownie is never really warm. It's just so good that it doesn't even matter. This coming from a warm chocolaty molten dessert snob.

I don't know what it is about this place but regardless of whether you're a visitor or a resident of San Francisco... go. go. go to Ghirardelli for some ice creamy goodness.
author: Derek B.

description:
YUM, YUM and more YUM!

Yes, I went through the store twice just to get another free chocolate form the nice lady at the door.

Well, you can buy Ghirardelli Chocolate just about anywhere in the US.  But I just love coming here because this is where it was born.  I also love the ice cream they serve.  It is usually really busy here, because it is a tourist stop.  But don't forget to venture out and see the other neat stores and restaurants in the shopping plaza.
author: John O.

description: Soo worth the walk here.  Delish deserts and took home some chocolates.  Gave only a few away.
author: Angela D.

description:
4 stars for Ghirardelli chocolate, but 2 stars for the Ghirardelli ice cream cafe experience = 3 stars overall.

I am very pro-Ghirardelli in general (hey, it's an icon of San Francisco), but the experience going to get ice cream and sundaes at the Ghirardellli restaurant is so way, way, way, way overrated.

Everytime there is a visitor in town, I have been guilty of taking them there, waiting in a super long line in front of the store, paying for some very overpriced sundaes, fighting through the aggressive crowds to find a cramped and dirty table inside, waiting a long time for the sundaes and for the clueless waiters/waitresses to walk through the entire place to find us, all for uninspiring sundaes. Granted the hot fudge in the sundaes is killer but the ice cream and the rest of the ingredients are no better than what you get at the supermarket. 

Bottom line: Ghirardelli chocolate and chocolate store yes, Ghirardelli ice cream shop - only if you have to and this is your absolute last resort when friends or relatives in town.
author: Jim C.

description:
I am only allowed to come here when I have an out-of-town guest visiting.  If I did not have this rule, I would be eating here ALL THE TIME.

This place used to have cutesy dootsey names for their sundaes, like "The Cable Car" and "The Earthquake," but I guess it got too confusing for people to figure out.  Now it is just the basic descriptions that match your sundaes:  raspberries and hot fudge sundae, for example.

The set-up is a little different now and actually is not as well-designed as it used to be.  The way the counter is set up totally breaks the single-file line apart and of course, all hell breaks loose as you try to approach the counter.  After that, it is the same mad dash to the first available table where you can victoriously plant your order number.  They still have the waiters and waitresses wandering around with deer-in-headlights expressions as they try to hunt down your number.

The old-fashioned hot fudge sundae is my favorite.  And the fact that it can now be ordered with DARK CHOCOLATE FUDGE makes it even better.  I usually substitute chocolate chip ice-cream for the plain vanilla scoop.  There is something so amazing about the whipped cream and the sprinkled nuts on top.  I don't know what it is but it is fabulous.

The thing that is not so fabulous is that the restrooms are all the way at the other end of the entire square.  Bummer for your lactose intolerant friends.
author: Adrienne P.

description: Plain and simple you can't go wrong with Ghirardelli.  Stand in an overly long line and you shall be rewarded with some sort of delicious treat and they have quite an assortment from just bars of chocolate to delicious sundaes (like super delicious) and even some beverages (which apparently are delicious because people would stand in line just to get one).  It is definitely a tourist trap but hey, doesn't mean it's not good!
author: Kat L.

description:
Date place number 2!  
******************************
Probably nothing more romantic than Ghiradelli sharing an ginormous bowl of ice cream at the world famous Ghiradelli.  Unless of you're planning to make out after in which the ice cream coma, in which the best use of ice cream would not be for eating but rather making out.  

I really like all of the history they try to show off at this place too, really cool.  They have ice cream process mills around this place.

-1 star for having too many tourists here ALL THE TIME.
author: patrick o.

description:
When my girlfriends come visit from out of town, I always take them here first even before the GG Bridge, the Wharf, Union Sqr or other places. I don't like their fudge sundae as much as their hot chocolate, but we always end up ordering one to share anyway. How can you not? It's "world's famous"!! It's very rich though and if you eat one on your own you can possibly clog all your arteries right then and there. So always bring your girlfriend(s) along. 

The line is always long so be patient. If it takes that long to order, it is going to be extra long to get your ice cream too. Good thing after they taste the ice cream, everyone's happy again. 

The location is great too. Don't forget to walk down to the beach, take some pictures with the Alcatraz and GG Bridge in the background. Walk up and down those steps to burn at least a few of those those calories you've just consumed. Then, sit down and enjoy the view.
author: Kwan H.

description: Um....who doesn't love this place.  Okay...so it's a little pricey, but if you're in the area and are not a local you should stop by.  The hot chocolate is to die for and is pretty reasonably priced.  The rootbeer float I got for $5.50 was also good, but I could have made it at home.  It was Barq's rootbeer and only one scoop of ice-cream for the small.  I kind of wanted more ice-cream in it.  Also if you go to the gift shop they often give out free sample squares of chocolate.  Plus it's a great view of downtown.
author: C S.

description: I'm a fan of chocolate so what better place to visit then the Ghirardelli in San Francisco. It was around 8:30 pm when we go to this place and I have to say that it was very packed!! We were hesitant to order anything because it was already late and we didn't want to get back to our hotel too late. However we couldn't resist the enticing smell and stood in line to order anyways. To our surprise our drinks were made pretty quickly. I enjoyed my warm tasty white chocolate latte outside in the cold San Francisco weather with my family. It was perfect and totally worth it.
author: Jared D.

description:
On my last trip to San Francisco I came here not once but twice... I guess that I was in need of their original hot fudge sundae. And what delicious treat they were, especially when we substituted in the dark choclate....yum.The cookie bottom sundae on the other had was not so good, too much cookie, not enough ice cream.

It can be hard to find a table when this place is crowded, as it was both times we visited, but be patient is all I can say. You can just spend your time watching them make chocolate, or eying other peoples sundae's. Also, I thought that the line out the door was a bit deceptive, since the cash register is just right inside, the line has no where to go but out.... and the move you through very quickly.

The only thing I didn't like...... the cherry on top, I don't eat those!
author: Danielle C.

description:
Prices are a bit on the expensive side, but sometimes I don't mind shelling out the extra few bucks if my madd chocolate cravings overtake any logical sense I may have.

Tables and floors are sticky. Bathroom always seems to be *under construction*. :(

The amount they put into these sundaes are huge! So, it would be wise to  share it with someone. As much as I like Ghirardelli, I've had better desserts elsewhere. 

Keep the receipt for the next time you visit for an extra 10% off or if you're feeling generous, give it to the stranger behind you!
author: Serena W.

description: Who doesn't love chocolate and shopping?!?! I had a chocolate sundae and my friend had the dark chocolate sundae. I couldn't even finish mine but I did enjoy the chocolate gooey-ness of it before I got too full! Just outside the compound I got an adorable hand-knitted hat for my soon to be born son too!
author: Kristin P.

description:
Sad sad sad... I mean yeah the chocolate is good but comeon!!! you can buy it at wallgreens!!! 
I wanted a chocolate factory! I wanted Willey Wonka, I wanted Oompa Loompas!!! What tha..........  Shops? Restaraunts? Small (SMALL!!) Samples?? Ice Cream? (horrible coffee by the way!) 
I am just so sad about it.. I may need to change to dove.
author: Tricia M.

description:
ok ok ok I know it is hell of touristy to come into the city and get some ice cream and Ghirardelli but I SWEAR I don't bring a camera. Sometimes this place drives me crazy. It's like a cest pool for pain-in-the-ass-children-from-around-the-world-who's-parents-should-NOT-be-giving-them-more-sugar-but-little-Timmy-whined-and-got-his-way. International hyperactive PITACFATWWPSNBGTMSBLTWAGHW's are pretty much everywhere in this place and while this normally sends me into a punching in the face fit, their sundaes are just really good. 

I'm a big fan of dark chocolate and I love the fact that they serve hot fudge dark chocolate. I mean what a concept right? Right now they have this whole dark chocolate fall lineup and a lot of their sundaes feature some good ass chocolate. Plus sometimes all I want to do is sit down with a huge sundae and a group of friends and judge people. There's a certain satisfaction to stuffing my face with ice cream and making fun of Mary-Sue's bangs. If you're like me, then this is the perfect place for you!

Still, even though it's ALWAYS crowded and a really trendy tourist spot, they make some damn fine chocolate and some delicious ice cream creations.
author: Mark B.

description: I ordered a white chocolate mocha hot drink. It was served just barely warm. I informed the server and he took it back. They reheated it but the flavor was awful.  I had the same drink at the San Diego location and it was great.  Disappointed!
author: Cris M.

description: The hot fudge sundae was just under $10 with tax and was too small.
author: Peter S.

description: I still like coming here for a Sundae, while most of the sundaes remain the same, the prices went up as time goes on. The Earthquake sundae really needs a lot of hungry ice cream eaters.... don't try to eat it yourself.
author: qirk z.

description:
Holy moly, macarroni! This place is great anytime and anyday. Such a touristy place too! hahaha. What I don't like about this place is that if you go there on a holiday or on a weekend, or even during the summer, it'll take you a long time to be seated (of course, im sure it depends on the time of the day you go). 

The chocolate is spectacular. They have such a great variety of ice creams and malts... I'd hate to live in SF, because if I did, I'd gain weight like crazy overnight (and everynight). Prices can be hard to look at, but I think it's totally worth the trip.
author: Rick K.

description:
Tourist trap? Yes!
Worth visiting? Yes!
Tasty stuff? HELL yes!
The only minus is that everything is just waaaay too sweet (which of course never stopped me personally).
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description: I absolutely loved visiting the home of Ghirardelli!  There was a little bit of a wait with the long line, but it's understandable!  The only reason I'd give it 4 stars was because I couldn't finish my dessert because it was so rich (and I have a terrible sweet tooth)!  But I'll blame my eyes for being too large for my stomach.  :D  Yay Ghirardellli!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I'm just glad I don't have visitors more often or we'd be putting on some serious weight. We usually visit and indulge from the menu when we are touring the city with friends and family.

If it was a Banana Split or the famous Hot Fudge Sundae, you can't go wrong. I've had almost everything on the menu by now and never regretted.

The parking garage is a pain, I usually find street parking and feed the meter.
author: Gabriel T.

description: As a tourist a Ghiradeli sundae was a must.  Ghiradeli square has three Ghiradeli chocolate shops.  They all serve sundaes.  The one with the cafe is super crowded and the one by the rest rooms had no people.  I would recommend going to the less crowded one and taking the sundae to the park to eat.  Got the gold rush (peanut butter and fudge).  It was good but had more peanut butter than fudge so I would ask them to put less peanut butter on next time.  Used a $1 off coupon I found in a Fisherman's Wharf map.
author: Catherine S.

description: High prices for just regular (warm sunday browni). It's stuffed in a glass where everything is melting on everything else.
author: Saad A.

description: Went here last night after some sushi. WOW a true San Francisco iconic place. The atmosphere is true tourist and fun to see the crowd. As always the fudge brownie did its thing. Great to go at night, even if it is freezing cold!
author: Chris H.

description: This is a must....the brownie sundae is to die for!  Unfortunately the seating area is an issue since its so crowded but still highly recommend it!
author: Tony C.

description: My twin nephews came to town to spend time with me and I took them here as a treat. We got peanut butter cupcakes from Tara & hot cocoa drinks from Ghirardelli. It was the perfect combination on a chilly day.
author: Monica M.

description: Could not have picked a better place for a quick dessert on our vacation.
author: Brad P.

description: I love Ghiradelli chocolate so much. The sundaes are delectable, the hot chocolate is perfect when it's cold.
author: Derya A.

description: Tourist trap, I'm a chocolate snob and Ghiradelli just doesn't cut it....any of it.  Not the ice cream, and definitely not the chocolate.  Hershey makes better tasting chocolate than this place.  Head down to the Ferry Building Marketplace and hit up Recchiuti confections to see what good chocolate really tastes like....quality not quantity.
author: Pamela M.

description: This is an interesting, touristy place to come to at least once in your life. I don't think I would go back more than once though. I love chocolate and ice cream, but this place was just overload. Neither my boyfriend or I could finish our sundaes.
author: Jen S.

description:
Life is short people. just relax and enjoy the smell of chocolate, get mesmerized watching the vats of liquid pleasure move in a smooth motion.  Who's needs hypnotherapy? 

Maybe I get more out of this since I was here frequently when I was a kid.  Brings back sweet memories.

Place is local and getting more popular.

Don't forget to your samples of chocolate squares...Just remember if there were no tourists, half of the city would be out of a job. Your also a tourist in someone else's hometown.
author: Ariel W.

description: As a bay area resident, this chocolate is tasty but overpriced.  If you're looking for a specialty item, go to this store and pick it up.  Or you can treat yourself to a nice ice cream sundae.  One bonus you get shopping here is if you save your receipt, you can get a 10% discount off your next purchase.  The annual chocolate festival, however, is pretty damn cool.  It's a neat two day festival where you can indulge in chocolate goodness.
author: Amy J.

description:
very nice place at the end of the wharf. come and visit at least once in your lifetime. unfortunately when we went, they were still renovated a big portion of the square. but there are some stores along with this chocolate place thats still open during construction. they hand out free samples and have some on sale, but honestly, you can get them just about anywhere else.

btw, the view of the ocean from the square at night is absolutely amazing!
author: Sara C.

description: We ordered the brownie sundae again but by the time they found our table our ice cream was mostly melted and it looks like the brownie got smaller. Perhaps we should have returned our sundae for a new one.
author: Helen L.

description: I've actually lived in San Francisco for almost 19 years and I haven't even been to this place - I've seen it, but never had the interest of going it, partially because of the line of customers leading out the door. When I actually came here, the line only took about 2 minutes! What complete awesome-ness! I had the caramel sundae and I will tell you now, there is a whole lot of caramel and a whole lot of sundae. I could only eat about 2/3 of the sundae before it became pure liquid and caramel. Come here if you are in the mood to eat a load of delicious ice cream. And when you're done, you can burn some of those calories off by walking around Ghirardelli Square.
author: Ryan L.

description: This review is for their retail shop.  I just spent $35 for a small tin of chocolates (2 lbs) and was told it would cost 10 cents for a paper bag to put it in to carry home.  Wow, that's a first for me!
author: Debbie H.

description:
It's a Fun place to take out of town guests for a visit.

I'm usually don't like chocolate but I have to admit  that their Hot Cocoa drinksare pretty good. The earthquake ice cream is always number one on my list.  Highly recommended the Earth quake for a group of four or more. Can't wait to go there again.
author: T B.

description:
Chocolate heaven *cue the collective singing 'ahhhhhhhh'*!

I mean, how can you not love their wide variety of chocolates and the ice cream? Hello, ice cream?!

And on certain weekends they have a live jazz band playing out in the square. Very cool.
author: Maricel B.

description: Had a banana split , it was good,I found it weird that they used strawberry,chocolate, with pineapple ice cream ?? I thought it was suppose to be vanilla, any ways the place was packed but they were able to get my order ready very quickly and the food runners were able to find our table without delay or getting lost in the crowd. I would come back again but probably not often, recommend this place for visitors and kids !
author: Jasmine L.

description: There's better chocolate in the world.  Much better.  Still, you gotta appreciate the history.  And the chocolate isn't bad.
author: Kent K.

description: Okay I love this place, I love the advertising photo of that sundae that drags me into to that place, yes it a little pricey for a sundae but you know what, it really is tasty even though it's a cold day outside, so anytime I'm in San Fran I always stop by.
author: B T.

description: more of a tourist trap type of place, but still quality chocolate!
author: Spenser D.

description: Haven't gotten the chance to try the ice cream but the hot chocolate is to die for!! Best hot chocolate hands down! If you don't mind the wait and the overwhelming amount of people this tourist attraction brings, definitely hit this up! you won't regret it! Great for locals and out of towners!
author: Esther M.

description: Best Ice Cream place in San Francisco for the ambience and everything (get the whole tourist and view thing going), but the best is the "Strike it Rich" which you can only get at Ghirardelli.  The Bannana Split and Fudge anything is the best.  The price is not cheap and the wait can be long, but it is a blast.
author: Christopher A.

description: Best sundaes everrr!! Make sure you get something with fudge! That's one of the best parts about ghiradelli sundaes.
author: T L.

description: I love ice cream and the combination of their house made chocolate makes it that much more worth it. Anytime of day you crave for something Sweet. Come here!
author: Julie B C.

description: I love chocolate.  I also love milkshakes.  I love San Francisco institutions.  I love hot fudge, especially when it comes at the bottom of my milkshake.  I love chocolate that has a taste you can't get in a Hershey's bar.  Hence, I loved Ghirardelli.
author: Jeremy G.

description: This has always been a favorite spot for my family to visit on a day in the city. We were excited about the new addition of the marketplace and decided to have ice cream there. We placed our order indoors and sat at the tables outside. It was only moderately busy with over half the tables empty. It took half an hour to get our order. When they finally came out, the waiter asked "did you wait long?"  We answered yes and his response was "well we have a lot  going on today."  Then when it was pointed out that the ice cream was melted, the waiter said "no it's not." The. Followed up with, it's supposed to be that way. I could not believe how terrible the service was and will not be going back.
author: Rose C.

description: Wow, the hot chocolate here is to die for!   If you like very rich hot chocolate that tastes like a melted chocolate bar...   you must try Ghirardelli's hot chocolate.   The shop was cute, and you could walk around and see how the chocolate is made.   It smelled really good in there - like waffle cones  :-)   I'm looking forward to going back and trying the ice cream!
author: Cheryl B.

description: Very VERY expensive. $9 for a medium sized fudge sundae. It was good, but way too expensive for ice cream and a little fudge. It was also very crowded and we were lucky to find seating. We had to share our booth with a poor lady who could not find a seat. The place was clean, the sundae was very yummy, but it was just too busy (came around 4 or 5pm) and expensive for me to go again. If you are only in San Francisco for one day and price is not an issue for you, it WAS a very nice site to see. The square outside was very cool--it had a fountain and seating, and there was a live one-man band playing wonderful music. The public bathrooms (women's) was very crowded--line went outside. But overall it was a cool place--just be ready to spend money and time waiting in lines.
author: Christie B.

description: Best ice cream and hot fudge in the world. The portions are enormous so I recommend getting a single scoop of your favorite flavor with dark chocolate hot fudge in a cup. Take it To-Go if it isn't your first time. No need to sit in the crowded shop, plus you get your order faster. Sit by the fountain or go down to aquatic park and watch the swimmers while you guiltlessly enjoy your hot fudge sundae.
author: Madeline R.

description:
Ghirardelli Chocolate/ Ice Cream shop is pure torture for a lactose intolerant man like myself.  The chocolate was great but the sundae was amazing. My girlfriend forced me to taste it, and my thoughts of being lactose intolerant went out of the window. There are really no words to describe it. 
It is in the "tourist trap" of Ghirardelli square and you will literally have to fight your way in and hover over people just to find a seat. If you can manage the crowds of tourists, it is A MUST HAVE in the city.
author: Frank B.

description:
OK, I live in SF. Proud of it. But ashamed when a local institution goes so far south it's embarrassing. Here, the tourists are fleeced for the "famous SF chocolate" & ice cream. You're better off going to Mitchell's Ice Cream or the St. Francis Ice Cream Fountain (both in the Mission). 

Used to be you could get table service. For a while now, you stand in line outside (mooo! ), then grab a menu and order and pay just inside the door. They give you a number, which you then take into the dining room, where you scan for an empty table.  Next, you hope to catch the eye of a waitron, and beg them to clean your table.  After a while, your melted ice cream sundae will be brought to you. Our waitron dropped plastic spoons onto the table (yech!), and walked off, even though they have long-handled metal spoons designed to reach into sundae glasses. We had to walk up to the counter to get them. We saw the great service was extended to others there, for example, the elderly guy w/ the "Retired US Air Force" ballcap who asked a 20ish waitron dude if he could use his rag to wash off his family's table.  The waitron grunted assent, and the USAF dude washed down the table while the waitron stood there watching him in amazement, something like 'huh, so that's how you clean a table' flashing across his face. You'd think this place would train their workers, or keep on only those who know how to treat paying customers. This is pathetic.  

Oh, yeah.  The ice cream?  Only so-so. Better to get the waxy free sample next door or upstairs and skeedaddle to Mitchell's.
author: Sue Ellen S.

description:
I've died and gone to candy land! The best chocolate candy, sundaes and shakes in the city!  (but when it comes to plain ice cream,  Swanson's in Russian Hill is a top contender.)  
Who says the chocolate factory is just for tourists? I've gone to see them make the creamy confection several times.  It takes me back to Charley and the Chocolate Factory without the oompa loompas. Plus you can't beat the patio sights and sounds of the sqaure.
author: Deanna C.

description:
Another tourist must-stop. This place is always packed no matter what season... I'm not a huge fan of chocolate, but it's always nice to visit this place from time to time.

Once you order, you're off finding the first open table there is, since it's always crowded w/tourists & large groups and families. What's nice about this place is their servers comes, finds you & give you your order.

There are 2 floors. The lower floor has the majority of the seating and has the wheel of chocolate for viewers to watch. The upper floor has another small ordering booth (probably for quick drink orders) and a small seating area.

If you're in the area, be adventureous and try the Earthquake. I've never attempted it before, but maybe I will one day (but not by myself)
author: Rosie C.

description: Good chocolate.  We had the earthquake.  Good, but there was way too much whipped cream, melted waay too fast, and I'm not a huge fan of maraschino cherries.  Much of it ended up being a puddly brown creamy goo with no distinguishable flavors in the end.  Sadface.  Was yummy while it was still in ice cream form.
author: Xue H.

description:
Yes, you must go get free chocolate and a hot fudge sundae.

If you get on thier email list they send you coupons.
author: Virginia L.

description:
Omg... the BEST sundaes I have EVER had are found at the Ghirardelli ice cream parlor. It was seriously an orgasm in every bite. The first time I had a Ghirardelli sundae, was in Old Town Pasadena, but they took it out!! I'm sooo sad.

I had a sundae with butterscotch at the San Francisco one. It was AMAZING. I wish we still had one down here.

If you're ever at Ghirardelli Square, have a sundae! It will change your life.
author: Tony Y.

description:
TOURIST TRAP with a cherry on top...

Watch out for the yuppie couples wine tasting and buying full outfits for thier pocket poodles.

Never would have come here if my friends didn't work at the cafe - loved the free (Peanut butter milk choc.) samples as you walk in the door, and the existence of the brownie fudge sundae...  but you cant deny that its pretty hard to f*ck up chocolate. I had a mint milkshake, and it was NOT as pretty as the picture showed it to be ;)

The parking machine a) ate my validation ticket. So I begrudgingly opted to pay the $9/hr for parking(?! Sheeit...) - and gave the machine my $20 - and got $6 change. Cool.

Overall annoying experience, despite the beautiful view of the bay - including a shitty musician covering The Beatles boringly and without soul. Yuck.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I'm a big time chocolate fan and this place is all about CHOCOLATE!

Staff - Wonderful staff.  Very friendly and give out chocolate samples.

Location - Nice tourist spot!

I would not order the Decadence Hot chocolate again.  After drinking that, I was chocolate out!  The Peanut Butter Caramel Sundae is AWESOME!
author: Wenzel A.

description: Nothing beats the taste of an intensely flavored hot chocolate beverage on a cold windy day!
author: Dorotka K.

description: I LOVE this place. I want to get married here. I'm a terrible chocoholic and when my boyfriend took me here, my eyes lit up, heart was pumping, and mouth salivating like a St Bernard! I can't wait to come back and visit! My ONLY two wishes are: 1) I wish my tummy could hold more so I can try all of their amazing sundaes and 2) I wish the actual store was just a wee bit bigger. Besides that, I'm on the hunt for a place to beat this magical land!
author: Jeremy Lou C.

description: I think this is a great place to take tourists. And actually a lot of bay area natives have never been here. If you have 5 or 6 friends you should definitely try the Earthquake. It's a whole lot of ice cream, chocolate, fudge, and various toppings. Once a year they also have a chocolate festival where they serve most chocolate covered things for a price, but they do give out free cake on that day that is shaped like the square. At night on a summer's day, the area is really nice to walk around too.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Whenever i go to Ghiradelli, i always make a trip of it. I take bart and get off at embarcadero, and then walk for a VERY LONG TIME (well maybe like 25 minutes) until i get to the long coveted treasure of chocolate! 

go with a group, get an earthquake! 

or not, get whatever's on the menu, its alllllllllllllllllll good. yadidamean!?
author: Janelle H.

description:
I really don't see the fuss about this place, I am sorry... I mean it's a landmark/tradition.. but I probably wouldn't go back after the 1st time.  

For the full review and pictures go to http://www.kats9lives.com/2008/05/got-chocolate.html

We were running an errand near by so we decided to stop by Ghiradelli to have a Caramel Sundae. They were handing out their new Peanut Butter Squares to try and they were fabulous! If you love peanut butter like I do, this will become one of your favorites! Now that I think about it again, I want more! ^_^ It's even better than Reese's Peanut Butter Cup because of the real nuts inside and rich filling that's enveloped in rich Ghiradelli chocolate. **drool drool**

There were very few people around in Ghiradelli Square because it's a week day. The only place that had any signs of life was Ghiradelli. Once you enter you will see a bunch of people enjoying cold desserts. The service was friendly and quick. Ms. Lin and I shared a Caramel Sundae, but we changed the Vanilla ice cream to Kona Coffee ice cream. The ice cream was flavorful, although the whole thing was melting when it came to us. I didn't like the caramel because it was way too sweet for my palette. If it were up to me, I would have gotten the mint or peanut butter sundae.

All in all it was good and an experience that one must do when they are at Ghiradelli Square. I have to say the price is definitely not worth it, but the experience is why you go. Now I want to go back to get Kara's cupcakes and buy more of the yummy peanut butter chocolate they gave away. Yum Yum! They have a nice assembly line displayed inside Ghiradelli. I tried to make a nice collage of the process that the chocolate goes through before they are left out to solidify. Got Chocolate? O=P
author: Kat L.

description:
Places like this make me hate people, because it brings out the worst in some of them.  After standing by a table for 15 minutes, I moved in to take it once I confirmed with the family they were done.  Some [insert expletive here] swooped in and took my table.  WTF?  (Did I mention my 71 year-old Dad needed to sit because he has a bad knee?)  She knew she was in the wrong because I gave her the evil eye and we caught each others eyes for a brief moment, and she looked away. 

In any case, the line is always long during summer months, especially on weekends or holidays.  Parking is spendy and hard to find (unless you park at the top of a hill 3 blocks away).  I would say you can go somewhere better, filled with less rude [insert another expletive here], with equally delicious ice cream and other dairy treats.
author: San D.

description:
I'm looking forward to the next big earthquake because I think maybe, just maybe the throng of idiot tourists will slow down and I'll be able to get a goddamn 'uge hot fudge sundae here. Every time I begrudgingly let an out of towner convince me they really want to see Fisherman's Wharf, I stare at the long line of jerks and the delicious sundaes everywhere.

To fully disclose: my manfriend and I pretend to be tourists every single time we are near a Ghirardelli store so we can act like we're browsing and had no idea you get little free squares of chocolate. Thye never remember us. It's a perfect scheme.
author: Shannon V.

description:
The original San Francisco chocolate.

This place is for tourists, but I know plenty of locals that enjoy sundaes here too. Locals should avoid weekends, but most weeknights are pretty low-key. I like that it's pretty spacious and that you can see chocolate being made. It's very quaint even as it's very well-known and commercial. A fun place to share a sundae with the girls (or a special guy)
author: Christy M.

description:
...Mmmm, that creamy, chocolatey fudge at the base of your vanilla ice cream, topped with whipped cream and nuts...oh, and you can't forget the cherry. 

That is what I think of when I think of this place. 

I realize this is a tourist trap, but it's okay for San Franciscans to enjoy this local sundae shop too. I also understand that it's probably cheaper to buy all these ingredients and make one or more for the price you pay for one of these very sundaes. But you know what? It's just not worth all the hassle when you can have one delivered to your table and not do all the assembling yourself; especially when you want one at the very minute you want one. My friends and I love coming here to enjoy a sundae while chatting away. Be careful while eating your sundae, it may cause an overflow and it could get messy. Go ahead; indulge yourself in this chocolatey goodness.

Don't forget to view the flow of Ghirardelli chocolate at the back of this place because it's cool.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I've been here two weekends in a row - yikes! I love the nostalgia and the ice cream creations. I don't know if they make their ice cream on location, but their conconctions are delicious - simple and decadent. My first visit was a week ago and I had the regular sundae with dark chocolate... daaaaaaaaaamn it was good. I love the warm/cold combination. This past weekend I had the cookie-bottom sundae and I wasn't too fond of it because the cookie was a bit overwhelming to me.

Service both times were fast and very friendly. No attitudes, lots of smiles. They encouraged us to take samples at the front where you order your ice cream. I enjoyed every minute of it and I look forward to returning... maybe this weekend haha.
author: Angie J.

description:
My boyfriend ordered a $8 banana split last night and quipped "it cost's as much as a meal!". I told him, it probably has just as many calories, too. 

I don't really go down to the Pier 39 area, and I've only been to Ghiradelli Square as a tourist and for visitors. I have noticed that there is constantly a line, and the few times I've had my own sundae I haven't been all that impressed.

Case in point: last night we ordered a banana split, with lacked chocolate sauce and came with coffee instead of strawberry ice cream. What? That's weird.

It seems that during the extremely busy hours, you wait about a century to get your order. It's loud and filled with tourists- who, let's face it, can get on your nerves after a while- especially when all you want is your chocolate sundae that you know is bad for you but oooh so good tasting.

Anyway. As far as I figure, G. Square is a fun place for tourists, a fat-trap for locals, and not worth a visit if you need a bar of chocolate. Just stop by your local Walgreen's.
author: Erin M.

description:
Yes, I know it's a tourist trap, and yes, I know that it's expensive. But I never really go to this neck of the woods, and it was a good change of scenery. It was cool to look at the lights at night. ANYWAYS. 

So when my group went there, there was no line. It was awesome like that. And the service was super fast. We sat down and were served. The place is pretty warm, so some friends went to the bathrooms and their banana split was melting. But my thing was good. I liked it a lot. It was a build-your-own-sundae thing. I love ice-cream...god, this is so incoherent. 

The bad thing about this place is the bathroom situation. Every single goddamned time I've come here, the bathroom is for some reason, in a different place. Last time it was through this secret corridor, down the elevator, through a secret passage way around the corner. Now it was down all they way on Beach St. in this fucking van. And they tried to class it up with their fucking wooden doors on the stalls. UH-UH. Hell nah. I didnt drive my fucking fat ass all the way here to use some Shitter-On-Wheels. That pissed me off. But yeah. Minus 1 star for that.
author: Dustin H.

description:
The chocolate shop is just my dream place. All sorts of ghiradelli chocolates and assortments. Yum yum yum. So, 5 stars here

The Ice cream is alright, I don't see what the fuss is all about though. It is just alright ice cream.So, 3 stars here
author: Mona O.

description:
I remember going here as a child the first time I was in San Francisco. I'm definitely thankful that there's one located in Downtown San Diego within the Gaslamp area. My fiance and I had the pleasure of visiting Ghirardelli Square after eating at Pier 39. 

In fact, we walked to Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop from Pier 39 and was able to order a Hot Fudge Brownie Sundae 5 minutes prior to closing. Despite the cold weather, I was determined to have that Sundae and I enjoyed every spoonful!
author: Joy F.

description: Tried the Mint Bliss after grabbing some dinner nearby. The store is neat but the dessert could have used more ice cream and less fudge in it. For the price I'd rather go grab some frozen yogurt.
author: Shaun S.

description: This place is maaaaad good! I came here with a few friends from out of town and its been wonderful. The place is absolutely beautiful and services as a tourist attraction for this same reason. Sadly, I wish I had found out about this place sooner. This place rocks my... Socks.
author: John C.

description: If you get two sundaes AND one hot chocolate, that puts the tab just over $20 so you get free validated parking downstairs!!!  We liked the midnight reverie chocolate-chocolate fudge-chocolate ice cream better than the original one with the vanilla ice cream.  Just saying.
author: Brad K.

description:
So I took my fiancee there for her 1st ever sundae....No, I am not engaged to a six year old girl, but rather an apparently sheltered 33 year old.  The sundaes are classic and the ice cream is quite good.  Most sundaes have 2 scoops and hot fudge poured over it.  The ice cream melts fairly quickly and the hot fudge hardens a bit.  The milky slush that results is just as I remember as a kid.  If you order the Presidio Sundae, then you get a large chocolate covered strawberry.  Considering that at Godiva, those strawberries are $4-$5, the sundae is a deal at $8.95.    
They have a window where you can watch the chocolate making process.  However, be aware that overweight people may be mesmerized by this process and block the flow of traffic.  In our case, one large lady stood there drooling for so long that we gave up trying to view the process.  I don't mean to be harsh, but she was large and was there for a long time.
author: Benjamin T.

description: Nice place to stroll through. Ate an $8 chocolate sunday and drank a $3 bottle of water. I figure you might as well see the place. It was fun looking for the building from Alcatraz. Sf i will be back.
author: Shabbadd S.

description: Where to start?  One hour wait for ice cream that comes out half melted? 11 dollars for a sundae? Dirty floors and sticky tables? Obviously, they don't care about customer service as they just take your money and move you along (like cattle).  Whoever manages or owns this place needs to take some more pride in service and cleanliness.
author: Enrico C.

description:
Good, but tricky: the sundaes are tasty, but overly priced, and decivingly small--they put them in very thick glasses to maek them look huge, and you are like holy crap how can i finish this, but then you get halfway through and are still hungry and though you're full at the end and not mad because you are, it's a little annoying to get to the bottom of what I thought was huge and find it to be simply overpriced.

it's a tourist trap, and it's not even the kind where it's okay for locals to go once in a while.
author: Caroline C.

description:
If you are in Ghirardelli Square you must go here.  This is just pure ice cream and sundae heaven.  I have yet to have a bad food experience here.

Having said that, seating is pretty horrible.  It's popular enough that finding an open table is a challenge.  And chances are you are there with a small group of people, and finding the extra chairs is next to impossible.  The tables also tend to be sticky because the staff are so busy simply bussing the dirty dishes around.

Times visited: 3+
author: Amy L.

description:
I like it!  Ice cream...Good, Chocolate...Good....Views of the Bay...Good.
Plus.. Free Samples!  I must have stepped in and out at least three times and I got free samples each time!  

Yes, I like free stuff!  Don't you?
author: YJ H.

description:
If I can only eat a sundae here everyday for the rest of my life I'd be a happy girl. A happy morbidly obese girl, but happy nonetheless. I've decided once (or maybe twice) a year would work out better. Thank goodness I don't live close by. 

Btw, they have a great chocolate festival towards the end of summer! Ok, maybe now three times a year...
author: Pippi L.

description:
While not a huge chocolate person at all, this place does make a pretty good sundae. I recommend it for out of towners or in the event that you live in the surrounding blocks and just have a craving. 

All in all, I think I prefer Swensen's but this is good and perfectly acceptable.
author: Anita B.

description:
A great place to just hang out and let loose! and, enjoy some chocolate, of course. I love this place and all the memories it brings of my old high school days with my friends. Free samples of chocolate squares once you walk into the shop, with the menu and registers in the adjacent ordering area. 

The dining area itself surrounds a beautiful old-timey chocolate mill..or whatever they call it and has a lot of historical facts about Ghirardelli Square. But, the BEST part of Ghriardelli Square is it's outdoor balcony-esk seating. Everyone is welcome to head upstairs to the balcony overlooking the beautiful San Francisco views...really nice when you can catch a non-foggy night. 

A great place to go for a group or a romantic date

A must: The Hot Chocolate and The Earthquake (A giant 8-scoop ice cream sundae) with extra hot fudge (for chocolate shots, of course, and extra cherries for everyone to tie cherry knots with their tongues!)
author: Jessica h.

description:
Ghirardelli's ice cream shop is the place I head when I have a taste for hot fudge.  Theirs is great!  I also strongly recommend getting the chocolate ice cream here as opposed to the classic vanilla.  After all, chocolate is what Ghirardelli's does best!
As a side note, don't bother with the brownie sundae... the brownies just aren't that good.  The Fella does recommend the new raspberry parfait with dark chocolate hot fudge.
author: Kri B.

description:
The ice cream here is so creamy and amazing. They're large though- so you might need a friend to share that "small" ice cream.

Mmmmmm. Oh and the chocolate ain't bad. Are they, like, known for that or something?
author: Diana H.

description:
Things I Hate:  Crowds, Tourists, Lines

Things I Love:  Ice Cream, Chocolate

You would think Ghiradelli wouldn't add up, and truthfully I've only ever gone here when people are visiting from out of town (because otherwise you won't find me anywhere near Fisherman's Wharf).  Still, this place has the best ice cream sundaes in the city.  

I recommend bringing friends so you can try multiple sundaes all at once or so you can try the massive Earthquake, though that's more for bragging rights than anything else.  An assortment of smaller sundaes is the way to go.

Oh - and do yourself a favor and take public transit.  The 10 and 30 routes go to the Market/Union Square area.
author: Tullia F.

description: Delicious chocolate, standard Ghirardelli fare.  Overpriced and touristy, but where else can you watch a stream of chocolate flowing through mysterious chocolate-making machines while you wait for you your shake?
author: Paul K.

description:
We used to frequent this place when I was in high school. Since then, I think I've been once or twice. You can't really mess up ice cream sundaes but the service is aweful.

You ever notice you can't understand anyone that works their? It's also a tourist trap and I'm not huge on having to hassle with tourists. It's just a little annoying, but aside from that it's all good.
author: Douglas L.

description: If you love chocolate, this is your haven!  If you walk into the store, you are sure to get a free sample of their new flavor.  And their ice-cream and hot-chocolates are chocolicious!  They also have brownies, cookies, coffee and everything imaginable that has chocolate in it.  Mmmmmmmmmmm....water in my mouth....
author: Doris T.

description: Gotta take out of town guests!  Great for kids.
author: Mark W.

description: Great waffle cones and friendly staff. Good thing I don't live close.
author: Matt K.

description: Came here a few months back while visiting family. It was the weekend, and it was crowded but nothing gets between me and chocolate. I got in line and ordered a chocolate ice cream cone. It was rich and creamy and delicious and I wish I had a Ghirardelli ice cream shop close to home. I want more, please.
author: Meesh G.

description: Great ice cream, really does taste homemade and maintains a soft consistency without actually being melted.  The sundae did have a bit more chocolate than I could actually handle but I suppose it is the Ghirardelli shop.  I did not like the actual layout of the shop, it gets crowded at the front and is not very inviting.  An otherwise nice place to sit down and have a late night snack
author: Michael C.

description:
OOOOOOOOH~LA~LA! Can I put it any other way? I stopped by on a very hot spring day. When I got my chococlate ice-cream soda (yum!) I slurped it down so fast that when I looked up, all my friends were staring at me. hahahhahhaha....Yes, it was so good, that when I saw one of their cafes in Miami, I ran in there.

Haven't tried anything else, but from what my friends ordered, you can't walk by this place. Too bad it's so crowded in there.
author: Lala L.

description:
We made it here just in time to squeeze in between the inexplicable 2:31 and 3:17 crunch.  

I had a hankering for a sundae for about five days before we came here, and my craving is now sated.  Yes, I did have a stomach ache for about two hours after.  Yes, I did give my friend who ordered the sipping chocolate the ridiculous amount of whipped cream that topped my sundae to make her drink a bit more drink-able.  Yes, we were surrounded by tourists (one with a sweet mullet), and watched a poor, awkward 12 year old girl have happy birthday half-ass sung to her.  But I don't care, I will come here again.  And when I do, all of the above will probably happen again, including hopefully getting in between the staggered rush of chocolate-crazy patrons.
author: Nicole A.

description:
Touristy, but definitely worth it for the sundaes. I like the Walnut Creek location better because it's my neighborhood, but you can't beat the view in the city. 

Yesterday they had a promotion for a dollar off any specialty sundae and I tried out their new mint dark fudge sundae which was YUM. 

Also they opened a new location in the back which beats waiting in line.
author: Tara P.

description:
You have to try the hot fudge.... Dont be ashamed that this could be a tourist thing to do right off the fishermen's wharf.... It's OK.... Your trip to SF is imcomplete if you dont try the hot fudge. We go to SF every weekend (almost), and we still go there everytime we are in SF. The milk inside the hot fudge is so thick....... OH..... so good..... and the chocolate.... Mint chocolate fudge is good too..... silky.... 
Yes, you need to spend more than $20 to get validated parking.... Then just pick up some chocolate.... or parking itself is 6 bucks!
author: JJ G.

description:
Though I live in Nob Hill, I never make it to the Fisherman's Wharf area unless I have people in town.  Whenever a friend comes in, I make sure to take him/her to Ghirardelli.  The parlor has been really busy the past few times I've been in and we have to prowl the tables looking for someone who looks almost finished, which can be annoying.  Also, free chocolate used to sit at the cash registers, but the past two times I've been there it was gone, boo.  I used to love taking a ton of that free chocolate!

The cookie sundae is definitely my favorite.  I will do almost anything for a delicious, warm cookie covered in ice cream, hot fudge and whipped cream.  Don't be fooled by the brownie sundae; it's a cold brownie and not as good.

To all my friends back in Ohio: come out and visit me ASAP.  I'm getting hungry again just writing this review and want to go back.
author: Jessica C.

description:
holy chocolate deliciousness.

for a chocolate lover like myself, this is heaven. great variety of sundaes, yummy-tasting fudge. loved the raspberry dark chocolate sundae i had last weekend.

the one minor problem is that they tend to have an overwhelming ratio of fudge to ice cream, and the warm fudge tends to melt the ice cream quickly. but it's still all good.

the lines are long and it's hard to find seating, but it's easy to see why this place is so popular.
author: Caroline I.

description:
I felt like such a lard-o after eating here, but it was soooo worth it. That mint thingy sundae that I got was heaven. Mmmmmm. That thing must have been 3000 calories but it was worth every pound I gained from engulfing it. The fudge and the chocolate were delicious. 

I should have known what i was getting myself into when I tasted one of your peppermint bark samples at the register.... mmm.. heaven.

Calorie and cost aside, it was totally worth it. Not an everyday thing however, but a great place to treat yourself and cash in those fat points.
author: Rocky K.

description:
I think, this type of dessert is really hard to make distingisable and memorable. 
IT JUST ICECREAM and some sugary syurps and chocolate. 
Trust me folks, you can get this shit anywhere else and it will cost you less than $8 a scoop.
author: E C.

description:
What can I say, the servings are big, the price is high, and the line is almost always out the door.

If you are in the area and want some good people watching for a bit, its worth it...the Sunday's aren't bad, there is definitely better though.
author: Jason B.

description:
I LOOOOVE CHOOOOCOLLLAAATE. (but u can't eat too much or else you'll get fat)

These are some of the BEST sundaes I've ever had. I think the hot fudge is...awesomely awesome. Ironically, the time that I went I had just gotten a cavity done and it ended up getting infected...GROSS. BUT I still managed to scarf down the sundae in agonizing pain because it was so worth it...at this point all I remember is the sundae and not the pain.

YUM!
author: Clarisse C.

description: It's a classic, and the best place for tourists! The ice cream is pretty good and the price is good. The service is fast, considering the insane amount of people there. but its not somewhere i would go often. Good once in a while.
author: Nikita K.

description: Not a big fan of chocolate myself, but my gf is...so taking her here was a no brainer. The sea salt caramel hot cocoa is the best hot chocolate ive ever had. Prepare to wait for a table as the place was jammed pack on a rainy day
author: Andrew P.

description: Wow. Best hot chocolate and ice cream sundae EVER. So good that on our last day in SF, we ate here and had ice cream for BREAKFAST. Get the chocolate midnight and the salted caramel hot chocolate. You won't be sorry you stopped here.
author: D G.

description:
Went here a couple of weekends ago entertaining relatives from Canada.  The desserts were alright, but, we couldn't find a table since it was so busy (Friday Night).  

The prices were on the high side, in my opinion.  9 Dollars for a sundae....

If you like desserts, you'll love this place!  The melted chocolate on the Sundaes were good.  

The out-of-town guests loved the visit.  If you take them to Fisherman's Wharf, you have to stop by here....
author: Edward L.

description: The banana split was good, but not mind-blowing. Nevertheless, visiting Ghirardelli Square and the shop was an experience!
author: Minji K.

description:
As a chocolate lover, I had to come here for the chocolate and the experience. I walked in the top of the building and thought that was all there was to Ghirardelli Chocolate...I was wrong. We realized that there is an ice cream and coffee stand upstairs and downstairs. Downstairs, in the corner, they show you how they make the chocolate, which is fun to watch. They also have the beloved chocolate store where you can buy all of your goodies. I definitely recommend getting the Ghirardelli mocha chocolate powder. 

This is obviously a touristy place, but I live in San Francisco now and still wanted to check it out.
author: Carly W.

description: When it comes down to choosing ice cream, you have to take into account what kind of texture satisfies you better. If you like the super thick stuff you might want to head to Coldstone. If you like ice cream that tastes like it's been churned with the best ingredients and is flavorful without the heavy aftertaste, go here. I ordered  chocolate dipped waffle cone with one scoop of cookie dough and one scoop of cookies and cream. Their ice cream is absolutely fresh and doesn't taste like it's been mixed with a whole bunch of guar gum and hydrogenated oils. My most favorite part actually wasn't the ice cream- it was the waffle cone. Man, i could eat that alone it was so good. The service was ok- we were handed our ice cream with no smile or verification as to what we ordered and our spoons had dirty handles. This place could work on customer service a little more.
author: A. B.

description: Ghirardelli Chocolate is the place to go to when you have that late night craving.  It is a tourist spot, but we just consider it as just a regular ice cream shop with THICK AND RICH CHOCOLATE.  Sign up for their emails and receive buy one get one free, or 1/2 off, whatever they offer.  They used to send me free ice cream coupons for my birthday too!  If you keep your receipts or even look at the bottom, it says you can get 20% off your next order at Ghirardelli!
author: Michelle N.

description:
Came in the evening for a hot fudge sundae. 

Yummy, but the hot fudge melted a lot of the ice cream already.

No restroom which was BS, you have to walk a block for the nearest restroom, which was a trailer that was leaking wastewater all over the street.
author: Joseph F.

description:
Pros: ice cream and chocolate

Cons: long line; parking might take a while (hulloo SF)

Well, ice cream and chocolate, and lots of both. What more can I say? I have always come here with good company. To enjoy sinful decadence with good company, there is really no complaints. I would say though, I've tasted better hot cocoa in a chocolate shop in Santa Cruz. I also need to warn people with eyes bigger than their stomach; they are really bigger in  this shop.

I would definitely come back here. With me being lactose intolerant; well, there's the lactose enzyme pills, I hope.
author: Tho V.

description:
short line when i went, but that's probably because it was 4pm on a sunday and it was raining...moderate prices!

if this is your first time here, here is how it goes...you line up, order from a paper menu, you are then given a number and then you find your own table..if you want water or anything you get it yourself from water fountains found where the napkins are too

cashiers were eh? didn't seem at all enthusiastic about their job...took about a minute to find our tables on our own, we ended up sitting next to the stairs and underneath a bug zapper =\...but besides that...great and delicious desserts for a good price...i didnt know i had to get my own water, but the waiter was nice enough to bring me my own when i asked him so he gets a star!

espresso escape was deliciousness! finished it pretty fast, the bottom was all hard chocolate, so that made it difficult to eat...my gf got a warm brownie sundae, very delicious, the brownie managed to stay warm the whole time =)...i must say the presentation of the food is great, take out your camera to take good pictures!

tourist trap btw
author: Andrew V.

description:
The best tasting chcocolate chip cookie ever....just like cookie dough right out of the oven yet it is fully baked.  Amazingly sinfully good. 

Read here for more in depth description of the cookies plus how to skip the line at the ice cream shop.  Who has time for lines when there is an ooey gooey cookie + hot chocolate waiting...
http://www.crumbycritic.com/2011/04/san-francisco-treat.html
author: Gina C.

description:
Even though I live in SF, I still come to this tourist trap, and LOVE IT!
The ice cream is the best, and I cant get enough of that sweet sweet chocolate love. Best fudge ever! Really!
I hate going to places in SF with so many tourists, those ugly rude Europeans ;-P
But this place makes all the trouble worth it. Its always crowded so be patient and amuse yourself by watching the 100 year old chocolate making machines churning that sweet sweet chocolate river. Oh I wish I was like Augustus and fell in.
They used to be stingy with the ice cream scoop portions, but I went recently and all was good!
author: Jonas S.

description: Best hot chocolate ever! Especially on those chilly San Francisco summer days.
author: Mindy R.

description: Frozen ice crystals were present in one of our sundaes, not cool considering their price. None of these sundaes shone; the disappointing desserts reinforced my tourist trap suspicions.
author: Alan F.

description:
the only reason i agreed to go here was because we got a buy one get one free coupon for sundaes walking around outside. as soon as we walked in the shop we were handed a little chocolate square with peanut butter inside to sample. it was good, not spectacular, and i would never purchase and entire bag of these things.  

ok, let me just say there are way too many workers in here that are taking up precious space in this tiny little shop. and the ones standing around doing nothing happen to be the rudest little shits i encountered the whole trip. one boy was sooo bothered that we didn't know where to order our ice cream, well excuuuuuse me peanut boy [he put peanuts on the ice cream] for not understanding the somewhat chaotic layout of this store at which you are employed and taking time away from your demanding job. sheesh!

the sundaes are somewhat over sized but definitely not worth the nine or so dollars they charge for each one. i got the one with banana and chocolate sauce with vanilla ice cream...simple and tasty. bf got some berry sauce over vanilla and a waffle stick with chocolate. that stick was kinda gross...and stale. 

they offer free water by the tables, don't be a dupe and purchase a bottle for 2.50 like ryan. :D
author: Jeni C.

description:
(From previous afternoon/evening/late night sundae cravings)
--Warm brownie sundae: My favorite one. Warm ghiradelli fudge with brownie bites?! Nothing better

--The original hot fudge sundae: also very good

April 4, 2008

Gold Rush: It's their newest addition to the sundae family. It's vanilla ice cream with layers of hot fudge and peanu butter. This definitely satisfied my peanut butter cravings for the next couple of days. The peanut butter was great! It was so smooth...a little bit too rich for me when about halfway done. Good thing I was sharing, because this was one of the richest sundaes that I've had in a long time.

Goal in life: tackle "the Earthquake" haha
author: Carrie W.

description:
What more can I say other than it's good. Of course the line can get out of hand on top of trying to find a location to sit down. But regardless of that fact, it is an ideal location to take family and friends for the history behind the Ghirardelli Factory. And a great location to take a date, even if its crowded. Not only will your friends and family be amazed with the tremendous factory but the taste of the decadent desserts. I have shared many laughs here, and I will always come back for more. The desserts may be a little on the sweet side for my tastes, but I don't think anyone has complained about it. A matter of fact, nobody has complained but the wait or the trouble of finding a table. Also, there is a little chocolate store connected to the restaurant, which just great for buying little gifts for friends, family and loved ones.

If you have the chance, purchase the Peppermint Bark Squares that they sell during the Winter Holiday season. They are just terrifically delicious. 

Got a date and don't know exactly where to take her for the after dinner treat? Well, there's no point to look any further because this is the spot to go to.
author: Jin B.

description: kill me now. I love this place! It's been one of my favorite travel spots to stop for a chocolate splash, love it!
author: Cassandra Jo M.

description: After waiting in a Long crowded line, we finally got served at the to go place.  The scooper was rude, short with customers and made a sloppy and poor sundae.  I had one with fudge and peanut butter and there was way too much peanut butter and hardly any fudge.  The scoops were also very small.  He would yell at customers.  He seemed over worked and stressed and it took away from what should have been a pleasant experience.  My husband felt the same way, although he was more pleased with his sundae.  We will never go there again, which is a shame because I have fond memories as a child, but it just isn't the same anymore.
author: Jessica S.

description: Really good fudge and shakes.. 7 dollars for a 12 oz shake makes me feel like travolta in pulp fiction but it was good and that's all they do so I guess it is what it is.
author: pete C.

description: It was a warm day, and so busy, but a scoop of chocolate ice cream was pretty good. Better than I had expected. $3.95 for single scoop is not cheap, but reasonable in the city.
author: Foomin U.

description: I wasn't too impressed with the hot fudge sundae.  I was expecting something better for $9. I have tried a couple of GOOD ice cream places here in SF but Ghirardelli is not one of them.  The portion is big but quantity doesn't mean quality.  If you live in SF I would recommend you to go to "Ciao Bella Gelato."  It's located at 1 Ferry Building. They have a lot of flavors, it's not too expensive and it's worth it.
author: Miriam G.

description: OMG-- I am the biggest ice cream lover ever and this was the BEST ice cream ever!!!! I had a huge hit fudge brownie sundae on a freeeeezing day, and I do not regret it at all! It was so ginormous I couldn't even finish it, which is a rarity. DELISH... go here!
author: Lisa S.

description:
I always think back to when I was in 6th grade and visited here for the first time on a class trip to San Francisco. The smell upon first entering is so sweet its almost sickening... in a good way and always reminds me of that kid.

I love sitting out in the square and people watching with some cocoa on a cold day.

There are a lot of tourists but still a fun place. Nothing funnier than seeing kids mash chocolate all over their face and seeing the horror on parents' faces at the thought of carrying around a sticky kid all day.

Great place to be a kid and have a chocolate sundae with someone you love.
author: R P.

description: Their hot chocolate is SO good. My friend and I ran in here while trying to find directions because I was thirsty and craving something hot to drink. They handed us a piece of wrapped peppermint chocolate and took my order -- very kind and cheery group in here. And yes, the drink was amazing, which for some reason I just wasn't expecting. It really is so very worth it.
author: Shauna S.

description: To celebrate the end of a long work week, my fiance and I told some "us" time and drove to Ghirardelli on a cold winter day. We caught up on life over a large salted caramel hot chocolate ($5+), which was a perfect combination of flavors. Back in our high school days, we came here to indulge in their huge ice cream sundaes. That was when we had high metabolisms, which has long gone. Oh, the nostalgia...
author: Tina T.

description: Hooray to yummy ice cream!  We got their chocolate ice cream and it was creamy, thick, and very chocolatey.  It definitely compares with other ultra-premium ice creams out there.  And for $5, you got a pretty healthy (or should I say unhealthy) serving!
author: John K.

description:
strawberry cheesecake was good
ghiradelli chocolate was dark~good
vanilla was OK
author: Diane W.

description: I live very close to this spot and used to shy away from it and other places in fisherman wharf but i gave in and came here when a friend was visiting. YES, tons of tourists were inside buying their square chocolates and hot chocolate drinks.  I decided to get ice cream.  Gotta say i was sort of surprised.  The cone was good!  Coffee ice cream was super tasty.   There is a lot of seating inside to enjoy your desert.  Totally worth a visit to get a scrumptious desert!   Also, note that it's right by the water, so props for a great view!
author: Ka C.

description: Well, what can I say about Ghirdelli Chocolate, except it's the best chocolate ever!  Ghirardelli Chocolate donates mini sundaes to the annual Helpers Holiday Party (this year on Nov. 11) every year.  They continue to support the community; their staff is super; and I LOVE THEIR CHOCOLATE :)  Thanks for being there!
author: Rita H.

description: I love ice cream but have never had a real hot fudge sundae......until I came to Ghirardelli Chocolate. Now, I was a little overwhelmed at the prospect of eating one of these. Lovely, warm, chocolate. Cool smooth vanilla ice cream. That cute little cherry. I did it and am a better person for it. I have never had such an awesome sundae before. It was the perfect size for a late afternoon treat. I did have to walk awhile to work it off but the sundae was worth it. I can't wait to go back!
author: Michelle R.

description:
ok so they have a million reviews but i must add my 2cents

their brownie sundae is to freaking die for. fudge, delish vanilla ice cream, a warm brownie, and whipcream (EW) and nuts! (9$)
