then their store they give u a yummy choocolate square (EW ours was peanutbutter) and i got myself 2 cans of HotChocolate for 6$ each! one White Mocha and one Chocolate Hazelnut (FREAKIN YUm!) 

insanely cold walk from pier 39 but worth the treat plus u need the walk if u wana indulge in one of their treats
author: Carolyn C.

description: This is an absolute must visit when in San Fran. Always busy at night, but well worth the wait. Enjoyed a delicious sundae that just melted in my mouth. Expensive yes, but honestly, I was okay with it!
author: Danielle B.

description: A nice male waiter came to my table while i was eating my icecream and asked if i wanted water. He brought it back and asked where i was from. I said texas and he burst out into song. Deep in the heart of Texas! He them sang " I left my heart in San Francisco to me. He finished smiled at me and gave me a little hug!  Wow thats service. And the icecream was wonderful.
author: Chloe E.

description: I like come here and get ice cream. I love ice cream so. My friend get me big bowl of ice cream. I never see bowl that big. I think bowl call Earth Shake. I eat half. I no can finish. So much ice cream.
author: Elizaveta C.

description: A SF Institution.  Is there better Hot Fudge sauce anywhere?
author: John K.

description: My friend and I split the hot fudge sundae and we fell in love with the fresh fudge and creamy ice cream. I can't wait to try their other sundaes soon. The sundae was smaller than I expected but so rich that it was still filling. The Ghiradelli cafe was a cute place with bright, yet soft, lighting and plenty of tables for patrons. You could also see the chocolate-making process behind the counters, which adds to the authenticity of this place (as opposed to the other Ghiradelli cafes in the area).
author: Jenny K.

description:
wow!  how good is their ice cream?  (rhetorical question, i know)
after ruining our diet plans (again) at fisherman wharf, we just saved space for some ice cream...
it was worth every calorie!
we tried the blueberry cheesecake n kona coffee and they were both so good...so decadent  (blueberry cheesecake was surprisingly yummy)
this pl is a must-try when visitin fisherman's wharf
the negatives are that the scoop is REALLY small; the ice cream was too melted; and u will need alot of H2O afterward.
author: yj k.

description:
We come here with the kids after some excursion or other - we get a half decent latte and they get a mountain of ice-cream sundae.  The choc-brownie one is pretty good.

The quality is fairly good and consistent, but the it's a little pricey - especially when the glasses are so thick you initially think you get more than you actually do.  I suppose it keeps the fat off the kids...

Pros
+ Pretty decent desserts and OK coffee's
+ Consistent quality
+ My kids are quiet for at least 10 minutes!

Cons
- Have to beat a path through the tourists on the weekend
- A little pricey for what you get
- You can get better chocolate elsewhere
author: Paul B.

description: had the famed ice cream sundae. initially, I enjoyed it, but after the 8th spoonful I had enough. wayyy too sweet and overpriced.
author: Michelle C.

description: Anyone who knows me is aware of my chocolate obsession! I visited San Fran a while ago, and the Ghirardelli Square was at the top of my list of places to visit in San Fran. When I stepped foot into the shop, I was dazzled by their enormous chocolate inventory. I immediately grabbed a bag and filled it to the top of my favorites: milk, dark, caramel, hazelnut, raspberry, strawberry, and white. I thought to myself "how could this day get any better?" And it did, when I discovered their cookie-bottom sundae!!! So irresistibly tasty..I wanted to savor every single bite and tried to eat slowly, but my spoon hit glass in what seemed like a matter of seconds. Ugh...I felt so sick after consuming so much chocolate, but it was worth it. After a couple of minutes of recovery, we decided to rent bikes and try to burn off at least a few cals. Oh, how I miss Ghirardelli Square; it's a chocolate-lover's paradise! I hope I visit again in the near future.
author: Angela K.

description: Wow, I really miss coming to this place when I used to live out here!!!The ice cream is to die for and soooo much to share. Sure it was always a little crowded but worth it!!. Miss you
author: Mary B.

description: No where else to go for the perfect hot fudge sundae. I love this place, just wish there was one closer to Laguna Niguel.
author: Kristine C.

description: I am a chocolate lover specially when ice cream is involved man its.like an orgasm in your mouth! I love this place. Good and friendly people! Different selections on ice cream!!
author: Blessed Z.

description: Absolutely the worst service I have ever experienced in SF.  Waited 45 minutes for $30 worth of sundaes.  Chatoic kitchen that lost the order and then gave us attitude too.
author: Menzel W.

description:
this is a must stop for me whenever i find myself in san francisco.

which coincidently, if i were ever to contemplate moving to san francisco, it would be anywhere within a block radius of this place. i can just imagine spending my weekend lazy time here, ordering shakes, and amazing sundaes and on my way out i'd order a bag chock full of dark chocolate.

but just before leaving, i'd watch the chocolate making machines one more time and see all that sweet, tasty, beautiful liquid chocolate go back and forth in the machines.

i love you chocolate and i love ghirardelli.
author: fran d.

description: The chocolate is a given-awesome. We were hoping to see it made and buy fresh... oh well, consolation prize was Ghiradelli Ice Cream
author: Mark W.

description: I debated even writing a review because I didn't buy anything, despite my intentions. There was an insane line everywhere - a line to buy a sundae, a line to get into the store, a line to find seating, a long line at the bathroom...you get my point. It is not worth your time if you're only in SF for a short vacation. It's pandamonium. The store doesn't mark down its ghiradelli at all - in fact we found the same prices for the chocolate at the SF airport. The building is standard, nothing special to look at. So don't bother spending time on this if you have other things you want to see on your visit. You can buy the same souvenir ghiradelli chocolate at Walgreens and save your self the hassle.
author: L. S.

description:
*******************
3/24UPDATE
*****************
WHO DOESN'T HAVE MINT CHIP ICE CREAM???  
WHO????
WHO SKIMPS ON THE WHIP CREAM? 
WHO LETS MY ICE CREAM SIT ON THE COUNTER WHILE I AM SHOUTING "I AM NUMBER 822!" URGGGGH! 
I guess the powers above were trying to let me know not to eat ice cream or worship false idols. I arrived late yesterday(I KNOW, I KNOW, bad omen going on Monday rather than Sunday...but I couldn't leave the family on Easter)and politely asked for a mint chip/chocolate chip hot fudge sundae.  The man behind the counter says...we ran out at about 745PM?  WHAT WHAT WHAT WHAT????  So I ordered chocolate chip and cookies and cream.  It was not what I wanted.  I felt so disappointed...like a woman in the bedroom let down by her favorite lover. To make matters worse, when my sundae finally showed up...it was droopy, and the whip cream was melted.  I wanted to send it back...but It was just a sign.  It was not meant to be.  How SAD!  They must have been busy on a Monday night. I will never come back that late...or a weekday for that matter. How sad. How sad.  I want my favorite back!
----------------------OG-------------------------
4 MORE DAYS...my trainers won't be happy....
but 4 MORE DAYS...till what?

till I give into one of my most decadent joys in life.  
4.3.2.1 BLAST OFF!
Contents of my journey:
Big cold icy mug
Mint Chip Ice Cream-1 scoop
Chocolate Chip Ice Cream-1 scoop
HOT FUDGE, better be on the bottom and on top.
Whip Cream-in a pretty fashion
Hold the cherry
Add the nuts!
Spoon, wait...do I really need it...I might as well just like the mug...I sometimes do.

SUNDAE ON A SUNDAY.  AMAZING GLORY AMEN!
If you notice my "last meal on earth" field, this is exactly what I am talking about!
author: Flor D.

description: Ghirardelli equals chocolate heaven (yes there is such a thing)!  Yea there's a wait but it's worth it.  The whole shopping center is adorable.  If you are in the area you must go there or even if you're not... maybe cute for a first date?
author: Ashley C.

description: Basically, they are riding on their name. We ordered 3 sundaes and a coffee and all three orders were wrong and they asked me if I wanted whip cream on my hot chocolate. Please stop going here so that they will shutdown and stop embarrassing the city of san francisco. The quality of the sundae was marginal making me wish that the Toy Boat people had taken over. Toy Boat on Clement st is staffed by people who take your order and make your sundae right then and there. They always get it right and the ice cream is Double Rainbow which blows the Dreyers that Ghirardelli serves.
author: Jim M.

description: The chocolate chip cookie sundae was nothing to write home about---especially for over 8 dollars!  A good tourist trap, but as a recent transplant, I can't see myself going back again.
author: Sarah M.

description: We ordered 3 ice cream cones.  They correctly filled 1/3 of the order.  We told them the other 2 cones were the wrong style and wrong ice cream.  No big deal... mistakes happen.  However, they were very rude about it.  They changed the cones and tried to give it to us again.  We told them the ice cream was wrong to.  They scooped the ice cream out of the wrong cone and "slammed" it into the right cone.  Chill out, people.
author: Daniel B.

description: I got a scoop of ghirardelli chocolate flavored ice cream.  It was possible the best scoop of ice cream I've ever had.  I also got a free sample chocolate square upon entering and got to see the machines as they make chocolate.  A mouthwatering process to observe.
author: Ben E.

description: The last time I came here was about 6 years ago.  I came with some old school fatties from college.  We ordered the earthquake.  Actually I ordered the earthquake and they watched in disgust as I devoured it.  I believe it was 6 scoops of ice cream with 6 different toppings.   I just remember it was a on a huge ass dish.  Ever since this day I have not set foot in this place.  It probably costs $20 but its worth it if you are a fatty.
author: Fatty A.

description: They may not be the BEST dessert place to you....  But it's the BEST for me.  Dunno why, love to go there on a weekend night and after dinner.  I guess my days of going to pub/clubbing are over.  A must go when you are visiting Fisherman's Wharf or just want to have a great dessert.
author: P. C.

description:
What a miserable experience. First you wait in a line outside. When you get inside you assume you'll be shown to a table, but no such luck. There's a register and someone asking for your order. You look around - menu? Nothing posted on the wall. You ask for one, and they hand it to you and expect you to decide on the spot what you want. Granted the selection is limited, but you're so confused you can't luxuriate in the ice cream possibilities. "Um... hot fudge?" you stammer, not knowing what else to say. You're given a number on a big metal stand. You don't get instructions, just the number and the stand. Now you can wander around and try to find a table. Only there are no tables available, and there are about 25 other people wandering around looking for tables. It's like the mall parking lot at noon on December 24th. Finally you snag a table and put your metal stand in front of you. The waitress brings your sundae. It's good, but melted. She wandered around for a while trying to find you. 
There are so many less stressful ways to get a decent sundae. Skip this place.
author: Lynne D.

description:
The ice cream itself is just ok, nothing spectacular. My sundaes, without fail, always melt before I finish them. But, I give Ghirardelli extra points for their friendly, happy ambiance... and also for staying open late to allow people (like me) to fulfill their 11 PM ice cream cravings. 

I tried the "earthquake sundae" with 4 or 5 other girls one time. It was gone in less than 5 minutes. No kidding.
author: Retired B.

description: As a tourist to SF, I tried Ghiradelli's twice and was definitely impressed with the ice cream sundaes there. The hot fudge brownie sundae is seriously to die for! The place has a small shop to purchase ghirardelli chocolates and gifts (kind of pricey but it's a tourist stop so go figure).
author: Helen H.

description: On a very cold night i ordered a peppermint quake shake and my wife ordered a hot fudge sundae. i finished mine with the quickness, we continued to walk around and we went back and i got a peppermint hot chocolate and it was also great.
author: Mike L.

description:
Ghirardelli Chocolate is the REAL San Francisco treat! We should take pride in our chocolate! The gigantic Ghirardelli sign in bright lights is like our Hollywood sign, calling out to tourists, we welcome you! And to natives, we're always here for you!

Yeah, yeah, it's a big tourist draw, but that shouldn't keep you from indulging in their sweet treats. It's like if you've never walked across the Golden Gate Bridge - you're missing out on one of our city's treasures. 

The first time I took my fiancee to the ice cream shop three years ago on one of our first dates, was his very first time there. When he asked me what Ghirardelli was, I was like, "Are you serious? You've NEVER heard of Ghirardelli and you grew up in the bay area? You're WEIRD!" That of course caused a bit of tension, but a huge brownie sundae made everything better. 

Last night, we decided to head into touristville and had dinner at Fisherman's Wharf and dessert at Ghiradelli. There was a short line out the door, but the wait was not long. When we got up to order, free chocolate squares awaited us. We got one $7 brownie sundae, took our number, and found a table in the corner by the window. The sundae was brought out to us and we dove right in. You really have to hurry and eat because the ice cream has a layer of chocolate fudge in the middle and everything quickly becomes melted and gooey, which is the only problem. It's so good though, and the fudge is surprisingly not as rich as I remembered it to be. The chunck of brownie, which is more like fudge, is also not that rich either - it's actually perfectly sweet and won't make your tooth ache. Be prepared to walk out of there with a bloated tummy though. (Kristina, I know you are laughing in your devilish way right now... muahahahaha EAT MORE GHIRARDELLI SUNDAES!!)

The annual Ghiradelli chocolate festival, usually in September, is a fun event to go to. For a ticket fee, you can sample chocolates and sundaes, and watch chef demos from various restaurants.
author: Connie C.

description:
omg go here if you like hot fresh chocolately chocolate on your sundaes.

mmm and the the peanut butter sauce on the peanut butter and chocolate sundae is warm thick and it even has bits of peanuts in it.  i think it's my favorite peanut butter!

this is the only place i've ever been where i don't mind the tourists.
author: paige m.

description: In love with this place as per my first visit ...definitely will come back again had the waffle chocolate , the mint and delicious wanting for more, also saw how chocolate made thru the machines
author: Reena A.

description: I walked across town just for a hot chocolate with sea salt and caramel. That is how delicious ghirardelli's hot chocolate is. Absolutely decadent, topped with whipped cream, doused in caramel sauce and sea salt, and finished with a chocolate square filled with caramel.  The cafe also offers squares of brownies, hot fudge sundaes, and chocolate galore.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: This place ain't no Serendipity, but the creations are perfect for my west coast cravings. I actually came after eating Kara's Cupcakes and lunch in Japantown (during which I also ate green tea ice cream) and needless to say, I left Ghirardelli sqaure with enough dairy to last me the rest of the week: but: it was good - we ordered a mint chocolate chip sundae and a good ol' fashioned vanilla and chocolate fudge, both of which we polished off to the point of becoming dishwashers. Great place for families and birthday parties and girls who are constantly dieting but really, don't give a crap.
author: Betty H.

description: I saw here almost everybody gave a 4-star rating to this ice cream store. I went there and it was a very long line to order the ice cream and after you order and pay for it you have to walk through the jammed store, go around the tables about 30-40 minutes to find a free place to sit. I told myself, it is OK, at least I will get a 4-star ice cream which is very rare in Bay Area. I ordered a "Very Berry Sundae" ($ 8.99). For my Surprise there were no berry at all in this sundae. It was a scoop vanilla ice cream, a small piece cheese cake, some blue berry shaped candy, some mixed berry jam and lots of whip cream. I could taste just sugar and heavy cream. It was a real disappointment. Hey Ghiradelli management, an almost $10 ice cream should have some quality. This was my first and last visit to this place. I can not recommend this place to anybody who loves qualitative ice cream. The only positive point: the service is fast after you find a sit.
author: Rokgoo R.

description: No, it's not very original, and yes, there are a ton of tourists down here guarenteed to irritate you... But, oh man, this is the only place worth putting on your Panama Jack t-shirt and hiking your shorts up to your armpits and try and blend in. This is because the ice cream is so good with a fantastic thick waffle cone that holds up until the very end.
author: Michael E.

description:
The Ghiradelli Ice Cream store has always been a favorite place for myself and my family to visit whenever we felt like having delicious sundaes- growing up, I remember getting the 'Cable Car' sundae on numerous occasions after going through the store so I could get my free sample of chocolate.  So, when a good friend came to visit and expressed interest in visiting this location, I was raring to go and have some ice cream and hot fudge as well.

Luckily, we went on a weekday afternoon and the place was relatively free of the hordes that I usually see when I visit at night.  We decided on splitting the hot fudge banana sundae- a classic that should have sated both the ice cream and chocolate cravings.  Unfortunately, I experienced BIG disappointment when it came to the vanilla ice cream, because it was full of ice crystals.  Not that it prevented me from eating the sundae, but it deflated my enthusiasm for it and made me kinda embarrassed that my friend was eating icy ice cream in this famous SF place.  I would have thought that with as much business as they do here that vanilla ice cream (the basis for the vast majority of their sundaes) would never sit around long enough to have accumulated ice crystals.  The hot fudge was still as good as ever, but I think they have reduced how much they put on the sundae.  I remember it dripping all over the place but now it stays very neatly contained inside the glass.  

In any case, 5 stars for the memories of previous visits and 2 stars for this last visit- $8+ for this sundae was an atrocity when I could have gone over to Ben and Jerry's for a sundae with better ice cream.  I'm sure that I'd still be back though, just because I do have fond memories of the place, so hopefully, my next sundae here will restore my faith in Ghiradelli.
author: Angela H.

description: It's smack in the middle of one of the biggest tourist attractions in town, so of course it's 'touristy' - so is the Statue of Liberty, but does that make it any less fabulous? I was introduced to two San Francisco traditions my first visit here a lifetime and a half ago - sourdough bread and the Ghirardelli Soda Fountain, and I still find both irresistible. I've never wandered in here without guests from out-of-town in tow, probably because this is an area of town I generally avoid unless, of course, I have out-of-town guests in tow. No matter who's manufacturing it these days, the ice cream is still a terrific base for hot fudge, whipped cream, and a sprinkling of nuts, or all by itself in a sturdy waffle cone. The lines look long but move quickly. If you need to entertain those out-of-town guests, then this should be your reward.
author: Gourmet G.

description: The place for tourists... like everything in Fisherman's Wharf, you go there once when you move here and you only go back when you have people out of town and you've exhausted other options. The chocolate is inferior to other San Francisco options.
author: Jeffrey A.

description: Okay, I'm not happy with Ghirardelli at all these days.  I went yesterday, wanting to order a Domingo Sundae without the nuts.  The cashier asked if I was allergic or if I just didn't like nuts.  I told her allergic.  She refused to sell me ANYTHING!  She said that because their kitchen has nuts, they don't feel safe selling to people with nut allergies.  Although I appreciate that they recognize the safety issues concerning nut allergies, I was incredibly offended about the fact that their solution to the problem was to discriminate against people with nut allergies.  THAT'S NO SOLUTION!  That's just plain ole lazy and intolerable.  I'm going to be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau, but before I do I wanted to let everybody else out there who can't eat nuts that you shouldn't even bother visiting his place.
author: Babette C.

description: Yum!!!! Amazing ice cream and sundaes. So worth the slightly high prices. I would recommend sharing with someone because their scoops are like none I have ever seen. We visited this location 2 nights in a row for ice cream. It is a MUST in San Francisco!!
author: Ashley S.

description: My first time to have ghirardelli ice cream was last night.  I AM the biggest ice cream lover in the world so entering this place was litterally a high for me!  But unfourtunatley theres a down side.  We ordered and waited.  We waited some more... I saw all the huge sundaes being delivered else where, looked good but we still waited....waited.....I cant believe that I was being patient for my ice cream (that never happens) So a total of 36 minutes.  And what do they do? "oh we'll make it right now"  NONE of the workers realized that we were just sitting there as the store emptied up.  Workers were just talking and standing around, some even looked too young to be working. SERIOUSLY! The ice cream sucked!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Why in the hell would you serve it in a HOT GLASS?!?!  I don't think they know that ice cream melts
author: Kool G.

description: Another place in SF, that you have to go at least once. Yes it is full of tourist and it is a bit expensive, but it is a good time. We sat with our friends from out of town and laughed as we attempted to polish off our huge sundaes. What a great way to spend a lazy afternoon.
author: Lisa A.

description: Amazing sundaes. The chocolate is so creamy and thick and I just love it! I love the feeling of the place. Reminds me of the holidays.
author: Jenny T.

description: The best thing about this place is that you always get a free dark chocolate caramel candy sample, just for walking in! There are two stores, right across from each other, so you can go to both and get two samples!  Their chocolate is yummy and so is the hot cocoa and ice cream sundaes. Yum!
author: Merredith L.

description: It's a SF tourist destination. Lines are long, servings are generous and 2 sundaes and 2 coffees is over $25. We came here as kids and now the next generation is getting hooked on ghirardelli chocolate :-)
author: Rebekah O.

description: I love it here! Maybe it's the smell of chocolate and little treats, or maybe it's the tourists that really don't bother me, but I just love Ghiradelli. I came to the Chocolate Festival filled with yummy samplings, fun giveaways and happy people on a sunny day in SF. Still haven't had a Ghiradelli chocolate sundae but I'm not leaving until I get one! I suggest stopping by Cellar 360 for some wine tasting if you have time too.
author: Kristin M.

description: The candy and ice cream are delicious. The place is known internationally, and this is where Ghirardelli chocolate began. The lines can be long, but the wait is worth it. The place is one of many great attractions in the Pier 39 area. There are many tables to eat at, but if the place is full, you can always hang out and eat outside.
author: DJ Guan Yu M.

description: I am a big fan and completely unafraid to admit it.  I'm not a tourist, but you can trap me.  Trap me in your loving, chocolatey arms of goodness.
author: Dave M.

description:
did the tourist thing today. so, after walking from chinatown to union square, then back to chinatown...the families were ready for dessert. didn't wanna roll the dice with street parking so we headed for the parking garage in the ghirardelli building.

the ice cream? it was aight...haha, it's actually dreyers, but the fudge is what makes the sundaes. holy shnizzle...i don't think i've ever seen the kids inhale ice cream sundaes that fast. if you're a local, don't mess around with the tourist stuff, get in, get a sundae, and gtfo dodge!
author: will b.

description: Every San Franciscan should go here at least once ...or maybe twice if your parents are in town. Ghirardelli chocolate is no longer manufactured at this location and is even now owned by European powerhouse Lindt & Sprungli. Leave the tourists alone and head down to Mitchell's on San Jose Ave.
author: Philip M.

description: I have been coming here since I was a kid, and I love it more everytime.  The wait is sometimes long, but I love their hot fudge sundae.  I also had this one sundae that they dont' have anymore called alcatraz, it was ice cream covered by a chocolate shell and it was crazy, the chocolate was hard as rock.  Anyway, always a good place for a fun treat:)
author: Sloane R.

description: They were soooo rude here and I couldn't complain to anyone because no one spoke English!
author: Charm N.

description: This place is beautiful... I walked all the way down the wharf from Hooters and through the park... up the stairs... but it was great sightseeing!  Ghirardelli was soooo busy though... we walked through the store section where they give you a complimentary square of chocolate... I really wanted to try a hot chocolate there but they were so busy there was no way I was going to wait through everyone else... so instead I went through to the area that they serve up all the goodness... the ice cream and drinks and what not... and took a look at the machinery and read the little museum like placards... it was fun but too busy, I want to go back and get some of the chocolatey goodness!
author: Krissy S.

description: Can't beat the hot fudge sundae's here.  The ice cream is great, but the chocolate is so rich (duh!).  If you plan on gaining a few pounds, go here. Remember : there's nothing wrong in being a bit overweight.  At least we know that you enjoy the food delicacy's in life like Ghirardelli.
author: Neil K.

description: Long line for seats so we got to go and ate outside.  Chocolate malt was sooo goood!! mMmmm
author: Eegnam A.

description: This place is for the tourists! But when the mint chocolate chip ice cream is so good, who cares? Try the ice cream--- oh and the holiday candy is one sale after the holidays.
author: Briana J.

description: I have probably had Ghirardelli ice cream and chocolates about a zillion times.  And every time I have them, it is like I am eating them for the first time.  The rich chocolate, the creamy ice cream, the fudgy sauce, oh my!!!  You cannot go wrong with any of their choices (exept, one time, I saw a girl eat an Earthquake by herself on a dare- SO not making that mistake!- you need at least 3 others to down that big boy)  I also love it when Ghirardelli is decorated for Chirstmas, and I especially love the peppermint bark that they sell around the holidays!  I also bring my out of town friends/family members to Ghirardelli 'casue you can't find this ice cream anywhere else in the world (SF pride!)  Anyway, Ghirardelli is a classical San Francisco landmark and is the best you will EVER TASTE!!!!
author: Shannon W.

description: i love their ice cream sundaes! i came back here about twice and they were always good! i tasted the brownie and one of their famous sundaes. my god were they good! i especially love the warm and chewy fudge they drizzle on! thats like the best part! the price was decent for their yummy sundaes! theres always seatings when I go, but crowded. the lines are pretty long too! as you can see their sundaes are that good. you get in line to order first and then find a seat yourself while you wait for the waiters to find your order number, which they give you to put on your table. oh yeah and theres also a to-go line for sundaes, which are much faster!
author: Crystal H.

description: I called Hiep and we agreed to meet in Ghiradelli Square, which is about seven blocks west of the Embarcadero along Bay St. It took a lot of walking for me to get there. Once I got there, I had decided to get something hot (like hot chocolate or cocoa) because it was absolutely freezing. Hiep went into the ice cream shop and I decided to get a banana chocolate sundae along with a small hot cocoa. It was expensive, but worth it, I think. Ghiradelli is always rather reliable with great chocolate. The sundae glasses looked intimidating, but it really isn't much in terms of ice cream and other dessert. The main problem was overflow, which meant that whenever I pushed down on the ice cream, the cream at the bottom would rise up and overflow out of the glass. Hiep had the brilliant idea to eat from the bottom up, which would then reduce the overflow. Great stuff. A little bit of an unconventional dinner, but I'll take what I can get.
author: Henry T.

description: I've lived in the Bay Area for 11 years now, and I love Ghiradelli's hot fudge sundae today just as much as I loved it when I first had it 11 years ago.  Every time I walk into the shop, great memories of great times flood into my mind.  Seriously, the hot fudge here is absolutely THE BEST hot fudge I've ever tasted.  (And I'm not even a big fan of chocolate.)  You now have the option of "dark chocolate" hot fudge or "milk chocolate" hot fudge.  Personally, I like the "milk chocolate" hot fudge (which used to be the only hot fudge option).  It's warm, sweet (but not too sweet), and creamy.  Pour that hot fudge on top of a few simple scoops of vanilla ice cream, top it all off with whipped cream, nuts, and a cherry, and you're in dessert heaven!  Sure, tourists flock here; but even if you're a local, I recommend satisfying your ice cream fix here every now and then.  (I do.)
author: Sophrosyne Y.

description: It's been awhile since I've been there...but the Domingo is my favorite (vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, bananas, whipped cream)--it's never too cold for ice cream!  Also, don't be intimidated by the potentially long line outside--it always moves very quickly, and you always manage to find a seat.
author: Joyce L.

description: The hot fudge sundaes rank up there.....delicious.  You order at the counter and have to find a seat....just like a fast food restaurant.  Which means, it's normally busy and you won't be able to find a seat right away.
author: Armen B.

description:
A tourist attraction worth repetitive visits as a local.  
They have hot fudge sundaes and are open till 11 PM/ Midnight. Winner.

My strongest memories are as follows
1. Visiting from out of town when I was about 8 and egging our driver to drive fast over the hills to get to my awaiting sundae terrifying the adults of our over packed car.  MAKE IT FLY!

2. Many a visit at night perched on some overlooking, probably not legal or safe to be around area of the square enjoying my sundae, listing to my ipod and checking out the view.

Because walking from Union Street to Ghirardelli Square justifies having one of the spectacular, never skimping on the hot fudge sundaes, as dinner, at 10pm.  I'm sure it becomes crazy 'amusement park long lines' tourist central during daylight hours, but I usually stick to later hours

There was a time I could eat whole pizzas in one sitting but alas I have satiety now.  I always get my sundae to go, eat half in the outdoor square area and half at 3am.

Fun for all ages!
author: Lisa E.

description:
The ice cream at this place is so- so.  I prefer Coldstone.  If you go next door, there's a candy shop.  9/10 times, i'll get a free treat.  Problem is... they cut open the wrapper for you prior- so caution if you don't feel like indulging at the moment and stick it in your pocket.  You'll be a "hot mess."  

Service at the ice cream shop on the other hand SUCKS!  My friends and I went the other night.  The server was straight up rude.  My friend kindly asked her for a straw.  She pointed over to the counter and said, "I am busy- you go get it yourself."  I know that English wasn't her first language- but don't you think that was harsh?  Needless to say, we didn't leave a tip.
author: Kat N.

description: Amazing.  But, if you're a true chocolate addict, you will order the brownie sunday, and ask for chocolate ice cream instead of vanilla.  to summarize, this decadent dessert begins with a warm fresh fudge brownie, topped with a dark chocolate ice cream, whip cream, fresh fudge sauce, and a cherry.  (i ask for no nuts.  trying to stay healthy.  just kidding- i just don't like nuts with chocolate).
author: Rohit G.

description: The best hot fudge sundae ever!  Any time I'm feeling down and need a pick me up, I'll go out to Ghiradelli for the infamous hot fudge sundae.  It has never failed!  I've tried Ghiradelli hot fudge sundaes at other locations, but nothing beats sitting down in the parlor at San Francisco and smelling the fudge being made while eating it.
author: Aura J.

description: How anyone can rate this place (or the company/products) average or below is beyond me. This place is somewhat a landmark. The chocolate is one of the best around, the factory location is filled with things to check out and yes there's always a line but get used to it .... it's the place to go. I'm having an itch to go back. It's been awhile and I miss the LA stores they had, emphasis on had ..although they didn't compare to the original SF spot. It's worth a trip!
author: LAURA E.

description: The chocolate syrup is sooooooo good.  I love the smores sundae a lot too.  The only problem is the ice cream melts quick b/c the syrup is so warm....but  i'm willing to accept their methods.  haha....   Eat in, it is so much more enjoyable!
author: sharon m.

description: I had a root beer float because I had just eaten a cupcake from Kara's and I didn't want to go on a sugar binge (but I ended up doing so anyway).  It was a good float: nice and smooth, and the ice cream was really creamy.
author: Geoff Y.

description: I've been here since I was little kid. I remember seeing the "big earthquake" on the menu where you a big mound of ice cream and then a bunch a toppings, it looked huge but I never have that many people to share it with me. I always end up getting the banana split. This place is great for taking a date, it's so eclectic and you see the chocolate or fudge machine working. I love this place. Still one of my favorite places.
author: Tossama C.

description: We go here every year right before Christmas, it's a family tradition.  Today we were very disappointed with the amount of ice cream in our sundae.  Two small scoops for $9.00!   a rip off!!!
author: Katharine b.

description: Never really had a problem with seating.  The place isn't spectacular but its definitely a stop if you're in the area and you feel like icecream and chocolate.  They have a chocolate making display so you can have a mini tour of the chocolate process from beans to bar [nowhere as great as scharffenberger's used to be].  The annual chocolate festival was good
author: Ryan Y.

description: Toursty doesn't come close to describing this place. But. *BUT*. The ice cream sundaes are damn good. I mean, *damn* good. Oh the chocolate shakes and ooooh (that's me with a shiver running up my spine they are so good)... pretty much anything with chocolate is good there. Heck, it is all good. If you're going to go there, be sure to order something truly fattening because if you're going to brave the wave of tourists, you might as well go all out. Geez. Now I want a sundae. Darn it. :)
author: Jordan M.

description: Yay! I'm a fan. My favorite chocolate even if its not the best. Great location, free samples, carmel milk chocolate, extremely rich hot fudge sundae is a bit too much for me to handle.
author: Jody S.

description: Okay, so I know it is sooo uncool to like this place...but guess what, I do.  I am speaking of the square only.  I've been coming here since birth and this place is super nostalgic for me.  I have so many memories here that are so awesome, I can't help but love it.   It's the best to come here after about 10 pm when everyone is gone...all that is left is the incredible crisp San Francisco air and all the lights...it's kind of romantic.  I love to take walks here, and do so about 3 times a week.  Next time you feel like a late night stroll, take your sweety here and smooch at one of the most iconic places in San Francisco.
author: Jess S.

description: I don't know why it took me so long to come get my monthly chocolate fix, but the sundae I had was sooo good. My mouth is watering as I type. I guess I know where I am going this weekend.
author: Christina B.

description: A place where the chocolate flows like wine. Where tourists instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano.
author: lindsay w.

description: My first 5 star rating on yelp! I lovelovelove you ghirardelli! What more can I say!
author: J A M.

description: come if not for the love of chocolate but for the free samples.  also being in san fran, one realizes where there are and are not bathrooms.  this place in their courtyard area
author: Nick S.

description: What a disappointment.  I brought an out of towner here and we both had sundaes.  Although the ice cream and the toppings were great, man, they've got these deceptively shallow glasses that cut the volume of sundae intake in half.  What's up with that?  If there's anything I hate the most about goods in thick glasses, it's beer, and ice cream.  Chicks in thick glasses are alright tho.  Extra points for kinky.
author: Tony L.

description: You know there's nothing that quite compares to a classic hot fudge sundae with vanilla ice cream on a warm spring day. Makes you really appreciate what life is all about. I come here once a year to get the sundae and reminisce about all those childhood summer days chasing the ice cream truck.
author: Cathy T.

description: I'm sure you all very well know that a trip to San Francisco is not complete without a trip to the Ghirardelli Chocolatier.  Don't be fooled; the selection is not just limited to chocolate--their sundaes are to die for and each come with a square of their famous chocolate.  Be forewarned--it can get crowded!
author: Dana B.

description: So my Mommie decides she wants ice cream so her boyfriend and her walk to Ghrardelli Chocolate - she didn't ask us if we wanted any but I assumed she wouldn't since we were drinking frappacinos.  The problem occurred when she came back with a huge waffle cone filled with chocolate ice cream and hot fudge and dripping - I started screaming because she got ice cream all over my coach bag - i couldn't even give the ice cream away because Mommie decided to buy one for everyone so no one had a free hand.  Of course I gave my Mommie a panic attack so she grabbed my bag and started cleaning it..  While my bag was getting cleaned I was able to enjoy all my ice cream and more!!!  Its yummy here!!
author: May A.

description: Of course this is a tourist destination, but since it's fabulous I'm happy to visit every time there's a reason for me to be in the Fisherman's Wharf area.  The sundaes are delicious, more than enough to split if you can agree on which delicious option to try.   If you do have tourists in tow, the old-time chocolate making equipment on display can be a good distraction for the kiddies during the wait for ice cream, and for the adults there's the chocolate shop next door so they can stock up on chocolate gifts after indulging in ice cream goodness.
author: Stacy L.

description: Okay having missed out on the restaurant piece of this the last two times in SF-made it there this time. First off, they have the machinery actually making the chocolate on premises so the whole place smells delicious and you get to watch everything work. Had the pumpkin caramel hot chocolate and it was, in one word, perfection.  One of the best hot chocolates you could ever hope to have-so go and get one!  If that's not your thing they have ice cream, cookies, brownies and coffee all with that yummy chocolate. I like the vibe here a bit better than the one in San Diego.
author: Rachel T.

description: I visited the square as a child and had the most wonderful ice cream experience. So, as an adult, when the opportunity presented itself, of course I had to have that ice cream again and play tourist. It was just how I remembered (I got the chocolate ice cream). My boyfriend and I were celebrating a belated Valentine's day, and this was the end to our night. Of course we did the cliched romantic posing in front of the fountain. It was a lot of fun and I'm looking forward to that ice cream next time I go back :)  And if you're someone interested in chocolate making, they still have their "old fashioned" (as they call them) machinery going for you to watch as they process everything inside the main store.
author: C M.

description: mmmm. sooo yummy. The line is LONG, full of tourists. However, it moves pretty fast. Sucks if your waiter with your sundaes doesn't see your number ;D
author: Katherine C.

description: Bought mugs with chocolates.  When we removed the price tag, we read that the mugs were neither microwaveable nor dishwasher friendly.  The price tag was put what it looks like purposefully over these instructions.  When I went to return the mugs, Ghirardelli would not take it back.  Instead for $32 for two mugs+tags, the manager offered 3 free sundae coupons worth only $27.  Do the math.  highly disappointed with the looting.  would have given zero if available.
author: D U.

description: This place is a MUST after a dinner at McKormick and Kuleto's. Cute place. I've never been here when it's at its prime hours so I have no complaint towards lack of seating, etc. LOVE the hot cocoa. and the brownie sundae.
author: Meryl Q.

description: Everything here is so good. I always get the warm brownie sundae. It is so good, the brownie is warm and moist and delicious. It is kind of expensive, but it is worth it since you do not get to eat it that often, especially if you do not live in SF. I do not go there often, but when I do this is a special treat for me. The ice cream shop is connected to the Ghirardelli candy store, so you can get on a sugar high.
author: Veronika P.

description: The coffee ice cream sundae is delicious!!! It's a huge portion and thousands of calories so definitely share it. It's delicious and will go back soon!
author: R And J.

description: Truthfully, this is such a tourist trap.  You can buy ghirardelli chocolates anywhere, even at your local pharmacy.  Basically you go and it's just a store where you can buy chocolates and then there is a chocolate restuarant where you can buy ice cream and other food items.  It isn't anything special and I would not go out of my way to come here.  The only way I would ever go back is if someone I was with wanted to go.
author: Jo W.

description: This place is an absolute must to take anyone visiting you from out of town. A hot fudge sundae here is the best in the world, and the chocolate shop next door has free samples.
author: Stacy H.

description: I'm not that much of a fan.  They give samples in the store, but those have never really tasted that great to me.  If you order the earthquake (huge sundae for 4 or more), don't let them choose the flavors for you, because I think they end up giving you the leftover ones no one wants.
author: Liz L.

description: This place is always packed. Filled with locals and tourist. The ice cream and desserts are too expensive. Starts at about $5 to whatever the Earthquake is at. It seems like everyone that works there is from Europe or something. Anyways it's a nice place to hangout and and eat ice cream. Really good ice cream.
author: alfred k.

description: I'm actually not the biggest fan of Ghirardelli chocolate, but the ice cream sundaes are truly enormous, and very tasty. I recommend splitting one.
author: Don H.

description: The smell alone makes it worthwhile to at least walk into this place.  One of the first times i ordered a 'sundae' styled icecream in a longggg time.  Other then the fact that they took down the wrong order (i ordered a 'cable car' and got a 'caramel sunday') it was pretty damn good - Hell, I enjoyed eating something I didn't even order!
author: Vinnie L.

description: For what it is, it is perfect: great sundaes, right along the water.  Who cares if the price of you sundae could pay for a good dinner.  Previous to last night, I think the last time I was here was for my 7th grade friends rollerskating party in sf.  Last night at 11:30 it was just as good.
author: Lauren S.

description:
If you like Ice Cream - Go to Bi Rite .. theirs is much much better.

I thought the quality was low and the place is over priced.  Plus - there were flies  -- flies gross flies -- in the restaurant.  YUCK!

I really wish this place were better.  

xx69xx00,

-j-
author: jenny w.

description: Everything is wonderful here except the hot chocolate.  Its more like tepid chocolate.  And I've given it 3 chances cause I really thought maybe the first 2 times were just a fluke, but no.  Its always room temperature.  Which is a no-no in freezing SF.  A MUST for tourists.
author: Cathleya G.

description: Most likely this was a psychological thing (ya know, the whole ghiradelli square vibe) but they served up a DAMN good sundae! If you have visitors coming, I definitely recommend this as a must-stop snack-break while they are strolling through the Embarcadero and Wharf. Plus the square is just plain cute and fun to run around in! :)
author: Susan L.

description: I used to hit up this place all the time during my Bay days. Yes its overpriced and the ice cream isn't the greatest (c'mon its a tourist trap)...However sometimes it just hits that spot one during the Ghiradelli craves moment after walking around! Sometimes its crazy busy but when I went everyone spoke English fine.....
author: Jonathan Y.

description: Yes, it is touristy and not particularly well organized, but it is a chocolate haven!  Unlike many visitors, I avoided the ice cream (what does ice cream have to do with chocolate anyway???) and went straight for the Drinking Chocolate.  It tasted like melted dark chocolate - rich, thick chocolate goodness!  Thank goodness for cacao!
author: Matt P.

description: It may be expensive for an ice cream sundae, but sometimes, you gotta have it. Try the Fog Horn with mint chip instead of chocolate ice cream. Man, I want one right now!
author: Mike I.

description: It was my first time here, I got dark chocolate expresso ice cream...   It was overpriced and mostly typical ice cream sundae stuff but the chocolate... you can't beat dark chocolate here!
author: Seung O.

description: My favorite place for ice cream at the pier. Portions are big enough to share between 2 - 3 people.
author: Jen P.

description: I love coming here late late at night for a sundae.  they are open till midnight. the sundaes are huuugeeee.  I can never finish on my own.  so much hot fudgeeee...  the only thing is that its pretty much always packed.  Also they dont really have that many choices for ice cream, when my friend was trying to get a rootbeer float he had a hard time trying to pair the rootbeer with the ice cream choices they have.
author: Janet S.

description: Five stars for the ice cream and chocolate but 2 stars for the fact that there is no sort of crowd control and lines just form randomly, with people barging their way to the front or coming from the side. Very nice servers who keep the place clean and of course outstanding location.
author: Joe S.

description: This is one of my favorite Saturday afternoon spots.  Walk through the store (get a free caramel chocolate square) and order up a bowl of pleasure.  These ice cream Sundaes are absolutely wonderful!  It's a bit touristy, which can actually be quite entertaining at times.  Great place to take visitors!
author: Sarah D.

description:
i really cant stand ghiradelli only because its hard for me to eat the milk chocolate...chocolate is like coffee in some ways...
ghiradelli tastes really acidic and robust...its almost like drinking coffee without the cream...See's Candies on the other hand is like the full package...it has the perfect blend of creaminess in the chocolate and sweetness as well.
author: Anthro Food E.

description: The hordes of tourists waiting in line and sitting in the cafe are enough to keep any sane person away. Of course, I still braved the swarms of people to try one of the sundaes and i was unimpressed. Yes, the chocolate is good, but I'd take a gelato any day over the ice cream served here...
author: Nicolas H.

description: My friend, a local, loves standing in line and shouting very touristy things ("I loooove California, let's have some fresh fruit!") when he goes here, which is very rarely. It's probably not worth the trouble or the wait but it must be experienced once. And so, while you're experiencing it, take a couple friends and order the biggest sundae they have, I think it's about $20 and called the Earthquake. It's hilariously huge! We laughed the entire time we ate it.
author: Melissa W.

description: Do you know how fat I get just thinking about this place? I love this place and I know the lines are long but it's well worth the wait  when you get your chocolate sundae delivered to your table. And as you think, "Should I share with my friends?" comes to mind, you realize that they are probably thinking the same thing and come to the conclusion of  "Hell, f*cking no!" This is my ice cream. I deserve it. I had a long day! It's too good to be true. Yum. More. Now. Eat. Score. Feel good. Till next time!
author: Mel P.

description: This is the best hot chocolate I have ever had in my life. Starbucks hot chocolate is really lame in comparison.
author: Linda S.

description: I'm not crazy about the ice cream. It's milky, not creamy and I prefer my chocolate sauce fudgy.
author: Rachel B.

description: ok, yes - it is a touristy type of place. They also have one of the best hot fudge sundaes around. The ice cream itself is only average, but the hot fudge more than makes up for it. Go early or late to avoid the tourist lines.
author: Russ C.

description: I've enjoyed this place a few times and always enjoyed taking the sample chocolate taking a loop around the store and snagging more chocolates. But the ice cream sundaes are super good...too much for one person, but a fun splurge.
author: Anita C.

description: Got the earthquake with a bunch of people ... OMG... ice cream overload, but it's fun to eat. You gotta be comfortable with swapping germs with people though, because it's definitely must be shared.
author: Joy C.

description: Good stuff is all I can about this place.  At night it gets packed like no tomorrow.
author: Christopher L.

description: This place brings back memories of my high school and college days. My friends and I would come here to celebrate anything.  In my college years, it was the place that my sorority held ice cream socials for potential members. I was always fond of the ice cream sundae with all the whip cream, chocolate sauce, nuts and vanilla ice cream i want... Or if i was feeling extra greedy, I would share the cable car sundae with my friends. It's sad that these days the closets I get to Ghirardelli is when I go for a run and pass by the big sign.  This place will always have a place in my heart.
author: Trish P.

description: AHH!!!! best sundaes EVER!! i bit into this thing that looked like a blueberry but it was a blueberry chocolate!!  Came her 4th of July one year to watch the fireworks (amazing by the way) and we waited nearly an hour for some ice cream...i got a little impatient because i wanted to see the fireworks, but not a problem - we got our ice cream in plenty of time and it was well worth the wait...
author: Jen N.

description: Their sundaes are a party in your mouth. The ice cream just harmonizes so well with hot fudge topping and almonds. I love their normal sundaes and the one with the brownie in it. Great place for dessert. I believe they use Mitchell's ice cream which is quite extraordinary itself. The line that comes trailing out the store may seem intimidating at first, but it goes by very quickly. Seating can be hard to find sometimes, but most parties just eat and go (the ice cream comes out extreme quick). My only complaint is the price, but what can you expect, it's Ghirardelli -_-. But despite being a tad bit overpriced, it's totally worth it.
author: Julie L.

description: A nice and cute spot. It has chocolates, ice cream, candies, and all of above for a decadent. The chocolate and ice cream are real heaven. Most of all, I love the place for the view and the romantic feel that the chocolate adds to just being there. It's located next to the Fisherman Wharf, in an old warehouse look kind of building which used to be the chocolate factory back in the days. Very nice outdoor view. It's a little touristy.. but, I still love the place for what it is.
author: Daisy S.

description: Their hot fudge tastes off. My ice cream had ice frozen in it- not the creamy delicious thing you'd expect from this overpriced place. If you want water you get to drink it from little paper cups. It was crowded and overpriced... I prefer rite aid ice cream any day.
author: Sarita M.

description: cool place always crowed , but that is a sign that people love it here I had the  banana hot fudge sundae. I will admit it was melting when it got to me but ho cares!!!!! it was good. we will be heading back soon
author: Martin G.

description: If you're going to come to San Francisco; you must visit one of the Ghirardelli shops on this hill point, sit down and order a sundae. It'll be the best of your life. I remember I shared a berry one, forgot what it was called, with a friend and it was DELISH!!! Save room in your suitcase and buy Ghirardelli chocolates at your local supermarket, if you want. It's about the same price. And it won't get damaged in transit. It's really pretty to walk around this area, too.
author: Joann P.

description: Huge selection of ice cream and all sorts of shakes and sundaes.  Pretty touristy though, and there is always a huge line too.
author: Nellie L.

description: A soon as I walk in the smell of this place is overwhelming, Every time I do come here I order the Banana Spit so I can have all the flavors in one...Fresh Bananas, pineapple, and all the ice cream is  yummy...I love seeing the waterfalls of chocolate too...even when I am super stuffed I still make room for the place.
author: Dee D.

description: Despite the long lines at this tourist attraction, the unique charm of this chocolate shop is timeless. I've only had the classic hot fudge sundae, but I must admit it was the most delicious and satisfying hot fudge sundae I have ever had.
author: Melanie K.

description: We had their famous hot fudge sundae and, frankly, I don't really know why it is so famous.  For about $7.50 (after tax) I expected a lot more.  Two scoops of vanilla ice cream, hot fudge and whipped cream and nuts on top.  Sounds like a lovely treat if it were to cost about $3.95 -- yeah, I know, it's expensive to run a business in San Francisco and since this is a touristy spot, they've gotta take the tourists' money...
author: Spicy T.

description: We were here on a gloomy Sunday and were lucky that there was no line.  We ordered some Hot Chocolates to go and they were great.  The chocolate is really rich and creamy, so a small would suffice for most people.  It totally hit to spot for a mid-afternoon snack/dessert drink.
author: Jaclyn S.

description: Forgot to review this--we were there last week on our trip to SF, and loving chocolate as I do, this was a must-stop.  Went with hubby, and bought some chocolates, as well as a brownie sundae with the milk choc hot fudge.  Yes, it's pricey, but the thing is HUGE!  We split it and could barely finish--I was glad we did not order individually.  And it was worth a splurge, so very delicious, mmmm!  Will go back next time in SF :)
author: Michelle H.

description: I truly love this place! I was surprised to find out that they use Dreyers Ice Cream...nonetheless their ice cream treats are excellent. Wish I could go there everyday...
author: Jaki B.

description: This the best place for a SUNDAE! They are so huge, so delicious, so sweet and so caloric! Great chocolate ice cream and hot chocolate syrup and real strawberry sauce. Banana splits are what I order and share it with my friend. We love looking at the old machinery that grinds the chocolate nibs. Yummy.
author: miriam b.

description: Hot fudge sundae @ 11pm on weekends!! Yeah baby! Parking's a breeze and there's no lines.
author: viv k.

description: The chocolate sold there is way more expensive than they sold outside.  But it is a tourist trap, so i cannot complaint too much about it.
author: Ame k.

description: A lot of my friends work here . The hot cocoa is pretty good . The world famous sundae is alright . Hot fudge .. mmmm . The strawberry milkshake is alright as well . Sorry but I don't think this is really my kind of place because everything is so sweet and fattening !! The chocolates are really good though .. esp. the vanilla dream . Can't get enough of it hehe . But their chocolate is kind of overpriced .. probably because of the tourists .
author: Eileen L.

description: This place is my HAVEN! I LOVE their sundae, hence the fudge syrup. The consistency is perfect and it tastes SOOOOO good...I dunno if anything compares. This IS the HEART of SF, if you're visiting the city, GO HERE!
author: Sean E.

description: The ice-cream sundaes are awesome but the best bit is watching the chocolate making process going on at the back. Hypnotic.
author: adam m.

description: Okay, these sundaes are pretty amazing. Probably not $8 amazing, but still. Yum.
author: Shawn B.

description: This place is for tourist, but the ice cream sundaes are so tempting that I just become one of the tourist when I bring along my out of state peeps. Expect a long wait, not to mention noisy and pricy, but then again... it's tourist place.
author: Will G.

description: Yes, yes..it's touristy...BUT, i AM a tourist. Free samples... stock up on a quick souvenier. The ice cream was delicious. And, the outside seating is an added plus! I can't complain!!
author: Jen T.

description: Had the mint chocolate ice cream shake.  The cup had chocolate frozen on it (probably the best thing about it). It was just alright
author: The O.

description: I've been here twice in the last two weeks to have dessert with people and I'm not impressed.  The sundaes just don't have the same taste when I first came to one of the ghirardelli cafes for dessert in southern california.  First the ice cream isn't that great.  It lacks substance.  Second, the desserts seem to be made then left to sit and melt for awhile before being served.  Third, the waffle cone was not crisp and crunchy as it should have been.  It felt soft and stale.  I will say that the place is a great way to buy up on the ghirardelli chocolates and baking essentials, but I think you could find better desserts in the area if you're more of the discerning type when it comes to higher quality.
author: Thomas C.

description: Went here for the first time with visitors from Socal even though I have already lived here for 10 months and visited multiple times. I really like this place. Their ice cream is delicious and the price is pretty much what you would expect. We ordered the earthquake for 8 people because it comes with 8 scoops for only 24.95, which includes bananas and other toppings. The line looks long, but it's pretty efficient because you order it and then take your number to your table. The only downside is the that the staff is all international, therefore when we asked for bowls, we got plates after some work at explanations. The area is beautiful at night and you can walk around on the pier if the weather is pleasant.
author: Katherine F.

description: Ordered hot fudge sundae for $8.95 thinking I'd rather eat ghirardelli chocolate ice cream than fro-yo.  After I finish, I was kinda disappointed.  Should have stick with fro-yo...much healthier & refreshing.
author: Chloe H.

description:
Rocky road + waffle cone dipped in chocolate and sprinkled with almonds =  Sweet goodness.

Sort of pricey because it's a tourist trap, but good nonetheless.  The employees are constantly busting the tables, and they're pretty flexible with the menu (ie. substituting the scoop of vanilla for something else in a banana split).
author: Lucy H.

description: I don't care how "touristy" this place is...they have the BEST sundaes...try the Chocolate Raspberry....oh man, to die for.
author: Rita M.

description: I would only recommend coming here when you have relatives or friends visiting but it is defiantly a nice place. The ice cream is delicious and the chocolate is great. If it seems very busy don't worry because the lines move quickly.
author: Tom A.

description: We walked there all the way from Fisherman's wharf to get a complimentary piece of chocolate : )  It was fantastic to see the place - some live music was playing outside.  We had to wait for some time to get a place - it was 3 of us.  We had some butterscotch sundae.  It was huge and I just had a bite or two.  It tasted good but nothing extraordinary.  The second time we tried the chocolate sundae - it was heavenly.  I am sure it had 500 calories so its probably advisable to share it.
author: J S.

description: Absolutely delightful!  The closest thing to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory! Beautiful twinkly atmosphere and the best chocolate on the planet!! Highly recommend visiting when you're in the area.... :)
author: Missy Rae H.

description:
i was craving ice cream as soon as i walked by this place...so after dinner and a short walk around the pier..my friends and i came here...we were lucky cause when we were looking at the menu a huge line formed!! it was crazy
i had the brownie hot fudge sundae.....something like that...and OMG!! i shouldve taken a picture...
this is the best place to get ur sweet tooth fix. my boyfriend had a choclate ice cream cone which i thought was very plain jane..but he said it was the best chocolate ice cream he had..
the service seems fun..but hectic for them..you get a number when u order ur ice cream have a seat and somone will bring it for u...it was fun watching the waiters trying to find their numbers...this place can get packed quick so get there early.
my friend got the strawberry sundae and that looked just as delicious...
will return for sure!!!
GO HERE if your by the wharf
author: Anna U.

description: The "Best" cookie bottom sunday ever.  This is my favorite place to go for ice cream.  Me and my girlfriends make a point to visit Ghirardelli once a month for our sunday fix.  You have to try it once in your lifetime.
author: Wendy H.

description: i love ghirardelli square! anything with chocolate is a star.  anyways, the other star is for finding parking right in the front! the third star is for the line...there was none.  the fourth star was for the attentive service and the fifth star was for the group of singers that was at the tea shop singing their lil hearts away!  the ice cream was delicious.
author: Angel G.

description:
What's not to love about this place (well, besides the constant waiting in line & packed tables)?? In the tone of Joey from Friends (remember the episode?): Ice cream? GOOD! Chocolate? GOOD! Hot fudge? GOOD! Sugar, fat, and more sugar? GOOD!

Aaahhh....the joys of Ghirardelli are enough to make me go into a diabetic coma.
author: Clare K.

description: So I've become accustomed to walking to the wharf (which fyi I used to loathe the wharf)...On my days off, I'll walk here and take my book with me, sitting by the water reading.  At night when the tourists have pretty much bedded down....or disappeared somewhere...I walk here to get their amazing milkshakes or ice cream.  I know, it is rather pricey and I would never pay the prices anywhere else, but there is some weird nostalgia for me.  How amazing is it to just sit by the water and drink a chocolate milkshake?  I don't know about you, but this is a slice of heaven.
author: Olivia S.

description: The gold rush (peanut butter and hot fudge) sundae was disgusting.  It actually was the peanut butter part that was repulsive.  I traded mine in after two bites for just  a regular hot fudge sundae....and that was pretty amazing.  The hot fudge really was Ghiradelli good.  But make sure you split this with one other person as it is massive.  The free sample piece of chocolate with my order was a nice touch for an $8 sundae, but I could only afford to do this once.
author: Jimi H.

description: A good place to enjoy a good sundae topped with freshly-made hot chocolate fudge (dark or milk chocolate).  It can get crowded during tourist seaon, but the service is efficient.  Keep the receipt to get 10% discount on your next visit.
author: Ken V.

description: had the famed ice cream sundae. initially, I enjoyed it, but after the 8th spoonful I had enough. wayyy too sweet and overpriced.
author: Michelle C.

description: Hmmm...let me unbutton my pants before I write a yelpin' review on this piece of heaven.  I am going to re-name this place one day to give-me-some-mo'...the array of sundays, ice cream, and chocolates are to live for.  I once ate three Domingo Ghirardelli sundaes with fudge, no nuts, two scoops of coffee ice cream and whip cream with a cherry on top.  You will leave this place with a humongous smile, a temporary beer belly like appearance, and whip cream on your nose if you don't check the mirror before you leave.  Everytime I go near that area....be assured I am stopping by for my fix and exit sayin' give-me-some-mo'.
author: Te R.

description: Great sundae with two scoops of ice cream, peanut butter sauce, and milk or dark chocolate hot fudge.  Only reason it gets four stars and not five is because the sundae is $10.  You have to do it once but be sure to share!
author: Tania Z.

description: God Help Me - I'm such a tourist - I cannot get enough of the sundae that isn't even on the menu - vanilla ice cream with hot fudge and raspberries.  OMG.  I'll take it with my LAST SUPPER.
author: Lisa L.

description: amazing!  the ice cream is sooooo good!  prepare to get fat... well worth it.  it was so busy inside this shop, but the staff handled it very well!
author: DL W.

description: Great ice cream sundaes, but pricey!   Should still  visit if going to SF.
author: Emily M.

description: Yum, yum, & yum!!!  The hot fudge sundae's are the best here! Of course it would be with Ghirardelli chocolate & their yummy vanilla ice cream. Yes, I bit pricier but well worth it!  I would go back again when I am in San Francisco for sure.
author: Donna S.

description: thumbs up suckas!!!  nice place to chill and drink/eat chocolate.
author: Roger A.

description: If i could give negative stars i wold.  I agree with a previous post that "this is just a tourist trap and offers nothing more than mediocre  chocolate"   the chicks at the front desk coudl not understand that my GF was allergic to nuts and we didnt want them on our sunday halfway through the misunderstanding she leans in and asks my GF to her face if "she was serious" stunned we both looked at her and nodded our heads agree with her dumb ass inquiry we then found seats to hopefully embark on a wonderful chocolate journey  with her parents who were in town visiting unfortunately  once our waiter finally found our number and handed us our half melted sundays with less than stellar chocolate sauce our journey was crushed with the storm of disappointment.  opening our umbrellas and trying to make the best of the icecream sundays in front of us i walked back to the counter to receive our validation the same girl who just rung us up informs me we need to have made a 20 or more dollar purchase and need to present a valid receipt i walk back to the table retrieve my receipt and present it to her i ask her how long the validation lasted and she asked me "if i could read" glacing at the back of the card and it saying nothing about the length of the validation i asked again she mumbled something about an hour i left promptly there after never to return again!
author: C. M.

description: The last time I came here was the day before Thanksgiving with my bf's family and it was crowded.  So what?!  It was totally worth it.  The desserts are a bit pricey but completely delicious.  I don't feel guilty about how fatten it is because I rarely get to come here.  The place just had such a holiday cozy feel to it.  Got to say, I love it and I'll definitely be here again next holiday season.  SO DELICIOUS!
author: Tiffany L.

description: Wow. 5 stars. Totally the great place every because uhhhhhhhhhiworkthere woohoo go Ghirardelli!
author: Joey Y.

description: The sundaes are gigantic and so goooooodddddddd. Can't they make a magical fudge that doesn't melt the ice cream so fast though? Just rush at a table, don't worry about being creepy because that's the only way you'll get a seat. Thankfully the service is quick!
author: Angela S.

description: i swear my chocolatey tunnel vision eclipses all one million of those tourists others tell of because i barely notice their existence, or anything at all, as i dip into my sundae of choice (domingos please).  and it is only my deep, inner strength that prevents me from diving head first into the vat of chocolate temptingly displayed in the back of the parlor. only certain desserts can also qualify as dinner and this is definitely one of them.
author: julia r.

description: I took my parents here and we al enjoyed the sundaes. There are many people in line and it is like an assembly line experience, but it is worth the wait. Good dessert place after McCormick and Kuleto's dinner.
author: Michele A.

description: Stopped by Fisherman's Wharf with some friends while killing some time before our flight back home.  We stopped at Ghirardelli and got sundaes after doing crabs and chowder over at the wharf.  Sure it was a bit overpriced and there were a lot of tourists there (me included).  But I thought the sundaes were pretty good.  I had the intense dark chocolate espresso sundae and between the coffee chip ice cream and dark chocolate fudge, I was pretty wired for the next few hours.
author: Scott S.

description: I love love LOVE the hot chocolate and ice cream here. There's an ice cream dish that's called Earthquake (costs about $30) and is the largest serving of ice cream I have ever seen. I'll try it one day... I think it's adorable how they made the ice cream names the streets of San Francisco like "Haight & Ashberry" and so on, ha. Their service is super friendly and it's usually crowded, but it's not a problem. It's also wonderful that it's open late, because you can go grab a hot drink and then overlook the ocean at night. It's a touristy location, but still beautiful nevertheless.
author: Katie N.

description: this place is way hyped up, but hits the spot when you need to be a fatty boombatty. first i have to say that they have one sugar-free flavor: vanilla. get with the times, people! not everyone can or will eat sugary sweets anymore. they have tons of sugar-laden choices on the menu as far as sundaes go. i don't know....it's certainly not gourmet or exciting, just good old-fashioned sundaes.
author: Sari W.

description: i was torn between kara's cupcakes and a ghirardelli sundae.  i am so glad that i chose the sundae.  it was awesome!  had the hot fudge brownie sundae.  the brownie was warm and super chocolate-y.  it was served on the side of the glass, instead of on the bottom, which i have never seen before, but makes a lot of sense - i was able to get some of the brownie with every spoonful, without having to dig to the bottom of the glass.  brilliant!  topped with vanilla ice cream and some of the best hot fudge ever!  ghirardelli sure knows their chocolate!
author: Maida L.

description: 4 Stars.  Having a bananasplit here on a warm summer day with your girlfriend at this Fisherman's Wharf location is a timeless classic despite the long lines of tourists and the bland tasting chocolates that seem more suited for cooking.
author: Foodie B.

description: get your ice cream and fudge fix here. services are never consistent, but after one sweet bite, it doesn't bother me anymore.
author: Angie Y.

description: great place to hit up when you are in SF and are craving something sweet. this place is always crowded, but the sundaes are yummu.  this is also a great place to bring out of town guests.  definitely a tourist favorite.
author: l. a.

description: Yum!  It's a nice place to hang out with friends after dinner or just a place where you want to catch up with some old friends.  Everything is good on their menu except for the Hot Chocolate!
author: Linda H.

description: I've been wanting to go here for the longest time. We went here for the first time on Saturday. Man, was it crowded, but it went by quick. Mm... the smell of chocolate when you go there. We ordered a hot fudge sundae since they're known for it and grabbed a table. The wait wasn't that bad and when we got the sundae it was pretty big. It was good. It's definitely a good place to go to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Jan And Daph S.

description: This place rocks for a late-night ice cream fix. Lots of choices and awesome ice cream. Watch out for tourists. They're rude and they'll steal your seats.
author: andrea a.

description: cute cute cute. love the look fo the building. and man i loved my sundae, i thnk it was a bit expensive but it was good. :) mmm ice cream
author: Brad B.

description: everyone likes chocolate .. right?  i really just come late at night and get the earthquake with a bunch of friends.  its a bunch of scoops of ice cream with a bunch of toppings.  everything gets really messy, gooey and delicious.
author: david m.
